name: Pina Playa
review:
['3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Golden color, slightly hazy, pineapple, lemon, and coconut notes on the nose, those notes translate to the taste, especially the coconut. The mouthfeel is to style. A nice Gose, I’d try this again as a summer quencher.\xa0222 charactersovaltine, Aug 06, 2019', "3.85/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.2%look: 3.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3(12 oz can, 03/13/19, purchased a cold single... poured into a fat tulip)

L: cloudy, pale, yellow-amber liquid; specks of sediment... slimy sponge of foam, but little retention, collar, or lace

S: rather unique smell - wouldn't peg it as either pina colada OR gose right off the bat (certainly more the former though)... maybe more dried mango, papaya, coconut lotion, urinal cake... fantastic potency, yet artificial, extract, concentrate-like aromas, and totally not to style

T: wow! despite its scent, the flavor certainly has an acidic gose pop up front, with the brine and tang lingering along with a powerful backbone of tropical malt-beverage... halfway through, the coconut does establish itself in the aftertaste, as does a light citrus-pithy bitterness... late into it, the colada flavorings just won't go away

F: bit more plump to the body and roll in its viscosity than usual for the style, but still light enough in its finish not to get in the way

O: shift this to 'fruit and field' style, dude - you gotta be kidding me... one of the few flavored goses I've tried, and a notably powerfully-flavored one at that... hitting a lot of the right spots with me, and I could see recommending it, but it's not something I'd seek out again\xa01,250 charactersBouleboubier, Jul 05, 2019", '3.71/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75On tap. Look is golden, slight haze. Smell light citric acid, very faint funk. Taste is pleasantly tart, not overpowering at all. Not sure I’d identify pineapple blind, but there is a fruity citrus. The coconut comes very faintly at the end. Feel is relatively high carb. Overall a decent beer, but not remarkable in any way.\xa0327 characters98green, Jul 02, 2019', "3.44/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.8%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.5Well, I'm glad I didn't go hog wild with blind faith and buy more than a single of this. That about sums it up.

This pours a dirty golden, with some head at first and much less later. The aroma is promising. Something exotic is coming, with fruit. The taste it delivers is a confiused, mildly tart, mildly dirty bitter yet fruity sweet beer. It's a mess. The aftertaste is mostly fruity and it's fine that it dissipates quickly.

Not recommneded. Your light, fruity beer guests aren't going to appreciate this one. Stick with Elvis Juice for them.\xa0548 charactersschoolboy, Jun 27, 2019", '3.85/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Brewdog Brewing Co. "Piña Playa"
12 fl. oz. can coded "03/13/19 190138 1421" and sampled on 06/04/19

Notes via stream of consciousness: Nice packaging design. The colors work perfectly for the style. It's poured a hazy golden body beneath a to finger thick head of fluffy white that's slowly dropped to just a single finger thick, but this is a sour beer so that's actually great head retention, and there's even some very nice lacing left behind. In the nose it's tropical with a distinct note of coconut backed by sharp fruit. I'm not finding pineapple but there's something there. On to the flavor... there's some pineapple there for sure, but I still feel like I'm getting more coconut. Maybe the coconut just stands out more against the sour base beer. It's tart but not too tart, and not at all bitter. I guess it's a nice summer beer. In the mouth it's light-medium in body and crisp. Overall it's a decent gose, but I have a feeling that whether you like this one or not depends more on your personal tastes than anything else.

Review #6,590\xa01,053 charactersNeroFiddled, Jun 04, 2019', "3.3/5\xa0\xa0rDev -11.5%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5355ml Can from Brewdog.com (£2.45):
Medium to slightly faded amber that has a mild haze to it as well & there's a half centimetre, bubbly white head that disappears to leave a tiny bit of lacing around the circumference. The nose is quite tropical with the pineapple most pronounced, there's some sugar sweetness & what I thought to be strawberries coming through as well though; it's slightly funky & sour with some lemon notes & zest too. The taste is a little more sour with a lemonade like flavour kicking things off before the pineapple comes through but it's definitely a touch more subdued than the nose was. Fresh & zesty with some tropical touches, it's more drinkable than I anticipated & comes through with a medium body & moderate carbonation, it's easily the best of the style I've had but it is only the second of the style I've had I guess.\xa0856 charactersflyingpig, May 27, 2019", '3.96/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.2%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Decanted from a 12 oz (355 ml) can into a Tree House snifter; canned 08/15/2018 in Canal Winchester, OH.
A: Pours an ever so slightly hazy, golden color with brief head formation and somewhat soapy lacing.
S: Hit hard by pineapple candy up front, but nose resolves rapidly to a slight salted caramel note.
T: Sweet to semisweet with pineapple candy (think Jolly Rancher), coconut, sea salt, and a touch of caramel. Bitterness not in evidence at all.
M: Medium bodied with low to medium carbonation.
O: Very flavorful, drinkable, and enjoyable. Does taste a bit like a Piña Colada candy.\xa0589 charactersVoxRationis, Feb 10, 2019', '3.85/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 4Appearance: Light and semi-cloudy golden. Thick off-white head and lovely loops of lace.

Aroma: Nice coconut, citrus, and pineapple notes here. Appealing.

Taste: Really brilliant and complex. Definitely get the pina colada flavor coming through — a tad sour but not pucker. Refreshing and light and packed with taste. Solid and enjoyable.\xa0342 characterssecondtooth, Oct 06, 2018', '3.78/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.512 ounce can into tulip glass, canned on 8/15/2018. Pours slightly hazy medium golden yellow color with a 2 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big juicy/lightly tart/tangy pineapple, coconut, fruit skin, lemon, lime, orange, citrus peel/zest, peach, pear, red/green apple, melon, white wine, sea salt, herbal, floral, grass, pepper, vanilla, wheat, cracker, white bread, light lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Nice aromas with good balance and complexity of fruity/light acidic yeast, pineapple, coconut, pale/wheat malts, and light-moderate earthy hop notes; with good strength. Taste of big juicy/lightly tart/tangy pineapple, coconut, fruit skin, lemon, lime, orange, citrus peel/zest, peach, pear, red/green apple, melon, white wine, sea salt, herbal, floral, grass, pepper, vanilla, wheat, cracker, white bread, light lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate herbal, floral, grassy, spicy bitterness; fruity/lactic tartness, and fruit tang on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/tangy pineapple, coconut, fruit skin, lemon, lime, orange, citrus peel/zest, peach, pear, red/green apple, melon, white wine, sea salt, herbal, floral, grass, pepper, vanilla, wheat, cracker, white bread, light lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/light acidic yeast, pineapple, coconut, pale/wheat malts, and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; with a nice malt/bitterness and tart/tangy fruit balance; with minimal astringent flavors after the finish. Moderately crisp/clean finishing. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering bitterness and tart/tangy fruit. Medium-plus carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately bready/grainy, fairly acidic/tangy/sticky, and slightly saline balanced mouthfeel that is nice. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5.2%. Overall this is a very good gose. All around nice complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/light acidic yeast, pineapple, coconut, pale/wheat malts, and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink with the modestly acidic/tangy/bitter/drying finish, not overly lactic or salty. Very flavorful for the ABV. Very balanced authentic juicy fruits, Lacto, and pale/wheat malts. Just a little too bitter, and not as tart/acidic as expected. Otherwise a very enjoyable offering, and well made style example. Not overdone on any aspect. Tastes like a pina colada as advertised.\xa02,647 characterssuperspak, Sep 29, 2018']

name: Poppy's Moonship
review:
["4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Thanks to Andy
Nice fizzy bubbly head, good retention with streaming bubbles, slight hazy pale watery color

Nose very gose, very earthy raw bread dough, lacto light sour funk and doughy lemony note, lactic acid notes and light guava, touch herbs and passion fruit but barely

Taste more lacto funk and lactic acid light tartness, light doughy malt, raw shortbread dough, not yeasty, mild guava and even less passion fruit but the finish brings more, light salt and coriander, drier finish not too flemmy

Mouth is med to lighter bod, good medium to higher carb, light acidity

Overall pretty good, fruit is a little light but I'd rather it be light that so overpowering that there's no more gose\xa0696 charactersjlindros, Jul 01, 2019", '3.69/5\xa0\xa0rDev -9.8%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.75On tap at the Granite State Brewers Assn. brewfest in Manchester NH on July 25, 2015.

The pour is pale yellow but a bit hazy. Modest white fizzy head.

Vague toasted malts but mainly sour and lemon zest nose. 

The body is light and refreshing.

This is a real pucker-up sour wild ale with maybe a touch of salt underneath.\xa0324 characterspuboflyons, Jul 26, 2015', '4.66/5\xa0\xa0rDev +13.9%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5Gose is a brew that I have sought after, particularly with meals, and the Schilling interpretation is excellent:
- Limited head with champagne feel
- Tartness in the nose
- Lovely tartness in the mouth, nice citrus tang
- Crisp champagne feel
- I want another
Well-done!\xa0270 charactersBrewhaha, Feb 16, 2015']

name: Gose - Apricots
review:
['4.18/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.9%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.2516 oz can poured into a teku

A- A hazy bright golden orange with a two finger white 

S- Sour, apricots, some salt, touch of wheat.

T- Tart, lemons, some apricot, some wheat, salt, touch of herbal tea.

M- Smooth, light body, crisp.

O- A nice gose, wish there was some more focus on the apricots, but still very enjoyable.\xa0325 characterslarryi86, May 05, 2018', '3.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev -25.4%look: 3.5 | smell: 2.75 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.25I love goses and this one did not do it for me at all. It is overly salty and rather than being fruity from the apricot, it has a strong floral aroma and flavor. Disappointing.\xa0176 charactersLucular, Aug 07, 2017', "4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.7%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Appearance: Pours a cloudy goldenstraw with a very fizzy head that crackles as it fades away in about 15 seconds; no lacing action

Smell: Wheat bread, apricot and a saline tone

Taste: Lactic apricot forward, with the salt building on the tongue through the middle; slightly puckery, with a dry finish

Mouthfeel: Light body with moderate to high carbonation (despite the head's rapid fade, the carbonation bubbles throughout the session

Overall: A nice gose; I would prefer the apricot to be a bit more pronounced but there is a lot to like here

Thanks, grover37, for the opportunity\xa0592 charactersbrentk56, Apr 21, 2017", '4.35/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.1%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Poured from a 16 oz can into a pint glass.
L - Pours a light orange with a white head,
S - Smells of apricots.
T - Tastes a little salty with tons of apricot throughout.
F - Medium body.
O - Really delicious apricot Gose. Highly recommended.\xa0241 charactersGriffin2, Feb 25, 2017', "4.6/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Pours a golden straw color with thin white lacy head. Nose is apricots for days. Taste is apricots, with some creaminess from lactose I believe, followed by a nice tartness. Perfect amount of salinity to make you go back for more. All of Aslin's beers have a nice mouthfeel!\xa0274 charactersGeuzeInTheHouse, Feb 05, 2017", '4.81/5\xa0\xa0rDev +14%look: 4.75 | smell: 5 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.75Ok. This is the real deal. Aslin gets pigeon holed into being a brewery that makes "juice bomb" IPAs but the fact is they make excellent tart/sour stuff! Ive had many Berliners and Goses from Aslin that were super crushable and delicious and each batch gets better and better. I really liked this the first time I had it last year but its definitely dialed in now. Gorgeous color, a glowing orb of bright orange like a sunrise. TONS of apricot on the nose that follows on the palate with heaps of fresh apricot and a great salinity that makes this glass disappear in no time. Bravo on this batch, cant wait to get my hands on more\xa0631 charactersoskinker, Feb 04, 2017', '3.78/5\xa0\xa0rDev -10.4%look: 3 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.5Poured out of 2 week old crowler. Has a 2 finger head that quickly withers to nothing. Subsequent pours generate no head either. Murky gold color. Aroma, white wine, apricot, lemon. Smells nice really. Taste, much the same. Definitely stronger on the apricot. Green apple a bit. This has a very mild acidity to it. Also has a good tasting malt backbone. Mouthfeel, the level of carbonation goes perfectly with the light body and acidity. Refreshing beer. Overall, this is not a real sweaty gose (nice) or real sour (nice). Pour this for friends who are leery of sours.\xa0568 charactersNoYouDidnt, Sep 16, 2016', "4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25The beer pours a very nice and brief head that dissipates very quickly. The beer itself is a nice hazy pale yellow with a nice golden hue to it in the right light. It's a nice beer to look at and looks very refreshing and appealing.

The smell is good. It's mainly a nice gose note with a bit of salt and funk followed by a sweet, syrupy, and apricot tart note that is actually pretty good.

The taste is pretty good. It's a nice mix between the funk and saltiness of the gose with the sweet tartness from the apricot. The gose notes is stronger than the other note but it doesn't completely cover it. It's a nice combination that works very well.

The feel is good. It's a light bodied beer with some nice biting carbonation with a mildly dry finish and a slight sweet syrupy note.

Overall, this a pretty good beer and refreshing beer that is pretty good for the humid and hot summer months. The taste is simple but definitely effective. This definitely a worthwhile beer to have. Go for it if it's available.\xa01,011 charactersHattedClassic, Sep 08, 2016", "4.34/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.8%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.2532 oz. crowler purchased 9/3/16 at brewery. Poured into Belgian ale glass.

L: Small 1F head with no retention, leaves no trace of anything. Pretty typical of the style. Beer is an opaque light orange.

S: Most prominent smell is the yeast, followed by the wheat, apricot, coriander, and a bit of brininess.

T: Apricot far more pronounced early and gathers strength through the process. Sense is more of dried apricots, then fresh. Kind of sweet, but yeast and wheat yank it back before it gets cloying. Coriander and brine (only a little) bring up the back end, but the apricot is very present all the way through.

F: Light to medium bodied, light carbonation (not much drying). Balance pretty good, but the battle between sweet and sour won't appeal to everyone. Great construction, as always.

O: I have a feeling I'm going to be on the very high end, as I think you have to like both goses and apricots to enjoy this. I do. Not quite as good as the absolutely incredible variant with blackberries and raspberries, but another top-notch Aslin offering.\xa01,057 charactersIvoryFoxhole, Sep 03, 2016"]

name: Gose O's
review:
["3.8/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.6%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5Thanks to JLindros hooking me up with a can. Canned on 5/22/19.

A - Poured into my Duvel tulip a nice clear honey hue with a quarter inch head that fades slowly to leave light wisps and a thin halo.

S - Aromas of sweeter cantaloupe melon, like the dried practically jellied cantaloupe chunks you can find online. I like the melon aspects here which can be tough to translate this aggressively in a beer. There really isn't much else going on let alone gose like. There is more of a minerality here than salinity, which isn't a good thing at all. The melon is nice for sure sure but blindfolded I would just assume this was a fruit beer not a gose.

T - Taste is simlar to the nose with big melon notes, though not nearly as sweet and floral as the nose. There is nice lactic tartness going on, more lactic/citric acid than lemons or something like that. Little bit of salinity on the finish on the lips. Maybe a little bit of passionfruit as well. 

M - Mouthfeel is lightly carbonated, little crisp, finish is just a bit too lingering flemmy unfortunately.

O - Overall I really enjoyed the canteloupe aspects of this beer as it's a fruit that can be hard to really make pop in a beer. Sadly though that's about all I really liked about it. Definitely not a gose I would reach for again.

Serving Type: Can\xa01,309 charactersrudzud, Sep 20, 2019", '3.94/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Nice lager color and a small frothy head redolent of espresso foam with tight bubbles. Moderate aroma of hybrid rose and sea spray. Classic gose with salty coriander and rose petal. Finished clean with little to no aftertastes.\xa0227 charactersosheamatth, Aug 29, 2019', '3.58/5\xa0\xa0rDev -8.2%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5Picked up on a whim at a random store in MD, canned 5/22/19
Pours a larger fizzy foamy head with lower retention, light lacing, mostly hazy light pale color

nose fair tart lactic acid and creamy lacto, distinct sea salt interestingly, tart mild citrus like acidity and some cantaloupe melon aroma, but also a little like butyric acid rotten fruit garbage thing going on, which is weird

Taste fair tartness with more lactic acid, very light creamy lacto, fairl sea salt like salty flavor, and light cantaloupe melon, tart citrus and bit more acidity, flemmy acidic finish, no butyric acid thankfully

Mouth is med to lighter bod, a little creamy but not much, fair acidity, medium-higher carb, quite flemmy

Overall mix of bleh, nose started pretty good then turned into garbage aromas, taste was Ok but mostly bland, a little too acidic and flemmy, overall not a great beer...
Sorry rudzud, I hope your can is better.\xa0919 charactersjlindros, Aug 24, 2019', "4.06/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.1%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Aroma is kinda sulfuring like many Gose's. Very sweet-tart to taste and salt provide a thirst quenching finish. Very slick mouthfeel and finished very clean. A decent beer. Not quite a session beer as the taste is a little too extreme but a nice 1 and done beer.\xa0267 charactersbubseymour, May 27, 2019", '3.95/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4On draft, Loosa Brews AL.

Pale golden yellow, small amounts of rising head with arching patterns of retention around the inside of the glass.

Tart nose of lemon and a pretty potent passion fruit aroma. The canteoupe is there, but unnecessary as the other prevalent fruits introduce this one nicely.

Tart lemon and passionfruit comes out again in the flavors, but as it’s settles on the palate you really get that sweet melon coming out nicely. Tart, sweet, lightly salty.

Crisp, clean sour with a lightly salty feel and a crushable finish.\xa0545 charactersWickedBeer, Apr 10, 2019', '4.44/5\xa0\xa0rDev +13.8%look: 4 | smell: 5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 5Such a great Gose ! Light salt. Great cantaloupe flavor, really enjoy this beer. Keep it in rotation while it’s available. Very good representation of a mild sour.\xa0165 charactersRC_Saunders, Apr 04, 2019', "4.28/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9.7%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25(12oz can) Love this Gose! Cantaloupe & black lava sea salt. Soooo fucking refreshing. ... & sooo quaffable! Hard to put down, in fact. 
Great balance, high-ish carbonation (nice, thank you). Drinkability goes to 11. 
Would prefer 16oz cans, but at least it comes in 6-packs. 
Can't think of a Gose I enjoy more. Will need to get lots more\xa0344 charactersausonius, Mar 13, 2019", '3.93/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4On tap at Dr D in Grenoble for their first year anniversary. 

A gose with cantaloupe in it. Nice but moderate tartness. Quite fruity and drinkable with the melon\xa0162 charactersBruno74200, Aug 18, 2018', '4.61/5\xa0\xa0rDev +18.2%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 5 | overall: 4.75Pours slightly hazy, gold in color with one inch head. Taste is big cantaloupe, big salt, and grains of paradise. Light bodied, high carbonation and salty. The world needs more cantaloupe beers. Love the high saltiness. Great beer that reminds me of their experimental saison.\xa0278 characterstigg924, May 26, 2018', '3.87/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.8%look: 3.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.75Definite cantaloupe smell and taste. Not a fan of the salt. Black pepper would have been a better and a more traditional Maryland choice. Who puts salt on their cantaloupe?\xa0172 charactersbackcountryjim, May 19, 2018', "3.81/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75A: The beer is hazy yellowish orange in color. It poured with a half finger high white head that died down, leaving a small patch of bubbles on the surface and a narrow collar around the edge of the glass.
S: Light to moderate aromas of cantaloupe melon are present in the nose.
T: Just like the smell, the taste has a lots of cantaloupe melon flavors but there are also notes of black lava sea salt, which seems to taste a bit smoky and salty.
M: It feels light-bodied on the palate and has a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: The taste of this beer has a very interesting contrast of flavors between the melons and black lava sea salt. It's a cool baseball-themed beer.

Serving type: can\xa0693 charactersmetter98, May 18, 2018", "3.22/5\xa0\xa0rDev -17.4%look: 4 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3 | feel: 4 | overall: 3Look- pours an opaque pale golden w/ a 2 finger white head and spotty lacing

Smell- sweet artificial-smelling cantaloupe and a musty and sour note

Taste- same artificial cantaloupe as in the nose, sourness, salt and a biscuity malt, but nothing comes together and comes across as a disjointed mess. Nothing tastes off or bad (except for maybe the cantaloupe), but it's very unbalanced

Feel- medium bodied, high carbonation

Overall- this beer was drinkable, but the artificial cantaloupe and lack of balance make it a one and done for me\xa0540 charactersbret717, Apr 06, 2018"]

name: Metric Systems
review:
["3.56/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.7%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Workin hard in the attic, warm day, good day for a light gose. Canned 9/28/17

Pours a light fizzy head that fades quickly over a crystal clear tan honey color

Nose very yeasty and doughy, lots of acid, lemon tartness, sour acetic acid, but also some unpleasant solventy notes, apple cider vinegar, fruity

Taste is very tart, sour apple cider and a bit of lemon, yeasty bready doughy malt and wheat, creamy lacto sour, acetic lemony acid, a touch of coriander spice, maybe a faint hint of salt but barely, a bit of flemmy finish

Mouth is a bit thin and watery feeling even for a gose, carbonation is a bit light too, very sour acidic and a touch flemmy

Overall not a great gose, perhaps a bit too old, but shouldn't drop off that much, esp the mouth, I know they make good beer so this is just a bump in the road, but still not really a BAD beer.\xa0850 charactersjlindros, Feb 17, 2018", '3.74/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Look: Clear yellow with 2 inch white head. Medium carbonation.
Smell: Seaweed, salt, tart, and grapefruit.
Taste: Tart, salt, nutty, and grapefruit.
Mouthfeel: Medium light.
Overall: An ok gose from Lamplighters.\xa0212 charactersPhineasco, Nov 11, 2017', '3.69/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.9%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Pours a slightly hazy light straw color with a one inch fluffy white head that dissipated quickly and left no lacing. Smell is very tart lemons and coriander. Taste is tart lemons, granny smith apples, coriander and salt. Light bodied, well carbonated, dry mouth feel.\xa0268 charactersEMH73, Nov 01, 2017', '3.68/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.7%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.5Cloudy, white to straw color. Good head but it dies quickly and leaves no lace on the glass. 

Earthy nose with a beef stew component. More savory than beer-like. 

The flavor is like a true Gose with a sourness tempered with a touch of salt. The finish is lemony almost like an unsweetened shanty. Good body with an elevated carbonation level. Long tart aftertaste.\xa0366 characterssmcolw, Oct 01, 2017', '4.12/5\xa0\xa0rDev +13.8%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4On tap at the brewery.

Pours a clear yellow with fluffy foam.

Smell is tart, with hints of apple and lemon.

Very refreshing beer, some apples and lemon gives a summery feel, and there is just a little bit of spruce on the finish.

Body is thin and the carbonaion prickly.

I enjoyed this quite a bit, a nice change of pace and good palate cleanser.\xa0351 charactersJamFuel, Mar 14, 2017', '3.61/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75Pours a hazy yellow in color with a finger of short lived white head. Aroma is muted with very light coriander and sour notes. Taste is has lots of moderately sour lemon upfront then I get a bit of a doughy sourdough note some light coriander in the dry finish. Medium body with medium-high carbonation. Overall I enjoyed this beer, I can see this being a good, refreshing option on a warmer day.\xa0396 charactersmnj21655, Mar 02, 2017', "2.59/5\xa0\xa0rDev -28.5%look: 1.25 | smell: 2.25 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 2.25 | overall: 2.25Easily the worst goseai've had. And i love gose. 

There was a ton of gross chunky white shit floating around. 

Looked like someone had a jizzum into a can of goat piss. 

Smelled like flat salt water. 

Actually tasted not awful surprisingly. 

Felt like drinking a cup of curdled stuff. 

Potentially a QC issue? But it was packaged and put on the shelf for me to buy. So fail.

edit- doesn't change the beer I had, but the folks at Lamplighter were cool enough to reach out apologize and explain that it was an already known QC issue that Is being addressed. So going forward, it will most likely be a different story. I'll have to revisit and reedit this in the future.\xa0674 charactersbrother_rebus, Jan 13, 2017"]

name: G-Funk
review:
['3.99/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Poured out a clear, golden orange color with a small, white head of bubbly foam. It smelled of tart green apple, some pear and lemon. Nice tart flavor with a salty bite.\xa0169 characterszeff80, Aug 17, 2017', "4.28/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.8%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Pours straw with a quickly dissipating head.
The aroma is acidic with notes of citrus fruits, it's floral and minerally as well.
Way way saltier than I thought it be. The salt hits immediately giving way to a bright tartness and a slight funkiness. The finish comes back to a minerally flavor mostly salty.
It's mouthfeel is light and refreshing with heavy carbonation.
Overall, this is the first gose I've enjoyed. It's growing on me more and more with each sip.\xa0464 charactersScott17Taylor, May 07, 2017", '4.2/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.8%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Pours a nice, soapy white head that has good persistence. Light, golden straw color. Very bright, sour aroma. Starts extremely sour with lovely, bright citrus notes. The sourness subsides and smooth malt comes through. Finish is lingering malt with a touch of citrus.

This is really good. Great sourness, awesome maltiness, and a really lovely citrus aspect. Well done.\xa0375 charactersTheSSG, Jun 02, 2016', '4.03/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Lovely pale blonde color with a distinct haze. Srm of 2 maybe. Head fizzles rapidly but starts off at 3 fingers. 

Aromas of citric acid, like orange juice or similar; some fruity and floral aromas like a zinfandel or a rose wine. Slight salt on the nose, too. 

This gose is a sour lovers beer. Lots of salt, lots of lactic acid and brettomyoces. Lemon lime flavors and tart lactic acid. Not for the faint of heart. 

Feel is heavily carbonated, lending to superior drinkability. 

G funk is a Gose i will be revisiting in the future. While its more like a cypress blanc or a sour, it still falls within gose territory and is downright delicious!!\xa0649 charactersThe-Adjunct-Hippie, May 07, 2016', '4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Aroma is salt/minerals, tart lemon and a hint of lactic acid/milk. The flavor is lemon/citrus, wheat, salt/minerals, slight Capri Sun/tropical Hawaiian Punch and a very tart finish.\xa0182 charactersjzlyo, Apr 14, 2016', "2.91/5\xa0\xa0rDev -26.7%look: 3.25 | smell: 2.75 | taste: 3 | feel: 2.5 | overall: 3Draft at the brewpub, quick review from written notes.

Pale dishwater gold, thin layer of white foam, minimal lace.
Smell is briny and salty, minerally and musty like a dirty dishrag.
Taste is salty and bland, bleh. Way oversalted. Tastes and smells briny, like seawater. Little in the way of any defining character, it's thin and watery feel, hard to put down (as in swallow). Not clean or quenching, I drank water to get the taste out of my mouth. Really unbalanced and too salty. 

Back to the drawing board.\xa0512 charactersemerge077, Apr 03, 2016", '4.28/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.8%look: 5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 4.25Pours a cloudy, gold color. 5/4 inch head of a white color. Great retention and great lacing. Smells of pale malt, sweet malt, lemon, bacterial funk, yeast, and slight hop. Fits the style of a Gose. Mouth feel is sharp and crisp, with an average carbonation level. Tastes of slight earthy malt, sweet malt, pale malt, bacterial funk, hint of hop, and yeast. Overall, great appearance, good aroma, body, and blend.\xa0420 charactersTone, Aug 23, 2015']

name: Peach Gose
review:
['3.84/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Gose brewed with corriander and sea salt with peach added. Poured from a can into a Sweetwater tulip. Pours pale gold, clear, and sports about a finger of fine white head that dissipates immediately due to the acidity. The nose has aromas of vinegar, apples, and white wine.

Medium-light body with a delicate feel. Tart and fruity throughout with slight hints of wheat crackers up front. No sweetness to speak of, but the tartness is not overdone and is very pleasant (not truly "sour"). There aren't any objectionable flavors that come with the tartness either - it's fruity and not spoiled or funky. Very refreshing beer.\xa0624 charactersdeadonhisfeet, Nov 05, 2018', "4.01/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.2%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Showing that craft beer aficionados don't have to get all sour over fruit beer, the Sour Note Brewing team embraces the tang while celebrating the classic American orchard fruit, peach. Piled onto a traditional German styled sour wheat ale, the fruit sees new life.

Pouring a slight foggy goldenrod, the spritzy ale rises and falls with a quick, loose froth. Racy aromatics fill the nose with citrus, cider, white wine, tart peach and a cast of light leathery must. Gentle sweetness layers on the tongue with a wafer thin maltiness that's suggestive of sourdough, saltwater taffy and hard candy.

Sweetness fades nearly as quick as its froth while the sourness begins to build upon the middle palate. Peach flavors float gently above the natural fruitiness of lime, lemon, white grape, green apple, gooseberry and kiwi. Melon-lie flavors come along a juicy but acidic path with distinct sour, dry, Mountain Dew-esque taste to round out the late palate.

The softness of perfumy coriander and the rounded flavor from sea salt keeps the ale tasting and feeling full yet bright while the unique acidity of peach bring a slight stone fruit character to the finish. Clean acids wash the thirst with ease as a quick after taste of peach and burlap highlight the beer's brightness and brininess all at once.\xa01,301 charactersBEERchitect, Jul 05, 2018", '4.21/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.3%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Appearance - Pours bright yellow with decent white head that quickly dissipates. No lacing.

Aroma - Peach, straw, some funk. there is a light sweet peach aroma.

Taste - Initially peach juice moving into a tart salty slightly funky flavor.

Feel - Light bodied well carbonated, slightly dry syrup finish.

Overall - I really like this gose, great peach flavor with a touch of funk and salt.\xa0392 charactersDragginballs76, Sep 04, 2017', "4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Appearance - The beer was straw yellow in color with a bright white head. 

Smell - The knows had notes of songs, but I didn't really did take the fruit. 

Taste - The peach is not over-the-top. It reminds me of peach tea. There's a slight salt presence. Over ripened fruit in the aftertaste.

Mouthfeel - The carbonation is appropriate. 

Overall - it is not my favorite 18th St., Gose, but it is very drinkable\xa0416 charactersJohnnyHopps, Nov 27, 2016", "4.45/5\xa0\xa0rDev +11.3%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Cloudy golden pour pinky head. Aroma- citrus fruits a slight funkiness to it. Quite a bit of a hop presence on this one too. Taste- Belgian yeast on the back end. Very delicious aspect of this beer. Some strong peach in the beginning. Not really all that sour or tart. Little bit of funkiness. Mouthfeel, tingling, refreshing. Overall, this taste does not longer on and on. It's really good as you sip. I want to drink more. It's great.\xa0436 charactersNoYouDidnt, Jul 27, 2016"]

name: Gooseberry Gose
review:
['4.13/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Great coloration, sour bite, nice lacing when tilted. Evervence hard to see other then the edges of the glass. Worth a second go, however a larger a larger bottle. Have a glass at Beers and Sauces, good pick guys. Just think of the food paring choices.\xa0252 charactersVolstead, Jul 21, 2018', "4.03/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Poured into a large wine glass its a hazy saturated orange, with an inch of foam on the surface and minimal spotty lacing.

Aroma is full of tart underripe fruit, and oddly a faint hint of mothballs.

Tart and juicy, green underripe fruit, it really pops and has a puckering sour fruit profile. Clean and moderately sour, unique gooseberry fruit character.
I've picked and ate wild gooseberries and this is similar but more green.
Nice effervescent light bodied feel. Overall it's a nice quenching summer beer. 
Thanks to Kate for the recommendation!\xa0550 charactersemerge077, Oct 09, 2017", '3.56/5\xa0\xa0rDev -10.8%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.25Bottle dated 11/2017 (8 months):
Pours a hazy dark yellow with a puffy white head. This fizzles away eventually, but a steady stream of carbonation maintain spots of white on the surface, including a thin collar.

Lactic avid give a lemony note with a hint of sour milk. There is the lightest sea foam in back.

Taste is high on the sour scale, as the nose indicates. The salt gets mostly lost in the puckering nature of the opening note. A not ripe tart berry note gets noted in the back. Carbonation is ok, but also kind of lost in the sour. Salinity gains strength either through buildup or warmth.

If you like your Gose more sour than balanced, this could be for you. I like a little more balance. This reminded me a tad of a DESTIHL wild ale in its puckering.\xa0773 characterscjgiant, Jul 07, 2017', '4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25this is so good. i have loved all of these, but this is killer. it tastes more like the green underripe gooseberries than the purple ripe ones, and the natural tartness of them is really rad with the bacterial tartness of the base beer, which i also think keeps improving with each successive iteration. wheatier than i remember, drier and well carbonated too, and i dont think i can fully credit the different fruit for all of that can i? the salt element here is the best, the brine aspect has a green olive thing to it, and before you think, "ew thats gross", consider the minerality, the salty satisfaction, and the relationship to the grain, its incredible, especially with the lemony acidity in here. the gooseberry s great, now i know why all the birds eat them up when they are still not quite ripe, this tang is so quenching, and this beer is quite sour, but its super dialed in, and although i couldnt drink ten of them, a few glasses from the tap or a large format bottle is a perfectly reasonable done. i am a huge fan of crane, and it keeps getting better. this is fantastic, just in time for summer too!\xa01,117 charactersStonedTrippin, May 25, 2017', '3.93/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4750ml bottle. 11/17/16 bottle date. Appearance: Light golden in color, mostly clear with a minimal white head that disappears quickly. Aroma: lactic acid, salty, and citrus peel. Taste: Pow, a sharp acidic puckering sour from the start. A touch of earthy berry and a salty back end. Mouthfeel: Light bodied and low carbonation. Finish: Extremely dry, with a sharp lingering tartness and some retronasal berry notes Overall: An intensely sour take on the style. Saltiness is relatively low, and this lacks the nuance and complexity of some other Crane goses. Still very refreshing, and would go great with some spicy food.\xa0621 charactersTH28, Apr 30, 2017', "4.18/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.8%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Light gold in color with a light haziness. The aroma is of lactobacillus, gooseberries, and salt. I'm tasting lactobacillus, gooseberries, and salt and somehow those flavors meld together very well. The mouth is delicate and refreshing, but moderately carbonated. This is fantastic!\xa0286 charactersFranziskaner, Mar 05, 2017", '3.99/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Pours a pale orange-yellow with a little fog to it. Head fizzes up high for a gose, with two fingers showing up in stark white. Retention is great, with no lacing. Aroma is gooseberry, with a salty, lactic sour quality to it. Flavor profile is no different. The gose style delivers some sour notes of its own, with the sourness multiplied by the gooseberry addition. Mouth feel is fizzy and holds at a medium thickness. Overall, a sour gose. The gooseberries are a nice addition, and while tasty, do add quite a bit of sour to the experience. Despite this, the beer drinks smooth at its 4.1%. 

Served in a teku glass.\xa0618 charactersHarrison8, Feb 26, 2017']

name: Tiny Bubbles
review:
['3.49/5\xa0\xa0rDev -15.1%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5A:Sharp sourness with slight off-notes, lightly lemony and salty.

A:Light golden color, slightly hazy, with a thin head that quickly forms a ring around the glass.

T: Sharp sourness that’s a bit harsh, with light malt, coupled with a lemony flavor, and faint saltiness.

M: Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. 

O: Try again; this beer’s lacto had some off-notes that make it difficult to drink.\xa0406 charactersPhil-Fresh, Jun 15, 2017', '4.2/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.2564 oz swingtop bottle into a chalice.

light golden color with a slight head. smell of salt, coriander, and malts. taste starts out quite salty and tart, and finishes with a lasting wheaty, saltines. its in the upper echelon of goses...saltier than most. mouthfeel is light and refreshing. 

overall extremely high drinkability, worth getting a growler!\xa0353 charactersAxnjxn, Jun 01, 2014', "4.11/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Tiny Bubbles isn't the best looking beer - fairly low carb, bright yellow, small ring of white head that quickly dissipates. However, the smell and taste are much better: lots of lactic tartness but not overdone, and nice salt/coriander in the background. At first I thought it was a little intense for a gose but I got through my pour quickly and wanted more. Great for a hot day. Overall a nice gose, now I need to try more of this style.\xa0440 charactersmrkdwrds, May 28, 2014", "3.48/5\xa0\xa0rDev -15.3%look: 1.25 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Served on-draught into Verdugo branded stemware at Verdugo Bar's anniversary event in Silverlake some months ago. Reviewed from notes. Due to the nature of the event (standing room only; crowded) I wasn't able to go into as much depth as I would have liked; please forgive the truncated review below. 

A: No bubble show forms as it's poured. 

Pours a 1.5 finger wide head of white colour. Head retention is poor - about 30 seconds. Body is a very dull murky copper. Looks pretty awful, to be honest. 

Sm: Lemon zest. Floral hops. A very light hint of salt. Clean malts. Light tart sourness. A mild strength aroma. No real biscuity yeasty character. 

T: Nice lactic tart sourness. Body is comprised of clean malts, light wheat, and barley. No real salt comes through. Well balanced, if simple. I do like it. Has a nice subtlety to it. 

Mf: Smooth and wet. Lightly refreshing. Decent thickness. Pretty good body. Suits the flavour profile well. 

Dr: Drinkable and enjoyable. It's a nice simple gose. I'd get it again. Quite nice for the style, but not fantastic or world class. I'm glad I got the chance to try it. I might recommend it to friends; one of the better beers I've so far in the style. 

Low B\xa01,209 characterskojevergas, Oct 07, 2013", '4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25On-tap at the brewpub.

A: Served a lightly hazy golden body with one inch of bright white head that faded to collar.
S: Light and crisp notes of green apple, golden fruits, stone fruits and dry grains.
T: Follows the nose with hints of apricot, peach, white grape, wheat, lemon and minerals. Clean wheat finish with a crisp lactic bite in the aftertaste.
M: Very crisp, dry, and refreshing mouthfeel, medium-light body, fizzy scrubbing carbonation, sharp acid bite.
O: Mild flavors overall with the lactic acid dominating. Similar to a Berliner Weiss. Very quaffable.\xa0568 charactersscottfrie, Jun 30, 2013', "4.37/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.3%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25From growler to flute glass

A unique and refreshing brew that's all the buzz here in San Diego after the amazing 2013 Firestone Walker festival, Toronado SD specifically mentioned this beer in their mailer. I stopped by Hollister brewing on the drive back from the fest, decided to try a flight of samples, this was by far the most impressive.

Pours a fleshy pink in appearance, with effervescing bubbles forming almost no head. Notes of apple and pear and tart berries form the bouquet, with a lingering cracker-y envelope. The flavors are more puckering than expected, keeping the sweet fruity aspects in check. Apples and berries are distinct, with notes of crisp lemon citrus anchoring the flavor profile. The tart aspects lead to a short, dry finish.

This beer is remarkably dry and refreshing. Even with what seems like a new brewery popping up on every corner around here (most of which are sub-par, I'm getting pretty jaded), I haven't tasted anything quite like this. Hope to see it again.\xa01,001 charactersrand, Jun 08, 2013", '3.68/5\xa0\xa0rDev -10.5%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75On tap at Hollister Brewing Company in Goleta, CA. 

Pours a murky light yellow with a foamy white head that settles to wisps of film on top of the beer. Small dots of lace form around the glass on the drink down. Smell is sour and tart with malt, wheat, and coriander aromas. Taste is much the same with sour and slightly salty flavors on the finish. There is a mild amount of acidity on the palate with each sip. This beer has a lower level of carbonation with a slightly crisp mouthfeel. Overall, this is a pretty good beer that is easy to drink and refreshing.\xa0564 charactersUCLABrewN84, Jun 04, 2013', '4.17/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.5%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4On tap at the brewery.

A: Pours a nearly clear pale yellow with a thin white head with "tiny bubbles" which fades to the rim quickly. A quick swirl returns nothing and no lace.

N: Lemon zest, wheat grain, spices (corriander), grassy/hay notes.

T: Mainly follows the nose with a nice tartness and salty combination. Very interesting and inviting.

M: Light body and carbonation with prickly bubbles. A good tart and refreshing finish.

O: Very good - got a growler to go. Perfect for a warm summer day.\xa0504 characterswethorseblanket, Aug 20, 2012', "4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.5On-tap at Hollister

Pours a hazed pale yellow color with a white head. Much more sour than most Goses I've tried. Heavy on the lemon, a touch of white vinegar, and definite salt. Minimal coriander, but some straw and sweet malt aromas. Light green melon on the palate, some salt, light coriander, and tons of lemon. A bit of white vinegar, some straw and grass, and a hint of sweet malt. Pretty solid beer all around.\xa0418 characterswomencantsail, Aug 15, 2012", '4.47/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8.8%look: 4 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Picked up a growler while traveling through the Goleta area. Poured from the swing-top growler (about 5 days later) into an Allagash tulip glass.

A: Slightly hazy, the color of golden straw, with a quickly fading effervescent head, similar to that of champagne.

N: This one tickles the nose with hints of the sea and a lactic-tartness. There is also a noticeable ester-like fruitiness, like that of a lager yeast.

T/M: Incredibly intriguing, the beer hits with flavors of tart green grapes backed by an immediate (pleasant) saltiness. The body finishes quickly and dryly, very similar to that of champagne. The carbonation is not as good as it could be fresh, but stands up pretty well to lend a slight prickliness.

This is a pretty great beer, although I cannot say much about it for the style as this is the only Goze style I have ever had the pleasure of trying. It was a fan favorite at the FWIBF, so I had to get a growler of it when I found myself by the brewery the following week. It is light, crisp, and incredibly refreshing. It really satisfies my desire for a summer sour!\xa01,088 characterspeacebone116, Jun 16, 2012', "3.64/5\xa0\xa0rDev -11.4%look: 4 | smell: 2.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4A - Cloudy, straw yellow with a green tint. Very small head that disappears quickly

S - The smell is very odd, and I must say rather off putting. Salt is prominate, with wheat in the back. 

T - The taste hits three notes. The first note is very clean and fresh, and bubbly. The second very wheaty with sour back notes. Finally it finishes sour and very salty. The mid note I found to be unenjoyable but the finish more that makes up for it. 

M - Pretty high in carbonation. It adds a nice mouthfeel that helps temper the harsher notes of the beer. Light to medium body. 

O - An undeniably interesting and unique beer. A fun novelty. However its sour and salty notes tire the palate rather quickly. A good beer for one glass on the porch on a spring day. I wouldn't want too much more than that.\xa0798 characterslinkin22luke, May 06, 2012", '4.8/5\xa0\xa0rDev +16.8%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 5A- Light straw yellow, very bright, white head that hangs for a bit, then resides to a ring. Some lacing. Looks fantastic.

S- Corriander, salt, light lactic acid. Smells very refreshing. Loving the nose on this beer.

T- Wow! Nice lactic acid that quickly gets backed-up by a very pleasant salt character. Very clean and balanced on the back end. Very tasty beer

M- light and bubbly, hence the name

O- Amazing gose! Wish this was around more. Hats off to Hollister\xa0467 charactersKshock, Sep 25, 2011', "4.35/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.8%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Served in a 10oz. nonic.

Appearance: A creamy, white crown sits atop a hazy, pale gold body. Head retains nicely throughout the session, while the lacing is essentially non-existent: it tries to cling to the glass walls but just can't seem to hang on. I'm still learning the gose style, but I believe this looks about right.

Smell: Wheat, lemon, hay, residual (pilsner?) malt sweetness, and faint coriander. As the beer warms, floral and herbal esters, both of which are soft and pleasant, enter the mix. Nicely done.

Taste: Very tart right off the bat! Lemon juice, wheat, honey/sugar glaze, and light vegetal notes define the flavor profile. Salt comes through in the finish and mixes with the sourness in the aftertaste. Acidic, but not to a point of being harsh or offensive. I'm quickly becoming a big fan of this style!

Mouthfeel: Sour, light-bodied, and refreshing. Residual sweetness helps promote the tartness in the finish, and also drowns any bitterness that may otherwise shine through. Carbonation is medium-to-high and fine. Malt-forward, crisp, and enjoyable.

Drinkability: Awesome! If you're a fan of sours, make sure you order this one!\xa01,168 charactersThreeWiseMen, Mar 30, 2011"]

name: I Want It Now!
review:
['4.01/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Hazy orange pour, strong notes of lime and mango off the nose with initial tastes of passion fruit with lime and tart bite at the end. Light kettle salt taste throughout, not overbearing.\xa0187 characterssirspins, May 22, 2018', '4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.1%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Appearance: Arrives clear and orange colored with a nice head that leaves a few strands

Smell: Lactic black raspberry and lime tones with a tangy wheat character

Taste: Black raspberry, papaya and melon tones forward, with passion fruit and lime building through the middle; after the swallow, there are some salt and coriander tones that linger into the finish

Mouthfeel: Light body with moderate carbonation

Overall: A nice gose with a variety of fruit elements to make it interesting\xa0496 charactersbrentk56, Jan 20, 2018', '3.58/5\xa0\xa0rDev -9.8%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.5650 mL bottle. Hazy orange with no head. Smells of passion fruit and some mineral notes. Tastes of strong passion fruit. Quite tart. Grain and mineral back end and a touch of Theraflu in the finish. Light body with high carbonation. Good, despite the weirdness in the finish.\xa0282 charactersAlieniloquium, Jul 20, 2017', "4.17/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 3 | overall: 4.2522oz bottle poured into a snifter

A- pours a murky bright orange-yellow with a one-finger fizzy white head that retains for a while before disappearing. Looks like a tropical fruit juice

S- smells like the nectar of guava and mango, as well as some melon, wheat, lactic tartness and coriander

T- big fruity notes of juicy mango, guava, passionfruit, papaya & melon up front. Mid-palate gives some tartness, as well as some fresh green minty flavors & a hint of salt and coriander, linger of mango and guava

M- medium body with high carbonation immediately fills the mouth with foam that continues into a dry, tart finish, highly over-carbonated 

O- a juicy tropical gose that intermingles the sweetness of the fruit with the tartness of the gose, just wish it wasn't so carbonated\xa0789 charactersTreyliff, Jul 08, 2017"]

name: Mojito Gose
review:
["4.3/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25Reviewed from (very) long-standing notes. Poured from a 750 mL bottle into a Brooklyn Brewery snifter. Purchased and consumed on 3/6/16.

A: Moderately hazy gold. A good amount of visible carbonation leads to a finger’s worth of white head, but that fades quickly.

S: Lactic acid tartness, lime, citric acid. A touch of salinity and minerals. Light cracker malt body, and maybe just a bit of funk.

T: Follows the nose – lactic bite and lime. Citric acid and lactic tartness. Residual salt – a bigger salinity than comes across with their regular gose, but not in a bad way. Light crisp cracker malt body. A salty lime puckering tartness lasts for a few beats after swallow.

M: Light crisp body, no alcohol presence. Lots of good carbonation sensation.

O: I really liked this one. A nice improvement on their base gose, which didn't need much improvement to it anyway. Only complaint is that if there's mint in here to mimic the mojito, I sure didn't taste it. But otherwise good.\xa0989 charactersmacrosmatic, Aug 02, 2019", "4.11/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25A - Pours a semi-opaque golden body with a fizzy paper white one finger head. 

S - I'm picking up the standard salty base with a lime tone to it. The additions of mint and lime are really hard to pickup on the nose. 

T - Delicious salty gose base and with mint/lime addition it added a certain amount of complexity to it. Light tartness throughout and really gets you on the finish. The lime really pops are the beer warms, it's really quite refreshing.

F - Light bodied and medium to high carbonation. It has a really dry finish.

O - It's a very drinkable gose that stays true to the style and the mint/lime definitely compliment it.\xa0642 characterscvm4, Apr 03, 2016"]

name: Culmination
review:
['4.03/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4On-tap 10/16/2016 at Natty Greene’s Tavern in North Attleboro, MA, served in a tulip glass.

A: The beer is a light yellow color, with a short white head that fades slowly and leaves a thick lace on the glass.

S: The aroma contains citrus, wheat, light malts and a touch of hops.

T: The taste starts out very tart with flavors of lemon and other citrus fruits. Then some mild breadiness comes in from wheat and a light malt character. The hops presence is mild but complementary and brings a good balance. The after-taste is slightly tart.

M: Very crisp and very smooth, light-to-medium body, medium carbonation, finish is clean.

O: Tasty, goes down easily, not too filling, mild kick, good representation of style, this is a solid sour beer to drink for a while.\xa0769 charactersTheManiacalOne, Oct 16, 2016', "4.05/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Pale yellow with a slight fizzy head.

Aroma: slight briney whiff, hint of hops from the dry hop, but it's subtle.

Taste: a prickly fruitiness comes first, followed by slight tart and faint salt and a touch of coriander. Lemony finish. A delicate Gose where everything is in harmony. No competition going on. 

Feel: light, thin, moderately carbonated, slightly fizzy.\xa0372 characterskalosjakar, Oct 06, 2016", '3.71/5\xa0\xa0rDev -8.8%look: 3 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Pale gold, thin film of a head.

Smell is grape juice, melon, and moderately to strongly sour depending on your threshold.

Taste is grape and lime juice, with a saltiness combined with the tartness that leaves a sweet and sour taste on lips. It almost burns, but not quite.

Tangy and tingly.\xa0293 charactersSabtos, Jul 06, 2016', '4.24/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.2%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25You pick up the hops on the nose and they really elevate this beer in terms of flavor. You get some grassy piney notes and some orange alongside the tartness of the base beer.\xa0176 charactersPHBoiler, Jun 14, 2016', '3.93/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.4%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 416 oz pour on tap into snifter

A: pale yellow body with great clarity creamy looking white head carbonation looks huge 

S: very little nose maybe some coriander and berries 

T: hoppy up front sour light berry a little salty on the finish 

M: lighter body decent carbonaation not as refreshing as a lot of Gose style beers I have had in the past

O: this is a nice sour level for a gose and the hop addition is pretty nice as well\xa0433 charactersSomethingClever, May 27, 2016', '3.99/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4This beer was a pale golden color with a small white head.
Aroma of sweet malt and floral hops.
Tart lemon taste, salty.
this had a tangy, salty mouthfeel.
Very nice!\xa0166 characterslordofthewiens, May 26, 2016', "4.31/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.9%look: 4.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 5 | overall: 4.5Looks bright straw yellow. Opaque. 
Aroma is very mild. Just some faint bready malt, touchnof lemon rind and funk. 
Flavor is really greqt. Tart up front, almost to the point that you think it's entering berliner territory but it backs off just in time. Big on lemon. Soft bready malt. 
Mouthfeel is crisp and silky at the same time - impressive.

Reqlly enjoy this, a weel done gose.\xa0384 charactersjbertsch, Apr 20, 2016", '3.96/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.7%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Stop by Deciduous Brewing yesterday after being in Portsmouth for lunch. Brought back a growler of Cumulation what is listed as an Imperial Gose. 
This beer poured a light golden color into my Deciduous glass. The nose is light with a slight almost faint floral aroma. The taste is crisp and clean not as sharp as some Gose can be. But pleasant and crisp and very light. The mouth feel is smooth. A nice interpretation of this style of beer. I think the only thing I find lacking is the little bit of saltiness that is there in most Gose style beers.\xa0550 characterssmanson56, Mar 27, 2016']

name: Cascade Winter Gose
review:
['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4And the award for the most growlers provided to a tasting group goes to...(drum roll)...drabmuh. Yet again, thanks Matt!

The beer appears clear and golden orange hued with a small white head. Spices, particularly of the Christmas (or holiday, if you prefer) variety. Pretty well balanced, though cinnamon stands out a bit. Only a light helping of salt. Personally, I like the briny quality of a bold gose, but this one is still pretty tasty. I would have it again, albeit in small quantities.\xa0493 charactersHuhzubendah, Feb 22, 2012', "4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4From 02/11/12 notes. Growler shared by drabmuh at a recent Cascade tasting. Poured into a tulip.

a - Pours a bright yellow-orange color with two inches of white head and low to moderate carbonation evident.

s - Smells funky, of salt, citrus hops, fruit, and earthy notes.

t - Tastes of citrus, sour fruits, salt, fruity malts, and light funk. More sourness then the nose, and a step up.

m - Medium body and moderate carbonation. Pretty easy to drink.

o - Overall a very good gose. Haven't had a ton of them but this is one of the better ones I've had. Would like to try their other versions.\xa0596 charactersmdfb79, Feb 16, 2012", "4.2/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.6%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4One of the best goses I've ever had and I've had a few. Beer served in a snifter. 

Beer is yellow, with a mild haze, decent head, no lacing, moderate carbonation.

Aroma is nice, mildly funky, a little lactic, a little sweet.

Beer is nice, not overwhelmingly salty but definitely there, a great little beer. Nice finish, mild funk, good lactic character. I could have a lot of this beer. Surprising to see it is 6%, not detectable at all.\xa0440 charactersdrabmuh, Feb 15, 2012", '4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.5Many thanks to drabmuh for sharing this growler.

Appearance: golden-yellow with touches of orange and peach; good white head

Smell: Light citrus, spice, salt, and funk with some floral notes.

Taste: Very nice, light salt and faint funk, along with some good citrus notes and a touch of pine.

Overall: very nice gose, I hope I can try this one again. Easy drinking and I am a bit surprised to see it is 6%.\xa0409 characterscraytonic, Feb 15, 2012', '4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.3%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Big thanks to drabmuh for securing this growler and bringing it to the Cascade tasting. Served in a Cascade Barrel House goblet.

Pours a fairly-clear orange color with a nice white head and a bit of lacing on the way down. Thin collar throughout. The nose has a nice combination of cranberry, citrus, and lacto. Nothing over the top, but plenty there.

The flavor hits the same notes, with the spice and fruit mixing really well with the acid. Very light salty note, which goes well with the acidity. Mouthfeel is very light with a dry, acidic finish. Really impressive from the folks in Portland.\xa0598 charactersThorpe429, Feb 12, 2012', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4A: Poured a golden color with noce carbonation and a small white cap

S: Some spice, orange peel and funky sourness

T: A big citrus taste coupked with sourness, some spice and floral notes

M: Medium body, well carbonated, sour as heck and good

O: Easy to drink and good\xa0272 charactersbarleywinefiend, Jan 27, 2012', "4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.5First had: on tap at Cascade, Portland, OR
'09 vintage tasted in Dec. '11.

Cascade seems to be a big fan of this style, and it's a good thing too, because I haven't had many goses...actually this might be one of only two or three I've ever sampled. I'm glad it was on tap for me to try.

Poured a golden yellow, slightly hazy, with a small white head. Aroma of gingery spice, light fruit and lemon zest. Taste was nicely complex, with tastes of tart fruits up front--cherries, cranberries--floral (there is hibiscus in it) and perfumey mid-palate, with a distinct saline finish that lingered on the tongue for a few seconds. Some light notes of cinnamon and ginger came out after a few more sips. Light-medium body, but full of flavor, distinct and very drinkable.\xa0765 charactersRifugium, Jan 04, 2012", "4.3/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9.1%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.52011 vintage. I tried an older one later, but unfortunately didn't make any more notes on it.

Good lace, pale white head, golden body.

Light crisp nose, vinous, champagne-like.

Tart vinegar sting wears off into sweet tart apple. Well blended.

Crisp, bright feel, and again, champagne-like.\xa0293 characterszaphodchak, Dec 31, 2011", '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4On tap at the barrel room today.

The beer pours a slightly hazy, solid gold color with good head retention and lacing. On the nose, I get a considerable amount of ginger and juniper berries, with a hint of lemon and lime. The flavor profile is pretty complex, showing more ginger and juniper, but with some vanilla and fruit cocktail flavors as well. Mouthfeel is light to medium bodied, with a fairly long finish. Drinkability is good, with the flavor complexity making me want to savor this beer slowly. Yet another solid beer from Cascade.\xa0543 charactersJohn_M, Oct 12, 2010', '3.58/5\xa0\xa0rDev -9.1%look: 3.5 | smell: 3 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5The bar that I had this at called this "Winter Gose", I'm assuming this is the same beer. Served in straight pint glass. Poured a coppery honey gold color with just under 1/2 inch of white head that had decent retention and lacing.

The aroma was dominantly grain with a slight salt scent in the background. The taste was very good, tangy grains, a bit of saltiness and a mildly tart finish.

The body was nice and smooth, but a bit sharp. Drinkability was very good, I'll be going back for more of this beer. Overall, a good beer, a bit fuller and richer than the other couple examples of the style I've had. Worth trying if you see it.

Edit 2/25/12: Had this again last night in a tulip. The beer seems to have stayed fairly consistent, my notes from last night matched almost identically. The only change is that I'm changing the taste score to 4, from 3.5. I really like this beer a lot, a must try if you see it.\xa0918 charactersbeertunes, May 27, 2010', "3.97/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.8%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4On draught at the lodge (a few times now), Holiday Gose is a tawny copper with a small white skim leaving very light, scattered lace. 

Smell is muted at first, as it's served very cold, some light pheonols, but gets fruity and floral as it warms, with the cranberries, hibiscus and orange peel all contributing to the bouquet. 

Taste has a really nice tartness, accentuated by the strong cranberry and lacto, a nice saltiness as well. A little caramel to the malt provides body, with a pretty clean finish, although there is a hint of ethanol. 

Mouthfeel is oily, but with a crisp finish and medium body. 

Drinkability is pretty good, definitely a holiday gose. I like the cranberry for sure, but this lacks the complexity and overall enjoyment of the autumn gose. Still, really enjoying this series, yet another creative take on this obscure yet enjoyable style.\xa0867 charactersccrida, Mar 04, 2010", "4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Draft, City Beer Store. This beer poured a relatively clear reddish amber with a small off-white head. The aroma is primarily sour cranberries. The hibiscus comes through a bit, but it's hard to pick it out exactly. There's some spice and fruity/malty sweetness. The flavor is sour berry tart. It's not an enormous pucker, but it goes down that road. There are some sweet floral and spice notes as well. A tad thin. A pleasant beer but quite off-style, not that I mind.\xa0469 characterspopery, Feb 25, 2010", "4.02/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2%look: 4 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.5Finally made it out to visit Raccoon Lodge/Cascade...a happy hour snack and a flute/goblet full of Holiday Gose (the nearer it gets to February, the more out-of-season this gets).

A: Lovely amber/golden, a little hazy. The finest and faintest ring of whitish cream and star-shapedfilm. Plenty of rapidly-rising carbonation.

S: So sniffable; a flowery and grass/hay earthy twang, mild orange citrus, a yeasty/crackery breadiness that -yes- smells oceanic. Salt in the aroma? I suppose the answer is 'yes'...

T: Love the blatant saliva-inducingsalt and mild berry tartness. Follows with a flowery/citrus-fruity quality that evokes a tropical fruit punch. More dry/earthy as it progresses - perhaps the berries taking over. Mild spice and little lasting bitterness.

M: A medium feel, borderline full, that has a round and somewhat chewy character. Rather refreshing, and the briny finish leaves one wanting more.

D: If you have it the pub, be sure to try it with some fries, paired with either the Blackberry Ketchup or the Raspberry Habanero; both pair exceptionally with the Gose's tart/fruit nature. A sipper only, not too quaffable, but a well-made and inspired brew I'd like to enjoy again.\xa01,197 charactersmsubulldog25, Jan 26, 2010", '3.7/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.5On tap at Raccoon Lodge served in Teardrop glass, 1.17.2010.

Copper amber body with reddish hints, one finger tan head, slow dissipation, nice lacing. The nose is sweet, tart and funky, the cranberries dominate with orangel peel taking a back seed. The cranberries are dominant on the taste, orange peel comes through, had a hard time picking out the hibiscus. Not as salty as the Autumn Gose, IMO. Tart, lip-smacking finish. An unusual take at a seldom seen style. The cranberries were a nice holiday inspired touch, could have used a bit more spice to cut through the sweetness, and the saltiness got a bit lost. Not my favorite beer from one of the most innovative breweries in Beervana, but worth a try for the curious Cascade fan.\xa0738 charactersjdense, Jan 19, 2010']

name: Chrissie
review:
["4.59/5\xa0\xa0rDev +14.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Poured into a pokal, the appearance was a pale paper yellow color. Light quarter finger's worth of white foamy to bubbly head fizzled out super quick to not leave any lace.
The aroma leads with a nice sweet to sour and tart lemon juice and sour-ed wheat. Salt maintains a substantial grip to try and balance. 
The flavor yields to the tartness initially but ends up bringing in a light balanced sweet and sour-ed wheaty sort of expectant bite to eat at the salt that did a substantial push to claim my taste buds. Mild aftertaste of sticky sour to tart lemon and sour-ed wheat.
The mouthfeel was between light and medium bodied with a fantastic sessionability about it. Carbonation felt fine, not distracting to the sour content. It's quite smooth in it's flow from the lemon juicy sour element to the wheaty bite. 
Overall, this is absolutely a wonderful gose very close to the traditional sense of style. If there was a touch less lemon in this, I'm close to 99% sure Southern Germans would mistake this for one of their own goses.\xa01,034 charactersLone_Freighter, Jul 03, 2018", '4.02/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.2%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25A: The beer is hazy pale yellow in color—too hazy to see if there is any visible carbonation. It poured with just a thin layer of white bubbles covering the surface and a minuscule collar around the edge of the glass. The head eventually completely faded away.
S: Moderate aromas of sour lemons are present in the smell.
T: The taste follows the smell and has lots of flavors of lemon verbena with a moderate dose of sourness.
M: It feels light-bodied and very tart on the palate with a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: This gose makes for a nice refreshing selection on a hot summer day and has some thirst quenching properties. Drinking this beer almost seems like having a sour version of a lemon Italian ice.

Serving type: bottle\xa0739 charactersmetter98, Jun 10, 2018', '4.19/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25L - light yellow Pilsner-esque straw. 

S - salt, lemon, and some sweet clementine. 

T - more salt, but not overbearing. Bready with a sharp twangy lemony tart coriander flavor. 

F - best part about this beer. Ridiculously smooth and creamy for the style. Full-bodied and rich. 

O - solid gose. The lager..ness adds another element that makes this a little more robust.\xa0372 charactersagreenman19, Jan 04, 2017']

name: Imperial Concord Grape Gose
review:
['3.77/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a Dogfish Head tulip

L: Clear maroon pour with fine sediment. 2 fingers of fluffy white head. Nice lacing.

S: Grape juice... wheat, light funk and spice.

T/F: Semi-sweet concord grape to start followed by a modestly tart gose. Wheat/grains and coriander in the background. Sort of a sparkling grape juice with a bit of salt and tartness to go along with. Light bodied... very drinkable.

O: A sweet/tart gose, and they do hit the Concord Grape pretty nicely. Very drinkable... a good intro gose.\xa0540 charactersEMV, Jan 14, 2019', '3.41/5\xa0\xa0rDev -9.8%look: 2.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75I am continuing my New Southern Tier Beer Sunday (Week 713) by delving into my Bottle Backlog. 

From the Bottle: "Imperial Sour Ale Brewed with Concord Grape Juice and Coriander"; "Why the hell not?"

I was curious about what this one was going to be like. I am not a huge Tart/Sour fan, but as a retired US Navy sailor, I do like the saltiness inherent in a Gose. Concord grapes also take me back. Growing up, my maternal grandfather had a Concord grape arbor which he used to grow plump, sweet fruit which we would pick & eat, but they were really for him to make wine in the cellar. His stuff must have been God-awful sweet, but it fermented & he drank it, so to each their own. His son, my uncle, took inspiration and became a home vintner, but I still prefer beer to wine. Onward!

As always, it began with a Pop! of the cap. I kind of enjoy that aspect of bottles since I have a local artist whose medium is beer bottle caps so they all get set aside for her. Following that moment of Zen, I went with a heavy-handed C-Line pour so as to ensure that all adjuncts were in suspension. I watched as it formed just under two fingers of fizzy, foamy, reddish-white (NOT pink) head with low retention. Color was a faintly hazy reddish-purple Amber (SRM = N/A). Hmm. Nose was kind of like opening a jar of Welch's grape jelly in one of those glasses with "The Archies" embossed on it! Suddenly, I was back in 1st Grade with a grape PB&J sammich on white bread in my "Partridge Family" Thermos lunch box! 8=O The concord grape smell was unmistakable, but this was a Gose, NOT a Fruit & Field Beer. 8=( Once more, the taste was tart, NOT sour! 8={} Man, the concord grape juice dominated, but the spices and lactic acid held its inherent sweetness in check. This was a really bizarre drink, stretching from one end of the spectrum to the other. I couldn't make up my mind as to how I felt about it, but it was a dichotomous beer to begin with. Finish was truly in the Twilight Zone between semi-sweet & semi-dry. Pick one, take a sip, wait a moment & see if you don't change your mind. Wotta choice of adjuncts! Wotta day this has become!\xa02,136 characterswoodychandler, Oct 21, 2018', "4.03/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.6%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4L: Poured from a bottle to a cylinder glass. Had an odd orange-red color and a slightly hazy consistency. there was a half inch of foamy head that lasted a below average amount of time. OK lacing.

S: A nice aroma of grapes, wheat, spices, and salt.

T: Tasted of bit of wheat (mostly in the finish - overpowered by everything else), a hint of salt (barely noticeable), lots of the advertised grapes, some coriander, citrus (lemon), and light bready quality. An interesting take on the gose flavor. The Concord grapes dominate the taste, but it works. It's a bit overly acidic and sour at first, but it calms down. Tasty.

F: A well-carbonated beer with a lively finish. Medium-bodied.

O: This beer probably isn't for everyone, but if you want something different give it a shot. Drinkable.\xa0791 charactersavalon07, Jul 26, 2018", '4.18/5\xa0\xa0rDev +10.6%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25This is the second of the huge gose beers from Southern Tier for me to try. This one I don't have anyone to share with. I'll just have to soldier on.

It pours an odd color - sort of ruddy orange, with some of the grape colors coming through. The aroma is fruity and yeasty. The taste is fruity, somewhat boozy, and tart, as you would expect. 

There was some fear than an "imperial" version of a gose would not be any good. They do lose the delicate taste you might normally appreciate, but they replace it with huge sourness and fruity taste that goes way beyond the norm.

Highly recommended. Just be warned, it is a seriously big take on the style.\xa0653 charactersschoolboy, May 10, 2018', '3.78/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.512 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 1/10/2018. Pours slightly hazy/cloudy medium orange, light reddish/pinkish color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy light pink head with good retention, that reduces to a thin spotty lace cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of tart/tangy red grapes, fruit skin, peach, plum, pear, lemon, red/green apple, red wine, coriander, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, and white bread dough; with lighter notes of toast, pepper, lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Nice and pleasant aromas with good balance and complexity of fruity/acidic yeast, grapes, salt, coriander, and moderate bready malt notes; with solid strength. Taste of tart/tangy red grapes, fruit skin, peach, plum, pear, lemon, red/green apple, red wine, coriander, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, and white bread dough; with lighter notes of toast, pepper, lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang, and light yeast/coriander spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/tangy red grapes, fruit skin, peach, plum, pear, lemon, red/green apple, red wine, coriander, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, white bread dough, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Very nice complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, grapes, salt, coriander, and moderate bready malt flavors; with a great malt/tartness and tangy fruit balance; and zero puckering sourness after the finish. Light-moderate increasing dryness from tartness and tangy fruit. Medium carbonation and medium-full body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/bready/acidic/tangy/tannic, and fairly saline balanced mouthfeel that is great. Minimal warming alcohol for 8.3%. Overall this is a very good gose. All around nice complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, grapes, salt, coriander, and moderate bready malt flavors; very smooth and easy to drink with the mellowly acidic/tangy/tannic/drying finish. Well balanced Lacto, fruit, coriander, salt, and pale/wheat malts. Not overly salty or lactic. A very enjoyable offering, and well made style example.\xa02,216 characterssuperspak, Mar 03, 2018', '3.62/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.2%look: 4 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75Upon opening the bottle, I get a whiff of grape juice+soda.
