Pouring........ clear red (slightly less bright than ST's Cherry Gose) , with slight, quickly-dissipating pink head.

Smell is grape soda, and the fresh-ocean-breeze aroma (wheat malt +sour+salt+ freshly-ground coriander) of a typical gose. 

Taste is tartness, a combination of semi-dry red wine + shredded wheat (better than it sounds ;) ) , and the briefest expression of alcohol, finishing with a touch of bitterness. A faint hint of saltiness lingers on the tongue & lips after everything else fades.

On the light side of "medium" body, with very fine , but noticeable , carbonation tingle throughout , and lingering on the tip of the tongue .

Overall, not bad , and glad I tried it, but won't likely be seeking more. Glad I only got a single. Better as it warmed.Might be better on warm summer days.\xa0872 charactersmikeinportc, Feb 19, 2018', "3.87/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.4%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Pours clear, purple-red in color, with minimal head. Taste is Welch's grape juice, mineral, and sour mix. Light bodied, prickly carbonation, and sour. Fruity, refreshing, and tasty. I prefer other goses, but well worth seeking out.\xa0235 characterstigg924, Feb 18, 2018", "3.68/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.6%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Clear shimmering light ruby red with a minimal white fuzzy head quickly dying to a thin ring.

Smell is grape gummies and red wine with a salty toast and touch of a lactic cheesiness.

Taste is slightly tart Welch's with a toasty cornbread aftertaste over a crisp medium body that finishes semi-dry. I also get toasted sesame cracker and grape skin.\xa0349 charactersSabtos, Feb 14, 2018", "3.37/5\xa0\xa0rDev -10.8%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.25When I picked this up the woman behind the counter told me that she liked it, but that it didn't really drink like a gose. I personally picked up quite a bit of sour saltiness. I understand that this doesn't make a lot of sense but it's what ran through my mind when I drank this.

It looks like a slightly darker version of an eight-dollar bottle of white zinfandel. Zero head of foam and light, light carbonation. I'm not really catching grape specifically on the nose but it's clearly a fruited beer. 

Tastes OK. I didn't have much of a problem identifying it as a gose. Not too sour. Definitely a little salty on the front palate but not overly so. Very, very light mouth feel.

I'm having some issues with Southern Tier these days. I thought Pumking tasted like poison this year, really offendingly horrendous compared to Elysian. I guess Thick Mint is pretty good. Salted Caramel was a gimmicky mess. 

This is a decent beer. I didn't expect anything outstanding, didn't get it either.\xa01,005 charactersNextBestThing, Feb 04, 2018"]

name: Citra Gose
review:
["3.87/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.8%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Reviewed from notes. Can purchased at Habersham Beverages in Savannah, GA. Poured from the 16 oz. can into an El Catador Barrel-Aged glass.

A: Yellow to light gold with mild haze. A good amount of visible carbonation leads to a two finger white head that fades to a ring of foam fairly quickly.

S: Citrus - lemon rind and zest. Milder orange and pineapple-forward tropical fruits. A modest lactic tart, with light cracker malts and some savory salt on the nose.

T: Big Citra hops up front – lemon and orange, pineapple and tropical fruits. Just a touch dank herbal as well. Lactic tartness and a table-salt type of salinity. A very mild Lactobacillus funk, and the palest of two-row malts. No pilsner character that I can get, but just a touch of huskiness. A mix of hop bitterness and lactic tartness in the hang.

M: A light body, maybe even a very light body, but not watery. Average carbonation sensation for style (which is to say high), and minimal if any alcohol presence.

O: A tasty beer. The hops are certainly “out of style” for any gose, but it is what they promised. But I wish they made an imperial version, where the hops and the tart and the funk were ratcheted up - I think it would be way better. As it is, an easy drinking light beer that could have been custom made for golf or beach or barbecues. But it needs to be “turned up to eleven”. Scores given are for personal preference, as scoring this as a traditional gose would be unfair to the brewers' intent, in my opinion.\xa01,507 charactersmacrosmatic, Mar 19, 2019", "3.56/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5Pours a clear light straw color, big billowy head. Nose is tropical and citrus with some earthy funk. Typical gose flavors with citrus mixed in. Interesting concept - usually this style is paired with a fruit or vegatable. Don't love it, but it is not completely offensive, definitely crushable. 

5/11/18
16 oz can from NC dated 3/14/18
3.5 rating\xa0353 charactersTony210, May 12, 2018", "3.67/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.4%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 3.75From growler filled a few hours before drinking. Into a pint glass.

Poured a mostly clear golden yellow, small amount of white head. Not much lacing.

Smells of some funk, a sour note meddles with citrus aromas 

Tastes follow similarly, bright crisp lemon tartness, followed by a citrus burst from the hops and the salt level is low so it's not a puckering gose by any means.

Low carbonation, yet easy drinking and light body.

Solid gose, expected a bit more from this but maybe it's my personal tastes. Expected a little more hop presence and sourness. But technically speaking this is a well crafted beer.\xa0611 charactersBrewsOverHoes, Jul 12, 2017", '4.14/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.8%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Appearance: Pours a hazy goldenstraw with a modest head that fades to a ringlet; dots of lacing hang around

Smell: Tropical fruit tones waft - pineapple, papaya and passion fruit

Taste: Juicy, with the pineapple, papaya and passion fruit tones detected in the aroma; through the middle the tartness builds a bit and the finish brings a little salt

Mouthfeel: Light body with low to moderate carbonation

Overall: A very refreshing and tasty gose for a 90 degree day\xa0473 charactersbrentk56, Jun 18, 2017', '4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Appearance - Pours bright golden color with thin white head that dissipates before I can put the can down. No lacing.

Aroma - Plenty of hay and tart citrus, nice amount of funk. Slightly floral and salty aroma.

Taste - Pretty salty up front and through the whole flavor profile. Nice sour hit with a touch of tropical fruit flavor grapefruit and pineapple.

Feel - light bodied soft carbonation slightly dry finish.

Overall - The taste is pretty impressive, good bit of funk in the nose that does not carry through to the taste. Very easy drinking and tasty.\xa0561 charactersDragginballs76, Jun 06, 2017', '3.72/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.1%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75From a 16oz can

Plenty of active carbonation, though it produces a very minimal head. It is predominately clear. The least foggy Gose I have seen. It is a pale straw yellow in color..

A little bit of floral and citrus on the nose, and a nice balance of sourness and saltiness. The grains are pretty subtle.

The citra hops are a little more noticeable in the aroma for me, but there is still some pineapple and grapefruit, with a touch of candy like passionfruit. The salt is very nice, and the sourness subtle. The wheat seems to be left behind though. 

Highly drinkable, and pretty good overall, but the flavors are a bit muted across the board. not sure if it is toned down by the sea salt, but this one is close to being outstanding with a bit of tweaking.\xa0763 charactersWesMantooth, Jun 01, 2017', '3.99/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.9%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25A: Pours a cloudy pale yellow in color with moderate amounts of active visible carbonation rising quickly from the bottom of the glass and moderate lemon yellow + straw yellow colored highlights. The beer has a two finger tall fizzy foamy bright white head that quickly reduces to a large patch of very thin film covering the majority of the surface of the beer (about 95%) and a thin ring at the edges of the glass. Light to moderate amounts of lacing are observed.

S: Light to moderate aromas of floral + citrus/grapefruit hops over the top over light to moderate aromas of slightly sour wheat malts with a hint of briny saltiness.

T: Upfront there is a just shy of moderate flavor of slightly sour wheat malts. That is followed by a light flavor of floral + citrus/grapefruit hops which impart a hint of bitterness which fades away quickly. There is a slightly heavier than light amount of briny saltiness which lingers slightly in the finish.

M: Light bodied with moderate amounts of carbonation. Initially crisp with a light hint of acidic prickliness in the finish.

O: Easy to drink, crisp, and refreshing... perfect for a warm NC late Spring/early Summer hot day. Enjoyable and a beer I could easily drink a couple of.\xa01,229 charactersdbrauneis, May 30, 2017']

name: Walking Away In Slow Motion While The Car Explodes Behind You
review:
['3.95/5\xa0\xa0rDev -8.1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75500 mL bottle. Huge white head on a hazy orange. Nose has all of the listed fruits. Pungent mango, some acidic lime, and pineapple, which I guess is the hops. Taste is dominated by lime. Tart lime. Wheat and some saltiness. Makes it grainy. Tropical fruit a little bit in the back. Medium body. Medium carbonation, despite the outrageous head. While some of these Kent Falls beers are getting ridiculous in name and description, this one defies both trends and tastes pretty nice.\xa0489 charactersAlieniloquium, Aug 29, 2016', "4.46/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5On tap at Extreme Beer Fest 2016 in Boston, MA.

This one a bright slightly dark-ish yellow, a little bit of haze, and a little bit of lacing.

Smells like pure citrusy hops, so much Galaxy and Mosaic here, with a bit of lemon/lime, mango, grapefruit, grassiness.

This was one of the standouts of Extreme Beer Fest for me. All of the things about the beer stood out- I got the lime zest and mango, and they tasted so fresh and juicy, and the dry hopping gave it a bitterness and additional citrusiness that really elevated the rest of the beer. I didn't get really any salt, but it was only mildly sour, which worked well to elevate the dry hopping.

This is light bodied, crisp and very clean, with a normal level of carbonation.

This beer was absolutely great- Kent Falls is one of my new favorite breweries. The name of the beer is obviously quite cool, too.\xa0863 charactersGreesyFizeek, Feb 08, 2016", '4.29/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.2%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25Tried this at EBF 2016, had three 2oz pours because it was so good:

Appearance: bright, hazy yellow, with a puffy white head. Lots of little bubbles rising from the center of the (tiny) glass. Looks a little bit like a more golden, slightly hazy champagne.

Aroma: fresh, citrusy scents, with a lot of lime, and a little bit of light pils malt aroma. Little bit of freshly cut grass/herbal aroma.

Taste: Very tart and lime-y, with the salt definitely present as well. I've never tried an "imperial gose," before, as I'd thought goses were kind of supposed to be low-ABV, but this tasted light and refreshing. No alcohol present, just citrus, potent tartness, and a little bit of mango.

Feel: extremely crisp, high level of carbonation with a light body. Left a slightly puckering flavor on the palate.

Overall: as stated above, don't know that I've ever tried an imperial gose, but it was extremely light, flavorful and full of flavor. Enticed me to buy a KF shirt. Excellent!\xa0980 charactersTheElectricOne, Feb 06, 2016']

name: Never Never Gonnagetit Gonnagetit
review:
['4.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.2%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5On tap at The Veil in Richmond.

Pours a dark purple with pink, fluffy head.

Smell is like burying your nose in raspberry, blackberry and boysenberry jam. Tart and fruity.

Taste is nicely tart, but nowhere near over the top. Tons of berries and a hint of lime and slight acidity brings it to a thundering conclusion of fruitiness.

Mouthfeel is medium and creamy, with bright carbonation.

Overall, a superb fruited sour. Great balance despite being very, very berrylicious, and just the right amount of tartness.\xa0515 charactersJamFuel, Dec 08, 2018', '4.44/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.1%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5It’s a berry purée! Really not much else to say. Pours a thick bright deep raspberry red to plum color. Head is thick and redish. Nose is of a can of berry frozen juice concentrate. Raspberry, strawberry, blueberry, blackberry etc. taste is thick and loaded with fruityness. Sweet and slightly sour berry tones. Again body is thick and smoothie like. Obviously I’m not rating to style I suppose because there’s really not much about this that says gose. But it’s good and refreshing so whadyado?\xa0504 charactersMFMB, Jul 31, 2018', '4.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.2%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5So first i will say that its kinda shitty that these cans are only fresh for like 10 days. I kept them cold the whole time and they still dont last very long

But, Damnnnn. Perfect super fruited gose style sour. I mean this beer is off the hook. So delicious. Would buy again, but maybe not a whole case\xa0303 charactersTommo, Jul 10, 2018', '4.45/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.9%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25Thanks to Dave, canned 10/17/17

Light fizzy purple pink head, dark purple reddish color

Nose loads of berry, raspberry, blackberry, boisonberry, maybe currant, berry melange, creamy wheat

Taste loads of creamy wheat and blackberry puree, melange of berries again, touch of tartness, creamy wheat almost lactose, juicy

Mouth is med bod creamy berry, fluffy carb

Overall another awesome beer but less gose and more berry\xa0423 charactersjlindros, Feb 18, 2018', '4.21/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.2%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25[From Notes | Consumed 10/22/17]

@ The Veil

Beautiful purple-red glow capped with a thin pink head that settles to a ring. Super juicy natural berry aroma...not much more to say. Lightly tart, deliciously juicy berry flavor with a slight lemon juice pucker. Soft, tart, and dry. Very good, natural seedy berry goodness.\xa0325 characterswedge, Dec 10, 2017', '4.87/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8.5%look: 5 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 5 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.75Wow.

This is a gorgeous heavily fruited gose. It looks incredible, like liquefied berries, with a beautiful light red head. Smells heavenly, like sweet raspberry, blackberry, boysenberries. Just a touch salty, a touch sweet, and quite tart. There is so much flavor of the aforementioned berries, if you like berry/punch flavor you will be floored. As far as heavily fruited sours go, this one is top 3 for me.\xa0410 charactersNedry, Nov 08, 2017', '4.33/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Pours a deep, hazy purple color. This beer's turbidity is extremely attractive in my mind. The head is a finger high and light pink in shade. Unfortunately, retention is poor, though a little bit of lacing sticks to the glass.

This smells exactly like mixed berry yogurt, and I LOVE mixed berry yogurt. The mixed berries come across intensely, yet naturally. Lacto injects a huge note of vanilla cream that plays well with everything else going on. Salinity and sourness is minimal. About the only thing to niggle about is how this is reaching a point where it's hard to find the actual beer, instead of pure fruit juice. Still, I can't help but be impressed how well the fruit additions completely transform an otherwise solid but unexceptional gose.

It tastes exactly like it smells. The initial flavors are intense waves of mixed berries, followed by a light tartness. Lacto near the middle doesn't translate quite as vividly as the aroma suggested, but that's about the only real niggle. A finish of Greek yogurt and vanilla cream still satisfies immensely. This seems a bit more "beer-y" compared to the nose, which I consider a good thing. Whatever the case, it's absurdly delicious. 

The initial feel is slightly creamy yet sweet; tartness dries it out post-swallow. It also adds some (not unexpected) sharp edges, aiding drinkability immensely. This goes down just as easily as regular fruit juice. Carbonation is medium-high

Welp, I'm sold. This stuff completely lives up to the hype created by stuff like Never Never Again Again. Not sure it's $22/4 pack amazing, but it's definitely amazing all the same. I'd even reckon it's one of the best fruit beers I've ever sampled!

4.33/5: Never never gonnastopmedrinkingthecrapoutofthis gonnastopmedrinkingthecrapoutofthis\xa01,780 charactersThisWangsChung, Oct 19, 2017']

name: Gose Gone Hopped
review:
["4.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev +14.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 5 | overall: 4.75Possibly the tastiest gose I have had yet, and one of only three that I've had that did not include a fruit.

L: Pours with a big sudsy white head. With the large bubbles, the peach nectar hue of the body gives the head a pale yellow glow. The body itself is almost as opaque as peach nectar, but with no visible sediment or pulpy bits. Head dies completely after a minute, but for a gose, the retention is excellent, and it even left a few speckles of lacing around the glass.

S: Mmm, very tropical. I get aromas of passion fruit, lemon, giant mango, mandarin, yellow grapefruit, rhubarb, and guava, which blend with a dry grassy white wine funk, like a sauvignon blanc. There's a hint of saltine cracker to the finish, but no real malt notes to speak of, and no herbal hop notes, except lemongrass and a touch of coriander.

T: Outrageously tasty. Lemon and passion fruit forward, for sure. Mango, grapefruit and guava make for some nice middle palate undertones. This kinds stretches out of the tart into the sour territory, which may be off-putting for some, but I think the saltiness balances it out perfectly.

F: So refreshing. Crisp, clean, bubbly... with just a dash of dry hoppy citrus bitterness on the finish... perfect.

O: As I said before: primo stuff. If you like light sour ales, this is a real treat. Cheers!\xa01,327 charactersAhypercube, Nov 14, 2019", "4.29/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.1%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4.2510oz pour into a snifter at a local restaurant. Hazy light gold color, with foam white head and decent retention. First aromas we're citrus hops. Upon first taste, the tart hits, followed by a hint of salt then a bit hop bitterness. I would want a bit more tart and salt but this is a tremendous beer. Paired it with some shrimp tacos which enhanced the flavors of both. The tart played well against mango salsa and the the shrimps saltiness worked well with the subtle salt in the brew.\xa0487 charactersBrolegario, May 16, 2019", '4.49/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.9%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5This is a fantastic hopped gose. Getting strong tangerine and citrus flavors that compliment the pucker wonderfully, very little salt, this almost tastes like a sour pale ale. Such an easy drinker, so juicy, really impressive.\xa0228 charactersdetpizzaboi, Feb 12, 2019', '4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.516 ounce can into tulip glass, canned on 7/10/2018. Pours very hazy golden amber color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with solid retention, that reduces to a thin spotty lace cap that lingers. Slight spotty lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big tart/sour lemon, lime, mandarin orange, grapefruit, peach, pear, pineapple, apricot, passion fruit, papaya, mango, melon, guava, berries, green apple, white wine, citrus peel/rind, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, and white bread; with lighter notes of peppercorn, pine, lacto/musty funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, citrus/tropical/earthy hops, and moderate pale/wheat malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big tart/sour lemon, lime, mandarin orange, grapefruit, peach, pear, pineapple, apricot, passion fruit, papaya, mango, melon, guava, berries, green apple, white wine, citrus peel/rind, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, and white bread; with lighter notes of peppercorn, pine, lacto/musty funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate lactic tartness; pine, citrus peel/rind, herbal, grassy bitterness; and peppery yeast spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/sour lemon, lime, mandarin orange, grapefruit, peach, pear, pineapple, apricot, passion fruit, papaya, mango, melon, guava, berries, green apple, white wine, citrus peel/rind, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, peppercorn, pine, light lacto/musty funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, citrus/tropical/earthy hops, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; with an awesome malt/tartness and bitter/spiciness balance, with no puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Moderately crisp/clean finishing. Light-moderate increasing dryness from tart/bitter/spiciness and carbonation. Medium-high carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately bready/grainy/acidic/sticky, and lightly saline balanced mouthfeel that is fantastic. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.8%. Overall this is an outstanding gose! All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, citrus/tropical hops, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink with the modestly acidic/bitter/spicy/drying finish. Not overly lactic or salty. Probably Mosaic/Galaxy. Awesome balance of juicy/fairly dank/earthy hops and Brett/Lacto complexity; with a nice pale/wheat malt backbone against acidity for the ABV. A highly enjoyable offering, and spot on style example as expected.\xa02,741 characterssuperspak, Sep 01, 2018', "4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25I'm sure Gose purists would scoff at this beer but as far as a tasty beverage this is awesome. It's basically exactly what it says - tart, wheaty, and very hoppy. I don't really get the salinity of a gose but maybe it's because this thing is so hoppy. Stillwater is great at appropriately hopping beer styles that are typically not hoppy and this is no exception. The hops accent the tart fruitiness and do not overpower. yb\xa0424 charactersSmashAdams, Aug 30, 2018", "3.83/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.9%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.7516 oz can poured into nonic pint canned on 6/27/17.

A: Murky tan yellow body with a tiny small white bubbly head.

S: Light metallic trace and then some grapefruit and pineapple hops

T: Light tartness a little bit of peach, apricot, grapefruit, and honey. Slight bits of wheat and salinity present themselves on the finish.

M: A little heavier than you would expect a goose to be.

O: It's a nice dry hopped beer the hops present themselves well it isn't that great of a gose though. reminds me a little of the Tool Sur series.\xa0530 charactersSomethingClever, Apr 28, 2018"]

name: Gose The Destructor
review: ['3.81/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.4%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75This was poured into a stange. The appearance was a faint hazy to pale white to yellow color with a slight transparency about it. Carbonation is seen rising at a rapid pace. A one finger white foamy soft head dissipated within about thirty seconds leaving some messy lacing roaming all around the glass. The smell started off with a bittersweet citrus adding a slight sweet wheat to eventually take the helm in the aroma. The taste mildly took the previously mentioned flavors and added a touch of salt. There’s a slight lemon aftertaste leading to a wet finish. On the palate, this one sat about a light on the body with a super nice sessionable feel to it. Carbonation feels pretty spot on - fairly low. Overall, for a gose, it’s a tad under on the "sour" to "tart" part, and the saltiness is pretty low as well. Still, I liked it more for me as it’s super sessionable and could be a good starter gose for a fair amount of people trying to get into the style.\xa0967 charactersLone_Freighter, Jun 07, 2017', '3.92/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Classic gose look. Cloudy straw with a moderate head. Not getting much smell off this beyond the wheat. Coriander is dominant flavor but not overwhelming. Sea salt is a nice touch. Nice smooth mouthfeel from the wheat. Better than this avg.\xa0240 charactersHootie159, Jul 15, 2016', '3.77/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Poured from a bomber into a snifter, the beer is a pale, hazy, straw yellow coloring with a halo of white head and a steady flow of carbonation throughout the body. Aromas of tart citrus, toasted grains, and a salty highlight. Flavors are very tart and salty forward, with a solid dose of lemon, and a cracker backbone. Very balanced and smooth, on a slightly effervesced, slightly dry body. The aftertaste has a bit more of the lemon notes, with some white grape highlights, as well as the continued salty character. The finish is dry, crisp, and with a salty linger. Solid beer.\xa0580 charactersGarthDanielson, Aug 26, 2015', "3.39/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.25Can't remember if it was on tap or from a bottle. VT Brewfest pour. Pours cloudy yellow. Aroma is mellow. Soft wheat, not too tart. Flavor isn't excessively tart either. Lightly salt. Spicy from yeast and coriander. Body is very light. Nothing more than a light bodied palate cleanser for me. Probably would have liked it better at a different place with more time put into it.\xa0377 charactersVelvetExtract, Jul 22, 2015", "3.14/5\xa0\xa0rDev -12.3%look: 4.5 | smell: 3 | taste: 3 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3Traditional coriander notes are present but light; salt is the dominant flavor (without being salty). Very light body, and an almost airy head. Great golden straw color with a crown of airy white bubbles. (Also: the name is one of the best I've ever seen.)\n\nTasting note: poured from a 22 oz. bomber into a stemware glass.\xa0322 charactersfounddrama, Mar 22, 2015"]

name: Never Gonnagetit³
review:
['4.14/5\xa0\xa0rDev -8%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4L - 1/2 finger dense pinkish head atop a sludgy maroon body.

S - blackberry, blueberry, brown sugar.

T - tart berry compote. No bitterness. Low sweetness. No booziness.

F - medium-full body with lower carb.

O - all about those berries.\xa0239 charactersCanConPhilly, May 04, 2019', "4.44/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.3%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.5The beer pours a heavy bubbly head that is fairly voluminous and purple with a reddish hue that dissipates fairly quickly. The beer itself is an opaque deep purple with a good reddish hue. It looks like a nice and delicious looking smoothie like texture to it.

The smell is pretty tempting and delicious. It has a fairly delicious sweet boysenberry note and with a hint of black berry and only a trace and almost invisible raspberry in the finish.

The taste is good and surprisingly different from the smell. The main notes in the taste consist of a moderate raspberry note with a mix of blackberry and a boysenberry note in the finish. The tart note mainly comes from the raspberry with a slight funk note and a tiny salt in the finish.

The feel is good. It's definitely a medium bodied beer with a thick and delicious texture and a lightly dry finish to it.

Overall, this is one fantastic gose and a delicious juice bomb to boot.\xa0936 charactersHattedClassic, Jan 09, 2019", '4.81/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.9%look: 5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 5 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.75Received as an extra in a trade and shared with JLindros. Canned on 3/13/18.

A - Poured into a Kate the Great tulip a murky vibrant purple red berry hue with an ultra thick ruby pink head that fades to leave sticky lacing. Looks like berry sherbet.

S - Big aromas of bright red berries, huge raspberry and boysenberries. Lightly sweet and tart berries, little creamy wheat. Nose is explosive.

T - Taste is similar to the nose with excellent pureed red berries. Excellent raspberries, blackberries, and boysenberries. Nice creamy wheat and lemon acidity. Good salt as well. Absolutely amazing.

M - Mouthfeel is lightly carbonated, heavy bodied, creamy. Not flemmy.

O - Overall this was an incredible beer, possibly the star of 2018 so far. Phenomenal berry and base beer notes. Staggeringly good. Gotta get more of this.

Serving Type: can\xa0846 charactersrudzud, Mar 24, 2018']

name: Gewürzgose
review:
["3.49/5\xa0\xa0rDev -13.6%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.5750 mL bottle poured into a snifter.

Appearance - Deep golden body. Small white head. Thick collar.

Smell - Spicy. Vanilla gives it some depth. Light bit of cola or root beer aroma. Cardamon is strong, too.

Taste - Lightly tart. Very lightly tart. Wheat and very light grain. Cardamon is strong here too. Vanilla and very spicy in the finish. I don't get a lot of salt, but it's got some mineral character back there.

Mouthfeel - Medium carbonation. Light body.

Overall - Loaded with spice, which keeps it interesting.\xa0533 charactersAlieniloquium, Jan 20, 2015", '3.6/5\xa0\xa0rDev -10.9%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5Enjoyed this one tonight at Bittercreek.... Pours the standard pale golden... slightly hazed... a bit more head retention than the Pineus.

Nose has all the standard Leipziger qualities, but is punctuated by something that makes me thin Xmas spices.... Clove oil.

Flavor mirrors the aroma with a more pronounced clove, but also with some orange zest and hints of dusty nutmeg.

Okay.... I am glad I got a chance to try this one, but I like the Pineus and the standard gose much better.

3.75/3.75/3.5/3.75/3.5\xa0510 charactersJohnGalt1, Apr 18, 2014']

name: Never Never Sufficient Sufficient
review:
['3.98/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 416 oz can dated 6/26/17 poured into Behind the Veil glass.

L: 2F head, light pink, dissipates quickly leaving only a few spots of lacing and a tiny ring. Beer is a pretty clear garnet color.

S: Sweet and sour cherries, coriander, flaked wheat, sea air

T: Sweet and sour cherries, a bit of coriander, some brine. Finish is very slightly sour. Good move to not make this cloying, but it is a tad watery.

F: Light bodied, undercarbonated, which undercuts the crispness. Construction is a bit off, balance is very good.

O: A little bit of a letdown in the usually very good Never series.\xa0588 charactersIvoryFoxhole, Jul 13, 2017', "4.26/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.25The fact that this didn't taste like cough medicine was enough for me to go bonkers of it. Clean and crisp, you get a heavy dose of cherries, not the medicine after taste of a lot of brews in this category.

This was outstanding for what it is, extremely well done.\xa0265 charactersjphipps83, Jul 10, 2017", '4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.7%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4The look and smell were definitely super cherry forward, buth i was expecting more on the palate. The feel was light but refreshing! Overall grat gose for the beach or hot summer day. The other fruited goses are way better IMO.\xa0227 charactersBEER88, Jul 02, 2017']

name: Ghost
review:
['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.9%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Growler thanks to Moll. Nose has tropical fruit along with a good dose of wheat. Flavor has nice citrus and tropical fruit notes with background wheat. Light and crisp. Very easy drinking. This made for a nice hotel room beer on vacation. Hope Jean makes this one again.\xa0270 charactersThorpe429, Dec 16, 2012', '3.42/5\xa0\xa0rDev -11.2%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 3 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Thanks to Pnell316 for sending this out to me. A weird interest in Goses for me. Head is pure white and maybe a finger tall which quickly falls to a trace. Body is slightly cloudy and a light straw yellow with a hint of orange. Aroma is great citrus of lime, orange, and grapefruit. Hint of some pine. Flavor is a little flat for me. Some harsh hops kills the citrus. Getting a lot of dirty pine. Only a little bit of salt, but really tiny. Mouth is pretty good on carbonation, but body is a little light. 

Overall an ok beer. Maybe it was the travel here, but not a whole lot to raise this beer up.\xa0600 charactersRuckusDu, Nov 04, 2012', '4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.5A- Thin sticky white head atop a clear golden body.

S- Sweet grassy hops, wheat, fresh cut grass, lemon/citrus aroma.

T- Nice hop presence all the way through, grass and citrus come through a lot as well. I do taste a slight mineral/salt presence apparent in the gose style.

M- Crisp and refreshing, slightly dry.

O- Very good, very drinkable.\xa0347 charactersstephenjmoore, Nov 03, 2012', "3.4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -11.7%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3First had: on tap at the brewpub

A gose hopped with Galaxy.

Half-pour, a pale straw-yellow liquid, clearish, with a small white head that receded to a ringlet, leaving some nice lacing on the glass. Aroma was fairly light, biscuity with hints of citrus. Similar taste, biscuity pale malts, lemony and crisp, but fell a bit short of what may be expected from a gose in general. Drank more like a light IPA or timid saison. It wasn't bad, but just not a fair example of the style, I thought. It's not a common style these days, so credit goes to the brewers for taking a crack at it. Light body, crisp, and still an enjoyable drink.

*At a second tasting of this beer a week later, it seemed somehow considerably more fruity in taste, with notes of pear and mango that I didn't get the first time. Hmm.\xa0802 charactersRifugium, Nov 01, 2012", "3.61/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.2%look: 4.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.5This beer poured out as a hazy looking golden yellow color with a very nice looking white head on top. The retention was low but the lacing was really impressive. The smell of the beer was loaded up with the lemony hop aromas and possible coriander that was used as well. The taste of the beer was hoppy to say the least... more hoppy than other beers I've had of this style. There may have been a very minimal amount of salt or mineral flavors in there but the hops dominated the beer with citrus flavors. The mouthfeel was smooth and very refreshing. Overall I think it's a good beer, I am glad I got to try this one because of the rarity of the style. It's something I would drink again but probably wouldn't classify it as a Gose.\xa0734 charactersKnapp85, Oct 21, 2012", "3.58/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.5On tap at Tired Hands. 

Pours pale gold, lightly hazed, with a big white head that has strong retention. Patchy lacing sticking to the glass. Faintly tart lemony aroma, some other citrusy hop notes, light yeast esters, a touch of biscuity malt, overall a very mild nose.

Flavor has lemon and grapefruit citrus, passion fruit, a suggestion of soapiness to the hops, and a hint of salt in the finish. Modest fruity esters from the yeast just poking out here and there. Mostly dry. A bit bland overall; one server suggested they simply didn't bring the saltiness out enough and that they weren't entirely satisfied with the results here. 

Smoothly carbonated, light bodied, easy drinking. A bit unexciting I'd say. Not bad but certainly not these guys' best work to date.\xa0771 characterstobelerone, Oct 19, 2012", '4.12/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7%look: 4 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4on tap at the brewery

Pours a clouded golden color with a thick crop of white head. Retains nicely with patchy rings of film on the glass. 

Fragrant galaxy hops in the nose with citrus peel. Hints of salt and light funk with yeast and biscuit malts. Faint fruit sweetness with hoppy spice. 

Nice peppery hoppiness up front with a hint of salt. Citrus peel, oranges and zest followed by light biscuit malts. A pleasant rush of funky yeast, galaxy hops and salt spice through on the back end. Finishes a little hoppy and dry. 

Lighter medium body, well carbonated, a little creamy and smooth on the tongue. Such a wonderfully interesting beer with a great combination of flavors.\xa0681 charactersxnicknj, Oct 18, 2012', "4.02/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.4%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4On Tap at The Brew Cafe in Ardmore, PA.

GHOST pours out a lighter shade of yellow with a hazy golden sunshine look to itself, hazier than most TH beers I've seen. A nice whisp of bright white foam up top, that did not stick to the glass as well as the creature, no biggie. Smell is bright with hops coming from the galaxy. I get some spicy notes with some strangeness from the salt. Some mild fruity appeal, passion fruit, and pale malt. Not as salty as say a Leipzinger, but the galaxy hops used are forefront with a minimal malty backing. I get some lemon in the middle with some spicy notes Feel is a step up from light bodied with active carb going for it. This is one to drink a lot of with some funky cheeses.\xa0718 charactersBARFLYB, Oct 13, 2012"]

name: Pickle
review:
['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.7%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 412 ounce can into tulip glass, canned on 6/25/2019. Pours fairly hazy medium golden yellow color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with solid retention, that reduces to a minimal spotty lace cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big juicy cucumbers, skin/seeds, tart/tangy lemon, lime, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, dill weed, sea salt, coriander, hay, straw, grass, wheat, white bread, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of cucumbers, fruity/acidic yeast, dill, coriander, sea salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt notes; with big strength. Taste of big juicy cucumbers, skin/seeds, tart/tangy lemon, lime, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, dill weed, sea salt, coriander, hay, straw, grass, wheat, white bread, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang, and light coriander spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of juicy cucumbers, skin/seeds, tart/tangy lemon, lime, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, dill weed, sea salt, coriander, hay, straw, grass, wheat, white bread, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Great complexity, robustness, and balance of cucumbers, fruity/acidic yeast, dill, coriander, sea salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; with an awesome malt/tartness, tangy fruit, and spiciness balance; with zero puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp/clean finishing. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering tartness and tangy fruit. Medium-plus carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/grainy, fairly acidic/tangy, and lightly sticky/saline mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.3%. Overall this is an excellent fruited Gose. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of cucumbers, fruity/acidic yeast, dill, coriander, sea salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth, refreshing, and fairly crisp/clean to drink with the mellowly acidic/tangy/drying finish. Mellowly lactic/salty. Very flavorful and not watery for the ABV. Great balance of juicy cucumbers, Lacto complexity, and dill/coriander spice; with a great pale/wheat malt backbone against acidity for the ABV. Minimal residual sweetness with crisp dryness. A very enjoyable offering, and spot on style example as expected. Would have actually preferred if they used white vinegar in secondary to make it taste more like a pickle. Nothing but the lactic acid going on. No complaints otherwise.\xa02,713 characterssuperspak, Aug 10, 2019', '3.77/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Thanks Alanna and Richard!

A: a hazy pale Amber in color.

S: celery salt, cucumber, and light malt.

T: light vinegar, cucumber, salt, and perhaps a hint of coriander.

M: medium light, moderate carbonation, semi dry. 

O: pretty tasty, and interesting.\xa0255 charactersBeejay, Jul 27, 2019', "4.32/5\xa0\xa0rDev +13.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.2512 ounce can, canned on 06/19/19. Served in a Tubby pint glass, the beer pours a cloudy gold color with about an inch white head. The head didn't stick around for very along, and there's a small amount of lacing. The brew smells just like dill pickles, with dill, briny/salt, and cucumber. Taste is pretty much just like the aroma but there's also the addition of some coriander flavor noticeable. But I think this is just like drinking a dill pickle, and I say that in the best way possible! Mouthfeel/body is light, it's easy and refreshing to drink with a good amount of carbonation. I could probably drink this year round but it's really good on a summer day like this one. Definitely recommend this especially if you like pickles! $11.99 a 6-pack.\xa0761 charactersbluejacket74, Jul 06, 2019", "3.99/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 412 FL OZ can
Served in a sour glass

This beer pours yellow and hazy without much head.

I smell fresh cucumber right away. It smells tart as well. The dill opens up as it warms a bit.

The taste is tart, briny cucumber. The dill is pretty subtle and slowly builds to become more of a factor near the end of the glass.

Smooth mouthfeel. Somewhat dry finish

A friend gave me this beer. I was a little apprehensive at first. I didn't think a dill pickle gose would be good. I was wrong. This is good and very refreshing. I would definitely have it again.\xa0554 charactersbuschbeer, Aug 25, 2018", "4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.3%look: 5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Enjoyed this from the can at Savages Ale House, so it's just going to get a 5 on the looks. I was expecting to hate this beer, as I'm not huge on pickles in the first place, but I thought it was interesting so I tried it. The smell came through not showcasing huge pickle, but more of a classic gose with maybe a touch of pickle. The taste had tart pickle all over it, and it actually worked quite great with the saltiness too. The mouthfeel was wonderful for the style and had that nice dry tartness with the salt to make you pucker a little. Overall, I'm glad I tried this!\xa0575 charactersAyatollahGold, Aug 08, 2018", "3.12/5\xa0\xa0rDev -18.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 2.75 | feel: 3 | overall: 3.25I don't know if I can finish this beer. I have loved everything else that this brewer has sent upstate, but this ain't working for me. And I love pickles too.

It pours pale, dirty golden with very little head. Right at first sniff you get pickles - completely overpowering the beer. The taste is like pickle juice with just a hint of the underlying gose. The pickle taste is very far forward, ruining the gose. It's sour, probably as much from the gose as the pickle ingredients. I am not having that hamburger or reuben recommended on the label (I do love both of those) right now, but I don't think I would want this with my hearty sandwich. 

Not recommended. I am going to chug a lug so as not to commit the alcohol abuse of pouring it down the drain.\xa0756 charactersschoolboy, Jul 15, 2018", "3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Everyone seems to like pickles, right? But will the same apply to a pickle flavored beer? The folks at Urban Artifact think so as they brew a German styled gose that's already equipped with sea salt and coriander. With the start of pickling spices at hand, the summery taste of cucumber is no surprise to the beer world, yet the dill and other pickling spices might be pushing the beer too far.

Pale and dirty golden, the hazy beer carries a spritzy light froth that dissipates quickly. Cucumber, herbs and spices leap out immediately over the piquant scent of sourness. Citrus, apple and berries round out the scent while its taste is of sour candy, sourdough and delicate pastry.

What little sweetness that the ale started with has retreated quickly before the middle palate. What billows behind is the sharply flavored sourness that takes the shape of lime, lemon, crabapple and cider, gooseberry and honeydew. Lightly winey and briney, the beer's balance comes from the roundness of salinity that plays perfectly into the hands of coriander, dill and underlying additional spices and herbs. A light minty, pepper and straw-like finish allows for the sourness to decide the outcome in taste.

Medium light on the finish, the beer's acidity strips any thirst with ease and becomes this beautiful refreshing course with the complement of herb, spice and yes, pickles to satisfy the culinary curious in much the same way that do summer salads, cucumber mixed drinks and citrusy sports drinks.\xa01,494 charactersBEERchitect, Aug 03, 2017", "3.68/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Gose brewed with (a half ton of) cucumbers, fresh dill, sea salt, and corriander. Poured from a can into an Urban Artifact Thoroughbred tulip. Medium-orange color, fairly clear, and a nice fluffy head that quickly succumbs to the acidity. The nose has a lot of cucumber on it (maybe a little too much). Heavy vegetative aromas and a little vinegar-like note. If I didn't know what was in this beer, I'd think it was a salad.

Light body with a firm feel and a crisp, tart flavor. Soft graininess up front, then a nice, pleasant tart flavor. As soon as it gets tart, huge notes of cucumber roll in. I get a little bit of the dill (not too much), but I don't detect the corriander. 

I've never had Cigar City's Cucumber Saison (I hear it's great), but I have had Wicked Weed's Coolcumber. That beer had far too much basil and not enough cucumber. This beer nails the cucumber flavor. Still, when it comes to Gose from this brewer I strongly prefer their Pinwheel and Keypunch to this one. If you like cucumber - I mean REALLY like it - you should seek this out. If you don't, then this beer will offend you. The can says it is the perfect complement to a burger or Reuben. I concur. I might add that it also goes really well with sauerkraut, mustard, and Queen City Sausage.\xa01,273 charactersdeadonhisfeet, Jul 25, 2017", "3.95/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.4%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Hazy apricot-yellow topped with a soft white fizz that dies off quickly.

Smell is certainly dill forward with cucumber, but there's a little grilled lemon or something baked or roasted with salt as well.

Cucumber takes the stage in flavor, like flavored water at a boutique store, with dill following. There's a little salty tartness, but it does not seem like enough of either at first. However, as you go there's a little breadiness, and the light tartness keeps it easy drinking, while the pickle flavor begins to bloom without becoming the acid bomb that drinking out of a pickle jar would, and it becomes addictive.

The medium body is smooth and round and finishes semi-dry. Like a cold AAL brew, this is great with food, especially a big greasy burger and fries.\xa0771 charactersSabtos, Jan 05, 2017", "3.77/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Sampled on tap in a taster. Pours a straw yellow with a white one-finger head. Strong dill on the nose, with a slightly musty odor. The palate is prominent pickle on the forepalate, with a faint cucumber background. The hint of salt from the gose base complements the rest of the beer beautifully. The mouthfeel is light-medium.

Overall, a strong beer. The pickle adjunct pairs extremely well with the solid gose base. That said, the pickle flavor is a novelty more than anything. The profile is perfect for a taster, but would quickly become tiresome in a full bottle, let alone a 4- or 6-pack. Nonetheless, it's excellent to see continued experimentation with the style.\xa0682 charactersLAp, Oct 22, 2016"]

name: Margarita Gose
review:
["4.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +28.6%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Ahh a gose style, probably one of the most complex ales we have tasted in some time, burnt out on dry hop offerings and fancy labels/hype ....some real brewer craftsmanship here, like once in a lifetime type 'hits' when you homebrew..\xa0235 charactersale1, Sep 23, 2019", "1/5\xa0\xa0rDev -71.4%look: 1 | smell: 1 | taste: 1 | feel: 1 | overall: 1Terrible beer. I'm not sure what they were thinking besides hopping on the tequila barrel band wagon. This stuff is garbage. I get virtually no margarita flavor from this, and it finishes more like malt liquor. I have been burnt by funky buddha too many times after this one. I would not reccomend this beer to anyone. Founder's Mas Agave is 1% less ABV, and much much much better than this hooch.\xa0397 charactersAceTub, Sep 07, 2019", "3.06/5\xa0\xa0rDev -12.6%look: 2 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3 | feel: 3 | overall: 3A: This was not a particularly good pour, and generally speaking, I'm pretty easy to please. The color is nice, a glowing amber, though there is a great deal of sediment and funkiness going on. The head forms very fizzy and recedes to nothing within a minute. 

S: The smell is pleasant, though largely just lime--it does have the scent reminiscent of margaritas in many Mexican restaurants--a good dose of lime. After opening up for a little while, a hefty honey-like sweetness comes through. 

T: The flavour is not terrible, though it is verging on being cloyingly sweet. A bit of alcohol astringency comes out on the finish, though it's not overpowering. The complexities of the lime and saltiness are quite subdued when compared to the sweetness.

M + O: The mouthfeel is heavier than I might have hoped, having a pretty full feel. The carbonation is moderate, though not surprising given the alcohol content. This is a very cool concept--one that, in my own opinion, could have gone over much better if everything was a bit lighter.\xa01,038 charactersProteus93, Jul 12, 2019", '2.49/5\xa0\xa0rDev -28.9%look: 3 | smell: 2.75 | taste: 2 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 2.5Picked on sale for 12.99 per 4 pack. Popping the top I get a fruity biscuit smell. Pours too a deep gold with a beige small bubble head. Taste is very thick on the mouthfeel up front with a tart and sour middle and a lightly bitter finish. At 11% it packs a wallop. Like most beers by Funky Buddha this beer is indeed “funky” and not in a good way. Have not had much luck with them.\xa0388 charactersmooseisloose, Jun 28, 2019', '4.17/5\xa0\xa0rDev +19.1%look: 4 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25It took adding something to a gose for me to really like this style...

From a purist point-of-view this gose is just a gimmick. However, looking at it at face value, I really like it. This is one of those beers, IMHO, that breaks the mold. Something like this simply is to be enjoyed for what it is. And in the case of this particular offering I’m just inclined to overlook the differences and embrace them instead.\xa0421 charactersjjamadorphd, Jun 16, 2019', '2.86/5\xa0\xa0rDev -18.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 3 | taste: 2.5 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3It's a very solid Gose. However, the agave from the Casa Noble barrels and high ABV overpower the palate, leaving little flavor of actual margarita. Opinions would be different had the word "Margarita" not been used in the name of the beer.\xa0240 charactersLak73089, May 28, 2019']

name: Gose
review:
["3.89/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75On tap at Druthers Brewing Company in Saratoga Springs, NY.

This one pours a light orange-ish yellow, with a small quickly diminishing head, and no lacing.

Smells a bit salty, with a good amount of orange and grapefruit, and some mild lactic acid.

This is a pretty solid but not spectacular gose. There's some lemon and grapefruit rind, slightly overripe in taste, with a salty note, some flat wheat notes, and a mild sourness of about 3/10. It's all quite refreshing.

This is light bodied, with a slightly slick mouthfeel, and a lower level of carbonation. I wish the carbonation was a tiny bit more lively.\xa0612 charactersGreesyFizeek, Jun 29, 2015", '3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.8%cool to see a place like this brew a gose, and its a good one too. light and tart, with a green apple pucker to it, but a longer wetter finish than others, which makes it both approachable and really easy drinking. blonde to brass in color, short lived half inch of white bubbles. the nose is tart, sour mashed style, a little funky, but somehow real clean and crisp. fruity finish, less coriander than others, more fruit than spice there, and then the salt. everything flows pretty well here, my only significant knock against it is the lack of expressive carbonation. its not flat, but i like this style to sing on the palate, and this never really quite gets there. overall though a really cool effort from a brewery i dont think i gave enough credit to for being adventurous with recipes. well done.\xa0803 charactersStonedTrippin, Aug 23, 2014']

name: Face Eater Gose
review:
['3.01/5\xa0\xa0rDev -15.9%look: 3.5 | smell: 3 | taste: 3 | feel: 2.75 | overall: 3Appearance: pours a straw yellow to golden honey color. finger or so of a white head with decent retention and a weak lacing. strong clarity and brightness to it. 

Smell: musty, light apple skin to lemon juice. salt.

Taste: opens up with a musty and grassy wheat. slight apple skin comes through but lacks much tartness. more fruitiness comes through but weakly and mostly in the form of lemon acid. salt and coriander come in near the end. 

Mouthfeel: light, musty, little to no tartness and lacking refreshing qualities.

Overall: has some good flavors but they are way too weak. it really needs a bump in strength of tartness. the musty flavor would be much better suited as the background rather than the main taste.\xa0723 charactersSportsandJorts, Mar 31, 2015', "4.21/5\xa0\xa0rDev +17.6%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25Poured at The Birch, review from notes. I'm actually not certain of the availability of this offering as I think the brewery is quite new. 

Soft white head on a pale, cloudy brew. Nice, subtle sour note with a hint of herbs wafting from the glass.

Fruity upfront with an emphasis on melon, lemon, and even a touch of summer thistle honey. Salty and oceanic notes. I think of crisp watermelon with salt sprinkled on it. Extremely refreshing and flavorful. Nice balance of sour, salt, and sweet. Mouthfeel is light and this makes for a great summer session ale. 

Based on the quality and solid presentation of this brew, I think I need to take a quick jaunt up the road to Charlottesville.\xa0696 charactersZraly, Jul 17, 2013"]

name: Disco Godfather
review:
["3.94/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.8%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4This was yet another beer that I traded for a while ago, as the date on the bottom of the can read 11/20/17. Never had anything from Platform before but if this beer was any indication, then it was obvious that they were good at what they did!

Liked the pour to this as the liquid was red, lively, and topped off with a moderate and quickly-fading head that sounded like retreating sea foam as it settled in my glass. The beet hue was quite light around the edges as this quite a bit of sediment floating in the liquid every time I took a sip. Tons of blackberry and marionberry (not to be confused with the former mayor of Washington D.C.) tartness in the nose with some lemon and salt in the mix as on top of that. Basic bread, extra tartness, sea salt, and vinegar/acetate emerged on the palate with this being a nice, full-flavored and full-bodied example of the style that had plenty of juice in it from start to finish.

Of course, this was light in alcohol as it easily went down and left a mild tartness behind until the next sip smoothed that out. A lively carbonation kept this light as this was one of the better examples of the style that I've had recently. Perfect for a hot summer afternoon such as today!\xa01,220 charactersJerzDevl2000, Jul 20, 2019", '3.92/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.3%look: 3 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4I have been delving deeply into ciders today & this CAN happened to be ready to go for The CANQuest (tm), so I am going to shift gears & have a Gose.

From the CAN: "Kettle Sour Series"; "Berry*Tart*Salty"; "Malts[:] Pilner[,] Pale Wheat[,] Vienna[,] Wheat Flakes[;] Hops[:] Crystal[;] Yeast[:] American Ale[;] Adjuncts[:] Black Raspberry[,] Marionberry[,] Natural Sea Salt".

I Crack!ed the vent open & beCAN a slow, gentle Glug into the awaiting glass since I was a tad apprehensive after reading prior reviews. Sure enough, it was pouring with a color that I am unacCANstomed to seeing. Further, it created its own fizzy, foamy finger of deep-pink head that quickly fizzled out of existence. Color was Cranberry-Magenta (SRM = N/A) with NE-quality clarity. Nose was easily identifiable as black raspberry & sea salt & if I knew about marionberries, I would have also mentioned them. I grew up baking with my grandmothers & my paternal grandmother grew both Black & Red raspberries & kept the bees very happy with the inclusion of her rosebushes. Black raspberries have a greater inherent tartness than their Red counterparts & so we often baked a combination of both into our pies. In late season, we would make a decadent all-Red raspberry pie. As to seas salt, I am a retired U.S. Navy sailor with plenty of sea time in the books. That scent just makes me long to get underway. Mouthfeel was medium. The taste was moderately tart, but the Black raspberry & sea salt remained easily identifiable throughout. I really must get smarter about Marionberries, I suppose. Finish was tart, dry, refreshing, fruity & definitely worth a try if you see it. Mmm.\xa01,655 characterswoodychandler, Jul 11, 2018', '3.81/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Disco Godfather - Platform
Gose - 4.2% abv
Purchased for $4.49 at Monde Market

L - 1/4 finger head atop a purple translucent body.

S - salt, berries. Rather subtle.

T - very salty! Fruit taste complements but is secondary. Mildly sour.

F - light bodied.

O - not for though with a salt senitivity.\xa0301 charactersCanConPhilly, Mar 21, 2018', '3.88/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.8%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 416 ounce can into tulip glass, canned on 11/20/2017. Pours lightly hazy/cloudy ruby reddish/pink/purple color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy light pink head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of tart/tangy blackberry, raspberry, lemon, peach, pear, red/green apple, red grape, sea salt, hay, grass, wheat, cracker, biscuit, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Nice and pleasant aromas with good balance and complexity of fruity/acidic yeast, berries, sea salt, and bready malt notes; with solid strength. Taste of big tart/tangy blackberry, raspberry, lemon, peach, pear, red/green apple, red grape, sea salt, hay, grass, wheat, cracker, biscuit, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit/wheat tang; and light bitter/spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/tangy blackberry, raspberry, lemon, peach, pear, red/green apple, red grape, sea salt, hay, grass, wheat, cracker, biscuit, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, berries, sea salt, and bready malt flavors; with a great malt/tartness and tangy fruit balance, with zero puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Light-moderate increasing dryness from tartness and tangy fruit. Medium carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately crisp, bready, grainy, acidic, tangy, tannic, and saline balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.2%. Overall this is a delicious Gose. All around nice complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, berries, sea salt, and bready malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, and refreshing to drink with the modestly lactic/tangy/drying finish. Nice malt body for the ABV to balance acidity. Awesome balance between the fruity lacto, berries, salt, and bready malts. A very enjoyable offering, and great style example.\xa02,076 characterssuperspak, Jan 20, 2018', "3.85/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75This beer/Gose was sent to me by a friend in Ohio. I thought it was a very good Gose.

Look: semi-clear red-purple, with a half-inch pink head.

Aroma: blackberries 

Taste: The taste is wheat & barley, black berries, allegedly Marion Berry (I have not had Marion Berry before), but there's definitely black berry and perhaps other berries. It's tart, fizzy, a bit sweet but not too much.

Feel: it’s light, Crisp, refreshing\xa0427 charactersThomas_Wikman, Apr 04, 2017", '3.61/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.7%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Poured from a 16 can from the taproom

It is a reddish purple color. Looks a little bit like cranberry juice. It is very turbid with a lot of floaties. Very fizzy, soda like head that dissipated rapidly. 

It smells like dark berries (black and raspberry), salt, and kind of vinegary. When it warms up, some wheat and bready barely comes through. 

It is tart, but not super sour. A sour blackberry with a hint of sugar. There is some acidic notes and a little bit of saltiness. A decent lingering wheat flavor. 

It has a crisp carbonation, is lighter bodied, and is pretty soft and dry finishing from the salt. 

While not a textbook version of a Gose that is also too fruit forward, this is still a very enjoyable beer that reminds me of Mad Tree Shade.\xa0756 charactersWesMantooth, Feb 19, 2017', "4.11/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4This beer is part of Platform's 12 Kettle sours series of 12 releases in 12 months. Poured out a 16 oz. can into a stange glass, this beer pours a cloudy/hazy deep, medium red color. I haven't too many, if any, beers with this color scheme before. Has a pink, fizzy head that while initially being about an inch thick when first poured, fizzes like the type of foam head one gets when one pours oneself a glass of soda pop. Interesting. Head dissipates very quickly to a medium sized ring lining the inside of the glass along with little bits of surface coating of foam. Barely any lacing. Aromas of some bready malts, black berries, and bit of musty barnyard funk from the yeast no doubt. Has a somewhat bready malt flavor along with some definite wheat that gives way to some blackberry sourness, a nice saltyness, and a hint of musty, barnyard funk. I really like the flavor profile here. This one stands out in a good way from other Goses that I've had. Has a crisp, yet smooth, slightly prickly, medium bodied mouthfeel with moderate carbonation. Has a clean finish with a slightly dry aftertaste. The flavors really linger nicely on the inside of my mouth and tongue after each sip. I quite enjoyed this one. 

Eric\xa01,237 charactersneenerzig, Jan 26, 2017", "3.82/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.7516oz can poured into a stange
A: A berry red opaque appearance, kind of the hue of a cranberry; no head
S: Somewhat muted but blackberry shows up
T: Tart, blackberry, what I assume is marionberry, light wheat and a hint of salt
M: Light-bodied, tart
O: This tastes great now, very refreshing, hopefully it will stay fresh through summer as I'd love to enjoy one on a hot day\xa0374 charactersONUMello, Dec 25, 2016", '3.89/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 4Unique and has the full on gose flavor going on. Aroma is wild yeast, and taste is sour, salty and raspberry. Slightly bigger mouthfeel than expected considering the low ABV.\xa0176 charactersHeightsEats, Dec 17, 2016']

name: Two Of Tarts
review:
['3.99/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 412oz can. Poured out a clear, straw-yellow color with a small, white head of foam. It smelled of mango, lemon and citrus. Tart with some sweet fruits and a hint of salt.\xa0169 characterszeff80, Jul 27, 2019', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 412 ounce can into tulip glass, best before 9/2019. Pours moderately hazy pale golden yellow color with a 1 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with good retention, that reduces to a thin spotty lace cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big juicy/sour/tart/tangy mangoes, melon, passion fruit, fruit skin/seed, lemon, lime, citrus zest, orange, peach, pear, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, light peppercorn/lacto funk and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of mango, passion fruit, frutiy/acidic yeast, sea salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt notes; with big strength. Taste of big juicy/sour/tart/tangy mangoes, melon, passion fruit, fruit skin/seed, lemon, lime, citrus zest, orange, peach, pear, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, light peppercorn/lacto funk and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang, and light spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/tangy mangoes, melon, passion fruit, fruit skin/seed, lemon, lime, citrus zest, orange, peach, pear, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, light peppercorn/lacto funk and yeast earthiness on the finish for a short bit. Great complexity, robustness, and balance of mango, passion fruit, frutiy/acidic yeast, sea salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; with a great malt/tartness, and tangy fruit balance; with zero puckering flavors after the finish. Moderately crisp/clean finishing. Moderate increasing dryness from lingering tartness, tangy fruit, and carbonation. Medium-plus carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately bready/grainy/acidic/tangy, and lightly sticky/saline balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.5%. Overall this is an excellent gose. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of mango, passion fruit, frutiy/acidic yeast, sea salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink with the modestly acidic/tangy/drying finish; not overly lactic/salty. Very flavorful and not watery for the ABV. Perfectly balanced between juicy/vibrant fruit, and Lacto complexity; with a great clean pale/wheat malt backbone against acidity. Minimal residual sweetness with crisp dryness. A very enjoyable offering, and spot on style example as expected.\xa02,552 characterssuperspak, Jun 04, 2019', '3.69/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Actually quite good - goses are not my go-to beer style, but this one was quite refreshing and not too tart. Pours a nice hazy yellow-orange color with lots of fluffy white head and spotty lingering lacing. Smells mainly of some fresh fruit - mango, passionfruit, pineapple, lemon - as well as a little faint spice and malt. Taste follows the nose, fairly accurately, with not too much tartness or overpowering sweetness. Maybe a hint of salt. Mild, thin mouthfeel, decent carbonation. Refreshing and quite pleasant to drink. Well done!\xa0543 charactersbeersampler6, May 24, 2019', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 412 fl. oz. can
Served in a stemless wine glass

This beer pours pale yellow and cloudy. It is topped with an inch of white head that leaves spotty lacing. 

The smell is tart and briny. I get aromas of lemon and mango. The passionfruit eludes me.

The taste follows the smell. I get lemon and mango with a lovely tart and salty flavor. 

Medium mouthfeel with an effervescent mouthfeel

This is a great beer for a hot, humid, spring day. I about drank it in four gulps, but I restrained myself.\xa0494 charactersbuschbeer, May 23, 2019', '4.06/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Had Two of Tarts poured from 12-oz. can, bottom stamped “BEST BY DEC 2018,” into pilsner glass.

Brewed with passionfruit and mango, this is a well-balanced tart, sweet and briny “Tropical Gose.”\xa0203 charactersBigGold, Sep 06, 2018']

name: Silly Gose
review:
["3.84/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.752019-09-15
12oz can served in a snifter. Dated 4/16/19. Gift from a friend at work.

Pours a clear golden color with very little head and a significant amount of fine carbonation. Smell is moderately tart, light, and apricotty.

Taste is stonefruit, tart, with noticeable salt (but not overwhelming). 

Mouthfeel is light and very effervescent. Overall, it's pretty good.\xa0371 characterssnaotheus, Sep 15, 2019", '3.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.9%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.512oz can, tulip, canned who knows when. Just put a date on the can! 

Apricot color and a white, rapidly vanishing head that’s composed of large bubbles while it lasts. Faintly hazed and no head once the pour party is over. 

Definitely an inviting aroma of, yep, apricot. Also light wheat, a little minty, a little citric. 

Orange slice, apricot, wheat, very light on the salt. There’s an herbal undertone. 

Thin, serious carbonation. 

This is a nice gose, which seem to be popular in Texas, though they range from pickle jar saltiness to this kind of subtly. The fruit is equally subtle.\xa0596 charactersbrewerburgundy, Apr 05, 2019', "3.63/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.4%look: 2.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Poured from a 12 ounce can into a beer can style glass. The thin head dissipated within seconds, which makes the beer look flat; not a good look but does it have to do with the high acidic nature of gose style beers? Don't know the answer to that. Tastes tart but not stomach turning. There is mention of Tangerine and Apricot flavors on the can but they did not distinguish themselves on the tongue. Overall a decent gose.\xa0424 charactersrorjets, Feb 27, 2018", "3.8/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Smells alot like my cat's litter box after a few days. Tastes about as tart as I can be comfortable with. Bright, light, tangy. A Decent sour by Community Beer Company.\xa0168 charactersprincessbay710, Oct 22, 2017", '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8.7%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Pours a mostly clear bright yellow golden color with fizzy white head that dissipates quickly. Citrus, tartness, salt, and light fruits on the nose; follows onto the palate. Light bodied. Finishes with citrus, salt, and a light tartness.\xa0237 charactersTX-Badger, Jun 05, 2017']

name: Salty Angel
review:
["3.69/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.6%look: 3 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Reviewed from (very) long-standing notes. Poured from an 11.2 oz. bottle into a Cigar City Brewing goblet. This bottle was purchased at a local bottle shop on 8/16/16, consumed 10 days later.

A: Hazy orangish gold – darker than most goses I've had. This has a lot of visible carbonation, but a thin ring of white foam is all that forms for “head” - and even that fades quickly.

S: Some funk, citric acid, and salty. Light biscuit and wheaty malts. Lactobacillus funk and lemon rind. Pretty nice.

T: Lactic tart, mild funk, and citric acid. Biscuity malts, and quite a bit of salinity with some hard water/minerally character. More tartness and saline after the swallow – the salinity really lingers.

M: A light body overall - but undeniably a little heavy for the style. Carbonation sensation on the low side. Low alcohol presence.

O: An acceptable gose, but nothing I’d go out of my way for. I think I’d prefer it either a little less salty, or a little more tart to offset the increased salinity. The bigger malt presence, especially as they come across more bready than typical, with the lower carbonation sensation doesn't help either. But still enjoyable.\xa01,177 charactersmacrosmatic, Aug 17, 2019", "4.34/5\xa0\xa0rDev +14.5%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Poured into a stange, the appearance had a light pink to yellow sort of color and a soft chill haze to it. The head didn't want to stick around and slid off immediately while not leaving any lace.
The aroma had some sour to tart red currants, sour-ed wheat and a decent dose of salt.
The flavor definitely leaned into the sour wheaty taste initially then dropped the red currants in for some extra sour and tart character. Red currant, salt and sour wheaty aftertaste.
The mouthfeel was between light and medium bodied with a pretty good sessionability. Nothing distracting despite the huge sour wheaty portion and saltiness. Clean salty sour crisp finish with a touch of sour wheat.
Overall, a very nicely done true to style gose, absolutely brings the style forth from it's roots while providing enough creativity to definitely want again. Can't believe this was on clearance!\xa0878 charactersLone_Freighter, Jun 21, 2019", "3.77/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75A: The beer is quite hazy orange in color and has a moderate amount of visible carbonation along with some reddish hues. It poured with a short head consisting of medium-sized bubbles that quickly dissipated, leaving only a collar around the edge of the glass.
S: Moderate aromas of sourness are present in the nose along with strong notes of red currants.
T: The taste follows the smell, but isn't as sour and has more in the way of saltiness with notes of red currants.
M: It feels light- to medium-bodied and very tart on the palate with a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: This is one of the saltier gose beers that I had before, but the red currant flavors helped to prevent it from being overly salty.

Serving type: bottle\xa0730 charactersmetter98, Dec 09, 2018", '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Nice and rose in color. The tartness comes off in the aroma of the beer. The head rapidly dissipates. The beer is nice and dry in body and surprisingly has little sourness despite the aroma. It’s really well done the acid of the beer doesn’t over power the sweetness.\xa0271 charactersi4ourgot, Mar 14, 2018', '3.42/5\xa0\xa0rDev -9.8%look: 4.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3 | overall: 3.25Had on tap. Pours clear, pink in color with minimal head. Taste is floral--rose petals, white wine, and moderate salt. light bodied, moderate carbonation, sweet and salty. The flavors here are very delicate. Not a bad beer, but I wish I got more that stood out than just a bit of brine.\xa0291 characterstigg924, Feb 20, 2018', '4.19/5\xa0\xa0rDev +10.6%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4.25a beautiful red currant gose, one of the best fruited takes on the style i have seen, and the first beer from these guys in the small bottles, its super original and worth the spendy price. it is pink to red in color, not super carbonated, and a bit hazy but still bright too. it smells tangy for sure, a mix of the currant and the lacto, which is oddly clean in this one. the salt is intense too, mineraly and drying and also sort of filling, like a mouthful of sea water. the yeast is light and so is the wheat malt, not even all that beery because of it, but a fine summer drink with a lot of layers for the style. the yeast its fermented with is somewhat different and plays nice with the acidity created on the front end. some hops here too, and some iron or something heavy in the salt, a cool contrast with the overall lightness of this thing. nice use of the currant, its flavor is true and fresh and better than it is in most beers that use it. these guys do some really neat stuff, and its great to see it trickling into the united states finally. i love the salty flavor, its great with grilled chickens and bitter greens. unique and awesome, but not as weird as some of their others. huge fan.

edit: had another bottle of this this week, and am thinking it really does need more carbonation. the acidity and the brine work well together, but this is a flavor profile that should be highlighted by lively bubbles, and there is almost none of that. a real missing element in an otherwise outstanding and highly original brew...\xa01,538 charactersStonedTrippin, Aug 10, 2016', '3.77/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Aroma is salt/minerals and light notes of citrus and fruit. The flavor is salt/minerals, slightly floral, citrus/fruit, malts and a tart/sourish finish.\xa0153 charactersjzlyo, Jul 23, 2016']

name: Tanker Truck Sour Series: Clementine Gose
review:
["4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.8%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Best by June 19th.
Pours a rather hazy bright yellow color with excellent foam and lacing.
S - Smell of slight stone fruit and orange peels mixed with some sour lemon.
T - Well it's sour and salty with tart notes that may be reminiscent of clementines so it gets a pass I guess...
M - For the style spot on very smooth, sour and drink able.

Overall a very tasty gose with some fruit flavor aspects.\xa0400 charactersDrDemento456, Feb 11, 2019", '3.92/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Pours misty gold - aromas of slightly musty tropicalfruits and grapefruit. Amplified and wonderfully tart on the palate. Great for the first warm day of the season.\xa0164 characterseberesford, Apr 22, 2018', '5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +25.9%look: 5 | smell: 5 | taste: 5 | feel: 5 | overall: 5One of my favorite brews right now. Great for summer and pairing with BBQ. Not too sour and a great fruity body. Definitely one to try for the sour beer fans out there.\xa0168 charactersjengel7210, Feb 24, 2018', '3.64/5\xa0\xa0rDev -8.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.7516oz can dated 05/Dec/17 brought by Tracey and Bob.
