Light orange color and slight orange nose. Carbonation was fizzy. Taste was definite tangerine with some salt and a somewhat sour finish. Definitely a summer brew. Not sure of any food pairings. Not a favorite.\xa0262 characterskeith40, Jan 15, 2018', '4.52/5\xa0\xa0rDev +13.9%look: 5 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4.5L: Hazy, pale yellow. Slightly translucent, but almost opaque. The head is boisterous, tight, and bright white; with unusually long retention for a gose. A thin film always remains. A gorgeous beer.

S: Freshly squeezed orange juice; but leaning toward tart and bitter instead of sweet. Seedy, pulpy orange juice, almost more like orange drink. Bittersweet pith and peel, zesty, complete with spraying oils. A nice lactic souring quality, a bit of tantalizing table sugar, vague dill pickle, and soft cracker/white wheat malt backbone.

T: Orange zest and oils ripping into your face; bright and spritzy and tangy. Like literally chewing on an orange, peel and all. Bittersweet and tart. Lactic sourness simply amps up the natural tart quality of the clementine peel and pith. The malt backbone is soft raw wheat that just tastes like a plain cracker. Not really noticeable. I detect of a bit of the coriander on the mid-palate. It closes out lightly dry, with some lingering orange pulp flavor.

F: Light, but not super light. Moderately carbonated. Wheat adds some body. Finishes almost watery, but more juice-like thanks to the fruit addition.

O: A fantastic gose. So profoundly forward in its clementine flavor. Two Roads absolutely slays in the Gose game.\xa01,280 charactersHorseheadsHophead, Jan 02, 2018']

name: Never Never Mind Mind
review: ["4.12/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Sweet, thick, dessert-like. Tasty in small portions ... but what is it? It's really too much. name: The Wind Blue
review:
['4.35/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.8%look: 4 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.25Really smooth drinking sour. Great mouth feel. Think you get a lot of the blueberry on the nose but needs more in the taste. Just the right amount of tartness and good finish.\xa0175 charactersGinjaSlice, Nov 09, 2018', "4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.7%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4On tap at Lost Nation Brewing in Morrisville, VT.

This one pours a light yellow color, with just the slightest pink/purplish tint, with a small head, and lots of lacing.

This smells like light and funky blueberry skins, lemon acidity, salt, and light funk.

Perhaps unsurprisingly, the blueberry is not overdone here, and is in fact, pretty subtle, giving off more of a funky skins sort of thing. It's properly acidic, enough to be interesting, but so overdone as to be overbearing.

This is pretty light bodied, and very cleanly fermented, with a pleasant acidity on the back end, and a hint of bitterness.

This isn't really a step up from the base beer, but it's still certainly worth trying.\xa0697 charactersGreesyFizeek, Aug 06, 2018"]

name: Watermelon Gose
review:
["3.01/5\xa0\xa0rDev -22%look: 3.75 | smell: 2.75 | taste: 2.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.25Bottle.

A: Cloying sweet watermelon syrup, lightly salty, with a sharp off smelling moderate sourness. 

A: Bright golden color, hazy with a thin white head that has solid retention. Light lacing in the glass. 

T: Sweet watermelon syrup flavor, lightly salty, moderately sharp sourness that lingers through the finish.

M: Light bodied with moderately high carbonation. 

O: Not good; the watermelon tastes like it's from an extract and tastes syrupy. Moreover, the lacto fermentation is reminiscent of puke.\xa0510 charactersPhil-Fresh, Sep 18, 2016", '3.58/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5a candy watermelon dominates the smell maybe a hint of lime salt. The taste is much more mellow watermelon bubblegum a light tartness And lime salt. light body dry in the finish. Not a lot of flavor in this beer. Easy drinking though.\xa0234 charactersMasonz223, Aug 27, 2016', '3.86/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.7512 oz bottle pous a hazed gold with very little bubbles. Non-existent head and just a spot or two of lacing.

Nose is almost all watermelon, has a nice rind aroma. I dont get much of the coriander in here, but the watermelon smell is pretty dominant.

If you like to put salt on your watermelon, this is your beer! Probably the most saline gose I have tasted with a nice bit of watermelon and sourness. More sour than your typical gose - between the salt and the sour, it tries to drown out the watermelon flavor, which isnt exactly subtle. I think the coriander is more prevalent in the taste, but not sure I would be able to pick it out if I didnt know it was there. It could be a little livelier on the tongue, would be nice to have a few more bubbles. Its a good, unique take on the style and I could see myself picking up another 4-pack at some point.\xa0856 characterstwiggamortis420, Jul 29, 2016', '4.04/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.7%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Pours a very hazy golden color with a thin carbonated head. Head retention is minimal. Lacing is decent. If you can get anything besides watermelon from the aroma, more power to you. Taste is what you would expect. Very big watermelon taste with very mild tartness and saltiness at the end. Very mild compared to other Goses. Nice and juicy and refreshing for a hot summer day. Very light. Mild to moderate carbonation. Could drink a few of them.\xa0456 charactersjngrizzaffi, Jul 23, 2016', '4.14/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.3%look: 2.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Excellent beer. I could drink these all day in the summer. Pours typical hazy yellow but almost not head which totally disappears quickly. Other than that excellent. Nose is watermelon candy. Taste follows suite, delicious, juicy watermelon followed by a tart, salty finish with a touch of wheat. Excellent beer.\xa0312 charactersilikebeer03, Jul 16, 2016', '3.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev -9.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Pale translucent amber with a foamy white head. Smells faintly of watermelon and summer grasses, a little sweet, a little sharp. Mild flavor, not too fruity, very tangy. Very light bodied, slightly dry finish.\xa0209 charactersJohnDee, Jul 06, 2016']

name: Pilot Batch #5- Passionfruit Gose
review:
['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Guess I expected this version to be a bit sweeter with the addition of passion fruit. Not that I am complaining but to me it came off more as a tart grapefruit. Still very sour, smooth and went down easy. Love these gose beers in this series.\xa0242 charactersDrDemento456, Feb 21, 2019', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Interesting Gose. The Pasionfruit dominates but does not obliterate the Gose characteristics of the beer. Pours a hazy yellow/gold color from a pint can to a pint glass with a medium foamy white head and some lacing. Head retention is good. Aroma includes the passionfruit but also some yeast, saltiness and hint of wheat. Taste is solid also but the passionfruit does not totally take over the flavor. The salt, yeast and some cloves are also noticeable, You definitely know it is a Gose. Mouthfeel is light, refreshing with some salt and wheat bitterness to add tartness as well as the sweet passionfruit taste. An escellent summertime choice.\xa0660 charactersJayQue, May 15, 2018', '3.53/5\xa0\xa0rDev -9.9%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5-canned 03.24.17 consumed 07.04.17 in spiegelau ipa glass.

A: Dense and hazy, brass-lemon coloring has a strong feverish pitch of effervesce within. A rapidly forming pearl white head rises quickly in the vessel with a much slower lapse. The capping is creamy, frothy in texture leaving not much aside in the way of lacing. Leaves with a polished surface. 

S: Big nose of freshly squeezed grapefruit juice, with a touch of sea salt. A bit of sour fruitiness moves in making way to some old musky scents of hay and barn wood. 

T: Tart grapefruit flavor, seems a bit thin a first, but reasonable due to style. A bit of saltiness mingles with tart semi-dry lemon slices, with some wheat backing. Small torpical sourness, watermelon and sour oranges finishes out. 

M: Tart mouthful, light-medium, very smooth texture, mineral feel, light carbonation.

O: A nice level of finishing sourness per style, smooth, tart, good drinkability for summertime enjoyment by poolside.\xa0972 charactersbeerthulhu, Jul 13, 2017', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4On tap at the brewery. Pours a vibrant golden orange color with almost no head. No lacing. The aroma is sour and salty with some light tropical fruit notes and wheat. The taste is lemon lime, passionfruit, and salt. More wheat comes out towards the end with tropical fruits. Sour finish with more saltiness. Light mouthfeel but pretty dry. The passionfruit works well with balancing out the tartness and salt. Overall, a pretty good beer I hope they end up canning.\xa0465 charactersPicoPapa, Sep 20, 2016']

name: Gose
review:
['3.55/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.8%look: 4 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.5Gose on tap at the brewery taproom. 
4.5% ABV / 10 IBUs
Light pale golden body topped by a durable white head. 

Moderately tart with some a light malt base. Lightly salty. 
Overly light body is a bit watery despite reasonable carbonation. 
Easy drinking and refreshing, especially after a long day of hiking.\xa0309 characterschinchill, Jul 29, 2016', '3.88/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.8%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Pours a straw gold color. There is slight lactic presence in the smell but not much else. Not a lot of tartness/sourness but enough to balance out the salt and there is a subtle wheat presence. Really smooth feel. Easy to drink and would definitely drink again given the opportunity.\xa0287 charactersjbaker67, Nov 22, 2015', '4.02/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.4%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Good golden color to it. Keeps the head with a nice etched glass, rather effervescent and bubbly. Does have a faint tartness to the smell along with a wheaty body to it as others have mentioned. Taste is smooth, easy, and crisp but also has an almost juiciness quality to it. Hint of salt toward the end. Goes down bubbly and smooth without much tartness, which I honestly would like a bit more of. Does, overall, come off very tasty and enjoyable but I would like a bit more to that body and a bit more tartness. But just a smidge. Very good Gose though still.\xa0561 charactersSound_Explorer, Oct 22, 2015', "3.9/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.3%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Poured from 375mL corked & caged bottle into a tulip.

Appearance: light gold hue with a dash of haze and a strong effervescence. Head is a thick finger of frothy white foam. Quite attractive.

Smell: lightly tart with a nice wheaty character. A hint of lemony fruitiness adds a nice touch; spot-on for the style and well-executed.

Taste: subtly wheaty up front with less tartness than the aroma suggests. It's not especially salty, but for the most part quite well done, if on the light side.

Mouthfeel: light body but with a really big carbonation and big, if ephemeral, creaminess. It works for me!

Overall: highly refreshing and drinkable. The flavor could use maybe a dash more oomph, but for the most part a very good beer.\xa0742 charactersflagmantho, Oct 06, 2015", '3.93/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Really classic version of a gose, a little tart lemon, a little spicy pepper, a little salt, really refreshing , bright straw colored beer, could be a little more tart, more expressive in the coriander, but still an easy drinker\xa0228 charactersoceanman907, Aug 03, 2015']

name: Cascade Spring Gose
review:
["4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Orange with a fleeting white head. Clarity is good, though I was expecting more cloudiness from a gose.

Fruity nose, specifically stonefruit and apples. Some spiciness too, with a nice sweet and sour dynamic. 

Tastes like red apple and peach, subtle saltiness with a pleasantly sweet backbone. Little bit grainy, little bit lactic - quite balanced for the style and pretty tasty, though I couldn't drink a ton of it.\xa0418 characterslargadeer, Jun 24, 2011", "3.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev -14.2%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3 | feel: 4 | overall: 3Appearance: Pours a slightly hazy straw color, topped by one finger of snow white head. Head retention is decent, as is the lacing.

Smell: Smells very herbal. Cloves and lavender stand out more than anything. I also get some light citrus and a small amount of lactic character as well. Interesting.

Taste: Again, interesting. The herbal character is noticed more so in the taste than in the smell. Very strong lavender and clove. Digging a bit deeper I also get a light lemony tartness and lactic character. Not bad and an interesting try, but I would prefer if they toned the herbs down a bit.

Mouthfeel: The mouthfeel is quite nice. Light bodied with pretty high, spritzy carbonation. Pretty refreshing. Overall, I thought this beer was pretty good but has some flavors that were a bit overdone. Still, I'm glad I got to try this style from Cascade. Hopefully I can make it back in a different season and try another gose from them, as they sound quite good.\xa0963 characterszhanson88, Jun 22, 2011", "3.93/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.7%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4On tap poured into a snifter during City Beer Store's anniversary party. This was my first taste of gose style beer. 

Beer poured a clear golden yellow with a thin but foamy white head that left a decent amount of lacing on the interior of the glass with some swirling, though no additional head formed with agitation. Good number of small bubbles slowly ascend from the bottom of the glass. 

Nose is mostly floral, earthy and mineral notes, with some lemon peel, and lemongrass. More floral and mineral than anything else though, perhaps from the chamomile and salt? Very light aroma that took a bit of work to smell anything past the mineral nature of the beer. 

Taste very closely resembles the nose, very earthy when it hits the tongue, like mineral water, pretty much. Some of the lemon peel and lemongrass makes shows up a little later, with some biscuit malt sweetness. Finish is light, lemongrass and minerals, but lingers for several minutes on the tongue. 

Light bodied with plenty of gentle small bubbles. Very refreshing beer that I wouldn't mind having on a hot summer day.\xa01,090 charactersnataku00, May 10, 2011", "3.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.7%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Appears somewhat hazy yellow with a thin white head. 

It smells of herbal tea like spices, I get a bit of a lemon smell and a bit of a sour smell. There is also expectantly a slightly salty smell.

It tastes of tea like herbs. I get a refreshing acidic flavor and a bit of a floral pollen type of a taste. The beer ends with a salty finish that is balanced by a pleasant sourness.

The mouthfeel is light and crisp.

I prefer some other seasonal gose's that cascade makes as I do not think the floral flavor adds much to the salty and acidic flavor of the beer. However it is still a nice beer.\xa0595 characterschumba526, Apr 02, 2011", "3.97/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.7%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4A nicely golden lemon hue with a hint of cloudiness. ample carbonation fuels a creamy head with good retention that leaves behind surprisingly minimal lacing.

aroma is intensely floral and complexly piquant. lavender, a hint of mint, a hint of muskmelon.

Taste is equally complex, with a melange of fruit, ranging from mandarin orange to honeydew melon. then some floral notes, not far from herbes de provence. Subtle hints of salt carry a subtle and very pleasant dry tartness.

Mouth is on the verge of slick, but just smooth enough to work for me. ample carbonation combines with the hint of salt and the slightly drying tart to create a complex mouthfeel.

I'm liking this one... not quite as vibrant as some goses I've sampled, but this one is a solid example... and I love lavender and chamomile and floral notes in general, so that probably doesn't hurt either.\xa0870 charactersdjeucalyptus, Mar 04, 2011", "4.04/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.6%look: 3.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5tasted 6/2/10:
A tantalizing beverage offered by the good people of the Raccoon Lodge. Had this on tap at the brewery and managed to snag a growler hours later at some distant land. Lavender and a slight hint of chamomile aromas, a little je ne sais quoi as well. This seems to be a favored style of theirs and they seem to put great effort into their melange of flavors. It is salty, a hint tart, definitely flowery with that lavender and chamomile. Effing enjoyable.
Some may say I sullied the taste by drinking the last portion with a raw egg after reading posts on here about such behavior. But I feel this was entirely appropriate to the salty style. My regret is that it wasn't for breakfast before work. Silly me.\xa0720 charactersdragonWhale, Oct 19, 2010", "3.29/5\xa0\xa0rDev -13.2%look: 3 | smell: 4 | taste: 3 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3On draught at the brewpub, served in a cervoise, Spring Gose is a somewhat spritzy dark gold with an off-white head that quickly dissipates, leaving no lace. 

Smell is very floral, perfume like from the flowers. Pretty nice, a light sweetness, it rounded out nicely with some air, bumping it up a 1/2 point. 

Taste is similar, the chamomile is maybe is more assertive then the lavender, and is overall too floral for me. Not really salty or lactic either, which I enjoy about this style. This is my least favorite of their seasonal gose's by far. 

Mouthfeel has an oily slickness, but a bit crisp, with a medium body. 

Drinkability is not that great, to perfumey with all the oils and adjuncts, and not of the salt and tartness I expect from a gose. A disappointing miss, but not one that should temper their creativity and experimentation.\xa0844 charactersccrida, Jun 29, 2010", '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4A:Poured a nice lighet golden color with good carbonation and a nice white head

S: At first it was funk, sour, horseblanket and then some fruits. 

T: A light funk, sour with some straw, watermelon and cantaloupe

M: Smooth, tasty and pleasing to the palate 

D: Indeed. I would go for it again.\xa0296 charactersbarleywinefiend, Jun 27, 2010', '2.98/5\xa0\xa0rDev -21.4%look: 3 | smell: 2.5 | taste: 3 | feel: 3 | overall: 3.5Served in straight pint glass. The color was a clear dark applejuice yellow with no head, thus no retention or lacing.

The aroma was very subdued, with light grain and soft salt scents. The tastes were also mostly subdued grain flavors, with a lingering salt taste.

The body was OK, but a little sticky. Drinkability was decent but not special. Overall, a decent introduction to the style, but this brewery makes better examples.\xa0431 charactersbeertunes, Jun 09, 2010', '3.4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -10.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3On tap at the Raccoon Lodge, home of Cascade Brewing. This is a difficult beer for me to review since it is only my second gose (pronounced go-sah). Pours a cloudy yellow with a half finger head. Smell is floral: lavender, flowers, clove, dandelion, quite interesting. Taste is like mixing sea water with a boquet of fresh cut flowers. Complex. Mouthfeel is slick and oily, and the salt is noteable by not overpowering. Drinkability is tough for me with this one, but was cool to try.\xa0484 characterssquaremile, Jun 08, 2010', "3.87/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.1%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.5Poured to a pint glass at Kelly's Olympian (Portland) under the label 'Cascade Special Ale'; though the bartender cited this as an old 'Belgian' style brew, I won't fault him much; a draught Gose IS obscure...a second bartender confirmed this to be the 'Spring Gose', which she called a 'love it or hate it' style.

A: Mildly hazy golden pour, decent carbonation to a thin and whitish head. Dwindles to a thin ring and a few patches of film. The streaming carbonation never stops, improving the look to better than average. Small head and very little lace. 

S: Hmm... Intriguing aroma, vaguely spicy and slightly sweet. So hard to peg what fruit is in there, let's say a salted version of cantaloupe. 

T: Yes, salt does come through in waves, otherwise it's a mildly spicy and fruity brew that opens with bread dough, and ends with a touch of sourness. Still plenty fruity (melon, baked apple pie) and slightly meaty; yes, 'meaty' - a bit of sweet prosciutto... Gose is an oddball style; this both confounds and tantalizes the taste buds.

M: Quite smooth, a candied melon with a crisp bite. Sweetness is suspect; it's caramel and sea salt, really. Medium-light body. 

D: Thoroughly enjoyable, if not quite identifiable. I think this bar took a risk with putting this on tap, but it's a risk I appreciate and want to have again. Mild alcohol, 'sipable' but not quite 'drinkable'.\xa01,382 charactersmsubulldog25, Apr 29, 2010", "2.93/5\xa0\xa0rDev -22.7%look: 3.5 | smell: 3 | taste: 3 | feel: 3 | overall: 2.5A gose! On tap! Never thought I'd see the day.

Pours a light gold. An inch or so of sudsy white foam.

Smells ... strange. A light whiff of malt, maybe a hint of an interesting vegetable/foliage aroma I can't place.

Taste is a bit weird. There's a strange, almost salty sour component, that same vegetable-y malt, and a metallic bite to it.

Well, nice to try. Good, well carbonated mouthfeel.\xa0395 charactersOverlord, Apr 29, 2010", "4.3/5\xa0\xa0rDev +13.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.5Had this at Bailey's Taproom in Portland, OR.

appearance - golden in color with some adequate bubbles

smell - fruit and a bit of sweetness

taste - sweet, lightly sour, some wheat, hints of salt

mouthfeel - fairly light body, a bit dry finish

drinkability - easy to drink, refreshing, a great spring/summer beverage\xa0319 charactersdjbreezy, Apr 13, 2010", "4.07/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.4%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.5On tap today at Saraveza's.

Poured into a chalice, the beer is golden in color with fairly decent head retention, but with not much lacing. The nose on this beer is intriguing, with honey, sweet orange citrus, butter and a hint of tartness. Flavors on the palate replicate the nose, except I'm surprised that there's as much sweetness as there is in this beer (it's not overwhelming, but it's definitely there). The light sour counters that sweetness somewhat, and I found the low alcohol and light mouthfeel just delightful. Drinkability is exceptional; what a lovely springtime beer!

Very nice stuff...\xa0606 charactersJohn_M, Apr 05, 2010"]

name: Raspberry Gose
review:
["3.73/5\xa0\xa0rDev -8.6%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Pours a light red/pink color. 1 finger white head. Head retention is good. Some lacing on the glass. 
The nose is a pleasing sour raspberry aroma. Slightly tart, but there's a hint of sweetness in the aroma. 
Taste - There's a hint of raspberry, but it's not strong. There's a hint of the salt. Slightly tart. 
The body is good. Not watery. About right for the style. 
Tasty, and I could see pounding these on a hot summer day.\xa0427 charactersVictory_Sabre1973, Sunday at 01:11 PM", '3.73/5\xa0\xa0rDev -8.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.75Pours a cloudy copper/pink color. 1/2 inch head of a white color. Great retention and decent lacing. Smells of raspberry, salt, hint of lactic acid, slight bacterial funk, and slight pale malt. Fits the style of a Leipzig Gose. Mouth feel is sharp and crisp, with a high carbonation level. There is also a noticeable tartness. Tastes of raspberry, salt, hint of lactic acid, slight bacterial funk, and slight pale malt. Overall, good appearance, aroma, and body.\xa0462 charactersTone, Nov 15, 2018', '4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.7%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Appearance - The beer poured a deep red color with a white head. 

Smell - The nose was highlighted by fresh raspberries and flowery notes. 

Taste - At the front, fresh raspberries were noted with the sweetness fading quickly. The salt and wheat helped to highlight the tartness. The profile seemed to have a strengthening tartness even as the sweetness fades to a dry ending. 

Mouthfeel - The carbonation pushed the sweetness back, while the fruit created a full body.

Overall - Another solid Sour Note Gose.\xa0512 charactersJohnnyHopps, Feb 18, 2018', "4.53/5\xa0\xa0rDev +11%look: 4 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5750 from brewery tasted from tall tulip. 

Look: somewhat cloudy amber. Pours with 3/4 in head that rapidly dissipates. Tiny amount of cling to glass as contents are consumed. Small bubbles throughout.
Aroma:earthy, floral, berry, sour, seltzer.
Taste: tart raspberries, white bread, salt and sweet, cracker/biscuit maltiness. Retronasal is pure red raspberries.
Feel: effervescent and puckery. Salt and acid bring you back for the next sip. Body is appropriately light. 
Overall: one of the best domestic gose I've had. Need more.\xa0531 charactersRobby_Hart, Apr 06, 2016"]

name: Andrew Gose' Way
review: ['3.78/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75tommy5, Feb 16, 2016', '3.65/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.1%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75onespartan, Dec 03, 2015', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4msumike89, Sep 30, 2015', '4.24/5\xa0\xa0rDev +13.7%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25jrs3994243, Aug 25, 2015', '3.81/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75mrebeka, Aug 13, 2015', '3/5\xa0\xa0rDev -19.6%look: 3 | smell: 3 | taste: 3 | feel: 3 | overall: 3Danielr26, Aug 12, 2015', '4.22/5\xa0\xa0rDev +13.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.254DAloveofSTOUT, Jul 27, 2015', '3.64/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.4%king75, Dec 10, 2014', '4.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +20.6%goast8127, Oct 07, 2014', '3.52/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.6%DingleBarry, Sep 27, 2014', '3.9/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.6%CheapBeerBuzz, Sep 04, 2014', '3.72/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.3%paleoplant, Sep 01, 2014', '3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.5%jampics2, Aug 26, 2014', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.2%Buck_Jones, Aug 24, 2014', '3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.5%loganburgh, Aug 23, 2014', '3.69/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75szmnnl99, Aug 23, 2014', '3.6/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.5%tectactoe, Aug 22, 2014', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.2%tommyz, Aug 21, 2014', '3.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev -12.9%MajorBear, Aug 20, 2014', '3.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.2%Zaphog, Jul 29, 2014', '3.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.2%alelover, Jul 27, 2014', '3.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.2%beergorrilla, Jul 27, 2014', '3/5\xa0\xa0rDev -19.6%JasonR1975, Jun 30, 2014', '3.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.2%PaulyB83, Jun 16, 2014', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.2%BrewtalHonesty, Jun 01, 2014']

name: Apricot Gose
review:
['3.12/5\xa0\xa0rDev -18.8%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3 | feel: 2.75 | overall: 3.25Mid sized bottle...."Batch 2"

Pours hazed light and dull yellow, minimal head, and no lacing left behind.

KInda nasty smelling/rotten matter.

Super sharp and sour on the palate..sour lemon overload

Prickly mouthfeel, even though there seems to be next to no carbonation

Not a big fan of the style and less of a fan of this one

Pass it by...a could get only a few sips down and I was thinking "drain pour"...a few more and I was done here....\xa0447 charactersBillolick, Dec 06, 2017', "2.96/5\xa0\xa0rDev -22.9%look: 3.25 | smell: 2.75 | taste: 3 | feel: 3 | overall: 3This one pours a (kinda dead looking) orange color, with no head or lacing.

The sourness on the nose is kinda unpleasant and basically medicinal. There's a lot of apricot, but the yeast used here doesn't work well for me.

This is medium bodied, with a thin and flat mouthfeel. It's not exceedingly drinkable.

This is nowhere near Kent Falls' best effort.\xa0357 charactersGreesyFizeek, Oct 15, 2017", '4.03/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.9%look: 3.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Had it in a bottle at Beer Shop NYC.
Pours a straw orange color, fairly clear and with a modest head that dissipates immediately. 
As for the nose...wow!...so much barnyard!! Funky, manure (but in a good fresh country air way), straw and hay. As the name suggests, apricots round out the aroma.
In the mouth it is tart and sour with a nice but not overbearing apricot coating that balances out the acidity. In addition to the apricot flavors, there is Lemon, wheat and a white wine vinegar finish. The palate is bone dry, medium bodied and refreshing. Appropriate to the style, a salty and briny flavor is subtle but ever present.
A nice example of a Gose. It was tart but not one dimensional\xa0698 charactersGajo74, Sep 02, 2017', "3.91/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Had this in tap at Seymour in Greenfield. The beer was murky with no head; generally straw yellow in appearance. The beer had a zesty, very citrus floral aroma that was really nice. The beer's flavoring was earthy with yeasty characteristics and a citrus sourness. metallic flowers with yeast. This beer was very refreshing, crisp, and light, perfect for a hot day. Overall, a really refreshing beer.\xa0400 charactersfitzy84, Aug 05, 2017", '3.67/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.4%look: 3 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.5Appearance: Pours a very hazy honey color; the head starts out at one finger but within 10 seconds it disappears without a trace

Smell: Salty and lactic, with a lemony tartness

Taste: Lactic lemon forward, with the salty character developing, through the middle and the blend of the two flavors coalesces into the finish; the apricot is very hard to find but lingers, perhaps, in the finish

Mouthfeel: Light to medium body with low carbonation

Overall: I was hoping for a lot more with this beer but it lacks apricot flavor and the mouthfeel is not very good

Thanks, AaronF, for the opportunity\xa0604 charactersbrentk56, Jan 16, 2017', '3.39/5\xa0\xa0rDev -11.7%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3 | feel: 3 | overall: 3.5A: straw colored, almost opaque, semi-hazy. Head that is white and all but disappears after a minute
S: fresh apple cider, apricots, funky late season apple orchard 
T: very distinct lemony-acidity, fresh apricots, the savory saltiness comes through at the end
M: thin mouthfeel, low carbonation
O: a good gose overall. Nothing extraordinary. Really enjoyed the aroma\xa0367 charactersRockthedashboard, Sep 27, 2016', "4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Cloudy, straw colored with a slight pinkish/orange hue. No head, although I decanted since they bottle condition.

Aroma: sweet apricot, it covers up the briney salt aroma i pick up in a lot of Gose but im not complaining, i prefer this. a bit of funk and you can smell the tartness.

Taste: very tart, like a lemon warhead. a bit of apricot at the very end. moderate salt. I find myself taking huge gulps and wanting more.

Feel: light/thin, has a good fizzy/bubbly quality to it.

havent had a kent falls beer I've didn't like.\xa0537 characterskalosjakar, Sep 27, 2016", "3.94/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.6%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Poured from the bottle into my stemmed Hill Farmstead glass, Apricot Gose comes out a very cloudy straw color with some orange highlights. Fluffy head leaves some lacing after an aggressive pour.

Smell is sweet, tart, apples, lemony, bit of grain. Taste is super tart, mouth puckering in a way. Fleshy fruit in the middle, good bit of apricot here, not overly sweet by any means. Bit of grain and saltiness near the end. Still tart after the swallow.

Maybe a bit too tart for a gose, this one was more like a salty sour beer, but was still a solid beer. The apricot flavor was very fleshy and wasn't too sweet, so it was pretty solid. I would try this again for sure.\xa0669 charactersBranfordBound, Sep 27, 2016"]

name: Lime Cucumber Gose
review:
['4.24/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.9%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25This was definitely frothy and after it calmed down, looked parched hay with a nice white head. Taste was tart and quenching with both the lime and the cucumber making distinct appearances. Not salty at all which is how I like my goses. This beer deserves to be in the Caribbean by a cabana during the day - just so good and thirst quenching. Really enjoyed it and could drink a bunch. I actually enjoyed it in the evening through as my last drink of the night and it worked just as well.\xa0493 charactershopley, Jun 30, 2019', "3.54/5\xa0\xa0rDev -14.9%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 4CAN: $1.69 a can in NoLa.

A wonderfully refreshing salty summer gose with admirable commitment to its titular lime and cucumber flavours. Cucumber is a tough flavour to nail, but they managed it without lending it an artificial or forced taste.

I feel like I could quaff this by the pitcher on a hot June day, and I can't imagine any fan of the style disliking it.

Tart, acidic. Has an ideal (2-3/10) level of sourness and twang.

One of the most quenching beers I've probably ever had, but definitely lacking in comparison to expressions of the style from the likes of Anderson Valley, for example. I do think it has a borderline unique taste, though, which alone makes it worth seeking out. Drinkability is off the charts.

Low B (3.54) / GOOD\xa0748 characterskojevergas, Mar 27, 2019", '4.37/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Lime Cucumber Gose has a thick, creamy, fizzy, white head, an opaque, white-yellow appearance, and no glass lacing. Aroma is of salty cucumber, and the flavor is of cucumber, lime, and salt. There is also white bread and tap water, in the taste. Mouthfeel is high medium and fluffy, and Lime Cucumber Gose finishes tart. Not sour. 

RJT\xa0336 charactersRonaldTheriot, Jul 24, 2018', "4.3/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.4%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5On a hot sunny day i could drink this all day. Doesn't have anything negative. Not the best beer I've had, and maybe not even the best Gose, but it's great, available, and so easy to enjoy.\xa0191 charactersTigerbrau, Apr 07, 2018"]

name: Kiss From A Gose
review:
['4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.3%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Poured a clear, golden orange color with a small head of foam. It smelled of tart fruits and a hint of floral notes. Very tart taste with a good deal of fruitiness and a touch of salt.\xa0184 characterszeff80, Aug 07, 2017', "3.96/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.3%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4pale yellow, almost yellow-green in appearance. pretty clear, a little bit of suspension. unusual appearance- I'm curious about this one. salty/funky aroma; smells like a gose. a tiny bit closed off i think. usually beers in this genre are like rank with sour and funk, this one is pretty reined in. tastes amazing. very true to the gose style - salt and sour strike a perfect balance, zero bitterness, with a wonderful wheat base. I've been trying a lot of gose beers from craft brews lately and this one is ON POINT. really precise in taste. mouthfeel is light to medium bodied, with a medium paced sour finish. the salt is always present however and lingers in the aftertaste. strong. Overall, a great example of this style. Peace Tree is an Iowa brewery and is catching a lot of attention lately for one of their blonde ales. I think this beers tops that one and may be their strongest offering that I have had the pleasure of sampling.\xa0949 charactersBaumer, Jul 02, 2017", '3.83/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 3.75Beautiful apple juice color, no head.

Very clean aromas, like fresh laundry, salt, flowers.

Taste is on par with many $5/bottle gose beers. Salt and sour combine real nicely with rose pedals, hibiscus.

Feel is crisp, but has a distinct dryness. Very cool.

Overall - a solid gose. Worth seeking out.\xa0302 charactersThe-Adjunct-Hippie, Feb 02, 2017', '3.85/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Pours nicely with minimal head, minimal lacing. Smell not strong, almost non-existant. Feel is sharp and crispy, almost fizzy-like. Taste is quite sour, not unpleasant, but rather very true to the gose style. A very fine beer out of the brewery in Knoxville. A perfect choice for a warm spring evening.\xa0303 charactersBike_Nerd, Apr 23, 2016', '4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 412 oz bottle. Pours clean golden with fizzy white head that fades quickly, no lacing. Very nice lemony tart gose aroma. Full flavors come out and blend well, lemon and coriander, right amount of tartness for me. Big punch of salt at the end, maybe a bit heavy on the salt but not off putting. Medium slick mouthfeel. Overall very solid brew, my first by Peace Tree.\xa0371 charactersNolaHopHead, Apr 09, 2016', '4.26/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.3%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25Aroma is strong coriander, wheat, citrus and mild salt/minerals. The flavor is salt/minerals, coriander/spices, wheat, citrus and a very tart/sourish finish.\xa0158 charactersjzlyo, Mar 05, 2016']

name: The Sun Is Too Bright
review:
["3.78/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4375ml capped bottle into a Surly teku. Shared by schen9303. 

Nose is lemon zest with the slightest hint of roast and smoke. Weird but not bad. Subtle and the sweetness is a nice touch. Beer opens prune, lemon and grape skin. Some roastiness in the middle and ends lightly puckering. Enjoyable. Body is light with moderate to ample carbonation. Prickly and lively in the mouth and goes down foamy, accented and dry. Real drinkable. 

Pretty good. I don't tend to like light beer styles made dark but this is pretty enjoyable.\xa0525 charactersSpeedwayJim, Jun 03, 2017", '4.01/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.2%look: 3.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Mid sized bottle purchased at the brewery about a week ago.

The pour on this one is near black, the cap quickly departs with nothing left behind to stick on the glass.

Blackberry sniff, tart and bright

On the palate, its more tart fruit, some salt in the finish. Just about medium tartness...this will not please many, but if you like a well crafted gose or wild/sour beer this one is enjoyable and well worth trying.\xa0422 charactersBillolick, May 14, 2017', "4.02/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Traded for this a few months back and finally got around to it tonight. I like this style of beer and if you're into something light and balanced, this would be a great choice to have on a cool night such as this. The red wine barrel aging added a certain kick and depth to it while keeping this beer true to it's stylistic roots!

This poured quite dark with a light tan head reminiscent of Guinness. In this case, it was quite loud as it receded fast like sea foam, complete with the accompanying sound of retreating waves. Lots of sea salt, red wine, and evidence of wooden barrel-aging in the nose with more of those in the taste to complement the aroma. Light up front, this had lemon juice and nice initial slickness before the wooden murkiness and heavier wine notes kicked in. The lively carbonation and boisterous salinity kept this from feeling heavy as there was little sourness here to weigh this down. 

Thankfully, the alcohol was light as this beer down about as easily as could be. With a light body and hardly any lacing to be seen on the side of my pint glass, this beer had an easygoing nature in every sense of the word. Fun stuff that deserves to be released again!\xa01,186 charactersJerzDevl2000, Mar 30, 2017"]

name: Holiday Gose
review:
['3.94/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.9%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Poured from a can (canned Nov 3) into a snifter at 50°F.

L: Clear, light pink/orange. Bright white head with low retention, can see the carbonation as the bubbles continue to rise.
S: Noticeable coriander, light fruit. More orange than cranberry. Aroma is not strong.
T: Citrus with cranberry being noticeable but not dominant. Dry finish brings out bready flavors. Not very sour.
F: High carbonation, light body. Mouthwatering.

Fruit compliments, but does not overpower the Gose.\xa0483 charactersWA_Brian, Jan 05, 2019', '3.79/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Pink hued, great clarity, bone white foam with lots of carbonation.

Acidity and salinity dually noted. Cranberry juice also prevelent with a touch of earthiness.

Tart cranberries, orange zest, and coriander all come me through well in the flavor as advertised. Nice saltiness throughout.

Light on the tongue, tart and salty. Well carbonated, exceptionally dry.

Pretty damn good flavored gose. Nice holiday treat.

Cheers.\xa0429 charactersLingenbrau, Jan 01, 2019', '3.22/5\xa0\xa0rDev -15.9%look: 3.75 | smell: 3 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.25Poured from a 12oz can into a Teku glass. 

Look is a clear pinkish with an eggshell colored head. 

Aroma is a funky sulfur, not totally pleasant. 

Taste is better a kinda seltzery cranverry, but the aroma is hard to get over.\xa0228 charactersEamonn-Cummings3, Dec 16, 2018', '3.93/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4From a can to a pint glass (not the best for a Gose, I know), poured a gorgeous cloudy ruby red grapefruit color with a quickly dissipating white head. 
Aroma is of sour fruit, cranberry, brine, and lemon zest. 
Taste is heavy cranberry early, citrus (grapefruit, lemon, and orange) later, and a mild salty finish. A nice sharp tartness is noticeable with dry lactic sourness that is not overpowering at all. 
It has a light body, high carbonation, and medium finish. 
Overall, the sourness is relatively tame and there is not a lot of yeast or bacteria complexity. I wish it was more sour. But I will say that it is an excellent, fun, easy Gose with a late fall holiday taste as the name implies. Citrus heads will enjoy it. I thoroughly enjoyed it.\xa0750 charactersMyros, Dec 14, 2018', "4.07/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Clear, pinkish pale-gold with a small head of loose bubbles that quickly fades into the body of the beer. It looks, as expected, like a fruited Gose. A tickle of orange appears in the aroma, but cranberry, a trace of bright, spicy, coriander, and the style's telltale salinity mingle together pleasantly almost like a cocktail or a chilled mulled wine. Highly carbonated, light-bodied, and subtly fruit flavored, this is an interesting, easy-drinking release from Reuben's that doesn't lose its identity with the introduction of additional flavors. The subtle cranberry tartness and tangy but subdued citrus marry nicely with the character of a Gose and a clean finish urge sip after sip. Very successful.\xa0705 charactersKeene, Nov 20, 2018", '3.94/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.9%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Nice color, clear pink/orange. Almost rosé like.
I mostly taste an orange and orange peel tartness, with a hint of cranberry. Flavor follows with a dry bready taste. 
A solid sipper.\xa0183 charactersBrennan27, Nov 13, 2018', "3.9/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.8%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 4From a can. 

A clear reddish pink with a light pink head that falls off rapidly, this looks great. The nose is a great blend of tart cranberry, bright orange and raw, grainy wheat. There's minimal salt or coriander present, though there is a touch of spice. The palate opens clean, bright, yogurt like and tart with a blend of cranberry tartness and orange sweetness. This is followed by a grainy, raw, doughy mid-palate. Lactic and mildly yogurt like on the finish, this beer is light in body, crisply carbonated and quite refreshing. Nicely done.\xa0549 charactersDefenCorps, Dec 30, 2017", '3.93/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.6%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75I had this beer on-tap in a goblet at Collins Pub in Seattle.

Appearance: rich red-orange hue with a clear body and a thin layer of frothy white foam with a little bit of a pinkish cast. I love the color.

Smell: a little sweet, a little fruity, and a little sour. Not quite sweet enough to be candylike, but still an enticing treat. I dig it.

Taste: extremely tart. One of the tartest Goses I've ever had; there's also a nice, almost dank wheatiness, and a bit of fruitiness. I like it, but oh man is there a pucker factor.

Mouthfeel: medium-light body with a decent carbonation and creaminess.

Overall: I like this beer a lot, but it might be too tart to really call "easily drinkable".\xa0697 charactersflagmantho, Nov 29, 2017']

name: Casper The Friendly Gose
review:
['3.44/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.1%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Brewer's Notes: "A German style of beer, which was nearly extinct until recently. A refreshing half-wheat, half-pilsner malt brew with notes of coriander, lemon, and sea salt that give a hint of a mischievous side. Very clean, and yet spicy. 
Available: July-September
Availability: Draft and Cans: Namesake: Named after Casper, the Friendly Ghost (Gose)
ABV: 5.0%
IBUs: 13"

Poured from 12oz can into glass. Canned on date is '07/20/17'.
Some white head upon pouring but dissipates to thin ring, no lacing. Copper, hazy body.
Sour lime aroma.
Slightly sour taste with very slight salt aspect.
Thin to moderate mouth feel.
To a gose style but average with taste and salt and spice.\xa0681 charactersMonDak_Joe1953, Oct 26, 2017', "3/5\xa0\xa0rDev -13.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3 | taste: 2.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3Served in pint glass on tap. Appearance is the best thing about this beer, hazy orange with thin rim of head. The most dominant flavor is an astringent flavor that is not from hops, so I am guessing coriander. I don't get much wheat or tartness. Definitely low hop profile as you would expect in the style. Overall a bit disappointing\xa0334 charactersKrisp09, Jul 05, 2015", "4.12/5\xa0\xa0rDev +18.4%look: 4 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Growler from Midtown poured into a bowled Founders tulip:

A- A cloudy golden orange amber with an eager creamy head that leaves frothy lacing down the side of the glass with a good residual foam. 

S - Zesty coriander predominates, with lemongrass, lime, and hay emerging afterwards. The hop/malt profile almost hints at a saison or other style, with caramel and grassy hop tones. The malts give a caramel/biscuity sense, along with some nice floral yeast aroma.

T - Big coriander right up front followed by a pleasant sweetness that gives way to chewy caramel and a subtle hint of gingery vibrancy. There is a pleasant bitter that balances out the beer and lingers throughout, but never do the hop flavors predominate. The coriander really steals the show, limiting the prevalence of other flavors. So its unbalanced, but if you like coriander, quite pleasant. Other malt/yeast flavors are there, but somewhat hidden.

M - Good carbonation, smooth, somewhat sticky mouth, but overall pleasant.

O - A great beer to try, although I don't know how much of it is around. If you don't like coriander, stay away, but if you're a fan of Indian food, etc., give it a go!\xa01,166 charactersdoopydoogle, Jul 15, 2012"]

name: Meyer Lemon Gose
review:
["3.65/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.2%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75August 28th, 2015 - I love Meyer Lemons! And goses! A salty, citrusy dream come true! This blonde brew conjures up a saline note for the nose, and placed neatly on top of that is the Meyer lemon I was so sincerely promised. It's a sweet smell more than it is better, and also gives off touches of macerated peaches. Tangy and clear, the flavor is refreshing and gives a nice salty smack at the end. The essence of Meyer lemon is evident too, but disappears quickly in the aftertaste. This is more than apt as a beer for a day at or near the beach.\xa0547 charactersGarrettB, Jun 11, 2019", '3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75i think its neat these guys are playing around with the gose a little bit, and its even cooler they are on tap around town, this one at hops and pie, but its not that good of a basic gose i dont think, too light in the tart department, and so these flavors make it even less like a gose than it is as a base beer. that said, its refreshing and the meyer lemon flavor is nice, part orange part lemon it seems, true to the fruit, and with the citrus helping add acidity where it was missing in the ginger one. still, even though the flavor is light, i feel like any salt and coriander and phased out as a result of the introduction of these flavors. its good beer, easy drinking and unique, but as a gose, i dont think it really passes muster. hard to judge beer to style though for me, and i find this a fine compliment to the filling and sometimes greasy italian sandwich at hops and pie, and i cans see this in a variety of other culinary contexts as well, especially indian food. not my favorite gose, but i will keep trying the different variations.\xa01,052 charactersStonedTrippin, Oct 08, 2015', '3.67/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.7%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75On tap at the LA Beer Week Kickoff Festival held at Exposition Park in Los Angeles, CA.

Pours a murky yellow-orange with a foamy beige head that settles to a partial film on top of the beer. Small streaks of lace form around the glass on the drink down. Smell is of grain, earth, lemon juice, lemon zest, and funk aromas. Taste is much the same with slightly sour grain, funk, earth, lemon juice, and lemon zest flavors on the finish. There is a mild amount of acidity on the palate with each sip. This beer has a lower level of carbonation with a slightly crisp mouthfeel. Overall, this is a pretty good beer with that has an interesting mix of lemon and funk aspects that are slightly better in the taste. 

Serving type: on tap.\xa0732 charactersUCLABrewN84, Jun 22, 2015']

name: Zero Point
review:
['4.36/5\xa0\xa0rDev +14.1%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.5wow! this is incredible beer, one of my favorite from finback to date, and arguably the best flavored gose i have ever had. these guys have done nice work with coconut in the past, but this is truly next level. the coconut is so natural in here, fleshy and tropical, earthy and sweet, bold and almost creamy to me, its insane, the real thing for sure, and it is perfectly set with the lightly tangy, wheaty, fluffy, mineral rich, dry vinous brew that serves as its base! there is a light toasted note to it, a warming thing that feels like vacation, and subtle citrus, lemon and an orange wedge maybe, that gives this an almost umbrella drink vibe as well. the wheat gives it a good foundation, its not all coconut and lactic pucker, and i like it being a little stronger than many, i think its well proportioned in that way. the coconut is strong in it, but its not overdone to me, although i can hear that criticism depending on how much the drinker likes coconut, but for me its just right because its so honest, such a likeness to a coconut itself, just delicious. i could drink this infinitely, i hope they make it again, its one of the coolest beers we had on our trip to new york this week!\xa01,197 charactersStonedTrippin, Dec 17, 2018', '1.24/5\xa0\xa0rDev -67.5%look: 3 | smell: 1.5 | taste: 1 | feel: 1 | overall: 1This smelled and tasted like trans fatty butter popcorn and artificial coconut. Huge disappointment from this good brewery. Took a few sips and had to throw it out.\xa0164 charactersegrandfield, Aug 05, 2018', '3.65/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.5%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75Can courtesy of Schlimenhaumer - cheers, bruv!

The coconut here is subtle, lending itself naturally to a mellow balance. Sea salt imparts classic gose tang without going too far and rendering it unrefreshing. Coriander could be more pronounced.

Harmonious and enjoyable. A highly drinkable summer sipper...good work from Finback.

Who woulda thunk coconut would play so well in a gose? Look out, Anderson Valley.
B / GOOD\xa0423 characterskojevergas, Jul 15, 2018', "2.32/5\xa0\xa0rDev -39.3%look: 4.25 | smell: 2.75 | taste: 2 | feel: 2 | overall: 2Poured from the can into a wheat ale glass. Canned May 29th 2018.

Nice and clear bodied, with active amounts of pinhead and cola sized carbonation. Creamy rich forming head, big and billowing, making a bright white three fingers and settling to a bubbly thin puck. 

Aroma seems a little butter popcorn, seems a little diacetyl going on here, but it's almost crispy kernel smelling. So this is the effect of the coconut, and then later going back it's got a bit of those soft aromas and sweetness. After that there's unfortunately not much else, no salt/brine, malt quality or much of anything. Not sure how this is going to turn out.

Yeah this feels like it is loaded with diacetyl, too bad. There's a touch of classic lime and salt going on here for a gose, but it even feels like a great slippery butter stick. This added coconut is not really making for a pleasant experience. Tart but with the added coconut makes for a weird quality.

I can barely drink this and it reminds me too much of diacetyl.\xa01,015 charactersSmakawhat, Jul 01, 2018", '4.2/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9.9%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Sample at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2018, Red Session. Aroma has candy like sweetness and honey. Taste is a sweet, salty and tart combo. A bit astringent. Really tasty and interesting combination of flavors.\xa0219 charactersCiocanelu, Jun 18, 2018', "3.8/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4On-tap at The Gibson, Brooklyn, NY

A: The beer is hazy pale yellow in color and poured with no head.
S: The beer smells rather sour and has strong notes of coconuts.
T: The taste is very salty and has notes of coconuts in the flavors.
M: It feels light- to medium-bodied and a little tart on the palate with a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: This beer is very salty for a gose and is the most saltiest beer that I've had in this style.

Serving type: on-tap\xa0461 charactersmetter98, Mar 12, 2018", '3.83/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75Finback has been kinda hit-or-miss lately, but the idea of a sour beer with coconut seemed interesting enough to pique my interest. The label says this is a "gose" but it's also 6% ABV, which is pretty far above the stylistically-intended ABV maximum for the style. The label also just says "sour ale" in another spot, so I don't know what this is going to be. Is it gonna be a "fruited" gose with a weirdly-high ABV (complete with coriander/salt) or just a regular-ol' kettle sour with coconut flavor? Who knows? That's why I review these oddities.

Pours a medium-hazy golden orange color with some blonde highlights. The head seemed pretty voluminous and intense upon initial pour, but it really petered out (thanks, lactobacillus!) after a few minutes. However, there's still a small ring of white bubbles adorning the top of this brew. Some bubbles rise to the surface rather nonchalantly, and overall the carbonation seems pretty meh. Not much else to say here... a standard gose pour... slightly better than I expected, actually.

The nose is really unique, but I'm not sure it comes together as well as it probably did in theory. First of all, this is most certainly a coriander-forward, mineral-laden gose beer. It's just randomly 6% where it probably should have been in the mid-4's, but whatever. Anyway, I get a lot of spicy, grassy and semi-funky coriander with some more earthy spice and a big hit of coconut as well. Like, the whole fruit. Shredded coconut, too. Some cinnamon-like spice... It's not just coconut milk... this really has the sweaty, tropical aspect going on, almost in the "uncanny valley" sense of things. Y'know, it's almost too much like coconut but there's something off about it? Weirdly enough, I loved how they used this flavor adjunct in their collaborative IPA with J. Wakefield, Smooth Beats Miami. This smells very interesting, but I'm not overly-convinced by it for whatever reason. Something doesn't jive well. Maybe too much on the sour side of things... there's a sharp citric note here that doesn't work with the nutty adjunct elements.

On the tongue, this comes together slightly better. It's a bit heavy bodied and syrupy, but the spicing and flavors are pretty accurate for what they were clearly going for. The baking spice (nutmeg/cinnamon)-esque flavors work pretty well with the coconut which has an earthy and nutty element to it. The base sour seems kinda distracting at first, but seems to blend in better over time. I think they should dial the acidity back a bit next time they brew this (if there is a next time)... it just feels overwhelming, and overshadows the tropical flavors I know this wants to exude. Overall, not a bad beer, but not the brewery's best use of coconut as a flavoring either. This would probably work better with pineapple when it comes to stereotypical tropical flavors, but what do I know?\xa02,875 charactersichorNet, Feb 17, 2018']

name: Gose The Destroyer
review:
["3.31/5\xa0\xa0rDev -9.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.25Purchased cold - 16oz can with no canned on date - Poured into an English pub glass

L - Pours a clear light brown/copper with mild sediment visible. Fizzy, loosely foamed head that dissipates quickly, no lacing whatsoever as it goes down.

S - Light hibiscus, indiscernible fruit, some salinity and a hint of sour.

T - Mild slightly bretty sour, indiscernible fruit, a touch of salinity.

F - Light to medium bodied with moderate, sharp carbonation.

O - Meh. This is the 2nd time I've been disappointed with a Slumbrew offering. I really hate whatever brettanomyces they're using. This needs more salinity, more sour and some dialing back on whatever fruit they've used that entirely overpowers the hibiscus.\xa0712 charactersMonkey-D-Luffy, Aug 23, 2017", '3.65/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5Clear light copper color nearly no head (just rim bubbles). A couple streaks for lace. 

Sweet and salty nose like one would expect from the style. 

Sour with a good dose of crystal malt for the base. The sourness plays throughout the tasting from the initial sip through the long aftertaste. Just a touch of saltiness.\xa0320 characterssmcolw, Aug 12, 2017', "4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4This Gose takes a different approach than other U.S brewed Goses. 
Less carbonated, more fruity, and far less salty.

Poured a copper-reddish color with a 3F head in a Stange glass ( best for the style).
It subsided within minutes.

Aroma: very floral, some dark, almost honey-raisin like flavor initially, which faded.

The MF is far less carbonated than other American brewed Goses. There is less tartness,
the body at first seems lighter than other U.S. Goses; with warming the balance is brought out.
With most Goses, colder is better, not with this beer.

The taste is fruity, somewhat spicy: citrus, berry, and hibiscus (?) It's difficult for me to recognize Hibiscus,
but the fruity quality is very pronounced.

Overall- quite different approach to the style. Excellent, and worth checking out.\xa0802 charactersbrureview, Oct 14, 2016"]

name: Triple Seesaw: Fruit Salad
review:
["4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.7%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Thanks Drew.
Poured into a stange.
The appearance was a thick magenta/purple-ish color with a fair finger's worth of white foamy head with enough bubbles to help sink the head fairly quick. No lace was left.
The aroma had a huge boysenberry to tart cherry up front meshing with some peach, plum, blueberry, strawberry and some apricot trying to get in there for balance. Some sly sour to sweet wheat slides in for an appropriate touch.
The flavor mildly blends the sweet to the tart up front taking in a wonderful fruity mellow sour character. Nice smooth aftertaste of all of the prior mentioned fruits.
The mouthfeel was about medium bodied, perhaps just a touch under. Carbonation felt a bit under but I wasn't bothered. ABV felt appropriate. Big berry tart and wheaty finish.
Overall, great as a fruited sour ale but where's the saltiness? Still, it's well done enough to have again.\xa0887 charactersLone_Freighter, Mar 15, 2019", '4.29/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Drank from a 1 pint can purchased at Trillium Brewing Company, Boston, MA
Canned on 11/06/18
Served in a tulip

The cloudy, dark magenta colored body was capped by a thin, bubbly, light fuschia crown that quickly fell to a frothy collar. A few odd streaks of lacing stuck along the glass.

The aroma was really fruity and bright. Berry notes dominated. Raspberry came through strongest. Strawberry was noticeable too. As the beer sat, blackberry and blueberry notes came forth, as did the overall sweetness. Later, apricot appeared and competed for dominance with the berries.

The flavor was quite fruity as well but definitely more tart and bright than the nose. Again, berry notes dominated. I might guess strawberry followed by raspberry or blackberry. Moderately sour and acidic. Underripe berries or berry seeds came to mind. The tartness and acidity intensified as the beer moved along the palate. Lemon notes and a hint of briny salinity appeared on the finish.

Ultra light and fluffy mouthfeel. The liquid contained a fine yet aggressive effervescence that came across as a touch airy initially. As the liquid sat, the carbonation settled to a more appropriate level and the liquid tuned creamy and slick.

This “Fruit Salad” variation of Triple Seesaw was enjoyable but a step below the other releases. With so many fruits in this one, some were bound to get lost in the fray.\xa01,391 charactersDamian, Jan 02, 2019', '4.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.3%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Hazy purple color with short lived purple head. Aroma is really fruity with jam and fruit preserve juices. Taste follows, tart and really fruity, not very acidic, easy drinking with a nice background sweetness. Medium body and carbonation. Really good, fruity, tart and refreshing.\xa0281 charactersCiocanelu, Dec 04, 2018', "4.18/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Poured from a 16 oz can into a stemmed harmony glass.

Pours a hazy deep ruby color with a finger of pink head. The head leaves minimal lacing as it settles into a thin ring.

The aroma is straight up peach rings, blueberries, strawberries, and tart cherry. There's plenty of bready malt in the background.

The flavor brings a ton of blueberry jam, boysenberry, and strawberry jam, as well as some wonderfully tart cherries and a hint of peaches. The finish has the faintest hint of salinity.

The feel is medium bodied with good carbonation. Very smooth and creamy, with just enough dry, crispness on the finish. Definitely drinks like a fruit smoothie.

Overall, a great Gose that is nicely balanced and subtly tart. This one is definitely a fruit salad.\xa0757 charactersScaryEd, Nov 20, 2018"]

name: Citrana Sour
review:
["3.57/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.5%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.5Can from Kings in Phoenix. 

A clear light orange with a thin white head that falls off rapidly leaving little lacing this looks solid. The nose is grainy with wheat to go with a mild prickly pear note, a moderate lactic sourness and a noticeable saltiness. A mild citrus note is present as well. As ot warms, a coriander note grows in prominence. The palate opens tart and salty, arguably a little too salty, with a grainy, wheat like note, a blend of coriander seed and fresh cilantro and a bit of lime. Drying, tart and refreshing yet harsh on the finish due to the liberal use of salt, this is solid. Alcohol is unnecessarily high, but isn't particularly noticeable on the palate.\xa0686 charactersDefenCorps, Jan 06, 2019", "3.63/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.9%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Appearance: Lays on a massive head, with three fingers and then some; the hazy golden liquid underneath slowly builds but the stickage is excellent with a few spots of lace hanging around

Smell: Salty, lactic lime tones with a strong coriander and cardamom edge

Taste: Sour and salty, from the outset, with the salt and lactic lime flavors battling; coriander and cardamom emerges, through the middle; the finish is a bit like a cheap Tequila shot without the burn

Mouthfeel: Light body with moderate to high carbonation

Overall: An interesting take but I can't say I am digging it

Thanks, kevindp9, for the opportunity\xa0629 charactersbrentk56, Dec 10, 2017", '4.36/5\xa0\xa0rDev +16.6%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25Served on tap at the brewery. From notes. Reviewed 27 February 2016.
4/4.25/4.5/4.5/4.25
Really crisp. Bracingly tart and pretty damn delicious. Definitely the best beer on the menu. Recommended.\xa0195 charactersAgentMunky, Mar 12, 2016', '3.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.4%On draft at The Perch. The beer is light orange with a mild haze a thin white head. Aromas lemon zest, cracked pepper, lime juice, light spice, maybe coriander. Prickly carbonation, finishing sweet and tangy. A very mild tartness in the mid palate. Notes of tropical fruit a la fruit punch. This is ok.\xa0303 charactersHuhzubendah, Sep 14, 2014']

name: Hop Gose Weasel
review:
['3.94/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4pours semi cloudy with a big white head. 
Drank out of a can purchased at Tricycle (the bar). 
smell is citrus and sharpness from the tartness. 
Flavor is fairly well balanced. definite citrus on the front palate, but then it goes tart. fairly clean finish for the style. Nothing bind blowing going on here, but pretty good. I could drink a couple\xa0352 charactersBshaw22, Nov 11, 2019', "4.34/5\xa0\xa0rDev +11.6%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Breaming with succulent and tangy fruit, prime tartness and a hint of salinity, the gose of Marz takes that traditional northern German style and puts it on its head with the late addition hops for a fragrant perfume and a brighter taste.

Hop Gose Weasel comes as a darker shade of gold than what's normal. But its creamy, short-lived froth abounds with the bright scent of tropical fruits, citrus fruits, herbal and piney aromas along with a brisk scent of the sea. Light sweetness touches the tongue as a modest savory tone of bread crust and sun kissed grains seem honey and caramel-like, but very, very soft.

Coming alive on the middle palate, the acidic taste comes quick. Buffered by bread crust, the acidity does off an apprehensive patience while the taste of matured pineapple rind, mango, apricot, lime, lemon and green apple take a sharp and succulent taste. Seeming margarita-like with strands of agave, chardonnay and gin, the beer's earthen salinity plays into a slightly robust taste of sourness for balance, complexity and rustic charm.

Medium light in body, the taste trends dry as the acidity takes hold. Salty, citrusy, piney, grassy, cidery and surprisingly toasty, the melange of flavors are impressively balanced while the ale trails into a short, crisp, clean, but rounded display of culinary art- all on the bright, beach, and sunshiny side.\xa01,368 charactersBEERchitect, Mar 18, 2017", '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.8%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Sweet/tart/sour. Copious head. Taste is reminiscent of biting into a piquant cone of cotton candy. Slightly acerbic and saline, yet delectable. Unlike any other gose-style beverage imbibed heretofore.\xa0202 charactersaronamerican, Jan 02, 2017', "4.13/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4500ml Bottle
$7.99
Open Bottle - Tinley Park

Batch: #189

Hop Gose the Weasel is pale golden when backlit with a hazy tone throughout. When it out of the way of light it takes on a mandarin orange color. The foam is cottonball white with the same consistency. It's fluffy and billowy with surprising sticktoitivness falling no lower than a cap throughout the drink. Small but chunky spots of lace cling to the glass after each drink.

The nose has a wheaty twang, damp graininess if you will, along with a bit of minerality as well. Briney. The dry hopping brings a really interesting and fun element to the style with some orange and lime notes. There's a nice citric quality that hints at acidity with both lemon and lime. There is a fresh, green floral character as well. I'm a fan, I have to say, my mouth is watering.

The flavor profile is brighter and punchier than the nose but the basis is the same. Damp wheat is the first twang with the salty minerality quickly rising up its back. The dry hopping brings a vivid citrusy punch to the middle with orange juice, lime zest and juice, and a squeeze of lemon. A citrus fruit basket of sorts. There's saltiness, acidity, and even a touch of bitterness. I'm a fan of this beer, fo' sho'.

The feel fits the style well. The body's weight sits a touch shy of moderate while the carbonation is zippy upfront before softening and allowing the body to take on a velvety softness. There's a soft acidic bite along the sides of the tongue and a mild bitterness on the swallow, very slight. Drinkability is off the charts easy. A pint is not enough.

Hop Gose Weasel is a mighty fine beer from the mighty fine Marz Brewing Co and the mighty fine folk from Bridgeport. The dry hopping adds a unique citric aspect to the twang and minerality that I can surely get behind. I won't hesitate picking this up again in the near future.\xa01,875 charactersjoe1510, Apr 10, 2016", '2.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev -29.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 2 | feel: 3 | overall: 3Has a yellow amber murky color to it with a large white head that goes away quickly. Has a sour fruit smell to it. Tastes is of little bit of sour fruit wheat and notes of hops.\xa0177 charactersThe_Snow_Bird, Mar 21, 2016', "3.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev -10%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5EBF sample pour. A very standard Gose. Coriander, light salt, tangy yeast. The flavor had a lemony tartness. By this point in the night I didn't pick up any salt. I did get some hoppiness, though. Light bodied. This style of beer isn't easy to describe in my opinion.\xa0267 charactersVelvetExtract, Feb 09, 2016"]

name: Petit Verdot
review:
['3.88/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.8%look: 3.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75So I dunno if I was just off my game or what, but I ordered a gose as a 6th beer in a 6 beer flight. Prolly should have been 2nd. Anyways, has a slightly hazy amber looking appearance with 1/4" white head on the top. The nose has quite a bit going on, there is the lighter than the appearance hay like yeast quality, a smidge of tart/sourness that is higher than average for style. 

Taste continues with the 7.5/10 gose levels of sourness. But its eminently crushable and easy to drink. The light and dry hay notes continue. There is a mild grape and salt presence. This is enjoyable all around. Its earthy with heavier "feels" of an almost flanders like dimension (dirt, tobacco, leather, animal hide, bark) but remains firmly in the light/levity lane. Its definitely stronger than a gose should be, and I would love if there was a way to dial the strength down. Nonetheless, I'm shocked it works so well, on paper, this beer should be a mess. In reality, it pulls it off and maintains a nice balance between complexity and crushability. 

First review that isn't nonsensical and/or laden with indecipherable aspects.\xa01,132 charactersrodbeermunch, Mar 19, 2019', '3.46/5\xa0\xa0rDev -9.2%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 2.25 | overall: 3.5Liked the flavor. Look was a little boring. Bot much of head, bir active bubbles. Taste was nice and balanced. Expected more of the thpocal grpw described. Frank like a cider. Would pair nice with rhubarb dishes, strawberry, and such. Tart level is more moderate than apparent, not necessarily funky or overly tart.\xa0315 charactersBeerswag, Mar 12, 2016']

name: Gose
review:
['4.07/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4Reviewed from notes. Poured from a 750 mL bottle into a Cigar City Brewing goblet.

A: Mildly hazy, very light gold to yellow. This is exceptionally clear for the style. Tons of visible carbonation, and a one-finger white head with very good retention.

S: Moderately funky (definitely more than a lot of goses), lactic tartness, earthy and minerally. A bit savory, with a bigger citric acid lemony bite. Very light two row malts and mild wheat grist.

T: Tart lemons, minerally and salty. Citric acid tartness, Lactobacillus funk. Cracker malts, again with a backer of wheat husk – but not at all objectionable. Salinity and citric tartness last into the hang and it ends up finishing pretty dry.

M: A light body, though heavier than some in style. Lots of carbonation sensation, and no alcohol to speak of.

O: This was really good, though a bit different take on a gose. Heavier on the funk, more balanced in the sour. But the salinity is obvious without being obnoxious – there’s no doubt as to the style in the flavor. Quite enjoyable, though I still think I would prefer a few others (Rapp and Westbrook come to mind).\xa01,131 charactersmacrosmatic, Jan 20, 2017', "4.04/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.9%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Hazy golden apricot with a foamy white head that settles to a thin layer.

Smell is very powerful lemon-lime and salt--this is a straight up margarita baby!

Taste is a little barnyard funk with super tart, salty lemon lime, big time. The saltiness can't be understated here--this margarita has one thickly salted rim! They may have gone a tad overboard but I think it works here.

Lots of froth on the palate.\xa0410 charactersSabtos, Dec 19, 2016"]

name: Never Aloha
review:
['4.34/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.2%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4.5On-tap at the Veil Brewing Co., Richmond, VA

A: The beer is cloudy ruby red grapefruit gin color. It poured with a white collar around the edge of the glass and some lacing on the surface.
S: Strong aromas of passionfruit are present in the nose.
T: The taste follows the smell and is very tropical with flavors of passionfruit along tithe notes of blood oranges and mangos with hints fo pineapple. There is a bit of saltiness and slight hints of sourness.
M: It feels light- to medium-bodied on the palate and has a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: This beer is like drinking a sour and salty version of a Hawaiian Punch with all natural flavors.

Serving type: on-tap\xa0672 charactersmetter98, Aug 10, 2018', '4.3/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5Sample at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017, blue session. Aroma has tropical fruits like passionfruit and papaya. Taste is sweet, fruity and tropical. Dry, easy drinking and refreshing.\xa0195 charactersCiocanelu, May 30, 2017', "4.73/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9.2%look: 4 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Hazy papaya colored with a small head that fades and leaves little to no lacing. Aromas of adult fruit punch. Notes of sticky guava, cherry, pineapple, passionfruit, Meyer lemon, ocean spritz and orange. Light toward medium, puckering and dry but highly drinkable. Stunning, simply stunning. Easily the best Gose I've ever had and one of the best beers I've had.\xa0367 charactersHopBomb515, May 20, 2017", '4.49/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Late March release, 2017. 16 oz can obtained in trade. Poured into Teku glass.

L: Almost no head when poured, what there is reduces to a thin ring in no time, no lacing. Beer is a hazy light pink, like pink grapefruit juice.

S: Tons of tropical fruit like pineapple, mango, passionfruit, and orange. Really does resemble Hawaiian Punch as far as I can remember. Light yeast and light salt/sea air on back end. Quite nice.

T: Seriously, so close to Hawaiian Punch, but fortunately not as sweet. Just tons of pineapple, passionfruit, mango, and other tropical fruits. Some lime peel. As I said, sweetness does not run away. Balanced by yeast and saline sea taste on finish, which likewise does not run away with sour. Nicely done.

F: Light to medium body, a tad more than most goses, but not an issue. Great construction melding the flavors together and great balance.

O: Fabulous fruity Gose. The Veil does not disappoint with its Never series.\xa0948 charactersIvoryFoxhole, Apr 23, 2017', "4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.8%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25I'm really torn on this one. The base gose is very, very good. The Hawaiian Punch taste throws me off. It does tsste just like Hawaiian Punch (with an appropriate hint of gose saltiness).\xa0188 characterskrome, Apr 17, 2017", "4.71/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8.8%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.75Straight to the point: this beer blew me away. It's one of those beers that you can't look at ratings because there simply aren't enough of them. I encourage you to seek this beer out and decide for yourself.

It has a beautiful color of cherry to it while keeping clarity (almost like they wanted it to look like fruit punch or something). The smell is entirely fruity guava. The taste matches the smell in the best of ways and the feel is super smooth (appropriate for a 4.9%). This may end up being a sleeper, but I seriously hope that I get to try this beer again one day.\xa0576 charactersJrodsmrs51, Apr 07, 2017", '4.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.9%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Reddish-Orange color with very thing lacing around the glass. Smells strongly of mango and pineapple with a little sourness. Delicious fruity taste with nice gose tartness. Some bitterness in the aftertaste as well as a tart feeling. Like drinking tart fruit punch.\xa0269 charactersbrocktune, Mar 31, 2017']

name: Suburban Beverage - Blood Orange
