review: ['4.43/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5poured from a 16oz can into a perennial willi becher glass. pours a semi hazy burnt orange with almost three fingers of bright white head. smells of assorted bitter / sour fruits. lemon, lime, orange, grapefruit and even a touch of barnyard funk. i’m not in love with the look or smell of this beer to be honest. taste is similar but exchange the funk with salty tartness. this has a little of that “pucker up buttercup” taste to it. it doesn’t linger though and it’s not too acidic. pretty light and refreshing yet full of flavor for a low ABV beer. the sourness keeps me from chugging it and makes it more of a slowly consumed pour. feel is bubbly and carbonated but it works for this style. this is very much a summer beer. i think i enjoy (appreciate) the simplicity of regular suburban beverage but respect the more complex flavors and aroma of this variant. i definitely wouldn’t say no to this and would very much welcome it poolside on a hot summer day.\xa0973 charactersLuscious_Malfoy, Aug 04, 2019']

name: Haterade
review:
["2.82/5\xa0\xa0rDev -27.7%look: 3.5 | smell: 2.75 | taste: 2.75 | feel: 3 | overall: 2.75A: The first time I had this, it poured basically opaque with floaties. Though, this has been cleaned up considerably. Most recently, pours a clear golden/yellow color. A one finger white head forms and recedes quickly with light lace.
S: Nondescript fruity aromas, pine sol/dish detergent is prevalent in the nose. Very soapy. Not digging this at all.
T: I get some faint tart fruity flavors. Soapy, pine sol/dish detergent like. A bit of savory saltiness, which is probably the best part. Though I can't get bast the soapy character.
M/D: A light body. Effervescent and crisp. Just a below average Gose IMO. Certain aspects I am not a fan of, and I don't really enjoy it.

Not the first time I have gotten a soapy character from 8th Wonder, and it is really prominent here. Its good that they cleaned this up a bit since I first had it. but not going to be many other repeat purchases for me.\xa0910 characterschamp103, Mar 17, 2017", "4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.9%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 5 | overall: 412 oz. on tap at the brewery

L: clear gold, pushes up 1 finger head of wispy foam, keeps very thin collar; the lighting isn't great, so it's hard to tell for sure ... but ... might be relatively dark for a gose, well past yellow into a bit of gold with some amber in it

S: light and fruity for a gose

T: salty lemonade ... the salt is a punch to the face, very mouth-puckering; as it warms, watermelon ... the sweetness really shows through; great grain aftertaste

F: light and crisp, almost watery but that allows the carbonation to fill in the rest; perfect for the style

O: great beer, nothing elaborate or out of place, and the nice clean tart kick fits in nicely with the grain flavor and sweeter nose\xa0715 charactersPremo88, Feb 07, 2017", '4.2/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.7%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25Poured from tap into shaker minimal head no lacing. Pale golden yellow in the glass. Smells a little of lactic sourness and faintly of lemon. Taste slightly sour with a little lemon mixes in then the salt shuts it down. I have to say this is balanced.... it is about a hair away from being too salty, but not there yet. This could be a dangerous beer. This has a great mouthfeel for the style and ABV.\xa0408 charactersdonspublic, Sep 20, 2016', "4.37/5\xa0\xa0rDev +12.1%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5On tap at brewery 7/3/16

Haterade is probably the best gose I've ever had. It poured cloudy and turbid yellow with no head. It was light bodied, drinkable, salty and thirst quenching. I went back for another. No stickiness, no sweetness, just salty and easy drinking.\xa0272 charactersCan_has_beer, Jul 05, 2016", "3.11/5\xa0\xa0rDev -20.3%look: 4 | smell: 3 | taste: 3 | feel: 3 | overall: 3.25Had this on tap at Lowbrow.

This beer was actually really interesting looking because of the sour patch kids they brewed/conditioned it with. There is a metallic/oily layer in the beer from the candy that swirls around on the surface, not much head retention at all, but really unique looking and worthy of admiration for sure.

Everything else about this beer is less than memorable, tastes like your typical witbier but with a slight variance in the mouthfeel from the sour patch kids. Not exceptionally sweet, but definitely a shade sweeter than the 'Intellectuale' that its based on.\xa0588 charactersbeerdrinker123, Jul 14, 2014"]

name: Gose Of Uncommon Origin
review:
['4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5750 ml bottle into tulip glass, 2016 vintage bottling on the cork. Pours slightly hazy pale golden/yellow color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with good retention, that reduces to a thin lace cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing clings around the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big lightly tart lemon, lime, peach, pear, green apple, melon, white grape, white wine, hay, straw, grass, oak, sea water, wheat, and cracker; with light notes of leathery/musty funk, peppercorn, vanilla, white vinegar, and yeast/oak earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, oak barrel, sea water, and light-moderate pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big lightly tart lemon, lime, peach, pear, green apple, melon, white grape, white wine, hay, straw, grass, oak, sea water, wheat, and cracker; with light notes of leathery/musty funk, peppercorn, vanilla, white vinegar, and yeast/oak earthiness. Light-moderate lactic tartness and yeast/oak spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart lemon, lime, peach, pear, green apple, melon, white grape, white wine, hay, straw, grass, oak, sea water, wheat, cracker, peppercorn, leathery/musty funk, light vinegar, and yeast/oak earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Great complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, oak barrel, sea water, and light-moderate pale malt flavors; with an awesome malt/tart/spiciness balance, and zero puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Moderate dryness from tart/spiciness and carbonation, increasing through the glass. Medium-high carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately crisp, acidic/grainy, and lightly saline/tannic balanced mouthfeel that is awesome. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5%. Overall this is a outstanding gose! All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, oak barrel, sea water, and light-moderate pale malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, and refreshing to drink with the mellowly lactic/tannic/drying finish. Really spot on Brett complexity and oak presence; solid malt balance; and not overly saline/salty or lactic. A highly enjoyable offering.\xa02,261 characterssuperspak, Jul 29, 2017', '4.17/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25A: The beer is rather hazy pale yellow in color. It poured with a half finger high white head that consistently left a short head covering the surface.
S: Light to moderate aromas of sour citrus are present in the nose.
T: The taste follows the smell and has a moderate amount of sourness with flavors of lemony citrus, oak, and sea salt.
M: It feels light-bodied and rather tart on the palate with a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: This beer is pleasantly refreshing. I particularly like how the oak and the lemons lended some tartness to the mouthfeel.

Note: 2016 vintage

Serving type: bottle\xa0600 charactersmetter98, Jun 11, 2017']

name: Hipster Popsicle
review:
['3.65/5\xa0\xa0rDev -9.9%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.7516 ounce can dated 6/28/18. Poured into tulip. 
Pours pink orange hue, 1.5 fingers of just off white head. The nose is light aromas of cherry, citrus, tart acetic bite. 
Taste is at first a tart cherry, then tartness, lime, light funkiness. Everything about the beer, taste wise, is light. 
Mouthfeel is light, effervescent, the bubbles carry away the beer from tongue.\xa0370 charactersstrohme2, Oct 07, 2018', '3.73/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.9%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Nice appearance, with a nearly opaque pink-orange brew topped with a strong head.

Aroma implies the notes hinted by the description, in particular musty rustic notes, cherry, and a slight sourness.

On the palate, it falls a touch flat, with a reasonable saltiness but far too restrained sourness - and very little from the cherry or lime.

Very refreshing and lively.\xa0369 charactersRoguer, Sep 16, 2018', '4.3/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.2%look: 4.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Straight pour from a 32oz flip-top amber glass “howler” to a small-ish, stubby, stemmed tulip (old Swamp Head glassware). This was filled one day before consumption at the source, and promptly went into the fridge until drinking. (Notes transcribed later, after taking them.) Freshy-fresh. 

Appearance (4.75): Pouring leads to a two-finger, light pink head that’s soft and shows decent retention (particularly for the style). Still, it dissipates to a thin collar at the surface. The body is a glowing, deep pink, like watermelon juice, and fairly hazy—but not quite opaque. Absolutely gorgeous. 

Smell (4.0): Light and bright lactic acid, a little coriander, the clear, strident citrus character of lime juice, and just enough cherry sweetness to flesh out the body. That lactic tang shines over all, in the end. 

Taste (4.5): The acidic blend of lactic and citrusy snap rule from start to finish: the beer comes in with an almost Greek yogurt-like sourness, funky but acidic, and moves to the midsection, off of the sour and onto the soft, floury wheat malt. The malt character turns into a bready note, like common crackers. Slight cherry sweetness, cut by lime bitterness, follows. That lime acidity follows through to the finish. On the mid-palate, the fruitiness slightly precedes the wheaty malt base, but soon they mingle together fairly evenly. A modest saltiness hangs out on the side all along, nicely complementing the fruity and bready flavors, drying them out slightly with that savory side. 

Mouthfeel (4.0): Immediately from the get-go, the sour and salty notes dry out and lighten the slightly light- side of medium-weight body. Fine, tingly carbonation washes in, covers all surfaces, and then washes out with an even lighter-weight body. 

Overall (4.25): This beer an absolute joy to drink, for me. Way too easy to drink, frankly. The mix of a nice, wheaty gose with the sweetness of the cherry and the acidic twang of the lime juice makes for an absurdly refreshing drink without any of the potentially off-putting characteristics of the gose style. I love the concept, I love the execution, and I love the finished product.\xa02,157 charactersfmccormi, Mar 31, 2016', '4.03/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4A gose on tap at the brewery. 

Pours with a cloudy reddish-copper body topped by a weak head that leaves little lacing. 

Near full, smooth body with well set carbonation. 

Complex and appealing spicy and fruity aroma. 

Fine flavor with good balance, moderate tartness, and very good complexity. Cherry and lime notes. 

O: an excellent gose worth seeking out.\xa0363 characterschinchill, Mar 12, 2016', '3.83/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.4%look: 5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5One of the most awesome named beers. Pours a light pink with a small white head that goes away quickly. Has a light fruity smell. Has a sour cherry lemon lime taste.\xa0165 charactersThe_Snow_Bird, Mar 12, 2016', "4.93/5\xa0\xa0rDev +21.7%look: 4.75 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 5 | feel: 5 | overall: 54oz pour at brewery, after that 32oz growler fill shared few hours later. Pours a unique light pinkish semi cloudy strew yellow with nice lingering white head. Smells exactly what a true traditional German Gose should, nice pleasant soury aroma. Taste is Just about perfect! I've had my share of Gose style beers and this might just be the best I've had yet! I mean this beer showcases what is great about American craftsmanship, crafting something better then the past. 4.90. The only flaw with this beer is it's name. Please rename it, can it at $11.00 a 6, send it out so we can all try this! We will all be rewarded. 4.90\xa0629 charactersKensWorld, Nov 07, 2015", "4.02/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Poured from a growler into a snifter. A good looking beer, light pinkish hue that looks great. Not a whole lot on the nose, a slight cherry note and you know it'll be tart. The taste is great- just enough tart and salt with shades of cherry. Didnt know what to expect and was pleasantly surprised. Great job.\xa0316 characterspmangold, Sep 12, 2015", '4.22/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25Really enjoyable brew (local for me). There is a slight tartness, but an excellent balance overall that makes this beer so crisp and refreshing. I have ordered it about 4 or 5 times now\xa0185 charactersJaxBeerBear, Mar 13, 2015', "3.55/5\xa0\xa0rDev -12.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.7532 oz. growler poured into a snifter.

Appearance - Hazy light orange/pink. Sunset-colored. No head, really. Very thin collar.

Smell - Light cherry. Some grain. Mild citrus acidity and a bit of an herbal note. Maybe spiced? Coriander? Can't really discern.

Taste - Lime is much stronger here. Shades of the cherry come through, but not much. Pleasant tartness. Grain. Kinda salty, too.

Mouthfeel - Medium low carbonation. Light body.

Overall - Pleasant beer.\xa0475 charactersAlieniloquium, Jan 27, 2015"]

name: Cup O' Beer
review:
['4.05/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.6%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25A: Pours a clear pale bright yellow in color with moderate to heavy amounts of active visible carbonation rising quickly from the bottom of the glass and moderate pale golden yellow + straw yellow colored highlights. The beer has a four finger tall fizzy foamy bright white head that reduces to a medium to large sized patch of thin film covering a little more than 60% of the surface of the beer and a thin ring at the edges of the glass. Light amounts of lacing are observed.

S: Slightly stronger than moderate aromas of slightly soured wheat malts with a moderate aroma of lacto tart lemon citrus + tart lime citrus. Light to moderate aromas of lemongrass + white pepper + coriander as well a hint raw ginger. Light amounts of brininess towards the finish.

T: Upfront there is a slightly stronger than moderate flavor of slightly soured wheat malts with a moderate aroma of lacto tart lemon citrus + tart lime citrus. That is followed by just shy of moderate flavors of spices/aromatics - lemongrass + white pepper + coriander as well a hint raw ginger. There is a light presence of earthy herbal notes likely from the seaweed and a just shy of moderate amount of brininess in the finish. There is a light to moderate lingering slightly salty citrus tartness.

M: Light bodied with moderate to heavy amounts of active visible carbonation. Crisp with a slightly heavier than moderate amount of acidic prickliness.

O: Easy to drink with well hidden alcohol. A very interesting experimental beer that is quite successful in my opinion though I do not actually smell or taste the noodles. I enjoy the combination of aromatics/spices with the tart citrus and I could easily enjoy another of these.\xa01,698 charactersdbrauneis, Feb 14, 2019', '3.77/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.8%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Appearance - Pours crystal clear golden yellow color with thick white head that dissipates quickly to a bubbly ring.

Aroma - Lemongrass, pepper, funk, salty, coriander smells a little like a sprite.

Taste - Tastes is alot like a tart salty sprite as well. Lemongrass, salt, pretty tart.

Feel - Light tart super prickly carbonation slightly dry finish.

Overall - A decent gose hits all of the marks not getting anything that relates to Ramen noodles.\xa0453 charactersDragginballs76, Dec 17, 2017', "3.85/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Large pour at Hopdoddy, Fort Worth. 

Looks alright, they serve in frozen glasses, so it's hard to tell. 

Vegetal, raw green peppers, lemongrass, raw ginger, pho, coriander. 

Lemon-lime tart sourness greets you on the first swig. It's highly carbonated, tart and spritz-y. There's salt in the finish, but the in the end the finish is pretty clean. 

It's bright and crisp. 

I think they got what they were going for; it's out of the box, but drinkable. It's a savory beer and an experiment that turned out well.\xa0514 charactersbrewerburgundy, Sep 16, 2017"]

name: Barrel-Aged Uror
review:
['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.7%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4tequila barrel aged bottle. not sure if uror is always barrel aged, but this drink was, and it was lovely. pale pale blonde very light colored beer, radiant though, crystal clear and holding a nice inch of rising white head. the nose is more gose than barrel, which i think keeps it honest. its tart, but not really lacto heavy, not acidic, not sour. the salt and the tequila barrel go well together, which was obviously the idea for this beer, its a match made in heaven, with just enough of that sharp agave profile grabbing the salt. the beer is so light, easy drinking and all, that its almost amazing that it can have so much flavor going on. you would think it would need a bigger base, but it does just fine as it is. the barrel character is impressive. seemingly done with decently quality tequila too, its not harsh or chemically. id like to see the beer just a little more sour, maybe some lactic fermentation rather than simply a sour mash. the acidity would help it stick i think. light body, great carbonation, long and interesting finish. i think this is a tweak or two away from being epic, but i think they accomplished their mission with it. maybe not worth the nearly 20 bucks i dropped on it, but i am glad to have tried this one of a kind brew.\xa01,264 charactersStonedTrippin, Sep 29, 2015', "4.02/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4From a 750mL into a snifter.

A- Cloudy straw-color with a thin and wispy head. Lace settles over the body. 4.25

S- It smells like a margarita. Salty and lime-like in a pronounced way. 4

T- It tastes like a margarita lite, but of the quality variety, meaning a real lime flavor with a heavily-salted rim. Tequila is up front and leads me to think I'm going to get a blast of boozy heat, but none comes. 4

M- Light and easy-drinking with a potent salinity. There's a touch of solvent tequila feel but it's fleeting. 4\xa0519 charactersONovoMexicano, Aug 24, 2015", '4.05/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4750ml bottle, Tequila barrel aged.

Pours pale yellow with a half inch head of quickly dissolving white. A partial skim coat with a few errant dots of lacing for the duration of the glass.

Aromatics lead off with hints of citrus and tequila. Lemons and coriander with a hint of booze.

Light bodied with a crisp, dry mouthfeel.

Lemony and bone-dry on the palate. Faintly salty with a trace of the Tequila barrel.

Finishes tart, dry and lemony.

Tasty beer but the Tequila barrel treatment is pretty faint and would probably not be detectable if not told so.\xa0560 charactersbrewandbbq, Mar 06, 2015', '4.67/5\xa0\xa0rDev +14.7%look: 4 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 5Poured from 750 mL bottle into a hefeweizen glass

A: Fizzy white head quickly dissipates, leaving one with the straw yellow color. The beer is slightly hazy, though still translucent.

S: A bit salty and sour lemon.

T: Fizzy, salty taste at the front with a big malted wheat finish (I think it is this opposition of flavor that makes a good gose). The tequila barrel is present in the after taste, a smooth oak/tequila flavor that balances well with the salty wheat.

M: Medium effervescence with a body that makes its presences known and welcome. A good bit of bubbles on the finish.

O: This beer is very much to style and a fantastic beer overall. The tequila flavor makes its presence known but is never overpowering. A salty tequila flavor lingers between sips. Would drink again.\xa0787 charactersKegelsKegs, May 11, 2014']

name: C Is For Cherry
review:
['3.87/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.9%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75Man, did I ever get lucky during my latest visit to The Beer & Beverage Shoppe on Roseville Road! It is out of order, but I scored a CAN of this one as I am wrapping up my foray into the Sue Grafton series of beers. I don't think that I bought either A or B when they were released, but I plan to stay current from now on. Viva The CANQuest (tm)!

From the CAN: "Let's face it - we all like to put labels on things. It just makes us feel more comfortable. What assumptions have people made about you based on your race, religion, gender, the way you dress, or even the beer you drink? We did in fact label this beer for your convenience. It his a fresh tartness, a twist of salt and a balanced fruitiness of cherry - apparently a complete reflection of your personality. We hope you like what this label says about you?" 

I Crack!ed the vent following some in-CAN agitation to ensure that any flocculate was back in suspension. After all, I was going for full-on Cherry! My C-Line Glug was more heavy-handed than usual, but again, it was a matter of getting the most out of this one. Man, it quickly foamed up to the point that I had to back down. It briefly formed two fingers of fizzy, foamy, soapy, pinkish head that quickly dissipated into wisps. 8=( Color was a cloudy pinkish-Amber (SRM = > 7, < 9), akin to freshly-squeezed grapefruit juice. Nose was redolent with sour cherries and a saltiness that was like standing on the forecastle in heavy seas, taking in the air. I always loved the smell of salt air while underway. Sigh. Mouthfeel was on-par for the style, which is to say kind of thin & watery. The taste was nice, but not traditional, thanks to the addition of sour cherries. Wow! If it was not tangy enough at its base, now it was downright puckering in its tartness! As to the style, this is from the site's revamped "Beer Styles" guide: "A wide variety of herbal, spice, floral or fruity aromas other than found in traditional Leipzig-Style Gose [may be] present, in harmony with other aromas." Fair dinkum! Man, this was an interesting twist on Gose, for sure. I am not a tart/sour guy by any stretch, but I gravitate towards Goses more than others simply because of their inherent saltiness. This did NOT disappoint in that department as it was not only tart from the cherries and sour from the lactic acid, but they did not hold back in the addition of salt. It seemed like a CANtradiction in terms (oxymoron), but I was now thirstier than when I started drinking this beer! 8=p Finish was bone-dry. Gaspingly dry. Reach for the asthma inhaler dry. You get the idea. Dry. Phew! This is quite the series!\xa02,629 characterswoodychandler, Jun 06, 2019', '3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75after how intense the fruit has been in some of these, i was really expecting a lot more cherry on this. i know its been out for awhile now, like it might have faded some, but the color is barely pink, just a light rose color, and the cherry flavor is pretty mild, in balance rather, not all juice and overdone, still beer first. lot of bubbles on this submerged in the liquid, but they hardly collect into any head at all, and it looks odd as a result. aroma is light medicinal cherry sweetness, a little tang from them too, and then a sort of candy thing before the clean lemony lactic sourness, middle of the road in intensity. its not real sour when i drink it, a little vinous and sharp, clean though on the bacterial side of things, seemingly leaving a lot of room for fruit to do its thing, but it never really comes through for me here. i do get some salt and a trace coriander thing to it, which give it some needed depth and roundness, itd be pretty bland without that i think, more cherry would be a good thing here, i cant believe i actually think that, these guys tend to overdo it, but here it seems less than optimal. great carbonation when i drink it, almost feels like a seltzer water on the palate, as there is not much grain body to this either. interesting stuff, real light, not their best work, but an enjoyable can of beer...\xa01,348 charactersStonedTrippin, Nov 17, 2018', '4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +13%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25C is for Gose. No, cookie. OK, cherry. This is a very good gose.

It pours just a tad off color towards red. The bubbles are exquisite. The aroma is also first rate, fruity and yeasty, like normal, plus the additional cherry flavor.

The taste is a great, tart gose, with a bit more kick in the tart department. It works. The finish is clean, just slightly tart, but it dissipates soon enough.

Highly recommended.\xa0414 charactersschoolboy, Jun 16, 2018', '3.92/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4A: Pours a cloudy pinkish burnt orange in color with moderate amounts of fine active visible carbonation rising along edges of the glass and moderate medium golden yellow + burnt orange + ruby red colored highlights. The beer has a tow finger tall fizzy foamy white head that reduces to a few small patches of very thin film surrounded by a very thin ring at the edges of the glass. Light amounts of lacing are observed.

S: Moderate aromas of slightly sour wheat malts with moderate aromas of lacto tartness. There are light aromas of lemon citrus and a hint of brininess. Light to moderate aromas of tart cherry.

T: Upfront there are just shy of moderate flavors of slightly sour wheat malts with light flavors of lemon citrus and moderate flavors of lacto tartness. Slightly stronger than moderate flavors of tart cherries and a light flavor of brininess. Light to moderate amounts of lingering tartness in the finish.

M: Light to medium bodied with moderate amounts of carbonation. Light to moderate amounts of acidic prickliness.

O: Easy to drink with the low ABV as well as being tart and refreshing - a really great beer for the very hot day that today was here in NC. Enjoyable - I could easily have a couple of these.\xa01,229 charactersdbrauneis, Jun 15, 2018', '3.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.9%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5I really liked the apricot and blueberry before this gose was out. It’s a cloudy pinkish color. Somewhat cherry but a subtle sour flavor to it. Good for beginners in the gose world. Bought 3 cans at a local bottle shop. Would buy it again but it wasn’t a have to find again brew....\xa0286 charactersRC_Saunders, Jun 11, 2018']

name: Or It Gets The Gose Again (Cucumber)
review:
['4.23/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.2512 FL. OZ can
Served in a sour glass

This beer pours a brilliant golden color and is topped with a fleeting head that leaves no lacing. 

It has a briny cucumber aroma. 

The taste starts out with cucumber. Then I get some lime in the middle with a nice tart finish. A light salty flavor persists throughout the taste.

Medium to light bodies and slightly dry.

This beer is refreshing as hell. A great beer to have on hopefully the last miserably hot, humid day of the year.\xa0476 charactersbuschbeer, Sep 21, 2018', '4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4really unique beer here, even in the cucumber beer world, which now seems quite a lot larger than it was even just a few years ago. there are a few features of this that i absolutely love. one is the overall quality of the base beer, it may look a little mucky and still, but its not, its clean and refined and quite lively on the palate. it has a lot of pucker, more sour than many, but its mineral rich and bright with the salt in here, and it has a citrus note to the lacto, very nice. the low alcohol is another favorite feature, in a beer like this, i want to drink a lot of it when i feel like it, and this allows for it. still wheaty in flavor and feel, and not too thin and not too sour to enjoy in volume, even with all the acidity. the cucumber is very natural and very forward, no perfume to it at all, and sort of waxy and earthy like the peels more than the flesh, juicy though and very fresh tasting to me, refreshing, dry, and appealing. salted plenty, it has a savory vibe, and a really snappy finish. all of us around the table really thought this was a standout in its field, and this is something i would buy again if i could. it has major cocktail potential too!\xa01,182 charactersStonedTrippin, Oct 30, 2017', '4.78/5\xa0\xa0rDev +12.7%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 5 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.7512 oz pour at brewery. Then next day from growler. This batch is at 4%. Very turbid looking. True straw yellow color. White head fades to ring cap. cucumber dominates the nose. Wow is this tart, Extreamly sour and tart. I love it! The cucumber addition in my opinion is one of the best ingredients to add to a wild/sour style. In this case the cucumber is well ballenced to the saltyness. Nice lingering aftertaste that makes you want more. Oh and the full name of this masterpiece is "It puts the cucumber on its skin or it gets the Gose again". Don't Pass this up, a must try for any sour head. Bottle this please!\xa0621 charactersKensWorld, Sep 04, 2016']

name: The Veil / Omnipollo - Tefnut
review:
["4.53/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.8%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.516 oz can purchased at brewery.

L: Little to no white head with poor retention and no lacing. Beer is a thick, solid orange.

S: Apricot for days. My goodness. A bit of passionfruit sneaks in there. 

T: Follows nose and we are talking pure fruit smoothie with just a very hint of alcohol. Don't really pick up the normal Gose elements like coriander and saline but who cares?

F: Pretty full bodied with mild carbonation. Fruit taste really lingers on the palate. ABV dealt with nicely, perhaps even dangerously. It does pack a punch after 16 oz. Just really great. 

O: Man this is something special. Just a yummy thick apricot bomb. Reminds me a bit of the Berliner Miami Madness.\xa0684 charactersIvoryFoxhole, Aug 24, 2019", '4.94/5\xa0\xa0rDev +11%look: 5 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 5 | feel: 5 | overall: 5How in the world is this beer 11%? I’d swear it’s less than 5% the way it goes down with no booziness and super-clean finish. Rasberries dominate but no cloying sweetness at all, with the most mild touch of tart, malt and carb. Only thing I dinged this beer on from perfection was the aroma. Rasberries are for-front but there is that hint of sulfur in the background you get with Gose brews. Other than that (very minor) this beer is perfection IMO for a fruit forward brew.\xa0484 charactersbubseymour, Feb 22, 2019', "4.46/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5L: Had this beer on-tap at Growlers to Go - Short Pump, poured into a snifter glass. Had a blood red color and a thick, viscous consistency. There was a thin, off white, foamy head that quickly dissipated. Pretty good lacing.

S: A sweet and enticing aroma of raspberries, citrus fruit, malt, and sea salt.

T: Tasted of a mild bit of malt (mostly in the front), a bit of citrus fruit (lemon, for even more tartness), a giant heap of raspberries, and a pinch of sea salt. An extremely sweet, tart, and fruity flavor. It's dominated by the raspberries, but it still manages to work. Lively and quite delicious.

F: A fair amount of carbonation with a vibrant finish. Medium-bodied.

O: A wholly enjoyable beer. Drinkable.\xa0720 charactersavalon07, Feb 16, 2019"]

name: Chariot
review:
['3.56/5\xa0\xa0rDev -8.2%look: 3.5 | smell: 3 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Glowing pastel salmon with a thin, off-white chain on top, this tart Gose exhibits cherry with cinnamon much like cherry pie but, lightly so, with lactic sour notes and a dry finish.\xa0182 charactersSabtos, Sep 04, 2018', "4.04/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.1%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 412 ounce can, canned on 08/23/18. Served in a Ritterguts Gose glass, the beer pours a cloudy reddish/orange color with about an inch off-white head that stuck around a while. Good amount of lacing. Aroma is nice, the brew smells like tart cherries, salt and wheat/grainy malt. Taste is similar to the aroma, but there's also some vanilla, lime, grape skin and coriander flavors. Mouthfeel/body is medium, it's slick and a bit creamy with a moderate amount of carbonation. I thought this was a good overall brew. I probably should have bought a sixer instead of just a single can. I'll learn my lesson one day, because Urban Artifact is one of the best breweries in Ohio IMO. $2.29 a can.\xa0696 charactersbluejacket74, Sep 02, 2018", '4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.512 ounce can into tulip glass, no can dating. Pours moderately hazy/cloudy reddish orange color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense off white head with good retention, that reduces to a thin lace cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big juicy/tart/tangy cherries, fruit skin/pits, lemon, lime, green apple, red grape, vanilla, coriander, sea salt, almond, wheat, cracker, white bread, herbal, grass, light lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/acidic yeast, cherries, spices/salt, and moderate pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big juicy/tart/tangy cherries, fruit skin/pits, lemon, lime, green apple, red grape, vanilla, coriander, sea salt, almond, wheat, cracker, white bread, herbal, grass, light lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang, and light bitter/spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/tangy cherries, fruit skin/pits, lemon, lime, green apple, red grape, vanilla, coriander, sea salt, almond, wheat, cracker, white bread, herbal, grass, light lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, cherries, spices/salt, and moderate pale malt flavors; with an awesome malt/tartness and tangy fruit balance; with zero puckering flavors after the finish. Light-moderate increasing dryness from tartness and tangy fruit. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately bready/grainy/acidic/tangy/tannic, and lightly saline balanced mouthfeel that is fantastic. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.7%. Overall this is an outstanding fruited gose! All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, cherries, spices/salt, and moderate pale malt flavors; very smooth and extremely refreshing to drink with the mellowly acidic/tangy/tannic/drying finish. Vanilla is definitely more noticeable here than the key lime gose. Super jammy authentic tart cherry presence with balanced wheat malts/vanilla; not overly salty or lactic. A highly enjoyable offering, and spot on style example. Tastes like cherry pie as advertised.\xa02,260 characterssuperspak, Feb 10, 2018', '3.83/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75``Cherry Pie Gose'' brewed with 1500lbs of fresh tart cherries, 9lbs of sea salt, 60g of vanilla beans, and 1.25lb of coriander per 30BBL batch. Poured from a can into an Urban Artifact Thoroughbred tulip. If it were just about any other brewer, I'd expect this beer to be pale gold with a hint of pink, but knowing how much fruit Urban Artifact uses, I'm not surprised to see a beer so red that it could easily pass for a glass of juice. It doesn't have much head, but I don't consider that a flaw in a sour beer. The nose is rather faint and isn't quite as "cherry" as I was hoping for, but it does have some nice cherry, white wine, and apple juice notes and I even get some of the vanilla on the nose too.

Medium-light body with a sharp, tart flavor and a nice delicate feel. I get some tart wheat-like notes up front, then lemon, then I get a pretty good jolt of tart cherry right past mid-palate. It finishes very dry, leaving you salivating for another sip. Lemon and tart cherries linger.

These Gose beers from Urban Artifact are among my favorite everyday sours. They are tasty, refreshing, well-crafted, and represent tremendous value. I get excited when I visit the bottle shop and see a new beer from Urban Artifact that I haven't tried yet. It's a feeling I haven't experienced since I first got into craft beers several years ago and looked forward to trying each and every Three Floyds and Founders seasonal for the first time. Thank you Urban Artifact!\xa01,470 charactersdeadonhisfeet, Sep 28, 2017']

name: Sour Inc - Apple Rhubarb Gose
review:
['3.99/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.4%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Welcome to the first beer in my New Super Michigan Beer Bowl Sunday (Week 728)! Hang on, 'cause it's going to be a wild ride today. 

From the Bottle: "Apple*Tangy*Crisp"; "Proudly Brewed in Holland[,] Michigan".

I began by Pop!ping the cap & performing a slow, gentle C-Line pour. I was pleasantly surprised when it foamed up to form just over two fingers of dense, foamy, rocky, bone-white head with above-average retention that left nice lacing in its wake. Color was a gorgeous Golden-Amber (SRM = > 5, < 7) with NE-quality clarity, leading to a visit from The Gelt Gang of Croesus, Midas & Mammon, all hoping for a taste. Sour? Nose was certainly giving off a tanginess & when I leaned in for a sniff, I really got apple vinegar! Phew. My late Pops used to tell of a time, during his annual check-up, that he passed out. In being revived, the smelling salts melted & went up his nose, REALLY reviving him! This had a scent that was going to stick with me for a while. Phew. Mouthfeel was kinda thin & watery, but that is par for the style's course. The taste was both tart AND sour! First, my lips puckered from the tartness of the rhubarb but then I got a definite sourness in the hinges of my jaw! Once I got over the initial onslaught & the panic of not having taken my acid reflux meds, I was good. Actually, I had awakened due to pangs of GIRD & took a pill before beginning this beer. Boy howdy, the taste was like sour green apples & I'm not talking Granny Smiths. This was the sourness of underripe apples that will give you a tummyache. Tart, sour, apple vinegar with a hint of salt for good measure. Phew. This is way outta my comfort zone, which is why I generally eschew Tarts & Sours, but I can still appreciate them when they come my way. I liked the inclusion of both apples & rhubarb, an unusual combination as compared to strawberries & rhubarb. Finish was dry, almost vinous in a dry white wine way. Mymymy.\xa01,931 characterswoodychandler, Feb 03, 2019', "4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.7%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Gose, berlinerweiss, wild ale... as the lines between these popular sour ales continue to blur, many don't remember what the difference originally was or how to honor those flavors in the current craft beer market. But New Holland gravitate toward the reasonably sour, briny, wheaten origins that truly make gose unique, albeit with a fruity upgrade.

Foggy gold and topped with a rich cottony froth, the spirited Sour Inc (Apple Rhubarb Gose) leads with a citrusy, cidery, berry-like twang along with the brisk brine of sea air that drift along the nose. Light sweetness captures an essence of sourdough, saltwater taffy and gentle bready sweetness.

As the ale washes the middle palate, the omnipresent fruit flavors gain command of the tastebuds with the apple character bringing a strong taste of cider, white wine and agave. Underlying fruit flavors that are more natural to the ale support the apple with gooseberry, lime, lemon, passionfruit, yuzu and white grape. Deeper into taste the tangy red berry character of rhubarb shines with redcurrant, strawberry and cranberry. A rounded salinity decorates the late palate along with the sour earthiness of under ripened citrus, matcha tea and margarita.

Medium light in body but reasonably full for sour ale, the moderate attenuation of the beer allows a soft wheaten pillow of malt to continue to temper the effects of acidity from start to finish. a brief aftertaste of salt and sourdough outlasts the linger of fruit but barely while stripping the thirst with ease.\xa01,524 charactersBEERchitect, Oct 30, 2018", '3.67/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75Decent crisp gose samples on tap at Knickerbocker New Holland. Nice golden color with a little lingering head and very spotty lacing. Smells of tart apple and a little caramel, tastes similarly along with some smooth grain and malt. I don’t really taste the rhubarb although there is definitely a nice tartness that isn’t too mouth-puckering. Just a little too sweet for me. Smooth mild mouthfeel, great carbonation.\xa0420 charactersbeersampler6, Oct 11, 2018', '4.13/5\xa0\xa0rDev +10.1%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.512 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 8/2/2018. Pours slightly hazy pale golden yellow color with a 1-2 finger dense and rocky white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Thick soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of big sour/tart/tangy rhubarb, red/green apple, fruit skin, lemon, lime, orange, peach, pear, melon, berries, white wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/acidic yeast, apple, rhubarb, salt, and light-moderate pale/wheat malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big sour/tart/tangy rhubarb, red/green apple, fruit skin, lemon, lime, orange, peach, pear, melon, berries, white wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang, and light spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/tangy rhubarb, red/green apple, fruit skin, lemon, lime, orange, peach, pear, melon, berries, white wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, apple, rhubarb, salt, and light-moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; with an awesome malt/tartness and tangy fruit balance; with no puckering flavors after the finish. Moderately crisp/clean finishing. Light-moderate increasing dryness from tartness, tangy fruit, and carbonation. Medium-high carbonation, and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately bready/grainy/acidic/tangy/tannic, and lightly saline balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.5%. Overall this is an awesome gose! All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, apple, rhubarb, salt, and light-moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink with the modestly acidic/tangy/tannic/drying finish, not overly lactic or salty. Very flavorful and not watery for the ABV. Great balance of jammy rhubarb, apples, and Lacto complexity; with a nice pale/wheat malt backbone against acidity for the ABV. A really enjoyable offering, and spot on style example.\xa02,352 characterssuperspak, Sep 01, 2018']

name: Apricot Gose
review:
['3.94/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Orange in color and murky in complexion. There’s a fingernail of dishwater white around most of the rim and a third of the top. Apricots, peaches, and sea salt are in the nose. I’m tasting very aggressive apricots and sea salt. The mouth is highly salinic, crisp, and refreshing.\xa0287 charactersFranziskaner, Jul 06, 2019', '3.96/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Candied apricot, haribo peach gummies, lime and salt. Wheat malt undertones. Light, crisp and drinkable. Lots of flavor for a sub 5% brew. Not too sweet. Weldwerks makes very good beers.\xa0186 charactersDavepoolesque, Feb 22, 2018', '4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.8%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Appearance: Pours a hazy honey color capped by a modest head; spotty lacing

Smell: Apricot tones with a lactic sour edge

Taste: Wheat bread and lactic apricot flavors at the outset; a bit funky, through the middle, with a salty finish

Mouthfeel: Medium body with moderate carbonation

Overall: My first beer from this brewery and I am quite impressed; very refreshing\xa0376 charactersbrentk56, Dec 06, 2016', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4great beer right here. these guys are becoming one of the stronger operations around. the apricot here is equally pungent, but far more authentic than the cherry edition of it, and the sourness comes through a little more, not so sweet despite still being extremely fruit. i dig that complexion a lot. clearish for the style, a little orangey, but pretty clean looking. aroma is great, fresh apricots, super ripe, with a nice dry tang from the lacto, not sharp, but pretty intense. the fruit is there the whole way through, more apricot than i have seen in other beers like this, and ultimately a very satisfying late summer beer that screams for funky cheese and crusty bread, maybe even some pickles of various kinds, some nuts, its a picnic platter type of beer, drinkable forever, but also satisfying in small doses too. carbonation is just a little less than i like, but the acidity helps make it feel alive. these guys are doing some great stuff and their sours are catching up to their hoppy beers in terms of overall awesomeness. pretty stoked on the whole portfolio right now...\xa01,087 charactersStonedTrippin, Sep 10, 2016', '3.37/5\xa0\xa0rDev -14.9%look: 4 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.2532 oz. crowler. Clear pale golden. Smells of wheat, light acidity, and the faintest bit of apricot. Tastes of wheat, light tartness, some apricot. Definitely more than I got from the nose, Coriander and a slight salty finish. Light body with low carbonation. Kinda meh, even with the apricot.\xa0300 charactersAlieniloquium, Aug 16, 2016']

name: Duplicitous
review:
['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.8%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4This beer was very light coloured, with a nice white head. Quite sour to my taste, but with good citrous flavour. However, the sour taste was overpowering, and not what I was expecting, considering a recently tried kettle soured Berliner Weisse beer. Not something I would buy again.\xa0287 charactersLarryfunnell, Apr 03, 2019', '3.68/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.4%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75473 ml can served cold into a pint glass. An LCBO purchase for about $3.35 CDN. Canned September 5, 2018.

Appearance - mildly hazy golden coloured beer. Two fingers of fluffy white head with good staying power and some sparse lacing left at the brim of the glass.

Smell - leafy and weedy hops with lemon. Not a lot else, but simplicity is king here.

Taste - tart and sour with lemon and lime being the stars. Leafy hops fill in the gaps. Pretty well rounded with some salt for good measure. Hints of wheat throughout, with a touch of gym socks.

Mouthfeel - light bodied, astringent on the tongue with a salty finish. Carbonation is fairly light. A certain creaminess in the body due to the wheat.

Overall - a pretty solid gose, that is worth trying. One of the better ones. Not as tropical as expected with the citra hops.\xa0828 characterstaxandbeerguy, Sep 22, 2018', "3.73/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75This one falls down on taste for me. It looks and smells great. On the nose I can really pick up the Citra, but then it was gone. What I mean is it didn't really translate well to the flavor. It's a good sour flavor, but I expected more from the Citra hopping. It just didn't translate. Feel was alright, perhaps a little lighter than expected, acidic finish which to mean means it is a little off balance. 

A good beer,but it just lacked what was promised in the Citra.\xa0473 characterspolloenfuego, Aug 19, 2018", "4.13/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5473 mL can from the LCBO; dated Jun 29 2018 and served slightly chilled.

Pours a hazy, pale straw-yellow colour, with one finger of smooth white foam settling atop initially; this layer dissipates within a matter of minutes, quickly being reduced to a collar of creamy-looking foam surrounding a thin cap. A few patches of lace have also been scattered about; looks pretty good to me. The aroma does include hints of lemon acidity, gritty wheat grains and brininess, but beyond that it's Citra hops all the way, which in this instance mostly impart notes of lime, berries and indeterminate tropical fruit.

A nice little light brew that blends together sour, salty, and fruity flavours quite deftly. Lemon and lime come through right off the bat, followed up by hints of honeydew melon and passion fruit; these fruitier aspects are underlain throughout the sip by a backbone of grainy wheat malts and persistent sea saltiness. The coriander spice finally makes its appearance on the back end, which also features a short-lived, mild lactic acidity that leads into a salty-sour finish; shades of citrus acidity linger on into the aftertaste. Light in body, with moderate-to-assertive carbonation levels that agitate the tongue continuously. Feels crisp and refreshing to gulp back.

Final Grade: 4.13, an A-. Nickel Brook's Duplicitous Dry-Hopped Gose is a quality soured ale, with the Citra dry-hopping treatment proving to be a fantastic complement to the base beer's acidity and sea saltiness. I didn't find this one to be overtly, puckeringly sour - the hops, sea salt, coriander and wheat malts all help to distract and dilute the effects of the lactic acid - but I suppose folks new to the sour beer scene might well disagree. I liked this beer quite a bit, and will be returning to it a few more times while it remains available.\xa01,836 charactersthehyperduck, Aug 15, 2018", '4.16/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.9%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Pale yellow and cloudy, with a slight green tint. Citrusy and vegetal aroma. A little bit of malty sweetness balances out the sourness, and the hops nicely fill in the flavour, avoiding the "sweatiness" of some goses while still staying in the background compared to the tart and malty flavours. Biscuity finish.\xa0312 charactersSenorBiggles, Jun 11, 2017', '3.83/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Light haze, pours a little head, sows some lace.

Lemon aroma, light sour dough, bit of yogurt.

Taste echoes the aroma, with a pleasant tartness and a bit of crackers.

Light body, hint of acidity, crisp finish.\xa0212 charactersDerek, Oct 16, 2016']

name: Gibraltar Gose
review:
['1.93/5\xa0\xa0rDev -51.6%look: 1.5 | smell: 2.25 | taste: 2.25 | feel: 2 | overall: 1In what world is a gose supposed to come out like a rank milkshake of beer such as this? That this is acceptable to the brewer is baffling, even more so to the customer.\xa0169 charactersbreadwinner, May 01, 2015', "3.98/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.3%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4I'm not a sour guy and really didn't like this at all. I rated it at what it's average score was at the time I reviewed because I don't think it's fair to slam it when I can't stand the category.

Tickers gonna tick\xa0216 charactersazdback, Feb 11, 2015", "1/5\xa0\xa0rDev -74.9%Loaded with diacetyl and baby diaper enterics. Second time I've had this beer and it was way worse the first time (riddled with baby diaper, so much so that even my non beer drinking father thought is was awful).

This beer needs some serious process development.\xa0263 charactersIrrenarzt, Sep 29, 2014", '4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.5%On draft at AZ Wilderness.

Hazy yellow body with a thin, wispy collar. Huge funk aroma, with lemon juice, light spice, sea salt. Light in body and refreshing, despite the intense sourness and aggressiveness. Well done indeed. AZW is doing some nice work.\xa0255 charactersHuhzubendah, Sep 14, 2014', "4.39/5\xa0\xa0rDev +10%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.5A great part of the starting lineup at Wilderness, the Gose is exactlty what I want in a lightly sour beer. Excellent drinkability with flavor and tartness to match.

A- A super clear gold, nice bubbles and good lacing.

S- Smellls of funk and fermented fruit. 

T- Taste smooth as F***, makes you think about chugging down the entire glass in one go. Sour with a light sweetness, seems like it was made from apples with an almost cidery flavor.

M- Thin, light, refreshing, tightens the mouth in a good way.

O- A very happy, drink on a sunny day type beer. Great beer for having a few, helps lift flavor profiles of other beers after it. If it's available you should at least get a taster will most certainly be worth your effort.\xa0732 charactersCrimtor, Jul 03, 2014"]

name: A Little Golden Gem
review:
["3.81/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.6%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Bottle Date: within the past few months
Palate Contaminants: none

Appearance is either dark straw or light gold. Not much head at all.

Smell is tangy citrus, including of course kumquat. It really reminds me of Five Alive. Man, I hadn't thought of that drink in more than a decade.

Sour and salt hit right away. Then mellow malt and bitter citrus take over, with the salt mostly lingering. As much as kumquats, lime. (Maybe I should use this as a tequila chaser.) There's some butter present, too. It's a really interesting combination of things.

Feel is lightly fizzy with a thin body. That salt still lingers.

Maybe it's not what one should grab unless one is in the mood, but it is good nonetheless.\xa0707 charactersZythophile, Jun 22, 2016", "4.14/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5Let this warm a bit, it actually mellows. Very unique, very interesting beer, even for a gose. The kumquat pops up in the aroma and flavor, but blends much more naturally than most citrus beer. Like you might not guess fruit was added. It's tangy and light, but with a big satisfying finish. It's juicy and thirst-quenching, but not sweet. The salt doesn't stand out (as it shouldn't) but add a savory edge.\xa0407 characterstempest, Mar 14, 2016", '4.24/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.9%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4I tried this on tap at Bluejacket, served chilled in a snifter.

the color is apropos with golden color and light haze with almost no head a ring of white beads collects. The smell is great -very tart lemony with subtle mineral odor. The feel is great -lactic tanginess with light body and slight dry finish.

The flavor is so good -the best beer I tried perhaps at Bluejacket -citrus and sour tangy tropical fruit with lactic tart flavor -that sort of sweet/sour kumquat quality is there with tropical fruity taste and dry element of salt in the finish. This is wonderful, easy to drink and very true to style with some extra flavor in the mix from the citrus\xa0660 charactersSlatetank, Feb 10, 2016']

name: Triple Seesaw: Raspberry
review:
['4.54/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.1%look: 4.75 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.5Dated 4/10/19 on the bottom of the can, two months since brewing.

Pours a completely opaque, gorgeous, deep burgundy with a finger of puffy dark pink head, beautiful. Nose is bursting with fresh raspberries; notes of bing cherries, lactic acid and a hint of wheat. Full on raspberry preserves. Taste follows the noses exactly with a small punch of sourness, lacto and a bit of water nerd minerality. Wonderful medium+ body for a 4.5% brew with a prickly effervescent carbonation. Medium- tartness. Absolutely perfect and thirst quenching for a hot summer day. I wish I picked up more of this one, truly a great beer!\xa0617 charactersBlackrobe, Jun 13, 2019', "4.56/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.6%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Good lord... of a gose, this I do not expect.

There's so much thick fruitiness to this beer that I'm not picking up much, if any, of the typical fruity elements to be expected of a gose. There's a good bit of tartness, but it's not particularly sour. So much fruit.

This is really excellent.\xa0293 charactersVidblain, Jun 10, 2019", '4.44/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.1%look: 4.75 | smell: 5 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 4.5Drank from a 1 pint can purchased at Trillium Brewing Company, Canton, MA
Canned on 04/10/19
Served in a tulip

Gorgeous appearance. The completely opaque, oxblood colored body was topped by a larger bubbled, light crimson crown that quickly dissolved. A thin collar encircled the liquid. No lacing whatsoever.

The nose was pure raspberry goodness. Freshly puréed raspberries came to mind. Nice jammy sweetness. Perfect in its simplicity.

The flavor profile was also very raspberry forward but not to the degree of the aroma. Big raspberry presence up front. Tart, slightly underripe raspberries came to mind. Loads of lemony sourness in the center. Moderately acidic. Touch of brackish salinity. More underripe raspberry and tartness on the back end and the finish. Some berry seed-like bitterness and acidity lingered after the swallow.

The beer was medium bodied for the style and contained a larger bubbled, fairly prickly effervescence. Really fluffy on the palate. A touch airy perhaps.

Trillium have been releasing some amazing fruited goses lately, and this Raspberry Triple Seesaw variant was one of their better ones to date. With the warm weather arriving, I look forward to enjoying more beers of this style.\xa01,225 charactersDamian, May 30, 2019', '4.47/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.4%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.5Thick and dense looking like a raspberry fruit shake. Reddish-pink, tall, flaky head. Straight raspberry juice. Natural berry flavor with a flare of lactic acid funk. Full mouthfeel which I love.\xa0195 charactersTheGent, May 13, 2019', '4.13/5\xa0\xa0rDev -8%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Pours red/purple color with a 2 finger thick pink foamy head that was packed with bubbles, dissipating slowly and leaving basically zero lacing. Smells of wheat, grains, raspberries, green apple, mineral water, fruit punch, salt and wet cardboard. Tastes basically like it smells, with raspberries, tart berries, wheat, grains, mineral water, fruit punch, salt, earthy notes that resemble paper, strawberry jam and wet cardboard. The fruity notes are quite tasty and help make this easy to drink.\xa0496 charactersCHickman, May 10, 2019']

name: Rose Gose
review:
['4.4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +18.9%look: 4 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4.5Clear vibrant gold colour. Smells like rosé, white grape, lilac, and a lil sweet and a lil floral. Crisp and light, delicate refreshing flavours throughout. A little tart upfront and hint of salt, with a semidry rosé body and dry palate finish. Great on a hot day, easy to drink.\xa0283 charactersNilocRellim, Aug 20, 2017', '3.74/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.1%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75From a bottle, pours a slight haze dark gold color with a bit of head then it just goes dead still.

The nose is very floral, perfume, earthy, dried fruit, a little lemon. The flavor is also very earthy and floral, a little acidic, salt, cracked pepper, reminds me of a white wine that is starting to turn. Tart, but clean finish.

Overall, this is pretty good. Not top tier, but good.\xa0388 charactersnmann08, Mar 18, 2015', '3.53/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.6%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Yellow body, slight haze, thin white cap. Aromas of floral notes, tart citrus. Mineral water, earth, floral notes, cracked pepper, a touch of white wine. Light in body with low carbonation. Decent.\xa0197 charactersHuhzubendah, Mar 17, 2015', '3.67/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.8%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75From a bomber into a tullip

A: clear rosy peach with a thin crown of white that quickly subsides; carbonation is okay, but not quite what I expected
S: some seaweed, some faint muskiness, some soft rosy floral notes, the promise of some tart and sour orchard fruits
T: identifiable with the nose: some very mildly salty and sour notes, but the lactic is balanced with a soft flowery perfumey sweetness. Some vineger and mineral notes, but fairly subtle. Not sure that everything hangs together as well as it might, but it is refreshing and enjoyable; moderately sour.
M: Good little pucker, sits on the tongue very nicely, light and refreshing\xa0647 charactersTaybeh, Feb 13, 2015', '3.78/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.2%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 4This beer was served on tap at Minneapolis Town Hall Brewery in Minneapolis, Minnesota. It arrived in a tasting pint, showing a white zinfandel coloring. A frothy, soapy one finger head of white bubbles showed decent retention, and left soft cratered lacing around the glass as it dissipated. No haze or sediment was noted, and carbonation appeared to be active. The nose opened with heavy plastic phenols, cold salt lick, green grassy hops, rose and lilac wet leafiness, pale and wheaty malts, mildly funky metallic yeastiness, rainbow sherbet, sake booziness, white rice, under ripe green pears, cotton candy phenols, vegetal seaweed, dusty drywall, and wet cotton. The following flavor included chlorine chemical zing, soured lemon juiciness, wet wheat, oily hazelnut, raw sourdough dough, plastic and chemical phenols, glass, glue, tart lacto fermentation, acetone, sake, cardboard, soured ginger root, wet and watery celery, white wine vinegar, pale malt dust, nickel, acrylic paint, and ball point pen inkiness. The body was lighter, and carbonation was high, but soft. Wet slurp and smack came atop creamy frothiness, and tight finishing pop. This bled into a high puck, with the mouth left crisply superdried. The abv was appropriate, and the beer drank easily.

Overall, this beer showed excellent sourness and boldness, offering up an ultimately fresh, yet classic, representation of the style. This remained true, with the tartness and saltiness actually curbed and softened by the rosy floral inclusions. This, coupled with the effervescent carbonation made it seem almost like drinking a light, sour version of party champagne. We would definitely toast with this at midnight on New Year’s Eve!! This was the last beer we drank on our final trip to Minneapolis Town Hall Brewery, and felt it to be a nice departing uniqueness from them. Always great to try to get exposed to more examples of these goofier, rarer styles in the states. Keep bringing it Minnesota!!\xa01,993 charactersTheBrewo, Feb 10, 2015', "2.88/5\xa0\xa0rDev -22.2%look: 4 | smell: 2.25 | taste: 3 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 2.75Cheers to the new dad, Steasy66. Worst fears realized with you reproducing, but at least you send me beer.

A. Pours gold with a touch of peachy-ping and half a finger of white head that fades to a collar.

S. Sweet floral notes, like in a powdery icing sugar kind of way. A touch of chlorine and a light frutiness. Hmmmm. Not as bad as the coupage, but not great.

T. Decent sourness, minerals and a touch of that chlorine from the nose, light floral notes, some tart orchard fruits.

M. Light body, medium carbonation.

O. Not sure what makes that chlorine-like smell in some kettle soured beers, but I'm not a fan.\xa0617 charactersRutager, Feb 09, 2015"]

name: Newburgh Black Oyster Cult
review: ['4.37/5\xa0\xa0rDev +20.7%look: 4 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25This is basically a gose x oyster stout. The pairing of the two is natural. Pours a dark brown with some garnet highlights and a medium brown head. Slight roast astringency, a little coffee, coriander spicing, and mild briny quality on deep inhale. Tastes of salt, brine. Brightened by strong citrus component. Tart grapefruit and grape musk. Foamy effervescence medium body. Overall impression is of a slightly savory gose.\xa0429 charactersorcrist_cleaver, Feb 07, 2015']

name: Imperial Hose
review:
['4.53/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.1%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.75Received in a trade, shared with JLindros.

A - Poured into a Kate the Great tulip a nice hazy dark golden hue with a fat two finger head that fades to leave dense lacing and creamy blanket.

S - Aromas of nice citrus hops, light tartness, nice almost stone fruit like aroma in the forefront. Rather yeasty finish.

T - Taste is similar to the nose, huge tart fruity notes, great acidity. Very nice fruity elements, citrus, light tropical notes. The salinity is almost non-existent. Still, rather flavorful.

M - Mouthfeel is nicely carbonated, crisp, little flemmy.

O - Overall this was a very solid gose. Really nice hop contribution and house yeast. Nicely done!

Serving Type: bottle\xa0688 charactersrudzud, Dec 03, 2017', '4.43/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.8%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Thanks to rudzud
Huge fluffy head 2.5 finger, nice fluffy lacing, hazy almost murky darker orange color

Nose loads with peach, fresh peach and stone fruit, little fluffy creamy wheat, grassy floral hop, little citrus, juicy fruit

Taste fairly tart, big stone fruit, juicy sour peach, apricot juice, little flemmy tart acidic but sour unripe peach acidity, little oak barrel notes, into grassy floral hops, little lemony, no coriander or salt though, flemmy finish

Mouth is med bod very tart acidity, fluffy carb

Overall an interesting tasty beer but hard to call a gose, still nice beer\xa0590 charactersjlindros, Dec 03, 2017', "4.24/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.6%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25The only reason this is not scoring higher is because there isn't too much that resembles a classic Gose. There is some salinity, but for the most part, this is just an exceptional wild ale. Nice and tart, somewhat enamel stripping, but with a soft and sweet Biere de Garde like finish. Cheers!\xa0297 charactersLingenbrau, Jul 12, 2017"]

name: 72 Stretch
review:
['4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +10.1%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25L: brilliant gold in the glass filled with streams of rapidly rising bubbles under a 1" pure white foam cap with fair to good retention

S: smells like wheat bread dough with a touch of lemon and a very faint hint of funk

T: starting lemony tart with some wheat to soften the edges. It has a trace of hard candy sweetness that works nicely with the coriander which you can find if you look for it. The salt is also apparent but it is not over done

F: The beer is light and very creamy and highly effervescent.

O: This is not a challenging Gose but it is a very drinkable and refreshing one.\xa0593 characterspat61, Oct 09, 2017', '3.69/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.4%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Pours a clear golden color. Minimal white head. Light somewhat wheat nose. Taste is interesting. Wheaty. Tart. Actually, fairly creamy feeling, and full bodied. Delicious gose.\xa0176 charactersVictory_Sabre1973, Oct 08, 2017', '4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4This beer pours a beige tinted golf with a smallish head. The aroma features rich wheat cracker malts, strong salt, orange peel, coriander, cumin, and other savory spices. The flavor is moderately sour, with a huge does of salt, big biscuity malts, a decent amount of malt sweetness is also present, with powerful coriander and orange peel flavors. The mouthfeel is medium bodied with fairly strong fizzy carbonation. Overall this is unique in that it is an un-messed-about-with gose - with moderate sourness and stronger salinity, it hits what this style was supposed to, and in doing so provides a much more drinkable, curious beer.\xa0634 charactersCzequershuus, Sep 30, 2017', '3.96/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.6%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 4Has improved as it warms up. Initially with a cold temp the details were not noticeable. The salt and coriander appear in time mostly in the flavor although even with warming the aroma still stays Limited. In time the coriander in the wheat appear in the aroma. Slightly cloudy weed looking ale with a very small head. Moderately like field with moderate carbonation but a bit of a Tang hangs on the tongue from the salt & acidity. Also fairly dry. 
Pleasing especially as it warms up in opens up.\xa0499 charactersgarymuchow, Aug 11, 2017', "4.28/5\xa0\xa0rDev +10.9%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Tallboy into a weizen glass. Pours a slightly hazy yellow with a decent white head, lots of bubbles in the glass. Very little retention or lacing on the head. Smell has a strong, sharp wheat base with citrus-y notes and a generally sour character. The smell stays strong even once the head has dissipated, which is impressive. Tastes of lemon, coriander, and a slight malty backbone. There's a definite sweetness to it as well. Mouthfeel is light to medium bodied with a good amount of carbonation, with a slightly dry and bitter finish. This is refreshing, complex, and juicy to no end, and a great summertime beer.\xa0617 charactersipeters1017, Aug 08, 2017", "3.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev -9.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5This is an interesting take on a Gose. It has a typical wheat base with light flourishes of coriander and salt. But is uses lemon and lime zest to impart a light tartness, which is nice but doesn't rival a traditional Gose.\xa0223 charactersbsp77, Jul 28, 2017", '3.71/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.9%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75Poured out a cloudy, golden-yellow color with a small, white head of foam. It smelled of lemon, a light toasty caramel. Tart lemon with a hint of salt. Slight caramel sweetness.\xa0177 characterszeff80, Jul 14, 2017']

name: Gose
review:
['3.47/5\xa0\xa0rDev -16%look: 4 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Pours a hazed light straw color with white head. The aroma is grainy, lightly sour with bread and hay. In the taste, restrained tartness, malt sugar, a bit savory from the inclusion of salt but not really salty. A hint of lemon lime, little hop flavor or bitterness. Slight mineral aspect. Light bodied ale with a low-medium carbonation. Overall this is a decent Gose, has the characteristics but could stand out more.\xa0418 charactersStinkypuss, Aug 08, 2014', '3.51/5\xa0\xa0rDev -15%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 3 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Thanks to Tommyguz for hooking me up with a growler of this. Poured into a matching Voodoo teku, the brew appears a hazy golden yellow color with a firm white topping that leaves sudsy stringy lacing.

The aroma consists of lemon/coriander with a bit of lactic aspect. Also present is some mineral aspect. The nose is quite nice, albeit simple and to the point without fault.

The taste is lemony and like a saline solution mixed with soap and minerals. A very awkward arrangement even by gose standards. The more I try and focus on the enjoyable aspects, the more the soapiness comes out and distracts from the overall experience.

This is a light bodied brew with a moderate to light amount of carbonation. This is a brew id kill if I had a sore throat but otherwise I wasnt digging this and thats hard for me to say because im a big fan of this brewery. The soapiness is strange. Not bad for a first attempt at the style but it needs to get rid of that soapiness.\xa0966 charactersstakem, Aug 04, 2014']

name: J. Wakefield / Bellwoods - 6IX Days In Dade
review: ['4.31/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.1%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Collaboration with Bellwoods. Super fruity, the guava and peach are both strong and lovely. Salt is noticeable but not too strong. Nicely tart, with the lactose providing a creamy sweetness.\xa0191 charactersjrenihan, Sep 30, 2017', '4.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.7%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5On tap at Beavertown Extravaganza. Aroma is fresh, lemony, briney with lactic notes and fresh pears. Taste is astringent, lemony with quince notes, unripe pears and candied lemon. Really nice, fruity and dry gose.\xa0213 charactersCiocanelu, Sep 20, 2017']

name: Pina Peno
review:
['4.3/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.6%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Golden mimosa color; the head is loose, foamy, and short-lived. Biting mango-melon rind on a salted margarita glass. The aroma of nearby Mexican BBQ wafts through: chili-sugar dry rub along with grilled and caramelized pineapple. The taste is pungent and slightly funky sour like a chili-dusted Tamarindo candy stick. Sweet and sour--pineapple and pome-- tropical fruit along with slight salt brine of sea air. A bit tingly feel to start, and very effervescent although a bit lacking carbonation. Creamy, saline and light bodied. This beer is definitely for a day at the beach.\xa0577 charactersorcrist_cleaver, Sep 20, 2018', '4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.4%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Moderate pour yields a 1/2 inch slightly off white head over a pineapple yellow body with scant lacing. Straight up Gose on the nose. Taste is where this shines, with the perfect conjunction of flavors from its ingredients: pineapple, jalapenos, and sea salt. Pineapple first, then the spice comes along, and then a slight salty finish. Nice feel and overall, this would pair famously with my Friday night salmon feast or even oysters on the half shell. Cheers to the guys from Winooski, VT!\xa0491 charactersbobv, Jul 29, 2018', '4.44/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5god this is delicious ... tastes like grilled pineapple sprinkled with a cayenne pepper or some kind of jalapeno salt. so odd and delicious, very well executed in that it brings the intended flavors but the spice has no burn and is in no way harsh, very well integrated.\xa0270 charactersHyptochrons, Jun 09, 2018', "3.76/5\xa0\xa0rDev -8.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.75Can to stange, the appearance had a transparent golden color with a two finger white foamy head that slid off at a fair pace. Some lace wisped out in strings.
The aroma had the pineapple and jalapeno up front, and the more it warmed the more the jalapeno started exhibiting it's strength a lot more. Saltiness was exceptionally light in this beer. Sweet and sour-ed wheat is there but pretty light.
The flavor was moderately spicy and allowed some sweetness from the pineapple and wheat. Jalapeno strong aftertaste with some pineapple.
The mouthfeel was between light and medium bodied with a fair sessionability about it. Carbonation felt fine. ABV felt fine fine.
Overall, pretty nice Gose to me even if the saltiness was a bit tamer than the style. Good job, Brian and company, I'd give this one another go.\xa0817 charactersLone_Freighter, May 26, 2018", "4.82/5\xa0\xa0rDev +17.3%look: 5 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 5Brewed with pineapple, jalapeno and sea salt. White hue with thin head into my glass. Spicy, tangy in the nose with pineapple. I'm in love here. The spiciness hits all the right notes and that's amplified with the sea salt and pineapple. It's wonderful. Get it while it's still available.\xa0288 charactersBrad007, May 13, 2018"]

name: Tropical Storm
review:
['3.96/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.4%look: 3.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Liquid Riot Tropical Storm
4.8% ABV "Sour wheat beer with loads of tropical fruit"

Poured from pint can to tulip at cool cellar temp. 

Pours a mostly clear burned pale golden color, with a touch of cloudiness. One finger of white head that quickly dissipates into nothing, not even a film. Poor, spotty lacing eventually makes its way down the glass.

On the nose, I get tart wheat and grain, huge passionfruit right up front, with aromas of guava, pineapple, tropical fruit salad, and maybe a faint touch of rose. A very subtle something that reminds me perhaps of grenadine.

Palate is tart wheat and pale grain with the same heavy passionfruit from the nose. The nose really tells you what you're in for. Same guava and pineapple notes, with vague assorted tropical fruits. The pineapple isn't a hoppy pineapple, it's legitimate ripe pineapple. Maybe a ripe strawberry touch, as well? Cherry? It's that same "grenadine" note I mentioned. There's also a nice minerally flavor with a faint salinity that really makes me want to call this a Gose. I'm going to say this is technically a Gose. The slightest wisp of bitterness, I'd say an IBU level of maybe 10. It's nice. Very enjoyable flavor profile.

Mouthful is light and crisp. Medium carbonation feels perfect for the style. Extremely drinkable and refreshing. It's definitely tart, but it's not puckeringly sour. I wouldn't even use the word sour for this one. It's enjoyably tart.

Overall, I enjoyed this one very much. It's nothing groundbreaking, and it didn't *blow my mind*, but I would say "exceptional" is an appropriate descriptor. It deserves it. It's great for a low ABV, highly refreshing, very tasty Gose, for when you want exactly that - something you can drink when you're thirsty and thoroughly enjoy, and get away with responsibly drinking a couple of them. I will buy this again.\xa01,855 charactersSierraNevallagash, Oct 07, 2018', '3.87/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.6%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4.25It is a murky, orangish gold color. Kind of like an pineapple-orange juice mix. Pretty big fluffy white head. 

Smells pretty sour when cold, but as it warms that diminishes. Lots of tropical fruit, and a little bit of salt water taffy.

A big blast of passionfruit. Almost tastes like grenadine does in a mixed drink with some cherry mixed in there. Also some pineapple and kiwi. A little bit of tartness, and a lot of lingering grain. Especially as it warms. 

Tasty beer, and easy to drink. Overall I really enjoyed it. Would love to have some on the beach. That being said, objectively/technically, it is a little heavy on the fruitiness and could probably be a little crisper\xa0681 charactersWesMantooth, Sep 30, 2016', "4.18/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25If it didn't start off with a fluffy white head, I would say this beer looks like a glass of orange juice.
Lots of tropical fruit in the aroma.
Guava, mango, and pineapple taste. A touch of lime. Nicely tart.
Tangy, light mouthfeel.
