The odd note found in the aroma is not present, thankfully, although there is still some minor saltiness. Light-medium in body and crisp with a fine-bubbled, gently effervescent carbonation. Refreshing, and funky with a little bit of complexity, but for me hindered by the aroma.\xa0884 charactersNeroFiddled, Jun 24, 2017', "4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.2512 oz pour at The Veil.

L: Hazy golden bronze. Small head, not much retention, a bit of lacing and a ring.

S: Lots of guava, a bit of coriander, wheat malt, and a bit of sea brine.

T: Slightly tart guava and a little bit of wheat malt until midpalate. Brine is present but wisely understated. Honestly tastes more like a true Gose than some of the others in the Never line.

F: Light to medium bodied, pretty aggressively carbonated so bitterness doesn't linger. Crisp and refreshing; well-constructed and balanced.

O: Very nice addition to the Never line.\xa0560 charactersIvoryFoxhole, Jun 10, 2017", "4.02/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.4%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Pink hue, minimal lacing, the aroma and flavor of guava dominate the tart and salt. One of the better gose's I've had from their series and probably overall\xa0157 charactersVeganUndead, Jun 07, 2017"]

name: Mango Gose
review:
['3.96/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Aroma is very lactic forward, with hints of coriander, wheat, and salt. Not much mango. 

Flavor is more mango prominent, with a tartness and light sweetness accenting. Still lactic dominant, with a touch of coriander and wheat at the finish.\xa0242 charactersbarczar, Feb 22, 2017', '3.84/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.3%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.7512 oz can. Pours super hazy orange with thick fizzy head, fades leaving little to no lacing. Fruity n tart aroma and taste. Juicy mango and orange dominate, tart comes in late with salty finish. Odd having a gose this juicy, but pretty good overall.\xa0253 charactersNolaHopHead, Dec 23, 2016', '4.27/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9.8%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Appearance - The mango seems to have given the beer a darker straw color. The head was bright white. 

Smell - Mango reall jumps out in a big way with a sour profile. 

Taste - Oh this is good! The mango is like candy. The leanings are toward a pleasant sour profile with a nice saltiness. The balance between sweet and salty is there. 

Mouthfeel- The carbonation works for the style. It helps create the overall profile. 

Overall - I am reviewing the second batch. Clearly, it is am improvement over the first batch based on the reviews.\xa0540 charactersJohnnyHopps, Nov 27, 2016', "3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.6%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Poured into a Wicked Weed snifter. No freshness date.

A- Pours a hazy orangeish medium amber color with a 1/4 inch off-white head that soon dissipates to nothing. No lacing to speak of.

S- Lactic acid, a bit of booze and some sweetish mango.

T- Mild tartness gives way to bright mango and a wheat-y finish. Very drinkable and pretty refreshing.

M- Slight pucker with medium carbonation and a light body.

O- I'm not a big Gose guy but, for what it is, it's pretty good.\xa0477 charactersImmortale25, Oct 05, 2016", '3.83/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Hits the salty, sour notes, but there is a slight astringency that makes this a bit difficult to drink. The mango is subtle, but there. Solid Gose, but misses on a couple of marks for me.\xa0187 charactersJMUbrewz, Sep 13, 2016', "4.02/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.3%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 412 oz can was poured into a sniffer.

Appearance: A two finger head was poured that reduced to nothing quickly. It is a hazy orange yellow color with no clarity or vision of anything.

Smell: Sour notes, wheaty, bready, and light mango.

Taste: Definitely getting those traditional tart, sour, salty, wheaty, and bready notes. Nice magpie flavor that doesn't overpower the beer too. Some chewy notes also.

Mouthfeel: Light bodied, tart, chewy, saltiness, and medium carbonation. 

Overall: Nice gose with complimentary mango flavor to offset the saltiness of this style of beer. Looking forward to the next can I have in the fridge.\xa0642 charactersFlounder57, Aug 23, 2016", '4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.4%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 412 oz can into 18th Street snifter

A: Hazy cloudy orange yellow, looks like fruit juice
S: Salt, tart, light wheat, mango, generic tropical fruit juice
T: Mango, tart, balanced salt, wheat, hint of coriander
M: A little creamy than most commercial examples of gose
O: The mango definitely balances out the usual tartness nicely\xa0333 charactersRimbimhoot, Aug 15, 2016']

name: Ottermelon Gose
review:
['4.22/5\xa0\xa0rDev +10.2%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25A - Pale golden body, clear, with minimal head, no real lacing to speak of.

S - Strong hit of funk and sour.

T - Opens with strong lactic sour, then the watermelon rolls in, followed by a salty note, fading into saltine malts, and a sudden close.

M - Brisk and prickly, but pretty mild and light all told.

O - Delicious and fun. The flavor experience is a real ride.\xa0371 charactersTsar_Riga, Nov 22, 2018', '3.9/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.8%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.516 ounce can into tulip glass, canned on 9/6/2018. Pours lightly hazy pale golden/straw color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with great retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big juicy/lightly tart/tangy watermelon, cucumber, fruit skin, lemon, lime, pear, melon, red/green apple, white wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, light lacto/musty funk, and yeast earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, watermelons, and moderate pale/wheat malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big juicy/lightly tart/tangy watermelon, cucumber, fruit skin, lemon, lime, pear, melon, red/green apple, white wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, light lacto/musty funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tart/sourness, and light fruit tang on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/sour watermelon, cucumber, fruit skin, lemon, lime, pear, melon, red/green apple, white wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, light lacto/musty funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Great complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, watermelons, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; with a great malt/tart/sourness and tangy fruit balance; with no puckering flavors after the finish. Moderately crisp/clean finishing. Light-moderate increasing dryness from tart/sourness and tangy fruit. Medium-plus carbonation and light body; with a very smooth, moderately grainy/acidic, and lightly tangy/saline balanced mouthfeel that is nice. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 3.5%. Overall this is a delicious fruited gose. All around nice complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, watermelons, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and pretty refreshing to drink with the modestly acidic/tangy/drying finish; not overly lactic or salty. Very flavorful and not watery for the ABV. Great balance of authentic watermelons and Brett/Lacto complexity; with a solid pale/wheat malt backbone against acidity. A very enjoyable offering, and spot on style example.\xa02,285 characterssuperspak, Sep 29, 2018', '3.49/5\xa0\xa0rDev -8.9%look: 3.25 | smell: 3 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 3.5Man I have been bad about rating beers.

The beer was bought in Cinnicinatti, Ohio during a trip for a wedding (forgot the place and price).

hazy yellow colored beer with a slightly off-white head that fizzes and dies quickly. Aroma is pretty faint but consists of yeasty grapey tones and wheaty hay. All the melon is in the taste, which is what I would prefer in this particular beer. Carbonation (highish) and body (thinish) is pretty much perfect.\xa0451 charactersminterro, Oct 21, 2017', '3.76/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.8%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75The historic northern German "sour, wheat ale" has grown up to take on modern kettle souring technique for a clean, consistent and refreshing taste that hangs its hat on the lemony tang of lactic fermentation.

Central State's Ottermelon Gose tingles the nose with refreshing acidity as its popping effervescence draws the senses near. Though creamy and arid only momentarily, the ale's hazy peachy gold hues recapture the foam rather quickly. Yet there's a distinctive watermelon aroma to accompany the citrus as they both carry over to a supple sweetened upstart of confection and light bread.

With the sweetness proving short-lived, the middle palate dives deeply into the acidity and added fruit as the character of lemon, lime, balsa and watermelon wash over the tastebuds and deliver a high level of refreshing, summery and tangy flavors. And as the acidity easily breaks up the thirst, the beer's late taste is of citrusy and perfumy coriander and saltine.

And with its light and refreshing palate, the ale is soft and delicate with the melon but firm and brisk with sea salt and limey sourness. As as the ale finishes the palate, its final character is once again of wheat and burlap. Ottermelon Gose is perfect for a hot weather thirst quencher or with summer salads or ceviche.\xa01,289 charactersBEERchitect, Sep 24, 2015']

name: Purple Passion
review:
['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Medium bodied with at least medium carbonation it has a decent feel to it.
Aroma is passion fruit, BlackBerry, tart sour berry candy. Theres a malt,sugary,candy smell that reminds me of sweet tart candy
..taste has a mild sweetness, as well as mild tartness. The fruit gives it an almost fermented grape,smell and taste which comes off a little wine like\xa0358 charactersHoppingMadMonk, Sep 11, 2019', '4.01/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.2%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Poured from a can -- which has a great look all on its own: great purple (Ravens?) tone with a Maryland sigil below the name.

The beer itself pours nicely with a poofy, off-white foam head that you can hear dissolving if you hold it up to your ear. The foam head does not last too long, which is great as it yields a phenomenal rose-gold color throughout -- one of the more inviting looking beers I have had in a while.

The scent is, unsurprisingly, acidic/sour with blackberry and other fruit notes coming through cleanly. The taste is sour throughout with a fresher, lighter fruit flavor up front followed up with a superb blackberry flavor towards the end and lingering into the aftertaste. That lingering blackberry aftertaste draws you back for another sip, and another, and another... As far as sours go, this is one of the safer ones I have tried -- a good, crisp one for these later summer days and upcoming fall.\xa0927 charactersakaizer, Aug 04, 2019', '4.34/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.75I love this beer. It is so delicious and decadant... it explodes with flavor. The look is pink transparent. Foam has pick tint and laces good. Has Himalayan salt that tickles the taste buds. I love this beer so much. 
Passion fruit, citrus, BlackBerry. Head recoils fast. Great for a hot summer day. Malted wheat, but not overbearing sour.\xa0339 charactersPrecisiondigital, Mar 08, 2019', "3.95/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.7%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4.25A: The beer is quite hazy purplish yellow in color and has a light to moderate amount of visible carbonation. It poured with a short white head that quickly died down, leaving delicate lacing on the surface and a collar around the edge of the glass.
S: Light to moderate aromas of passionfruit are present in the nose.
T: The taste has flavors of blackberries and passionfruit and is a little sour with a bit of saltiness.
M: It feels light-bodied on the palate and has a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: I found this gose to be very refreshing because it was nice and fruity and wasn't really that sour. It would make for a good selection on a hot summer day.

Serving type: can\xa0682 charactersmetter98, Feb 18, 2019", '3.65/5\xa0\xa0rDev -9.2%look: 4.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5Hazy, with the colour of a pink rose wine. Little carbonation, 1/2 finger worth of head, but a good amount for the beer/style. 

Blackberry is the only strong flavour I taste. Sea salt is noticeable and compliments the blackberry. Sour to the nose and taste, but with a light sweetness. Alcohol is not noticeable and is hidden well. Easy to drink, but not my favourite. 

$9.99 for a 6pk. For that price id go with something else at my local place. Not bad, but not something to write home about unless you love blackberry.\xa0523 charactersSpeartron, Jan 13, 2019', '4.47/5\xa0\xa0rDev +11.2%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.5Pours hazy, purplish-tan in color with 1/3 inch head. Taste is big blackberry, peach, dragon fruit, and salt. Medium-light bodied, moderate carbonation, prickly, sweet and salty. Makes for an excellent, unique blackberry forward beer. Plenty of good salt. Will get this again. Great year round easy drinker.\xa0313 characterstigg924, Dec 10, 2018']

name: Swingers
review:
['4.01/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.3%look: 3 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4Merry label, smells of lemon and a touch of bubblegum, flavored with lime and creamy sugar stream and a pleasant salt tone that complement all tastes; Bought at Hopdonders\xa0171 charactersschavuytje, Jul 15, 2017', "4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Hazy pale color with white head. Aroma has lemon tartness, some sauerkraut but also some nice hoppy notes. Taste is quite briney, lemony, some grapefruit bitterness in the background and a hoppy freshness on the finish. Medium body, soft mouthfeel. Overall it's a quite good gose, salty and hoppy.\xa0297 charactersCiocanelu, Nov 26, 2016", '4.57/5\xa0\xa0rDev +15.4%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.5A: poured from a 330 mL bottle into a glass, golden with very little white head, very cloudy

S: citrus, heavy lemon and lime, pineapple, like a West Coast IPA

T: salty up front with a blast of lemon bitterness, tart citrus fruits, orange, lime

M: thin with low carbonation

O: really surprised by the awsome aroma of this beer, taste was excellent\xa0350 charactersM_C_Hampton, Jun 19, 2016', "4.23/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.8%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Enjoyed at Cafe Gollem on Amstelstraat in Amsterdam. On tap poured into a snifter.

L- A nice cloudy yellow with thin white, quickly dissipating head
S- Lemony and citrusy, very pungent and sour 
T- Passion fruit like tartness and citrus. Not a lot of salinity but very refreshing. 
F- Good carb, goes down easy
O- A very nice offering from Oedipus. This may be the first gose from Holland and they are very new to this style. As a result, it's not the most traditional with a distinct lack of salt. Really enjoyed this one\xa0523 charactersCanada_Dan, Jan 21, 2015"]

name: Sour & Salt
review:
['3.88/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 3 | overall: 3.75The colour is pale gold, the liquid is hazy. The head is white and airy; it sinks slowly with a fizzing sound leaving no lacing on the glass.

The rich smell is sour with fruit candy, yogurt, gooseberries and some floral notes.

The taste starts with a distinct passing salty flavour, growing sweet notes of old fashioned fruit candy, gunpowder and Chinese black tea. Light to medium body. Light aftertaste with floral and fruity notes, yoghurt sourness, passing fruity sweetness. The long finish is smooth with minerals, lime and a touch of salt.

The carbonation is strong, the mid-sized bubbles are fresh and short-lived. The liquid is a bit thick and harsh. 

A solid Gose, and as one expect from Brekeriet some extra flavours and complexity is added to this historical style.\xa0780 charactersbark, Jul 09, 2018', "4.18/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.5%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Bottle dated 4/2017, BB 4/2022:
The head of this beer expanded like a time lapse of a storm cloud stopped just perfectly at the top of the glass. The beer was near clear straw color before I tossed it the very last of the bottle in with the first 95%. Streaks of cloudiness eventually completely hazed the contents. This head lasted as a thin cap most of the pour.

Upon popping the bottle, I got a rush of tart apple with a little funk. Getting into the beer, that impression isn't changed, though the intensity isn't what I'd expect given that first waft. There's a little of the grain - can't say it's wheat or rye, maybe a little more of the latter, combining with the coriander to have a mildly earthy counter to the sour apple, wet wood funkiness. This has a little bit of a farmhouse feel to it.

A blast of lemon tartness first, which fades to Granny Smith apple, including some skin as my palate recovered. A barnyard funk comes in with a light earthy spiciness. Salt is present throughout, but isn't the interesting part of this beer. Not too heavily carbonated, but the combo of tart and light carbonation brings enough to the feel. Perhaps the softening aspect of the salt is in play here as well.

This is an interesting take, and there's a somewhat Brett-like funk to this beer. It's not huge and loses early against the more sour lactic ingredients. The bottle specifically mentions lactobacillus, but if that's all that's in there, it's coming across differently that it ever has in the past for me. Regardless, the net effect is, as mentioned, a barnyard/farmhouse feel to this beer once the sour aspects let it come out.

A really enjoyable offering. This somehow came across as what I think might be a more classic gose with some new twists involved that aren't focused on fruit of more sourness. I like the outcome.\xa01,837 characterscjgiant, Mar 18, 2018", '3.81/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.1%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Pours bright yellow, little hazy with a small white head. 
Aroma has lots of floral notes, lemons, hay, 
Taste is sour lemons, salt, floral, dry finish. Very refreshing.\xa0169 charactersNicolaiw, Oct 17, 2017', '3.85/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Pours an unclear yellow, pretty much no foam.

Smell is very crisp and tart, with lime and apricots dominating.

Taste is very refreshing and crisp. Tart, with mostly lime and apricots. Finishes with hints of mint and basil.

Thin bodied, quite bubbly.

Overall, a very refreshing beer, not all that deep, but good.\xa0315 charactersJamFuel, Jul 16, 2015']

name: Hibiscus Goes-uh
review:
['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Had it on tap at the wonderful bar and bottle shop Top Hops NYC, the venue that was formative in my introduction to craft beer.
Pours an amber color with a sunset reddish hue. Translucent and slightly on the darker side, it leaves a moderate foam head that retains well.
The aroma transports me to the farm. Scents of barnyard, hay and horses hit the nose with earthiness. Lemon and sour blood orange rise up to greet the farmhouse aromas and soon overpower them with their tart and acidic sting.
In the mouth the zest of lemons, tart citrus fruit, and wild yeast add an acidic tingle that is both bold and refreshing. Light bodied but approaching medium due to a fullness of flavor and complexity. Certainly not a one dimensional brew in that I detect an understated sweetness from a blend of malt and wheat as well as juiciness from citrus fruit. The finish is intensely dry adding to its drinkability.
A refreshing and complex wild ale that is a fine example of the style.\xa0979 charactersGajo74, Jun 27, 2017']

name: Double Apricot Popsicle (Andall)
review:
['4.66/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.75From crowler canned 4-3-18. Pours like orange juice, with a smidgeon of head to let you know there is some alcohol in it. Smells and tastes like apricot juice. Would have again in a heartbeat.\xa0195 charactersgibgink, Apr 18, 2018', "4.49/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5L: Had this beer on-tap at The Answer Brewpub, poured into a snifter glass. Had a bright orange color and a thick, slushy consistency. There was no real head to speak of. A thin layer of lacing.

S: A super sweet aroma of apricots, some salt, and wheat as well.

T: Tasted of a little tinge of sea salt (mostly in the finish), some mild wheat notes, a gigantic pile of apricots, and some other light citrus notes (maybe this was in my head). A very enjoyable flavor that's heavy on fruit. The slushy quality takes a little getting used to (about five seconds), but is oddly enjoyable.

F: Not a whole lot of carbonation, given the nature of the beer. An icy cool finish. Light-bodied.

O: I was hesitant to try The Answer's Frozan beers, but I'm glad I did. Well worth a look.\xa0776 charactersavalon07, Oct 08, 2017"]

name: Wake Me Up Before You Gose Hibiscus
review: ['3.82/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75Pours a nice burgundy/garnet color with sparkling but short lasting head. Aroma of tart citrus and hibiscus flower. Flavor is sour apple, sweet hibiscus flower, slight yeast and bread/wheat. The feel is light but somewhat syrupy. I think I had a touch more syrup than needed in mine. Taste was great just think the mix was a little off. Will come back to this rating next time I try it.\xa0386 charactersStolenface1, Nov 26, 2015']

name: Graham's Watermelon Gose
review: ['4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25watermelon in beer is really hit or miss for me, usually its too juicy and sweet, and even if it tastes naturally derived, its not a flavor that i think often lends itself well to most beer styles. i really like it here though, its obvious yet also somewhat subtle in here, as much rind it seems as flesh, as there is a nice vegetal bitterness and tang to this along with the fruit itself, and its really pleasant with the mild acidity developed in this beer, refreshing and summery and clean, really understated and well done overall. always exciting to have new beers from these guys, its rad to have them around colorado a little bit now. hazy and frothy from the tap this one, washed out straw color, super pale, and an aroma of clean citrusy lacto sourness, insanely mild in flavor by the way, the fresh melons, lemons, and a bright saltiness that i really like. the wheat malt is simple and rustic in the flavor, an arizona ingredient and a unique one. the melon is nice in here, its really natural and it works great with the wheat. a cool floral element too. majorly clean finish to this, nice carbonation, and it just seems better made than a lot of these, nothing cheap about it, not too sour, just right. i have been loving all the arizona wilderness stuff lately, glad i tried this!\xa01,294 charactersStonedTrippin, Nov 14, 2017', '4.03/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Cloudy golden yellow body, one finger white head, not much lacing, good retention. Smell is classic sea salt and lemon, mild lactic acid, touch of that watermelon sweetness. Flavour brings out even more watermelon flavour, nice sweet watermelon tempered by the sea salt and mildly lactic lemon, nice tartness and clean crispness. Lighter in body but not lacking for flavour, nice carbonation. A perfect lake beer.\xa0413 charactersStevedore, Sep 04, 2017', "4.07/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.7%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4One of the best fruit Gose's I've had. Great taste of salty watermelon with a nice balance of sour acidity. All blends together very well. Only oddity is a slight smell of smoky farts on the nose. Not that unpleasant actually but pretty odd.\xa0241 charactersMonkeyBread, Aug 13, 2016"]

name: Colombian Necktie
review:
['4.13/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.7%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Look - hazy yellow tan color no head or skimming 
Smell - tart sweet citrus 
Taste - way fruitier taste. Still sweet and tart but a more tropical fruit taste to it and some apricot 
Feel - medium body and carb 
Overall - different and tasty\xa0241 charactersdrdiesel9483, Oct 15, 2019', '3.65/5\xa0\xa0rDev -10.1%look: 4 | smell: 2.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75I hate to say this but I really could not get past the smell of this beer. The smell was odd and offputting almost like something was rotting. It tasted fine with tart mangoes being the predominant flavor with some lemon, apricot, orange and a hint of sea salt. Ultimately I could not finish it because of the smell.\xa0317 charactersEMH73, Sep 06, 2019', '4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.7%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 416 ounce can into tulip glass, canned in 8/2019. Pours very hazy deep golden amber/light orange color with a 1 finger fairly dense and fluffy off white head with solid retention, that reduces to a minimal spotty lace cap that lingers. Minimal spotty lacing, some clinging bubbles, and a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big juicy/tart/tangy mangoes, fruit skin, lemon, lime, orange, peach, pear, pineapple, apricot, mango, honeydew melon, strawberry, citrus peel/zest, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, white bread dough, biscuit, light honey/peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of mangoes, Lulo, Soursop, Lime, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, and pale/wheat malt notes; with big strength. Taste of huge juicy/tart/tangy mangoes, fruit skin, lemon, lime, orange, peach, pear, pineapple, apricot, mango, honeydew melon, strawberry, citrus peel/zest, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, white bread dough, biscuit, light honey/peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang, and light spiciness on the finish. lingering notes of tart/tangy mangoes, fruit skin, lemon, lime, orange, peach, pear, pineapple, apricot, mango, honeydew melon, strawberry, citrus peel/zest, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, white bread dough, biscuit, light honey/peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of mangoes, Lulo, Soursop, Lime, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, and pale/wheat malt flavors; with an awesome malt/tartness and tangy fruit balance; with no puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp finishing. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering tartness and tangy fruit. Medium carbonation and medium-plus body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/silky/grainy, acidic/tangy/tannic, and lightly saline balanced mouthfeel that is fantastic. Minimal warming alcohol for 7.2%. Overall this is a fantastic fruited imperial gose. All around fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of mangoes, Lulo, Soursop, Lime, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, and pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth and fairly crisp/refreshing to drink with the modestly acidic/tangy/tannic/drying finish. Fantastic soft feel, not overly lactic/salty. Fantastic balance of big juicy/jammy fruit and lacto complexity; with a nice sized pale/wheat malt backbone against acidity. Mild residual sweetness with crisp acidic/tangy dryness. A highly enjoyable offering, and outstanding spot on style example as expected.\xa02,705 characterssuperspak, Sep 01, 2019', '4.21/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.7%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.2516 oz can

Pours hazy lemon golden, sugar white head dissipates to a ring.

Aroma is of tart citrus and sweet tropical fruits over cracker malts.

Flavor is of tart citrus and some sweet unfamiliar tropical fruit notes. Wavering between mango, banana, papaya, and citrus zest. 

Medium body, stinging carbonation on the tongue. 

Very nice, pleasant gose with some enjoyable tropical and citrus flavors. Drinks a bit heavy on account of the 7 percent. Worth trying, would have again.\xa0488 charactersCylinsier, Aug 31, 2019', '4.07/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.2%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4.251 pint can. August 2019. 
Look: No head, opaque. Fine bubbles slowly erupting to surface. Resembling mango nectar in color
Nose: mango
Taste: Light flavor, no alcohol taste, pleasantly sour, balanced, refreshing.
Feel: Light body--almost too light. Effervescent. Good with salty food.\xa0290 charactersWinterV, Aug 26, 2019']

name: Gose Of Althea
review:
['4.03/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.6%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4On tap:
Pours a hazed blood orange hues amber. White head might have a few specks of pink in there. Thick collar, brief lacing.

Nose has floral accents to a sour orange to grapefruit tartness. The floral either combines with or adds a little nectar-to-honeydew sweetness.

Taste starts with a light tartness and a medium cracker-like malt flavor. Hibiscus with the tart brings a pseudo berry note to mind. Tart stays at a nice moderate level, allowing the malt to come back into play a little near the end. Not getting much salinity.

A light and refreshing feel, not too puckering with a medium carbonation level.

An enjoyable beer, flavorful and balanced - solid.\xa0673 characterscjgiant, Mar 07, 2018', '4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Gose is a style that is usually not my thing, but every once in a while I fund one I enjoy. This was one of those. Nicely tart, but acidity seems low, keeping it drinkable and refreshing. Saltiness is also at a nice medium level, and the spices add just enough to keep it interesting. Nicely executed.\xa0309 charactersAngusOg, Jan 19, 2017', '4.28/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.4%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5A: Pours a clear rosy red-brown. Very little head that dissipated almost instantly.
S: Very little aroma other than a faint funk.
T: Starts sour with a tart berry flavors. Nice fruity and sour flavors neither which overpower the other.
M: Light body, moderately acidic with matching carbonation. 
O: A very nice refreshing drink. Very drinkable and not quite sour nor sweet. Would pair nice with a warm summer night.\xa0417 charactersBmanley90, Dec 01, 2016', "4.53/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8.4%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Drinking from bottle at my house. Nice pink/red hue with a small head. No lacing but Gose style rarely laces up. So now on to the taste. Probably one of the highest quality standard Gose I've had to date. It's a wonderful balance of the salt and sour with sweetness in balance. Really, no homerism here at all, this one is done on a world class level. I highly recommend for any lover of Gose / Berlinner Weisse beers to get Monocacy a try on this one. And for Monocacy/Mr. Flores, put this one into a seasonal release each summer and perhaps consider doing some off-shoot variants from it. It's a true winner on the world stage.\xa0638 charactersbubseymour, Aug 01, 2016"]

name: Push It
review:
['4.16/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.5%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.2516 oz pour on tap into a shaker pint.

A: Slighty murky lemon yellow body with what appeared to be pretty high carbonation. Head was tiny white and fizzy.

S: Lots of lemon, smelled tart with some salinity.

T: Fairly decent level of sourness with some light saltiness and a good bit of lemon and grass flavor with a fairly strong wheat finish.

M: Medium bodied with an almost effervescent carbonation.

O: It was a pretty good beer, but I thought the lemon flavor was a bit too high on it.\xa0491 charactersSomethingClever, Dec 22, 2018', "3.76/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.4%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Get it?! Salt-N-Pepa gose. It appears they're not the only ones to think of this, but they may have been the first...

Cloudy pale yellow with a soft white collar.

Smell is salt, Colby cheese, peanut, fried egg, with black pepper only rising after time.

Don't let the smell turn you off--some of the best goses I've had have smelled like that, and the taste totally turns the corner, with wheat, lemon-lime, cheddar cheese funk, but super tangy.\xa0447 charactersSabtos, Mar 18, 2017"]

name: Saltwater Intrusion
review: ["4.54/5\xa0\xa0rDev +19.5%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.5Two 6 oz pours from brewery. Way more tart and salty then most. Very close to Westbrook's. One of the best Gose's I've had in a while. This should be canned ASAP! 4.50\xa0168 charactersKensWorld, May 15, 2016", '3.87/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.8%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Pale gold, almost straw colored draft pour with white head; good lace. Tart lemony nose. Salty, tart lemon flavors. Crisp and clean light mouthfeel; tart, salty tongue coating. Overall, nice interplay between tart citrus/lemons and salt - lite and quite enjoyable.\xa0264 charactersDoctorZombies, Aug 13, 2015']

name: Salt Of The Gulf
review:
['3.6/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5an incredibly mild take on the gose style, a real food beer if you want a palate cleanser and something that wont be filling, but for me it left a little bit to be desired. this is my first beer from these guys, and its decent but not inspiring. the sourness is super low for the style, which i get for high volume consumption and wider appeal for a beer like this, but its super mild, almost like a lemon got squeezed in the beer, no more acidic than that, but it is really clean and refined lactic tang, and i appreciate its tidy profile here. the salt is actually pretty robust which is cool with things like seafood and also fatty pork dishes, it accents and cuts at the same time, and i feel like this beer really does need the food context to work this well. the malt base doesnt taste wheaty to me, it has the finish and feel of an adjunct lager, kind of cheap and metallic, no structure at all, and despite excellent carbonation, it feels way too light. overall a beer i had no problem drinking through and actually enjoyed with my food, a little different proportionality from what i am used to in the style now, but this is only decent, not great as goses go...\xa01,171 charactersStonedTrippin, Nov 16, 2017', '3.96/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Pours a clear deep straw/pale gold (with a rose hint) producing 2 fingers of mineral water effervescent, rapidly diminishing, foamy, white head that leaves minimal lacing, only a hint of a surface cap & a thin collar ring. Aroma is mildly tart & mineral. It has a low malt profile with something Graham cracker like, ale yeast, brine, a hint of coriander & it may be my imagination but a little grassy hop hint. Taste opens with a salinity & lactic acid sourness that complement each other without overpowering the hints of Graham cracker, thin white fruit (green apple) & lime that develop during the swallow, ending in a peppery, clean, crisp, dry finish. Aftertaste is shortlived salty lime & green apple. The coriander while present in the nose is difficult to pick up in the mouth. This may be the most easy-drinking Gose I have had to date. Mouthfeel is light bodied with moderate carbonation that rapidly dissipates as the brew warms, mildly astringent, prickly & dry. Delicate & delightful. Well done Grayton!\xa01,019 charactersmothmanscott, Oct 10, 2017', '3.64/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.8%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75Light lemon yellow color with diminishing white cap.

Aroma of light citrus, floral and a touch of spice with underlying sweet malt.

Taste is lightly tartly, sweetly maltly, lemony with a touch of salt.

Light texture with balancing carbonation.

It seems to be some sort of sweet tart version of a beer. A beach thirst quencher that I imagine would go well with food cart cuisine.\xa0384 charactersSquire, May 25, 2017']

name: Guava Lime Gose
review:
['4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.4%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Canned 3 weeks ago.

Pours hazy orange with a persistent white head.

The nose is lemon, lime, salt, and guava. Electric.

The taste follows, with a slight yellow Gatorade vibe. Zippy tartness. Lemon-lime, guava, and grapefruit. Hints of coriander and salt.

The mouthfeel is medium for the style with medium tartness.

Overall, tasty.\xa0335 charactersmkh012, Nov 17, 2019', "4.26/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.2%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25Tangy, tropical, tantalizing, a strong flavor of margarita oozes from WeldWerks German styled sour, salty wheat ale with the help of guava and lime. So, the tastebuds can certainly take a trip to the beach even if the rest of you can't go.

Aptly named Guava Lime Gose, the matte orange and golden hues carry a visual density under a thin white skirt of froth. Mouthwatering aromas grab the nose with the threat of refreshing tropical fruit, sea air, citrus, light wine and a soft candied backdrop. Early sweetness teases the tastebuds with saltwater taffy, sherbet and agave.

And the individual fruits reveal themselves as guava, passionfruit, kiwi and honeydew for a tropical and orchard variety. But the blast of lime kick the flavors into the world of sangria and limeade. As the rounded salinity brings a savory component to the late palate, that full margarita taste takes full command. The tang of gooseberry, under ripened oranges and grapefruit round out the sour and slightly bitter taste.

Medium light and with a hint of sourdough looming in a short aftertaste, the clean, crisp and highly refreshing beer carries a high rate of drinkability for a full sherbet succulence and the thirst quenching refreshment of margarita even in a light bitter balance from citrus peels and a scant spice of gin.\xa01,309 charactersBEERchitect, Dec 06, 2018"]

name: Swan Dive Pina Colada Gose
review:
['4.05/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Poured from a 12 oz can into a Dogfish Head tulip

L: Clear light golden pour with thin white head. Modest lacing.

S: Coconut and pineapple... funky and fruity. Smells awesome.

T/F: Tart up front.. light lemon and funk. Strong tart pineapple followed by coconut and some fruity sweetness. Light bodied... well carbonated. More pina colada in the finish.

O: A very interesting and tasty Gose... and I love how the coconut works with this one. Great beer!\xa0466 charactersEMV, Nov 01, 2018', '4.06/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Cloudy pale orange color. Medium body as well as carbonation action, to me it had an o we all good feel
Aroma is pineapple, pineapple juice, and coconut . Very strong pleasing aroma
Taste is similar, pineapple forward followed by coconut. Some cereal and malt start to show up as it warms.
Figured it would be gimmicky but it was actually a very decent beer. Especially as a summer beer it worked perfect for after mowing the lawn or sitting on the deck\xa0461 charactersHoppingMadMonk, Aug 28, 2018', "3.84/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75-Pina Colada Gose with sea salt served in Duvel globe.

A: Faint orange coloring has an even fainter display of effervesce within a pristine clarity. A quickly dissipating head quickly turns to a polished surface. The vessel is free of lacing. 

S: Loads of fresh coconut flakes and pina-colada scents are true on the nose. Hints of pineapple slices of really good strength lingers for a good period of time. Touches of sour fruitiness and sea salt comes on the trail.

T: Sour watermelon and pineapple fruitiness are prominent at first for the flavor. Nice coconut presence, fresh, wet flakes, with an overall presentation that was very clean and crisp. The sourness was light, clean and crisp, gentle for newcomers, while some soft sour orange wheatiness and sea salt accents close things out.

M: Light carbonation presence on the mouthful, with a crisp palate on the tongue. Clean, softly oily texture with some mineral content is delicate. A very soft salty sendoff lingers only briefly. 

O: I really enjoyed the aroma on the open, true to pina-colada terms, the flavor was crisp and softly soured with sea salt accents. Very good drink-ability to style, the sourness was a bit on the light side. I give props for the inventevness of blending a pina colada style drink with the gose style, especially since I'm partial to pina-coladas and coconut as well the gose style. The aroma was spot on, the flavor was moderate or as close to be expected. Perhaps a wit style pina colada, creamy white wheat base to add more substance? But i regress, this had a nice tropical fruitiness and range of flavor by style, I personally liked the pairing, worthy a try if you do too.\xa01,675 charactersbeerthulhu, Jan 21, 2018", '4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.8%look: 3.25 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 4**
10/14/17

Central Jersey Beer Fest.
On Tap to 2 oz. tasting glass.

LOOK: yellow, foamy white head
AROMA: super pina colada smells - Pineapple and coconut bring you to a tropical island.
TASTE: like aroma, but less strong. Still tasty. Tropical flavors work well with this style.
FEEL: a little weak and thin

Another nice find from Manayunk. 

**\xa0358 charactersq33jeff, Oct 22, 2017', '3.76/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.5%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Manayunk Brewing Co. "Swan Dive Piña Colada Gose With Sea Salt"
12 fl. oz. can without production coding or freshness dating
$2 @ Shop Rite, 2800 Fox St. Philadelphia, PA

Notes via stream of consciousness: What's going on here? Has Manayunk jumped the shark? I assume this is an Evan Fritz beer but it just sounds crazy - or is that exactly right, his beers are all crazy! Well we'll see. I'm a little trepidatious and definitely skeptical, but who knows, maybe this will take me away to a tropical island somewhere. It pours a very hazy straw gold colored body beneath a short lived head of bright white - but it's common for sour beers to lose their head almost immediately, so that's OK. The aroma is distinctly coconut but there's some pineapple in there as well. It's OK but not great. It's from extract so how good could it be? The flavor expresses piña colada as well, with less coconut than the aroma suggests, and it's moderately tart, which is good because any more tartness would have killed it. The salt is also fairly low key, and I think that helps as well. Sitting in the hot sun I could see having one of these. At any other time of the year, probably not. Light-medium in body and gently crisp. Surprisingly well balanced. Refreshing.\xa01,254 charactersNeroFiddled, Sep 06, 2017']

name: Salt & Sea
review:
['4.2/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.2512 oz can poured into a tulip pint glass. Strawberries and limes are not my favorite fruit additions to beer, but Salt and Sea manages to get them perfect. You can taste both the strawberry and lime distinctly but neither overwhelms the other or the base beer. Nice salinity, moderate tartness. Tastes like taffy or gummy bears.\xa0328 charactersLucular, Nov 19, 2019', '3.57/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.5Not my favorite style of beer so I don’t have a lot to compare. For my taste just a little too sweet and sour. Great idea for a summer shore beer and if you like fruity sours this might be perfect for you. Definitely has a cherry in scent and taste. A little salt but not much. Overall too strong for me.\xa0308 charactershaines710, Sep 14, 2019', "4.04/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.9%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4If anyone is going to get a salty gose right, it's a shore brewer, might as well be FF on Jersey Shore (or close 2nd, Carton Digger)
a) Lofts a big white head over a slightly hazed golden body, but it's lost quickly due to salt and fruit additions. 
s) Strawberry, lime, salt air. (a bit too much strawberry for me)
t) Follows aroma with bigger punch than its light ABV - great food beer! In this case with diced chicken breast over home grown salad of mint, basil, cilantro, first tomatoes with pickles, garlic, grapes. Yummm. 
f) Bright, fruity, crisp. 
o) As good a salad, cold protein, seafood beer as it comes in summer.\xa0625 charactersAct25, Jul 15, 2019", "4.16/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25sometimes the strawberry flavor comes thru more and then sometimes it's the salt coming through more. it's a pretty good combination for a refreshing beer.\xa0155 charactersmmmbeer89, Jul 07, 2019", '4.01/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.2%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Pours a clear golden amber color with a modest and quickly dissipating head.
Fruity aromas, with strawberry in particular featuring prominently. The malt gives off a graham cracker and lime fruity blueberry muffin like aroma. Furthermore, the smell of lime evokes tartness, complimented by a pinch of sea salt.
Tart throughout with flavors of lemon and lime, beautifully complimented by the restrained briny flavors of sea salt. The sweetness of the strawberries do a great job of taking the edge off of the acidity. Additional flavors of unripe grapefruit, peppery spice and dry cracker malt. The finish is dry with a lightly puckering lime pith linger.
Medium bodied, crisp and with a tight carbonation. Tart, fruity and dry with good drinkability. 
This was a nice refreshing example of a Gose.\xa0797 charactersGajo74, Jun 02, 2019', '3.97/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.1%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Maybe it’s the pairing with tacos, but I really dig this beer. Balances flavors—tartness blends well with fruit. Salt is there, but again, not overwhelming. I found this VERY refreshing. Nicely done FF!\xa0209 charactersDJED69, May 05, 2019', '3.65/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.2%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75VERY INTERESTING! From tap at industry Public House. Definite floral and tart. Leah gets a salt feel on the tongue. Have only had one other of this style. This is an enjoyable beer! Good job!\xa0191 charactersBluerabbitbell, Apr 16, 2019', '4.03/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.7%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Had on tap at Ocean Odyssey. Very enjoyable Gose style brew. Salt was notable but pleasant not distracting or competing in the flavor profile. Light easy drinker with a slight tartness; some subdued yeast and a modest salty accent. Refreshing. Impressed.\xa0254 charactersBillRoth, Apr 06, 2019']

name: Blueberry Popsicle
review: ['4.37/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.1%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Crowler shared with a few people. Poured into a goblet glass. Poured exactly a blood orange color with almost no head at all. The beer was very fruity and was very easy to drink. Was a little light on the sour but personally enjoyed this one quite a bit.\xa0258 characterstimmy2b, Sep 08, 2017']

name: Enough Already - Blueberry And Blackberry
review:
['4.13/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.9%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4L - pours an opaque cranberry juice. 6500K bright white head with big bubbles that's gone in a flash. 

S - nail polish and white zinfandel. Strong nostalgia from Thanksgiving dinners with the family. Cheap rose was always involved. 

T - tart, underripe blackberry and sea salt. White grapes give off vinous vibes. Wants to be a dry chardonnay. Very strange.

F - light and effervescent. Lively, but not overcarbed. Decent velvety feel to make this pleasant to sip.

O - tastes like white wine you'll find at a vineyard in a location not known for good wines. Lol. That's not to say it's bad, but it gives off the impression of "best ingredients available". Unique and concise flavors, but little oomph or backbone. But that's if this was a wine. It's not, although it honestly tastes more like a wine than beer!\xa0813 charactersagreenman19, Aug 10, 2019', "4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4.25If you look closely, it seems most of the others who reviewed this beer aren't big fans of goses. That said, I love goses, and I think this is a great one. It pours a beautiful ruby red, with a pretty pink head. Smells like both berries mentioned on the label. Taste is tart, tangy, and sweet, with what I would consider to be the perfect level of saltiness. Body's fairly light and refreshing, but not watery. It's tasty, and pretty much exactly what I look for in the style.\xa0476 charactersalextastic, Mar 11, 2019", '3.84/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.5%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Had on tap at the brewery. Pours a blue/purple color with a thin pink head that dissipated very quickly and left little lacing. Smells of tropical fruit, funk and floral notes. Tastes of blueberry, blackberry, raspberry, lemon peel, yeast and funk. Light bodied and carbonated and a dry mouth feel. Far from my favorite style, but this was very well done.\xa0356 charactersEMH73, May 23, 2018', '3.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev -10.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 2.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5Pours pours pink/purple color with a pink foamy head that faded on the quick side and left minimal spotty lacing.

Smells like rotting grass scraped off the bottom of a lawn mower with a dash of sweetness and floral notes. Yikes.

Thankfully it tastes good, with cranberry, raspberry, sea salt, lemon zest, tart red grapefruit, grains, yeast or wheat, watermelon and summer fruit. Easy drinking and would be session-able out of the can if the nose is contained.

3/12/2019-Had it again and it was much better, especially the nose which was quite fruity and pungent.\xa0565 charactersCHickman, Dec 03, 2017', '3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Pours raspberry red. Aroma of tropical fruit, blueberry and blackberry. Taste follows the nose with a light sour/tart finish. Big fan of Sand City. Not my style but well crafted.\xa0178 charactersBoccu, Dec 02, 2017']

name: Omnipollo / Great South Bay - Bianca Peanut Butter Jelly Lassi Gose
review:
['4.32/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25On tap at the Beer Station (SC).
Pours with a hazy, purple-maroon body topped with a thin white head that leaves minimal lacing. 
Exceptionally interesting and appealing aroma with PB&J. 
The flavor is nicely balanced and highly complex. Moderate tartness for style with some sweetness up front. 
Light carbonation in a medium body.\xa0332 characterschinchill, Jul 14, 2019', "4.21/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Fruity, light, tart and highly redolent with childhood lunches, Onmipollo's PB&J rendition of gose, provides a sweet and sour flavor with hints of strawberry jam, peanut butter and toast to go along with the creamy wheat to support the natural souring power of lacto-fermentation for a medley of taste that's acidic and complex.

Bianca Peanut Butter Jelly Lassi Gose pours a visually dense ruby, almost purple and crimson hue and nearly turbid. A dainty pinkish, loose zest rises and falls quickly, filling the nose with jaw-tightening aromas of strawbrerry jam, green apple and a citrus medley with a gentle waft of nuttiness and brine. Its taste is just as jelly-like, filled with candied strawberries and a sweeter overall berry cobbler attitude.

Its maltiness drops from underneath and allows the premier taste of strawberry flavor to command the middle palate. Lactic fermentation provides the sharp flavors of lime and lemon with cider, white wine, raspberry, blackberry, gooseberry and the robust tang of red grape. But its the strawberry additions that give a robust sweet flare to the taste that reads like stewed, macerated, richer sangria character through much of the session. 

Crisp, refreshing, but also sweet, the beer's refreshing fruit taste is a little work on the palate with a higher rate of residual sweetness that's common for gose. Creamy and acidic, its thirst quenching properties trails shortly in aftertaste with a finish of rounded saltwater taffy with a soft afterglow of whole wheat and stewed berries.\xa01,535 charactersBEERchitect, May 10, 2019", '4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.3%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.516 ounce can into tulip glass; no can dating, but is a recent release. Pours hazy dark ruby red/purple color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy light pink head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big sour/tart/tangy strawberry, raspberry, fruit skin/seeds, lemon, lime, orange, grapefruit, peach, plum, pear, apricot, red/green apple, red grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, vanilla, cream, wheat, cracker, and biscuit dough; with lighter notes of peanut butter, peppercorn, lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of berry jam, fruity/acidic yeast, lactose, pale/wheat malts, and light peanut butter notes; with big strength. Taste of big sour/tart/tangy strawberry, raspberry, fruit skin/seeds, lemon, lime, orange, grapefruit, peach, plum, pear, apricot, red/green apple, red grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, vanilla, cream, wheat, cracker, and biscuit dough; with lighter notes of peanut butter, peppercorn, lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tart/sourness, fruit tang, and light bitter/spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of sour/tart/tangy berries, fruit skin/seeds, lemon, lime, orange, grapefruit, peach, plum, pear, apricot, red/green apple, red grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, vanilla, cream, wheat, cracker, biscuit dough, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of berry jam, fruity/acidic yeast, lactose, pale/wheat malts, and light peanut butter flavors; with a great malt/tart/sourness and tangy fruit balance; with minimal puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering tart/sourness and tangy fruit. Medium-plus carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/bready/grainy, acidic/tangy/tannic, fairly crisp, and lightly saline balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol for 6%. Overall this is an awesome fruited gose. All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of berry jam, fruity/acidic yeast, lactose, pale/wheat malts, and light peanut butter flavors; very smooth and fairly crisp to drink with the modestly acidic/tangy/tannic/drying finish; not overly lactic/salty. Awesome balance of super jammy berries, and Lacto complexity; with a great lactose and pale/wheat malt backbone against acidity. Minimal residual sweetness with crisp lingering acidic/tangy dryness. A really enjoyable offering. Hardly any PB flavor, but impressively spot on for a fruited gose otherwise.\xa02,701 characterssuperspak, May 08, 2019']

name: Gose
review:
['4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%I was pumped to see a Gose on tap at Aardwolf. 

It was served in a pint glass and the beer is a hazy straw with a skim of off white head. 

Nose is of malts and something delightfully sour. It kind of reminds me of sour heads candy.

Taste is tart and refreshing. Sit is sour and grainy with a bit of lemon rind. I like how the sourness ramps up as you work your way through the beer.

The mouth is crisp and smooth. Thank you sir, can I have another?\xa0457 charactersRedrover, Oct 27, 2014', '3.19/5\xa0\xa0rDev -23.1%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3 | feel: 4 | overall: 3th person who let us taste it said its not made with brett anymore, so its tasts like weak yellow coolaid with too many lemons if you ask me. no salt , sad....\xa0159 charactersazorie, Aug 23, 2014', '4.8/5\xa0\xa0rDev +15.7%look: 4.75 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 5Hazy gold with a white head. An amazing tart, funky aroma with a flavor profile to match. Dry finish with a moderately thick body. Refreshing and very drinkable, this is one of the best examples of a gose I have had.\xa0218 charactersLovely85, Jul 07, 2014']

name: Lil' Creepster
review: ['4.05/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.7%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 412 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 6/26/2018. Pours slightly hazy/cloudy medium golden yellow color with a 1 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with great retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Nice spotty lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big tart/sour lemon, lime, orange, grapefruit, apricot, peach, pear, pineapple, melon, red/green apple, white wine, citrus peel/zest, coriander, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/acidic yeast, fruit, spice, salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big tart/sour lemon, lime, orange, grapefruit, apricot, peach, pear, pineapple, melon, red/green apple, white wine, citrus peel/zest, coriander, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang; and light coriander spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart lemon, lime, orange, grapefruit, apricot, peach, pear, pineapple, melon, red/green apple, white wine, citrus peel/zest, coriander, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Great complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, fruit, spice, salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; with a great malt/tartness, tangy fruit, and spice balance; with no puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering tart/sourness, tangy fruit, spiciness, and carbonation. Medium-plus carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately bready/grainy/sticky/acidic/tangy, fairly crisp, and lightly saline balanced mouthfeel that is fantastic. Zero warming alcohol for 6.6%. Overall this is an excellent Gose! All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, fruit, spice, salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, and refreshing to drink; with the modestly acidic/tangy/drying finish. Not overly lactic or salty. Great balance of juicy fruits, Lacto, spices, and pale/wheat malts against against acidity. A very enjoyable offering, and spot on style example as expected.\xa02,370 characterssuperspak, Oct 27, 2018', '3.4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -11.2%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.5Taste: Complex, apricot, orange peel, stone fruit, tart, fermented yeast notes. herbal lemongrass nose. golden hue, slight haze, white foamy head, sticky lace. Medium to med/light body. Unique. 9 IBUs\xa0200 charactersBlackBeerPirate, Sep 07, 2018', "4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.4%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Served on tap at a Short's beer pairing dinner. Light yellow/orange in color, hazy, with a swirl of foam on top. Aroma of citrus and salt. Taste is fruity, tart, and salty. Flavors of citrus, lemongrass, and some coriander. Well balanced and refreshing. Would work well on a hot summer night with Melt My Brain.\xa0312 charactersTripel_Threat, Feb 16, 2017"]

name: Never Never Last Last
review: ["4.02/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Pours a ridiculous shade of rich, transparent crimson, with a big, fluffy head of large, active bubbles that take a while to settle down. Smells like a gose, with pungent notes of salt and malt and just a liiiittle fruit in the background. Taste is a bunch of grapes in your face, like Welch's if Welch's was way more awesome. The folks at The Veil have a way with goses, and so far, have never let me down.\xa0407 charactersalextastic, Jul 06, 2018"]

name: Meri
review:
['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +11.1%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4It pours a somewhat cloudy, copper body, with a tiny amount of visible carbonation and floaties. Small white head with some lacing.

It has an aroma of apricot, citrus and orange.

The taste is mostly dominated by citrus and salt, with notes of minerals. The mouthfeel is medium bodied, dry, crisp and slightly sour, with medium carbonation and little bitterness. The aftertaste is wheaty.

A refreshing gose.\xa0409 charactersNofoba, Nov 08, 2019', "3.84/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.7%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Pours a slightly cloudy, deep, dark amber coloration with a medium, quickly dissipating, frothy head and some particulates on final pour. Smells of red berries and some mild and lightly sweet biscuity malt. Taste is quite tart, mildly acidic and rather salty, with notes of red berries, citrus fruit and just a hint of biscuity malt and coriander as well. Finishes tart and briny, with some red berries lingering in the aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel with a medium body and carbonation.

A very nice, understated Gose, but not all that classic in my opinion because both the maltiness and saltiness are higher than what you would expect from a classic Leipzig Gose. I've certainly never seen this amount of particulates in a Gose ever either.\xa0740 charactersSnowcrash000, Jan 14, 2019", "3.57/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.8%look: 3 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.5330mL bottle I got from a rep. Poured into a tulip glass at approx. 16-18°C (Little warm for a sour, I know, but I prefer my beers a little warmer so as not to miss flavors)

Look: Surprisingly dark for a gose, hazy amber in colour, loose head that dissipated fairly quickly and left no lacing. Fine carbonation. 

Smell: Definitely some rich toffee notes underneath citrusy acid a bit of tropical fruit. Different from many gose's I've had. Interesting and a nice departure. 

Taste: Quite a bit of salt present, making biscuit and toffee flavors stand out strongly against the bright tartness and lemon. Again, different but pleasant. 

Feel: Thicker than your average gose. Higher alcohol content and darker malt profile gives it a bit more substance. Pleasant briny tingling along the sides of the tongue and cheeks. 

Overall: Good variation of my favourite sour style. Love the amount of salt. 3.5/5\xa0907 charactersA-B, May 31, 2017", "3.55/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.4%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Slightly hazy dark golden color with a bit of white head. Aroma is somehow salty sweet with some nice caramel malt and generic fruitiness. Taste follows salty, like a briney salad dressing, tart but not too intense. Light body, low carbonation. Overall it's a decent gose but a bit too briney for my taste.\xa0306 charactersCiocanelu, Feb 26, 2017"]

name: Drink A Peach!
review:
['3.84/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Poured from the bottle into a wheat ale glass.

Pale brass body color, with some slight haze, meeting to a fleeting off white snapping head. Settles with a small collar and nice amounts of fine carbonation.

Peach aroma on the front with some mixing touches of different malt qualities. Hits a little grainy almost biscuity and dry smelling, with a touch of chewy wheat faint quality. Peach quality seems a bit canned and sugary though, faint touch of acidity but sweetness is ruling out as the dominant aroma.

Interesting gose. Light and refreshing bodied with a bit of chew, but has more of that simple fruited peach flavor. Good amount of sourness and brine quality far more than expected on the palate than the nose indicates. Lots of crackery and flour like malt flavors, making for an almost saltine like taste and experience.

Very different flavored malt bill going on for a gose here, seems quite different, and a fairly standard peach fruit. Pretty interesting, but also ordinary in the same time. Not bad.\xa01,025 charactersSmakawhat, Aug 26, 2018', '3.92/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.6%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 3.75A: A aple yellow. Slightly hazy with a white head. 

S: Tart with stone fruit, but perhaps there is a touch of wet dog in there. 

T: Tart with peach flavor, and some light malty flavors. A touch of sea salt, and citrus. 

M: Medium light, with very active carbonation, and a dry tart finish. 

O: Overall light, tasty, and refreshing.\xa0337 charactersBeejay, May 17, 2018', '3.49/5\xa0\xa0rDev -9.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 3 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5Pours a pretty orange color, with a little strip of head to top it off. Aroma is straight up peach, with the delightful fruity bouquet very pleasing to the nose.
The taste is a bit muddied, the initial peach giving way to a overwhelmingly sour taste. 

Overall not bad, but I couldn’t drink more than one or two of these in a sitting before moving on to something else.\xa0371 charactersramseye4, Oct 08, 2017', '4.51/5\xa0\xa0rDev +16.8%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Pours a fairly clear pale yellow color with a minimal white head that fades away quickly. Smells of fresh cut peaches and a little tartness in the back. Taste is excellent, fresh peach up front with a little sourness fading in, and a touch of salt towards the back. Clean, crisp, light body beer with a peach flavor that lingers just a little while. Fantastic, simple gose that really does drink like a peach.\xa0409 charactersRiff, Jun 23, 2017', '4.41/5\xa0\xa0rDev +14.2%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25This pours a very very pale color with light head and minimal lacing. Aroma is of fresh peaches. Awesome taste of fresh peaches, great souriness, salty and overall one of the best goses I have had recently
.\xa0207 charactershophugger, Sep 09, 2015']

name: Never Know
review:
["4.31/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.4%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Never Know - The Veil
Gose with Pineapple
Canned 8/15/17 (12 days ago)

L - 1-finger head dies rapidly, leaving no lacing. Deep yellow body.

S - pineapple, pineapple, pineapple. I'm sure there are other things to smell here but that's beyond me.

T - pineapple, biscuity malt, some saltiness.

F - light body, highly carbed.

O - A great summer gose. I prefer the Veil's berry goses, but this one still pleases.\xa0412 charactersCanConPhilly, Aug 27, 2017"]

name: Raspberry Gose
review:
['4.39/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25another absolutely lights out bottle of beer from one of my up and coming favorites! this is every bit as good as the blackberry gose, with such an enormous fruit profile on it, but still beery, not just juice, impressive overall quality, and everyone who got in on this bottle thought it was awesome! the color is vibrantly pink, stained glass bright, almost unnatural, and the raspberry essence brims from it, like we can smell it across the yard as soon as i pop the cap. the nose is awesome, faint coriander in here, a super clean lactic acid profile, and then just a ton of raspberry, so natural and fresh, instantly summery and sexy, the right mix of tart and sweet, but with the gose still apparent behind it. the flavor is just like the nose, all fruit up front but the saltiness comes in well and dries it out long before it would be done on its own, sweet for only a second, enormously juicy, like putting as many fresh picked raspberries in your mouth at the same time and slowly grinding them down to a sweet and tangy summery pulp. its amazing really. coriander is nice and adds a cool herbal aspect, while the wheat never gets completely covered up either. lemon note to the acid profile, not too sour to drink a lot of either, nice in the belly and with a long flavorful finish. as good of a fruited gose as exists as far as i am concerned. truly next level!\xa01,373 charactersStonedTrippin, Jul 08, 2018', '4.19/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Alesong has created a lovely, fairly traditional Gose that goes perfectly with a summer evening. Bright, clear raspberry color, quite bubbly, with a nice little open head that settles to a little foam island. Aroma is a bit subdued, but very pleasant - more or less raspberry lemonade, but subtle with it. Taste is excellent, following the style very nicely. Raspberries are there for sure, but not dominating. Alesmith has neither stinted on the salt nor over done it, it’s just right for my taste, which is a vital element of a Gose. A little typical sharpness from the coriander and just enough sour to bring the raspberries alive. Feel is great too, very refreshing. Another great beer to contemplate in a hammock at the end of the day.\xa0750 characterssiskiyoucellar, Jun 25, 2018', '4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25A: The beer is hazy purplish red in color. It poured with a short pink head that died down, leaving a thin layer of white bubbles covering the surface and some specks of bubbles down the sides of the glass.
S: Light aromas of sourness are preset in the nose along with notes of raspberries.
T: The taste follows the smell, except that the raspberry flavors are a bit stronger and there are also some hints of saltiness.
M: It feels light- to medium-bodied and a little tart on the palate with a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: This beer is nice and refreshing. I liked how the raspberry flavors were not overpowering.

Serving type: bottle\xa0644 charactersmetter98, Oct 29, 2017', "4.24/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.257/17 bottling date from the Rare Beer Club

A: Pours a nice hazy red with an effervescent pink head. Soda-like head fizzes out fast and leaves no lacing behind. 

S: Big raspberry aroma. Smells fresh and delicious and natural. 

T: Again with the big raspberry flavor but it's not pure raspberry juice like the aroma. This is a semi-sweet, semi-tart mixture of raspberry puree. It's a bit salty on the back end, smoothing it out with a nice crisp and dry finish. 

M: Lighter bodied, smooth and crisp. Lightly salty and just a little dry in the finish. 

O: Really nice raspberry gose. Tasty and refreshing without being overly sweet or sour or salty. Light and crisp and super drinkable.\xa0688 charactersDope, Sep 25, 2017", "3.65/5\xa0\xa0rDev -13.9%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Appearance: Slips out an opaqie, reddish-pink body with no more than a thin, white head.

Smell: Slight, sweetish malts beneath a discharge of pureed raspberries and squirt of lemon. Some lacto noted but the dense fruitiness leaves little room for salt and spice.

Taste: The concoction is rather sweetish yet nimbly tart with, well, not a quite blanket of lactic quality, more like a throw, you know, something that you'd have tossed on the couch. Clap of lemon. Faint saltiness, the coriander is altogether imperceptible. A stream of fruit from beginning to end.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium-plus carbonation.

Overall: Would've preferred something just a bit drier, lighter in body, too. More cultivated, if you will. Not bad, though.\xa0742 charactersChainGangGuy, Sep 21, 2017", '4.29/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.2%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4.25Poured from a 750 mL bottle into a tulip.

Pours a hazy burgundy that looks like an unfiltered, fizzy fruit juice. The head dissipates quickly, and the lacing is scant, but the bubbles are solid and have staying power. A unique look.

The raspberry in the name is no gimmick. The raspberry is very forward on the nose, followed immediately by sour lemons and funk. Simple, but clean and refreshing.

Tart raspberry and lemon, dry funk, and just the perfect hint of trademark salt play across the palate pretty effectively. Each sip is a bit different. Initially the raspberry and funk take the center stage, but as the brew warms more, the salt and lactic acid flavors become somewhat more prevalent. Very acidic, but never offputting, as there is just enough extra raspberry blast happening to balance it out. Excellent balance. Simple but effective.

The mouthfeel is just a shade disappointing compared with everything else about the brew. The carbonation is just a shade weak, and the sweetness, for all of its help on the balance, robs the brew of a bit of its crispness. This isn't a "bad" mouthfeel, it's just not as good as the other aspects of the beer.

I am not a huge gose fan, but this is an excellent fruity take on the style that is pretty darn approachable, particularly for those that find the saltiness of many takes a bit jarring. Recommend.\xa01,372 charactersMindcrime1000, Sep 02, 2017']

name: There Gose Train
review: ["3.87/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.3%look: 2.5 | smell: 3 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75Bright yellow, head dropped to nothing after pour. Drank out of 32 oz crowler. Awesome taste, perfect balance. I love good sours. This tastes so clean and tart, it is a great tasting sour. Could be carbed more, but that's prob cause I saved it. Was shipped in fedex. April can date. Want more.\xa0293 charactersZimples, May 21, 2016"]

name: Grapefruit Gose
review: ['3.48/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.7%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.5not a bad brew, and with some relatively high capacity for refreshment, but next to some definitely superior goses, this really didnt hold up. the grapefruit element is pretty slight, and more like a fresca soda than the real fruit, which is a shame in florida here where they grow so well. the beer is a little lifeless too, thin in body and not as carbonated as i like the style to be, it doesnt quite quench the way it could because of that. the acidity is lactic and clean and citrusy, but its kind of one dimensional and generic as well, not as interesting as it might be, and against a backdrop of pale wheat, there really isnt a whole lot going on here, and as it warms, it gets a little too acidic to want to drink a ton of. that said, the salt element is great, its high and it accentuates the tang and the earthiness and gives it some needed depth. more fresh grapefruit and more carbonation would really improve this, but i drank a can down easy enough as it is. good hot weather brew, but a couple of tweaks would make it great i think.\xa01,048 charactersStonedTrippin, Feb 23, 2018']

name: Short's / Central State - Internet Dating
review: ['4.35/5\xa0\xa0rDev +11.3%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25This feels underrated to me, really nice crisp refreshing sour here. Pours a nice light purple, minimal head but some nice lacing on the edges, smells really nice and jammy. Taste is great - puckering jammy raspberry, nice tart citrus bite, very subtle mellow cucumber to balance some of the tartness. It all works, really nice light tingly mouthfeel, this is a summer crusher.\xa0377 charactersdetpizzaboi, Jul 01, 2019', "3.82/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4From bottle to pint glass. Pinkish red in color with pinkish foam. Aromas of raspberries and salt, with something that's just a touch off-putting that I can't put my finger on. A bit funky in a way that doesn't quite work. Flavor, however is quite nice. One the bigger disconnects between aroma and flavor I've had. Tart raspberry and cool cucumber, with wheat and bread getting kicked with verbena, salt, and a touch of lactic acid.\xa0433 charactersTripel_Threat, Jun 10, 2019", '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.3%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 412 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 4/23/2019. Pours slightly hazy medium orange/amber, light reddish color with a 2 finger fairly dense and fluffy light pink head with great retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big sour/tart/tangy raspberries, fruit skin/seed, lemon, lime, cucumber, mint, peach, pear, melon, apricot, red/green apple, red grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, herbal, floral, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, light peppercorn/lacto/musty funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of raspberries, lemon verbena, cucumbers, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big sour/tart/tangy raspberries, fruit skin/seed, lemon, lime, cucumber, mint, peach, pear, melon, apricot, red/green apple, red grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, herbal, floral, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, light peppercorn/lacto/musty funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tart/sourness, fruit tang, and herbal/grassy bitter/spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/sour raspberries, fruit skin/seed, lemon, lime, cucumber, mint, peach, pear, melon, apricot, red/green apple, red grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, herbal, floral, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, peppercorn, lacto/musty funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Great complexity, robustness, and balance of raspberries, lemon verbena, cucumbers, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; with a great malt/tart/sourness, tangy fruit, and bitter/spiciness balance; with minimal puckering flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp/clean finishing. Moderate increasing dryness from lingering tart/sourness, tangy fruit, and carbonation. Medium-plus carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth and moderately grainy/acidic/tangy/tannic/saline balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5.5%. Overall this is an excellent fruited Gose. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of raspberries, lemon verbena, cucumbers, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth and fairly crisp/clean/refreshing to drink with the moderately acidic/tangy/drying finish; not overly lactic/salty. Great balance between juicy/vibrant raspberries, lemon verbena, cucumbers, salt, and lacto complexity; with a nice clean pale/wheat malt backbone against acidity. Minimal residual sweetness from crisp dryness. A very enjoyable offering, and spot on style example as expected. Not overwhelming on any aspect.\xa02,711 characterssuperspak, May 26, 2019']

name: Cosmic Exoskeleton
review:
