['4.63/5\xa0\xa0rDev +17.8%look: 4.75 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.75Brown appearance, big raspberry and chocolate aroma, tobacco and chocolate flavors follow through with big fresh raspberries, salt and lactose milk sugar\xa0153 charactersStoutElk_92, Mar 20, 2019', "4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 3.75This was poured into a pokal.
The appearance was a fairly thick dark purple to ruddy brown color with a head that started off pretty damn thick. Ended up dissipating to a small rim just concaving itself against the sides of the glass. 
The aroma was thick with black raspberries initially then some red raspberries enter in with a sweet creamy lactose.
The flavor leads with the sweet and tart black raspberries. Red raspberry quality comes back slightly and pushes the lactose in with a sweet creamy fashion. Sly aftertaste of black raspberries and wheat.
The mouthfeel was medium and full bodied. There's a certain thickness to this not usually associated with the style that I don't mind. Carbonation felt fairly low, but I didn't mind for me. ABV felt appropriate. Finish was dry with a powdery like grip along my tongue and a touch of bitterness.
Overall, odd gose to say the least. At least, nothing traditional but since I know the brewery I'm dealing with, I'm not holding it against them. This would definitely be one to come back to when Spring comes around.\xa01,068 charactersLone_Freighter, Feb 02, 2019"]

name: Gose w/ Blackberries and Apricots
review:
["4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.9%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Can't say I really enjoyed this beer greatly, but it can't be because I'm not a big gose fan as the salinity is not there. I think it's because it's very fruit forward, and very tart - and perhaps I'm just not digging these particular fruits as I normally enjoy most lambics too. Blackberries can sometimes be a little strong for my palate when they're not overly sweet, so I'm going to call it at that. I think I might have preferred it more if the fruit was more muted, but then again, I guess then it would have been a different beer. Other than that - the look, smell and mouthfeel are all pretty solid.\xa0611 charactershopley, Jun 17, 2018", '4.03/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.2%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Crowler shared by Matthew. Thanks man!

Bright ruby body with a thin pink collar. Aromas of blackberry right up front, followed by alcohol, bread. Stone fruit (apricot) emerges in the flavor. Mild puckering sensation. Light sweetness. Pretty good.\xa0247 charactersHuhzubendah, Nov 19, 2016', "4.07/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4Crowler purchased 11/3/16 at brewery. Poured into Belgian ale glass.

L: 2F+ foamy head, but with no retention, ends up just leaving very thin ring. Beer is a deep magenta, like their Raspberry/Blackberry Gose of high repute.

S: All apricots and berries up front. The tiniest hints of wheat and yeast and no hint of salinity. 

T: Really nice apricots and blackberries up front. Very clean fruit flavors. Muted are the Gose characteristics of the wheat backbone, coriander (can't taste it), and briny finish (very, very barely). You could almost sell this as fruit juice. A step down from the other Gose and honestly comes off as a very good Lambic.

F: Light bodied, medium carbonation. Very crisp and clean. Leaves the palate a bit sour.

O: Absolutely poundable because it tastes so great, but it's not world class like their other Goses because it doesn't come off as a Gose.\xa0881 charactersIvoryFoxhole, Nov 06, 2016", '4.19/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.7%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.75On tap at brewery:
Ok, this isn't a "traditional Gose" - whatever that means. Trying to balance the style and fruit additives/adjuncts.

Clear rosé leaning burgundy color and clear. Nice pinkish head, but there's a lot out of style here, despite it looking decent.

Big on the apricot, lightly tart, maybe a bit of berry, but kinda indistinct. Lacking salinity to me.

Apricot right up front on a slightly tanic base. Tart, with a nice carbonation level a little above average, which is good. The blackberry grabs the back end of the taste.

Ok, to me this is more of a tart fruit beer, maybe even leaning lambic (tartness, though the barrel/funk is obviously missing). I get a little salinity mid-to-late taste, but I am searching for it. Ignoring all that, I really enjoyed drinking this beer, whatever style it fits into.\xa0832 characterscjgiant, Nov 05, 2016']

name: Margarita In Gose
review:
["2.89/5\xa0\xa0rDev -24.7%look: 3 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 2.5 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3I like Second Self. I really like most goses. This is not a good beer. Haven't written a review in awhile but this one inspired me.

I can appreciate an attempt at something different, but this came up short.

Aftertaste leaves a sticky lime-y flavor and feel. Almost like a corona with 3 limes.\xa0295 charactersBorn_Beerknurd, Jan 27, 2018", "3.18/5\xa0\xa0rDev -17.2%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3 | feel: 3 | overall: 3To be fair, Goses / sour beers are not my thing I keep on trying them because they are all the rage. This particular Gose sounded interesting, because I do like a good margarita. This Gose did taste margarita-esque, but it's not something I want with my beer, I suppose. It was also a bit too tart for my liking.\xa0317 charactersiheartmyTHO, Aug 27, 2017"]

name: Passionfruit Gose
review:
['4.06/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4Poured from a 12 oz can into a nonic pint. 

A: Clear straw gold with short-lived off-white cap of head with no lacing.

S: Early sour sock and hot dog aroma gives way to more fruity passionfruit and mango aromas with time.

T: Exceptional flavor for the style with slight salinity up front giving way to a grainy mid-palate and finishing with a zesty passionfruit, peach, and lemon-lime flavors. 

M: Dangerously crushable with light body, above average carbonation, and dry finish.

O: Best adjunct gose I have had by far -- delicious blending of fruity flavors with light salinity and grainy malty character. Another winner from Coelacanth -- I hope they keep pushing more beer up our way from Norfolk. Impressed with superior execution on both this an Kopimanis.\xa0766 charactersargock, Mar 26, 2018', "3.59/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75A bit more filtered than I would prefer, but the salinity that is still there is how I think Gose's should taste when done true to style, but also why I'm not a huge fan of them\xa0177 charactersVeganUndead, Feb 26, 2018", '3.32/5\xa0\xa0rDev -13.1%look: 3.25 | smell: 3 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.25Nice tart beer, even though I do not get a lot of passionfruit. tART is good ans mouth feel is refreshing and tart. Overall good, looks good and is tart and balanced. Flavor lacks a bit but a good beer\xa0202 charactershophugger, Oct 11, 2017', '3.92/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.6%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Coelacanth Brewing "Passionfruit Gose"
$3/5 oz. on tap at the brewery on 17 June 2017

Notes: 4.5% ABV. Slightly hazy straw gold body beneath a bright white head that displays limited head retention and lacing. The aroma is tartish, peppery, and fruity. The taste is tart, earthy, fruity with lemon and passionfruit, and peppery. Dry finish from the tartness as it has only a limited bitterness. Light bodied and gently crisp.\xa0426 charactersNeroFiddled, Aug 07, 2017']

name: Ginger Gose
review: ["3.68/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.8%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75On tap at Brewer's Republic in CO Springs. Light golden color, no head. Aroma was pretty light, just a touch of ginger and a light salty smell. The flavors were pretty subdued, mainly ginger, kinda lacking from most Gose's in that it really didn't have that tart, salty flavor that I really love in a Gose. Was not terribly impressed with this one.\xa0348 characterstimontheroad, Oct 22, 2015", '3.58/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5a new one from almanac, maybe their newest, at least in colorado. its good beer, on tap at tap and handle in for collins. i was surprised how little this seemed like a gose. to me, its more of a ginger pale ale or something. sure i get a little salt and some herbal quality, either hops or coriander, depending on impression, but its not much like a gose as i know them. i dont get a lot of wheat malt on it, its crystal clear and more brassy darker colored than the style usually allows for, and also real light on the sourness. i thought these were all quick lacto beers, but this one presents almost no acidity. despite all the body and the salt that does come on strong mid way though, it just lacks that hazy raw bucket beer thing that makes gose so original. this is too cleaned up, too refined, and it misses the mark a bit for me, especially for almanac, who is so good at beers like this. as for the ginger, its lively and fresh, quite pungent, almost at the expense of the more delicate parts of the beer, but refreshing and zippy on the back end. carbonation is there, but there is a little more body than i need and a little too much leftover sugar for me to want more than one. mixed feeling about almanac lately. if the price points were lower, itd be all good, but at these prices i need to be impressed...\xa01,321 charactersStonedTrippin, Oct 07, 2015']

name: Sheen
review:
['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 416 oz. can.
Moderate pour yields a 3/4 inch white head over a bright body with slight lacing after head subsides. Nose of coriander, citrus, and salt. Flavor mirrors nose somewhat with the citrus and salt taking over just a bit too much for me. Nice feel and overall a good representation of the style.\xa0302 charactersbobv, Oct 23, 2017', "4.72/5\xa0\xa0rDev +13.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.75Poured into a stange.
The appearance was a deep straw yellow color with a foamy white finger's worth of head that slid off fairly quick. Not much lace.
The aroma had a nice blend of crushed coriander, salt, sour-ed wheat, a tart lemon edge and a subtle earthiness even slighter underneath.
The flavor was mildly sour with a substantial coriander and tart lemon edge pushing forward into the balance. Mild aftertaste of the sour-ed wheat with the salt.
The mouthfeel was between light and medium bodied, perhaps leaning closer to light bodied with a fantastic crushability about it. Carbonation felt spot on. ABV felt as projected. Mild sour-ed wheat to crushed coriander finish.
Overall, it's as if Deciduous decided to replicate an exact copy of the true style which to me I have to rate high because this was exceptionally well done. Thank you for not overdoing with excessive adjuncts just to be overly creative.\xa0915 charactersLone_Freighter, Oct 08, 2017", "4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Purchased cold - 16oz can dated 7/13/17 - Poured into an English pub glass

L - Pours a clear gold color with a densely foamy 2 finger head on a mildly aggressive pour. Dissipating quickly it leaves a thin cap over the beer itself and a foamy ring around the glass. Delicate wispy lacing as it goes down, which also dissipates quickly.

S - Saltines, coriander, and a twang of sour on the nose.

T - A love tap of sour, coriander and saline with bits of malt poking through. 

F - Light bodied with light, sharp carbonation.

O - This is a very well executed gose. I'm not a fan of coriander, but in this beer it isn't overpowering or offensive, instead it lends itself to the overall flavor profile and is beautifully balanced. Really, thoroughly enjoyed this one to the last drop.\xa0782 charactersMonkey-D-Luffy, Aug 03, 2017", '3.99/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.9%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Sample at the Granite State Brewers Festival. 
Hazy deep straw color without much of a head. Spicy earthy tasty and salt with hints of crackery malt underneath. Tasty Gose.\xa0172 charactersjohnnnniee, Jul 30, 2017']

name: Sea Cucumbo Gose
review:
['3.12/5\xa0\xa0rDev -16.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 3 | taste: 3 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3Tasted in a pint glass from a one pint can on September 27, 2019. I like gose and I like cucumbers but this did not work for me. Tastes like carbonated cucumber juice.\xa0167 charactersHopheadjeffery, Sep 28, 2019', '4.03/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8.3%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Obtained as a 4-pack of pint cans from the PW Dojo on its release weekend, three days ago. This is crisp and fresh, a great summer sipper. Lemon, the salty twang of a sea breeze, celery, pear, and of course, cucumber.\xa0217 charactersdarktronica, Aug 22, 2018', '3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75650ml bottle, undated but purchased fresh, poured into a Pipeworks snifter glass.

The beer pours a dullish golden color, lemon hues with some haziness and a foamy and fizzy white head, moderate retention that offers a bit of soapy lace. The aroma is pleasant, soft cucumber, light mineral water with some floral aromas, a touch of citrus peel with pale wheat grain and a nice amount of salty brine. The flavors echo the nose well, refreshing and crisp cucumber with some lemon zest and more assertive sea salt while the finish is more grain forward with a little bit of floral character and a strong mineral water profile. The mouthfeel is good, very lively, zippy and crisp with a light body that coats well and finishes tartly and dryly. 

Verdict: A very good Gose from Pipeworks. Refreshing, crisp, bright and the cucumber is a nice touch, really makes for a great summer beer.\xa0882 characterskevanb, Dec 07, 2017', "3.83/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Look is very light yellow and pours with 1/2 a finger of bright white head. Dissipation is rapid.

Aroma is cucumber and sea salt. Neither one overpowers the other. 

Taste follows nose. Cucumber upfront, sea salt and a bit of tartness. 

Feel is crisp and refreshing. 

Overall a nice gose with an unusual ingredient. All things considered it's pretty well executed in my opinion.\xa0383 charactersFFFjunkie, Jul 30, 2017"]

name: Shanghai Noon
review:
['3.67/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.2%look: 4 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.7516 oz can poured into a shaped IPA glass.

Appearance
Straw blonde. Good clarity. Moderate carbonation. Short head fizzles out quickly.

Nose
Pear, sweat, lychee, lactic acid, SweeTarts, and lemon juice.

Taste
Light lactic sourness, lemon juice, SweeTarts, and mineral water. Hints of prickly pear and lychee fruit. Light malt backbone of caramel and cereal grains.

Mouthfeel
Light bodied, crisp, tart, and refreshing.

Overall
A decent Gose with light flavors of lychee and pear.\xa0482 charactersjustintcoons, Oct 26, 2017', '3.24/5\xa0\xa0rDev -14.5%look: 3 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.25Poured from a tallboy into a tulip. Sadly, this beer met expectations...which were, admittedly, rock bottom. Saccharine juice through the palate with a lager finish. Not even a hint of salt - a gose in name only. What are you doing Platform?\xa0245 charactersLAp, May 03, 2017', "4.06/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.1%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Poured out of a 16 oz can into one of my weizen glasses, this beer pours a clear, fairly pale, medium golden color, with a shite head that's about an inch thick when first poured that settles very quickly tp a thin ring lining the inside of the glass. Barely any lacing. Also has lots of streams of little bubbles rapidly and continuously rising to the beer's surface. Aromas of pair tart and alright. Not much else though, if anything at all. Some of the lychee I suppose. Has a somewhat sweet pair taste followed by nice tart and salty notes and a bit more sweetness from the lychee. A very refreshing taste overall, and a very nice representation of this style hat also has a it if its own unique twist. Has a crisp, slightly prickly, yet smooth, light to medium bodied mouthfeel with moderate carbonation. Has a smooth finish along with a somewhat dry, tart and salty aftertaste. A very enjoyable beer all around.

Eric\xa0934 charactersneenerzig, Apr 23, 2017", '3.81/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.5%look: 3 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.7516oz can poured into a weizen glass
A: Pale yellow with buttles that instantly settle, no head to speak of
S: Every note on the can is there - prickly pear, lychee, tart/salty
T: This is quite tasty, again matching the nose. The tartness of the prickly pear matches the sweetness of the lychee with a light salinity from the style
M: Light-bodied, a nice sweet/sour balance
O: Well-made, quite tasty\xa0399 charactersONUMello, Mar 22, 2017']

name: Never Never Weak Weak
review:
["3.62/5\xa0\xa0rDev -12.1%look: 3 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5This is straight-up carbonated juice. Strawberry-banana (I agree with a previous review that there is banana flavor) and pineapple. Not complex at all at least in terms of flavor. It smells kind of like beer but doesn't taste like it. It's a fruit smoothie with a hint of beer. Meh.\xa0282 charactersLucular, Nov 13, 2018", '3.49/5\xa0\xa0rDev -15.3%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Poured from a 16 oz can into a tulip glass.

Pours an opaque deep magenta color with a small, bubbly off-white head. The head is gone instantly and leaves very little in the way of lacing.

The aroma brings notes of strawberries, pineapples, and blueberries. Literally a fruit smoothie.

The flavor starts with fresh pineapples and berries, and finishes with subtly tart strawberries.

The feel is medium-light bodied with soft carbonation. Very refreshing and finishes exceptionally dry.

Overall, a good Gose that is exploding with fruit flavor. The tartness is present but restrained. This is a beer smoothie.\xa0612 charactersScaryEd, Sep 05, 2018']

name: Gygax
review:
['3.83/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 4.25A: The beer is relatively clear yellow in color and has a light amount of visible carbonation. It poured with a quarter finger high bright white head that left a large patch of bubbles on the surface and a collar around the edge of the glass.
S: Light to moderate aromas of quinine are present in the nose along with notes of grapefruit.
T: The taste follows the smell and has lots of flavors of quinine (similar to what you would expect from tonic water) along with a bit stronger notes of grapefruit. There is a faint amount of sourness.
M: It feels light- to medium-bodied on the palate and has a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: This beer lives up to its name and tastes just like tonic water with an added dash of grapefruit juice. It is light and refreshing to drink.

Serving type: can\xa0795 charactersmetter98, Jun 02, 2019', "4.16/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.9%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4.5I had this beer on-tap in a mug at Special Brews in Lynnwood, WA.

Appearance: light yellow hue with the tiniest touch of haze and a thin layer of white foam. Attractive enough, and about what you'd expect from the style.

Smell: quite tart, with some sweet and fruity notes and just a dash of funk. It's pretty enticing.

Taste: bright sourness with plenty of fruity character, backed up with a bit of a bitter bite and enough sweetness to engender a candylike flavor. I can see how people call this a soda-pop, but basically it's just a darn good sour.

Mouthfeel: medium-light body with a good level of carbonation and a decent level of creaminess for the style.

Overall: a massively thirst-quenching sour with just enough funk to be interesting and enough sweetness to be balanced. I really like it.\xa0812 charactersflagmantho, May 15, 2019", "4.24/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25With the aid of tonic, quinine, alcohol and milk sugars, the brewers at Omnipollo are going to make sure that we all sleep like a baby tonight. Their distinctively spiced sour ale does so with a rounded taste of gin and tonic with a margarita twist.

But leading through dreams of dungeons and dragons, Gygax pours with a lemony golden color and slighted with a sprinkle of haze. Its airy and frothy cap entices the nose with a crisp and tangy scent of citrus, cider, white wine and green berries. A gentle must of funk precedes an initial taste of taffy, light cream and candy for a brief key lime pie memory.

The brisk and acidic ale washes over the tastebuds with a fruity taste that hinges on lime, lemon, grapefruit, kiwi, honeydew, white grape, crabapple and gooseberry. Trending playfully sour, the fruits turn gently dry and minerally with the crispness of seltzer and tonic leading the way. A mild earthen character of cork and burlap adorn the finish while a light piney bitterness awaits.

Light, crisp and highly refreshing, the beer's balance for sourness comes via a creamy sweetness from lactose that almost interfered with the beer's utmost drinkable gin and tonic nature. But its a delicious and dry ale that easily takes the place of gin cocktails or margaritas at any outdoor summer occasion.\xa01,312 charactersBEERchitect, May 04, 2019", '4.4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +13.1%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5Great beer, not sure what was going on with the couple brutal ratings. This is great, very big grapefruit, sour, tart, quenching, nice full body, subtle salt, slight bittnerness, tastes like a cocktail, very nice.\xa0213 charactersdetpizzaboi, May 03, 2019', '4.18/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.5%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.516 ounce can into tulip glass, canned in 3/2019. Pours fairly hazy pale golden yellow color with a 2 finger dense and fluffy off white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice dense foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of big juicy/tart/tangy red grapefruit, lemon, lime, citrus peel/zest, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, tonic water, coriander, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, vanilla, cream, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of grapefruit, fruity/acidic yeast, quinine, coriander, sea salt, lactose, and pale/wheat malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big juicy/tart/tangy red grapefruit, lemon, lime, citrus peel/zest, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, tonic water, coriander, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, vanilla, cream, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang; light citrus peel bitterness, and coriander spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/tangy red grapefruit, lemon, lime, citrus peel/zest, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, tonic water, coriander, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, vanilla, cream, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of grapefruit, fruity/acidic yeast, quinine, coriander, sea salt, lactose, and pale/wheat malt flavors; with an awesome malt/tartness and tangy fruit balance; with zero puckering flavors after the finish. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering tartness, tangy fruit, and carbonation. Medium-plus carbonation and medium body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/grainy, and fairly crisp/acidic/tangy/saline balanced mouthfeel that is fantastic. Zero warming alcohol for 6%. Overall this is an outstanding fruit gose. All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of grapefruit, fruity/acidic yeast, quinine, coriander, sea salt, lactose, and pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth, refreshing, and fairly crisp to drink with the mellowly acidic/tangy/drying finish; not overly lactic or salty. Awesome balance of juicy grapefruit, quinine, coriander, salt, and Lacto complexity; with a great lactose, and pale/wheat malt backbone against acidity. Mild residual sweetness with crisp dryness. A highly enjoyable offering, and impressive spot on style example as expected of the brewery.\xa02,650 characterssuperspak, May 01, 2019', '1/5\xa0\xa0rDev -74.3%look: 1 | smell: 1 | taste: 1 | feel: 1 | overall: 1This stuff absolutely sucks. Paid almost $6 for a can at total wine Greenville SC. Very little grapefruit. No smoothness you would expect to have lactose,has Some kind of fruit flavor, but tastes terrible and had one of the worst aftertaste I’ve ever experienced in a beer. Almost like a goody powder! Wish I could give it a negative bc I damn sure would!!!!!\xa0361 charactersRC_Saunders, Apr 26, 2019', '2.3/5\xa0\xa0rDev -40.9%look: 3 | smell: 3 | taste: 2 | feel: 3 | overall: 1.5Meh. It’s supposedly a “Grapefruit Tonic Gose” with quinine, but damned if I could detect any bitterness. Basically an adult grapefruit soda, and not even notably grapefruity at that, just typical Gose tartness. Refreshing enough, but if I want a soda I’ll get a soda. It wouldn’t even rank high among tonic waters, what with the imperceptible quinine.\xa0362 characterssanhedrin, Apr 11, 2019']

name: Double Seesaw: Cherry
review:
["3.92/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75Trillium Double Seesaw Cherry, 16 oz can sent from egrandfield. Can date 2/13/19. Served at 50 F
Poured into Sierra Nevada Spiegl Glass. 

Kool-Aid red with a bright pink bubble gum head of 4 fingers, receding quickly to 1/2 finger. Sparse lacing up the sides. 

Aromas of sour cherry and vinegar, slight mineral, hints of saltine. 

Flavor is acidic mineral-y cherry, slight soursop, vinegar, lime, mineral, and more cherry. 

Feel is undercarbonated to me, with a slick feel and almost nitro-level creaminess. 

Overall, I wasn't overly impressed with this Trillium offering. It's refreshing though, and has a nice acidic tart bite. Recommended if you like Gose and you are near Trillium.\xa0690 charactersThe-Adjunct-Hippie, May 14, 2019", '4.27/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.9%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25My favorite offering in the Seesaw series thus far. Huge cherry pie filling character in the aromas and flavors, with a nice clean and refreshing mouthfeel. Although still a bit sour for a gose, the sourness works here more than it did in the previous variants 

86/100\xa0269 charactersHolderness, Feb 23, 2019', "3.83/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 4L: Pours a lovely ruby red, deep blood red in the glass, with rose pink head.

S: Sweet and tangy, lots of cherries and notes of other berries

T: Not as sweet as the nose led me to believe. Less tart than I had expected as well. Cherries, with the barest hint of salt. More mellow on the finish than I'm used to from Seesaws.

F: Nice carbonation. Almost a little oily.

O: Pretty good, but not my favorite Seesaw.\xa0415 charactersTwitch, Feb 15, 2019"]

name: Side Piece
review:
['2.46/5\xa0\xa0rDev -33.5%look: 3 | smell: 2.5 | taste: 2.5 | feel: 1.75 | overall: 2.5**
01/13/2018

**\xa0183 charactersq33jeff, Jan 13, 2018', '4.01/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8.4%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4I got this beer before Thanksgiving. When I poured it into the glass I loved the red color of it. It tasted exactly as I expected, a hint cranberry with the right amount of sour! Hope they bring it back, it was the only Gose I could find in the Jersey Shore!\xa0258 charactersJerty, Jan 03, 2017']

name: Unicorn Joose
review:
['4.13/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.3%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25The beer has a nice purplish pink color that is opaque. The beer also has some little black stuff at the bottom but that doesn’t really detract from anything.

The smell is fruity with the more sweet fruit coming out with only a hint of tartness.

The taste is the same as the smell. The different fruits blend well together to the point where you can barely tell them apart.

The feel is good. It has a medium body and goes down smooth.\xa0439 charactersHattedClassic, Dec 15, 2018', '4.22/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.2%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 432 ounce crowler into tulip glass, no can dating. Bit of a gusher upon opening. Pours very murky ruby red/pink color with no head retention or lacing. Fair amount of streaming carbonation. Good appearance. Aromas of big juicy/lightly tart/tangy kiwi, strawberry, passion fruit, guava, mango, melon, fruit skin/seeds, wheat, cracker, white bread, light salt/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/light acidic yeast, fruits, salt, and pale/wheat malt notes; with great strength. Taste of huge juicy/lightly tart/tangy kiwi, strawberry, passion fruit, guava, mango, melon, fruit skin/seeds, wheat, cracker, white bread, light salt/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light fruity/lactic tartness and fruit tang on the finish. Lingering notes of kiwi, strawberry, passion fruit, guava, mango, melon, fruit skin/seeds, wheat, cracker, white bread, light salt/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/light acidic yeast, fruits, salt, and pale/wheat malt flavors; with an awesome malt/tartness and tangy fruit balance; with zero cloying/puckering flavors after the finish. Lightly increasing dryness from tartness and tangy fruit. Medium carbonation and medium-plus body; with a very smooth, creamy/bready/grainy, and lightly acidic/tangy/tannic/saline balanced mouthfeel that is fantastic. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 3.5%. Overall this is a fantastic fruited gose! All around outstanding complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/light acidic yeast, fruits, salt, and pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth and refreshing to drink with the mellowly acidic/tangy/tannic/drying finish, not overly lactic. Extremely jammy fruit flavors, with nice base gose style presence. A highly enjoyable offering, and great style example.\xa01,860 characterssuperspak, May 19, 2018']

name: Go Ahead
review:
["2.86/5\xa0\xa0rDev -23.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 2.25 | feel: 1.5 | overall: 2.5Very tart, quite sour. I wouldn't want to have more than the 355mL presented in the can.
The head fades after a few seconds but the nose is nice. Let's also mention that this is a 5.20 ABV, not as noted here.
Drinking this once was enough. This is not my style.\xa0261 charactersCramshawbar, Jul 15, 2019", '3.78/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.1%look: 3.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75355 ml can, served col into a chalice. Canned December 10, 2018.

Appearance - raspberry colored brew with some haze, a thin half finger of white head that burns away very quickly. Looks like fruit juice with a touch of carbonation.

Smell - Lots of sweet, ripe raspberries, a touch of wheat and some apple and pear combo in the background. Raspberry is the primary focus of this beer though.

Taste - Lots of raspberries, tart, acidic with a bit of creaminess coming from the wheat in this gose. A touch flowery in the taste which is the hibiscus of course. Saltiness comes through with repeat sips.

Mouthfeel - Tart, prickly and reasonably dry with a slightly salty and peppery finish on the tongue.

Overall - A pretty good flavored gose, that would probably be enhanced on a hot summer day.\xa0795 characterstaxandbeerguy, Apr 23, 2019', "3.78/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Not a long review, just enough to say that I quite enjoyed this beer. Raspberry and the hibiscus are both present on the nose and on the tongue. Tart, and yes, I get the salt. Acidity from the fruits probably adds to this beer. A good beer that is tart and refreshing. I'd have another on a hot summer day easily.\xa0315 characterspolloenfuego, Jan 19, 2019", "4.19/5\xa0\xa0rDev +12%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Very pretty ruby beer. Great summer patio beer. (I would drink 2+ in a row in the summer.)

It would be a slam dunk if it were a bit salty; it's leaning on its sweetness.

Definitely tastes like Swedish berries (although sour) in a great way.\xa0242 charactersMpawliuk, Jan 05, 2019", "4.08/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9.1%look: 3.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4.25355 mL can from the LCBO; dated Nov 21 2018 and served slightly chilled. Listed at 5.2%.

Pours a hazy reddish-pink colour, capped with one finger of fizzy, pale pink-tinged head that has almost completely dissipated within sixty seconds. The surface is totally bare: no cap or collar, not even a smudge of lace. Oh well: that's the way it sometimes goes with gose... at least the colour is attractive. Raspberry fruit and hibiscus flowers are the most notable aspects of the aroma by a considerable margin, with mild lactic acidity and brine being the only other smells of note.

Good stuff, though perhaps not the most assertive gose out there - it has some sourness, obviously, but it integrates so beautifully with the inherent tartness of the raspberry purée that the impact of the overall acidity is lessened (if that makes any sense). The raspberry hits you right off the bat, overlapping with light, wheaty grain and floral hibiscus notes. The lactic acidity peaks towards the finish, with easily-missed suggestions of salt and coriander popping up briefly prior to (and during) an aftertaste of raspberries and lacto sourness. Medium-light in body, with moderate carbonation levels that prickle and scrub the palate softly with each passing sip; very refreshing to drink, too. 

Final Grade: 4.08, an A-. Left Field's Go-Ahead is exactly the sort of beer I'd love to have in my hand at the next Jays' game. I don't think I'd call this an amazing gose, but I do think it's a solid variation upon that theme - as others have noted, this would be a good brew to give to a newbie, as its low saltiness, low-to-moderate sourness and tasty raspberry/hibiscus flavours serve to make this beer much more approachable than the average gose. Well worth trying, and certainly not the last time I'll be having this one.\xa01,817 charactersthehyperduck, Jan 02, 2019", "3.9/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Super short lived head. Clear candy apple red brew, just colour, no lace, nohint of a head. Tart raspberry nose, not a ton of hibiscus to me. Big fruit to taste, and now some hibiscus which helps dry things out on the palate. Not super sour like some other goses I've had. Useful probably to gently introduce somebody to the style. Drinkable.\xa0342 charactersTerryW, Dec 01, 2018", "3.67/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.9%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75A Gose brewed with raspberry and hibiscus. The salt is present but not strongly. The focus of the flavour is the raspberry and hibiscus, which are very strong. Only lightly sour- while the nose gives off a lacto aroma, this is muted a bit in the flavour, probably by the fruit. Decent, but not really my thing. It is hard not to see this beer as a take-off on Rosee d'Hibiscus, despite that beer not being soured.\xa0413 charactersjrenihan, Oct 09, 2016"]

name: Bianca Blueberry Lassi Gose
review:
['4.28/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.4%look: 4.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25A 330ml bottle with a best before date of 1st April 2017. Poured into a Lost Abbey teku glass.

Appearance: A deep dark purple-ish red colour with a one finger purple-ish pink colour head that dissipated fairly quickly while leaving some sparse lacing.

Aroma: Tart and sour with a Ribena like aroma of blueberry, blackcurrant and grape with hints of grapefruit.

Taste: Tart and lightly sour. Again like the aroma, the Ribena comes through with blackcurrant, blueberry and grape. There is also hints of salt. Sourness increases towards the end along with acidity.

Mouthfeel: Light bodied with high spritzy carbonation.

Overall: Very refreshing and very easy to drink with nice amount of fruit and tartness.\xa0709 characterskitch, Mar 21, 2017', '4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.9%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.5330 mL bottle. Pours a murky deep purple (with some really icky purple gunk inside the cap and neck). Smells of intense berries. Like blackcurrant. Hefty lactic aroma, like yogurt. Tastes of blackcurrant, mineral flavor, yogurt. Sharp tartness. Light body. Impressive.\xa0276 charactersAlieniloquium, Jan 02, 2017', '4.17/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.2%look: 4 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 4The colour is deep, warm purple-red, the liquid is clear. The finger thick airy pink-purple head sinks down to a few bubbles leaving no lacing on the glass.

The smell is a bit tart with distinct notes of fresh unripe bilberries, and a touch of sea salt. Tart hints of dry apple cider, raspberries and green wine grapes.

The taste is sour-tart with passing notes of bilberries, blueberries, salty sea water, unripe red berries and sour fruit candy. Light balanced clean sweetness. Light to medium body. Growing salt and somewhat harsh unripe red fruits/berries in the aftertaste as well as salty sea water, bilberries, rosehips and blueberry chewing gum. The long finish got fresh bilberry/raspberry/juniper flavours and a hint of salty liquorice.

The carbonation is mild, yet there are lots of very small fresh long-lived bubbles. The liquid is light and quite harsh in the mouth. 

Very far from a macro pale lager, this is a highly refreshing and fruity take on the gose style. Enjoyable!\xa0993 charactersbark, Oct 19, 2016', "4.42/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.7%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5All about refreshing blueberries. A tart and balanced gose. The salt brings roundness but doesn't alter the taste. It's a really good brew, real blueberry. Nonetheless I think the raspberry one was much more complex\xa0215 charactersBruno74200, Aug 26, 2016", '4.13/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.2%look: 4.75 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 4.25Easy pouring, with a strong bouquet of blueberry yoghurt in a blender. Tastes light and ribena-y, with a slight salty kiss at the end. Thin mouth feel typical of the style. Definitely worth seeking out this range.\xa0213 charactersstereophobic, Jul 19, 2016', '4.35/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.1%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.2533cl bottle. Dark ruby pour with a medium height pink head. Blueberries, grapefruit, sour cherries, yogurt, unripe mango and a ton of fruit sourness, tobacco (the taste it leaves in your mouth after you smoke a lot), followed by lactic acid and a hint of farmhouse funk. Sour aftertaste, full of fruit. Quite refreshing. Did I say it’s sour as hell?\xa0351 charactersMarius, Jun 14, 2016', '4.35/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.1%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25Dark, crimson color with pink head, looks gorgeous. Aroma is straight-up blueberry yogurt. Fruity, slightly sweet and lactic. Taste starts tart up-front with lots of blueberries. Finishes fruity and acidic. Medium, soft body with just the right amount of carbonation. Another great gose from Omnipollo. Tart, extremely fruity, great looks, nice mouthfeel and it has the extra yogurt feel from the lactose.\xa0405 charactersCiocanelu, Apr 28, 2016']

name: Fruit Saxx (Mango & Passionfruit)
review:
["4.32/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Poured from a 1 day old growler into a tulip. Appearance is a hazy golden yellow with a fairly thin white head that dissipates quickly. The nose is all mango and passionfruit, with touches of tartness and saltiness. The taste is loaded with tropical fruits, touches of pine from the mangos, and good levels of tartness. The salt is also clearly present and adds wonderful complexities. This is a great brew! It's not quite as sour or salty as other examples of the style, but the fruit additions are absolutely perfect for this beer.\xa0533 characterszimm421, Oct 12, 2015", '4.58/5\xa0\xa0rDev +10.1%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5Certainly the best sour central Ohio has ever produced. Super juicy, taste is purely tart mango and passionfruit, just as you would expect. Really hazy color and rich yellow in color. Definitely going to pick up a growler next time they do this (if they do it again).\xa0270 charactersAlienSwineFlu, Oct 06, 2015', '4.51/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8.4%look: 5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5On tap at the Konkey Dong release.

Pours out a beautiful, hazy orange. Looks like orange juice in the glass.

Aroma is completely dominated by the mango and passionfruit addition. Very fruit smelling with a hint of tartness.

Taste is also passionfruit and mango forward! Peach, guava, orange, passionfruit, mango notes burst out of the glass with a light tartness and bit of salinity. Has a very juicy quality.

Mouthfeel was crisp and body light.

Super easy to drink and crushable! Almost seems like a Sour version of Avery Lilikoi Kepolo. Awesome stuff!\xa0558 charactersJohnnyMc, Oct 06, 2015']

name: Surly Gose
review:
["4.36/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8.5%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5had ton tap at beer hall

Appearance was crystal clear yellow and perfect white head. Great lacing. Aroma is a little wheat and tart, the taste follows, great tartness and that great gose saltiness, the beer has great body and doesn't feel watery like many Goses do. Overall one of the most flavorful and best examples of the style that I've had.\xa0346 charactersStillyman11, Mar 10, 2016", '4.29/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.7%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5On tap at Surly’s Beer Hall. Served in a 16 oz. chalice.

Appearance: Color is a clear golden orange. Moderate amount of bubbles and a solid finger of white head which settles into a thin creamy layer. 

Smell: A crisp and tart sour aroma with a scent of grains and salt. Upfront acidic and tart scent. Wheat grains with some hints of straw, cracker, and yeast. Nice hints of sea salt. Some mild spice hints as well. A pretty solid smell. 

Taste: Like the nose hints at, a tart and crisp sour taste with notes of grains and salt. Upfront tart and sour taste with some lactic acid. Wheat grains with some crisp notes of cracker, straw, and yeast. Solid notes of sea salt. Some coriander notes. Pretty nice taste. 

Mouthfeel: Light bodied with a moderate level of carbonation. Crisp, tangy, and pretty drying. 

Overall: A good take on a Gose. Nice balance of tartness and salt.\xa0880 charactersMattyG85, Feb 14, 2016']

brewery: Three Notch'd Brewing Company - Charlottesville Brewery & Restaurant
name: Passionfruit Gose
review:
['4.13/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Canned on 05/21/19. 

Well-executed fruit gose with inviting slightly bready/bread crust Pils malt backbone both in flavor and aroma with extremely tropical and lemon-lime fruit aroma which settles some on the flavor but is still refreshing while remaining Light body with heavy carbonation. Excellent example of a fruited gose.\xa0328 charactersargock, Jun 08, 2019', '3.81/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Amazing aroma of passionfruit and a nice touch of skunkiness. Mild head and lacing. Taste is nicely sour passionfruit and orange. Mouth feel is tingly and refreshing and finish is relatively clean with a bit of citrusy souriness at the end\xa0239 charactershophugger, Jul 08, 2018', '4.05/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.2%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4L) Pours a hazy amber color with a very small and ephemeral head.

S) The smell is delightful, very forward with acidic passion-fruit that prickles the nose. Incredibly inviting for fruit lovers.

T) The taste is very tart, with a clean and distinct passion-fruit profile. Other fruit notes are there, like guava and citrus, but there is no mistaking the juice they actually used in this brew.

F) This brew has a decent mouth-feel and is perfectly carbonated for the style. Very refreshing.

O) This is a very solid passion-fruit soured beer. I would recommend to anyone that enjoys easy drinking kettle sours or fruited tart beers.\xa0633 charactersDewsby, May 18, 2018', "4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.9%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4L: Had this on-tap at Three Notch'd, poured into a pint glass. Had a pinkish-red color and a slightly hazy consistency. There was a small amount of foamy, off white head that quickly dissipated. Pretty good lacing.

S: A solid aroma of passion fruit (of course), sea salt, wheat, and some other light fruit.

T: Tasted of a moderate amount of wheat (not overly noticeable), a lot of passion fruit (not overpowering), a good amount of sea salt, and little bit of citrus (lemon, I think). An extremely focused and direct flavor. It's definitely on the tart side, but this hardly matters. Pretty tasty.

F: A well-carbonated beer with a lively finish. Light-bodied.

O: A very well made and drinkable gose. Sweet, light, and easy to drink.\xa0736 charactersavalon07, Apr 20, 2018"]

name: Pineapple Gose
review:
['3.96/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Aroma is pineapple and big wheat grain/earthy. The flavor is pineapple, fruit/tropical fruit, a hint of raspberries, wheat grain and a tart/slightly sweet/dryish finish.\xa0170 charactersjzlyo, Aug 14, 2018', "4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Appearance - The beer poured a pale straw color with a generous white head. 

Smell - Salt and wheat come through in the nose. 

Taste - My first impression is the pleasant level of salt. The pineapple is light, which is kind of nice. If it were overpowering, it might border on cloying. The finish allows all compenents to linger before disappearing. 

Mouthfeel - The carbonation reflects the style, making you want to drink more

Overall - It's not my favorite sour note gose, but it is solid.\xa0496 charactersJohnnyHopps, May 28, 2017"]

name: Gose Rustica
review:
['3.22/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5%look: 3.25 | smell: 3 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.25Had this on tap at BeerNV. Pours a feint straw yellow with cloudiness. Soft 1/3" white head. Aroma wasn't much, mild lacto, no salinity, mild wheat?

Taste, somewhere in between berliner and gose, the salinity wasn't there, the tart and sour aspect was barely there. Very restrained, albeit plenty light for the summer in terms of mouthfeel. 

Everything is pretty minimal, the brett, the wood, the sour, the wheat. Nothing bad though. Probably fits the traditional mode except for the total lack of discernable sodium.\xa0527 charactersrodbeermunch, Sep 08, 2016', "3.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.2%Pours an unattractive very translucent yellow. No head or lacing which isn't surprising given the style. 

Nose features sour bitter lemon, some grass and a yeasty character. 

This one is light on the taste and mouthfeel. Not very sour or salty or too tart. Very watery in all regards, but hey, at least it's refreshing! Honestly the nose was a bit more interesting than the taste and that's saying something because I can't smell. 
I'll give you points for trying a tough style and not being terrible.\xa0503 characterssamtrillo, Dec 09, 2014"]

name: Grapefruit Gose
review:
['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.7%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4apparently also known as "forbidden grapefruit gose" this is a tasty and rightly fruited gose from these guys, my first of their beers. the citric acidity of the pink grapefruit flesh and zest goes great with the rather high lactic acidity from the souring, but there is enough fruity sweetness in here and wheat malt structure for this to not feel harsh in any way. furthermore, the salt seems to add body and enhance the grapefruit, making this supremely refreshing for how puckery it is, and gives it drinkability well beyond what is normal for me in this style. the fruit tastes really natural, which helps a lot, and there is quite a bit of it, summery tasting and juicy. the beer is simple but well constructed, appropriately light, and very clean on the lacto side, not cheesy or funky in a bad way like some of these can be. my lady and i both really liked this one, and she doesnt even really care for grapefruit generally speaking. it looks like these guys have quite a few our beers out there, which has me curious if they have them all this well dialed in. this is a great alternative to one of those lousy grapefruit shandys that are so popular right now...\xa01,170 charactersStonedTrippin, Nov 01, 2017', "4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.7%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4As the traditional gose style trends citrusy and cidery, the Tin Man brewers opt to prod these flavors along by layering the sourness, floral coriander and gentle salt additions with complementing grapefruit juice for added brightness and bitterness.

Hazy canary and with a faint wisping froth, the tart ale sheds its acidity on the nose with the strong scent of grapefruit but also dry cider, white wine, lime, lemon, green berry and a brisk must of the sea. Its taste is gentle with sweetness, carrying a mild bready taste and light confectioner's sweetness on the front of the tongue.

The bulk of taste circulates around the sour impact on the middle palate and that firm white grapefruit flavor. Crabapple, lemon and lime, gooseberry and sharp chardonnay all play out with the brightness of floral orange and the earthiness of brine playing counter to both the fruit and acidity.

Light but with a constant undercurrent of wheat malt for creaminess and sour support, the beer's low-lying sweetness keeps the acidity seeming candy-like. Grapefruit warheads now seem a thing as the ale trails with the bitterness of grapefruit peel, a hint of salinity and a thirst-stripping sourness.\xa01,188 charactersBEERchitect, Sep 26, 2016"]

name: Gose

name: Double Seesaw: Passion Fruit, Pineapple, Toasted Coconut & Sea Salt
review:
['3.18/5\xa0\xa0rDev -19.9%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3 | feel: 3 | overall: 316 oz. can. Called "Island Inspired Double Seesaw" on the can. Pours just a tad hazy orange-golden. Smells of coconut, passion fruit, wheat, and sweet pineapple. Tastes of stronger pineapple. A little tart passion fruit. Lots of salt, wow. And some coconut lends a bit of slickness to the body. Medium body. It's barely tart and a little heavy for a gose. It's a little slow to drink, adjunct-heavy, and quite salty.\xa0417 charactersAlieniloquium, Sep 22, 2019', "3.54/5\xa0\xa0rDev -10.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.516 oz can

orange colored, white head. aroma is definitely dominated by the tropical fruit and is pleasant. taste is too heavy on the salt and coconut, it's not favorable to me. thin bodied.\xa0192 charactersjmdrpi, Jul 27, 2019", '3.82/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.8%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Canned 7/17. Pours a slightly hazy amber orange with lively effervescence and head that quickly recedes. Prominent notes of ripe passion fruit on the nose. Lots of passion fruit juice flavors, followed by a background/finish of pineapple. Supposed to be getting toasted coconut- maybe it’s there on the back end but I wouldn’t tell it was there if I didn’t know if. Really hard to find. Slightly less salinity that I expected based on the addition of sea salt. Does a pretty good job of hiding the ABV, given it’s not exactly a sessionable one.

A solid beer and a refreshing one for today’s heat wave, but I was a little bummed that the coconut was pretty much nonexistent for me. The flavor profile is reminiscent of another Trillium collab called escape plan that I liked better. It was heavier and had a thicker mouthfeel, but the pina colada flavors were all there.\xa0880 charactersVTbrewfan, Jul 21, 2019']

name: The Joose Is Loose
review:
["4.38/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25L: Had this beer on-tap at The Answer Brewpub, poured into a pint glass. Had a dark red color and a thick, murky consistency (kind of like a puree). There was a half inch of foamy, fairly long-lasting head. Good lacing.

S: A nice and sweet aroma of citrus, salt, cherries, and other fruit.

T: Tasted of the typical gose salt, raspberries, a lot of citrus (lemon and orange, in particular), a bit of cherries, light wheat notes, and pronounced sour quality. An exceptionally fruity flavor that's light, but manages to be quite complex. Very sweet (and sour) and refreshing.

F: A highly carbonated beer with a vibrant finish. Light-bodied.

O: Not your typical gose for sure, but it still manages to be drinkable. Very tasty.\xa0726 charactersavalon07, Jul 22, 2017"]

name: Madcap
review:
["4.29/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.9%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25This is a very pretty beer. It is gem clear and pale gold with a huge five-inch, rocky, white head. The head never falls below one inch, although it does leave a thick, sticky lace on the walls of a Stiegl stange glass. Random large bubbles rapidly race upwards from within.

The aroma resembles fresh lemon/lime with an emphasis on the lime. The background contains an expected brine with tartness.

Lemon dominates the flavor and it is exceptionally tart. There is an interesting peat flavor that is revealed just before brine and campfire smoke take center stage. The finish is long.

A light body with nylon texture. Alcohol is as expected, although high for this style. Spritzy carbonation is ample.

This Gose has refreshing tartness and bright citrus, along with an unexpected summer campfire. What's not to love? I enjoyed it on a hot summer day and, while excellent, I imagine it would be even better around a campfire at night. Either way, this would be perfect with Bratwurst and mustard.\xa0999 charactersSLeffler27, Sep 01, 2019", '3.97/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.9%look: 4.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Aroma is fruit/lemon, spices and funky tamarind. The flavor is smoke/campfire smoke, fruit/lemon, malts/wheat and a tart/slightly sweet/sourish finish.\xa0152 charactersjzlyo, Aug 25, 2019', "4.17/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4.25No canned on date.

The beer pours a deep gold, with a soft, thin head of foam that rises high above the beer and leaves nice patterning of lace as it settles.

Primarily lemongrass and sweet grapefruit on the nose initially, with only the slightest touch of smoke. As the beer opens up further, there are some hints of milk chocolate and vanilla, as well as a quickly emerging herbal, smoky quality.

That evocation of smoke really comes out more on the palate than the nose for me. Reminiscent of a past experience with Smoky Bohea tea, I learned from some further research that lapsang souchong is in fact a member of the Bohea family of teas. Subtle smoke, tart tamarind candy, and bitter cacao really stand out for me. The smoked tea also brings about an earthiness, which is really where that intended campfire inspiration begins to come together.

Thin, mildly puckering. The carb is fairly sharp and in your face, but in a good way. There's a touch of tannic dryness in the finish, but this one's predominantly crisp and clean.\xa01,035 charactersWickedBeer, Jun 29, 2019", '4.39/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.3%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5i had this beer twice. the first time it was very fresh and smelled strongly of a campfire. this made for a very interesting experience- the flavor and the smell were completely different. under the smokiness was a refreshing, great sour ipa. the second time i had it, the can had aged about a month and the smell almost completely mellowed out. No longer getting campfire smell, but still the sour ipa is nice and tart, grapefruity.\xa0433 charactersJoeMad, May 27, 2019', '4.64/5\xa0\xa0rDev +12.3%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.75Another amazing Freethought beer. Pale, slightly hazy yellow, smells like a campfire, pleasantly smoky, tastes fantastic. Great quenching sour ale, lemonade, smoky campfire, sour apple, nice tingly soft cocoa sweetness on the finish. Unique, intricate, well balanced, another home run.\xa0285 charactersdetpizzaboi, Apr 23, 2019']

name: Never Never Stop Stop
review: ['4.26/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.9%look: 4.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25this is insane beer, my first from this much acclaimed operation, and while i dont necessarily want to drink all that much of it, i sure respect it. its in that tool/mikkeller/evil twin vein, totally fruited to oblivion, with a beautiful rich pink color, milky and thick like purple gravy almost, a nice head on it and all the density in the world, especially for a beer this low in alcohol. its hard to not find the color sexy, as new school and overdone as it obviously is. the aroma is more fruit than tart, but the tartness also seems fruit derived, although i get a blackberry and raspberry sweetness too, even though its apparently all boysenberry. crazy fruit profile, no way its all real berries right? has to be some type of syrup or concentrate i would think to get it this intense in here, but oddly enough its fairly dry when i drink it, and the very professionally done lactic sourness keeps it kind of clean for all the fruitiness. minerals and citrus too, a faint green olive pickle sort of thing, a little jammy character too, like i want to spread this on toast or mix it with gin. seems not particularly beery with all the fruit, but it isnt one dimensional either like some of these can be, i really appreciate that. really cool with the drying brisk salt at the end coming in, definitely gose not berliner, which is cool. overall i like this, but i still dont think i have a great feel for what kind of quality brewers these guys are, this much fruit would make anything taste good. ill look for more of their stuff though, this was fun!\xa01,557 charactersStonedTrippin, Nov 02, 2018']

review: ['3.81/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.2%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Futbolmanby, Aug 11, 2018', '3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.7%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75jwat, Jun 24, 2018', '4.03/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.2%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4ccozzi, May 11, 2018', '4.08/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4npachl, Apr 04, 2018', '4.23/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Jhfinn, Apr 02, 2018', '3.96/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4acurtis, Mar 31, 2018', '4.13/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Coon_Hopster, Jun 08, 2016', '4.17/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25DenverBigRed, Jun 06, 2016', '4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Panama69, Jun 05, 2016', '3.98/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4MammothTarantula, May 29, 2016', '4.16/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.5%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4rbrefbeerman, May 27, 2016', '3.87/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.7%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75eawolff99, May 26, 2016', '3.62/5\xa0\xa0rDev -10%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Mebuzzard, Jan 11, 2016']

name: Just A Pinch
review:
['4.19/5\xa0\xa0rDev +22.9%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Rogue Ales "Just A Pinch"
12 fl. oz. can, "CANNED ON 05/30/2019 19:26:42" and sampled on 09/21/2019
$2.79 @ Total Wine & More, Cherry Hill, NJ

Notes via stream of consciousness: So is this a gose? Not really I guess, the label reads "sour session ale made with hand-harvested salt". Fine by me. It's poured a hazy deep golden body beneath a massive head of white foam that shortly dropped to a thin surface covering. There's some lacing left behind but not much, although that's not bad for it's being a sour beer. I really can't decide if that's a 4 or a 4.25 but I'll give it the benefit of the doubt. Just that the head held as long as it did was pretty good, leaving some lace put it over the top. The aroma is mildly fruity and suggests a mild acidity. It's surprisingly clean for a sour which is nice as well. As expected, that's exactly what you find in the taste except that there's also some sweet malt to it and it only comes off as mildly sour. The fruitiness is mainly like apple. With the acidity it reminds me of a bruised apple, or one that's fallen from a tree in the orchard and is more fully rotting - don't take that in the wrong way though, we're not going to eat that apple but you can smell the sweetness as it breaks down and the vinegar as it ferments. There's not a lot of bitterness here, the label lists 10 IBUs, but not much is needed anyway. Any more might be too much. It starts acidic, shows its sweetness and fruitiness, and then returns to acidity going into a fairly short and dry finish with some apple and acidity lingering. I guess there's a little salt there as well, but they've kept the salt restrained throughout. Good move.It really is "Just A Pinch". In the mouth it's medium bodied and soft and smooth with a moderate carbonation. I wasn't really expecting much from this but I'm actually impressed. This would be a great summer beer, especially if you're going to spend a good part of the day in the sun.
Review #6,704\xa01,965 charactersNeroFiddled, Sep 21, 2019', '4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev +20.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4L - Amber with a good amount of clarity with a small off-white head that dissipates quickly leaving behind minimal lacing. 
S - Nice sour notes along with some wheat and saltiness. Light fruit notes 
T - Sour/saltiness up front that somewhat fades followed by light fruit notes, earthiness, and some spice. Some notes of wheat, yeast, and malt as well. 
F - Light to medium body with a moderate amount of carbonation. 
O - A nice sour ale that seems very well balanced.\xa0469 charactersLifesAnesthesia, Sep 14, 2019', '3.54/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5the story of gathering their own salt is cool, but as a gose its just okay. it has a strong mineral and salt profile, maybe more than just a pinch, but thats kind of what i wanted from this, a spotlight on the cool element of the beer, and so i have no issue with the dosing. the souring seems fast and hot, a little sweaty to me, and there is enough wheat in here that this actually has a pretty full body for what it is, not nearly as light as it would need to be to be fully crushable and refreshing. i also dont really mind that, i like a gose with some character, and this certainly has that. i think the coriander element is a little light in here too, so it seems a bit one dimensional, only slightly herbal, but its the minerals of the salt and the earthy, starchy wheat that flavor this the most. i wish it was a little cleaner in terms of souring profile, not that its amateur, just that rogue should have the know how to have this be good and tidy, but its short of that. carbonation is fine, the salt lingers at the end, and the beer is a little more filling than i want it to be, some subtle lemon and lime notes at the end. overall a better story than it is a beer, but cool to be so ingredient focused, that will always be cool to me.\xa01,249 charactersStonedTrippin, Aug 29, 2019', '3.72/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9.1%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.512oz, canned on 04/29/2019. Thanks to my friend, Eric, for giving me a can to try. Drank from the can. Fruity aroma with some mild citrus, berry, and grass. Modest flavors with fruity boysenberry, lemongrass, lime, biscuity grain, and salt. Lighter body, moderate carbonation, tart & salty finish. I am not a huge fan of sours, but I enjoyed this one more than most apparently. I especially liked the berry flavor notes I was picking up.\xa0438 charactersbarnzy78, Jul 29, 2019', '1.9/5\xa0\xa0rDev -44.3%look: 2 | smell: 2 | taste: 2 | feel: 2 | overall: 1.5Smells like a kick ass sour. Taste not so much....starts off salty, then some weird lemon lime something, I don’t even know what to fucking call it. This is trash. Not a rogue fan and this is nothing short of my expectations. Garbage!!!!\xa0239 charactersRC_Saunders, Jul 24, 2019']

name: Nice & Easy
review:
['5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +31.6%look: 5 | smell: 5 | taste: 5 | feel: 5 | overall: 5A Gose that would make Leipzig proud! Beautifully executed - just a touch of lip smacking salinity and tartness with a body luscious enough to make Beyoncé jealous. 5/5 on all counts for an impressive true to style beer that would hold its own against German breweries in a double blind taste test.\xa0299 characterspsoriasaurus, May 24, 2019', '3.77/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.8%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Golden body, kind of cloudy, wheat malt forward with a mild dosage of salinity. Overall, a refreshing summer drinker, and a solid standard gose. Cheers.\xa0154 charactersLingenbrau, Jun 22, 2018', '3.84/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.1%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4.25A: The beer is pale yellow in color and has a light amount of carbonation. It poured with a short white head that quickly died down, leaving only a collar around the edge of the glass. 
S: Light aromas of sourness are present in the nose along with hints of lemons. 
T: The taste follows the smell, having some sourness along with notes of saltiness and slight hints of lemons. Bits of yogurt are also perceptible. 
M: It feels light-bodied on the palate and has a moderate amount of carbonation. Slight bits of creaminess are perceptible. 
O: This beer is super light in body and is very easy to drink. It makes for a good summer beverage. 

Serving type: bottle\xa0663 charactersmetter98, Sep 29, 2016']

name: Steel String / Haw River - Picklemania Dill Spice Gose
review:
['4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4500 ml bottle, dated 6/17, poured into a tulip.

A- A super hazy, almost murky, golden copper color with a small head.

S- Lots of allspice, some dill and peppercorns, tart wheat, grainy, salt, some coriander.

T- Tons of allspice upfront and the dill lingers of the back end, touch of sweet groan, some sour wheat, touch of peppercorns, and a nice bring/salty flavor. Not fully getting pickles.

M- Smooth, light to medium body.

O- Allspice is a little overwhelming at first and gives it an almost pumpkin beer quality, but in the end this is a Gose and an interesting idea that is fairly well done\xa0602 characterslarryi86, Jul 21, 2016', '3.98/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.7%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Note: Bottled on 5/24/2016

A: Pours a lightly hazy medium lemon yellow in color with light to moderate amounts of active visible carbonation rising from the bottom of the glass and faint golden yellow highlights. The beer has a two finger tall foamy white head that reduces to a large patch of thin film covering a little more than 75% of the surface of the beer and a thin ring at the edges of the glass. Light amounts of lacing are observed.

S: Moderate aromas of slightly sour wheat and grainy malts with moderate aromas of pickling spices - dill, peppercorns, and allspice stand out with subtle notes of coriander.

T: Upfront there is a slightly less than moderate flavor of slightly sour wheat malts and grainy malts. That is followed by moderate flavors of pickling spices - dill, peppercorns, allspice, and coriander in descending order of strength. There is a lingering light to moderate amount of tartness.

M: Light bodied with moderate amounts of carbonation. Slightly heavier than light amounts of acidic prickliness and a hint of dryness in the finish.

O: Very much as advertised, the aroma and taste definitely remind me of dill pickles (or at least the process of making them). Much more drinkable than I was expecting and enjoyable.\xa01,252 charactersdbrauneis, Jun 23, 2016', '4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Poured ontap at the brewery and served in n a snifter, the beer is a cloudy, light, lemon yellow coloring, with a filmy, frothy, white halo of head. Aromas of toasted grains, subtle citrus, and a heavy hand of dill. Wow! Flavors are tart and crisp wjite grape forward, with toasted notes, and a quick building dill character. Smooth, light bodied, with a dill and tart grape sweet aftertaste. Slightly sour, dry finish. Very nice and amazingly drinkable.\xa0455 charactersGarthDanielson, Nov 24, 2014']

name: Wake Me Up Before You Gose Ghost Pepper
review:
["3.9/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.2%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 4Poured from 375mL bottle into a Bear Republic tasting glass.
3.5/3.5/4.25/3.5/4
A: Hazy auburn with no head.
S: It smells like a margarita. A bit syrupy.
T/M: Tart and watery and wheaty. The spice creeps up on the end, but it's not oppressively. Nicely balanced with citrus. The rum doesn't materialize as much more than an indistinct sugariness.
O: Really interesting...but I'm not sure if it's *good*. Still, it's drinkable and compelling. Recommended.\xa0454 charactersAgentMunky, Oct 17, 2015", '4.22/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25On Tap @ Strangeways:
The previous reviewer cj8311 hit the nail right exactly perfect on the head! One of my favorite offerings from SW. The Heat from the ghost chile is at the perfect level. very drinkable.\xa0208 charactersStolenface1, Oct 08, 2015', '4.45/5\xa0\xa0rDev +10.4%look: 4.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.5On tap at the brewery from a 5 oz snifter. Poured a hazy tan with some brightness. Nose was subtly pungent, with a bit of fresh fruit/pepper aroma underneath. Only a trace of rum was detectable. Well carbed, but with a creamy mouthfeel on the front end. Creamy initial mouth feel gives way to a tart gose punch followed on the very back end with some pepper heat. The heat was not overpowering, and came entirely on the very back end / after taste.

Very strong effort that showed a deft hand - the pepper could easily have been overpowering. Rum barrel character was not strong, but there nonethless. Not sure how much it added but it didnt detract either.\xa0673 characterscj8311, Aug 18, 2015']

name: Never Calm³
