name: Spindrift
review:
['3.7/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.8%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75From the 16 oz. can dated 11/17/16. Sampled on January 14, 2017.

The pour is pale yellow with a modest white fizzy head and decent clarity.

This is two months old but I still pick up the passion fruit on the nose along with a melon-like character and toasted bread.

Light to medium body.

There is a clean fruitiness in the taste with that juicy passion fruit thing. There is also citrus. It did not blow me away but it was a decent or better than decent beer.\xa0465 characterspuboflyons, Jan 14, 2017', "3.88/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Had trouble sleeping, and needed a light nightcap to ease me in. In disclosure, BA RIS are my de rigeure style and I know Gose like I know goose - which ain't very much. 

A: Pale yellow; thin 1/2 head onto semi-gentle pour. 

S: Light tartness, faint tequila/ fainter margarita 

T: Much like it smells. Might be a light lemon - lime presence in the back end.

F: Very low carbonation. Very easy to drink. I am quickly downing this on a November night, and in the Summer this could be a go-to-beer with an evening meal or a 'sessionable lawn mowing beer'.

O: No idea how it rates per the style, but very enjoyable. I will have to buy some more.\xa0647 charactersJebBeerFish, Nov 29, 2016", "3.84/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Can from Greg and Jane's
Pours a hazy deep yellow color with a small bubbly white head that dissipates quickly. Smells of tart lemon with a salty earthy funk to counter. There's a light fruit in the nose that I can't describe, maybe its floral? Lemony tart flavor with hints of stone fruit and some saline and light earth to balance. Medium body moderate carbonation. Maybe I'm just hungry but I think some chips and salsa would pair very well with this beer.\xa0459 charactersjohnnnniee, Nov 12, 2016"]

name: Lime Gose
review: ['3.69/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.8%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5From a tall green bottle, this brew is hazy and golden. Medium white head. The aroma is fresh, with a little lime and pale grain scents. The taste has the notable salt of the style. Soft. Not as tart as I expected (or hoped). Medium body. Nice, but not outstanding.\xa0272 charactersSuds, May 20, 2018', '3.44/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3 | overall: 3.5Can. Pours a hazy golden color with a head that fades quickly. Aroma of citrus, lime and bit of grain. Taste of citrus bit of malt sweetness, lime and grain. Some bitterness that lingers into the finish. Moderate body with a decent tart feel. Interesting.\xa0255 characterssoju6, May 13, 2018', '3.78/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Poured out a clear, golden yellow color with a fizzy, white head of foam. It smelled of lime and tartness. Nice lime flavor with a touch of saltiness and tartness.\xa0163 characterszeff80, Apr 09, 2017']

name: Gose Both Ways
review:
['3.68/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.3%look: 3 | smell: 5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 2 | overall: 3.5on tap

Look: Maybe a bit on the yellow-goldenrod side, but what else would it be? I'm not looking for aesthetics out of a 4.7 sour.

Smell: Yes, this is a Gose, and it is clearly a Gose. A discerning nose will not confuse this with a Berliner Weisse or some random, experimental sour. The smell is sour, but not funky. One sniff and you know what this is. Excellent job by Parkway on the nose. I smell it, and I want it.

Taste: As with the nose, definitely a Gose...but I'm not sure what they really wanted to accomplish. No clear salt, no clear coriander, no clear fruit complement (or compliment). Then again, maybe this is a perfect Gose and everything else I've had was just trying to feature a particular ingredient (Westbrook: salt, Six Point: coriander, Anderson Valley: somethingness, NoDa: ginger, Troegs: sour cherry, Devil's Backbone: cranberry)...which is entirely possible.

Feel: Heavier than it should be. I feel like a Gose should hit the palate and then go away, but this actually lingers like a Berliner Weisse and doesn't have the complexity to do so (instead of "ew....oh!" it's "hmm...ok?") 

Overall: Hey, it's a Gose from the mountains of Virginia! Then again, it's a Gose from the mountains of Virginia. I am grateful to Parkway for all of their efforts-- they never disappoint-- and I am glad that they made a Gose. I will order it again, but if I had any other Gose option, I'd take it.\xa01,427 charactersReverendMaibock, Aug 18, 2015', '3.65/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.1%look: 3 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75On-tap at Highline RxR, on to the beer:

Here we have a light yellow colored beer with a short lived head. The beer smells acidic with a note of vague fruit. I get a slightly better impression as the beer enters my mouth. Indeed, the beer is acidic, but a relaxing acidic. I taste lemon, berries, a light saltiness, and acid in the aftertaste. Sticking to style, the beer is light bodied, crisp, and simply a refreshing gose.\xa0425 charactersDoubleJ, Aug 16, 2015', "3.88/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4On tap:
Revisit on tap, 10/2015: look is much clearer than original post, but head is lighter-color is still a tad dark. Balanced but very drinkable brew, on re-analysis. No ratings change, but will add, if you're up for a fruit-tart refreshing summer beer, give this a shot.

Pours a nice hazy-to-cloudy yellow, perhaps just a tad to the dark side of the color. Head is fluffy white; torrents of carbonation can be seen through the haze supplying/sustaining a half finger atop the whole beer.

Nose is tart, sorta on the lemony side, but there's a hint of lighter fruit also. A hint of the sea is there, but weak.

A more fruity Gose than I'm use to having, almost having an estery Belgian taste to it, a little apple and pear (as the beer warmed, the fruit flavor faded replaced by an earthy taste). That isn't to say the beer isn't tart, there is some sour in there but it's subdued. The lemon-lightly cider-vinegary sour tries to come on strong but is overcome by the other fruit notes. Light salt water flavor hits at the end with a hint of more apple.

Feel is light, smooth, maybe just a tad watery thin at the end, but that actually works very well for me in this beer. 

As stated, a bit more fruity in my initial tastes (this actually faded as the beer warmed, but brought a sight degrading of feel also, balancing it out). A lighter, less extreme version of the style but quite quaffable. Don't let it get too warm, though.

Note: I got a slight bit of butter, but not much. I've gotten more in the Goses I've made and it didn't bother me. Not sure if the flavor profile tricks my palate or not.\xa01,614 characterscjgiant, Jun 23, 2015"]

name: Bärentöter - German Sour Gose Bock
review:
["3.23/5\xa0\xa0rDev -18.8%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.25No bottling date

Pours a darker ruddy orange-amber body topped with a creamy few fingers of tan head; good retention fades steadily to a fluffy collar, paper-thin cap, and minimal-no lacing.

Aroma brings a healthy medley of orange peel, raisin, fig, dried caramel, green apple, and concord grape intertwining throughout; a touch of salinity brings a savory quality to a bouquet dominant in dark fruits.

Taste welcomes a soft, borderline muted oaky acidity before a familiar dosage of dark fruits (fig, raisin, cherry skins) comes into play; bits of caramel, green apple, and earthy spice coming through on the mid-palate, with a light cocoa dusting lingering into the finish.

Mouthfeel presents a medium-light body while a minimal spritzy carbonation remains steady along the palate; minor, evenly-distributed acidity fades toward the back end, leaving a bone-dry texture toward the close, almost to the point of flattening.

A gose-bock hybrid; an attempt at ingenuity I can get behind. The aroma is pleasing, definitely leaning overall in style toward a bock, while the rest of the beer just doesn't come together as I might have hoped. Muddled, inconsistent, and hardly defined; the end product is just ok, with plenty of room to refine and improve.\xa01,256 charactersjrc1093, Nov 12, 2019", '4.04/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.5%look: 4.75 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4A very lovely pink/orange-burnt orange color & a much bigger head than expected based on other reviews. Very pretty aroma, cinnamon, caramel & malt. Moderately salty, slightly less tartness with a hint of bitter. Flavors if salted apple, lime, caramel, malted grain & a little smokeyness (or smockyness for you Where’s the cinnamon? No alcohol detected. Feel is medium thin. I’m a little disappointed in the flavor but still very enjoyable.\xa0445 charactersViaduck, May 04, 2019', '4.46/5\xa0\xa0rDev +12.1%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.75Dark golden, quickly vanishing finegrained foam.

Aroma of salt-enhanced lime, a bit of fruitiness, just a little sweetness. Quite unique for a beer, really, even for a gose (usually the blend of aromas is much less subtle and does not impose itself as forcefully from the first whiff), although if you have ever drunk cheap tequila with lime and salt, the association is inescapable. The alcohol is completely missing, though. Even though this is strong for the style and above the taste threshold for alcohol (6.6%).

Taste fills the palate with even more lime, although it is wrapped in a smooth tartness that moves via a round saltiness to a minimal spiciness. Label claims coriander (as per gose style) and more exotic cinnamon. Also orange peel, I guess inspired by witbier. Cinnamon I just cannot detect at all, the others maybe. Of course it means the spicing has been successful and subtle. There are citrus notes, a bit of bitterness and a whiff of exotic aroma.

Feel is perfectly balanced.

Overall, a delightfully appetizing modern stronger version of a revived style with a bit of twist in spicing that is not obvious.\xa01,132 charactersKooVee, Dec 25, 2018', '4.43/5\xa0\xa0rDev +11.3%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Brauerei Reichenbrand GmbH & Co. KG "Bärentöter - German Sour Gose Bock"
1Pint .9 fl oz brown glass bottle without production codes or freshness dating
$6.99 @ DeDicco & Sons, Brewster, NY

Look: A rough pour brings up a thick head of creamy off-white foam atop a very hazy copper colored body. Being a sour beer the head will steadily fade to nothing and no lacing will be left behind but it will put up a fight. 

Smell: Malty, caramelish, and delicately spicy. Fruity like a tart red apple. Slightly smoky like burnt plastic - that seems to have been a passing note though, perhaps due to the yeast struggling because of age or condition. 

Taste: As the aroma suggests, it's malty and caramelish, and not as tart as their "original Ritterguts Gose". There's plenty of apple, soft apple, regular apple, and tart apple and maybe a little bit of soft red berry as well. The salt seems a bit more limited as well but perhaps that's just because there's more malt there covering it up. There's not a lot of bitterness, and there's just a touch of floral and herbal hops in the far back. Still, it has a mostly dry finish.

Feel: It's medium leaning towards medium-full in body with a dextrinous edge, maybe even medium-full in body, and gently smooth with a soft, gently effervescent carbonation. 

Overall: This is a wonderful cold-weather version of a gosebier, and the only one I know of. The apple-like fruitiness and salt and caramelish malt mix really well. It's expensive but at least with this one you get some alcohol for it at 6.6% abv versus their original at 4.7%. Well worth trying.

Review# 6,271\xa01,612 charactersNeroFiddled, Oct 02, 2018', "3.91/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.8%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Pours a blushing peach-zinfandel body with very small head retention.

Nose is of salt, light mineral, and the honey-sweetness of medium dark malts. Not very loud.

Sour characters come out first, reminding me of jawbreakers, then a slight dark malt character arrives, imparting rye bread crusts and turning the profile into somewhat of a sour cherry coke-like thing. It's unique.

Feel sticks to the palate beautifully and leaves a coating of cough syrup-thickness but it's oh so welcome.

Overall, if you haven't tried it, do it. Really great execution here.\xa0560 charactersThe-Adjunct-Hippie, Jan 15, 2017", '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Clear amber color with beige head. Aroma is somehow fruity and salty. Taste follows with tart fruits and a bit of salty pickle juice, overall like pickled fruits. Medium to light body and carbonation. Quite tasty, not overly tart, fruity... nice one.\xa0250 charactersCiocanelu, Nov 16, 2016']

name: Gene Flow (2018)
review:
['4.29/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.2%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25A - Pours a beautiful ruby red with a large fizzy pink head.

S - Aroma is cranberry, cinnamon and orange zest.

T - The taste is cranberry, orange peel, cinnamon, green apple, hibiscus and sea salt.

M - Light body with medium carbonation. Soft mouthfeel with a crap dry finish.

O - One of the best Gose’s I’ve ever had. So many different things going on in the flavor. Cinnamon adds a great spice to the finish.\xa0418 charactersTreyIsWilson, Jun 09, 2019', '4.49/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.9%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Beautiful fruited golden sour here, pours a beautiful light cherry color, tart, crisp, funky. Beautifully carbonated, tastes like a cocktail, the salt is great. Nice tartness from the cranberries, balanced nicely by the cinnamon. Another refreshing, crisp, fruity, wheaty, golden sour from Speciation.\xa0301 charactersdetpizzaboi, Mar 10, 2019', '4.41/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5That to rudzud
Pours nice fizzy pink head, fades quickly, little retention, no lacing, hazy bright pink reddish color 

Nose tons of cranberry and tons of apple cider cinnamon, cranberry tea, spice, orange, herbal, a gose not sure but otherwise nice 

Taste big tart cranberry, apple cider and loads of cinnamon, apple cider, little tart cider, hibiscus notes, cranberry juice and tart berry, more cranberry tea, juicy but tart, dry finish little flemmy

Mouth is med bod, good fizzy carb, bright acidity, not too flemmy

Overall really nice, big cranberry apple cider with big cinnamon and tart flemmy acidic sour beer, enjoyable but a sipper\xa0643 charactersjlindros, Jan 05, 2019', "4.35/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Received in a trade and shared with JLindros.

A -Poured into a Kate the Great tulip a nice hazy cranberry juice hue with s light wispy head that fades to leave a thin halo.

S - Big aromas of cranberries, tart, mulling spices, cinnamon, oranges, tart. 

T - Taste is similar to the nose with loads of tart cranberries yet juicy and sweet. The orange is zesty and the cinnamon is warm, tastes almost like mulled cider! Great salt too.

M - Mouthfeel is lightly carbonated, crisp, the finish is not flemmy at all. Very pleasant.

O - Overall this was a very solid gose with great salinity and cranberry juice notes. Haven't had a beer with this much cranberry in years.

Serving Type: bottle\xa0690 charactersrudzud, Jan 05, 2019", '4.37/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.1%look: 4 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4750 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled in 10/2018. Pours slightly hazy deep orange/amber, light reddish/pinkish color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy pink head with good retention, that reduces to a thin spotty lace cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing clings on the glass, with a light amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of huge sour/tart/tangy cranberries, strawberry, pomegranate, hibiscus, fruit skin/seed, lemon, lime, orange zest, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, red grape/wine, hay, straw, herbal, floral, grass, sea salt, wheat, cracker, and white bread; with lighter notes of cinnamon, pepper, musty/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Incredible aromas with fantastic complexity and balance of cranberries, hibiscus, orange zest, fruity/funky/acidic yeast; light-moderate pale/wheat malts, and cinnamon/salt notes; with big strength. Taste of huge sour/tart/tangy cranberries, strawberry, pomegranate, hibiscus, fruit skin/seed, lemon, lime, orange zest, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, red grape/wine, hay, straw, herbal, floral, grass, sea salt, wheat, cracker, and white bread; with lighter notes of cinnamon, pepper, musty/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness; fruit/hibiscus tang; and light cinnamon/yeast spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/tangy cranberries, strawberry, pomegranate, hibiscus, fruit skin/seed, lemon, lime, orange zest, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, red grape/wine, hay, straw, herbal, floral, grass, sea salt, wheat, cracker, white bread, light cinnamon/pepper/funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish fora good bit. Amazing complexity, robustness, and balance of cranberries, hibiscus, orange zest, fruity/funky/acidic yeast; light-moderate pale/wheat malts, and cinnamon/salt flavors; with a fantastic malt/tartness and tangy fruit balance; with no puckering flavors after the finish. Moderately crisp/clean finishing. Light-moderate increasing dryness from tartness, tangy fruit, and carbonation. Medium-plus carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately bready/grainy/acidic/tangy/tannic, and lightly saline/sticky balanced mouthfeel that is fantastic. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.2%. Overall this is an amazing fruit/spiced Gose! All around incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of cranberries, hibiscus, orange zest, fruity/funky/acidic yeast; light-moderate pale/wheat malts, and cinnamon/salt flavors; very smooth, crisp, and refreshing to drink with the modestly acidic/tangy/tannic/drying finish; not overly lactic or salty. Absolutely perfect balance of juicy/jammy cranberries, hibiscus, orange zest, and Brett/Lacto complexity; with a nice pale/wheat malt backbone against acidity. Nice complementing cinnamon spice and salt presence, without being overwhelming. A highly enjoyable offering, and amazing style example as expected. One of their best beers yet.\xa02,926 characterssuperspak, Dec 12, 2018']

name: Gose To 11
review: ['3.39/5\xa0\xa0rDev -11.7%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3 | overall: 3.25this is the first lackluster beer i have had from oakshire, who i have a lot of love for. this is pretty darn flat from the tap, both in look and feel. nice clarity for the style, golden color, but unappetizing in a pint with no head or visible bubbles, as still as apple juice. aroma is a little sweaty and sharp, but its not as weird or messy in the taste, lacto forward and a little strange rather than clean, but its not gross or anything, just a little amatuer tasting for such a dialed in operation. the wheat has some body but is mild and dry in the taste, notes of green apple and white wine in the taste, quite fruity, with some herbaceous toasty coriander type spice in behind, but very little appreciable salt on this. id like it a lot more if it were drier and more carbonated, its so flat that i seems dead, and thats just wrong for this style. maybe its better in the can, i have seen those around too, but from the tap (at star bar downtown), it just was lifeless. hard to hold anything against these guys with the track record they have, ill try it from the can and reassess...\xa01,093 charactersStonedTrippin, Aug 24, 2017', '3.59/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.5%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.512oz single cam bought from Lifesource natural Grocers in Salem OR about $2 Pours a pale cloudy yellow with a small white head..that dissipates fast leaves lace. Faint sea salt and barnyard type aromas. Nice sweet vinegar and fruit taste with a drying seas salt finish. Mouth feel is OK for style and nicely drying..making for an easy drinker. A nice gose.\xa0356 charactersReidrover, Oct 17, 2015']

name: 5 Lives Gose
review: ['3.38/5\xa0\xa0rDev -14.2%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 3750 mL bottle. Clear golden. Smells of lime and orange acidity. Tastes of a variety of citrus. Lime, tangerine, orange. Pleasant tartness. Grainy with a lightly salty back end. The citrus kinda drops off in the back end. Light body. Decent.\xa0240 charactersAlieniloquium, Jul 08, 2017']

name: Watermelon Gose
review:
['4.04/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4different from the one with graham in the name, as i believe that one has hibiscus in it, and this one does not. this is a great gose, and its cool they are canning it now. it tastes like the little white layer on the watermelon between the flesh and the rind, juicy but bitter too, not sweet at all, and coming through the beer really naturally and cleanly. the whole thing is simple, not a ton going on, which i appreciate because it leaves plenty of space for this unique white wheat to flavor the beer along with the watermelon, its earthy and interesting, very fresh tasting to me. cleanish sourness here, its not overly acidic at all and stays plenty drinkable as a result, but there is also a weird little funk to the end of it, i really like it, my lady a little less so, but it gives a little character to the finish. amazingly pale and light to drink on, summery but not exclusively so, and with a high degree of carbonation. cool beer, really natural and better than almost all of the others out there doing the same thing. a pricey can, but worth it. i love these guys.\xa01,081 charactersStonedTrippin, Nov 21, 2018', '4.36/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.6%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Pours a cloudy straw color with no real lacing and no retaining head. Poured from a 32oz can.

Aroma is surprising full of watermelon. Not watermelon candy, but more like a freshly picked slightly dirty watermelon. A bit funky on the nose with some wheat.

Taste is full of watermelon flavor. Plenty salty with a nice sourness. Incredibly refreshing. Very drinkable and unique. Carbonation is a little weak, but overall really good stuff.

Overall, the gose style at AZ wilderness is probably my favorite style they cover. It genuinely tastes so much like what they boast and the flavor is not artificial. I see this pairing well with Korean fried chicken and pickled vegetables. It gets a 87.5/100.\xa0699 charactersDaverCS, Aug 03, 2016']

name: Let's Begin!
review: ["3.84/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Overall a prettynice an easy to drink gose; not sour at all and light on the taste, but there is some lime and salt in the taste, as well as light citrus. I would have guessed it was 3.5% ABV.\n\nWouldn't rush out to get it but worth a look as a cheaper summer beer.\xa0264 charactersmdfb79, Jan 11, 2018", '3.66/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.9%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Kinda misses the mark. Has a nice sessionable flavor with a hint of salt in the aftertaste. Really not sour nor does lime flavor come through. Might just need some tweeking.\xa0173 charactersJbats, May 03, 2016']

name: Paloma Gose
review:
["3.98/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.1%look: 2 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Pours an effervescent gold with rapidly falling beige head. Stays effervescent, zero head retention or lacing. Murked up a little as the bottle was drained 

S: Lime & salt, pretty much smells like a margarita

T: Follows the nose, pink grapefruit as well, very tart & dry up front. More lime, salt and dryness as this warms, not getting any coriander at all. Finishes dry, tart salty with lime

MF: Lightish body, slight carbonation

Pretty drinkable, not top of the line for the style, but worth a go, especially on a late September day where Summer isn't giving an inch\xa0580 charactersrusspowell, Sep 30, 2019", '4.16/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.8%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25L - Golden with a ton of clarity - no real head or lacing to speak of 
S - Lots of salt and citrus 
T - Follows the nose: all the flavors are very present: grapefruit, lime, coriander, and salt - the lime and coriander being especially present. 
F - Light, crisp, moderate to high carbonation - light, crisp, refreshing
O - A very light, crisp, and refreshing citrus gose. Very enjoyable\xa0388 charactersLifesAnesthesia, Jul 20, 2019', '3.71/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.9%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Gold colored with no head and vibrant carbonation. The aroma is packed with sea salt and grapefruit. I’m tasting lots of grapefruit and sea salt. The mouth is heavily carbonated, crisp, and dry.\xa0199 charactersFranziskaner, Dec 28, 2018', '3.78/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75On tap. Poured a hazy, golden yellow color with a small, white head of foam. It smelled of lemon, grapefruit and tartness. Nice tart flavor with sweet grapefruit.\xa0162 characterszeff80, Jun 12, 2018', '3.91/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Pours a cloudy maize color. 1/5 inch head of an off-white color. Poor retention and poor lacing. Smells of salt, citrus, hint of bacterial funk, hint of pale malt. Mouth feel is sharp and clean, with an average carbonation level. There is an elevated tartness and acidity. Fits the style of a Gose. Tastes of citrus, salt, pale malt, floral hops, and a hint of wheat. Overall, good aroma, body, and blend.\xa0405 charactersTone, Apr 25, 2018']

name: Layer Cake Gose
review:
["3/5\xa0\xa0rDev -18.3%On tap at Freshcraft in Denver. 

Hazy and dull golden body. Bright white head. 

Corriander with an off putting bile like aroma. A sharp twang to it. 

The flavor is muted, and that may be a good thing. Light salt, and has that same bile flavor I picked up in the aroma. 

Light body, crisp carbonation. 

I wasn't a fan. It had that odd aroma and flavor I just couldn't get past.\xa0384 charactersVonerichs, Sep 11, 2014", "3.64/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5very good beer, not amazing as a gose. i dont think its sour enough for the style, which surprises me, given trinity's penchant for wild ales. it also comes across far less salty than others, which is mixed for me. i like enough salt for the finish to be dry, but not so much that i cant really drink it easy. this has no drinkability issues at all, its down super easy with just a light tartness and fabulous carbonation. coriander and salt are both minimal, so the beer comes across under flavored a little. not a ton of malt on it either, but the more caramel orange color instead if the classic yellow golden for the style led me to expect more grain character. i know trinity does some of the coolest sours out, but i wanted more from this. if it came from another, more pedestrian brewery i would be stoked on it, but trinity (and their ungodly price points) have forced me to hold all of their beer to a higher standard. worth trying at falling rock on tap while it lasts.

edit: they must have made this one again, or its aged well. the different types of salts seem more evident now, and i think the name much more appropriate. tangy almost, still super light, but flavorful salty. better than i gave it credit for the first time around...\xa01,248 charactersStonedTrippin, Aug 28, 2014"]

name: Chill Vibes
review:
["3.98/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.9%look: 3.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Poured from a can into a tap glass.

Pours a crystal clear pale-gold with a modest had and no lacing. 

Aromas of cucumber, brine, lemon/lime and grass.

The brew hits the tip of the tongue with plenty of cucumber and honeydew sweetness. At mid-palate, some crackery grain and salt arrive, with the acid/brine and citrus arriving at the finish. Fairly well-balanced, although the tart finish comes to dominate as the brew warms. The cucumber doesn't distract but in fact accentuates that this is pretty solid for the style.

Despite its modest carbonation, it is still a medium-light brew that finishes well, owing to its solid acid punch. This would be an excellent warm weather brew.

I had only modest expectations for this beer, and feared it would be gimmicky. Not so. The salt, acid, and cucumber flavors marry exceptionally well.\xa0843 charactersMindcrime1000, Nov 02, 2019", '3.68/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.9%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.7512oz can. Poured out a clear, golden orange color with a small, off-white head of foam. It smelled of cucumber, salt and grains. Sweet cucumber with some tartness and a salty finish.\xa0182 characterszeff80, Sep 22, 2019', "4.07/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.3%look: 2.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 4.25Pours bright, effervescent & gold with one finger of pearl colored head. Some head retention, zero lacing 

S: Cucumbers, grassyness

T: Follows the nose, also picking up a little lemon, mint & dryness up front. Tartness, cucumber, a little saltyness & lemon as this warms. Finishes dry with a slight lemon sweetness/tartness & a faded salty cucumber

MF: Light carbonation, medium body

Love the flavor, drinks too easy, they could've released earlier in the Summer & I would've bought a ton\xa0498 charactersrusspowell, Sep 08, 2019"]

name: Key Lime Pie Gose
review:
["4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25The taste of pastry and pie without much sweetness sounds like a terrible idea. But when life serves you limes, you make sour beer. And that's just what Southern Grist does with their key lime inspires Northern German gose. 

Cloudy yellow and looking more of the part of lemon than of lime, Key Lime Pie Gose pours with a skinny froth of trickling white lace. Striking aromas of lime, cream, vanilla and cidery tartness swirl about the nose with a background of toasted nuttiness in the wake. But to taste, its that toasted nuttiness that brings a full out caramelized, honey-dipped granola flavor that swoons the tastebuds first.

And then the layers begin to build. Sweet cream, vanilla and taffy bring the graham cracker character into the pastry world where the taste of agave and lime await. The underlying beer simmers with the natural sourness of cider, white wine, green berry, kiwi and guava extend into the cream for a meringue and yogurt kind of way. Trailing with sourness, sourdough and saltwater taffy, a refreshing margarita character replaces the sweetness to ensure drinkability and crispness.

Medium bodied but cleanly layered, the complex flavors of pie come together effortlessly. Its body is bolstered by the additions of cream, vanilla and graham cracker but the brisk salinity keeps the palate light and drying. A quick finish of citrus peel is outlasted only by echoes of graham cracker for a pleasant and whimsical linger.\xa01,450 charactersBEERchitect, Mar 08, 2019", '4.21/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.2%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Thanks goes out to Buck89 for this brew.

16 oz. Can
Canned On: 04/13/18

Poured into a Trillium glass a pretty nice hazy pale yellow color, very nice carbonation, with a very nice thick/creamy/fizzy two-finger white head, which leaves some sticky lacing behind. The nose is malty, yeasty, with a nice little coriander note, lime, some vanilla, graham crackers, tart. The taste is pretty nice, malty, yeasty, with a nice little lime note, coriander, tart, nice vanilla note, graham crackers. Medium body, ABV is hidden very nicely, with a nice little dry/bitter finish. Overall, a pretty tasty brew. I like this one. Thanks John!\xa0630 charactersWasatch, May 23, 2018']

name: Cherry Gose
review: ["4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4The beer pours a nice medium amber color that seems to have slight redness to it. The smell and taste both have a sweet and tarty cherry note. The beer isn't very salty like other ones but it still has enough salt to make it good. The beer is fairly refreshing but still has a nice slight dry finish to it.\xa0306 charactersHattedClassic, Apr 25, 2015"]

name: Plum Llorona
review: ['4.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.2%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Poured a hazy light purple-pink in the glass with a nice white head. Aromas and flavors of plum candy, sea salt, and nice tart citrus qualities all around. Mouth puckering and deliciously refreshing.\xa0199 characterscrob3888, Mar 12, 2016']

name: Gose
review:
["4.23/5\xa0\xa0rDev +20.9%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Pint at the Bobcat. I've never had a Gose before and I know that this is a difficult style to find in the states, so I was happy to have it!

A - very good looking beer. The pour is hombre, orange in the middle and yellowing on the periphery. Very little head, so the glass is nice and full. Sediment is visible and clouds the beer through and through. 

S - not a lot there, but given the subtlety that follows in the taste, this isn't surprising. Some zesty sweetness on the nose, a little sourness, but not much else. The pint glass is an interesting choice of serving ware, so I assume that some of the aroma is lost there.

T - delicious. Sweet and sour at the same time, big lemon taste. No alcohol to speak of. This is really a great taste for summer; nothing overly flavorful or sweet. Subtle and sessionable.

M - excellent as well. Very little alcohol and nothing outrageous in the flavors leads to a very balanced beer. 

O - I love it, I'd get it again in a second, and two or three more afterwards.\xa01,021 charactersJamesShoemaker, Aug 04, 2013"]

brewery: Zero Gravity Craft Brewery / American Flatbread
name: Gose
review: ['3.93/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.4%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4The appearance was a ruddy burnt yellow color with a quickly dissipating little bit of a white head. Thin white foamy lacing ran slim around the glass. The smell started off with the soured wheat portion up front with a sly salty underneath riding in to spoil a wanted return of the citrus. In other words, citrus wants to bounce forth but remains more so in the background. The flavor takes in the soured wheat with a nice salty underneath to once again flush out the citrus sweetness trying to come in. Salty/sour aftertaste is there. More dry/sour than salty and aour in the finish. On the palate, this one sat about a light on the body with a great sessionable feel running all around. Overall, nice gose for the most part, pretty sure I could come back to.\xa0761 charactersLone_Freighter, Jul 14, 2017', '4.04/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25really different from the other gose they made a few years back, this one is much lighter, not just in abv (which rules in hot weather), but also in sourness, its not nearly as acidic as i remember the other one being, lending further to drinkability. its murky and faded looking, minimal head but some lace as it drinks down. it smells and tastes quite herbal, the coriander in this really comes out. i like how light the wheat malt base is, its flavorful and still has plenty of texture, but isnt weighty or thick in the least. its also well enough carbonated that it has great capacity for refreshment. it seems almost lacto fermented, the way the acidity builds, its not foot-like or stinky like some kettle soured and sour mashed beers can be, its better technique, or maybe closer attention to detail, either way, it really works. great take on the style, gose is here to stay i think!\n\nedit: this keeps getting better every time i have it, really professionally done. i think it stands out because there are so may bad ones out there these days, this is simple, clean, properly salty, and just really well done! summery and crushable, awesome with their pizza, amazing stuff.\xa01,182 charactersStonedTrippin, Jul 25, 2015']

name: Super Paradise
review:
["3.89/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 416oz. can into Night Shift stemware. Shared with schen9303. 

These raspberry/blackberry beers always look great. Stunning color. Nose is seedy with a juicy, almost puckering tartness mixed with a certain jammy profile. Pungent and aromatic. Beer opens moderately tart. A touch briny almost. The saltiness isn't usually that apparent in gose. Heavy raspberry puree notes in the middle with a touch of funk. Juicy with a little seedy bitterness. Soft, mellow finish makes this one seem almost watered down at the end. Body is light with ample carbonation. Prickly and lively on the palate and goes down aggressive. Puckering, foamy finish. 

Overall decent but again, the flavor almost feels watered down at times. Worth trying but it's not anything special.\xa0757 charactersSpeedwayJim, Sep 28, 2018", '3.42/5\xa0\xa0rDev -9%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Deep, deep red color--so deep even the head is pink. The blueberries and the dry hop process do a nice job of balancing the gose sourness. A really inventive brew!\xa0163 charactersDaveMaciolek21, Sep 24, 2018']

name: Blood Orange Gose
review:
['4.44/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9.4%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.5Poured from a 750 ml flip top bottle into a chalice. Bottled on 9/26/2017.

Appearance: Pours a cloudy golden orange. Lots of bubbles and a slight finger of off white head that quickly fades away. 

Smell: A juicy and tart aroma with a scent of blood orange and funk. Big upfront scent of blood orange juice. Hints of funk and coriander. Also some hints of sea salt. A pretty nice juicy aroma. 

Taste: Like it smells, a juicy and tart taste with good notes of blood orange and funk. Good juicy and tart presence of blood orange juice. Some notes of funk and coriander along with some slight sea salt. Light malt notes of cracker along with some yeast. A very good taste. 

Mouthfeel: Light bodied with a moderate amount of carbonation. Juicy and very smooth. 

Overall: A very good fruit Berliner. Big blood orange flavor with balanced tartness.\xa0846 charactersMattyG85, Oct 06, 2017', "4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25No head. Pale golden orange.

Pretty juicy and pretty tart. The blood orange shows a lot but it's not mouth puckering. Lemon citrus. 

Light bodied. Easy drinking. Solid.\xa0170 charactersmothman, Oct 01, 2017"]

name: Shark Tears
review:
['4.21/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.3%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 5 | overall: 4.25Pours hazy, gold in color with one quarter inch head. Taste is big salt and pineapple and rhubarb. Light bodied, salty with moderate carbonation. Love all the brininess. Excellent super salty gose. Really curious about the rest of their lineup.\xa0249 characterstigg924, Apr 17, 2019', "4.05/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4On-tap at Pizza & Beer of Richmond, Richmond, VA

A: The beer is light yellow in color and has a light amount of visible carbonation. It poured with a short white head that died down and left a narrow collar around the edge of the glass.
S: Moderate to strong aromas of sourness and lactobacillus are present in the nose.
T: The taste follows the smell but isn't nearly quite as strong. There are also hints of saltiness.
M: It feels light-bodied and quite tart on the palate with a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: This beer is easy to drink and has some refreshing properties but I wouldn't call it thirst quenching.

Serving type: on-tap\xa0643 charactersmetter98, Aug 10, 2018", '4.24/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.1%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25L: Poured from a 1 quart can to a cylinder glass. Had a pale color and a cloudy consistency. There was a half inch of creamy / fizzy head that quickly dissipated. Pretty good lacing.

S: A nice aroma of salt, wheat, rhubarb, and some spices as well.

T: Tasted of a moderate amount of rhubarb (a new one for me in terms of goses), a bit of sea salt, some coriander, wheat (mostly in the finish), some citrus (lemon), and other light fruits. This beer has an interesting flavor that gets better as it goes along. Light, vibrant, fruity, and tasty.

F: A well-carbonated beer with a lively finish. Light-bodied.

O: Shark Tears is a fascinating take on the gose style. Well worth a look.\xa0685 charactersavalon07, Sep 01, 2017', '3.93/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Pleasure House Brewing "Shark Tears"
on tap at the brewery on 19 June 2017
$5.50/Pint

Notes via stream of consciousness: Gose w/ Rhubarb? Now that's interesting. Just 7 IBUs. Hazy golden body beneath a bright white head that displays limited retention, and unfortunately seems to be leaving no lacing ~ but that's not unusual for a sour beer. The aroma is tart, fruity, and mineralish. Whoah! It's very tart, I wasn't expecting that. It's a little too sour to be a proper Gose in my opinion, but I guess they called it that because there's some salt added. The fruitiness remains. Dry acidic finish. I wish the Rhubarb stood out a little more but it has a hard time fighting the acidity. Light bodied and sharp with acidity and a gently bristling carbonation ~ this beer will wake up your tastebuds! Still pretty decent. As I progress through the pint I'm becoming more accustomed to the acidity and I get more character out of it ~ I guess as it warms and the carbonation softens a bit as well. Nice beer. Somewhat unique. Worth trying.\xa01,038 charactersNeroFiddled, Jun 22, 2017', '4.05/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Appearance: No lacing and no real head to speak of.

Smell: Rhubarb, sea salt with a general fruitiness. 

Taste: Same as on the nose. I can definitely taste the sea salt. 

Mouthfeel: fruitiness all over the palate with some carbonation. 

Overall: I spoke with one of the persons involved with brewing this beer. He boiled down the sea water to get the salt! What a great idea! A patron provided the sea water. What a great story that perfectly illustrates why I admire the entrepreneurial spirit within the craft brew industry! Cheers!\xa0551 charactersMarvinSnyder, Jun 04, 2016']

name: Preserved Lemon Gose
review: ['4.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +10.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5I normally do not like sours, but the description piqued my curiosity. It exceeded my expectations - opens sour, then it mellows out into a wheat/spelt finish. Also taste some light saltiness, perfect balance. Delicious!\xa0220 charactersmngermanshepherd, Jul 27, 2019', "4.48/5\xa0\xa0rDev +10.1%look: 3 | smell: 5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.5Preserved Lemon Gose pours a yellow color, with not much head. Big aroma, lots of lemon and salt, sour notes; exactly what you want and expect from a gose. Flavor is big, lots of lemon with a salty and sour bite. Great body, not overpowering or too sour to enjoy. Overall, big fruit, nice sour notes that isn't overpowering.\xa0329 charactersvette2006c5r, Sep 03, 2018", '4.2/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.2%look: 4 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25This beer pours a nice golden color. White head when poured. Nice arch lacing on the glass. The nose, when I first smelled it, I said "woah". It is hard to describe. So many juxtapositions. It is light, intense, earthy, fruity - lemon. The taste is, well, lemon up front. Some tartness to it. \nActually quite full bodied for the low ABV. \nOverall, an amazing beer. Delicious, refreshing, just plain good.\xa0404 charactersVictory_Sabre1973, Jun 19, 2017']

name: Saltpan Desert Gose
review:
['3.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.8%look: 2.5 | smell: 3 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.25Look: It pours cloudy light yellow with a white head that has low head retention. 

Smell: It has a heavy lime and citrus aroma. There is a bit of spice in the background with salt notes. There is also a touch of sourness. 

Taste: There are lime and citrus flavors with low coriander and a slightly tart element. The salt element is low and in the background. 

Feel: It has a slightly tart finish with a moderately low body. 

Overall, this is dominant by the citrus and lime. The other elements are well in the background with a slight tartness.\xa0548 charactershman43, Mar 12, 2018', '3.39/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.4%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.25I was scouring through some of my increasing backlog of CANs, thanks to the eradication of the Bottle Backlog, when I came across three Australian Nomads & suddenly, my CAN fancy (CANcy) was tickled! It may seem as though I am easily amused, but when it comes to The CANQuest (tm), there is no shame in my game. 

From the CAN: "We've trekked inland for an outback interpretation of the Gose style using Murray River pink Salt and native desert limes. Combining salt and citrus to produce a refreshing beer perfect on its own or paired with food."

I am always elated when a beer is either marked as being unfiltered or is of a style in which haziness/cloudiness is perfectly acceptable. I agitated the beer while still in the relatively tiny 11.2-fl. oz. CAN. Once I had CANducted the Crack!, I went with an inverted Glug to produce two-plus fingers of dense, foamy, bone-white head with modest retention, but it left great lacing in its wake. Color was a deeply-hazy Straw-Yellow (SRM = > 2, < 4). Just from the pour, I could smell the salt! I am a retired U.S. Navy sailor with loads of sea time & the smell of salt gets me every time. Leaning in, I really opened my sinuses with a blast of salt & lime citrusiness. Phew! Mouthfeel was kind of thin & watery, but I will try to refrain from dunning it too hard in that aspect. The taste was rather muted, especially as CANpared to the nose. Yes, I was getting the salt, lime, tartness & even some spiciness from the coriander, but it just seemed like the dial had been turned down to "4" or so. 8=( This was NOT a CANparatively inexpensive little CAN & I was really hoping for more out of it. Finish was dry, tart, spicy & citrusy & while it might be absolutely refreshing on a hot summer's day in Oz, I would have a tough time justifying the outlay for a seCANd go-'round. YMMV.\xa01,831 characterswoodychandler, Dec 13, 2017', "3.56/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.6%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5L: Poured from a can to a cylinder glass. Had a golden yellow color and a cloudy consistency. There was an inch of foamy, fairly long-lasting head. Sparse lacing.

S: A decidedly subdued aroma of wheat, salt, citrus fruit, and coriander. 

T: Tasted of a good shot of citrus fruit (lime, especially), a moderate amount of salt (could have used more), light coriander notes, and a whole lot of wheat. The trouble with the flavor is similar to the aroma: It's a little weak. Some of the ingredients aren't powerful enough. Some elements, like the lime, save the flavor.

F: A decent amount of carbonation with a slightly slick finish. Light-bodied.

O: This beer has its good points, but doesn't quite succeed. Not terrible, though.\xa0730 charactersavalon07, Oct 22, 2017"]

name: H Is For Hops
review:
['3.9/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Poured a golden-orange body with minimal head and lace patches down the glass. The aroma is hoppy with floral and citric notes along with a lemon juice-like sharpness. Hoppy, zesty, sour-like lemon floral hops with hints of grapefruit and tropical fruit sweetness and a crisp, somewhat salty finish.\xa0301 charactersclayrock81, Jun 17, 2019', '4.13/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.2%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4.25Boy, is my face red! I spent most of last week running through Evil Twin's Sue Grafton series of beers. ICYMI, she was the author of the Kinsey Milhone series of mystery novels in which each title beCAN with a successive letter of the alphabet. I was not a big fan of her series, but I like these much more. Sadly, I don't think that I bought either A, B or C when they were released, but I plan to stay current from now on. I was becoming anxious that I might have missed this one when lo & behold, I found it in my backlog while prepping for the upcoming New Beer Sunday! I had bought it at the Universal Package Store in NLON, CT during a recent Navy reunion. Viva The CANQuest (tm)! This absolutely marks my last one for the time being, unless A Is For Apricot and/or B Is For Blueberry turn up or the I entry is released. 

From the CAN: "Let's face it - we all like to put labels on things. It just makes us feel more comfortable. What assumptions have people made about you based on your race, religion, gender, the way you dress, or even the beer you drink? We did in fact label this beer for your convenience. It his a fresh tartness, a twist of salt and a balanced fruitiness of fresh hops - apparently a complete reflection of your personality. We hope you like what this label says about you?" 

My CANputer is acting wonky. I'm going to save this & return ASAP!

It turned out to be a pending system update & such was my aging computer's way of alerting me. 8=( Well, alles gutes now & so I shall proceed as though there had been no break in the action. 

This has been quite the series, to date! With this one, I am as up-to-date as Kansas City (an allusion to the musical "Oklahoma") & having gained a modicum of exbeerience since "D Is For Dewberry", I Crack!ed open the vent & beCAN a quick, steady, C-Line Glug into the awaiting glass. It reacted like so many of its predecessors, quickly foaming up to form just under two fingers of fizzy, foamy, rocky, bone-white head with limited retention before falling back & away to wisps. Color was a cloudy Yellow-Gold (SRM = 4 - 5). Nose had an interesting twist in that not only was the saltiness quite prevalent, but it also had a grapefruit citrusiness! 

It is the saltiness of the style that always takes me back to my U.S. Navy career & my time underway. We did not do it often enough on my first ship, which is why I requested a swap of orders to my second ship. Aboard the USS Crommelin (FFG-37), we were underway a good bit & I really came into my own as a sailor. I became a boxer & a fighter, a damage CANtrol locker leader & a helicopter crash & rescue team leader. The latter meant that I spent a LOT of time on the flight deck, the fantail or the helo hanger & while food was not supposed to leave the mess decks, they turned a blind eye to those of us who wanted to eat chow on station, al fresco, as it were. I was big on FF&V (fresh fruit & vegetables), eschewing red meat for the most part. As such, I got more than my fair share of FF&V to eat & besides tropical fruit, I loved grapefruit, sometimes taking two (2) whole ones up topside & leisurely eating them in the salt air. Heaven. 

Grapefruit & salt! Now, we're talkin'. Great nose! Mouthfeel was thin-to-medium, a little bigger than usual. The taste was the dictionary definition of "tart" - really puckering from the time that it hit my lips until well past the swallow. 8=* Phew! I still prefer this tartness to sour, which catches me in the hinges of my jaw & makes my ears Pop! There was a little of that going on, also, but in the main, it was simply tart & salty. Phew. Finish was super-dry & clearly not meant for the uninitiated. My eyes also felt dry. Man, this one was sucking the air out of the room & yet, it didn't suck! Quite a find on my road trip.\xa03,801 characterswoodychandler, Jun 07, 2019', "4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Note to self read before you buy and try, unless you want a surprise. Hops in my mind equates to hoppy beer. Wasn't expecting a gose, but this is a great beer.\xa0159 charactersKorbynlehr, May 27, 2019", '4.34/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.4%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Very hazy pineapple juice yellow with a substantial foamy white head that retains well, finally subsiding to just a light skim but produces some nice lacing. The aroma is tropical fruit, with an overtone of pine resin and fresh hay. The taste is complex, lots of tropical fruit - grapefruit, pineapple, lemon, passion fruit, etc., hints of apple pear and white grapes, saltine crackers, grass, and pine. The finish is very dry with grapefruit, pine and salt lingering. The body is medium light, smooth. Overall a very complex, flavorful and refreshing brew.\xa0557 characterswhynot44, Apr 15, 2019', '4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 416 ounce can into tulip glass; no can datng, but was just released. Pours very hazy medium golden yellow color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice dense spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of huge tart/sour lemon, lime, orange, grapefruit, peach, pear, pineapple, apricot, passion fruit, papaya, mango, melon, guava, berries, citrus peel/zest, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, and white bread; with lighter notes of peppercorn, pine, musty/lacto funk, white wine vinegar, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/acidic yeast, citrus/tropical hops, sea salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt notes; with big strength. Taste of huge tart/sour lemon, lime, orange, grapefruit, peach, pear, pineapple, apricot, passion fruit, papaya, mango, melon, guava, berries, citrus peel/zest, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, and white bread; with lighter notes of peppercorn, pine, musty/lacto funk, white wine vinegar, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate lactic tart/sourness; and light pine, herbal, floral, grassy, peppery bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/sour lemon, lime, orange, grapefruit, peach, pear, pineapple, apricot, passion fruit, papaya, mango, melon, guava, berries, citrus peel/zest, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, light pepper/funk/vinegar, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, citrus/tropical hops, sea salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; with an awesome malt/tart/sourness balance, and no puckering flavors after the finish. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering tart/sourness and carbonation. Medium-plus carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/bready/grainy/acidic, fairly crisp, and lightly saline/sticky balanced mouthfeel that is fantastic. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.5%. Overall this is a fantastic dry hopped gose! All around fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, citrus/tropical hops, sea salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth and fairly crisp/refreshing to drink, with the mellowly acidic/drying finish; not overly lactic or salty. Tastes like a lot of Galaxy/Mosaic. Amazing balance of juicy/vibrant hops and Lacto complexity, with slight dankness; with a great pale/wheat malt backbone against acidity. Mild residual sweetness with crisp dryness. A highly enjoyable offering, and amazing spot style example as expected. Best of the letter sour series so far.\xa02,830 characterssuperspak, Mar 28, 2019']

brewery: Three Notch'd Brewing Company - Charlottesville Brewery & Restaurant
name: Blackberry Gose
review:
['4.24/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.4%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25This is a very good gose. Very light carbonation with a mauve/taupe tinge to the color. Aroma is what you would expect from a sour but with blackberries coming through. Taste and feel is exceptional. Very easy drinking and appropriate for any season.\xa0250 charactersDarkSideOfTheMoon, Mar 11, 2019', '4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Appearance is clear with slight red tint.
Aroma is blackberries.
Taste is light blackberry.
Slightly under-carbonated. Growler fill poured into a nonic glass.
Overall, very tasty. Light and refreshing.\xa0201 characterswhitetale, Mar 10, 2019', "4.17/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25A - Hazy, dark orange body, with a thin white head that fades to an intermittent cap. Stringy line lacing runs down the glass.

S - Smart nose of berry and bright acidity. Quiet, but promises something tasty.

T - And the flavor delivers on the nose's promise - big blackberry flavor up front, a strong acidic bite, and a slightly saline berry jam trail. Yum.

M - Brisk carbonation, slightly puckering acidity, and a lingering tingle on the tongue. Bright!

O - The berry note reminds me of Berliner Weisse with syrup, but the result is more integrated, makes good use of the salt, and delivers a delicious take on the classic.\xa0632 charactersTsar_Riga, Mar 31, 2018", "4.2/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.4%look: 5 | smell: 3 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.5Wow - just wow. What a delightful gose! I'm a huge fan of goses and sours, and I picked up this TNBC Blackbery Gose the other day for a dinner party. I made an excellent choice!

The gose is crisp, but not overly intensely so. It's very slightly sweet, with a hint of salt and sour in there. It's not the sourest gose, nor the sweetest. But it finds its balance right in the middle without compromising anything. If you love sours and goses, my guess is that you'll like this. If you tend to like sweet drinks, you'll probably also like this. If you want an easy-drinking Saturday afternoon beer - this is the beer for you.\xa0623 characterslapland_lapin, Mar 24, 2018", '3.79/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.6%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Pours reddish-orange with a thin white head that fizzes away rapidly. Smells tart, with a hint of blackberry, maybe a note of Jolly Rancher candy. Taste is tart with a little blackberry note to it. Crisp, light body. Pretty solid gose, a little sweet, a little tart, not terribly complex. Easy drinking.\xa0303 charactersRiff, Jan 29, 2018']

name: Never Ever
review: ['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.6%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Hazy plum color with light pinkish head. Aroma has dank strawberry, earthy with some vegetal notes and tart fruits. Taste has earthy notes with some plastic like strawberry notes, quite tart and fruity. Medium to light body with medium carbonation. Quite soft mouthfeel but strawberry in beer is seldom integrated well.\xa0319 charactersCiocanelu, Jan 25, 2019']

name: Batch #034
review:
["4.21/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.1%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25The affinity that sour ale has with mango is one of the best in all the world of culinary arts. Tangy, succulent and highly refreshing, Nowhere In Particular Brewing can't resist the temptation to give the these two love birds a spin.

Batch #034, or Mango Lime Gose pours with a pale pastel golden color that hinges on peach. Floating the beer lies a stubby white cap that pops excitedly to reveal a rich citronella bouquet. Citrus, orchard fruit, tropical fruit and a faint whiff of the sea drifts across the nose ahead of the soft malty sweetness of saltwater taffy, sourdough and mild agave.

As the fruit flavors unfold on the middle palate, the full mango and lime characters take over. Mango leads the way with a close backup of orange, papaya and pineapple. Soon after, the lime steps up with its counterparts of cider, white wine, lemon and yuzu. Trending sharply but cleanly sour, a gentle earthiness of burlap offers a soft earthy note while the sea salt adds an off-salty roundness to the late palate.

Light in body but remaining creamy and drying, the tartness of fruit and fermentation cleanses the palate with ease, ushering in a high degree of refreshment, drinkability, a quick aftertaste and sheer enjoyment. The ale never looses its identifiable mango or lime flavor as its sure to be a great choice for sangria and bellini lovers as well as those of beer.\xa01,376 charactersBEERchitect, Sep 19, 2019", '4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.3%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.512 oucne can into tulip glass, canned in 6/2019. Pours very hazy deep golden amber color with a 1 finger dense white head with good retention, that reduces to a thin spotty lace cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing on the glass, with a light amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big juicy/tart/tangy mangoes, lime, lemon, orange, fruit skin, citrus peel/zest, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, coriander, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/acidic yeast, mango, lime, coriander, sea salt, and pale/wheat malt notes; with big strength. Taste of big juicy/tart/tangy mangoes, lime, lemon, orange, fruit skin, citrus peel/zest, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, coriander, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang, and light coriander spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/tangy mangoes, lime, lemon, orange, fruit skin, citrus peel/zest, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, coriander, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, mango, lime, coriander, sea salt, and pale/wheat malt flavors; with an awesome malt/tartness and tangy fruit balance; with no puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp finishing. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering tartness and tangy fruit. Medium carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/grainy/acidic/tangy, and lightly sticky/saline balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.8%. Overall this is an awesome fruited gose. All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, mango, lime, coriander, sea salt, and pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth, refreshing, and fairly crisp to drink with the modestly acidic/tangy/drying finish; not overly lactic/salty. Very flavorful and not watery for the ABV. Awesome balanced super juicy/vibrant fruit and Lacto complexity; with a great balanced pale/wheat malt backbone against acidity for the ABV. Minimal residual sweetness with crisp dryness. A really enjoyable offering, and outstanding spot on style example as expected.\xa02,531 characterssuperspak, Jul 13, 2019', '4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.1%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Appearance - Pours hazy yellowish orange with a thin white head that quickly dissipates to nothing. No lacing.

Aroma - Huge lime aroma, orange, salt, and mango.

Taste - Drinks almost like a mixed drink. Lots of lime, orange the coriander should probably be left out it adds an earthiness that detracts. Nice salty finish.

Feel - Light bodied up front little slick and sticky on the finish light dryness.

Overall - Hit the mark with this one, nice flavors not a fan of the coriander.\xa0486 charactersDragginballs76, Jul 05, 2019', '4.08/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.8%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.2512oz can poured into a pils glass
A: Opaque pale orange/light brown, one finger head that settles very quickly
S: Orange, lime, mango
T: Matches the nose adding a bit of salt & coriander
M: Light-bodied, crisp
O: While perhaps not an original blend, it’s refreshing, crisp/clean and well made\xa0294 charactersONUMello, Jun 09, 2019']

name: Gose
review:
['3.59/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.7%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.25On tap @ Bad Seed.

Pint glass. They still exist in NYC. Light, pale opaque gold body.

Smells of mellow malt, lemon, not much else.

Taste is starchy, tart, light lemon, light pepper, yeasties. Good carb, maybe too thin.

Easy, if a bit too basic to compare to German varients.\xa0278 charactersPEBKAC, Jul 14, 2019', '3.83/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 4A: The beer is crystal clear light yellow in color and has a light amount of visible carbonation. It poured with a short bright white head that died down rather quickly, leaving a large patch of bubbles on the surface and a narrow collar around the edge of the glass.
S: Light aromas of lactobacillus are present in the nose.
T: The has flavors of yogurt along with notes of salt and hints of lemons, the latter of which becomes stronger as the beer warms up.
M: It feels light-bodied, somewhat tart and a little creamy on the palate with a moderate amount of visible carbonation.
O: This beer is easy to drink and has some refreshing properties.

Serving type: growler\xa0670 charactersmetter98, Dec 02, 2017']

name: Passionfruit Gose
review:
['4.35/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Bottle.

A: Lots of passion fruit upfront, followed by bright moderate hoppy citrus and light dank aromas, light salt and moderate sourness on the finish.

A: Bright golden color, slightly hazy, with a frothy white uniform head that has solid retention and light lacing in the glass.

T: Moderately strong passion fruit, with lots of hoppy citrus notes in support, followed by light salt and a clean moderate (fairly lacto) sourness through the finish.

M: Medium-light bodied with moderate carbonation.

O: Excellent; the beer has lot of passion fruit aroma and flavor, coupled with lots of citrus hoppy notes that are nicely complimented by light salt and moderate sourness.\xa0676 charactersPhil-Fresh, May 15, 2017']

name: Off She Gose
review:
['3.8/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Look: It pours straw with a white head. Head retention is low but there is some lacing. 

Smell: It has a definitive flowery aroma. Hibiscus is the main flower that comes through with a bit of cherry and some wheat. 

Taste: There are flower like flavors with wheat and a crackery grain element. It also has some salt with dark cherries and a vinous quality about it. 

Fee: It is moderately tart on the palate with a moderate body on the light side. The wheat and grainy cracker are long lasting in the finish. 

Overall, this is an interesting Gose with flowers front forward, the fruits in the middle, and the wheat and grains at the end.\xa0641 charactershman43, Jun 16, 2017', '4.04/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.8%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4A: Pours a hazy medium straw yellow in color with moderate amounts of active visible carbonation and moderate lemon yellow + golden yellow highlights. The beer has a two finger tall sudsy foamy white that reduces to a large patch of thin film covering the entire surface of the beer and a thin ring at the edges of the glass. Light amounts of lacing are observed.

S: Light to moderate aromas of slightly sour wheat with a light amount of lemon citrus and a hint of brininess.

T: Upfront there is a moderate flavor of slightly sour wheat with a hint of grainy malts. That is followed by a light amount of brininess and a touch of coriander spice. Light to moderate flavors of orange zest and citrus/lemon hops. Minimal amounts of bitterness but a light amount of lingering tartness in the finish.

M: Light bodied with moderate amounts of carbonation. Light amounts of acidic prickliness. 

O: Very refreshing and very easy to drink with well hidden alcohol. A very nice example of the gose style and very enjoyable. I could easily have a couple of these, especially with as hot as it has been around here lately.\xa01,114 charactersdbrauneis, Jun 14, 2016', '4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.1%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Hazy pale gold with a foamy white head that lingers for a bit and leaves a few ribbons of lacing. The beer smells tangy and bright with citrus notes, hay and a bit of seawater. The taste is only mildly tart with a decent amount of coriander and a hint of citrus. There is a saltiness at the end and some toasted wheat. This is a really nice gose that is a little less tart and quite thirst quenching.\xa0400 charactersFriedSlug, May 07, 2016', "4.33/5\xa0\xa0rDev +10.2%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.5On tap at the brewery:

Look: Translucent straw color. Not clear by any means, but there is some light coming through the glass.

Aroma: Huge sour notes but it is balanced well with a malt aroma. 

Taste: Sourness is very present initially, but it fades as the malt backbone of the beer becomes more apparent. It's actually balanced very well as not to overpower with astringency. The saltiness is present and pleasant. 

Feel: Refreshing. The carbonation adds to the pleasantness of the beer. As the style dictates, this beer gose very well with hot summer weather. 

Overall: Typically, I am not a fan of the gose style (due to a few bad and undrinkable experiences in the past), but this is an excellent example of what a gose should be. It's a very situational beer, but I found it to be enjoyable without overpowering sourness.\xa0845 charactersAdamGrant, Jul 04, 2015"]

name: Heath Sweat
review:
['1.86/5\xa0\xa0rDev -45%look: 2 | smell: 1 | taste: 2.25 | feel: 2 | overall: 2I am honestly offended this was bottled and distributed. While i agree with other reviewers, this has some nice salty sour flavors, some fruity overtones. They are COMPLETELY masked by the overwhelming cheese and foot odor of the beer. I drained poured it, and now my kitchen smells like sh*t too.\xa0297 charactersTommo, Feb 13, 2016', '3.42/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.2%look: 4 | smell: 2.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5I am really torn on this beer. I actually really enjoyed the taste. Lots of nice sour and salty notes that one expects from the style, but the nose was so awful that it made it hard to drink. The nose was a lot like sweaty feet. I know that funk is normal with the style, but this one was overpowering.\xa0302 charactersBeerSamurai34, Jan 24, 2016', '4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev +21.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Pours an effervescent gold with a pinky of ivory colored head. Murks up a bit, above average head retention & lacing

S: Horse blanket, not much else, a little yeastyness

T: Saltyness, sourness, a little bit of lime up front. Saltyness, coriander & lime as this warm. Finishes tart, a little lemony, with salty goodness & just a kiss of melon

MF: Light body & lively carbonation

Super drinkability, a very solid take on the style they should revisit\xa0458 charactersrusspowell, Dec 31, 2015']

name: Kiwi Gose
review:
["3.95/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Aroma is coriander and lactic acid sourness. Kiwi isn't prominent.

Flavor is fairly tart, with a dry coriander finish. Salinity is on point. Again, not sure I'd know kiwi was an ingredient. Tasty, though!\xa0205 charactersbarczar, Sep 11, 2016", '3.79/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.8%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Appearance- The beer was straw yellow color with a bubbly white head. 

Smell - The beer smells like a straight gose. I really do not detect fruit.

Taste - The gose is more aggressively sour at the front. Since kiwi does not have a real distinct taste, I am uncertain how much I get. With salt detected, the tastes fades quickly. 

Mouthfeel - The carbonation is pretty spot on for a gose. 

Overall - Of the Sour Note fruit goses, this might be the weak link.\xa0461 charactersJohnnyHopps, Sep 05, 2016']

name: Willow Gose
review: ['3.69/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Draft: Poured a clear pale yellow gose with a nice white foamy head. Aroma of tart notes with light lemony notes is pleasant. Taste is a mix of tart notes with some lemony notes. Body is about average with good carbonation. Refreshing beer with nice lemony flavours.\xa0267 charactersPhyl21ca, Jun 28, 2018', '3.91/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.1%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Dense hazy shiny dark straw color with no visible activity. Slightly foamy white 1-2 finger head, lasting around 2 minutes, with poor legs. Flavors of sweet grains dominant wheat, cabbage, cranberries, and floral hops. Slick full body with high crispy carbonation. Light to medium strength finish, sour tart feel with a bit of straw. Vegetal, salty and flowery with a hint of wood and cheese. Real good freshness. One of my favorite Gose with a much more refined taste than usual. Very well balanced and deep complexion. Overall excellent quality craft.\xa0553 charactersTheBierdimpfe, Oct 04, 2017', '3.65/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.9%look: 3 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.5Bottled 600ml. Beer in a slightly clouded dress, blonde with a small ephemeral white foam leaving a small ring around the glass, no lacing. On the nose, sour cereals, lemony, mineral, sea salt. Taste is wheat, lactic bacteria, lemon. It is a well salted gose, sour sea in a glass! Quite refreshing, light body!\xa0310 charactersFrudel, Jul 15, 2017', '4.04/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4On tap at the local. \nIncredibly clear appearance with a light auburn hue. Initially a strong white head that quickly fades to a ring around the glass with almost zero lacing. Strong lemon nose and flavour with minimal salt. Nice clean finish. Really enjoyable and refreshing.\xa0276 charactersdabeerbuddha, Nov 17, 2016']
