name: $ellray $our
review:
['3.94/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.1%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Canned 5/4/18; drank 5/31/18 @ the Yarchives. 

Cloudy dull dandelion appearance; champagne bubbles throughout. 

A rough pour yielded a big, noisy white head; minimal lace. 

Celery, mild black pepper & faint cucumber notes in the nose. 

Medium thin mouthfeel. 

Celery & faint tart lemon flavors up front; mild sea salt & faint black pepper notes on the finish. 

Refreshing & balanced; a killer hot summer beer. I was apprehensive...buy with confidence.\xa0457 charactersGuyFawkes, Sep 17, 2019', '3.62/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.6%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5Appearance - The beer was golden in color with a clean white head. 

Smell - The nose bring to mind celery salt without the Chicago style hot dogs. 

Taste - Celery salt is the initial taste, followed by sour lemon. As the lemon becomes more sour like lemon rind, there developed a leafy quality. I was made to think of celery leaves. The lemon essence continues in the aftertaste. 

Mouthfeel - Carbonation is appropriate to the style, with the body having some viscosity. 

Overall - This is not one of Pipeworks better beers, but it is unique.\xa0546 charactersJohnnyHopps, Jun 16, 2019', "3.68/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Who would bother making a beer with celery? Who wants a celery beer? I am simultaneously shocked by this concept and appreciative of Pipeworks for daring to try it. It's not for me, but I have a tough time finding fault with it that isn't related to my own tastes. It's a celery gose, alright.\xa0293 charactersdarktronica, Sep 04, 2018", "3.56/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5Tasted in a Rastal Teku from a one pint can on May 18, 2018. Gose brewed with celery and celery seed. Smell and taste is tart celery. Not bad, I'm just not a big fan of vegetable beers.\xa0185 charactersHopheadjeffery, May 29, 2018"]

name: Gosebuster
review:
["3.53/5\xa0\xa0rDev -8.1%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 1.75 | overall: 3.5The latest version of this beer is 6.0% ABV.

A: Pours a light golden color and is quite hazy. Head is creamy looking with ok retention and lacing is alright.

S: Actual straw, light barnyard, coriander seeds, salt and light green apple tartness and lime. Slightly sweet with light honey and biscuit malts. Not very traditional but smells alright.

T: Taste is stronger than expected considering the ABV. You get the straw, barnyard funk, coriander seeds at the front with juicy green apples and lime finishing with a slight salty finish. The higher than usual amount of residual sugar adds to the juiciness of the beer. Malt profile is much less present than in the smell but still a little bit there. It's definitely a really good and quite unique tasting beer.

M: Body is too heavy for the genre. Is kind of weirdly syrupy too with medium to low american style yeast carbonation, which isn't correct.

O: It's a good tasting beer that isn't much genre-correct. Taste is good, smell is meh, mouthfeel is pretty bad.\xa01,018 charactersflipper2gv, Aug 08, 2019", '4.12/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Slightly hazy light golden color with good activity. Foamy 3 finger head, lasting around 5-10 minutes, with poor legs and mediocre swirl reaction. Flavors of lime, cranberries, straw, coriander, salt, and floral hops. Slick medium body with a decent crisp. Medium to strong strength finish, highly fruity and tart, moderate vegetal spiciness, pleasant wheat 
feel and a bit flowery. Thick double flavored Gose, slightly more sweet than usual, this greatly augments the balance and makes it more bearable to drink. This also makes the freshness pretty good for the style. Lots of complexity in this brew with interesting ingredients, overall excellent quality craft.\xa0665 charactersTheBierdimpfe, Oct 10, 2018', '3.86/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.5%look: 3.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75Appearance: A murky yellow body with low carbonation that produced two fingers worth of head that immediately dissipated and didn't lace very much.

Smell: Oh man, this is going to be a punch in the face...I can tell as it has an overwhelming lime smell punctuated back a background of sea surf. Warming was not remotely needed.

Taste: The best way to describe the potency of this is beer's sour note, would be "POW!" from the 60's Batman television. show. It starts with the small wheat malt presence with maybe a hint of coriander with a strong lime presence and then "BIFF!" as a salty lime bash hits you right in the face as it slowly peters out. This stuff could easily substitute as a chaser for tequilla...something that I'm not going to recommend here. It's a good thing I'm a fan of sour.

Mouthfeel: As I said, this stuff hits you like a shot to the mouth, and normally that would bug me, but for some reason it doesn't here. The carbonation is a bit low but the mild lime aftertaste makes up for it.

Drinkability: The beer's carbonation comes forth after it has been taken down, which isn't very pleasant. What is pleasant is that it's highly refreshing and masks its high alcohol content masterfully. 

Final Thoughts: If you want a sour beer that is going to punch you in the mouth, wake you up and gets you tanked twice as fast as light beer with all the refreshment and flavour, this is the beer for you. If none of that appeals to you (and it's understandable that it might not) this beer isn't for you. I enjoyed it, so if you want a sour sour, grab this guy.\xa01,578 charactersTheHammer, Mar 27, 2018']

name: Gose
review:
["3.78/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75At the source.

With the strict beer laws on ABV for beers served at breweries in Oklahoma, it's very nice to see a beer option that is actually supposed to be lower in ABV, as opposed to a beer that's tuned down to fit the ABV. 

Pale yellow in color. Very subtle fruit in the aroma and taste. Slightly tart with faint sour candy, lingering citrus peel and a touch of salt. Light and quite dry. 

A nice brew from a nice brewery, and things should really take off when the ABV chains are lifted, but this particular brew could use just a little boost.\xa0556 charactersstephens101, Jun 18, 2016"]

name: Rose Wheat
review:
["3.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3 | taste: 3 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.25A- Very nice super white head that has excellent retention, starting a full finger thick and settling to a thick layer around a half finger in thickness. The color of the beer itself is a yeast clouded yellow with golden/straw hues all over it as well. The carbonation is aggressive and with big bubbles rising quickly to the top of the liquid, while the lacing is modest overall.....some small patches of protein cling before slowly sliding to the abyss.

S- I detect huge citrus fruit (grapefruit/pomello/lemon zest), along with bittering hops, grainy barley and wheat, floral aromas (roses do come to mind), some spicy heat from the ginger root used, and the finish is clean and full of hops again. Nice overall!

T- Ok this is interesting to say the least......initial flavors of citrus flesh, floral notes, and theres an underlying soapiness that seems to take me back to my childhood (soapy bathwater). I could see this being a bold lemonade tasting beer as well.....as time goes on, the flavors meld and get better, with the finish being refreshing and palate cleansing. Still not sure at the same time though.

M/O- Palate scrubbing carbonation allows this to be a reasonably simple beer flavor wise and overall this is a light bodied brew. It's drinkable enough, but I don't think it's a really good social kind of beverage, as it's weird.....nothing wrong with trying though right?! I'd probably pass in the future but would drink it again if offered one......\xa01,476 charactersChrisCage, May 19, 2017", "2.34/5\xa0\xa0rDev -28.9%look: 2.75 | smell: 3 | taste: 2 | feel: 2 | overall: 2.25Are they sure that this isn't mead? Because it is watery, pink, and tastes nothing like beer.
Too yeasty, too fruity, and too light to be enjoyable.
I'm sad to say that I couldn't even finish a whole bottle of it.\xa0213 charactersMAB, Jan 11, 2017", "3.65/5\xa0\xa0rDev +10.9%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75330ml bottle, day 4 of the 2016 Craft BeerAdvent calendar - a rose and ginger-flavoured sour beer - also made with 'malted what', apparently. What the what?

This beer pours a hazy, pale golden straw colour, with a teeming tower of puffy, finely foamy, and mildly creamy bone-white head, which leaves some high-flying streaky lace around the glass as it very slowly abates.

It smells of rather pungent rose water (like my Mom's old bathroom), zesty ginger spice, some muddled pale and wheaten cereal malt, a hint of earthy yeastiness, and some plain leafy, weedy, and further floral green hop bitters. The taste is gritty and bready pale malt, some grainy wheatiness, more estery rose petals (bordering on Turkish Delight), white saltine crackers, lemongrass, musty ginger root, and more tame leafy, herbal, and piney verdant hoppiness.

The carbonation is fairly active, if in a plain-Jane frothy manner, the body a so-so medium weight, and mostly smooth, if attar perfume is your idea of a good mouthfeel time. It finishes off-dry, a lingering mixed maltiness tamping down on the rose and ginger essences, to all our good fortune.

Overall, I can't complain that this brewery didn't bring their A game in providing the promised flavours - I mentioned Turkish Delight earlier (which I could really go for right about now), and I stand by that, if in a much less sweeter version than yer typical bulk aisle purchase. Interesting, and yet another reason why this crazy-assed Yuletide mixed pack is worth it.\xa01,511 charactersbiboergosum, Dec 05, 2016", '3.58/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Golden-bronze with a white head, very thin ring of retention.

Some floral perfume in the aroma, with underlying ginger bread.

Taste is full on ginger, like a Jamaican ginger beer, with a little wheats biscuit.

Light to moderate body is bubbly, with a dry finish.\xa0265 charactersDerek, Nov 10, 2016', "3.43/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Bottled
A found the whole affair a little odd to be honest 
Slight pink blush to a golden body with thin white head
Aroma exactly as name suggests 
a little too perfumed for me I'm afraid\xa0187 charactersEmperorBevis, Dec 27, 2014"]

review: ['4.16/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.5%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Raziel313, May 28, 2017', '4.05/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4sd123, Apr 10, 2017', '3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Gagnonsux, Mar 12, 2017', '4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Keananmichael5, Dec 03, 2016', '4.02/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4kmanjohnson, Dec 03, 2016', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4GRG1313, Nov 27, 2016', '3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Furlinator, Nov 13, 2016', '3.74/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75notchucknorris, Apr 19, 2016', '4.23/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.3%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25cocoapuph, Mar 01, 2016']

name: Eli Traks Popsicle
review:
['4.22/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.2%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Not usually a fan of sours but this brewpub came highly recommended by a BA maven. 

Beautiful thick juicy pour of red. Fruit smell. Tastes or tropical fruuit, I get the berries and mango on the nose and tongue. 

Not as sour as expected. A pleasant tart finish is more like it. Can’t go wrong with this one!\xa0315 charactersDmbphoenix, Mar 17, 2019']

name: Cranberry Gose
review: ['3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.2%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75underrated here in my opinion, this is very light, summery, and crushable, not too sour, and without too much fruit. the cranberry is an accent, its natural and not forced, and this drinks about as easy as any sour i have known. if you want a more striking gose, you will have to look elsewhere. clean as the lactic element here is, its mild, and the salt part is pretty subtle too, so really its just a lightly tart wheat beer with a hint of cranberry, which in hot weather is pretty ideal. my lady loved this, pounded it actually, and i found myself sipping pretty quickly too. it has a light floral coriander sort of aspect to it, and the natural tang of the cranberry there in nose and taste, minerals more than brine at the end, but it helps dry it out. i like that the wheat malt can still be tasted and appreciated here too, and its very well carbonated, almost like a soda in the absence of much body. the whole thing could be about 20% more dramatic, but i like it being understated as well, and think it leads to increased session potential. i have still been pretty up and down on the beers these guys make, but this is definitely one of the good ones! try it on a hot day right from the can!\xa01,203 charactersStonedTrippin, Feb 27, 2019']

name: Never Light
review: ['4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.4%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25The Veil\'s "Never" series of Goses seem to be home run balls pretty much every time. This is right up there with the others - nicely tart, well fruited, mild on the salt.\xa0170 characterskrome, Jun 22, 2018']

name: Van Art
review:
["4.03/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Ruby colored beer, very tart and jammy. Salt notes in the back. Summer thirst quencher but it's not too simple or watery. Can't wait to crack into a few of these when it's 80+ outside and I'm grilling something tasty.\xa0217 charactersBranfordBound, May 21, 2019", "4.01/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.6%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Smell: Sea salt and tart berries.Jammy Raspberry, a hint of blueberry. Wheat bread. It smells like a nice Tart refreshing summer beer.

Taste: upfront your hit with a nice saltiness that carries throughout the beer. In the mid palate you get light berry notes, Raspberry pure, wheat bread. The beer finishes with a hint of blueberry tartness and sea salt. 

Feel: light medium body. A really clean tasting beer. Extremely easy drinking. It wouldn't be hard to drink a lot of this beer in the summer.

Overall: A really nice Gose. All the flavors are light and not overwhelming. It's a great option for a summer beer.\xa0616 charactersMasonz223, Jul 27, 2017"]

name: Salinity
review:
['3.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev -10%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.5refreshing enough but there is an off flavor that i dont enjoy... its very distinct but cant quite put a finger on it. like chalky or soapy or something!\xa0153 charactersHyptochrons, Aug 13, 2019', "4.04/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.9%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Growler hour after pour:
Pours a dark golden, with a light haze and a decent white head that fades fairly quickly. A thing ring remains but provides no lacing.

Nose is heavy on the grain, it seems. Wheat and cereal notes give way to just a hint of tartness and saltiness.

The taste also get cereal in the backbone, but there's a lime-level tartness (though it is lacto in flavor) that pairs with this right up front. The salinity level, ironically enough, stays light and fills in the back as the tartness fades a bit.

A pretty solid, straightforward Gose that has a moderate level of tartness and lets the grain bill show, but could probably use just a little more salt flavor.\xa0684 characterscjgiant, Nov 22, 2017"]

name: Mar-GOSE-rita
review: ['3.44/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.8%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Draught in Brewpub: this one poured a hazy, light golden color. It had a small white head. There is some sour fruits to the nose and not much else. The taste is lighter, sour fruits. Some earthy notes. Not too tart. It has a slightly lighter body. OK\xa0250 charactersBoto, Oct 10, 2013', '3.19/5\xa0\xa0rDev -9.9%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3I remember this offering being way too salty. I had tried a small pour at the brewery, thinking it was a solid brew. But when I got home, and got maybe two and a half pints off the growler, I found it to be not as drinkable. Maybe should have split the growler with a friend, even though their growlers are rather small.\xa0320 charactersTidesox28, Sep 29, 2013']

name: Guava Lava
review: ['4.74/5\xa0\xa0rDev +20.3%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.75This was recommended by Gabe at Plaza Liquors in Tucson, as I buzzed through on a last minute New Year\'s Eve sour-spree. What a wonderful surprise! My knee-jerk response upon first sip was "this tastes like Strawberry Quik". It pretty much stayed that way. Kinda milky, and fruity. I\'ve never had anything like it.\xa0314 charactersUncleBuccs, Jan 09, 2019', "3.78/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.1%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.5Got in a trade from RaulMondesi. 16 ounce can into tulip glass, no can dating. Pours moderately hazy/cloudy golden amber color with a 1 finger fairly dense and rocky white head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of juicy/lightly tart/tangy guava, passion fruit, lemon, lime, orange, peach, pear, red/green apple, melon, hay, straw, grass, sea salt, wheat, cracker, white bread, light lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Nice and pleasant aromas with good balance and complexity of fruity/acidic yeast, guava, salt, and pale/wheat malt notes; with solid strength. Taste of juicy/lightly tart/tangy guava, passion fruit, lemon, lime, orange, peach, pear, red/green apple, melon, hay, straw, grass, sea salt, wheat, cracker, white bread, light lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light fruity/lactic tartness and fruit tang on the finish. Lingering notes of guava, passion fruit, lemon, lime, orange, peach, pear, red/green apple, melon, hay, straw, grass, sea salt, wheat, cracker, white bread, light lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, guava, salt, and pale/wheat malt flavors; with a great malt/tartness and tangy fruit balance; with zero puckering flavors after the finish. Light-moderate increasing dryness from tartness, tangy fruit, and carbonation. Medium-high carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately bready/grainy, fairly acidic/tangy, and lightly saline balanced mouthfeel that is nice. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5%. Overall this is a very good Gose. All around nice complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, guava, salt, and pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth and refreshing to drink with the mildly acidic/tangy finish, not overly lactic/salty. Very flavorful and not watery for the ABV. Not as huge on fruit or acidity as I expected, but this fits the style just fine. Nice balance of Lacto, fruit, salt, and pale/wheat malts. No detectable smoke from the salt at all, but it didn't matter. A very enjoyable offering, and well made style example otherwise.\xa02,264 characterssuperspak, Jun 30, 2018"]

name: Glow Worm
review:
["4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25On tap at Thin Man Brewery in Buffalo, NY.

This one pours a vivid dark purplish color, with a small head, and lots of lacing.

This smells like dark berry and dark fruit, very tart and very juicy, with a bit of acidity.

I don't get really get much guava here, but there's definitely a lot of boysenberry, with some lighter blackberry-like tones. There's not much here other than fruit, but it's definitely tasty anyway.

This has a pleasantly light acidity with a pretty crisp finish, and a high level of drinkability.

This is somewhat basic, but still tastes good, and goes down so easily.\xa0593 charactersGreesyFizeek, Feb 18, 2019", "4.16/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.5%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4A: The beer is hazy purplish red in color. It poured with a quarter finger high white head that left a thick collar around the edge of the glass and wisps of bubbles on the surface.
S: Strong aromas of guava are present in the nose.
T: The taste follows the smell and has lots of flavors of guava along with hints of boysenberry.
M: It feels light- to medium-bodied and slightly tart on the palate with a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: I really liked the dominant aromas and flavors of guava in this gose. It wasn't really sour or salty but had a nice amount of tartness.

Serving type: can\xa0595 charactersmetter98, Feb 03, 2019"]

name: Sweetie Pie
review:
["4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.8%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Bottled 7/1/16; drank 7/31/16 @ the Yarchives. 

Semi-opaque yellow/orange appearance. 

A rough pour yielded a nice white head; no lace. 

Sweet strawberry & dry rhubarb tartness notes in the nose. 

Medium thin mouthfeel. 

Sweet strawberry flavors up front; tart, dry rhubarb notes on the finish. 

Salt notes settled on my tongue over the course of the quaff. 

A simple, effective gose. I'd have another.\xa0409 charactersGuyFawkes, Oct 18, 2019"]

name: 3-2-1 Gose
review:
["3.96/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.3%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Poured from a crowler into a wheat ale glass.

Very nice darkness for a gose, a light copper like body with brass yellow glow mixed in. Nice clarity, and a touch of foamy head, that only slowly fizzles to a simple but good light white collar.

Tangy nose a bit, but also a good mixing of bready malt notes that get into slight doughy territory. Faint touch of bile though and a strange almost industrial mechanical smell. Still pleasant all considering.

Palate hits the right notes. Tangy and good bready chew in the middle of the palate, with refreshing lemon and even a bit of lime bit mixed in as well. Good mild salinity but just noticeable enough as well on the finish, creating quite a nice dryness to the beer as well.

A very nice take and a good simple tasty gose, with perhaps a faint touch of minor fault that really doesn't ruin the experience overall.\xa0870 charactersSmakawhat, Apr 30, 2017"]

name: Smoked Apple Gose
review:
['4.55/5\xa0\xa0rDev +13.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.5A: Hazy gold with small head that fades very fast and no lacing. 
N: Apples, some char/smoke, and wheat tones. 
T: Very nice, slight sour hit with a little smoke off the apples and some salt. 
M: Light
O: Outstanding beer, very easy to drink and super refreshing. Another Gem from AZ Wild.\xa0289 charactersAZBeerDude72, Jul 21, 2018', '4.05/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.7%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25these guys just keep doing it. you have to like the earthy and the weird, but if you do, this one is a special treat. the smoke in here is strong, its autumnal, campfire-esque, woody and rich, all things that gose, in its finest form, is not. its a cool idea to put two divergent vibes together, and they have done it brilliantly. there is enough sturdy wheat structure to this to support the both the piquant sourness from the lacto and the density of the smoke element, and the salt fits in nicely too. i think the apple is the thing that bridges the gap though, the skins are tart, the flesh is sweet, and it has both green and red apple characteristics, really natural fruit too, and almost like the fruit itself, not the malt, was the smoked part, although im not sure how they made this one in actuality. smoke has some nice bitterness in with it, not acrid at all, but grounding for sure, and its smooth in the feel for a sour beer, all just so interesting, flavors and textures together. this is very interesting stuff, sort of primitive and rustic, reminds me of something the dudes at scratch would make, which is a real high compliment!\xa01,147 charactersStonedTrippin, Sep 08, 2017', '4.3/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7%look: 4 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Tastes like a lichtenhaier style with nice smokiness. Really smells like braised pork and a smoker. Sugary apples and a slight sourness complements. All comes together real nicely.\xa0180 charactersMonkeyBread, Aug 13, 2016', '4.34/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Pours a slightly cloudy yellow, with a quickly dissipating white head. Instant aroma of smoked wood and faint acidity. Flavor is intense, but also subdued compared to a lot of other smoked beers I have had. Delicious tartness, and a mild sweet apple presence. Great for someone starting to get into either Rauchbiers or Gose. Cheers!\xa0338 charactersLingenbrau, Jul 07, 2016']

name: Never Meant
review: ['4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.4%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Peaches can win or loose andvthis is teatering between the two.63 charactersBEER88, Sep 04, 2017', '3.95/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.7%look: 4 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75revo, Aug 17, 2017', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4iRun2Beer, Jun 01, 2017', '4.27/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.9%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25pinebarons, Apr 03, 2017', '4.71/5\xa0\xa0rDev +12.4%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.75ogman, Mar 28, 2017', '3.97/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4brocktune, Mar 18, 2017', '4.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.4%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5atrocity, Mar 13, 2017', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4kylehay2004, Mar 12, 2017', '4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.4%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Casey3236, Mar 12, 2017']

name: Photo Booth
review:
['3.99/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2%look: 3 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Completely headless is the smooth fluid surface over a shimmeringly clear gem amber body.

Tart and crackery with a light salinity, this features a pleasant level of spicy grapefruit notes paired with accents of orange zest. 

The crisp tingly medium body finishes semi-dry, where it becomes lightly juicy with notes of cucumber on the swallow. The aftertaste is fucking amazing--it goes on and on with a mildly floral and citrusy, clean and refreshing character.\xa0463 charactersSabtos, Oct 23, 2019', '3.97/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 412oz can, media sample from the brewery.

This well balance tart ale comes across quite clean, the grapefruit flavor hit the palate at the same time as the sourness and plays well off of the malt base. Zesty with a citrus juicy punch, refreshing enough to make that next sip easy.\xa0281 charactersJason, Oct 18, 2019', '4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8.7%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 412 ounce can into tulip glass, canned on 8/20/2019. Pours lightly hazy/cloudy medium golden amber color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy off white head with solid retention, that reduces to a thin spotty lace cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big juicy/tart/tangy ruby red grapefruit, citrus peel/zest, orange, lemon, lime, peach, pear, apricot, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, and white bread dough; with light notes of toast, biscuit, peppercorn, lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of grapefruit juice/zest, fruity/acidic yeast, and moderate pale/wheat malt notes; with big strength. Taste of huge juicy/tart/tangy ruby red grapefruit, citrus peel/zest, orange, lemon, lime, peach, pear, apricot, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, and white bread dough; with light notes of toast, biscuit, peppercorn, lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang, zesty bitterness, and light spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/tangy ruby red grapefruit, citrus peel/zest, orange, lemon, lime, peach, pear, apricot, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light toast/biscuit/pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of grapefruit juice/zest, fruity/acidic yeast, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; with a fantastic malt/bitter/tartness and tangy fruit balance; with no pucker/astringent flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp/clean finishing. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering bitter/tang/tartness and carbonation. Medium-plus carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/grainy/acidic/tangy/zesty, and lightly saline balanced mouthfeel that is fantastic. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.3%. Overall this is a fantastic fruited gose! All around fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of grapefruit juice/zest, fruity/acidic yeast, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink with the mellowly acidic/tangy/drying finish; not overly lactic/salty. Very flavorful and not watery for the ABV. Amazing balance of super juicy/vibrant grapefruit/zest and Lacto complexity; with a great pale/wheat malt backbone against acidity for the ABV. Minimal residual sweetness with crisp dryness. A highly enjoyable offering, and amazing spot on style example as expected of the brewery. Have loved all of their sours so far.\xa02,732 characterssuperspak, Sep 26, 2019', '3.78/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Gose brewed with grapefruit juice and grapefruit zest. Poured from a can into an Urban Artifact Thoroughbred tulip. The pour is dark orange, hazy, and sports two fingers of fine white foam with low retention (typical for a sour beer). The nose is rather faint without much there, except for some grain, sharp vinegar, lemon rind, and grapefruit.​
​
Light body with a soft feel and a refreshing flavor. Up front is lots of sharp acidity. Lemon and grapefruit dominate with a little bit of orange peel and a faint touch of salt. The fruit flavors persist across the palate, softening on the finish. Lingering are tart flavors of lemon and grapefruit and when they drift away there is a distinct cereal-like graininess that complements the flavor well. Very refreshing beer. Reminds me a little of Pinwheel, but with a slightly softer flavor and without all of the citrusy goodness that one has.​\xa0899 charactersdeadonhisfeet, Aug 17, 2019']

name: Rhubarb Gose
review: ["4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.9%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Pours a whitish color with a slight pink tint, smells of funky yeast, rhubarb and strawberry. The taste is sour and tart, with an excellent rhubarb taste that doesn't overwhelm... Some other berries in there; strawberry and raspberry stick out. Is smooth with a nice amount of carbonation... A very well done gose with a fruit (vegetable?) that is not commonly utilized.\xa0372 charactersPourharddrinkslow, Nov 03, 2015"]

name: Grapefruit Gose
review:
['4.28/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25A: Hazy yellow/gold with mild head and zero lacing. 
N: Loads of grapefruit with some wheat tones. 
T: Amazing flavors, salty grapefruit with some wheat giving it a mild mouthfeel. 
M: Light to mild Medium
O: Fantastic, I am not a big GOSE drinker but this is amazing, I will always buy these when in season, very good and easy to drink, sour but not too much for those of us who cannot handle a lot.\xa0400 charactersAZBeerDude72, Jan 20, 2018']

name: Purple Grain
review:
["4.01/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.5%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Gusher right off the bat. Came cascading out of the bottle as soon as I opened the cap. Pours a... ruby thick looking body. It looks exactly like watermelon juice. Once I get it out of the bottle and into the glass, the effervescence calms down and the head, which is a pillow faded lavender/pink settles in easily to little more than some lazy wet bubbles gathered in a ring. 

Nose is tart with a slick salinity. As I let it sit there's a shift away from the tart and salinity and towards more straight grains and an earthiness that is undeniably boiled beets. That dull/sweet earthiness always reminds me of my mom cooking them up on the stove (and not just because it's Mothers Day!). I'm not a huge fan of beets. So this doesn't excite me overly much, but it is well done and is true to the stated intentions on the label, so credit where credit is due. 

Flavour brings a sharp acrid tartness back to the forefront. The same slick salinity creeps in here, but is a compliment here, as opposed to the overwhelming (and frankly unpleasant) presence I've found in some other goses. The tart is balanced with an almost juicy sweetness that isn't really sweet, more just a juicy foil for the tart front. The beets don't make much of an appearance in this phase of the experience as it's all tart n' juicy. Almost more like the tart aspect of early season berries, but accentuated and with the sweeter bits toned down.

Brightly effervescent, I'm enjoying this quite a bit and it's perfect for this turning weather and early early onset summer (we need more spring!) as the days have been hot and bright of late. Quite tart, and enjoyable!

Thanks @FlintB for sending this along as part of NBS BIF#007. Still working through those boxes!\xa01,738 characterskemoarps, May 13, 2018"]

name: WiLD Sour Series: Key Lime Pie
review:
['4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.7%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Gold in color with good carbonation. There’s no head on top. The aroma is of lime, coriander, and sea salt. I’m tasting lime and coriander intertwined with a sea salt finish. The mouth is lightly salinic, dry, and crisp.\xa0228 charactersFranziskaner, Jul 19, 2019', '3.99/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 412oz can. Poured out a slightly cloudy, straw-yellow color with a small, white head of foam. It smelled of lime, caramel and hints of salt. Sweet lime and caramel with a tart bite and a touch of salt.\xa0200 characterszeff80, Jul 01, 2019', '3.95/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Straw yellow pour with a quickly fading head. No lace. 

Distinct smell of lime and coriander, vanilla. Interesting. 

Acerbically tart up front, flavors of lime, then distinctive vanilla coming in the middle, wash of salty coriander toward the end. The vanilla almost comes off as sweet but is quashed by the tart and salt. Medium thin body works well for the style. 

Overall is a tasty lime gose with some extra layers of flavor that add rather than distract.\xa0462 charactersJackieTH, May 24, 2019', '4.2/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.2%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25This beer pours a clear yellow with a small head. The aroma features cheese rind, lime, cream cheese, doughy malts, and salt. The flavor starts very creamy, with cream cheese and graham cracker, followed by lime curd and a touch of lemon juice. The mouthfeel is light with bright fizz. Overall a rather delicious beer, with a big creamy quality and not too much sourness.\xa0371 charactersCzequershuus, May 04, 2019', "4.2/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.2%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25L: Pours a light golden yellow with a finger of white bubbly head. Recedes quickly. 

S: A bit like key lime pie. A light smell but distinct. 

T: It's damn close to being key lime pie in a glass or can. The lactose really comes through but in an enjoyable way. On the back end the classic gose tartness hits. 

F: High amount of carbonation, light body. 

O: Surprisingly good. I think it's about as close to key lime pie as it gets. But it's still refreshing like a gose aught to be.\xa0499 characterschrishiker1409, Apr 14, 2019"]

name: Wizard of Gose: Apricot Gose
review:
['3.52/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Quick: A hazy beer with a decent head, but missing the lacing. Smell is apricot, wheat and a weird funk. Taste brings the weirdness forward and then there is wheat and apricot. Feel is alright, a little weak on carbonation and probably a medium body.

Not a great beer in my opinion, the weird funky taste was a little unpleasant.\xa0331 characterspolloenfuego, May 17, 2017', "3.89/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.2%look: 4.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75Super handsome beer. Big firm head that eventually settles to a solid cap. Hazy pale apricot tinged yellow brew. Lots of carbonation action. Appetizingly yeasty nose, noticeable apricot fruit. Aggressively carbonated out of the bottle, less bite if you wait it out. Yeast and fruit to taste. Soft to taste. Enjoyable yeast with a hint of fruit. A little drying. Some sourness. Light thin mouthfeel one you're past the carbonation. Interesting, well made, but something I'd drink only occasionally.

Note that this beer actually goes by ghe name Wizard of Gose: Apricot Gose.\xa0574 charactersTerryW, Apr 22, 2017"]

name: Ion Cannon
review:
['4.51/5\xa0\xa0rDev +17.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 5 | overall: 4.5500 ml bottle
Served in a sour glass

This beer pours a turbid orangish yellow color. It is topped with an inch of off white head that leaves minimal lacing. It looks like a NEIPA really.

The smell is briny, sour, and full of fruity goodness. 

The taste is fantastic. The salt, the sour, the strawberry, and the kiwi are in perfect balance. It is more on the sour side which makes me love it.

Pillowy, full mouthfeel. It is like my tongue is draped in velvet.

I have not had a lot of good strawberry beer, so I had lowish expectations. This beer is lined up perfectly for my palate. I love the smell, the taste, and the mouthfeel. I am so lucky that this was available on my weekend in Toronto. It makes me wonder what other brewers are doing to mess up their strawberry beers. The sourness is perfect. Great beer.\xa0818 charactersbuschbeer, Jul 03, 2018', '3.55/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75Lucky to live on the same street as Halo. Ion Cannon is a Gose with strawberry-kiwi flavors it hits you with a tart berry flavor. Its easy to drink quenches your thirst and is one of my favorites from the brewery.\xa0215 charactersMicrobeerfan, Jul 28, 2016']

name: Strawberry Rhubarb Pie Gose
review:
['4.4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.9%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5Canned 08/26/19.

A nice rosy pink, almost rust-hued coloration.. carbonation is soft, lacing comes in spots.

Nose is all fruit, with strawberry and raspberry coming through. Hints of rhubarb, with a touch of that fresh seediness aroma you sometimes get from fresh, ripe seeded berries.

Flavors tart and fruity, with ripe strawberry flavors making room for a burst of earthy rhubarb, cinnamon, and a touch of vanilla sweetness on the tail. This is killer.

Fairly light-bodied and very soft for no lactose addition. Carbonation is soft and effervescent, with a light, lingering pucker.\xa0587 charactersWickedBeer, Oct 03, 2019', "4.44/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.8%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Thanks to rudzud, canned 8/26/19

Pours a light fizzy airy but dense off-white head that fades at a medium pace, a little whispy lacing, very hazy cloudy pinkish mauve color

Nose brings plenty of tart rhubarb and a bit of tart strawberry, juicy strawberry, a bit of lactic acid and creamy like lacto, with a little bread dough, some vanilla icing, a little cinnamon starting to come through as it warms

Taste starts a bit sweet but very tart sweet pie like flavors, lots of juicy strawberry and some tart rhubarb, nice blend of the two, with some bread dough and pie crust notes, mild lactic acid and lacto creamy like, a bit of cinnamon in the middle adding a nice spice, then wash of vanilla and vanilla icing on the back end, with a tart and sweet sour patch kids like finish, not too flemmy either, and a bit of more bready doughy finish, a touch of salt when I'm really searching for it

Mouth is med to a bit lighter bod, creamy lacto and a bit juicy, medium to lighter carb, a little tart acidity and light flemmy finish

Overall pretty nice, great taste with all the nice flavors blending well into a nice strawberry-rhubarb pie, nose was a little light but still on point, and overall base gose was there and not overpowered too much\xa01,244 charactersjlindros, Sep 29, 2019", "3.97/5\xa0\xa0rDev -8.1%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5A: The beer is very hazy amber yellow in color. It poured with a finger and half high dense off white head that has some light pinkish hues and hardly died down.
S: Light to moderate aromas of rhubarb are present in the nose along with hints of yeast.
T: The taste follows the smell, having flavors of rhubarb with notes of saltiness and hints of strawberries.
M: It feels light-bodied on the palate and has a high amount of carbonation. There's so much carbonation in this beer that it's difficult to perceive if there is any tartness on the mouthfeel.
O: This beer was much too carbonated compared to other beers in the style to be refreshing.

Serving type: can\xa0665 charactersmetter98, Sep 23, 2019", '4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Look is a deep, cloudy pink with 2 fingers of head that has a pinkish/orangish tint. Aroma is salinity up front (on par for the Gose), and a spicy/sweet smell on the back end. The salty sweet thing really works in the taste of this beer! I have no idea what rhubarb tastes like, but what I get is salty up front, sweet strawberries in the middle, and a quick salty finish. Mouthfeel is thicker than normal for a Gose, but still below medium. Great prickly carbonation. Overall this is a fantastic offering from Westbrook!\xa0521 charactersJimmy_Kneecaps, Sep 22, 2019', "4.85/5\xa0\xa0rDev +12.3%look: 4.75 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 5 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.75This pours out a hazy light pink color. The aroma is strawberry, vanilla, a hint of cinnamon, with a lovely tart/ sour air to it. The flavor profile on this is magnificent. You get strawberries that could have been made by smuckers, you get a kick of pleasant tartness from the rhubarb. The cinnamon and spice set the overall flavor profile off as neither take over the flavor profile but if they had not been added this would have simply been another same old same old gose. This has a medium mouth feel to it. Not overly wet but it's not full bodied either. I am not normally a huge fan of sour beer or gose style beers however this is one of my favorite offerings I've had of theirs.\xa0686 charactersFrothyBeard, Sep 15, 2019", "4.59/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.2%look: 4.75 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.75Received two four packs of this in a trade.

A - Poured into my Duvel tulip a nice hazy pinkish golden hue with a fat creamy two finger white head that faded slowly to leave a thick almost one finger super creamy blanket. Great color and retention for the style.

S - Aromas of slightly sweet red berries, but a good swirl produces huge strawberry jam aromas, not overly sweet but 100% jammy. The cinnamon and vanilla plays in to that as well big time without getting aggressive lending more of a baking spice type note than cinnamon sticks and vanilla pods. The rhubarb is rather subtle providing just a flash of tartness. For the most part though this is a strawberry pie bomb.

T - Taste is really, really big vanilla and definitely baked pie crust up front with a dusting of cinnamon. It's wild how Westbrook manages to nail the 'pie' aspect of their pie gose series through the usage of wheat. The strawberries are once again more cooked seedy and jammy than fresh berries, which I suppose makes sense as they'd be cooked in a pie. There is pleasant tartness from the rhubarb. Lingering more on the lips than anything is some nice almost drying salinity. It really does taste like summer time for me baking strawberry rhubarb pies and cobblers fresh from the oven with some vanilla ice cream melting on it.

M - Mouthfeel is nicely carbonated, medium bodied. The big thing here though is the finish; it's clean and a bit heavy. It doesn't have that lingering flemmy finish that can plague poorly executed goses. 

O - Overall I utterly loved this beer. Great color and awesome retention, one of the cleanest strawberry aromas and flavours I had in a beer in years and years. The rhubarb was a nice replacement for the tradition lemon with the cinnamon, vanilla, and wheat bringing the pie crust and ice cream to the table. Westbrook Key Lime Pie Gose is my go to trade for summer crusher due to it's intense tartness and acidity, however, I think I like the actual execution of this beer more. It is definitely a dessert beer thanks to the amount of strawberry and probably not one I could sit down and put back can after can, so that edge still goes to Key Lime Pie Gose. Still though...if this is added to the Westbrook seasonal release schedule I would trade for multiple four packs. Delicious.

Serving Type: Can\xa02,322 charactersrudzud, Sep 14, 2019"]

name: Saranac Silk Road Gose
review:
['4.07/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.1%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 412oz. pour at Farmhouse Tap and Grill in Burlington, VT.

A= Light amber tint to an otherwise golden beer. Thin white head that settles to ring around the glass.

S= Light aroma, a bit of tartness.

T= Crisp and light tartness with background salinity. Salt is briny ocean flavored.

M= Light body with active carbonation. 

O= Clean flavors, crisp, very easy to drink, seems like it meets the characteristics of the german style. Not big bold and new, but no faults.\xa0470 charactersjhavs, Sep 01, 2015']

name: Mermaid's Scorn
review:
["3.79/5\xa0\xa0rDev -10.6%look: 3 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5I don't see a date on the can.

Appearance: The body is gold and cloudy. It has a short fizzy white head that loses bubbles about as fast as it gains them. Poor retention. No lacing.

Aroma: There is a pleasant aroma of berries that smells as if it is souring slightly. With this, there is also a faint scent of wheat.

Taste: A cream of wheat flavor comes through at first. This is followed by a tangy lime flavor. There is a salty aftertaste.

Mouthfeel: The body is light and textured with a smooth and pleasant character. Carbonation feels a bit low.

Overall: It is a good beer with a wonderful flavor and aroma. It feels light on carbonation and it can't maintain a head but that doesn't hamper the drinking experience too much. I enjoyed it and I would drink it again. It's worth picking up.\xa0798 charactersteromous, Jul 13, 2019", '4.21/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.7%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Poured from a 16oz can into a Teku glass. 

Look is a slightly hazy yellow with a thin frothy head. 

Aroma is strong lime with a hint of dry salt.

Taste is a malty lime, almost a little margarity. 

Not too strong on the sourness a nice blend.\xa0245 charactersEamonn-Cummings3, Dec 28, 2017']

name: Gose with Blackberries & Apricots
review: ["3.16/5\xa0\xa0rDev -21.2%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3This is my second gose from Aslin with apricots and I haven't been a fan of either. There is a really weird honey-like flavor that totally ruins it. It looks decent, reddish-purpose, and has okay berry flavors but the honey sweetness is a deal-killer.\xa0251 charactersLucular, Oct 30, 2018"]

name: Gosaic
review:
["3.96/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 432oz growler from the brewery. Pours a translucent pale golden color with no head. Very little lacing. The aroma is sour and salty but a noticeable amount of Mosaic hop aroma. A bit dank and fruity. The taste is tart and acidic with the sea salt coming out more towards the end. The finish is where you get the fruity berry flavors along with more lime and salt. Somewhat wheaty. Not much carbonation and very easy to drink. The addition of the Mosaic hops is an interesting one and it works well blending the sourness with some fruity hop notes. Overall, I'll be grabbing this one again.\xa0588 charactersPicoPapa, Sep 21, 2016", "4.04/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.8%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Had at Thimble Island on Friday night, this beer just got released within the week. They also had a cask version that was with peaches, needless to say I indulged in both (see below for this quick comparison). The regular Gosaic pours a bright yellow with a thin white head, the beer itself is quite cloudy. Spotty lacing.

Smell is kind of unexpected, there's an underlying sweet malt and lactic sour, but upfront are these heady, dank mosaic hop notes, too. It's a bit jarring at first but eventually the two blend a bit. Flavor doesn't have the crazy mixture as much, Gosaic is pretty tart with a prominent brine like saltiness. Some fruit notes from the sweet malts and mosaic hops. Finishes somewhat dry with a slight bitterness and earthy dankness.

Overall a pretty cool beer, I'm not totally sold on using mosaic with a gose, but I found the final mixture to be quite refreshing.

Cask: The version casked with peaches was a bit better, the mosaic hops were a bit more subdued and overall beer was sweeter and featured juicy peach notes that mixed with the gose flavors. I liked this one a hair more just because it was bursting with so many flavors.\xa01,158 charactersBranfordBound, May 16, 2016"]

name: Everyone Gose Mad
review:
["3.26/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.5%look: 3 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.2522oz bottle into dimple pint. 6/13/17 bottling date - no idea how my local grocery ended up with these to be honest. 

Dark straw pour, quite cloudy, very minimal head and light crown. Not getting much in terms of smell - citrus, touch of light malt. 

Faint malt backbone, nice peak of citrus but not as sour as expected - the pithy flavors are very noticeable. Smooth malt finish, biscuity, and some yeast. I didn't notice much of a saline flavor except in the finish - definitely surprising. 

Mouthfeel is smooth and refreshing, helped along by fairly noticeable carbonation. 

Overall, hardly a typical gose, not exactly my favorite ever\xa0642 charactersExec_Crawfish, Feb 21, 2019", '3.39/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.7%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.25poured from a 22 oz. bottle

a little more on the dark straw spectrum than I like
nice initial white fizzy head, reduces tho
sourness is slight and a bit more saltiness would be ideal
thin as expected and clean finish.i do pick up more brine the more I sip
nice summer backyard drink but there is something
this could use more of to me.passable tho\xa0348 characterslaketang, Jul 15, 2017', "3.32/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.8%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.25Bottled on date of 05/12/17

Appearance - Pours hazy and dull golden orange with a white, half-finger width head that displays sub-par retention before dying down to a mostly barren surface and a razor thin ring of suds around the edge of the glass. No lacing, but none expected.

Smell - Distant aroma; fermented orange, hints of floral character and a touch of salinity.

Taste - Follows the nose. Fair saltiness with orange flavor. Distant floral notes. Light tartness in the finish that comes through with tangerine and mild lemon. 

Mouthfeel - Light-bodied with moderate carbonation. Slick texture makes for an easy drinker with a lightly dry finish.

Overall - I've been a huge fan of Mad River in the past (their Scotch Porter is still my favorite American Porter to date), but their latest releases have not been very inspiring. This is, at best, an average gose. Lacks ideal sourness and salinity. I wouldn't buy this again.\xa0934 charactersTheSixthRing, Jun 18, 2017"]

name: Blood Orange Imperial Salty Lady
review:
['3.11/5\xa0\xa0rDev -21.7%look: 3.5 | smell: 2.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3 | overall: 3$ 5.32 (Including shipping and PA tax)/12 oz can ($ 0.444/oz) from Tavour, Seattle, WA. Reviewed 9/5/19.
“CANNED ON 07/09/19” stamped on can bottom. Stored at 42 degrees and served at 42 degrees in a hand-washed and dried Jester King snifter.
Appearance – 3.5.
First pour – Very light yellow, very slight haze.
Body – Yellow, hazy.
Head – Large (Maximum 7.3 cm, aggressive center pour), white, high density and creamy, average duration, diminishing to a five mm crown and a complete cap. 
Lacing – None.
Aroma – 2.5 – Rotting fruit and the ocean, not pleasant.
Flavor – 3.5 – Much better than the nose. A bit of dilute orange, slightly sweet and lightly salty. No alcohol (9.2% ABV) flavor or aroma, no dimethylsulfide, no diacetyl. 
Palate – 3 – Medium, almost creamy, lively carbonation.
Final impression and summation – 3 – Alcohol is well hidden and the flavor is OK after getting by the stench.\xa0934 charactersOzzylizard, Sep 05, 2019', "3.38/5\xa0\xa0rDev -14.9%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.25CAN:

Smacky and strangely delicious, with a nice salty dried-lime finish and hints of coriander throughout. Lactic acid is strong in this one, but the sour twang really works for it, and I'm appalled how well hidden the 9.2% ABV is - I'd figure this for 5.5% max. The blood orange isn't all that apparent, but it's present, blending into the citrusy lime-lemon melange of goodness.

Finishes tart, sour, smacky, acidic, and twangy, bringing all its fruity notes to the fore with aplomb.

I didn't know Martin House had this in them. A standout Gose with a lovely sour acidity and style-appropriate citrus and salt. I'd definitely pick this up by the sixer - and that's not something I think can be said about any Martin House beer I've had to date. Unexpectedly good work from a brewery not known for the same.

B / GOOD\xa0821 characterskojevergas, Jul 14, 2019"]

name: Gose
review:
['3.99/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 412 FL. OZ. can 
Served in a becker glass

This beer pours pale yellow with a slight haze to it. It is topped with an inch of beige head that leaves no lacing.

The smell is tart and contains coriander with a salty aroma.

The taste is tart with flavors of orange and coriander. It has a briny and semi dry finish.

This is a nice, simple gose. It is not over the top as so many nowadays seem to be. It is a very good beer to enjoy on a beautiful summer evening.\xa0461 charactersbuschbeer, Aug 10, 2019', '3.48/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5Pours a cloudy straw with a white head. The aroma is tart, with a touch of coriander spice. Light bodied, bright acidity, and a touch of salt to finish. The coriander is there if you look for it, overall a nice summer session sour.\xa0234 charactersNephilium, Jul 27, 2019', '4.01/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Yet another on-tap only “pub exclusive “ at the GLBC. Served to me in a snifter glass, this beer draws a clear, light golden color with a fairly thick white head that’s about 1/2 inch thick when first served that settles eventually to a medium sized ring lining the inside of the glass along with just a slight touch of lacing. Aromas of some bready malts and a bit of wheat along with a very subtle sour funk hint. The taste is pretty much the same, with some bready malts and wheat, some yeasty notes and a hint of salt and a slight sour funk. No discernible hop presence, which is to be expected for this style. Has a mostly crisp, also quite smooth, light to medium bodied mouthfeel with light to moderate carbonation. Has a clean finish and a slightly sour and salty aftertaste. Spot on for the style. A solid representation of the style.

Eric\xa0863 charactersneenerzig, Aug 05, 2018']

name: General Gose
review: ['4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.6%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Dark orange with a bubbly head that quickly disappears. Orange citrus aromas, along with some spice and funk. Taste is tart and spicy, with the chili pepper and msg creating a tingling heat. On the lighter side, crisp, refreshing, and dry. A very interesting and enjoyable spicy gose with a unique twist from the msg.\xa0317 charactersJakeSip, Aug 16, 2019', '3.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev -14.7%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.25BBE January 31, 2020.\n\nI wanted so badly for this to be awesome. The color is good, but it’s overpowered by tart citrus and salt. The chili heat starts to build after a few sips, but overall it just fell short and drinks pretty bland. I will say it’s got that familiar MSG essence I remember from so many college nights.\xa0324 charactersWickedBeer, Aug 13, 2019', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 416 ounce can into tulip glass, best before 1/1/2021. Pours lightly hazy deep golden amber color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy off white head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice dense spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a light amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big sour/tart/tangy lemon, lime, orange peel, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light chili/peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of orange peel, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, pale/wheat malts, and light chili powder notes; with big strength. Taste of big sour/tart/tangy lemon, lime, orange peel, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light chili/peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate lactic tang/tartness; light citrus peel bitterness and chili pepper spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/tangy lemon, lime, orange peel, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light chili/peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Great complexity, robustness, and balance of orange peel, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, pale/wheat malts, and light chili powder flavors; with an awesome malt/tartness balance, and no puckering flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp/clean finishing. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering tang/tartness and carbonation. Medium-plus carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately bready/grainy/acidic, and lightly sticky/saline mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.5%; with minimal lingering chili pepper heat after the finish. Overall this is an excellent gose. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of orange peel, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, pale/wheat malts, and light chili powder flavors; very smooth, refreshing, and fairly crisp/clean to drink with the mellowly acidic/tangy/drying finish. Not overly lactic/salty. Very flavorful and not watery for the ABV. Great balance of orange peel, salts, Lacto complexity, and pale/wheat malts against acidity; with mild chili pepper presence. Minimal residual sweetness with crisp dryness. A very enjoyable offering, and impressively spot on style example as expected.\xa02,502 characterssuperspak, Aug 07, 2019']

name: 30A Rose Gose
review:
["3.23/5\xa0\xa0rDev -15%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.25It is an interesting attempt. I rather enjoy the sour, hibiscus taste. It is a clean and works for this area's look at me clientele. Refreshing, if in this area, but nothing that translates to greatness. Try it.\xa0211 charactersDavid_Frisco, Mar 02, 2019", "3.94/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.7%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 412 oz can, best by 10/1/18 oops. 

Poured into tall New Glarus Pilsner Glass. 

The pinkish hues described on the can from the hibiscus must have faded as this pours a very crisp gold color, oddly enough fitting the pilsner glass it's in. Tall fluffy head of 3 fingers, leaving lots of broken lace as it recedes. 

Aromas are abundantly fruity - Fruit Stripe gum, wildberries, and bubblegum. Slight malt aroma behind that. Reminds me a bit of a girl's perfume or a dessert shop. 

Flavor is biscuit malt and blackberry jam. Some sea salt. The hibiscus and hay are forthcoming, with slight bubblegum. Light plant material and wildberry soda on the finish. 

Feel is clinging, with some crispness on the finish, and fairly clean throughout. 

Overall, a pretty decent Gose that's not too sour or salty, and fits firmly in that spot when you want both a Pilsner AND a Gose. Not sure when that is, but there you have it.\xa0916 charactersThe-Adjunct-Hippie, Oct 09, 2018", '3.99/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4From the pink can, it pours a nice light golden color with a modest head that slowly diminishes and leaves lacing. A bit of plant, possibly hibiscus (clueless as to the scent of it), in the nose. The mouth gets the same, a llight flowerly flavor in the mouth with the malt. Interesting!\xa0289 charactersBeerAndGasMasks, Jul 22, 2018']

name: Never Again³
review:
["4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.9%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Thanks Drew.
This was poured into a stange.
The appearance was a thick red raspberry puree color with nice fairly thick two finger white foamy head softly dissipating leaving some speckled sticky lace.
The aroma had a full sweet and tart red raspberry puree, and some soft lemon peel underneath.
The flavor blended the tart with the sweet fully, just like red raspberry puree. Mild red raspberry aftertaste.
The mouthfeel is about medium bodied with a fine sessionability about it. Carbonation felt good. ABV felt good. Finish was all about the red raspberries.
Overall, not a gose. No soured wheat, no salt. As much as I love red raspberries and as thick as it is like puree, all of the true attributes of the style are MIA. Still, I'd have again preferably for me and possibly in warmer weather.\xa0797 charactersLone_Freighter, Dec 28, 2018", "3.94/5\xa0\xa0rDev -8.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Let's start this off with the fact that I don't enjoy this type of beer, but as it was one of the two cans left here I thought I'd try it. I was pleasantly surprised. It wasn't a slap-in-the-face sour, and the berry taste was quite enjoyable on the first drink. There was a good sour taste at the end but it wasn't one of those unexpected/overpowering tastes. Poured great and look great in the glass. Word of warning tho, as it is berry-based careful on opening. If you get a lil bit of splash and this gets on your clothes, all bets are off\xa0548 charactersMichael7, Dec 23, 2018"]

name: Dillaman Margarita (Andall)
review:
["3.77/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.8%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.75Appearance is a sort of pale pastel peach-salmon with a surprising cameo by a short lasting head.

Simply due to nailing what they're going after, this is probably my favorite fruit joose they make. The smell exhibits that salty rim, as well as a bit of toasted pie crust. As it comes to temp, the meyer lemon makes itself known.

Taste has plenty of blood orange and an almost peach creamsicle flavor, all tart and margarita-like, with less fizz than the Tyrion next to it, finishing semi-dry. At times I get candy.\xa0516 charactersSabtos, Apr 19, 2018", '4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.3%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25L: Had this beer on-tap at The Answer Brewpub, poured into a snifter glass. Had a blood red color and a thick consistency. There was a quarter inch of foamy, off white head that lasted an average amount of time. OK lacing.

S: A sweet, fruity aroma of oranges, sea salt, wheat, and other light fruit. 

T: Tasted of a fair amount of sea salt, light wheat notes (not too much), a lot of citrus fruit (lemon, orange, lime), a tinge of watermelon, and a little bit of pears. An extremely fruity, light and enjoyable flavor. It really does taste like a margarita (minus the tequila). Quite tasty.

F: A well-carbonated beer with a somewhat slick finish. Light-bodied.

O: This is one of those beers that good on unseasonably warm days. Well worth a try.\xa0749 charactersavalon07, Oct 08, 2017']

name: Double Seesaw: Peach
review: ['4.43/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Dated 6/24/19 on the bottom of the can, 2 weeks since brewing.\n\nPours a very hazy light gold in the glass with a finger of puffy white head that dissipated rather quickly. Nose of slightly tart peach, apricot, orange rind, slight lemon, wheat flour and a little earthiness. Taste brings the flavors up a notch, bursting with tart yet very sweet apricot/peach notes and a wheat backbone, almost like a peach/apricot pie. Great! Smooth medium- body with low prickly carbonation, as well as a lingering mouthwatering aftertaste. Low drying, high- sweetness. I really this this go around with Double Seesaw, the raspberry version was fantastic and so is this!\xa0655 charactersBlackrobe, Jul 09, 2019']

review: ['4.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.9%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Poured a bright hazy light yellow color with a small white head. Aromas and flavors of tart grapefruit, lemon juice, sea salt, and a hint of wheat. So damn drinkable and light and refreshingly tart. Incredible gose.\xa0215 characterscrob3888, Mar 12, 2016', '4.21/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.8%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Pours a cloudy straw yellow color. Aroma is tart with some citrus. Flavor is funky and fermented with an aftertaste of bitter citrus. Overall really tasty.\xa0155 charactersStevem68, Mar 12, 2016']

name: Blackberry Gose
review:
['3.82/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.2%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Look: from a 12oz can, it pours reddish (like a berry Jello) with a 1/4" white head that dissipates immediately and leaves not much behind. the Gose is cloudy as expected and absolutely no lacing was observed.
Smell: Sour berries, citrusy lemony coriander and salt. light wheaty malts.
Taste: the beer is tangy tart but not to sour extent. acidity is significant but not the dominant factor. there's berries (not sure if blackberries necessarily) and lemony spices and its lightly salted. bitterness and any hops flavors are at a minimum.
there's good balance between the acidity and any malt sweetness.
Feel: medium light bodied, slightly creamy texture, almost effervecent carbonation and pronounced astringency from the acidity. Finish is dry with lingering astringency.
Overall: a well balanced (to style) Gose and will please many fans of the style. I can drink a lot of these refreshing beers\xa0898 charactersdescobar, Mar 07, 2019']

name: Mandarin Coconut Gose
review:
['3.97/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 416oz can into snifter. 

A: Pours a clear watery color with a a light orange tint. Very clear, brilliant, and light in color. Head was off white, very effervescent, and fleeting. No head or lace. 
S: Right after the pour this smells of spritzy, briney, cracked wheat mixed with orange sceltzer water (in a good). Upon further investigation I get more sweet and juicy mandarin notes with subtle hints of toasted coconut. The mandarin/coconut almost gives off sweet tropical fruit scent at times of papaya and guava, maybe mango. Smells great. A light tartness is present as well.
T: Mandarin up front followed by mineral water flavors and then toasted coconut and a hint of grainy wheat. Very subtle lingering saltiness in the back of my cheeks in the aftertaste. Coconut has a slight sunscreen quality in the finish. Light citrus tartness throughout. 
M: Finish has a very creamy lingering coconut oil quality that I find pleasant. Almost a greasy sensation left after the swallow. Light body, splashy carbonation, clean tart sensation with no acidity. Silky finish. 
O: Very balanced between the light coconut and sweet citrus flavors with a balancing brine and lactic tartness. Enjoyable.\xa01,191 charactersscottfrie, Feb 12, 2017', "4.11/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Appearance - Pours slightly hazy and golden yellow in color with a white, quarter-finger width head that dissipates in about 30 seconds, leaving behind a barren surface with few bubbles found on the outer edge of the glass. No lacing.

Smell - Sour mandarin orange hits first, then sweet and slightly toasted coconut fill the nostrils, almost overshadowing the wheat underbelly. Definitely a saline aroma as well. 

Taste - Follows the nose. Tart orange and salty flavor hits first which is quickly met with a sweet, slightly toasted coconut which strengthens by mid-taste. Finishes much the same, with lingering tartness, sweet coconut and the savory salt undertone.

Mouthfeel - Light-to-medium in body with lightly bitey carbonation. slick texture with a crisp, slightly puckering and semi-dry finish.

Overall - This is the second gose in their Curiosite series, and both have been fantastic. Though I prefer the key lime offering, I couldn't fault anyone for preferring this one. Nice balance of the tartness and sweetness with that salty bite that brings everything together. New Glory is certainly helping to put Sacramento on the map of premiere craft brew cities in the US.\xa01,182 charactersTheSixthRing, Jan 17, 2017"]

name: Marryin Berries
review:
['4.01/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.2%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 412 oz can

Pours hazy raspberry pink. Pinkish white head dissipates to nothing.

Smells of fresh mixed berries, cracker malt and citrus tartness.

Flavor is of raspberry, blueberry, lemon, tangerine, and cracker malt.

Light body, stinging carbonation.

Fruity, tart, and refreshing. Drinks easy. Tastes very fresh and natural. Would have again occasionally. Good early summer beer.\xa0387 charactersCylinsier, Jun 27, 2019', '4.06/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Cloudy watermelon color with two fingers of pinkish head. Nice rings of lace.
Strange aroma. 
Taste is salty fruity 
Mouthfeel is light to medium. Finish is mildly dry with salty balanced finish.
Overall a fine beer.\xa0218 charactersSpikester, Jun 22, 2019', "4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.7%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Pour is a blushing muddled pink that is the colour of blended watermelon. Decent two finger off rose head that settles slooowly but eventually. 

Nose is blunt sour wheat with just a hint of berry juices. As it warms it develops a slightly jammy top layer which appeals to me.

Flavour has a bit more character and depth to it, but at its core is the same ideas. There's the sour wheat foundation with a trellis of tart juicy berries on top and then the same jammy development as it warms.

Tart carbonation over a dry body with a sticky component that keeps the craw engaged throughout and beyond. It's refreshing in this abominable heat.\xa0639 characterskemoarps, Jun 20, 2018", "4.27/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.2%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25These beers are always a bit difficult to review. Is it a traditional Gose? Absolutely not. Did they accomplish their mission and execute it properly? Absofrigginlutley. Merryin' Berries pours a vibrant dark pink. Megenta even. A thin wispy pink head is only around for a moment. As advertised, this things screams raspberries and the Oregon love child berry that is a Marion in aroma and flavor. Perhaps a squeeze of lemon, and a pinch of salt. It's light, tart, salty, sweet, and ultimately refreshing. It's delicious, and I'd love to have this on a warm spring day. Here's hoping for one soon. Cheers!\xa0617 charactersLingenbrau, Mar 23, 2018", '3.62/5\xa0\xa0rDev -10.8%look: 4 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.5Poured from 22oz bomber into a tulip glass. I don't see any dates on the bottle, but I can say that my wife picked this up for me while in Portland a couple of weeks ago.

Appearance: holy guacamole, that's an interesting look. Salmon pink with a finger of frothy ivory foam; there's a pink tinge to the head that might be due to just the body's mighty hazy pink character. Whatever the case may be, I like it.

Smell: very wheaty; there's a maltiness and slight sourness that just read as "beery" to me. The berries/fruit are kind of disguised here.

Taste: good berry flavor; there's a good sweetness and a prickly acidic berry quality. Raspberry and blackberry definitely come to mind here; good, if a bit muddled.

Mouthfeel: medium body with a good level of carbonation and a good creaminess for the style. I quite like it.

Overall: this beer is obviously all over the place for me. The smell is rough and unpromising; the flavor has a lot going for it but is muddled, and the texture is quite nice. Overall, this is definitely a beer worth trying if you get your hands on it, but it's not worth going crazily out of your way to do so.\xa01,155 charactersflagmantho, Mar 07, 2018']
