review: ['3.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.2%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.25ilikebeer03, Jun 02, 2019', '3.83/5\xa0\xa0rDev +11.7%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75rsuarez1982, Apr 29, 2019', '3.74/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75kkarimi, Mar 12, 2019', '2.63/5\xa0\xa0rDev -23.3%look: 4 | smell: 2.75 | taste: 2.5 | feel: 2.25 | overall: 2.5aatazebeats, Mar 06, 2019', '2.95/5\xa0\xa0rDev -14%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 2.5 | feel: 2.5 | overall: 2.5Mortarforker, Mar 01, 2019', '3.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5archero, Feb 22, 2019', '3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75csfcmitchell, Feb 17, 2019', '3.81/5\xa0\xa0rDev +11.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Karibourgeois, Feb 08, 2019']

name: Sun Gose Down
review:
["3.45/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.7%look: 3 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.25Reviewed from notes. Poured from a 16 oz. can into an J. Wakefield Brewing OG teku glass.

A: Mildly hazy and gold, with a thin white head that disappears almost instantly. Similarly, there's a quick buzz of visible carbonation at first, but it stops almost as soon as you’re done pouring. A little disappointing in the appearance category - this looks flat and almost sad.

S: Pilsner malts, light lactic tartness. Some fruity yeast esters – a mild Belgian yeastiness with apples up front. Not off-putting, but this doesn’t much smell like a gose.

T: Light lactic tartness over cracker malts with a moderate pilsner character as well. Mild lemony citric acid, coriander, and then more yeast esters that just don’t belong here, and lend an apple or pear flavor. Maybe a very mild salinity, but mild enough I think I would have missed it if wasn’t looking for it. More fruitiness at the swallow.

M: A light body, with low carbonation sensation (though not as flat as the appearance suggested). Low alcohol presence.

O: Despite what the name (and can) indicated, this just isn’t a gose-style ale at all. The Belgian-type yeast flavors shouldn’t be there, it’s not very tart, and the salt is largely missing. I would certainly prefer without the pilsner malt flavors, but that’s personal preference. It’s not undrinkable, but I won’t be drinking it again. Also, I wouldn’t recommend it if you are looking for a gose. Scores given end up being appropriate for both personal preference and to-style, though for different reasons.\xa01,551 charactersmacrosmatic, Sep 18, 2017", "3.68/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.5%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75Poured a 16 can into a pint glass. Purchased at a Total Wine in Viera, FL for $2.29. 

A: pours a hazy golden, lemonade colored hue below roughly 2 fingers of fluff. 
S: lemons, yeast, bread crust, and pineapple juice. Nothing overpowering the other, and all aromas listed are very subdued. 
T: follows the nose fairly well. Sour, citrusy tartness on the front/middle tounge. Salty pineapple on the finish. 
F: medium body, low carbonation. Too much body/thickness for a gose-styled beer to me. 
O: not too shabby for a first attempt at a gose. This is a beer style that was nearly dead in the water up until 3-4 year ago. Flavor was quite good, body a bit too much. Overall drinkablity is great. I'd certainly have another.\xa0724 characterskell50, Jun 21, 2017"]

name: Little Saint Nick Cranberry Gose
review: ['4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.516 ounce can into tulip glass, canned on 10/18/2018. Pours slightly hazy medium orange/amber, light reddish/pinkish color with a 1 finger fairly dense and rocky light pink head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Nice spotty lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big juicy/tart/tangy cranberries, fruit skin, lemon, lime, orange, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, red grape/wine, coriander, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, lightly toasted bread, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/acidic yeast, cranberries, salt, spice, and moderate pale/wheat malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big juicy/tart/tangy cranberries, fruit skin, lemon, lime, orange, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, red grape/wine, coriander, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, lightly toasted bread, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang; and light coriander spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of juicy/tart/tangy cranberries, fruit skin, lemon, lime, orange, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, red grape/wine, coriander, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, lightly toasted bread, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, cranberries, salt, spice, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; with and awesome malt/tartness and tangy fruit balance; with no puckering flavors after the finish. Light-moderate increasing dryness from tartness and tangy fruit. Medium carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately bready/grainy/acidic/tangy, and lightly saline balanced mouthfeel that is fantastic. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.2%. Overall this is an outstanding gose! All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, cranberries, salt, spice, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth and refreshing to drink with the modestly acidic/tangy/drying finish. Not overly lactic or salty. Very flavorful and not watery for the ABV. Awesomely balanced juicy/jammy cranberries, Lacto complexity, and pale/wheat malts against acidity. Not overdone on salt/coriander at all. A highly enjoyable offering, and spot on style example.\xa02,403 characterssuperspak, Nov 03, 2018']

name: Side Project 31: Himalayan Pink Sea Salt Lime Gose
review:
['4.12/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25L - Golden with clarity, no head or lace retention. Gose for sure

S - Salt and lime

T - Lime and coriander dominate. Tasty

F - Light and refreshing

O - An excellent Gose\xa0174 charactersBeerDawgs, Apr 14, 2019', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Look- almost looks like a hazy Pilsner 
Smell- sour and salt with a hint of lime
Taste- easy drinking, a little heavy on the tart and sour with a touch of lime in the aftertaste
Feel- decent feel not much head
Overall- pretty good but not great would buy again but not regularly\xa0278 charactersCdriver0414, Apr 04, 2019', '3.63/5\xa0\xa0rDev -11%look: 2 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Pours an effervescent amber with near zero carbonation. Zero carbonation & head rentention

S: Lime in small doses

T: Lime & a little salt, with just a little wheattyness underneath up front. Lime & tartnes spicks up a little as this warms, also the salt. Finishes limey with a nice more-ish saltyness. a touch of lemon as well

MF: medium body, light body

Super drinkalbility, but was hoping for more lime & salt pop, needed a smidge more tartness as well\xa0464 charactersrusspowell, Jan 31, 2019', '4.24/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.9%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Citrus, sour and succulent, Terrapin Beer Company turns to the uniqueness of lime to give their traditional northern German styled sour ale a special citrusy pep along side of the gourmet salinity of pink sea salt. Together, a strong margarita taste is born.

Pale gold and cast in a foggy gaze, the nearly chrome stained ale crowns with a frothy white swath of sea foam. Aptly named Himalayan Pink Sea Salt Lime Gose, a scent of sea air is wrought with citrus, cider, white wine and a flowery orange scent playing second fiddle. A light undercurrent of sweetness brings a sense of sourdough and saltwater taffy to the early palate.

As the middle palate unfolds, the sweetness scampers away while the acidity washes the tastebuds with a clean, concise and succinct sourness wrapped around notions of crabapple, white grape, gooseberry, lime, yuzu and kiwi. Exotic fruit flavors carry a strong margarita and sangria taste into a late palate of brisk salinity that both brightens and rounds the session in a savory and sour interplay.

Light, crisp and utmost refreshing, the tart and tantalizing ale is a delight for sour savants who have an affinity for margaritas. Its acidity washes the thirst from the tongue with ease while providing a rounded salinity for a burst of lime, coriander and agave to close\xa01,307 charactersBEERchitect, Dec 13, 2018']

name: Gosuhhh, Dude? Grapefruit
review:
['3/5\xa0\xa0rDev -18.9%look: 3 | smell: 3 | taste: 3 | feel: 3 | overall: 3Released 9/21/18; drank 10/21/18 @ the Yarchives. 

Opaque dark orange appearance. 

A rough pour yielded a small off-white head which quickly dissipated; no lace. 

Grapefruit & faint honeyed wheat notes in the nose. 

Sticky medium thick mouthfeel. 

Grapefruit & sticky table sugar flavors up front; dry sea salt notes on the finish. 

Way too heavy & sticky; a gose should be effervescent, but this fails the test.\xa0418 charactersGuyFawkes, Oct 22, 2018', '3.71/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Tall frothy ivory colored head caps a hazy grapefruity colored beer. Floral and earthy/herbal aroma with citrus. Flavors are good with notes of grapefruit and tangerine citrus-burst while being floral, sour, and tart. Light-to-medium body - tart and sour finish. This was good and has a nice grapefruit accentuation without being too dominant.\xa0343 charactersbarnzy78, Oct 01, 2018', '3.82/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.2%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 3.75Tasted in a snifter from draft at More Brewing Company on September 21, 2018. A gose brewed with coriander, sea salt and bursting with ripe grapefruit.\xa0151 charactersHopheadjeffery, Sep 28, 2018']

name: Never Mind³
review:
["4.31/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.2%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25The beer pours a light purple head that dissipates fairly quickly. Th beer itself is a deep berry purple with a reddish hue to it.

The smell is pretty good. It has a nice fruity sweetness in the form of a delicious and ripe plum with of natural tartness to it. 

The taste is fantastic. It has the delicious sweetness and tartness of a ripe plum.

The feel is good. It has a juicy light body to it and very easy drinking along with an acidic finish to it.

Overall, a pretty good gose and one I'm glad I got a chance to have. It may not be overly complex but it is delicious.\xa0576 charactersHattedClassic, Oct 11, 2018"]

name: Bikini Season
review:
['3.96/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.9%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4I know that the FBI is coming for me, but I swear that space aliens have NOT taken over as a replica of me with my body in a pod in the basement, but it just isn't so. I know that I eschew Hefeweizens & pooh-pooh Tart/Sour beers so that the last couple/few days may seem totally outta character for me, but it's still me at the keyboard! It has been really hot, hazy & humid & I just CAN't bring myself to CANtemplate drinking anything else, especially when I have so many in those styles to further The CANQuest (tm). I hope that you understand. 

From the CAN: "Gose Beer" & a sea of pink & white polka dot bikinis against a bright yellow background. 

I Crack!ed the CAN open & beCAN a Gussie Busch Glug that was only partially successful. It created two fingers of fizzy, foamy, eggshell-white head with extremely limited retention, fizzing its way to wisps as I gaped in disbelief. No skim, no lacing, no trace. 8=O Color was a deeply-hazy/lightly-cloudy Amber (SRM = > 7, < 9). Nose had a very unusual (for the style) raspberry-like quality. Wow! My glass was absolutely rinsed clean & nothing that I had drunk out of it previously had anything to do with raspberries. It was all the beer. I CANnot find anything on their website, so I am pressing on. Mouthfeel was thin-to-medium, a step or two above watery. Phew, was this one tart! My lips were not just puckered, they were trying to turn into Eugene on "Preacher". OMFG! The taste remained very tart throughout with notes of raspberry and salt. Salted raspberries!?! Is this a CANming thing?!? Phew. Finish was tart and dry and the raspberry taste lingered. Wow. What else/more CAN I say?\xa01,648 characterswoodychandler, Aug 09, 2018', '3.79/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.6%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Though billed as a straight gose, it is definitely fruited, which took me off guard at first (if it is fruited, why not advertise that fact?) but it is still good. A little heavy, not too salty or tart, fruit is mostly a vague raspberry or pomegranate. Needs more of a snap on the finish.\xa0288 charactersajm5108, Jul 22, 2018', "3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.6%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.7516 oz. can. Clear orange. Smells of pineapple and coconut, which I know are not in the beer at all. A bit of grain and some brininess. Tastes of bright acidic fruit, salt, wheat. Maybe coconut again. Light body. Very good, even if it's got none of the fruits I think are in it.\xa0277 charactersAlieniloquium, Jul 17, 2018", "3.99/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.6%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4This is a very refreshing gose not too sour with mild fruit presents of kiwi and lemon zest. Not too salty either. Was going to mark it down for not being overly sour but it's really growing on me. Worth trying at least once\xa0224 charactersDrDemento456, Jun 24, 2018", "4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.9%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Poured from a tallboy can into a Dogfish Head tulip

L: Cloudy golden brown pour with 1 finger of fluffy white head. Nice rim of lacing.

S: Tart and fruity... kiwi and pomegranate. Light lemon and funk.

T/F: Tart and fruity... strong presence of kiwi. The pomegranate is also noticeable... not sure if I'd have come up with it though without the can. Not overly sour... just pleasantly acidic. Mildly funky... a bit of lemon. Light and crisp. Zesty carbonation.

O: A pretty outstanding gose... a style I find that it hard to get excited about in general. Great fruity tart flavor... low ABV and perfectly crushable for the warm weather.\xa0650 charactersEMV, Jun 02, 2018"]

name: Aloha Fridays
review:
['3.98/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Pours a pinkish orange with light, soapy head.

Smell is tart and slightly floral with notes of passionfruit and citrus.

Taste is crisp and tart with notes of passionfruit, tangerine and guava and some floral hints. Finishes with a hint of sea salt.

Mouthfeel is medium with strong carbonation.

Overall, a nice, refreshing Gose.\xa0332 charactersJamFuel, Oct 13, 2019', '4.03/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4.25A: The beer is hazy pinkish red in color and has a moderate amount of visible carbonation. It poured with a finger high off white head that died down, leaving a large patch of bubbles on the surface and some lacing down the sides of the glass.
S: Moderate aromas of passionfruit are present in the nose along with notes of pineapple.
T: The taste has flavors of pineapples, passionfruit and tangerine with notes of saltiness and hints of sourness.
M: It feels light- to medium-bodied and a little tart on the palate with a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: This is a nice take on a tropical gose and makes for a nice selection on a hot summer day. It is very easy to drink and has refreshing properties.

Serving type: can\xa0723 charactersmetter98, Sep 26, 2019', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 416 ounce can into tulip glass, canned on 7/22/2019. Pours lightly hazy medium orange/amber, light reddish/pinkish color with a 1 finger fairly dense and fluffy light pink head with solid retention, that reduces to a thin spotty lace cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big tart/tangy passion fruit, tangerine, pineapple, hibiscus, cranberry, strawberry, fruit skin/seeds, lemon, lime, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, coriander, peppercorn, hay, straw, floral, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, light lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of passionfruit, tangerine, pineapple, hibiscus, fruity/acidic yeast, coriander, salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt notes; with big strength. Taste of big tart/tangy passion fruit, tangerine, pineapple, hibiscus, cranberry, strawberry, fruit skin/seeds, lemon, lime, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, coriander, peppercorn, hay, straw, floral, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, light lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang, and coriander spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/tangy passion fruit, tangerine, pineapple, hibiscus, cranberry, strawberry, fruit skin/seeds, lemon, lime, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, coriander, peppercorn, hay, straw, floral, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, light lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Great complexity, robustness, and balance of passionfruit, tangerine, pineapple, hibiscus, fruity/acidic yeast, coriander, salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; with an awesome malt/tart/tangy/spiciness balance; with no puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp/clean finishing. Moderate increasing dryness from lingering tart/tangy/spiciness and carbonation. Medium-plus carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately bready/grainy, sticky/acidic/tangy/tannic, and lightly saline mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol for 5.9%. Overall this is an excellent fruited gose. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of passionfruit, tangerine, pineapple, hibiscus, fruity/acidic yeast, coriander, salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink with the modestly acidic/tangy/tangy/tannic/spicy drying finish; mellowly lactic/salty. Awesome balance of juicy/vibrant fruits/hibiscus and Lacto complexity; with a great clean pale/wheat malt backbone against acidity. Minimal residual sweetness with crisp dryness. A very enjoyable offering, and impressive style example as expected. Not overwhelming on any aspect.\xa02,808 characterssuperspak, Sep 06, 2019']

name: Gose II
review: ["4.47/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8.8%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Akasha is one of my favorite local breweries in Louisville, and this beer is one of the biggest reasons. A tart and salty beer that drinks as smoothly as one could imagine. Definitely worth a trip if you're within an hour of the city.\xa0234 charactersgordo1, Feb 28, 2016"]

name: Siren - Blackberry And Raspberry
review:
["4.54/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.2%look: 4.75 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.5On tap at Mortalis Brewing in Avon, NY.

This one pours a dark purplish color, with a small head, and lots of lacing.

This is so jammy on the nose, with more blackberry than raspberry, with a light sourness.

You don't get the base much hre, but it's just such a well done expression of all the fruit here- a decadent and over the top treat for sure. There's more blackberry than raspberry, but both are represented well. It's a nice mix of sweet and sour here.

This is light bodied, clean and super drinkable, with a good level of carbonation and drinkability.

Mortalis continues to crush the Rochester scene.\xa0613 charactersGreesyFizeek, Nov 12, 2018"]

name: Gose Pun
review: ['4.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +10.8%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5-Andrew-, Mar 30, 2018', '4.11/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.2%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4.25BarryMFBurton, Mar 03, 2018', '3.18/5\xa0\xa0rDev -21.7%look: 3.5 | smell: 3 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3 | overall: 3.25BenHoppy, Jan 01, 2018', '5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +23.2%look: 5 | smell: 5 | taste: 5 | feel: 5 | overall: 5nickpanchame, Nov 17, 2017', '4.94/5\xa0\xa0rDev +21.7%look: 5 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 5 | feel: 5 | overall: 5isoddhipa, Nov 15, 2017', '3/5\xa0\xa0rDev -26.1%look: 3 | smell: 3 | taste: 3 | feel: 3 | overall: 3Benjolovesbeer, Jul 02, 2017', '3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.6%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.7598green, Jul 01, 2017', '3.97/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.2%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4loganburgh, May 05, 2017']

name: There Gose The Diet
review:
['3.66/5\xa0\xa0rDev -12.4%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.5Poured from the can into a wheat ale glass.

Pale lemon with a nice glow, and a bit of clarity. Sharp bright white head and a frothy richness, settling easily to a nice half finger fine white puck. Small mix of soda and fine carbonation, very nice looker.

Lots of "notes" on this aroma. Touches of ginger and lime, a bit of salt brine as well. Definitely goes into that almost ginger ale territory as well. Flirting light acidic notes, but goes into a more piercing ginger sweetness and nearly cola.

Palate is a bit muddied up it seems. A decent dense chewy body, with light touches and feel. Palate seems to generate a lot of noise. Gaseous lime and touches of cola ginger ale flavor. A bit of almost muddy and earthy sourness, like sourdough bread that hasn't risen or something. Burnt grass strangely as well it seems on the finish, but not overly bad in taste. 

This is a very odd gose, and seems just to be going in a lot of different directions that don't make it too grounded. Drinkable at least, and things could be far worse.\xa01,049 charactersSmakawhat, Aug 15, 2018', '4.61/5\xa0\xa0rDev +10.3%look: 5 | smell: 4 | taste: 5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5This gose is flavored with lime and ginger and maybe a hint of mint? The balance of flavors is really perfect. Its hard to get the amount of lime right in a beer, and ginger can be unpredictable. After tasting this other goses and sours seem crude. This beer has a faint haze that makes it catch light and glow. Special all around.\xa0336 characterskmf_chantilly, Aug 08, 2018', '4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.9%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Moderate pour yields a 3/4 inch white head over a very slightly hazy body with very little lacing. Nose of citrus and slight ginger. Very nice taste of tart lime and bite from the ginger. Good feel for the style and overall, a nice job.\xa0236 charactersbobv, Oct 01, 2017', "4.39/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5The beer pours a very fizzy white bubbly head that dissipates very quickly. The beer itself is an interesting look. It's a pretty cloudy and hard to see through beer with a pretty nice pale straw yellow color. It definitely looks nice even though it isn't quite to standard.

The smell and taste are fantastic since they both replicate a Moscow Mule as advertised. The strongest notes are ginger and lime that come to the front with a good salty and tart follow up. There is a slight hint of mint but it is largely hidden.

The feel is light with a light body. The beer has an acidic feel to it and a slight salty burn but it works well. It has a pretty dry finish.

Overall, a pretty unique and interesting beer that is completely worth getting one's hands on before it's gone. The flavor and smell notes so uncannily resemble what it claims to resemble while maintaining what people expect from a beer.\xa0904 charactersHattedClassic, Aug 06, 2017", "4.3/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.9%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.75Can dated 7/25:
Pours a white haze with some pale yellow thrown in. The white head builds to about a finger and a half. It holds for a little while, but cannot last the whole pour, even in a nucleated glass - no lacing.

Nose is a combination of lime and ginger with a very light salinity. The lime is easily the most dominant, and while the ginger is quite noticeable, the combination gives me an overall impression of juniper. Not sure if there's anything additional (maybe the coriander that is a part of the standard gose) that is helping this impression.

Taste is similarly heavy on the lime - more evident when colder. The Ginger bite is up front, but the flavor plays second fiddle. In some respects, there's an aspect of a radler here, but any sweetness is replaced by ginger spice, enhancing the tart aspect. There is a minute salt taste that lingers behind the two main components to catch my palate as the beer goes out the door. Feel is light, puckering, with a spice bite that pricks more than the tickling carbonation.

A very good flavored beer that more or less has the basics of the base beer included. The added items shine, though, at least this early after canning.\xa01,195 characterscjgiant, Jul 30, 2017"]

name: Sour Apple Gose
review:
['3.9/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.4%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.512 ounce can into tulip glass, best before 4/30/2019. Pours crystal clear medium golden yellow color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with good retention, that reduces to a thin spotty lace cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big tart/sour red/green apple, fruit peel, lemon, lime, orange, peach, pear, passion fruit, mango, melon, berries, white grape/wine, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, and white bread; with lighter notes of sea salt, peppercorn, lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of apples, fruity/acidic yeast, citrus/tropical hops, and moderate pale/wheat malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big tart/sour red/green apple, fruit peel, lemon, lime, orange, peach, pear, passion fruit, mango, melon, berries, white grape/wine, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, and white bread; with lighter notes of sea salt, peppercorn, lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang, and light spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/sour red/green apple, fruit peel, lemon, lime, orange, peach, pear, passion fruit, mango, melon, berries, white grape/wine, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, sea salt, peppercorn, lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Great complexity, robustness, and balance of apples, fruity/acidic yeast, citrus/tropical hops, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; with a great malt/tartness and tangy fruit balance; with no puckering flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp/clean finishing. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering tartness and tangy fruit. Medium-plus carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately bready/grainy/acidic/tangy/tannic, and slightly saline balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5.1%. Overall this is a delicious fruited gose. All around nice complexity, robustness, and balance of apples, fruity/acidic yeast, citrus/tropical hops, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink with the mellowly acidic/tangy/tannic/drying finish; not overly lactic or salty. Very flavorful and not watery for the ABV. Great balance of apples, Lacto complexity, and Citra hops; with a nice pale/wheat malt backbone against acidity for the ABV. A very enjoyable offering, and spot on style example.\xa02,477 characterssuperspak, Jan 12, 2019', "3.46/5\xa0\xa0rDev -9.2%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.5Crystal clear, pale yellow body; lively carbonation with a wispy head. Warm bread aroma with a trace of apple on the nose; toasted wheat. Tart, green apple flavor. Dry, acidic mouthfeel.

You want apple, you got apple. This beer wouldn't be a go-to beer for me as it comes across like a sparkling apple juice. But if this is your thing...\xa0338 charactersbeergoot, Jan 16, 2018", '3.79/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 4 | smell: 3 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Poured into a balloon glass.

The beer is a see-through light golden color with a quickly receding white head that only leaves a thin collar with no lacing. The aroma is almost completely vacant, if not for a slight hint of green apple peel I’d suggest it smells like purified bottled water! The taste is really specific in harboring green apple tartness with a dose of sea salt in the finish. The mouthfeel is light and dry. Overall, very drinkable beer if you like apple tart and a wee bit of saltiness in your gose. I’m highly impressed that this may be the first beer I’ve ever stuck my nose in and smelled absolutely nothing.\xa0636 charactersJuicesFlowing, Dec 08, 2017']

name: Blood Orange Gose
review: ['3.6/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5Decent gose with a decent amount of blood orange flavor. Would have been better if it were a little more sour with detectable salinity. Not bad but falls a bit short.\xa0166 charactersLucular, Apr 13, 2018']

name: Nelson Gose
review: ['3.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev -8.6%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.5Overall a nice beer, but there was some off taste in the finish that I did not like. It was out of a few hour old growler. The smell, look, and feel were all really good, but if that off taste was removed it would have been great.\xa0231 characterslic217, Feb 06, 2016']

name: Jingle Zombie
review:
["4.33/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9.3%look: 4.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.25To my knowledge I've not familiarized myself with beers of this type previously, so there were no expectations other than what's advertised in the name. It is indeed sour, but there's room for it in this world, though it definitely seems like the sort of thing you partake in when you're craving it very specifically. Something that brought to mind kombucha, the drink struck me as a bit yeasty and having an earthy immediate after taste. Suds are active, there is a head if poured aggressively, but it only lasts a few seconds.\xa0531 charactersjguzman718, Nov 26, 2018", "3.9/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4A: The beer is hazy pinkish red in color—too hazy to see if there is any visible carbonation—and somewhat has the color of ruby red grapefruit. It poured with a narrow white collar around the edge and lots of specks of bubbles on the surface.
S: Moderate aromas of sourness are present in the nose along with notes of yogurt and hints of cranberries and tangerines.
T: The taste has flavors of cranberries and tangerines along with a light to moderate amount of sourness and associated hints of yogurt-like flavors.
M: It feels light- to medium-bodied and somewhat tart on the palate with a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: The taste of this beer isn't nearly sour compared to others in the style and has a good amount of fruity flavors compared to other sours.

Serving type: can\xa0786 charactersmetter98, Nov 25, 2018"]

name: Bianca Lemon Coconut Tart Lassi Gose
review: ['4.02/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.3%look: 3.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Unsure of the canning date. Looks like sparkling apple juice, there was a very modest off-white head that faded very quickly leaving no lacing or suds/foam on the surface. Sporadic carbonation bubbles. Smells like a cinnamon babka and apple pie to me, it actually smells like the inside of Ikea. The taste has more lemon and slight coconut presence but it has a distinct sweetness/tartness to it, i still taste more apple than anything. On the fuller side but starp carbonation and a sweet finish.\xa0498 charactersGreyvtrayn, Jun 08, 2019', '4.13/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.1%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.516 ounce can into tulip glass, canned in 4/2019. Pours slightly hazy/cloudy medium golden yellow color with a 1-2 finger dense and rocky off white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice dense soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of big juicy/tart/tangy limes, coconut, citrus zest, lemon, orange, peach, pear, melon, apricot, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, vanilla, cream, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of limes, coconut, fruity/acidic yeast, lactose, and pale/wheat malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big juicy/tart/tangy limes, coconut, citrus zest, lemon, orange, peach, pear, melon, apricot, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, vanilla, cream, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang, and light spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/tangy limes, coconut, citrus zest, lemon, orange, peach, pear, melon, apricot, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, vanilla, cream, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of limes, coconut, fruity/acidic yeast, lactose, and pale/wheat malt flavors; with an awesome malt/tartness and tangy fruit balance; with zero puckering flavors after the finish. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering tartness and tangy fruit. Medium carbonation and medium-plus body; with a very smooth, creamy/silky/grainy, fairly acidic/tangy, and lightly saline mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol for 6%. Overall this is an awesome fruited milkshake gose. All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of limes, coconut, fruity/acidic yeast, lactose, and pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth and refreshing to drink with the mellowly acidic/tangy/drying finish. Great soft feel, not overly lactic/salty. Perfectly balance between juicy/vibrant limes, coconut, salt, Lacto complexity, lactose, and pale/wheat malts against acidity. Mild residual sweetness with lingering dryness. A really enjoyable offering, and spot on style example as expected.\xa02,426 characterssuperspak, May 29, 2019']

name: Gose IPA Du Barachois
review: ['3.95/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.5%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Hazy straw color with no visible activity. Foamy and frothy white 3-4 finger head in a stange, lasting around 10 minutes, with faint legs and swirl reaction. Flavors of lemon, cranberries, sweet grains, coriander, salt, wheat, and floral hops. Slick and smooth medium to full body with crispy carbonation. Medium to strong citrusy tart strength, feels flowery and a bit candy (jolly rancher) like with sharp yeast and a grainy final. More hops than typical Gose, still well balanced. A lot similar to their regular Gose IPA. Perfect summer beer boosting good freshness and well bodied. Overall high quality craft.\xa0613 charactersTheBierdimpfe, Mar 11, 2018', '3.98/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.3%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Pale slightly cloudy straw with very little head. Flowery funky aroma - pear? - floral, salty, tart, faint citrus. Full mouth as expected. Very drinksble and refreshing.\xa0169 characterseberesford, Aug 15, 2017', '4.02/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.3%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Bottle: Poured a slightly hazy pale blonde color Gose with a large nice foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of coriander and floral hops is quite nice refreshing. Taste is a mix of coriander with some subtle salty notes offset by citrusy floral notes and a tart finish. Body is about average with good carbonation. Well brewed with loads of flavours while retaining great drinkability.\xa0403 charactersPhyl21ca, May 01, 2017']

name: Salt on the Rim
review:
['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Southern Grist Brewing Company

Salt on the Rim

Canned on 5/1 in time for Cinco de Mayo

Look: The beer is hazy and translucent. Golden straw in color with an active bone white that quickly disappears. Constant stream of bubbles rise to the top of the glass. Zero lacing. A nice appearance for the style with inviting, lively carbonation. 

Smell: The nose on this beer is huge. A lot of salinity and minerality. Huge lemon and lime citrus and acidity. Lots of green jello. The sweetness that comes along with the zest, and the bright acidity from the juice. Earthy black lime peel. Fresh, bright and earthy all playing nicely together. 

Taste: This beer is very tasty. A lot of lemon and lime flavor combined with sweetness and tart acidity, neither dominating. Diluted like juice, lemon/lime sour gummy candy. The acidity is not too high. And the finish nails the dry, crackery wheat finish I love so much in the style. 

Feel: Moderate carbonation, soft, with some gritty pithiness, dry and only slightly puckering. 

Overall: A refreshing and tasty beer that nicely resembles the cocktail, as much as a beer could, while still drinking like a beer with some level of complexity. These beers can easily go sideways, but this one does not. I’m glad the beer is not overly acidic or enamel stripping.\xa01,313 charactersTheGent, Jun 16, 2019', '4.02/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Poured into a snifter. A slightly hazy pale straw color with a thick white head. Fresh-squeezed lime, faint citrus, and wheat on the nose. Taste is definitely margarita-like with tart lime, some orange and floral notes, and prominent mouth-watering salt. No off flavors. Body is a bit heftier than most Goses. Straightforward and well-made.\xa0340 charactersBuck89, May 09, 2019']

name: Blood Orange Gose
review:
['3.6/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.8%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Appearance – The beer is served a super hazy pink color with a tiny fizzy white head. The head fades very fast to leave a light level of foamy lace on the sides of the glass.
Smell – The aroma of the brew is lighter than expected. It has notes of blood orange and some sour apple cidre vinegar. Along with these aromas comes some light hay and grass.
Taste – The taste begins with a tart green apple flavor that has a lot of sour lemon. There is a hint of orange upfront which grows slightly stronger as the taste advances. There is not much else going on in the taste and these tastes take the taste to the end to leave a sour and tart taste to linger on the tongue.
Mouthfeel – The body of the brew is on the on the thinner side with a carbonation level that is higher. For the tart tastes of the brew the feel is great and makes for an easy sour sipper.
Overall – Not a bad sour. Not really heavy in orange flavor, but nice and easy drinking none the less.\xa0975 charactersDarkmagus82, Aug 09, 2018', '3.31/5\xa0\xa0rDev -12.4%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.25I am not really a fan of this beer style so it might not be appropriate to rate it. But I have had several gose and this one is one of the better ones even though I do not drink them often.\xa0190 charactersvabeerguy, Jun 16, 2018', '4.37/5\xa0\xa0rDev +15.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Bright, crisp, tart, sour, salty, refreshing. This is the perfect summer beer. It has all the substance of a quality. The blood orange adds a nice spin on the style and gives it a juicy finish. Killer beer and look forward to more of the funk works.\xa0249 charactersdrinkin-beeers, Jul 09, 2017']

name: Peach Gose
review:
['3.82/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.1%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Hazy blonde; vinegar + musk, no fruit, touch of salt; slight oyster cracker, hit of salt, vague orchard fruit sorbet, herbal end. 

4 3.75 3.75 3.75 4

Not the cleanest nose - funk more than yeast. Salt over sour; lemon as it opens. And yet, still not very peachy. 

2800th review.\xa0281 charactersStJamesGate, Aug 27, 2018']

name: Gose
review:
['3.81/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Clear golden color with a small head. 
Grassy wheaty farmhouse smell. 
Tastes tart, fruity, citrus, berry. Great balance. 
Semi dry, light bodied, carbonated well.\xa0163 charactersWontonst, Dec 05, 2016', '3.71/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Lots of clarity from the golden brew, plenty light and in conformity with style guidelines. Aroma was minimal in terms of the salt and coriander impact.

Good light refreshing smack of lacto and salt. Again, coriander, anything else spice rack is in the back. Reminiscient of the Uinta Ready Set Gose, but this one has more clarity, salt and tang to it. A solid effort, very much enjoyed before the 4th of July Reno Aces game at Mellow Fellow. Paired decent with an average burger.\xa0487 charactersrodbeermunch, Jul 05, 2016']

name: MarGrooVita
review: ["4.2/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Pours a soft, slight, white head. Bright aroma of sourness and citrus. Golden, chill haze color. Starts with a nice sourness; tons of complex citrus and saltiness. Citrus leads the way, then a flash of salt, then a wall of maltiness. The finish is yeasty bread. \n\nThis is very nice. It's all the loveliness of a gose, with a slightly more aggressive citrus profile. I am so glad I have six bottles of this.\xa0406 charactersTheSSG, May 28, 2018", '3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.2%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.7512oz bottle, served in a snifter glass. Pours a slightly cloudy and unfiltered golden yellow body, one finger white head, short retention, bit of lacing. Smell is lime, wheat germ, grapefruit, touch of salt, light lemon and touch of lactic acid. Similar flavour profile which fits the profile of a lime gose, absolutely. Does a reasonable job of capturing that profile; really solid beer with a good tartness to it. Mouthfeel is lighter bodied, good carbonation, lime and zest on the backend.\xa0492 charactersStevedore, May 02, 2018', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Poured 12oz bottle into tulip. It is a clear pale yellow with thin 1.5 finger white head. Retention is minimal and no lacing. Aroma is tart lemon and lime with some grain and floral notes. Starts out with a tart citrus of lemon and lime that gives way to a slight sweet and salty middle with the sweet agave and floral notes. Mouthfeel is clean, refreshing and tart. Very easy drinking. I think they nailed it.\xa0410 charactersRi0, May 01, 2018']

name: Salt & Seed
review:
['3.9/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4From a twelve ounce brown bottle, this is a hazy gold color. The aroma is grainy and grassy. The taste is a bit tart, with some salt and brine. Flavorful and enjoyable.\xa0170 charactersSuds, Nov 04, 2019', "3.89/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 3.7512 ounce bottle - $2.79 at Total Wine & More in Alpharetta, Georgia.

Appearance: Pours a straw-hued body, a little bit of haze, with a thin, thinning, immediately gone, white head.

Smell: Well salted watermelon, with touches of rind, meat and seed.

Taste: Ample watermelon with a good salt lick to the thing. Nice lactic tartness, acidic. Some underlying hints accounting for barley, wheat, yeast, but, really it's just the watermelon and salt, or salt & seed, as the label proclaims.

Mouthfeel: Medium-light body. Medium-plus carbonation.

Overall: Fine.\xa0559 charactersChainGangGuy, Nov 03, 2019", '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Experience by November 6th 2019.

Looks straw yellow, clear, small but retentive head of foam. 

Smells of watermelon, salt, medium degree of tartness. 

Watermelon up front, salt is right there , sensing other fruit. Tartness appropriate. 

Light body with lively carbonation. 

Good Gose.\xa0291 charactersBitterbill, Sep 24, 2019']

name: Gose The Gozerian
review: ["4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.9%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 44 across the board. This is only my 3rd Gose but I'm beginning to take a liking to the style. Really only going to explain the taste here as everything else falls in line. First a sour vinegary taste hits you (may not sound appealing but I like vinegar) then you get the saltyness and it finishes sweet. I enjoyed this one. Sour acidic to salty to sweet worked very well.\xa0371 charactersMFMB, Nov 13, 2015"]

name: Raspberry Gose
review: ['2.95/5\xa0\xa0rDev -20.9%look: 4 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 2.75 | feel: 2.75 | overall: 2.75Lovely fermented/red fruit aroma, rich color...but the pallet is really syrupy and concentrated. Not an easy drinker in my opinion. This beer coats the mouth completely and sticks. Not too sour/unripe, the raspberry comes in more on the finish. A pleasant beer, but seems to be hard to drink a whole can.\xa0304 characterslinuslanducci, Jul 04, 2019']

name: Mojito Lime
review: ['3.55/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.1%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.5Pours a clear golden color with a finger width carbonated head. Head retention is minimal. Lacing is decent. Aroma of lime, salt and spearmint at the end. Tart taste with moderate salty lime and good amount of spearmint at the end. Light bodied with moderate to heavy carbonation. A good summer, pool side sour.\xa0316 charactersjngrizzaffi, Sep 18, 2018']

name: Dunkle Gose
review:
['2.99/5\xa0\xa0rDev -11%look: 3.25 | smell: 3 | taste: 3 | feel: 2.75 | overall: 3Pours a dark amber-orange color, with a small white head.

Offers a lactic, toffee coated sourness, with an interesting toasty note to it. 

Has a medium carbonation, which is by far not as refreshing as the Hell version, with a watery, one dimensional finish, as for the lack of required carbonation.

Tastes of a toffee covered toastiness among dusty old bakers chocolate and a chunk of crisp lemon. Its typical mineralic quality, which is symptomatic for the style, is a tad subdued, compared to the regular Gose, producing a very steamlined but boring and watery finish. 

Drinks more than a brown ale than a Gose, due to it more pronounced malts, lower carbonation, lack of spices and a subdued lemony infusion.\xa0716 charactersaleigator, Jun 05, 2016', '3.79/5\xa0\xa0rDev +12.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Hazy, muddy, amber-brown pour with an off-white two finger head with good retention and lacing. The nose is pretty typical of a German Dunkle with lots of malt with hints of caramel, subtle chocolate, brown bread, grain, and brown sugar. The taste is malt forward with lots of caramel, brown bread, brown sugar, subtle saltiness, and a just a touch of sour on the finish. The mouthfeel is slightly thick with medium carbonation and a salty-sweet finish. Overall, this was a bit more interesting than the Helle version. I think the salt plays better with the dark malts.\xa0574 charactersbeerdrifter, Nov 09, 2014', "3.41/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.5%look: 4 | smell: 3 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Half litre bottle, no head, hazy,copper colour. Vegetable smell, notes of carrot, coriander, salt and cucumber. Fairly sour and the sourness doesn't ease up. I can't really taste much difference to the Helles Gose. Not smooth but not fizzy either. Interesting beer again non-Reinheitsgebot but too sour for me.\xa0310 charactersjonb5, Feb 01, 2012", '3.18/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.4%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 2.5 | feel: 3 | overall: 4A - Pours a hazy deep honey color with a thick off-white head. While certainly darker than a regular Gose ("Dunkle" indicates "dark"), this would be about as light of a Munich Dunkel or Dunkelweizen as you would find.

S - Aroma is straight up, slickly sweet Munich malt with just a hint of herbal noble hops.

T - Much like the aroma, the flavor is bready, sweet and grainy up front, much like I would expect from a Munich Dunkel. The characteristic sourness I expect from a Gose is noticeably absent, as is any hint of coriander. There's a bit of rye flavor and dryness in the finish. The only Gose-like quality I pick up is the same slightly salty mineral harshness I pick up in the aftertaste of Brauerei Goslar's Helle Gose.

M - Somewhat thin but this is offset by the ample carbonation.

D - Quite refreshing and flavorful without being heavy.

Overall: This would be a good Munich Dunkel, but I can't help but be disappointed given that this is the only dark Gose being produced. Brauerei Goslar should brew this just as they do their Helle Gose, only with ample Munich malt, and this would be an awesome beer. But without the sourness, it's just another Dunkel.\xa01,180 charactersWindigstadt, Jan 27, 2009']

name: Never Together
review:
["3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75This was another beer that I traded for a while go, as the date on the bottom of the can read 9/25/17. I love this style because it's easy to enjoy in all aspects and that was true with this as well. No, it wasn't strong but nothing of this sort is and the taste and mouthfeel were more than satisfying enough for me on this mild summer night!

The pour to this was a dark blood orange with enough sheen to it to serve as reminder that this wasn't an unfiltered IPA or anything of the sort. A nice, loud head topped it off but the liveliness of it faded quickly as the bubbles settled before I had a chance to fully admire this beer's look. Never saw lacing like the one this left behind as it was a cross between a spider web and a tan, stringy mess that looked like it was violently tossed against the inside of my pint glass. Lots of sea salt, blood orange, lactic acid, and yeast in the nose with the funky, acetic tone emerging even stronger in the taste. Blood orange juice, berry tartness, citrus tang, and lively bubbles rounded this out as there was plenty of life to this, for a beer that almost felt like a sour...

Of course, the booze was light as this was quite easy to quaff. A good amount of fruit lingered throughout as the malt was quite basic and the sea-salt was present, but never overpowering. Not the best brew from The Veil but there was enough to like here and those looking to have a Leipzig Gose for the first time would be wise to reach for this. Quite enjoyable for a quiet summer night!\xa01,517 charactersJerzDevl2000, Jul 10, 2019", "4.35/5\xa0\xa0rDev +11.3%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Appearance: Arrives with a cloudy peach nectar color and a nice head that leaves some spotty lacing

Smell: Wheat bread with lactic blood orange tones

Taste: Lactic blood orange forward, with the wheat tang building; tart, with some bitterness in the mid-palate; modest salt tones appear in the finish

Mouthfeel: Medium body with moderate carbonation

Overall: I was not expecting much, given the previous ratings but this is a nice Gose, with Veil's distinctive juicy character imprinting\xa0496 charactersbrentk56, Oct 28, 2017"]

name: Gose IPA
review:
["3.99/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.5%look: 3.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 4.25Cloudy straw color with low activity. Thick foamy and frothy white 3-4 finger head, lasting around 5-10 minutes, with faint lacing. Flavors of coriander, pears, peach, lemon, tart cranberries, roasted grains, wheat, yeast, floral spices. Very sour, highly sharp citrusy feel. Slick and smooth full body with crispy and prickly carbonation. Strong finish, very sharp fruity tart feel, but at least not too candy like, with flowery and citrus hops, ending with a soft wheat feel. A Berliner weisse style of Gose, it's better but still feels too sour and acidic for my taste, though I enjoy the freshness and clean end. Unique vegetal perfume, almost like seaweeds, quite pleasant. The flavors are nice and of high quality. Never tasted a Gose before, although I think overall this is an excellent quality craft, nice complexity and good ingredients. The sour queen wife really likes it.\xa0884 charactersTheBierdimpfe, Dec 17, 2016", '3.4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -13.5%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Bottle: Poured a hazy yellow color gose with a small white foamy head with OK retention and no lacing. Aroma of light salty and tart base with some citrusy hops notes. Taste is also a mix of tart notes with some salty and coriander notes also perceptible with some citrusy hops with no bitterness. Body is about average with good carbonation. Not bad but hops are more subdued then I was expecting.\xa0398 charactersPhyl21ca, Nov 23, 2016', "4.48/5\xa0\xa0rDev +14%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5Cloudy straw color with a 1-finger thin white head. 

Interesting aroma, the traditional saltiness of the Gose meets the bitterness of the IPA. Some tartness notes in the nose too. 

It all merges in the mouth, the taste being salty and sour at the same time with a touch of bitterness. It's a really unique beer and it's pretty good. 

Good mouth feel, lots of fizziness.\xa0372 charactersVbolieuV, Oct 15, 2016"]

name: Punch Drunk
review:
["4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Poured from 750ml crowler into glass. Canned on date of '6/24/17'.
Clear red body, pinkish head settles to scattered islands, spots of lacing.
Slightly sweet berry aroma, wheat base, salty.
Sweeter berry flavor, with lemon/green apple tartness, salty on lips.
Lighter mouth feel, carbonation refreshes.
A gose with the sweetness built in with the berry aspect.\xa0360 charactersMonDak_Joe1953, Dec 04, 2017", '4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25L: looks a lot like a glass of cranberry juice with a 1/2" pinkish white foam cap on top

S: has a rich, almost punch-like berry aroma with a trace of wheat and a hint of floral and spice that suggests corriander

T: It has a rich berry flavor with a level of lactic acid tartness between a Granny Smith apple and a lemon. The berry's tartness adds to the Gose's Lactic acid tartness while the sweetness and the wheat soften things slightly. The tannins from the berry add bitterness and dryness to balance the sweet

F: effervescent, light bodied 

O: a tart, refreshing, dry, complex and layered beer\xa0602 characterspat61, Nov 27, 2017']

name: Never Never More More
review:
['4.48/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.4%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5Appearance - Pours deep thick burgundy with nice pick head that dissipates to a thin film.

Feel - thick creamy with a great dry finish.

Overall - Very well done Gose nice flavors.\xa0378 charactersDragginballs76, Jul 29, 2018']
