name: Gose
review:
["3.65/5\xa0\xa0rDev -8.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75A cloudy pale yellow color with a rather thin white head that leaves no lace.

Tart and lightly lemony smell.

Good amount of sourness going on. Some lemon and a light wheat presence. The sourness is not overwhelming and quite refreshing.

Light bodied and goes down easily. 

Had a tall boy of it and had no problem finishing it. This is my first of this style and have to say that it was pretty enjoyable. It was along the lines of a Bell's Oarsman and is a well done brew.\xa0475 charactersjera1350, Sep 12, 2010", '4.47/5\xa0\xa0rDev +12.6%look: 4 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Had this on tap at the Herkimer.

Served in a 23 oz weizen glass with "Gose Spezeill Weizen" printed on the glass. Color is a hazy straw yellow with a lively carbonation. Thin white cap about one finger in width with good retention. It does leave some sticky lacing around the outside of the glass.

The nose is very acidic, with a firm wheat backbone. Very sour and tart, very lemony. This is a combination of a weizen and a berliner weisse, so it's a combination of a wheat beer and a sour beer. That is exactly what it smells like.

This is some tasty stuff. Sour and tart lemons, with a smooth wheat finish. Smooth yet sour, a very nice combination. I wish I could say more, but my previous review got deleted. Needless to say, this is some tasty stuff.

Mouthfeel is light and smooth, with an appropriate carbonatoin level. Drinkability is excellent.

Overall, my favorite offering by far from the Herk. I've ordered this multiple times and it always impresses.\xa0966 charactersMistofminn, Oct 05, 2009', '4.55/5\xa0\xa0rDev +14.6%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 5This brew pours a hazy pale yellow-orange color. The head is large, white, and billowy, but recedes quickly into spaarce lacing. The aroma is very tangy with a noticable salty twang. Underneath is a nice wheat and coriander backbone. The taste is as tangy as the aroma, with a nice mild sourness, and a nice crisp saltiness. The mouthfeel is meium bodied with fittingly high carbonation. Overall, this is one of my favorite beer styles, and I am glad to see a local brewpub makine one on a regular basis. I only wish more beers like this were more easily available. I could session this forever.\xa0595 charactersKarlHungus, Aug 14, 2007', "4.18/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.5Served is a big 24 oz. weizen glass with a slice of orange (I left it on the side). This was quite a tasty summer drink. It's described as cross between a Belgian wit and Berliner weisse and I pulled those sorts of flavors out. It appears a hazy yellow-gold with a mellow spice aroma. The flavor was fairly complex, it's tart with a bit of lemon juice, followed by coriander and mellow wheat grains. Yum. 

This is worth a trip down to the Herk. Go get it.\xa0458 characterstempest, Jun 06, 2007"]

name: Von Steuben's Gose
review:
["4.26/5\xa0\xa0rDev +15.1%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.5A smoked gose is the kind of idea that sounds dumb at first, just because you never heard of one before, but then after you think about it for a few seconds you realize that, yeah, that actually probably should work.

Newburgh's works.

Pours very pale and hazy. Smells very light, appropriate for the style, a lemony tartness subdued by smoke. Tastes like it smells: not so much of a combination of meaty and sour nodes but a sour base smoothed out wonderfully by the addition of smoke.\xa0488 charactersmynie, Mar 22, 2015", "4.2/5\xa0\xa0rDev +13.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25From 02/27/13 notes. Had this on tap at Pony Bar on the UES in NYC. Served in a pint glass.

a - Pours a hazy, murky pale yellow color with one inch of bright white head and low carbonation evident. Looks ok.

s - Smells of citrus, bananas, sour fruits, cloves, spice, earthy notes, and some bready malts. Pretty nice, I like the citrus and slightly sour notes quite a bit.

t - Tastes of sour fruity malts, citrus, lemon zest, some major salt, yeast, spices, cloves, floral hops, earthy notes, biscuit malts, and wheat. Wow, great taste here. Little more sour fruits and citrus than the nose, and the salt is there and very nice.

m - Medium body and low to moderate carbonation. Body is super smooth and creamy and very easy to drink. Awesome mouthfeel...I think the salt smooths it down a bit somehow.

o - Overall I loved this one; never had anything from Newburgh before but this is one of the better goses I've had in a long time. Nose is pretty nice with some light sour fruit and citrus, and the taste has a little more of those mixing with salt, but in a really nice way. Super easy to drink and the salt is up front but doesn't take over; I thought this was a great beer. Would like to have it again for sure and look forward to trying more of their beers.\xa01,266 charactersmdfb79, Feb 28, 2013"]

brewery: Right Proper Brewing Company - Shaw Brewpub
name: Right Proper / Oxbow Gregarious
review: ['2.28/5\xa0\xa0rDev -38.7%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 1 | feel: 2.5 | overall: 2Straight vinegar. Had on tap at Right Proper 7/23. Did not want to finish. Not sure if I had a different batch than the other reviewers but mine was near undrinkable. I love goses and have had many examples of the style from the very sour and salty to milder ones, but this batch should have been drainpoured in my opinion. Very carbonated, very vinegary.\xa0355 charactersjafrick, Jul 28, 2015', '4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +14.2%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a sticky white head; aromas of lemon and brine jump out of the glass. The flavor is very lemon-heavy, with a touch of salinity, and a blast of mouth puckering acidity and a dry finish. A great beer for a hot summer day.\xa0251 charactersDavidHume, Jul 19, 2015', '4.41/5\xa0\xa0rDev +18.5%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Packs so much flavor into a small package. Lemon pucker with a touch of salt gives way quickly to a crisp, super drying tartness in the back of your mouth.\xa0155 charactersgrover37, Jul 14, 2015']

name: Island Göse
review:
['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Pours hazy yellow amber with a fast falling head of creamy off white foam that made a good stand. Malty nose with the light scent of fruit. herbal and a soft floral. A minerally scent. Drinks just acidic with a hearty yet refined cracker malt. Just a hint of salt int he finish. prickly bubbles, soft body, lightly fruity. The earthy coriander is feather light. Low bitterness. The body of the Lepzinger gose is what this beer reminds me of. It has the white rock like mineral taste of salt. There is also a light tropical scent. Finishes light, refreshing and tart. The floral and herbal on this hop seem to be perfectly matched. Mouth watering tartness sweet lemon peel.\xa0672 charactersutopiajane, May 13, 2018', "3.68/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75This one pours with a slightly hazy golden hue, with a small head, and not much lacing.

This smells like sour lemon, with a bit of sweet orange and guava, a bit of acidity.

Ellicottville definitely could have gone into this a bit more bravely with the fruit additions, but it's a very crisp and drinkable gose. The sourness level is nice, slightly lingering, and the salinity level is subtle but nice. I don't get all the fruits- mainly orange and guava.

This is light bodied, and crisp and very clean, with a pretty refreshing drinkability to this.

I wish Ellicottville hadn't held back with the fruit here, as it could have really elevated this, but the base gose is surprisingly sturdy and solid.\xa0703 charactersGreesyFizeek, Apr 30, 2018", '3.63/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.1%look: 3 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5L: Hazy translucent gold with a small white head. Slight retention, with some spotty lacing.

S: Salty and tart with orange and pineapple. Hints of passionfruit, guava, and mango. Grainy, wheaty, cereal-like malt with a touch of coriander.

T: Orange peel and pineapple upfront. Lightly tart with a good amount of salinity. Passionfruit and guava are there, but more subdued. Wheaty, almost harshly grainy malt with toasted coriander. Moderately tart throughout.

F: Light, but not watery. Well carbonated. Crisp, clean, and lightly dry.

O: A decent tropical-fruited gose. I wish the fruits popped a bit more, but this is quite refreshing.\xa0650 charactersHorseheadsHophead, Apr 17, 2018']

name: Rind
review: ['4.02/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4i love the woody or wild gose type, i am fatiguing of the one dimensional thing with these, the lacto leading the charge and nothing else there from a fermentation standpoint, but this isnt like that, it has great complexity to it, woody but still light and refreshing, the wood fermentation is important here, sort of its signature for me, but its also got a little bretty wild thing going on, fully compatible with the watermelon and herbs its made with. i like the pale washed out raw wheaty look of this and the dry and bitter watermelon on it, rind seems like a good name, more green and cruchy than sweet and fleshy there, a cool touch and use of this fruit in here. the salt is way light, but there is a strong citrus thing happening, general minerals more than salt to me, sort of tied in with the wood. some tea and dried cooking herbs too, neat with the watermelon but streamlined to me, more complex than most gose, but nowhere near as interesting and layered as so much of the fonta flora beer that i have had in the past. crazy drinkable though because its botanical and summery and fresh and insanely light, without being real sour at all. i enjoyed this, found it unique, but its not on my list of all time fonta flora brews. great use of the watermelon though!\xa01,276 charactersStonedTrippin, Oct 27, 2018']

name: Imperial 3 Scoops: Pineapple, Coconut, Strawberry
review: ['3.73/5\xa0\xa0rDev -11.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75PprBurke, Feb 11, 2019', '4.6/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8.7%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5CreightonSM, Jan 27, 2019', '4.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.4%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5mflamar, Jan 17, 2019', '4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25PhineasMcClintock, Nov 12, 2018', '4.24/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.2%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25NolaHopHead, Nov 01, 2018', '4.08/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4caahare, Oct 24, 2018']

name: Spaghetti Gose
review: ['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.7%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4i appreciate this more than i like it, if that makes sense. i think there is so much room for savory and unconventional culinary ingredients in beer that has yet to be all the way tapped into, and i think this is a cool step towards that. i like that the base gose is light, if this was too sour it would be problematic i think, as some serious acidity is contributed by the tomatoes, which i think are the most prominent of the additives here, fresh and natural, with the fire roast element evident more in the nose than the taste, not quite smoked, a little sweet too, really cool, fleshy and real. the salt is also pretty bold in here, but like a shake on a fresh slice of tomato, it really enhances it here, that synergy is brilliant. the herbs are interesting, they taste dried not fresh to me, more of a pizza sauce than a pasta sauce to me because of all the oregano, but i like it, i just wish it showed up a little sooner, it starts when the rest of this fades out, so they arent really on the palate at the same time for very long, which is to its detriment. the base beer is clean, and i can still taste the wheat, almost like a pasta water or something, its pretty cohesive all up, and it works well enough that i would drink more than one of them. i think tomato has a ton of potential in beer, and this is more than just a gimmick. i have been critical of weldwerks overuse of adjuncts, but i respect this one a lot. i hope they dial it in and keep making it. very unique!\xa01,486 charactersStonedTrippin, Sep 29, 2018', '3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.8%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3 | overall: 3.75Made with tomatoes, pasta, and dry "hopped" with oregano and basil. I had 5 oz or so of it, which is all I needed. It was interesting and well crafted, but not something I want in liquid form again. Nose of marinara, first taste was of V8, then the salt of the Gose, the herbs and a finish of roasted tomatoes. Seemed a tad watered down, perhaps better if it was a bit more concentrated. \n\nFun to bring to a tasting, but not something that I need to drink again in my life.\xa0473 charactersisraellamar, Sep 13, 2018']

name: We Want The Funk - Pomegranate Margarita Gose
review: ['3.77/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Tasted in a Rastal Teku from a 12 fl oz can on July 10, 2018. This beer is based off the traditional German style Gose which was made in a very nontraditional manner. Light body and low bitterness keep things simple while the infusion of salt, lime zest, pomegranate and agave bring the margarita to life. A mild tartness mingles with all the other adjuncts bringing out the margarita flavor.\xa0392 charactersHopheadjeffery, Oct 03, 2018']

name: Apricot Gose
review:
['4.04/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.9%look: 3 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Cloudy pale yellow with a thin ring.

Apricots and fresh green hops on nose, with a wheat malt presence.

Taste is bready, yet tangy. Lactic apricot, followed by a little barnyard funk.

Light, smooth, soft and delicate.\xa0220 charactersSabtos, Aug 10, 2016', "4.67/5\xa0\xa0rDev +12.3%look: 4.75 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.75Pours a peachy colored hazy beautiful mess. Huge apricot aroma. Loads of apricot on the palate but it still retains the gose salt and sour flavors. This is in my top 3-4 great raft beers. But it's hard to rank them when everything they make is of the highest quality.\xa0267 characterstbryan5, Jul 26, 2016", '3.97/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.6%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Had on tap at the Great Raft taproom. Pours a clear, straw color with a thin, soapy white head. Moderate lace. Smell is lemongrass, lighter stone fruit, ocean air saltiness. Taste is light in the tongue. A slight lemony tartness backed with just a mild amount of saltiness. Perfect. Not picking up much apricot in the sip. Mouthfeel is light and goes down perfectly on a hot Louisiana summer day. Expected a bit drier finish but was more on the semi-dry edge. Overall, this is a way better Gose than their previous one.\xa0523 charactersJamesStreet, Jul 07, 2016']

name: Lime Gose
review: ['2.53/5\xa0\xa0rDev -24.7%look: 3.75 | smell: 2.5 | taste: 2 | feel: 4 | overall: 2.5This is not my typical style of beer, so maybe my comments should be taken in that light, but this tasted like It is in a race to the bottom with Bud Limarita or some such Saturday afternoon sorority type swill. Very chemical, attificial taste. Sorry guys, I did not care for this, but will try your other beers.\xa0312 charactersThe_Figs, Sep 14, 2018']

name: Isotonic
review:
['3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.7%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Murky peach color with a bit of white head. Aroma is really nice with tart fruits, honey and some briney pickle juice. Taste is tart and slightly salty with some lactic funk. Medium body with low effervescence. Quite well made, traditional gose.\xa0245 charactersCiocanelu, Mar 30, 2016', "2.94/5\xa0\xa0rDev -17.9%look: 3.25 | smell: 3 | taste: 2.75 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3When pouring the beer, you get a white foam fine thick foam. The foam has small bubbles and leave no lines. The beer has a hazy yellow color. The scent is refreshing and is a bit 'funky'. It is a bit fruity and a bit small sweet in smell and I find some honey and tangerine. Smells a little spice, a little lemon, berry, a little malt. Fruity but slightly sour taste of some saltiness. Hints of honey and mandarin who get up a little sweetness. Finds little orange and lemon in the notes, some malt, a hint of nuts. Tart and dry with a high carbonation. But refreshing, delicious taste that sits in a little while.\xa0614 characterswoomThomas, Feb 28, 2016", "3.82/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.7%look: 4.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Pours a vibrant, completely hazed color, with a fizzy, immediately dissipating head.

Smells truly refreshing, reveals a soft funkiness on the nose, balanced by salt and bready malts. Its yogurt tartness blends into a flowery quality, bringing old cheese to the nose. As easily as its tart qualities become noteable, they stay on par with the other aromas, producing a crisp, lemony peak.

Has a high, bubbly carbonation with an interplay between an aqueous softness and a stony minerality.

Begins with unripe orange and lemon zest among a salty note, introducing doughy malts to the palate, which later on get enhanced by old leather. The unripe fruits blend into the beers pleasant tartness among a bubbly, recognizable carbonation. During the middle, a watery quality gets very profound, still leaning on the metallic carbonation, while lemon returns during the finish, accompanied by yogurt and sweeter malts.

The beer lives up to its name without a doubt, this might be the most refreshing gose I've ever had. Drinks like a sports drink, with just enough body to keep the palate satisfied. A little too thin before the swallow, while its tartness is beautifully integrated.\xa01,180 charactersaleigator, Nov 30, 2015"]

name: Artista Zynergia: Gosanite
review: ["3.85/5\xa0\xa0rDev -8.1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Pours a burnished gold with a tight band around the shoulders and a slight haze to the clarity. Nose expresses cardamon, medicinal and herbal notes. Taste follows nose with the addition of a peppery quality. Mouthfeel is light and acidic with a carbonation shy of lively. Overall, there's a little too much going on for me in this beer. Complexity is a bit over the top.\xa0375 charactersJwale73, Nov 04, 2019", '4.34/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.6%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25this is awesome beer, so stoked to have found this on tap in idaho, extremely complex as gose goes, and maybe not the most representative example of the style, but i dont care. its super wild and sour, very lembic-esque in terms of fermentation profile and maturity, way more than just a kettle soured wheat beer with a neutral ferment, its super funky, old worldy, rustic, and amazing. i think the spices on this are pretty minimal, cardamom and vanilla are especially reserved in here, it has some wit type spicing to me, but not as complex there as anticipated, subtle clove and coriander and citrus, but its about the fermentation profile more than anything else. i get some rawness from the grain, wheaty sure, but quite earthy and rugged, a nice base for the rising acidity as this warms. i do get quite a lot of salt at the end, which both dries it out, but also sort of makes my mouth water for more each time i sip it, and i end up putting this away way too fast for how good and nuanced and rare it is, like i wish i could have drank it slower, but it kept calling me back. lots of bretty funk, white winey acidity, oak, tannins, dried flowers, oranges, and hay. the minerals from the salt at the end are also nice. i love how wild this is, id love to know more about the process here, but its a downright impressive beer with a ton of lambic character. what a treat!\xa01,377 charactersStonedTrippin, Sep 29, 2019']

name: Quick Pickle
review:
['3.99/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7%look: 3 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 4.5Stamped on the label: "08/09/19"

Appearance: The beer is a gold-orange color and is mostly opaque, only allowing the beer to lighten slightly when held to a light. The head is short, white, and fizzy. No head retention or lacing.

Aroma: The beer smells like vegetables in general. It smells a bit like a Bloody Mary but without the spice or tomato. There is a strong cucumber scent to the beer. As odd as the beer smells it is actually quite remarkable and clear. There is a bit of parsley scent to the beer. It is a crazy smelling beer but it has a nice quality to it.

Taste: Up front there is this tart and slightly sour bite that puckers the lips with a tart lemon and a bit of sour raspberry flavor. Soon after this there is a cooling sensation and a flavor of cucumbers. Very clean and enjoyable flavors.

Mouthfeel: The beer has a very pronounced and tart opening that is quickly swept away with a cooling sensation. Carbonation feels low.

Overall: This is a pretty awesome beer. The name of the beer is "QUICK PICKLE" but it says that it is a "Gose brewed with Carrots and Cucumbers." It really tastes like cucumbers and not pickles. It's a very refreshing beer to drink and it's the kind of beer you just have to try for yourself. I could see this being an extremely popular alternative to the standard Bloody Mary or Mimosa. I really enjoyed it and I'm very impressed by it. I would highly recommend it even if it sounds like something you wouldn't want to drink. This is one of those rare beers that is greater than the sum of its parts.\xa01,551 charactersteromous, Aug 30, 2019', '4.12/5\xa0\xa0rDev +10.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25nice simplicity on this....no dill, no garlic.....just light sweetness of carrot, particularly on aroma, cool refreshing flavors of cucumber, and nice salty tartness to make a subtle balance.\xa0191 charactersBeerness, Feb 05, 2019']

name: Strawberry Rhubarb Popsicle
review:
['4.23/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4The beer pours a bright pink with a small white head that recedes quickly. It has low carbonation. The beer smells of strawberry, rhubarb, pear, watermelon, orange, and sea salt. It tastes lightly tart, with strawberry, rhubarb, pear, orange, and sea salt. The feel is light and refreshing. A decent gose from the Answer, but tastes nothing like beer.\xa0351 charactersPhineasco, Jul 09, 2018', "4.03/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.8%look: 3.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Crowler filled 06/12/18

L-The beer pours a cloudy pinkish with a minimal head. Unsurprisingly no lacing is present. There are lots of floaties.
S- The nose is sweet natural strawberry. Lives up to it's name.
T- On the palate the beer is a little bit more complex. There is less sweetness than the nose. The beer is actually pleasantly tart from a combination of the rhubarb and strawberres. I even get a bit of salinity in the finish which was honestly surprising given how sweet the nose was. There really is a gose under all that fruit.
F-Mouthfeel is light overall with a not quite puckering dry finish. Carbonation is light almost to the point of being flat after the initial pour.
O- Honesty in advertising. Just don't expect it to taste like a traditional beer. I'd have no problem serving it to non beer drinkers. Maybe a touch flatter than I'd like, but overall it's flavorful. I like it. Recommended for fruit beer and sour fans.\xa0939 charactersNotAlcoholicJustAHobby, Jun 24, 2018", '4.41/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.3%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Pours a deep ruby red grapefruit pour, with tons of fruit pulp floaties.

Melted popsicle, strawberry nose. Predominantly sweet, with no off flavors. Straight juice.

Strawberry rhubarb flavor balance. Fresh picked strawberries balance a slightly earthy, herbal rhubarb presence.

The body on this is creamy, with a seltzery carb and a thick mouthfeel.\xa0352 charactersWickedBeer, May 27, 2018']

name: La Llorona

name: Extra Plenty Hibiscus Cucumber Gose
review:
['3.87/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.8%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75A: Pours bright Magenta.. I mean.. whoa. In the glass it is Ruby hued with a large pink head. 

S: Definitely cucumber in there, as well as a hint of tartness and floral notes. The very finish has a bit of a watermelon jolly rancher aroma to it. 

T: Tart up front, followed by saltiness and a definite cucumber/earthy and floral aroma that pseudo fakes the flavor of watermelon. 

M: Light bodied, plenty of carbonation, and a decent cling form the tartness. 

O: Overall probably one of the more interesting brews I have had recently.. Earthy, salty, and odd. Might be good in cooking as well. super weird. I dig it.\xa0620 charactersBeejay, Oct 30, 2018', "3.9/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.6%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4On-tap at Capital Ale House, Richmond, VA

A: The beer is dark red in color and poured with a finger high pink head that died down, leaving a narrow collar of white bubbles around the edge of the glass and a small patch of bubbles in the surface.
S: Light aromas of cucumbers are present in the nose along with notes of hibiscus.
T: The taste has strong flavors of cucumbers with hints of hibiscus.
M: It feels light-bodied and faintly tart on the palate with a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: You wouldn't expect it from the appearance as this beer is all about the cucumbers and doesn't have that much in the way of hibiscus.

Serving type: on-tap\xa0652 charactersmetter98, Aug 10, 2018"]

name: Tropical Salty Lady
review: ['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Ice_Cream_And_IPAs, Nov 18, 2019', '3.35/5\xa0\xa0rDev -17.9%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.25SicemWT, Nov 08, 2019', '3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev -8.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75archero, Nov 03, 2019', '4.24/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.9%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25ruzzal, Oct 10, 2019', '4.78/5\xa0\xa0rDev +17.2%look: 4.75 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 5 | overall: 4.75Chilmer, Oct 09, 2019', '4.34/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.4%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Gagnonsux, Oct 08, 2019']

name: Apri-Gose In Der Hose
review:
["3.72/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.9%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 3.75Decent Gose that ticks all the boxes. It could have been a bit more intense in my opinion though (a bit more sour, a bit more salty). And I am also wondering were the Apricot went. Prolly in der Hose indeed, because I didn't smell or taste any in my glass. Refreshing though, as it should be.\xa0292 charactersZet, Aug 20, 2019", '3.49/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.4%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.25L: Hazy yellow, faint head.
S: Citric, tart, a bit as in Lemon fanta.
T: Bracing sourness. Some salt. The apricot is noticeable in the end, but rather faint. I was expecting more of it, but otherwise good.
F: as expected: highly carbonated, dry finish. As it should be.
O: I wonder where is the apricot! Otherwise a good Gose.\xa0326 charactersmarcbosch, May 29, 2019']

name: Gose Shore
review:
["4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4L: A nice hazy golden amber with a white head that lasts.
S: smell of sweet tropical fruit with a little bit of hop and a yeast smell. Very good.
T: sour taste up front and you can definitely taste the salt. The tropical flavor follows and wraps it up nicely.
F: a little more full and pillowy than I was expecting. The bite seems from the sourness and not the carbonation.

O: I really, really like this beer. I don't have a lot of experience with the Gose style but this is the best one I've had. Not a huge fan of their other stuff but their sour beers impress the heck out of me.\xa0589 charactersStrike00, Jul 25, 2016"]

name: Gose Mania
review:
["3.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.1%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.25Hazy straw color with white head. Aroma has sweet lemon, coriander, wheat and some chemical note. Taste is tart and has lemon flavor, wheat is also present but also the same chemical notes from the aroma. Light body with medium carbonation and alcoholic/chemical feel. Overall this is not what I would expect from a gose. It has some similar elements but it's not really true to style.\xa0385 charactersCiocanelu, Jul 30, 2016", '4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev +19.9%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Picked this up at Feine Biere in Gärtringen, Germany. Hazy yellow-orange pour with a quickly fading one finger white head with minimal lacing. The nose resembles a gueuze with lots of must and barnyard along with hints of citrus, grass, and hay. The taste follows suit with huge sour notes along with hints of citrus, barnyard, corriander, peach, gooseberries, and subtle saltiness. The mouthfeel is tangy and sour with fizzy carbonation and a crisp, tart, dry finish. Overall, this was a very surprising beer. Extremely refreshing and hugely drinkable. Right up there with some of my favorite sours. Highly recommended!\xa0629 charactersbeerdrifter, May 01, 2015', '3.88/5\xa0\xa0rDev +12.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Giant white head, with a hazy amber yellow-orange color. 

Wheat, a bit funk, fresh hay and a little peppery. Sweet, fruity beginning, apple and peach. Hay and wheat are present, adding a lovely earthy note, which results in a smooth mouthfeel. 

Taste gets even better, as spices, clove, become recognizable. Finish gets fruity-bitter, not the usual hop aftertaste, a lot more refreshing, while also hints of wheat are still present. Great balance, as the beer develops several different taste impressions, all flavors blend well together to an overall very enjoyable Gose.\xa0574 charactersaleigator, Feb 02, 2015']

name: Amarillo Gose
review:
["4.04/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.9%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4L: Had this beer on-tap at Capital Ale House - Midlothian, poured into a snifter glass. Had a brownish color and a thick, kind of murky consistency. There was a quarter inch of foamy, off white head that lasted an average amount of time. OK lacing.

S: A good aroma of hops, wheat, citrus, and malt.

T: Tasted of a fair amount of citrus fruit (grapefruit, mostly), a good shot of hops, a light amount of salt, some wheat (less than expected), and light malt. This is more of a sour beer than a gose, but it still works. Not quite as sour / tart as I would've thought, but it's light and refreshing.

F: A well-carbonated beer with a vibrant finish. Medium-bodied.

O: An interesting hybrid of the gose and wild ale styles. Definitely drinkable.\xa0745 charactersavalon07, May 17, 2018", '3.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.4%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Tulip at brewery. 

Opaque glowing orange beer with no head to speak of. 

Juicy vitamin C, grapefruit 

Hop oils are layered on a tart vitamin C of a body that somehow still ends up smooth. The finish is only slightly salty, just a hint of the style. 

Matte, a little yeast on the tongue, and dry puckering finish. 

Nice tart little hoppy beer that you might not guess was a Gose.\xa0383 charactersbrewerburgundy, Dec 21, 2017']

name: Rice Plum Gose
review:
['4.18/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Appearance: surprising; the beer pours a cloudy peach-pink with a thin, spritzy head that faded immediately. The color makes me think of a cherry blossom.

Aroma: floral (a spring varietal). The plum makes me think cherry blossoms. The plum is delicate but still present. The sourness is very mild, hardly present.

Flavor: impressive. This is a mellow beer, but is so well layered. Salt first, immediately followed by the tart and coriander, which then transitions to the plum. Weldwerks’ brewers delivered on all of the flavors described on the label, and all of the flavors appear as a separate layer. The plum flavor is so delicate but exhibited so well in the finish. This beer is certainly not fruit forward; the plum flavor is captured so well, however. The plum flavor conjures thoughts of a spring garden and flower blossoms. 

Mouthfeel: light-medium, just a wee tad heavier than I expected or prefer. Very drinkable, though. Gassy-carbonation; soda-like.

Overall: this is a beer that is well executed at every metric. This is one of the best in styles that I’ve tried to date (fruited or otherwise). This is the first Weldwerks fruited beers I’ve tried, but I will readily buy/try any other I encounter. To repeat myself again, damn impressive showcase of the plums.\xa01,284 charactersPray_For_Mojo, Sep 12, 2018']

name: O.G. Wheat
review: ['3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev +16.1%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3 | overall: 3.75You could call this a kindler, gentler sort of Gose. The brewery doesn\'t actually use the "G" word-- they say it\'s a wheat spiced ale (coriander) with German malt and hops, and a sour mash. It\'s not really sour, but it has a pleasant tart edge. It\'s stronger than any Gose I"ve encountered. In fact, it\'s weirdly rich and malty, like a winey Pilsner. \n\nNot very fizzy or foamy. Clear golden color in the Duvel tulip. Meaty and salty. From the 22 oz bottle purchased at the tasting room in Ocean Beach.\xa0501 charactersmactrail, Oct 09, 2016']

name: Goldener Gose
review:
["4.27/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.6%look: 4 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5On tap at the Golden City Brewery. Review from notes.

A: Pours a slightly hazy straw/yellow color. A minimal white head forms, and sticks around as a small cap. Not much lace, but I love the color.
S: Husky wheat, cereal grains. Slightly salty in the nose. Acidic and tart with a great lemony citrus aroma.
T: Follows the nose. Husky wheat stalks, cereal grains. Peppery spice and acidic. Tart and tangy citrus and lemon. Very nice.
M/D: A medium body that is crisp and effervescent. So dry and clean. I can drink this all day. Just an excellent example of a not so common style.

Love it and can't get enough. Such a unique style, and done perfectly. Highly recommended.\xa0672 characterschamp103, Jul 22, 2012", "3.95/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 4On-tap and served in a snifter. Was a cloudy pale golden color. Head was small to average and quickly faded. No noticeable carb streams. Good sliding lace that doesn't stick.

The aroma was citric, spice, malt and a bit of salt. It started out weak but the aromas got stronger as it warmed but even then was a little subdued. The taste was good and again better as it warmed up. Citric and spicy with a touch of salt. Others in my group tasted the salt more than I did. Goes down easy but doesn't have a flavor that begs for several at a time. Mouthfeel was a bit watery and could have used some more carbonation. 

Overall, a good beer and recommend trying especially if you like trying rare styles. Since it was my first Gose, I can't say how it compares to others but if this is representative, I'd try some more of them. Rotation - tap only in Colorado and only every so often. Plan on hitting the brewery during next CO trip though so hopefully have some more then.\xa0970 charactersTexIndy, Mar 03, 2010", "4.23/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.7%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Gose is a light colored wheat beer made with salt and a lactic ferment. My understanding is that this GCB beer was made with an actual sour mash, a very difficult procedure to control and obtain desired results.

Consumed at the brewery in spring 2010. Pours a thin layer of off white head over a cloudy drab golden liquid. Smells lemony, flat wheaty, salty, and sharp acidic.

Tastes bright citric acid. Lemony with ironlike acidity that could go awry, except for the earthy wheat keeping things in balance. Both puckering and mouthwatering at the same time. Has a honey-like or mild perfumey character that worked well with the lemony brightness. Thin body comes across heavier, I think due to salt clinging to the tongue a few moments after swallowing. Lingering acid in the finish. Nice quencher and best Gose I've encountered.\xa0831 charactersmentor, Jan 22, 2010", "4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.9%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3 | overall: 4.5Cloudy pale orange-golden with small spot of head and lace.

Citrusy hop smell with sour/saltiness. Orange and lemon-lime with spicy wheat edge.

Spicy wheat with salty citrus overtones. Pretty mild saltiness comes off more citrusy, but definitely there. Brininess comes right out when swished in the mouth.

Medium-high carbonation prickles the tongue, feels heavier than it looks.

Pretty decent, one of the more drinkable Gose's I've tried.\xa0443 charactersBeerZack, Jan 13, 2009", "4.07/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.2%look: 4 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 4I believe this is replacement for the Die Gosebier. Tapped at Falling Rock for GABF week, this is a bright, hazed light gold brew. Smooth, blotchy head, not very tall, but seems dense. Good lacing. Aroma is filled with citrus, sharp malt and salt, and a touch of spice.
It's a smooth flavor. Citrus and floral yeast blend well with the wheat. A bit of a musky aftertaste. Faint apricot rounds out the palate. A bit fizzy, yet refreshing.\xa0438 charactersMebuzzard, Oct 10, 2007", '4.2/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.9%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Aroma: light malt with hint of citrus from the corriander presumably. no perceivable hop character in nose.
Appearence: Slightly cloudy but still fairly clear for a wheat style. Nice yellow color slightly darker than straw.
Taste: Clean with brisk citrus, close to lemon rind flavor, not overpowering. Salt flavor was not strong, but lended balance to the wheat tartness. Hop bitterness was low, again just enough for balance.
Mouth: Good body, medium to low. Carbonation was typical for european styles. Carries aroma and flavors well but doesn't contribute to "beer bloat"

Overall, very drinkable and quenching. The beer would probably be even better sampled in hotter weather. I wish I could get this beer regularly back home (BOS).\xa0741 characterswarchez, Sep 27, 2007']

name: Steady As She Gose
review:
['3.02/5\xa0\xa0rDev -19.9%look: 3.25 | smell: 3 | taste: 2.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.25Pours a hazy pink lemonade color with a thin fizzy head that disappears immediately.

Nose is lacking, a bit of bright fruity (not cranberry specifically) and sour.

Flavor is muted, watery. Sour notes are there with some pucker but no other discernible flavors. No salinity to speak of.

Feel is fine - a bit light, watery. But smooth and no jagged edges. 

Still, overall this is a bit sour with not much else.\xa0416 charactersoldn00b, Feb 14, 2016', '4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8.5%look: 4.5 | smell: 3 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25Smells pretty bad, but the taste is unbelievable. Salty and delicious. Probably the best Gose I have ever had. If I could name a better one I would. So hold your nose and take a sip. I promise it will be worth it! Cheers!\xa0221 charactersLAND_MINE, Jul 09, 2015']

name: Discovery Mode
review:
["3.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev -16.7%look: 4.5 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3 | feel: 3 | overall: 3Snifter on tap.

A: Pours a chalky, cloudy, creamy colored yellow with a large, soft, and very fluffy looking bright white head that left a solid sheet of rocky lace down the glass.
S: Lightly fruity nose with hints of sweet stone fruits and a mild mineraliness. Coriander is light.
T: Follows the nose with flavors of the base gose, light bready malt, slight herbal coriander and a very light saltiness under shadowed by hoppier notes of tropical fruits and light citrus. Not a hoppy beer by any stretch, but the hops add a nice complexity. The finish is watery and really falls off.
M: Light body, clean mouth, light overall, carbonation is soft but short lived on the palate.
O: For a style that's already really light, I thought this was a bit water. Was expecting more from the dry hop, but what's there is good.\xa0817 charactersscottfrie, Mar 16, 2015"]

name: Rhythmic Convergence
review:
["3.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev -9%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3 | overall: 2.5Can to tulip, why? Because this is not a gose! Period!
The appearance had a dark purple color topped by a finger's worth of pink to white semi-foamy to soft bubbles for a head. This head fell off fairly quick and a spider webb-ed ring of lace slid on through.
The aroma had some sweet to tart sharp blueberry flesh rolling through a sweet side of vinegar and some white wine.
The flavor seemed to be pretty much the same as the aroma pushing and pulling sweet against tart hints while developing some acidic and super light vinous features. Sticky aftertaste of blueberry, sweet white wine and some white grapes.
The mouthfeel was almost medium bodied but seemed to sit just a touch under with a fair sessionability about it. Carbonation felt somewhat low and left a ton of cloying qualities. Finish was sticky blueberries and sweet vinegar, some acidity.
Overall, pretty nice as a fruit beer but whoever was the asshat that thinks this is a gose should probably be laughed right on out of the beer world. Nice try, dumbass!\xa01,024 charactersLone_Freighter, Aug 18, 2019", '3.99/5\xa0\xa0rDev +15.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4A: Pours a deep blue/purple color with 2 fingers of head that fades down to a thin cap that leaves decent lacing

S: Lots of blueberry up front along with some earthy tones and salinity. Quite blueberry forward overall

T: Follows the nose. Starts off with the blueberry and then picks up some salinity and herbal earthy undertones. Finishes with lingering blueberry

M: Medium bodied with moderate carbonation

O: A solid fruited gose that definitely hits hard with the blueberry. Double blueberry without a doubt. Certainly unconventional with the 8% (even labeled as a ‘double’ with both the gose and blueberry), but it works. Burlington likes to be out of the box, and this is no exception\xa0697 charactersBEERMILER12, Aug 11, 2019', '2.56/5\xa0\xa0rDev -26%look: 1 | smell: 2.5 | taste: 2.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 2.5I added this beer as a Fruit and Field Beer yesterday and lo and behold it is now a Leipzig Gose!
16 oz. can.
Rating for Fruit and Field Beer:
4.25/4.0/4.0/4.0/4.0
Moderate pour yields a light pink head over a purple body with some lacing. Nose of blueberries. Taste mirrors nose with a salty finish. Nice feel and overall, if I added this beer as a Leipzig Gose the rating would be lower; much lower, as it is now.
Rating for Leipzig Gose:
1.0/2.5/2.5/4.0/2.5
Cheers!\xa0468 charactersbobv, Jul 28, 2019']

name: Ocean Of Noise
review: ['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8.1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4a gose with yuzu fruit and hawaiian salt, i did not know these guys were making such heady beer. this is tangy and tart in the right places, not overly fruity but distinctly yuzu, clearly not lime o grapefruit or anything, a unique piquant element to yuzu, and its on display here. some hops in the nose too, i think that element is understated but cool, while the salt is high minerality and about as far as it can be pushed, yet somehow the overall vibe of this is mellow, which i think is its real success. seems like these guys have really turned a corner, cool ingredients, well dosed, well thought out, and well executed. a couple of years ago i would not have thought them capable of a beer like this, either in recipe or quality, and there is a lot to be said for a brewery who can evolve like this. i am very impressed. the right amount of sour, the right amount of wheaty body, and quite well carbonated, its very easy drinking stuff. one of the better beers these guys have ever made if i dare say so...\xa01,014 charactersStonedTrippin, Apr 29, 2017']

name: The Guava Otter
review:
['4.14/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.3%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Beautifully tart and fruity. Very refreshing. A Gose with multiple fruits, salt and lime especially. Cloudy and light bodied. Thin head. Drink to be refreshed on a warm day. Or at the pool or beach.\xa0198 charactersopieo, Jul 20, 2019', "4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.6%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4L: Had this on-tap at Growlers to Go - Short Pump, poured into a pint glass. Had pale yellow color and an extremely cloudy consistency. There was a thin, foamy head that quickly dissipated. Not a whole lot of lacing to speak of.

S: A very nice aroma of tropical fruit, malt, citrus fruit, and yeast.

T: Tasted of a small amount of yeast (not a huge component), a light dusting of salt (a fleeting presence), lots of tropical fruit (guava, of course), light malt, and some citrus fruit (orange). A light and effervescent flavor. It's not as overwhelmingly sour as some goses, but definitely has some there. An interesting flavor.

F: A fair amount of carbonation with a creamy finish. Light-bodied.

O: This is a solid, easy to drink beer. Worth a try.\xa0753 charactersavalon07, Jun 21, 2019", '3.92/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.6%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4A-Pours a light hazy golden color with a slight head and lacing
A-Aroma has generous Guava hints
T-The taste follows the nose witha strong Guava flavor
M-A medium bodied decently carbonated beer
O-A good Gose\xa0208 charactersVABA, May 19, 2019', '3.65/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.4%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Poured from a 16 oz can dated 4/30/19 into a willi becher pint glass.
L - Pours a hazy orange color with a white head that dissipates quickly.
S - Smells tart and lightly fruity.
T - Starts out tart, followed by some sweet fruitnyness.
F - Medium body and carbonation.
O - Pretty nice fruity Gose. I would have liked it better if it was a little more tart.\xa0356 charactersGriffin2, May 11, 2019']

name: Tefnut - Apricot And Passion Fruit
review:
['4.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.2%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5L: Had this beer on-tap at Growlers to Go - Short Pump, poured into a snifter glass. Had an orange color and a thick, viscous consistency. There was a half inch of foamy, somewhat long-lasting head. Very good lacing.

S: A fantastic aroma of tropical fruit, apricots, malt, and citrus fruit.

T: Tasted of a nice heap of apricots (a big component here), a light malt presence (mostly in the finish; very faint), a whole bunch of tropical fruit (passion fruit), and a bit of citrus fruit (orange, lemon). A zesty, fruity, and lively flavor. In spite of the high ABV%, the booze is barely noticeable. Quite delicious.

F: A good amount of carbonation with a smooth and creamy finish. Medium-bodied.

O: A well-constructed, easy to drink gose. Drinkable.\xa0751 charactersavalon07, Aug 31, 2019']

name: Black Cherry Gose
review:
["4.24/5\xa0\xa0rDev +11%look: 5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25It broke my heart they didn't have crowlers of this at the brewery on my visit.

This brew was on point in every way. Dark burgundy color like a wine, but with a steady carbonation. Smells and flavor were bursting with black cherry, very reminiscent of the black cherry sodas I recall from my youth. It did almost feel artificial, but that didn't stop me from enjoying the hell out of it. Add to this that there was a plentiful salt presence and moderate tartness and the overall product was just tasty.\xa0505 charactersONovoMexicano, Jul 08, 2016", '3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75i liked this one better than others in our group, served from the crowler, fresh and unique. its a deeply dark red brew, still creamy and soft looking, hazy, but intense on the color. it smells like medicine a little bit, but absolutely black cherry, no doubt about it, a little artificial to me in the nose, like a black cherry soda or something, and they arent shy with it here. the flavor is more genuine but sill a little suspicious, syrupy or something, but they have gotten the acidity exactly right, lemony lacto to cut through some of the cherry, ends up more balanced than it starts off being. i like the flavor, even if it does taste like a kids drink. very little salt here, seems more like a berliner than a gose, and i dont taste much of the wheat malt, perhaps a tad over flavored, but it tastes good and i like the plush fuller feel to this, so often these are all thin and sharp, but this is more mellow and hearty than that, and its needed with this much flavor. ive been impressed with these guys overall lately, the hype seems largely warranted...\xa01,066 charactersStonedTrippin, Jul 07, 2016', "3.73/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.4%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75On tap at the brewery to a tulip glass. Reviewed from notes dated June 1, 2016. 

A-The beer is slightly murky and dark-cherry purple-ish red. No head on my pour; just a white collar. A few bubbles make their way up the glass.

S-The aroma opens with a bit of lactic funk. It is mildly tart with a salty pull on the back of my glands. Fruit is lurking mostly in the background, but a little cherry creeps in as the beer warms up. 

T-The taste is pretty tart with a nice black cherry flavor. It is simple and on the dry side thanks to the salt (especially on the finish). The beer opens with more fruit and salty sour power as it warms up. There is a touch of grainy malt flavor too.

M-For a gose, this beer is pretty substantial on my palate. Carbonation is fine and prickly.

O-A good, but ho-hum fruited gose. There isn't really enough fruit flavor or sour power to slot this beer into the new-school gose (like Anderson Valley), but it has more fruit and salt than a true German style. It isn't a bad beer, but it is a mut that doesn't really fall into any camp.\xa01,067 charactersspoony, Jul 01, 2016", "3.56/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5Black cherry warhead color. Cough drop meets cheery pie. Nose is a bit acetic. Not enough sweetness left here to overpower the tartness and tanins. Flavor improves as it warms, but I can't escape the cough syrup comparisons. Medium body and drinkable, but I'll probably pass on the next pour. There are significantly better goses to be had, even down the street at Wiley Roots.\xa0377 charactersTychoNDC, Jun 25, 2016"]

name: Nobody Puts Baby In The Corner
review:
["3.54/5\xa0\xa0rDev -10.6%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5Served on tap into a goblet at the Sand City Brewery.
A: Pours a cloudy, bright yellow color with an orange or more brown caste, a brief, less than one finger, white head, no retention, or evidence of any real lacing.
S: Very tangy almost to the point of sharp at first whiff. Fruity aromas, mango and melon seem to predominate.
T: Dry. Sourness was so out front, I thought this was a sour sight unseen. Then on second taste, the sourness is virtually gone and resembles a more conventional gose, with the flavors of melon, mango, and lime, as well as a healthy dose of sea saltiness dominating the palate. Bitterness fairly low and in the background.
M: Medium bodied with medium carbonation.
O: An oddly crafted gose. A bit at the edge of the style, but that didn't add. Generally enjoy the style, this one, not so much.\xa0828 charactersVoxRationis, Feb 17, 2019", '3.92/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 4I’m a huge sand city fan boy but their gose game hasn’t improved much. This beer uses twice the amount of fruit as the enough already series which to my untrained palate only means that this brew tastes more like a fruit purée. I prefer more saltiness/pucker-worthiness to my goses but your mileage may vary. A rare miss from this world class IPA factory.\xa0363 charactersalexsergio, Feb 02, 2019']

review: ['4.56/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.8%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.7512 oz from brewpub. Nice cloudy yellow appearance. Not much smell. Tastes semi tart with guava the dominate taste. Mango creeps in. Not to salty but just the right tartness. Very easy drinker and well ballenced. Wish they bottled this\xa0236 charactersKensWorld, Mar 13, 2016']

name: Stone Gose
review: ['4.24/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.7%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25this is money, i love a gose that actually has a yeast complexion, and this isnt just any fermentation profile, its a wild profile, and from these guys at that! no more generic kettle soured salted wheat for me with this thing in existence! its pale and a little cloudy, fizzy headed and active looking, real light looking, and smells like ripe stone fruit, as the name suggests, the nectarine and peach both drip from this, seem obvious, and make my mouth water insanely. the salt gives this thing a green olive character too, which i would never think would be a desirable feature in a beer like this, but it is, pure brine, dirty martini, its bizarre and awesome, and it somehow loves the funky mature brett in here and the fruit. slices of yellow peach, skin and pit and all, and naked nectarine, also ripe, the flavor here is crazy. in so few beers can you, in equal parts, appreciate the fruit in the beer, the complexity of the yeast (and here its more brett than bacterial but fully wild and de garde), and the curious other elements and nuances, here green olive, sea salt, toasted bread crusts, raw wheat, minerals, and lemony acidity. disparate parts come together here in a way they so rarely do. huge thanks to a new friend of mine for sharing this, peaches pop the finish right off, and in the end its another de garde beer that stands out from the crowd and is memorably great. wow! so much more than a gose...\xa01,425 charactersStonedTrippin, Oct 19, 2019', '4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Poured from fridge temp into a tulip. Pours a nice light orange with white head. Nose is funk, salt, peach, oak, grass, and a bit of spice. Taste is fairly subtle. Not what I was expecting from a de Garde beer. Not over sour, but not overly sweet. Coriander, orange, peach, oak, vanilla, and a bit of pine (although very subtle). The beer nicely coats the mouth and the taste lingers for quite a while. Dry. Overall, a really nice beer.\xa0436 charactersBeersnake1, Oct 05, 2019']

name: Undertow
review: ['3.65/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.9%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75Picked up today on one of the first days of hot weather. Solid pour but little head. Nose is salt and citrus fruitiness. More or less what is expected. \n\nA little schizophrenic with berry flavors in the front and salty vegetation providing the finish. Not much for balance, but a workable example of the style. A bit of a pucker, but satisfying.\xa0349 charactersdaliandragon, May 21, 2018']

name: Galloping Gose
review:
["4.97/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9%look: 4.5 | smell: 5 | taste: 5 | feel: 5 | overall: 5This beer is like nothing we have tasted anywhere. It's very easy to drink. We have tried all of them we can find on tap while visiting Wilmington and every one of them had some similarities, yet the fruits really come out in color, aroma, and flavor.\xa0251 charactersKev-a-Beer, Feb 25, 2019", '4.94/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8.3%look: 5 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 5 | feel: 5 | overall: 5So sad we have to leave today. Love this town and this brewery.
Appearance: Beautiful - purple
Aroma: Sour and fruity
Taste: Wow! Super interesting and delicious
Mouthfeel: High carbonation and light\xa0199 charactersCaliBeerBear, Mar 29, 2018', "4.67/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.4%look: 4.75 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.75Quick: Black Currant/Plum Galloping Gose. Very pink with pink head. Slightly cloudy. Heavy Lacto nose with dark fruit. You can get the tartness just by smelling it, but not in a sour candy way. Complex super tart flavor. Totally hits you in the back of the mouth. It's a palate wrecker. Fantastic mouthfeel. It's a shock at first but I could drink three of these.\xa0373 charactersILMbeer, Mar 18, 2018", '4.84/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.1%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 5 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.75Excellent example of the style.
Aroma: Acidic fruity smell. Prepares for the upcoming flavor.
Taste: Slightly tart with some salty backbone. Fruit presence not overwhelming.
Appearance: Lite amber
Overall: Very good\xa0215 charactersTim5085, Dec 09, 2017', '4.24/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Appearance: Arrives hazy and amber colored; the modest head quickly faded to ringlet leaving a few spots 

Smell: Lactic and salty with a lemony tone

Taste: Lactic and lemon forward with the salty tone developing after the swallow; the finish is decidedly tart

Mouthfeel: Light to medium body with moderate carbonation 

Overall: Pretty darn well done; hits the style\xa0374 charactersbrentk56, Sep 03, 2017']

name: Gose
review:
['4.01/5\xa0\xa0rDev +10.8%look: 4.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.5From notes when I had it on tap a couple of months ago.

A - Hazy golden yellow with an egg shell white head. Head is about 2 fingers thick and has excellent retention. Very active carbonation.

S - Strong yeasty esters with hints of bananas and a touch of musty old socks. A touch off-putting but as you get used to it it becomes a rather inviting aroma. Spent wheat comes through a bit as the beer warms.

T - A touch of citrus fruits, especially lemon. Wheat malt comes through as the primary backbone throughout and there is just a touch of sourness underneath. Saltiness comes through in the finish with a mineral water like taste.

M/D - Crisp carbonation and a touch dry. Very easy drinking and certainly refreshing.\xa0723 charactersckeegan04, Oct 27, 2010', '3.68/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.7%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4This beer is now called Sunshade Gose.

The beer pours a hazy yellow color with a white head. The aroma is coriander, wheat and citrus. The beer smells a lot like a traditional Belgian white with a little bit of funk. The flavor is more of the same with a lot of orange and lemon plus the addition of salt. The beer is pretty good overall and is very drinkable. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.\xa0402 charactersMora2000, Jul 20, 2010', "3.73/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4On-tap at the Draught House in Austin. My first Gose!

Pours with a dusty goldenrod color, hazed by yeast and wheat malt. Lots of carbonation trails on the rise to supply a thin tuft of creamy eggshell-white head. Smell is a funky and musty, like homebrewed hefeweizen yeast in mid-fermentation. Wheat malt and lemon zest in the background with a briny, salty edge. 

The salt doesn't stand out too strongly in the flavor; rather, it nicely complements the refreshing nature of the wheat and pale malts. A bit of citrus fruit and mineral water mid-sip, while the finish is tangy with a kiss of salt. Mouthfeel is bubbly and light on the palate--perfect carbonation level and consistency for a hot July day in Texas. Definitely a drinkable, interesting beer. And so it Gose. Verdict: recommended.\xa0795 characterswagenvolks, Jul 14, 2010", "3.82/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.5%look: 3 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Gose? Real gose? With actual salt? Absolutely! A finger's worth of bone white head with great retention. Color was a hazy golden-yellow. Nose had a mild banana overtone. Mouthfeel was medium with a muted banana taste in the mouth. Finish was dry, slightly salty, but nothing having to do with bananas. Wow!\xa0306 characterswoodychandler, Dec 21, 2009", '2.7/5\xa0\xa0rDev -25.4%look: 3 | smell: 3 | taste: 2.5 | feel: 2 | overall: 3Light yellow cloudy pour. Smell was very witbier like to me, as was the flavor. Kind of creamy mouthfeel, with no noticeable salt, although I understand it is brewed with it. Good if you like hefeweizens or wits, but just not my preferred style, and very similar to them.\xa0271 charactersJDV, Feb 22, 2008']

name: Gose
review:
["2.88/5\xa0\xa0rDev -19.3%look: 3 | smell: 2.5 | taste: 3 | feel: 3 | overall: 316.9oz bottle packaged 9/13/17 poured into a stange
A: Cloudy yellow with no head
S: Generic wheat/spice/sour with a bit of funk that doesn't fit
T: Wheat/coriander/light sour/salt notes
M: Light bodied with a light sourness
O: Nothing wrong with it but nothing stands out. Plain/average overall\xa0295 charactersONUMello, Oct 18, 2017", "3.26/5\xa0\xa0rDev -8.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.5Poured from a 500ml bottle with a Sept 12, 2017 stamp. 

It's a foggy, dull, straw color with a bright white cap that recedes quickly and leaves a thin film on top. 

It smells like pear, lemon, salt water, and flowers. I really get a lot of rose petals from it. It is fairly acidic too. 

It has a very tart, sour, citrus bite with some pear/apple and floral flavor. I do notice some coriander spice, and the salt is pretty prominent and very nice. It finishes clean. Lingering sourness with a bit of coriander. 

It is crisp and lively bodied, but smoothed out a bit by the soft salts. 

This is a really good tasting beer, but I don't think it is what I would call a Gose based on what I have had from Germany and a few of the better onesin the US. Maybe a super Americanized Gose. This one is lacking a bit in wheat, and has some flavors that aren't typical. Call it a Saison or maybe a Berliner Weiss and I would score it higher. A good beer. Just not a good Gose for me.\xa0976 charactersWesMantooth, Sep 20, 2017"]

name: Gose
review:
["3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.6%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 4I had this on-tap in a pint glass at Special Brews in Lynnwood, WA.

Appearance: medium golden hue with a bit of haze and a thin layer of white foam. A pretty convincing gose.

Smell: light, wheaty aroma. Smells like a low-intensity European hefeweizen; good, but the volume could be turned up a little.

Taste: quite tart right up front; kind of reminds me of gooseberries. This is followed by a light wheatiness which works well; saltiness is present although pretty low. I like it quite a bit, although a little more banana-and-clove hefeweizen flavor would be nice.

Mouthfeel: medium body with a good level of carbonation and a satisfyingly creamy mouthfeel; it's a nice juxtaposition to the tartness.

Overall: a refreshing and very drinkable beer. Goses usually go down pretty well with me; although I'd like a little more banana in this bad boy, I'm quite satisfied.\xa0874 charactersflagmantho, Feb 12, 2014"]

name: Awesome Blossom
review:
['4.36/5\xa0\xa0rDev +15.6%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25Thanks goes out to TheManiacalOne for this brew.

16 oz. Can

Poured into a tulip a hazy golden pale yellow color, very nice carbonation, with a very nice quick/foamy one-finger white head, which also leaves minimal sticky lacing behind. The nose is malty, yeasty, with some cherry blossoms, rice, tart, citrusy. The taste is very nice, malty, yeasty, tart, with some cherry blossoms, and rice. Medium body, ABV hidden very well, with a very nice dry/bitter finish. Overall, this one surprised me very tasty brew. Glad I got a chance to try this. Thanks Mark!\xa0559 charactersWasatch, Jul 21, 2017', '4.01/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.4%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Poured from a 16oz can into a tulip glass.

A: The beer is a light gold color with a thin white head that fades very quickly and leaves a very thin lace on the glass.

S: The aroma contains cherries, wheat, rice and light caramelized malts.

T: The taste starts out with some tart flavors of cherries and citrus. Then a mild breadiness comes in from wheat, rice and a thin malt character followed by a bit of Gose-like saltiness. There is a very good balance for the style. The after-taste is slightly tart.

M: Smooth and very crisp, light-to-medium body, medium carbonation, finish is dry and clean.

O: Tasty, goes down easily, not filling at all, very mild kick, very good representation of style, this is a solid sour beer to drink for a while if you’re in the mood for the style.\xa0787 charactersTheManiacalOne, Jun 20, 2017', "4.35/5\xa0\xa0rDev +15.4%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.2516oz. can served in a Spiegelau ale glass. Canned 6/14/17. Pours a lovely pale yellow with a slight haze and a fluffy, 1.5 inch bright white head. Copious tiny bubbles are present effervescing in-solution and adhering to the walls of the glass. Nose is delicate and bright - notes of brine, citrus and cherries. Taste is quite pleasant - consistent with nose; however, the rice comes out forming the backbone and leaving a residual sweetness. Citrus and cherries are present, yet not as assertive as in the nose. Finishes with a light medicinal quality reminiscent of cherry Sucrets. Mouthfeel is light in body with a lively carbonation and a mild acidity. Overall, drinkable and refreshing. An excellent example of the style and perhaps the best Gose I've had to date. Hope to see this added as a summer staple.\xa0822 charactersJwale73, Jun 19, 2017"]

name: Super Journey
review:
["4.42/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25Look: Pours a pinkish, peach color with a quarter finger, satin white head of rocky foam. Lots of chunky yeast floaters in the glass, not that I mind. No lacing.

Aroma: Funnily enough turmeric and mace. Like pepper almost. Chili powder. Cumin. Cilantro. . . some sour dough bread and yes, lime.

Taste: Unique and lovely. Really bright, follows the nose. Lots of very clean, floral spice. Rose hip, slightly salty and briny. Turmeric, basil, tarragon, sage, clove and soapy cilantro. . . it's mild and supple, almost velvety. Potpourri like. Spicy floral which develops into tart/dry grapefruit. Only on the aftertaste do the very supple, tart notes of lime zest and semisweet cherry emerge giving the beer a little bit of sweet/sour contrast to the initially dry, herbal flavors.

Feel: Light and refreshing. Low carb, light body.

Overall: Like nothing I've tried before. To me it tastes almost like a scotch gruit or herbed ale with a gose twist. Very interesting and experimental. This is how you do a gose with lime right. It shouldn't overpower the beer with citrus - instead it should provide a supple backdrop upon which the traditional beer flavors can express themselves, like it does here.\xa01,203 charactersBloodSoakedAleMug, Jul 14, 2019", '4.21/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.4%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25A: The beer is very hazy reddish pink in color. It poured with a quarter finger high white head that left a collar around the edge of the glass and lots of wisps of bubbles on the surface.
S: Moderate aromas of limes are present in the nose along with hints of cherries.
T: The taste follows the smell and has lots of flavors of sour limes along with strong notes of saltiness dashes of the juice from a jar of Maraschino cherries.
M: It feels light- to medium-bodied and tart on the palate with a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: This beer can definitely be classified as a gose with its sourness and saltiness, but I found this to be much more complex compared to other beers in the style given the variety of flavors. I really liked the interplay between the cherries and limes in the taste, which provided an interesting contrast in flavors.

Serving type: bottle\xa0870 charactersmetter98, May 02, 2019', "4.38/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25Picked this up recently at Grimm, intrigued by how different it came across as. Sure enough, this wasn't like anything that I've had before in terms of the look or taste as this beer drew me in from the first sip and was a great choice for the burgeoning spring season!

Loved the pink grapefruit hue to this liquid as it surprised me during the pour. The haze in it even look like pulp as the salmon head came across like whipped jello. Not a lot of lacing left behind as there were just a few scattered, soapy sections in the middle of my pint glass. Tons of wood, star fruit, and cherries in the mix as this was quite light and tart on the nose. The taste was wonderfully slick and easy to enjoy without a lot of salt or odd flavors; even from the foeder fermentation. A lot of the salt settled to the bottom but even with that in mind, this was like a nice spring day minus the wind!

It didn't even seem that there was any booze in this as I could have easily had another bottle after finishing this off. A floral undertone like hibiscus or lavender took hold once I finished this off as the tartness was just at the right level. Lovely stuff that was truly super!\xa01,169 charactersJerzDevl2000, Apr 25, 2019"]

name: Lulu Gose
review:
['4.05/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Pours slightly hazy, orange gold in color with 1/4 inch head. Taste is big peach, pear, apricot, and sour mix. Light bodied, slightly sour, with moderate carbonation. Missing the saltiness I associate with the style. Still makes for a really enjoyable sour. Better as it warms. Will get this again.\xa0303 characterstigg924, Jul 18, 2019', '3.91/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3%look: 3 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4.25As the first review, I usually research the brewery. But I could not find the "English" translation button on its website (which still is being built.) And Polish to me is impenetrable. So sorry that all you get is a beer review.

While Lulu is not a prize-winner, it is most refreshing on a hot summer day... and peachy in Smell and Taste. While Lulu as a beer does not Look like much (even for a gose), its label is arty and intriguing from a country that seems to be quite serious. So perhaps, the micro-brew revolution getting a foothold there also.

While Lulu does not have the classic gose dryness and tartness, its peachiness makes it interesting.
Would I be a repeat customer?
Possibly. Binny's (where I do half of my beer shopping) specializes in Polish beers (because only Warsaw has more Poles than Chicago, so the joke goes.) But the next time I'm at Binny's, I just may wander by to that section and look for the arty labels.\xa0942 charactersBeginner2, Jul 11, 2018']

name: Apricot Gose
review: ['4.23/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.5%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5A little salty on the back of the tounge, this gose is very apricot foward, but not unpleasant at all. A great refreshing beer that has a lingering sweet flavor as well as sour. I really appreciate it for what it is.\xa0216 charactersupsmann, Nov 28, 2016']

name: Mango Salt on the Rim
review:
['3.92/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.4%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75L - 2-finger popcorn butter head recedes rapidly, leaving behind a neon orange body.

S - mango, sweet orange, salt.

T - follows the nose. Lots of mango with a heaping portion of salt. No bitterness. Low sweetness. No booziness.

F - light body with appropriate carb.

O - looks and smells otherworldy. As in, something not produced on Earth. The mango taste is pleasant, although a little one-dimensional. I could see Moon inhabitants going gaga over this.\xa0459 charactersCanConPhilly, Jun 25, 2019', '4.06/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.1%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 4.25Appearance is deep bright orange with minimal head. Head has an orange tint to it. Aroma is Mango, big salt, some lime
Taste is Sweet mango up front, salt, lime, tartness on the back but not puckering
Fuller than medium mouthfeel, seems like purée fruit in this joker. Overall I really like this, they nailed the margarita taste. Amazing for summer drinking.\xa0359 charactersJimmy_Kneecaps, May 26, 2019', "3.78/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Poured into a snifter. A bright, turbid yellow-gold color, could be mistaken for orange juice, with a small white head. The aroma was fresh-squeezed lime with lemons and mango juice, but the lime dominated. Same on the palate. It's personal preference, but the lime and mango seemed at odds with each other. Otherwise the beer was very well crafted with a nice tartness and a nice amount of salinity.\xa0400 charactersBuck89, May 10, 2019"]

O-A good Gose\xa0229 charactersVABA, Jun 01, 2019']

name: Tiki Tack
review:
["4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Poured from 16.9oz bottle into glass. No dating information found.
Pale gold colored body, with a cloudy appearance. Slight fizzy head quickly goes away, leaving a spotty ring fed by rising bubbles. No lacing.
Fruity aromas - lemon, passion fruit and guava. 
Fruit dominated taste, with the passion fruit providing both tartness and sweetness, while the guava is more smooth and sweet. Slight lemon underlay. Has a briny, mineral aspect also. The wheat can be tasted and provides some sharpness. A little dry at the end.
Medium, carbonated mouth feel. Both the tartness and the salt rake the teeth.
Enjoyment level will depend upon affinity for passion fruit and guava. It's a solid Gose with the fruits being prominent players. Especially good and refreshing for hot weather drinking.\xa0785 charactersMonDak_Joe1953, Aug 27, 2018", '4.04/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4a very bright and flavorful gose brewed with passion fruit and guava. really sunny in the glass with a gentle haze over it and a frothy churning white bubbly head with nice retention and lace, looks rich for the style and the abv, and i like that! the aroma is more fruity than sour, with a lot of the immediately perceived tang coming from the passion fruit, natural and bold, with some of the clean lactic acid in behind. the smell of guava is there too, fleshy and tropical and floral and sweet. the flavor has a nice balance between the two fruits, and there is a lot of fruit here, but just as importantly, i can taste the wheat malt too, its still a beer despite being so fruity and delicate, the dry cereal grain is a welcome onset here in the middle of this. the bacterial sourness is moderate in intensity but awesomely clean, with a rustic saison element in here too, maybe multiple yeasts at work. esters of pear and southern hemisphere white wine come in, more sweet and tart passion fruit, and expressive dancing carbonation to wash it all down. minerals and brine there with some lemony acid at the end, but dry for sure. delicious and well made beer here. i have really been stoked on the green bench sour and wild stuff lately. this is well ahead of the curve for the style, and has a fantastic mouthfeel. florida summer in the midst of the colorado winter! loving it.\xa01,384 charactersStonedTrippin, Jan 23, 2018', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4500 ml bottle into tulip glass, no bottle dating. Pours lightly hazy pale golden yellow color with a 2 finger dense white head with solid retention, that reduces to a thin spotty lace cap that lingers. Minimal spotty lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big juicy and fairly tart/tangy guava, passionfruit, fruit skin, lemon, lime, pineapple, melon, berry, red/green apple, pear, white grape, sea salt, wheat, cracker, bread, light lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/acidic yeast, passionfruit, guava, and moderate pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big juicy and fairly tart/tangy guava, passionfruit, fruit skin, lemon, lime, pineapple, melon, berry, red/green apple, pear, white grape, sea salt, wheat, cracker, bread, light lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness and fruit tang on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/tangy guava, passionfruit, fruit skin, lemon, lime, pineapple, melon, berry, red/green apple, pear, white grape, sea salt, wheat, cracker, bread, light lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Great complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, passionfruit, guava, and moderate pale malt flavors; with an awesome malt/tartness and tangy fruit balance; with zero puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Light-moderate increasing dryness from tartness and tangy fruit. Medium carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately bready/grainy/acidic/tangy/tannic, and slightly saline balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4%. Overall this is an excellent fruited Gose! All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, passionfruit, guava, and moderate pale malt flavors; very smooth and refreshing to drink with the modestly lactic/tangy/tannic/drying finish. Perfectly balanced Lacto/Brett complexity with passionfruit/guava, and a nice malt backbone. Very flavorful and never watery feeling for the ABV. Not as much salty notes as I expected, but solid. A very enjoyable offering, and great style example.\xa02,191 characterssuperspak, Jan 13, 2018']

name: La Vida Gose #3 (Peach & Passionfruit)
review:
['3.96/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.9%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Appearance - Pours deep burnt orange with thin white head that dissipates to a thin film not much lacing.

Taste - Wow taste follows mostly peach but the passionfruit is there along with a great lemon tart bite. There is an initial tart salty hit followed by a syrupy sweetness.

Feel - Medium bodied slightly syrupy finish that is also a little dry. 

Overall - Really tasty tropical gose, little thick but the nose and flavors are solid.\xa0567 charactersDragginballs76, Apr 11, 2018']
