name: Rain
review: ['3.77/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75this is really close to being incredible, a full flavored gose with blueberries and currants. its purple and bright from the tap at the brewery, but almost still looking after the initial pour. the color is wild, like a highlighter, almost unnatural. the nose is nice, tangy from the currants and a little pie-like from the blueberries, minerals from the salt but not obviously salty per se, and a fairly clean but one dimensional lacto sourness, mouthwatering though and nice for spring. the flavor is right on line with the smell, the fruit is less intense than it looks like it should be but both are there and the contribution each lends is quite obvious, very cool and quite professionally done there. the sourness is tired to me, boring and what everyone does, that classic kettle quick sourness, almost all the way clean, lemony and tart without being harsh, its not amazing but its right for this beer. the salt adds more body than brine character, but it also serves to enhance the fruit which is cool here. smooth going down, not a ton of bubbles, not too sour to drink a good amount of it, and a great combination of the currants and blueberries. a red wine barrel and some brett would be fun for this one...\xa01,219 charactersStonedTrippin, Apr 30, 2018']

name: Ghost Of Rita
review:
["4.61/5\xa0\xa0rDev +19.4%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.75One of my favorite beers!! Can't wait for this to come around again. I'm a huge fan of sours and goses and this one is in the top faves. I love me a good salty lime beer but the thing that makes this beer stand out among others is it's unique smokey flavor. Brings me back to one of my favorite places sitting around the campfire :)\xa0332 charactersHandMeAnother, Oct 11, 2019", "4.02/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.1%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25This beer is hazy, light honey amber-to-golden straw with a loose, foamy while head that quickly reaches half an inch before dropping to obscurity. Occasional rapidly ascending large bubbles of carbonation add interest within a Stiegl stange.

The aroma opens with coriander before becoming rubbery with faint honey and sea breeze brine in the background. Rubber yields to dirty socks as it warms.

The flavor begins with coriander and light salt with a touch of bitterness. Lemon pith and some celery overshadow mild sourness. Light acidity helps to balance the bitter and sweet flavors while cereal comes out late, just as a mild lingering finish begins. The finish is punctuated by lemon.

The light body is no match for vigorous effervescence, producing a rough satin texture. Alcohol is absent in this exceptionally dry beer.

This was a nice Gose from a brewer I didn't expect would brew this style. I enjoyed it on a cold, lazy, snowy, early December Sunday.\xa0965 charactersSLeffler27, Jul 25, 2017"]

name: Indian Summer
review:
['4.02/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4L -- Moderately hazed golden orange body with two fingers of rocky white head produced with moderate pour. Some retention and minimal lacing. Lots of visible effervescence. Looks quite refreshing

Smells and tastes very tangy and tart. Light elements of salt and watermelon. More watermelon rind than flesh as it did not taste very sweet. Finishes dry. Light bodied. Lingering tartness. A part of a flight.\xa0234 charactersVelvetExtract, Sep 16, 2016', "4.2/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5%Earth eagle makes herbal, joyful beer. I liked the gose and thought it was one of the best I have had. Made with wood chips soaked in tequila. I am not crazy about tequila but the there was a sweet fruity something to this beer. The tewuilla was soft on the palate and id not have that sour taste that I don't like about tequilla. A light malt, light soft salt that was mineral fresh , dry and bright. Floral. Very different from the in your face sour goses.\xa0460 charactersutopiajane, Oct 24, 2014"]

name: Perma-Grin
review: ['3.88/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.3%look: 3 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Perma-Grin pours a hazy yellow color, with not much head. Big citrus and tropical fruit aroma, and coconut. Flavor is similar to a pina colada, lots of creamy and tropical fruit flavors, and finishes with a strong coconut flavor. Good body and feel. Overall, a creamy tropical beer.\xa0286 charactersvette2006c5r, Sep 03, 2018']

name: Brightberry
review:
['3.55/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.4%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75a gose with raspberry and lime. it seems like nobody can get let a gose be a gose anymore, which i think is a shame, as the base beer seems to all the time be obscured by the additives to the point that its almost unrecognizable as a gose, just a little salt and a little lactic tang on a bland and covered up wheat body, nothing to it. this isnt as guilty as most, but its on that track, where the added flavors are a lot more powerful in the mix than the natural beer ones. fortunately, the beer is pretty good, summery and drinkable, and the synergy between the raspberry and lime is nice, without it totally running away in the flavor. there is some citrus flavor to the souring profile that works well with the lime, usually i get lemon from it but here i get lime too, nice. the pink hue is more intense than the raspberry actually tastes, and to me its almost a generic berry, raspberry sure, but could also have some others in the mix. enough wheat to still feel like a beer which is important, but maybe less carbonation than these summery outdoorsy flavors want. the sourness is clean, the residual sugar is thankfully lower than most, but the salt element is missing a little bit for me. overall this seems to be riffing on a trend, which is fine, but i miss a basic gose, they are harder and harder to find now, especially from american breweries. the beer underneath the fruit seems promising too...\xa01,412 charactersStonedTrippin, Jun 14, 2019', '3.78/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75From a can to a tulip. Best by 3/28/2019.
Pours a hazy reddish-peach grapefruit meat color. The head is a thick, two-finger white with a hint of pink. Good retention and nice lacing. 

Aroma is bright and noticeably Gose. The raspberry and lime are strong and sweet smelling but there is also a bit of coriander. Sourness comes through moderately. Noticeable salt. Very pleasant overall. 
Taste is tart and fruity. Lime juice up front with a sweet raspberry finish. Medium lactic sourness. Light malt flavor. Restrained saltiness is nicely balanced. Coriander spice provides a lemony note. Hop bitterness is low to none. No detectable alcohol. 
Mouthfeel has a medium-light body, high carbonation, and a refreshing almost watery finish. 
Overall, a very good Gose. I don’t know why Ninkasi doesn’t call it a Gose because it so obviously is. Maybe for marketing reasons, but why not give credit to the style? My only negative about this beer is it is a little too sweet. But that could just be me.\xa01,003 charactersMyros, Jan 28, 2019']

It could have been really nice but there is definitely some big fermentation problems in this one.105 charactersBruno74200, Sep 17, 2019', '3.49/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.9%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.5jroof1, Aug 20, 2019', '4.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +21.3%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5igl, Jun 12, 2019', '3.96/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.7%look: 5 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Oleg85, Jun 09, 2019', '4.24/5\xa0\xa0rDev +14.3%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.2519.5%\nRaspberry, cherry, lime gose.35 charactersDentist666, Apr 01, 2019']

name: Harmonic Convergence

name: Enough Already - Cranberry
review:
['4.17/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25On tap at Sand City in Northport.

Pours like Ocean Spray, clear red with soft, pink foam.

Smell is tart and slightly salty with notes of cranberries and lime.

Taste is mildly tart, with low acidity. Notes of cranberries, lime and a hint of salinity nd just a smidge of bitterness. Very crisp and refreshing.

Mouthfeel is thin to medium, with spritzy carbonation.

Overall, a very nice, mild sour, great for refreshing the palate.\xa0433 charactersJamFuel, Dec 18, 2018', '3.94/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Oddly enough it looks like cranberry juice with a quarter inch pink head that leaves little lacing. Rather mild on the nose, once again cranberry juice with a bit of sea salt.Tastes of cranberry, wheat, sea salt and some spice. Very mild bitterness and tartness, light bodied, softly carbonated.\xa0295 charactersEMH73, Dec 05, 2018']

name: Salt Of The Dog
review: ['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.9%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4an active and fresh fruited gose here, saltier than most, which i appreciate. i like how bold this is there, and also how forward the grapefruit is, it stays summery and fairly drinkable, but has a lot more depth than many of these do. very active from the can, i like the tart and bitter grapefruit hitting my nostrils through the tall white head. it smells intense, lots of minerals, clean lactic pucker, and quite a bit of white wheat. its simple, but its also well layered in the flavor, with the grapefruit almost so strong that it takes over the other elements, but it fades fast at the end, flashy and almost sour for a moment before it turns pithy and zesty and bitter, very fresh and natural to me. the salt brings out its best, like actually salting the fresh slices fruit, yum! good job on the sourness too, better here than i recall it being in other weldwerks beers like this. carbonation is high and keeps this feeling summery, light medium body is just right for the flavors, and this is a sour beer i could have plenty of in a given session. nicely done.\xa01,070 charactersStonedTrippin, Aug 04, 2018']

name: Gose'N'Berry
review: ['4.21/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.5%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Poured a clear, reddish orange color with a small, one-finger head of foam. It smelled of raspberry jam, salt and caramel. Nice sweet and sour notes from the raspberry. Good salty bite.\xa0185 characterszeff80, Jun 26, 2017', '4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25this was one of the beer surprises of the month for me, what an awesome little beer from a brewery i literally know nothing about. a delicious gose style with raspberries, it has to be one of the better fruited takes on this style i have come across. huge crayon red color from the fruit, almost not real. it smells tangy, in equal parts from the raspberries (which almost have a cranberry component to them, tart and pithy), and from the lacto, which is sharp enough to cut the jammy (yet authentic) sweetness of the fruit without making this too sour to crush on. tart but not stupidly acidic, cleaner than it seems like it should be, puckery and mouthwatering, but approachable and sexy too. i love the depth of flavor, nice use of salt here, really accentuates the berries, which are heavy all the way through. the wheat base is nice too, a little extra body to support the bolder flavors, and an oddly snappy finish for what else is going on in this one. for a brewery i have never heard of, this is astoundingly good, and if you told me someone like allagash or rare barrel or whomever was responsible for this, i would totally believe it. its one of the better fruited gose beers out there right now, i wish they would package this, its really tremendous. a highlight of the summer for me, yummy!\xa01,303 charactersStonedTrippin, Sep 01, 2016']

name: Blueberry Imperial Puffsicle
review:
['3.77/5\xa0\xa0rDev -8.9%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75On-tap at The Answer Brewpub, Richmond, VA

A: The beer is very dark purple in color. It poured with just a thin ring of white bubbles around the edge fo the glass and slight hints of lacing on the surface.
S: Light to moderate aromas of marshmallows and blueberries are present in the nose.
T: The taste has flavors of blueberry juice along with notes of marshmallows.
M: It feels light- to medium-bodied on the palate and has a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: I felt that the marshmallow aromas and flavors in this beer could have been a little stronger and more balanced with those of the blueberries.

Serving type: on-tap\xa0629 charactersmetter98, Aug 12, 2018']

name: Second Nature
review:
['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.4%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Poured on draft at brewery. 

A: Light pink tending towards red with smallish one finger head that dissipates quickly. 

S: Blackberries and basil with subtle saltiness. 

T: Slightly tart blackberries mixed with basil and finished with a touch of salt. 

M: Very light and refreshing. 

O: Excellent gose. Pairs very well on a hot summer day.\xa0348 charactersrichj1970, Sep 16, 2019', '3.8/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4a really subtle base gose, not a ton of coriander or salt or anything in here, very light on the wheat malt both in taste and body, and only minimally tart, not heavily sour at all, so the whole thing drinks really delicately, but the additions of basil and blackberry really make it unique, and they stand out even in low dose in such a light base beer, a nicely restrained recipe with these flavors as accents not drivers, very summery and drinkable. the lacto aspect isnt quite perfectly clean, but its mellow enough to not seem sloppy to me either. the blackberry is in front of the basil, which seems somewhat counterintuitive if you are familiar with these ingredients in beer, but thats the case, sweet and a little jammy and even floral, but delicate, with a light basil essence in behind it. this would be decidedly under flavored if it werent for these additions. its just so light. this is pretty unique stuff, dont come in expecting the type of gose you are used to, but i thought this was really interesting and it drinks evenly and easy for the style. not quite professional on the souring aspect, but the rest of it rules.\xa01,137 charactersStonedTrippin, Jul 05, 2018']

name: The Veil / Omnipollo - Tefnut - Mango
review: ['3.68/5\xa0\xa0rDev -9.4%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75If it were 90 out in the summer, this highly fruity beer might appeal to me on a more visceral level; but it is just much too sweet for my tastes, like drinking pure juice concentrate\xa0183 charactersSebastianOwl, Oct 23, 2019']

review: ['4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.5%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Draft at the source.\n\nHazy, yellow body with a small white collar. Apricot, yeast, funk aroma. Nice salty presence in both the aroma and flavor. Light in bodied with assertive tartness. Good stuff.\xa0197 charactersHuhzubendah, Jan 03, 2016']

name: Salty Margarita Tequila Barrel
review:
['3.83/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.8%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75On tap at Token, Dubin. 
Hazy bonde; rotting lime; tart hit, bag of salt + tequila barrel end. Crisp + tart.

4 3.5 4 4 3.75

Not much to it but can there be with this pseudo-style? Tequila woodiness saves this one. But no big deal.\xa0232 charactersStJamesGate, May 21, 2018', "3.98/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4On tap at Brewskival.

Pours a hazy yellow, with soft foam.

Smells a bit salty, with plenty of lime and lemon.

Taste is very refreshing with loads of lime and lemon balanced by some salt and just a hint of bitterness. 

Mouthfeel is thin and sparkly.

Overall, another Magic Rock beer that really tastes like the cocktail it's modeled on. Really tasty!\xa0354 charactersJamFuel, Aug 29, 2017", "4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Sample at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017, yellow session. Aroma is bright, citrusy and floral. Taste is tart and citrusy, refreshing and light. It has some kind of cleaning product lemon fragrance but it's not disturbing in any way.\xa0244 charactersCiocanelu, May 24, 2017"]

name: Funky Face: Blood Orange Gose
review:
['4.51/5\xa0\xa0rDev +23.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.75This beer has a great smell of fresh cut mangos, the appearance is a little cloudy with mild carbonation. It has a mild bitterness in the backend that is pleasant when mixed with the light mango on the tongue. This is a great slow drink in the heat of a late summers day.\xa0271 charactersVolsdrunk, Jul 30, 2016', "3.67/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.5%look: 3 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Bottle:
This beer pours with a medium haze. Carbonation streams are visible, but the head is pretty much invisible.

Nose is light, with a sort of wood-like sweet funk or tang. I do not get blood orange myself - but I do like the nose even if it isn't very traditional for the style.

Taste start with that tang - a much lower level of tartness than I expect from a Gose. The tang is indistinct, but I get a peach to stone fruit flavor going into mid taste. With some warmth, I do start to get the fruit addition in this beer with maybe a hint of that lemongrass/coconut flavor (which I believe came across as woody funk initially).

A nice soft feel with the salt being obvious throughout, adding to that soft feel. It is missing the sour or even tart bite, though.

An interesting beer that I ended up enjoying for its strangeness. I wouldn't be expecting a traditional sour Gose with this one though.\xa0909 characterscjgiant, Jul 17, 2016"]

name: Dance of the Salt Plum Fairy
review:
["4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4A: The beer is very hazy dark pinkish purple in color. It poured with a half finger high white head that quickly died down, leaving a delicate webbing of bubbles on the surface and a thin collar around the edge along with bits of lacing down the sides of the glass.
S: Light to moderate aromas of lime yogurt are present in the nose.
T: The taste follows the smell, and has flavors of yogurt-like lactobacillus and strong notes of plums limes. There is a light amount of sourness.
M: It feels a bit more than light-bodied and a little creamy on the palate with a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: This gose isn't that sour or salty, but the taste has nice flavors of plums and limes.

Serving type: can\xa0704 charactersmetter98, Apr 06, 2019", '4.02/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4A really neat brew here, beautiful lavender pink to soft purple in the glass from the plums, packed with flavor, but never forced, and quite drinkable for what it is. A gose type with lime juice and plums and salt all happening it, and quite a bit more complex overall than a lot of these ever are, even if the yeast element is relatively minimal. The lactic sourness is mild and its clean, the acidity of the lime seems higher than any from the fermentation profile, and the plum has enough sweetness left in its fleshy ripeness to balance this and keep it from being aggressive or anything at all. A light candied note to it but not sugary, just like a flavor concentration, a floral complexion too, a really neat freshness that I like, and just a little brine thing in the finish from the salt, but less than is common in the style. Refreshing because of the high carbonation, interesting layers of flavor through it, and overall something we all really liked. Great beers from top to bottom of the menu in here, I loved this place!\xa01,035 charactersStonedTrippin, Dec 15, 2018', '4.14/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4.25A: Pours an opaque slightly cloudy soft purple in color with moderate amounts of active visible carbonation rising along the edges of the glass and moderate ruby red + plum + orange colored highlights. The beer has a finger tall fizzy foamy pinkish white head that reduces to a large patch of thin film covering a little more than 90% of the surface of the beer and a medium thick ring at the edges of the glass. Light to moderate amounts of lacing are observed.

S: Moderate aromas of slightly sour wheat malts with minimal amounts of sweetness with a light to moderate amount of brininess. Light to moderate aromas of acidic lacto tart lemon and light aromas of fresh lime citrus. Slightly stronger than moderate aromas of plum and light aromas of citrus/orange.

T: Upfront there are just shy of moderate flavors of slightly sour wheat malts with minimal amounts of sweetness. That is followed by light to moderate amounts of brininess and moderate amounts of acidic lacto tart lemon and light flavors of fresh lime citrus. Finally there are moderate flavors of citrus/orange and slightly sweet, slightly tart plums. Light amounts of lingering tartness.

M: Light to medium bodied with slightly heavier than moderate amounts of carbonation. Crisp with a moderate amount of acidic prickliness.

O: Easy to drink with well hidden alcohol and a nice crisp refreshing mouthfeel with just enough acidity. Enjoyable with a really nice combonation of plum, orange, and lime over the top of pleasant gose base.\xa01,506 charactersdbrauneis, Dec 14, 2018']

name: 3 Stars / Olivers Ale The B.W. Rye #4
review:
["2.45/5\xa0\xa0rDev -28.8%look: 4 | smell: 2.75 | taste: 2 | feel: 3 | overall: 2.25From 04/26/13 notes. Had this on tap at RFD; served in a tulip.

a - Pours a hazy medium amber color with two inches of white head and low to moderate carbonation evident.

s - Smells of citrus, hay, lemon, rye, mustiness, and earthy notes. Kind of reminds me of that Lemon scented Pledge you use on wooden tables. Not very good and no salt.

t - Tastes very strongly of sour lemons and citrus, earthy notes, hay, pine, alcohol, and some rye. Again, reminds me of what I'd imagine lemon pledge or pinesol would taste like. Some light salt in the aftertaste. Worse than the nose; not a fan of this one at all. Way too much sour lemon.

m - Medium body and moderate to high carbonation. 

o - Overall I was not a fan of this one at all. I love sour beers and like goses, but this one didn't do it for me. Some rye and a TON or sour lemons, but not in an enjoyable or balanced way. Two of us ordered this and neither of us could finish a full glass. Would not recommend.\xa0967 charactersmdfb79, Apr 30, 2013", '4.24/5\xa0\xa0rDev +23.3%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Soured with lactobacillus.

On draft at Smoke and barrel in D.C.

the beer has a cloudy apricot appearance with a sliver of head that fades rapidly to nil. the aroma brings stone fruits, salt, earthy tones, and prominent lactobacillus. The flavor is sea salt and sourness with a heavy puckering effect. A lot of flavor packed into a 2% abv beer. Salty crackers with a touch of citrus and aggressive sourness. Light to medium in body with moderately low carbonation. I really enjoyed this one.\xa0496 charactersHuhzubendah, Apr 30, 2013']

name: Double Cherry Popsicle
review:
["4.29/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.6%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25L: Had this beer on-tap at the Answer Brewpub, poured into a snifter glass. Had a blood red color and a thick, almost smoothie-like consistency. There was a quarter inch of foamy, off white, long-lasting head. Fantastic lacing.

S: A super sweet aroma of cherries, some malt, and salt.

T: Tasted of a mild amount of malt (barely noticeable), a tinge of salt, a gigantic heap of cherries, a light amount of spices (hard to tell what), and some other fruit (raspberries?). They definitely went all in on the cherries for this one. The flavor's tart, sweet, light and enjoyable. Not exactly complex, but it doesn't have to be.

F: A decent amount of carbonation with a slick, yet lively finish. Light-bodied.

O: Quite a likable beer. If you love cherries, check this one out.\xa0774 charactersavalon07, Dec 31, 2017"]

name: Way / Stillwater Amazon Gose
review:
['4.46/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5A: Lightly floral, with plenty of barrel character and a light saltiness.

A: Golden color, hazy, with a moderate white head that has adequate retention.

T: Floral, light mineral brine with a plenty of barrel character, tart, light smoke and light salt and a dry finish.

M: Light bodied with moderate carbonation. 

O: Incredible; the beer has a great complex mescal like character with a light saltiness and smoke. Very easy to drink and refreshing!\xa0452 charactersPhil-Fresh, Jun 13, 2017']

name: Grapefruit Gose
review:
['3.89/5\xa0\xa0rDev +15.8%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75From 01/28/15 notes. 16 oz. pour in a pint glass at the Marco Island Brewery.

Pours a murky pale yellow color with one inch of bright white head and low carbonation evident. Salt, light citrus, lightly sour grapefruit, more sour fruits in the taste, sour dough, and bread. Medium body and moderate carbonation.

Overall pretty solid actually; was pleasantly surprised by this one. Would have it again.\xa0402 charactersmdfb79, Feb 03, 2015']

name: Gilgo
review:
['3.96/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.6%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4A: The beer is very hazy yellow in color. It poured with a minuscule white collar around the edge of the glass and some specks of bubbles on the surface.
S: Moderate aromas of passionfruit are present in the nose along with hints of guava.
T: The taste follows the smell, having moderate to strong flavors of passionfruit along with notes of guava. There is some sourness and a slight bit of saltiness.
M: It feels light- to medium-bodied and a little tart on the palate with a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: This beer is nice and refreshing. I really liked all of the fruity aromas and flavors.

Serving type: can\xa0620 charactersmetter98, Dec 16, 2018', '4.23/5\xa0\xa0rDev +14.9%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.2512 oz can, no canning date info that I can find.

"Gose with Himalayan pink salt, pink guava and passion fruit"

Has the look of a Belgian wit beer, medium haze, moderate off white collar, film and some super fine bubble sheeting.

Sweet and tropical fruit sniff, with lime, grapefruit and mango coming to mind.

This is a mighty fine and quite tasty Gose...might be a nice fresh sample or maybe the other raters just dont like sour/wild/funky kinda beers. Bright, fresh, flavorful and complex...About medium sour, more lime, mango, pineapple, grapefruit....mighty fine stuff...well done DUBCO....gonna pick up more of this next time I venture out to Long Island.\xa0665 charactersBillolick, Oct 09, 2018', '2.6/5\xa0\xa0rDev -29.3%look: 2.75 | smell: 2.75 | taste: 2.5 | feel: 2.75 | overall: 2.5I was not a fan of this beer at all. Some people like these styles and particularly this beer but I was not a fan and it was a complete drain pour for me. I badly want to give theyre "Dominick white" a try tho!\xa0210 characterscalitrie1486, Oct 30, 2015']

name: Fat Panda
review: ['2.81/5\xa0\xa0rDev -19.3%look: 2.75 | smell: 3 | taste: 2.75 | feel: 2.75 | overall: 2.75The habanero burned my throat. Not pleasant at all. It would not have been so bad otherwise. It was cloudy and moderate sour. The peppers made it painful to drink though.\xa0174 charactersbluehende, May 11, 2018']

review: ['4.28/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25Daver32nh, May 18, 2017', '4.35/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.6%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.5ilikebeer03, May 09, 2017', '4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4GDawgs34, May 01, 2017', '4.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.1%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5atlbravsrno1, Apr 29, 2017', '4.12/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.7%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Zazzi82, Apr 24, 2017']

name: One Eyed Gose
review: ['2.64/5\xa0\xa0rDev -25%look: 3.75 | smell: 2.25 | taste: 2.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 2.5jrfehon33, Aug 04, 2017', '3.94/5\xa0\xa0rDev +11.9%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Jason_cs, Jun 23, 2017', '3.96/5\xa0\xa0rDev +12.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4dbrauneis, May 28, 2016', '3.68/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75qcghost, Apr 11, 2016', '3.38/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.25kell50, Mar 26, 2016']

name: Hoser Gose
review:
["3.41/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.4%look: 3 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5On tap at Cock & Bull Hyde Park, arrived in a shaker pint.

A: Arrived as a cloudy dark straw color, with minimal head. No real lacing to speak of.

S: As usual, when tasting in a bar with a kitchen, I am not able to detect much aroma. What I did get was pale wheat, laced through with hints of funk and salt.

T: This beer drinks like a nice, solid wheat beer, with a hint of salt and some notes of must and funk drifting through the flavor profile. There's a couple faint bits of fruitiness, like green apple, and something reminiscent of horse blanket.

M: Thin and light-bodied, with enough carbonation to feel lively without adding too much sharpness.

O: A decent beer. I had a second.\xa0691 charactersUrbanCaveman, Nov 23, 2014"]

name: Leipziger Gose Johannisberg
review:
['4.02/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25Had a 10 oz pour on tap, served in a snifter.

Nice golden color, slightly cloudy with a fluffy white 1/2" white head. Good retention. Looks appealing.

The scent is kind of faint, but there's some coriander, a little brine, and a nice wheatiness. A bit of sweet grains.

Lemon and wheat lead on the taste, with a slight tartness and soft saltiness in the finish. Everything works together well and it is nicely balanced. 

Light, lush body from the wheat. There's a really nice soft texture to it that makes it incredibly drinkable. 

This is my first gose and I really liked it. Simple, clean, with great wheat character and a refreshing tartness. Very nice texture and body. I would drink this all day in the summer.\xa0719 charactersbusternuggz, Jan 07, 2013', '3.93/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4A- Pale yellow, with a medium-large white head. Body is quite hazy. Retention is good, with some lacing.
S- The aroma is lemon, spicy, a touch of wheat. Smells on the whole like a witbier with only minimal twang or aggressiveness.
T- Different story here. Up front it carries on a lemon/spice/wheat flavor that is very pleasant. The middle and finish has a somewhat sharp tartness to it. 
M- I found the tartness refreshing, albeit maybe the slightest shade too far. Carbonation was right on. Body was quite light.
O- This was a great hot summer night beer. Very refreshing, and a good example of the style.\xa0611 charactersjsprain1, Jul 08, 2012']

name: MF Gose: Pamplemousse
review:
["4.46/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5Thanks Steve.
This was poured into a pokal.
The appearance was a semi-cloudy burnt yellow color with some carbonation seen rising here and there. A slim white foamy fizzy head slid off immediately and didn't leave any lace.
The aroma was majestic as it combined a semi-sweet wheaty funk to a salty whiff and grassy hopped character flowing through some lemon tart tones. Grapefruit juice comes through with more warmth.
The flavor blended the salty wheaty character to grapefruit juicy and lemony tart qualities, all so very nicely. Mellow aftertaste initially but seems to change midway with a little bit of a wheaty kick but nice. Initial aftertaste seemed like sticky grapefruit.
The mouthfeel was almost medium bodied but was extremely sessionable! Good carbonation. Nothing distracting as everything seems to roll right on through over my tongue. Finishes semi-crisp with wheaty salty notes and grapefruit juicy pulp.
Overall, starting to realize these guys certainly know how to brew to style and still add in some awesome ingenuity!\xa01,039 charactersLone_Freighter, Sunday at 09:11 PM", '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.7%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Unlike Future Knowledge this beer has a more refined sourness and is much less puckering and easier on the palate. The 5% is a good plus as most Gose beers are around 4% and it coming in a pounder is also a plus. If anything it restores my faith in the brewery a bit since they can make a pretty tasty gose style beer.\xa0318 charactersDrDemento456, Sep 06, 2019', "3.83/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.9%look: 3 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Soft pale yellow body; very lively carbonation but with absolutely no head; very effervescent with spitting carbonation bubbles. Citrus fruit aroma; lime. Juicy and acidic flavors with a note of salt; white grapefruit and lime; tangy. Medium-light body; tart and dry.

This one is a mixed bag for me. The 'Look' got a slight boost in my rating if only for the novelty of carbonation spitting through the top of the beer, otherwise, no head would rate a max of 2.75 from me. The smell and and feel are okay, but it is the taste that somewhat saves this beer.\xa0558 charactersbeergoot, Jul 03, 2019", '4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.7%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.5Got in a trade with beergoot. 16 ounce can into tulip glass, canned on 3/14/2019. Pours very hazy pale golden yellow color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with poor retention, that reduces to nothing pretty quickly. No glass lacing and a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big sour/tart/tangy ruby red grapefruit, lemon, lime, orange, citrus peel/zest, peach, pear, apricot, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, oak, peppercorn, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, and white bread; with lighter notes of leathery/musty/lacto funk, white wine vinegar, and yeast/oak earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of grapefruit, fruity/acidic/funky/spicy yeast, moderate oak, and pale/wheat malt notes; with big strength. Taste of big sour/tart/tangy ruby red grapefruit, lemon, lime, orange, citrus peel/zest, peach, pear, apricot, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, oak, peppercorn, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, and white bread; with lighter notes of leathery/musty/lacto funk, white wine vinegar, and yeast/oak earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang, and Brett/oak tannin spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/tangy ruby red grapefruit, lemon, lime, orange, citrus peel/zest, peach, pear, apricot, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, oak, peppercorn, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, light leather/funk/vinegar, and yeast/oak earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of grapefruit, fruity/acidic/funky/spicy yeast, moderate oak, and pale/wheat malt flavors; with a great malt/tart/tangy/spiciness balance; with zero puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp/clean finishing. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering tartness, tangy fruit, and carbonation. Medium-plus carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/grainy/acidic/tangy, and fairly saline/tannic balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5%. Overall this is an awesome fruited gose. All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of grapefruit, fruity/acidic/funky/spicy yeast, moderate oak, and pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth, refreshing, and fairly crisp/clean to drink with the mellowly acidic/tangy/tannic/drying finish; not overly lactic/salty. Awesome balanced juicy/vibrant grapefruit and Brett/bacteria complexity; with nice oak foeder presence, and pale/wheat malts against acidity. Minimal residual sweetness with crisp drying. A really enjoyable offering, and impressive spot on style example.\xa02,660 characterssuperspak, Jul 02, 2019']

name: Frequency Pattern
review:
["3.9/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.8%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Moderate to vigorous pour yields 1/2 inch off-white, pinkish tan head over a dark mahogany brown body with no lacing. Nose of tart cherries and a bit of oak. Taste of tart cherries with a finish of salt on the tongue at the very end. Good feel for a Gose and overall, a cherry lover's dream. Cheers!\xa0299 charactersbobv, Feb 05, 2018", "3.61/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.7%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.7516 oz can

Pours opaque black, dark brown tint of light around the edges. Head is tan and retains as a film.

Smells of tart cherry and berry, citrus, lactic acid and cracker malt.

Tastes of tart cherry and berry, lactic acid, citrus, bread and hint of woody bitterness. 

Light to medium body, stinging carbonation on the tongue.

Interesting and reasonably decent gose, a bit boring on the flavor. It's sour with some fruit characteristics, but the fruit doesn't reach the level of a sweetness you would expect and the malt character is a bit stale. This are minor quibbles. It's okay, probably wouldn't have it again but I don't mind drinking it.\xa0654 charactersCylinsier, Feb 03, 2018"]

name: Gose to Jamrock
review:
['3.9/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4I look for this brewery and found several at a place in Boston recently. Glad I did. Bought this and found it to be OK. Love the style and sours are sometimes 2 sour at and maybe difficult to find common ground as a spur. This was a tad to sour for me very drinkable but I would likely not get it again. Can’t wait to try the three others I purchased.\xa0358 charactersNewbeergeek1, Aug 18, 2019', '4.31/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25From the can - gose style ale brewed with mango guava cnae sugar and matured with Jamaican rhum oak chips. Best by date 25/9/19.

Pours a light hazy straw color with short fizzy head. Little laccing.
Sour smell with distinct note of wood.
The oak chips don’t really make it into the taste unfortunately, but the fruit components are a good counterpoint to the dominant tangy taste.

Pretty good, but pricey.\xa0410 charactersTinFang, Feb 18, 2019']

name: Roll In Ze' Hay Gose
review: ['3.8/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.2%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4really nice take on the style here, verboten is a pretty awesome brewery, way ahead of the new brewery curve, and beers like this one keep proving that. it looks the part, pale wheat colored brew with milky haze to it and a substantial head, just off white and wispy. the nose has a really neat herbal property that goes beyond coriander. there are some hops in this one too, which you never really see in the style. the nose shows a little tangy kick, but its much more sour in taste than in smell. salt is middle of the spectrum here, all in the finish, making it both dry and mouthwatering at the same time. its quite sour, but not in the usual hyper acidic respect, and i like that a lot. less of the lemon lacto and more of a younger profile, keeps it drinkable and super refreshing. its a style of beer that is incredibly in vogue right now, a few years ago there were just a couple on the market, and now they are as prevalent as anything else. i feel like people just realized kettle souring isnt real tough to do, and thats great. its tough to stand out from the crowd though, and this one does an excellent job of distinguishing itself. i could drink ten of these easy.\xa01,179 charactersStonedTrippin, May 09, 2015', '3.62/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.7%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Poured on-tap at the brewery and served in a shaker pint, the beer is a cloudy, straw-blonde coloring, with a filmy, clingy, white head. Nose of subtle floral notes, salty highlights, and toasted grains. Flavors are salty forward, with a floral and subtle caramel and bread backbone. Crisp and clean, with a salty, semisweet aftertaste. The finish is crisp and clean. Refreshing beer.\xa0384 charactersGarthDanielson, Nov 03, 2014']

name: RBF
review:
["3.84/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.9%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.752018-11-02
12oz can served in a little Cantillon glass. I don't see a date on it. I have no recollection of where I got this beer.

Pours light foggy yellow, no head on my glass, and not much carbonation. Smell is mostly just tart -- lemony. Smelling the can directly, I can definitely detect raspberries.

Taste milder. Still tart, but loses the lemons. Gets a more raspberry / general berry flavor across. Salt is mild -- not really detectable on its own, but I think it helps soften some of the flavors more than anything else.

Mouthfeel is dry, smooth. Overall, not bad.\xa0575 characterssnaotheus, Nov 03, 2018", '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Pours a mostly clear but partly cloudy golden straw color. The carbonation is visible. A modest head quickly dissipates. A thin ring of lacing retains throughout.
The aromas emit a pleasant feel of sour raspberry. This is accompanied by lemon peel, faint bread and an even more minuscule touch of some kind of peppery spice.
The taste has a pleasant tartness that is not too acidic and doesn’t overwhelm. The predominant flavor of raspberry helps take a lot of the edge off and provides balance. Other flavors include grapefruit, lemon, dry cider, and green apple, along with a touch of salt.
The mouthfeel is light and crisp. The finish is dry and with a strong touch of lemon and raspberry. 
This was a refreshing Gose. I thought the raspberries provided a nice touch.\xa0773 charactersGajo74, Apr 13, 2018']

name: Shaking Like Tremolo - Strawberry and Pink Guava
review: ['3.6/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3 | overall: 3.25Holy shit this beer has way too much lactose in it. I see what they were trying to do with the balance of salty, sweet, and sour however, the fact of the matter is the lactose dominates the beer. It does have a sour taste but the aftertaste is too sweet and sugary for me even in a milkshake IPA.\xa0296 charactersThe_Beer_Guru, Jul 06, 2019']

name: Dynamic Convergence
review:
['3.88/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.6%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4A: Pours an orange color with 2 fingers of head that fades down to a thin cap

S: Kumquats and tartness up front along with some lighter fruitiness

T: Follows the nose. Starts off with the kumquat and tartness and picks up some vinous notes and light general fruitiness

M: Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Acidic

O: A solid double gose that highlights the kumquat. Definitely on the fruity side. Not bad\xa0414 charactersBEERMILER12, Nov 10, 2019', "3.53/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.6%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.25Opted for a tulip since the brewer claims this is an imperial version.
The appearance was a semi-thick burnt orange creamy color with a small white foamy head sliding off at a fair pace. Not much lace, dissolving little speckles few and far between.
The aroma had the kumquats, bold and sweet up front with adequate tart to sour qualities roaming in and out nicely.
The flavor had a bit more sweet fruity kumquat likeness in front than the sour and tart character. Mild aftertaste of kumquats and a touch of lactose.
The mouthfeel was about medium bodied with a fair sipping quality about it. Low carbonation and a rough sort of likeable edge of kumquat tartness drying out my tongue. Finishes semi-sticky and crisp with kumquat fruitiness.
Overall, possibly more of a fruit and field beer depending upon how one takes this beer. But I'd still have again despite it not being anywhere close to a true gose.\xa0906 charactersLone_Freighter, Oct 12, 2019"]

name: Sun-Kissed Gose
review:
['4.14/5\xa0\xa0rDev +14.7%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4I tried this on tap at Columbia Kettle Works served chilled in a pint. 

The color is a hazed golden with white head that drops to a ring, visibly carbonated. The smell is lightly lemony with wheat malt smell and mineral notes with subtle fruity scent. The feel is tangy but not tart with yeast adding creamy feel wth malt in a bready texture with mildly carbonated and mostly dry finish. 

The taste is tart with lemony and wheat flavor miex with coriander spice and slihg salt mid palate with a astringent and dry lemony finish with dry toasted effect. Great gose as far as style goes -light body and very drinkable after spending time in the sun -nicely balanced.\xa0668 charactersSlatetank, Sep 01, 2015', '3.59/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.6%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5Had this on 2015-07-04 at the brewery. Their description is "3.1% ABV - 10 IBUs. An unfiltered, traditional German sour wheat beer. Brewed with coriander and sea salt, finished with fresh Navel oranges."

A - Hazy straw with a 1/2-finger white head and little lace.

S - Yeasty bread, straw, some barnyard funk.

T - Sourdough wheat bread with just a little salt and coriander. Not very sour at all. More lactobacillus please! There's a hint of orange. The adjunct-like base lager flavor is prominent. 

M - Light body and light-medium carbonation. It's not as refreshing as I expected due to the small amount of lactic acid. 

O - Not bad but I liked the previous Saskia Gose more. This might be just the thing for someone's first introduction to the style but it didn't get me where I live.\xa0804 charactersTucquan, Jul 04, 2015']

name: Paloma Gose
review:
['3.77/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.1%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Had on my first visit to the Tin Roof taproom, on draft into pint tumbler.

The lime and grapefruit are evident the agave syrup not but in any event these additions do not destroy this otherwise on-style gose.\xa0209 charactersBigGold, Jun 22, 2019', '4.68/5\xa0\xa0rDev +21.6%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.75Paloma Gose has a fairly thin, stark-white head, a hazy, lemon yellow appearance, and minimal lacing. The aroma is of the juices and underlying crackery malt, and the flavor is the same, but with a saltine cracker aspect. Mouthfeel is medium, and Paloma Gose finishes mostly dry. A very tart item, here. No bitterness. 

RJT\xa0324 charactersRonaldTheriot, Apr 30, 2019']

name: Son Of A Batch Dark Gose (Apple Wood)
review: ['3.42/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.6%look: 3 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3 | overall: 3.5Slightly hazed copperish amber with a yellowish white, extremely bubbly head. Nose is a fair bit of apple and cinnamon. Has a touch of apple sauce quality. Earthy and musky spice. Taste has some apple and cinnamon, less than the nose. Some light grain mixed with musk and a hint of salt. Fairly spicy with notes of citrus. Heavily carbonated, lighter body. Carbonation makes the finish a bit uneven and thins out the flavor.\xa0424 characterscpetrone84, Feb 25, 2014']

name: Gose With Nectarine
review: ["3.85/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75This is a dandy, fruity, lighter option to the radler world. The taste is lovely, with plenty of earthy, grassy notes and just enough of the promised nectarine to satisfy the palate. I'm not the biggest afficionado of this style or fan of the brewery, but this one is definitely worth a try on a hot summer day.\xa0311 charactersBunman3, Aug 16, 2016"]

name: Gose-Sur-Mer
review: ['3.74/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.2%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75"Gose on sea". Bright straw color with a mist of yeast. More cloudy if poured all the way. Slightly foamy and frothy white 2-3 finger head, lasting around 5 minutes, with mediocre lacing. Flavors of sweet grains, salt, sea, lemon, light cabbage and grapefruits, wild yeast, and floral hops. Slick and oily full body with a good crisp. Light strength finish, soft salty and flowery feel. Slightly sour and tart with a very faint barnyard feel. The salt is mellow and the rest highly accessible but still well balanced. Session type of strength, lacks a bit of flavors, but I find some pretty good complexity in there. Very fresh while filling and salivating. Overall very good quality craft.\xa0690 charactersTheBierdimpfe, Jun 14, 2018', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +11.4%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Bottle: Poured a clear pale yellow color ale with a nice large pure white foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of light tart notes with some lemon notes is quite refreshing. Taste is a good mix of lemon notes with some tartness and light salty notes also apparent. Body is about average with good carbonation. Super well brewed Gose with nice level of complexity and retaining great drinkability.\xa0413 charactersPhyl21ca, May 17, 2018']

name: Blueberry Ginger Gose
review: ['4.05/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25it was cool to visit the almanac taproom because they had a ton of different beers, stuff i have never seen in bottles, and this was one of them. the ginger here i think is a little stronger than the blueberry, its spicy and natural tasting, and its nice with the light mineral salt profile and the sweetness of the blueberries, but i think its just a little dominant and out of balance, at least for high volume consumption, but the relationship between the blueberry and the ginger is a good one, complimentary and even synergistic, which is cool. the sourness is pretty high here, its cleaner than a lot of the almanac stuff i have had before, and its quite puckery, cool with the tartness of the blueberry skins and the drying heat of the ginger, but it makes for a pretty intense drinking experience. i like how light it feels, but more carbonation would really help it move a little bit more. a neat mix of flavors, fresh and real tasting to me, a neat beer from these guys and something that would probably do well in bottled form. highly recommend a visit to their spot, the beer list is incredible! i was happy to find this one there.\xa01,143 charactersStonedTrippin, Nov 11, 2017']

name: Go Get It Ginger Lime Gose
review:
["3.86/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4473ml can - 'tis the season of ginger/fruit pairings in the brewing world, it would seem.

This beer pours a mostly clear, medium copper amber colour, with two fingers of puffy, finely foamy, and somewhat fizzy off-white head, which leaves zilch in the way of lace anywhere near the glass as it quickly blows off.

It smells of store-brand ginger ale, the lime juice that comes in those little round plastic containers, grainy and bready cereal malt, saltine crackers, and very subtle earthy, musty, and floral green hop bitters. The taste is gritty and grainy pale malt, lightly spicy ginger root, muddled lime flesh, a hint of lactic sourness, saline solution, and more ethereal leafy, weedy, and musky floral hoppiness.

The carbonation is average in its palate-pinging frothiness, the body a so-so middleweight, and essentially smooth, once one becomes used to the bite of ginger and lime alike at this point in the game. It finishes off-dry, the citrus-tinted ginger ale soda association growing with each glug.

Overall - yuppers, this one certainly delivers on its marketing promise, with both of the adjuncts bringing their A-game. Crisp, refreshing, and totally worthy of a few turns on a sunny and warm patio, should you get the chance - so go get it.\xa01,264 charactersbiboergosum, Aug 03, 2018"]

name: Cherry Tart
review:
['3.59/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.8%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Pours slightly hazed golden yellow A thin white head almost immediately becomes a lasting island. Very little lacing.

The smell is of bread, with mild cherry juice.

The taste is of musty wheat malt, cherry pit. A bit of salt in the finish. Not as tart as expected, but some in the aftertaste. (In my opinion very close to the next highest score, but not quite there.)

The feel is the best part. Smooth, zesty, light and refreshing.

The cherry is mild (not necessarily a bad thing). As far as a gose it has the traditional characteristics, with a twist of mild tart cherry.\xa0576 charactersjwc215, May 28, 2019']

name: It Gose In Your Moutha
review: ["4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25swung by the tasting room. grabbed a few samples, including this. pale yellow. nose is really funky tart sweet. huge wheat and hints of vanilla. tastes like a hefe. where's my slice of orange. another tasty beer but not classic gose...enjoyable.\xa0246 characterscosmicevan, Sep 22, 2017"]

name: Saltwater Intrusion - Raspberry
review: ["3.73/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Really nice fruit treatment of a style I'm usually not a huge fan of. Raspberry is big on the aroma, but light in the flavor. Nice tartness. Liked the strawberry slightly better, but this is a nice job. These guys are really looking to hone in their light styles in the hot Florida sun.\xa0286 charactersBMMillsy, May 31, 2015"]

name: Gull Harbor Gose
review:
["3.72/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.6%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.752017-05-20
22oz bottle served in a pair of nonic WABL samplers. Date on the neck is 9/8/16.

Pours clear light yellow with a smallish head and lots of carbonation. Almost looks like a soda. Smell is slightly sour and fairly yeasty. Lemon.

Taste is fruity with more noticeable salt than I get from most goses I'm familiar with. A little limey, maybe, some other kind of fruit I can't pick out right now. Not bad.

Mouthfeel is light, dry, smooth. Overall, solid, tasty beer.\xa0474 characterssnaotheus, May 21, 2017"]

name: RBG - Raspberry Bramble Gose
review:
['3.43/5\xa0\xa0rDev -11.6%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5on tap at the brewery friday evening

Arrives in the appropriate glass, pale red wine coloring, nice small fizzy, slightly off white head which persists in some form throughout.

The aroma seems a little artificial, but Raspberry is the dominant aroma,along with a little grassiness.

Unfortunately, the taste comes off as artificial as well. Like raspberry cough syrup or something. Nicely tart and slightly sour, but that berry taste overcomes all. Sadly, I could not finish it. 

Mouth a touch below medium, finish sour berry.

I love Troegs, but this one did not not taste good to me at all. Offered to others in the group, and it was a unanimous thumbs down.\xa0664 charactersMikeWard, Dec 02, 2018', "4.02/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.6%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Thanks to JLindros for hooking me up with a can.

A - Poured into my Duvel tulip a nice crystal clear light ruby hue with a thin white head that fades slowly to leave a creamy halo and light wisps.

S - Aromas of light wheat and lemons, some decent salinity but with almost some toasted notes. There is some seedy berry notes which could be higher.

T - Taste is similar to the nose. Very nice creamy wheat little bit of lemon as well, decent salt level. Berry is pleasant, little jammy but not overly so. Finish isn't flemmy, rather pleasant. 

M - Mouthfeel is nice and creamy and not really flemmy, however, I feel the body is a bit on the thinner side.

O - Overall this was a solid berry gose, though it's not exactly stellar. 

Serving Type: Can\xa0751 charactersrudzud, Oct 25, 2018", '4.05/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.4%look: 4.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Best by 12/22/18, picked up at the brewery a couple weeks ago

Pours a big foamy fluffy bubbly 1 finger head that fades at a slow pace, nice retention and thick soapy lacing, crystal clear reddish orange color

Nose plenty of decent gose up front, raw bread dough malt, creamy wheat like as well, a touch of tart lemony like souring thing, a little coriander, and a touch of salt, either good or bad not sure but the raspberry bramble is very light, not overpowering but not much at all either, actually maybe even more lemony than raspberry

Taste brings more of the same but thankfully a bit more raspberry, base gose out front, raw bread dough creamy wheat and a little lactic sourness, mild coriander and a little salt as well, good sourness level, nice base gose in general, raspberry adds a bit of tart fruit but again lighter than I would have liked, but at least it;s not overpowering, mild flemmy finish

Mouth is med to lighter bod, nice fizzy creamy carb, a touch of lactic tartness and flemmy

Overall not bad, good base gose, not enough raspberry but thankfully not a raspberry bomb either\xa01,102 charactersjlindros, Oct 07, 2018', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Tröegs Brewing Company "RBG - Raspberry Bramble Gose"
$6.50/pint on tap @ Gingerbread Man, Carlisle, PA on 8 September 2018

Notes: Clear ruby in color beneath a short head of white. Limited head retention and lacing but it is a sour beer so that's expected. The aroma suggests tartness and fresh raspberries, a light bit of grainy malt, and some mild floral and earthy character. The raspberries are seemingly natural and not sweet. The flavor however has more to it and the blend of raspberries and tartness with the bit of malt that backs it is nice. The salt appears after that, lightly, and although there's next to no bitterness it finishes dry with a flicker of acidity and some residual earthiness. This is not a beer that's overdone, and it's light but flavorful and refreshing, and perfect for summer.\xa0812 charactersNeroFiddled, Sep 29, 2018']

name: Poppy's Moonship (Guava and Passionfruit)
review:
['4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.516 ounce can into tulip glass, canned in 7/2019. Pours very hazy medium golden yellow color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big tart/tangy passion fruit, pink guava, fruit skin/seed, lemon, lime, peach, pear, apricot, melon, red/green apple, berries, white grape/wine, sea salt, coriander, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of guava, passion fruit, fruity/acidic yeast, coriander, sea salt, and pale/wheat malt notes; with big strength. Taste of big tart/tangy passion fruit, pink guava, fruit skin/seed, lemon, lime, peach, pear, apricot, melon, red/green apple, berries, white grape/wine, sea salt, coriander, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang, and light coriander spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/tangy passion fruit, pink guava, fruit skin/seed, lemon, lime, peach, pear, apricot, melon, red/green apple, berries, white grape/wine, sea salt, coriander, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of guava, passion fruit, fruity/acidic yeast, coriander, sea salt, and pale/wheat malt flavors; with a fantastic malt/tartness and tangy fruit balance; with no puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering tartness, tangy fruit, and carbonation. Medium-plus carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/grainy, and fairly crisp/acidic/tangy/tannic mouthfeel that is fantastic. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.8%. Overall this is an outstanding fruited gose. All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of guava, passion fruit, fruity/acidic yeast, coriander, sea salt, and pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth, refreshing, and fairly crisp to drink with the mellowly acidic/tangy/tannic/drying finish. Fantastic soft feel, mellowly lactic/salty. Very flavorful and not watery for the ABV. Perfectly balanced juicy fruits, Lacto complexity, and pale/wheat malts against acidity. Mild residual sweetness with crisp acidic/tangy dryness. A highly enjoyable offering, and outstanding spot on style example.\xa02,581 characterssuperspak, Sep 08, 2019', "4.16/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.7%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Poured into a pokal, the appearance had a bright yellow color with a nice transparency about it. Modest finger's worth of white foamy head sustained appropriately for a good minute before dissipating and left in a respectable time to leave some concave lace.
The aroma had the gose qualities of sour-ed wheat, salt and coriander up front, nice and emphatic. Guava and passion fruit tartness hardens the overall nose to be a bit more complex without overdoing it. Light funk developing as it warms.
The flavor blends sour to the tart with the wheat and the fruitiness running through each other. Saltiness seems to slide into the backbone a bit more here. Super quick aftertaste, really seems almost not there, however, there is just some tart guava/passion fruit, salt and sour-ed wheat.
The mouthfeel was between light and medium bodied with a good sessionability about it. Sturdy carbonation punching against the sour harshness to end up taming the feel all around. Not much of a finish, but seemed semi-salty with some coriander and guava/passion fruit tartness, touch of dryness.
Overall, very much a gose as in the traditional sense but also bringing in a certain creativity just to ensure this is Schilling's beer. I'd definitely have again.\xa01,248 charactersLone_Freighter, Jul 17, 2019"]

name: Ode To Austin
review:
["3.54/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.6%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5Pint at Whole Foods Fort Worth. 

Pale yellow, hazy, with a fast disappearing pure white head. 

Delicate aromas of grain and stone fruit. 

Wine vinegar acidity, light fruit, but what kind of fruit is not especially pronounced. Peach makes sense, clearly something light. Decent bitterness in the finish and high carbonation. 

Very active mouthfeel, light body, and a clean finish. 

I would like a little more distinct peach flavor, but it's a nicely made beer. Not too sour, not salty at all, crisp, and not too sweet.\xa0522 charactersbrewerburgundy, Sep 18, 2017"]

name: Blueberry Cucumber Gose
review: ['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 412 ounce can into tulip glass, canned on 6/22/2018. Pours moderately hazy reddish/pinkish orange color with a 1 finger fairly dense and fluffy light pink head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big juicy/tart/tangy blueberries, cucumber, fruit skin, lemon, lime, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape, coriander, sea salt, hay, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/acidic yeast, fruit, salt, coriander, and pale/wheat malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big juicy/tart/tangy blueberries, cucumber, fruit skin, lemon, lime, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape, coriander, sea salt, hay, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang, and light coriander spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of juicy/tart/tangy blueberries, cucumber, fruit skin, lemon, lime, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape, coriander, sea salt, hay, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Great complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, fruit, salt, coriander, and pale/wheat malt flavors; with an awesome malt/tartness and tangy fruit balance; with no puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Lightly increasing dryness from lingering tartness and tangy fruit. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/bready/grainy, fairly acidic/tangy, and lightly sticky/saline balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5%. Overall this is an excellent fruited gose! All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, fruit, salt, coriander, and pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth and refreshing to drink with the mellowly acidic/tangy/drying finish. Not overly lactic or salty. Well balanced authentic juicy fruits, Lacto, spice, salt, and pale/wheat malts. Liked this a bit more than the watermelon. It had some spice astringency, which was not present here. This also had more tart/tangy fruit presence from the berries. A very enjoyable offering, and spot on style example.\xa02,400 characterssuperspak, Jul 21, 2018']

name: Flowing Well Goze
review: ['3.6/5\xa0\xa0rDev -8.2%look: 4 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.75Pours a clear straw producing 3+ fingers of fizzy, foamy, somewhat lasting, white head that leaves more surface cap, collar ring & lace than is usual for beers of this style. With that said all three disappear rapidly. Abundant effervescence streams from the bottom. Aroma is mildly tart, coriander, barnyard funk, thin lemon/lime, acetaldehyde, grainy wheat with faint fruit/berry & mineral hints in a thinly briney background. Taste is tangy, salty, thin wheat, cracker, lemon/lime & coriander. Finishes tart & dry with with faint acetaldehyde, leafy floral & faint mineral. Tart finish is short-lived. Aftertaste is a short-lived lightly tart, lime citrus & brine. Dry throughout. Mouthfeel is light-medium bodied with moderate-high carbonation, crisp, light prickle & very dry. A decent but very middle of the road Gose.\xa0825 charactersmothmanscott, Dec 01, 2018']

name: Sleeping Limes
review:
["3.84/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75330ml can - made with limes and sea salt. A perfect summer release, as it arrived here in November, of course.

This beer pours a mostly clear, pale golden yellow colour, with three fingers of puffy, rocky, and mildly fizzy off-white head, which leaves a little bit of streaky lace in places around the glass as it evenly evaporates.

It smells of slightly sour lime zest, gritty and grainy cereal malt, saltine crackers, and very faint earthy, musty, and floral noble hop bitters. The taste is bready and crackery pale malt, a lesser grainy wheatiness, watered-down lime juice, saline solution, and more well-understated herbal, floral, and weedy green hoppiness.

The carbonation is adequate in its palate-satiating frothiness, the body a decent medium weight, and generally smooth, as the tart/sour essences are restrained enough to allow for a good time at this particular point in the game. It finishes off-dry, the malt and lingering citrus fruitiness carrying on like old pals.

Overall - this does indeed come across as a rather refreshing tipple, as claimed in the marketing blurb on the label. Well-made, if a little steeply priced in my neck of the woods, but that's not on the brewery, it just affects my desire to procure more of it.\xa01,250 charactersbiboergosum, Nov 29, 2018", '3.94/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 4Pous a clear pale yellow colour. Smells like a salty margarita; sour and salty preserved limes, sour, and with some bitter lager-esque notes. Tastes medium-bodied. A clean salted lime gose profile throughout. Lingering mineral and tangy lime rind palate.\xa0256 charactersNilocRellim, Jul 26, 2018']

name: Cowthulhu
review:
['3.94/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.6%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75A: The beer is very hazy brownish purple in color. It poured with a narrow collar of white bubbles around the edge of the glass and some small patches of bubbles on the surface.
S: Moderate aromas of berries are present in the nose - blackberries and blueberries seem to stand out in particular.
T: The taste follows the smell and has lots of flavors of berries along with touches of sweetness and sourness.
M: It feels medium-bodied and a bit smooth and creamy on the palate with a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: This beer tastes like a hybrid version of an Imperial Gose and an American Wild Ale.

Serving type: can\xa0621 charactersmetter98, Nov 15, 2019', '4.23/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25This is my absolute first beer from Bolero Snort, who seem to be some kind of... contract brewery obsessed with bulls? Umm... okay. I mean, I've already accepted that 2019 is truly the year we fell into an alternate universe that is less-than-stellar, but there are some good things about it, and one of those is that the beer this year has been crazy good. Will BS follow that path? Or will this be pure bull...?

Pours like a fruit smoothie with a dense, deep red/garnet color that stays completely opaque and unmoving throughout. Topped off with a really fluffy head of pinkish foam, this looks... interesting. Reminds me a lot of an even more saturated version of Cantillon's Zwanze a few years ago. I'm pretty sure it won't be as good as that beer was, but it seems like it's gonna damn well try to be (within what can be expected from this being a fruited "imperial gose," anyway).

This is brewed with blackberries, blueberries, and elderberries, so obviously a big component of the nose is a rather sizable jammy berry component. I'm actually pretty surprised of a couple things here, though. First off, there's a surprising coriander element here, and I appreciate that. It really helps drive home the point that this isn't just a fruited sour, but it's supposed to have at least something tangentially in common with the gose style. Granted there's also sea salt in here, but that's tough to smell, so I'll have to wait to sip this to figure out if it plays a role. The second interesting aside is that this actually smells like there's vanilla beans in it, but the label says nothing about lactose or vanilla. It does give me that "smoothie" vibe, though.

I'm kinda taken aback by how well this drinks and how nicely all of these flavors come together. Cowthulhu has a definite berry jam flavor profile, of course, but there are slight nuances, and it's not super-sour... it's just smooth and fruity in an endearing, well-built way. I pick up the somewhat grassy and funky note from the blueberries, for example, while there is a light dose of sweetness from the elderberries. This definitely has a mineral component as well, and I'm grateful for that as I was grateful for the coriander in the nose. These slight but important elements give this beer some gravitas and seem to indicate that this isn't just some goofy maximalist fruit beer. There's panache here, and actual brewing talent to boot. I'll have to grab some other Bolero Snort stuff at some point.\xa02,473 charactersichorNet, Oct 05, 2019']

name: THOT
review: ['4.05/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.3%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25truly one of the most unique beers i have had in a long time, and thats saying something because ive had some weird ones this year! this is a classic styled gose, lightly tart, briny, and incredibly sessionable with a light wheaty body, near perfect dryness, and a nice low abv. what makes it interesting and special, is the inclusion of a whole mess of heirloom tomatoes, some of which were apparently smoked. i love a good field beer, and this is certainly that! i aint scared! the tomatoes dont seem to influence the appearance much, it looks a touch flat and maybe lightly orange, but its not red or pulpy, apparently cleaned up pretty nicely. i can smell the smoke and the tomato vine aspect, and i get the acidity of the tomato right away in the flavor with the lactic sourness, which is very clean and professionally done here. the tomato flavor is very natural, which it needs to be for this to be good, and i can taste the ripe flesh for sure. the smoked part is subtle but adds some cool nuance, and there is an almost bloody mary vibe here, herbal, citrusy, even a black pepper hint. this is very natural and organic tasting to me, really well proportioned with the tomato, and refreshing oddly enough, i drink one, and i want another right away. ingredients like this have been underutilized i think, and its nice to see a brewer use them so confidently and effectively. i thought this was awesome, it helps that the base beer is excellent, but this was a real treat!\xa01,479 charactersStonedTrippin, Oct 18, 2017']

name: Pacific Ocean Blue Gose
review:
['4.05/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.3%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25a gose made with seawater, not the first one i have seen but almost assuredly the best, this is really good beer, and another winner from these guys, who it took me forever to get into because of the prices, but i am fully on board now! not sure how much seawater they used, but it had to have an impact on mash chemistry i would think. there are some tannins in here but more from oak than grain for my palate, so im not sure the story of the seawater there, but the brine character of this is undeniable, more intense than many, loaded with earthy minerals and almost tangy saltiness. the sourness here is clean, middle of the road on acidity, and aiding the minerals and the salt and the oak, bringing all of that to the fore. the oak is great, a white wine note to it, and a rather robust taste to it, all the way through this, making it a little heavy in the right spots, a nice contrast to the clean oceanic elements and the lemony citrus of the lacto. some coriander here too i reckon, toasted and herbal at the same time, follows the intensity. complex in the sense it has some funk to it as well, and oak on gose is becoming something i really like, giving a little more depth to the style. these guys did a great job with this, and while i want to know more about the use of seawater in the process, i think the beer overall is exceptional, pungently flavorful yet quite drinkable. yum!\xa01,396 charactersStonedTrippin, Oct 23, 2018', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4$ 15.70 (Including shipping)/corked AND capped 750 mL bottle ($ 0.606/oz) from Tavour, Seattle, WA.
Undated bottle but the cork is dated “2017”. Stored at 42 degrees prior to consumption and served at 42 degrees in a hand-washed and hand-dried Jester King snifter. 
Appearance – 4.
Body – Light yellow, hazy.
Head – Exists for only a few seconds past the end of the pour – small (Maximum < one cm, controlled center pour), off-white, fizzy, leaves neither ring nor layer.
Lacing – None.
First pour – Very light yellow, nearly colorless, clear.
Aroma – 4 – Similar to an ocean breeze minus the fish – a bit of spice and vinegar.
Flavor – 4 – Begins salty and sour, becomes sweeter in the middle with an oakiness that lasts to the end. Very good. No malt, no alcohol, no diacetyl, no dimethylsulfide.
Palate – 4 – Light to medium, watery, lively carbonation.
Impression and summation – 4 – A well-made and tasty gose with a well-designed label.\xa0980 charactersOzzylizard, Jun 09, 2018']
