name: Is This Beer?
review:
['4.18/5\xa0\xa0rDev +10%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.2512 oz can with “DOB” dating of 2-8-19

Red raspberry colored pour with a lasting red hued cap, initially a bit fizzy, with bubbles continuing to rise. 

Mixed fruit on the sniff.

Refreshing, light, mildly tart, fruited up brew, with raspberries, blueberries, and lime coming to mind...tasty, different and well worth a try.\xa0329 charactersBillolick, Apr 02, 2019', '3.83/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.8%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 3.75On tap at Swiftwater Brewing in Rochester, NY.

This one pours a vivid and opaque dark red color, with a small head and not much lacing.

This smells mostly like juicy and sweet raspberry, and not much else. There’s a hint of lime, but not much in the aroma that would suggest a gose or even a beer.

This is definitely delicious, but it’s so simple that it’s almksr boring. I’d want more sourness, more funk, more lime, more everything.

This is crisp and clean, and very drinkable, with a decent level of drinkability.

This is pretty basic but still tasty enough anyway.\xa0581 charactersGreesyFizeek, Jul 14, 2018']

name: Stops And Goes
review:
["3.74/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.8%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75Appearance: It has a nice hazy pale golden/yellow color to it. It has a nice thick off-white head that dies down slowly and leaves some spotty lacing.

Smell: The aromas definitely give out hints of wheat malts, a light lemony tartness and some herbal undertones. 

Taste: Like the aromas, it has wheat malts upfront, followed by a subtle lemon tartness, light herbal notes and a faint saltiness. 

Mouthfeel: It has a low carbonation with a nice overall balance and feel. 

Drinkability: It's a very smooth drinkable beer accompanied by good flavors and aromas. This will be great in the summer heat. 

Serving type: Can\xa0621 charactersSebD, Jan 06, 2016"]

name: Strawberry Margarita Popsicle
review:
["4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.9%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25L: Had this beer on-tap at The Answer Brewpub, poured into a snifter glass. Had a reddish color and thick consistency. Kind of looked like a smoothie. There was a quarter inch of off white, foamy, fairly long-lasting head.

S: An interesting aroma of strawberries, sea salt, and citrus fruit.

T: Tasted of the typical gose saltiness (quite evident in the finish), a lot of strawberries, a hint of wheat (not that much), and lots of citrus (lemon, lime, orange). An extremely fruit-centric flavor that's light and playful. It does taste like a margarita (to an extent) and is extremely lively.

F: A well-carbonated beer with a somewhat slick finish. Light-bodied.

O: If you're a gose purist, you might want to avoid this one. Everyone else should give it a try.\xa0763 charactersavalon07, Aug 20, 2017"]

name: Bro-Ham
review:
["3.31/5\xa0\xa0rDev -21.4%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.2512 ounce can - $2.49 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia.

02/27/19.

Appearance: Pours a golden-orange body with a slight haze about it. Scant, short-lived, white head.

Smell: Wheat malt, lightly toasted grain. Slightly sweet-scented accent of honey with a kiss of salt-sprinkled citrus and only a mild sniff of lacto.

Taste: Wheat, a little bite of toast and a bit of honeyish sweetness. Amongst the modest lactic quality is a faint, faintly candyish blood orange character with some far subtler lime. Sturdy background salinity. None of the flavors really quite pop, with the citrus quickly receding, leaving just a taste is a little sweet, a little salty and not all that much else.

Mouthfeel: Light-bodied. Medium-light carbonation.

Overall: Eee. I'd like it tighter and brighter, let's be honest. Good salinity, though! I can't fault that salt.\xa0860 charactersChainGangGuy, Apr 12, 2019"]

name: Nino’s Prickly Pears
review:
['3.84/5\xa0\xa0rDev +13.6%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75New 4 x 12 Stable Street Dock Hands Beer Sunday (Week 689) is progressing nicely and this marks the seCANd-to-last installment for this phase of today's evolution. I read a local gasbag proclaiming that Goses are now at the same level of proliferation as (A)IPAs & they are therefore passé. 8=O Who are these self-proclaimed experts, anyway? Hey, I will be the first to admit that Gose is not my go-to style, but to pooh-pooh what others like under the auspices of journalism?!? I have found that since I stepped down as a writer, I am increasingly disinterested in reading others' musings. I CANnot tell you the last time that I bought a beer magazine. It is like the old saw: I read where heavy and repeated imbibing CAN have negative effects on one's health, so I gave up ... on reading!

From the CAN: "Gose brewed with Prickly Pear"; "'Beer has virtue only in giving its victims more of the good-natured stupidity of the idiot and less of the demoniac frenzy of the madman.' - Lyman Beecher"; "Nino’s Prickly Pears is inspired by the enchanting world of Sicily, the birthplace of Dock Street founder Rosemarie Certo. Pours a deep pink with a similarly-tinged white head. A mild aroma of tart fruit leads to clear flavors of prickly pear and hints of watermelon. Light bodied and dry, the slight sweetness in this beer is balanced by a tart finish typical of the Gose style. Nino’s Prickly Pears is an escape from winter; evocative of semitropical Sicily and its scorching sun." 

I beCAN by lightly inverting this beer while still in the CAN since haziness is okay in the style. My Crack! of the vent gave me some light foaming so my efforts had paid off. I followed all of this up with an inverted Glug that raised a very quick, brief two fingers of pinkish off-white head with low retention, quickly reverting to wisps. Color was a slightly-hazy pinkish Yellow-Gold (SRM = 4 - 5 or N/A). Nose smelled like the spray of salt in heavy seas that I fell in love with in the Navy! There was an underlying tartness, but it was salty! Mouthfeel was thin-to-medium, actually big for the style. The taste was lightly tart, very much of watermelon, but without the usual cloying sweetness. I do not know what a prickly pear should taste like, but this was tasty! It was not hardcore tart and the flavors worked well together to make for a pleasant, easy-drinking beer. That said, 6.0% is on the high side for the style, so you should bear that in mind as a quaff CANsideration. Finish was semi-dry, but on the edge of semi-sweet! I got hints of honey to go along with the watermelon & salt. Mmm.\xa02,597 characterswoodychandler, May 07, 2018', '4.14/5\xa0\xa0rDev +22.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4.25Pours a really lovely toned down ruby red color, little to no head. Scent is strong with fruity notes such as kiwi and raspberry and honey like sweetness. Taste mellows down the fruit a bit - kiwi at the front, red raspberry at the back end, faint notes of dark fried fruit, moderate honey like sweetness. Lighter side of medium, could use a touch more carbonation. Unique, exciting and refreshing - would enjoy more.\xa0417 charactersrfgetz, Jan 21, 2013']

name: Two Up Two Down
review:
['3.55/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.6%look: 3 | smell: 3 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5I don't see a date listed on the can.

Appearance: The body is hazy gold and it has a very short head that quickly fizzles out to nothing.

Aroma: It smells a bit like passion fruit and souring mellons.

Taste: It tastes like peach, pineapple, mango, and a bit of tangerine. It tastes a lot like a fruit cup.

Mouthfeel: The beer is only a tad sour, is light, and easy to drink. The sourness builds up a little bit as the beer is consumed but it stays well restrained. There is a very light acidity to the beer.

Overall: The can states this is a "Gose Style Ale with Pineapple, Guava, and Grapefruit." It has a lot of fruit character which seems to even surpass the fruits that were added. It is a nice fruity, tropical, enjoyable beer. I would drink it again on occasion and I would recommend it. It would work best as a beer to drink by a pool or on a hot Summer day.\xa0870 charactersteromous, Oct 25, 2019', "3.83/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.3%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 3.75L: Poured from a tallboy can to a cylinder glass. Had a golden yellow / amber color and a slightly hazy consistency. There was a half inch of foamy head that lasted an average amount of time. Not much lacing to speak of.

S: A good, but not great, aroma of citrus fruit, wheat, tropical fruit, and salt.

T: Tasted of a decent bit of tropical fruit (pineapple, in particular), some wheat notes (present throughout, though subtle), a hint of salt (briny, not a big factor), and a good amount of citrus fruit (grapefruit). A lively, if somewhat unfocused, flavor. Some of the fruit elements don't always come through, but it's still not a bad taste.

F: A well-carbonated beer with a sharp finish. Medium-bodied.

O: An uneven beer, but still interesting. Worth a shot.\xa0767 charactersavalon07, Oct 22, 2019", "3.9/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.6%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Hazy golden color with short lived white foam. Aroma is briny and fruity with a bit of booze. Taste starts quite salty followed by tropical fruit notes. Finish has some fruit seed bitterness which lingers on the aftertaste along the tropical notes. Medium body and carbonation. A bit boozy and the bitterness doesn't fit too well between the other flavors.\xa0356 charactersCiocanelu, Dec 13, 2018", '4.08/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.3%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4This seemed pretty interesting, and the new (to my area) Commonwealth Brewing Co. has yet to really let me down, so I grabbed a single to give a try. This is a strong gose-style ale with pineapple, guava and grapefruit.

Pours a hazy deep yellow/golden color with a thin head of white foam that bubbles away to essentially nothing. However, incredibly tenacious carbonation activity flourishes below the surface, with tons of tiny pinprick-size bubbles rising to the top of my glass, crowding the rim. The beer is not opaque, and is translucent enough to see even more evidence of these busy bubbles if I hold my glass up to light. Pretty cool looking stuff, though I definitely wish it had slightly more head retention.

The nose reminds me of Fla-vor-Ice-brand freezer pops I used to have when I was a kid. No joke, it literally smells exactly like those... talk about nostalgia! I get a lot of strangely-artificial blue raspberry here, for instance, which is really unusual. I can definitely see the pineapple addition, but the guava is a little muted. The grapefruit kind of stands out to me because it's so different from the other two fruits... it lends its tangy citrus note with aplomb. I think there's some coriander or something going on here, too, as it doesn't just smell like the fruit adjuncts or the typical "tangy lemon" element that fruited goses have. Interesting.

Sweet pineapple, mango and guava on the palate with a lot of intense, lingering pithiness. Grapefruit rind and salty minerality somehow gel really well here, lending an awesome bit of drinkability. This is super fruity and unique, with a well-done fruit treatment that nevertheless feels a little bit grater than the sum of its parts. Oh, and I'm really surprised that it's almost 7% ABV. There's a slight thickness to the body here, but the crisp carbonation keeps things rather grounded for most of the time I'm sipping at it. That said, it gets a little hairy as the beer starts to warm, which brings upon my palate a rather syrupy sensation. Still tasty, but something to consider. Though, at the same time, I wouldn't recommend chugging this one!\xa02,135 charactersichorNet, Aug 16, 2018', '3.86/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Gose with pineapple, pink guava, and grapefruit. Great aroma, salinity is there, and I appreciate the elevated ABC. Probably my favorite goes they have done so far\xa0163 charactersVeganUndead, Jul 08, 2018']

name: Watermelon Gose
review:
["4.47/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.4%look: 5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Served in a 16 ounce pub glass at the brewery. 

Hazy straw colored liquid with a wispy pale white head and film. Lace is there too. 5

Smells like a ton of watermelon, tartness, salt. Honestly, this smells awesome. 4.25

Kind of blown away here. This tastes awesome. So much watermelon it's unmistakeable and gives it a juicy, sweet fruitiness. But it's also nicely tart and they did not go gentle with the salt. The finish shows the wheatiness and a touch of mineral quality. I'm in love. 4.5

Already mentioned it but this is tart aplenty, salty, juicy, refreshing. It's 102 degrees outside and this combats the heat perfectly. 4.5

Maybe I'm hyping this, maybe not. Weather like today's will make a beer like this taste like it was poured from a growler from the hand of god. But despite the influence of the weather this is a standout beer. Excellent.\xa0856 charactersONovoMexicano, Jun 19, 2016"]

name: Watermelon Mint Gose
review: ["3.91/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.7516oz can, snifter glass. Pours a cloudy golden straw yellow body, one finger white head, good retention, not much lacing. Smell is a slight bit of pepper, watermelon, wheat, mild lactic acid, a bit of grain and mineral, and a bit more watermelon. The flavour works really nicely, a big dose of that distinct watermelon flavour, combined with a bit of lemon and mild-moderate lactic acidity turns it into a fairly mild watermelon Jolly Rancher. The mint adds a slight herbal and minerally balance to it as well. It's more than drinkable, very refreshing mint and mineral finish on the backend that is just slightly dry. Solidly constructed gose with a nice watermelon quotient. FYI, the mint is very mild here, if that is what worries you.\xa0738 charactersStevedore, Dec 12, 2018"]

name: Prince Of The Rodeo
review:
["3.54/5\xa0\xa0rDev -12.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5355ml can (@ 4% ABV) - they don't directly mention the Stampede in the marketing blurb, but the release coincides with the so-called 'Greatest Show on Earth'. A 'grapefruit gose'.

This beer pours a hazy, pale golden yellow colour, with a teeming tower of puffy, rather loosely foamy, and fizzy off-white head, which leaves a bit of scattered soap scum lace around the glass as it quickly dissipates.

It smells of soured, grainy, and crackery cereal malt, a bit of sugary lacto, ephemeral generic citrus rind, and very, very tame earthy, musty, and floral hop bitters. The taste is gritty and grainy pale malt, saltine crackers, soured milk (like the stuff I dumped out earlier today that expired in June), still hard to discern citric acid notes, and more well-understated earthy, leafy, and dead floral hoppiness.

The carbonation is pretty meek in its bored-seeming frothiness, the body a so-so medium weight, and generally smooth, as nothing really misbehaves to the point of causing concern here. It finishes off-dry, the malt and ghostly fruitiness keeping the home fires burning.

Overall - yeah, I think that they must have been a tad hungover from the aforementioned excuse to drink, I mean rodeo, and forgot to actually add any grapefruit to this offering. Because if the label didn't say so, I probably would not have even noticed. Besides that, an ok Gose (with apologies to OK Go - here it goes again).\xa01,421 charactersbiboergosum, Jul 18, 2018"]

name: Dub Mango
review:
['4.16/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.9%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4a nice beer here, a double fruited gose with what appears to be a whole heap of fresh mango. its orange in color, like orange juice really, almost pulpy looking and without a lot of head on it from the tap. it smells awesome, some light coriander and minerals from the salt, a very clean but quite subtle lactic souring, and all the sweet fleshy juicy mango natural as can be but dosed to the point of absurdity. the flavor is awesome too, so much mango from start to finish, and it warms up really well, a bit sweet but not desserty, and true to the ripe fruit all the way. the salt is real light, accenting the tartness and the fruit pretty well, but its overwhelmed by the fruit for sure. the coriander is somewhere in between, needed for complexity, this would be pretty one dimensional without it. nice balance of flavors and textures, it has a ton of body from all the fruit and not a ton of carbonation, but the acidity cuts it well enough to keep it drinkable. fun and flavorful brew for summer, i could see the same recipe working great with wine grapes, strawberries, and currants if they want to make a series out of it...\xa01,133 charactersStonedTrippin, Aug 07, 2018', '4.23/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.3%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25A - Pours a hazy golden orange with a one finger creamy white head. Light amount of sticky lacing.

S - Aroma is mango and sea salt.

T - The taste is mango, orange, corriander and sea salt.

M - Light body with medium carbonation. Soft mouthfeel with a crisp dry finish.

O - This is a very crushable gose. The mango adds a nice sweetness to pair perfectly with the salt.\xa0372 charactersTreyIsWilson, Jul 19, 2018']

name: Cranberry Rye Gose
review:
["4.34/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.1%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Pours a cloudy dark gold with slight reddish cast. A large topper of snow white foam takes its time relaxing to a thick cap that lasts. Ladder-like lace legs linger from successive sips and create a pretty pattern that persists.

Mmm, nice medium strength aroma that hits with tart cranberry, which is joined by wonderful citrus notes, and as the aroma recedes from nose the spicy rye shows up with a twist. A nice interplay of sour and tart weave through the bouquet.

Taste is a blast of cranberry tart quickly joined by general over ripe fruit funk notes, grapefruit, and bitter orange, The interplay of rye at the end of the sip and pith bitter, and lingering deep tart notes end things dry and delicious

Very soft on palate, med. carb. quite viscous, very refreshing, silky body, and an excellent finish that is clean as clean gets.

A joy of a beer that is the case of a master creating in the style he does best. The fruit doesn't overpower and is strikingly tasty. Very highly recommended.\xa01,004 characterscavedave, Mar 25, 2018", '5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +18.8%look: 5 | smell: 5 | taste: 5 | feel: 5 | overall: 5This and a few from two roads brewery are my number one beers right now. If you like sours, this is a great one to try. It is just the right amount of sour with a great fruity flavor.\xa0183 charactersjengel7210, Feb 24, 2018', '3.73/5\xa0\xa0rDev -11.4%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75A: The beer is hazy yellow in color and has a light amount of visible carbonation. It poured with a quarter finger high white head that died down, leaving a thin layer covering the surface and a narrow collar around the edge of the glass. 
S: Moderate aromas of sour cranberries are present in the nose. 
T: The taste has a light amount of sourness with notes of cranberries and faint bits of salt. 
M: It feels light- to medium-bodied on the palate and has a moderate amount of carbonation. 
O: This is an interesting beer for the holidays. I didn’t get any of the spicy rye, but the aromas and flavors of cranberries where nice and it wasn’t overly sour. 

Serving type: bottle\xa0683 charactersmetter98, Dec 24, 2017']

['3.42/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.5A very subdued quaff. Peach Amber looking under a moderate head, no lace. A somewhat earthy nose, that carries over to the taste. Dry, slightly metallic, watery in character. Smoke? None of that really. A bit of fruitiness. But mostly meh.\xa0239 charactersTerryW, Apr 19, 2019', "3.64/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.75600 mL bottle from the LCBO; dated Oct 11 2018 and served slightly chilled. A 6.7% gose? Seems a little high, but who am I to judge?

Pours a foggy medium gold, with half a finger of loose, soapy white foam rising to the top before falling apart within 90 seconds or so. A thin collar sticks around, as do a few scant swaths of lace; the surface is otherwise barren, save for a few patches of bubbly film. The nose is very subtle considering the beer's ingredients - there's faint suggestions of brine, woody bark and berries, as well as some earthy, patchouli-like notes, all of which are overlain by notes of wheaty bread and yeasty spice. Hints of smoke and acidity open up slightly as the glass warms (emphasis on 'slightly').

Interesting. There's a sturdy wheat malt backbone, imparting notes of doughy bread that help keep the profile centered in the midst of various much stranger flavours. The smoked myrrh is a common thread throughout the sip, as is the sea saltiness, though neither one is necessarily an overpowering feature - each outlasts the lingonberry fruitiness that comes through by mid-sip, carrying over into a spicy, rather herbal, woodsy back end. Smoked resin, salty brine and Belgian yeast spiciness characterize the finish and linger briefly into the aftertaste, along with a touch of boozy sweetness. Medium-full in body, with moderately low carbonation levels that provide a gentle bite to the mouthfeel, which is otherwise kind of frothy, thick and soft. Very little sourness; an issue I have noted in every single Beau's gose that I have tried. I'm starting to think it's deliberate.

Final Grade: 3.64, a B grade. I know that goses don't need to be puckeringly acidic, but without at least some semblance of sourness present, I didn't even feel like I was drinking a gose as I sipped my glass of 49° 54°. Rather, it felt more like some sort of smoked spiced/herbed beer with salt in it. That's not a dealbreaker or anything - and for what it's worth, I more or less enjoyed my glass - but I'd still have a hard time recommending this to anyone seeking out an honest-to-goodness gose. Still, it was unique enough to be worth a shot, and probably the best of the three Beau's goses I've tried.\xa02,226 charactersthehyperduck, Nov 27, 2018"]

name: Blood Orange Gose

name: Chimera - Fruit Salad
review:
["4.29/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.1%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25On tap at Mortalis Brewing in Avon, NY.

This one pours a slight reddish pink color, with a small head, and lots of lacing.

This smells like a million different fruits - I don't need to list them all. Strawberry and pineapple are clearly dominant and jump to the forefront.

This fun and tropical at its core. It feels like the strawberry and pineapple were used the most here, but there's definitely a touch of sweet cherry, and a solid enough amount of passionfruit. It's not really sour at all, with just a light soft tartness on the back end.

This is light bodied, very juicy, with a very good level of drinkability.

I wish I got more of the fruit here. What's there is great, though.\xa0691 charactersGreesyFizeek, Jun 28, 2019"]

name: Bleacher Creature
review:
['4.03/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.6%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4"Bleacher Creatures" draft at Smallbar. 
Same beer (Hallertau Blanc dry-hopped Troublesome), alias name outside of Sheffields.

Murky pale yellow, thin layer of foam with minimal spotty lace around the edges. 
Aroma has a lightly green herbal hop characteristic, outside of the usual wheaty lactic tartness. 
Taste carries a bit of the hop character too, vaguely herbal greenery in the background. Tart and wheaty. 
Soft feel, smooth and creamy, tart lactic bite. Overall this was a nice subtle variation, dry hopped sour ales are trendy but this one is subtle and very drinkable.\xa0580 charactersemerge077, Sep 30, 2016']

name: Salty Dog
review:
['3.49/5\xa0\xa0rDev -8.9%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Bottle version:
Pours hazy amber beer with nice off-white head, good to moderate retention, some laces.
Smell - wheat, cookies, salt, lemony, herbal.
Taste - slightly sour, coriander not found, lemony hop tones, a bit saline.
Light body, soft carbonation. Nothing interesting.

Tap version: 3.42 (3.75, 3.5, 3.25, 3.5, 3.5)
Pours slightly hazy amber beer with nice off-white head, moderate retention, some laces.
Smell - wheat, cookies, salt, lemony.
Taste - slightly sour, coriander not found, lemony hop tones.
Light body, soft carbonation. Nothing interesting.\xa0563 charactersDentist666, May 14, 2016', '4.06/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6%look: 3.5 | smell: 5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Pours hazy deep straw color with a very thin head, disappearing fast. Nice hoppy smell reminds apa. The taste is sour and salty (as it should be). Malty finish makes it close to sourkraut.\xa0188 charactersOleg85, Dec 31, 2015']

name: Seedless
review: ['4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25this beer was quite good with solid taste of watermelon. Good sweetness and definite drinkability. I really liked this beer and would most certainly drink it again.\xa0164 charactersnpolachek, Sep 19, 2019']

name: Elbe Gose
review:
["3.13/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.4%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3 | feel: 3 | overall: 3.25L- Pale straw, moderately cloudy. It's bottle-conditioned, in this case I chose to rest the beer for a week and pour gently to leave most of the sediment behind. Pours with 1Cm white fine-bubble head (ps which holds right to the end 10mins later).
S- It has 'that very yeasty smell', that earthiness, with a slight sour note within it.
T- DRY, wow! Not OTT hipster-hopping that can make my tongue curl as I wince, but the kind of dry you get from a double Gin+tonic mixed using a 1/2 measure of good tonic water; that gin+quinine dryness. Somewhere amongst this some mild fruit notes waft to and fro, perhaps some moderately sour apple.
F- Dry, refreshing.
O- Interesting as it's notably dry, yet the hop taste itself isn't as prominent as a typical hipster beer. The sour note adds a sense of dryness too as it resembles that found in soda water. This beer is certainly different, and if you like a very dry beer experience this could work for you. 
Bought from Hamburg airport, duty free, not in the main 'Drink' section but rather the 'Hamburg specialities' sub-section. 330ml bottle with export quality glass (quite heavy) BB: 08.2020\xa01,138 charactersJonnoWillsteed, Nov 15, 2019", "2.88/5\xa0\xa0rDev -14.8%look: 3 | smell: 3 | taste: 2.75 | feel: 2.75 | overall: 333cl brown glass bottle purchased at Craft Beer Store in Hamburg. 4.50% ABV.

Lemon, coriander, wheat (?), grassy hops. Refreshing, but a bit funky (gym sock does come to mind).

Slightly smacky, lightly tart, refreshing, smooth, wet. Light-bodied.

Highly drinkable, and a good beer for pairing with salad. But the salt and the coriander just don't come through.

C / AVERAGE\xa0376 characterskojevergas, Mar 15, 2016"]

name: Shamma Lima-A Lime-A (Gose)
review: ["4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev +21.4%look: 4.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25What a thirst-quenching brew! Just the right amount of salt, tart, carb and it's beautifuly clear. The lime is more than subtle and ends with almost a creamy balance, maybe a stretch but think key lime pie. This is the exact kind of brew I'm looking for while hanging by the pool or sitting outside during these warm winter days.\xa0329 charactersEyePeeAyBryan, Feb 16, 2015"]

name: Sour Skettles
review:
['2.72/5\xa0\xa0rDev -30.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 2.25 | taste: 2.75 | feel: 3 | overall: 2.75Hazy straw with little carbonation and a half finger of white head.

Smells of kids plastic toy, sour gum, and a hint of malt.

Tastes sour of guava, plastic toy, and a hint of Budweiser. Some fruitiness in the background, but model airplane glue remains through and through.

Light body, moderate carbonation.

Got in Sacramento, drinking in Redding, Nov 4th, 2018.\xa0367 characterspatre_tim, Nov 05, 2018', '4.16/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.9%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Canned 9/17/18
L: Golden straw yellow in color, Hazy appearance. A finger of a bubbly white cap with no lacing. 
S: Mute smelling but does have hints of guava. Slight yeasty/bread smell. 
T: Tart up front with guava/fruity finish that lingers. Really nice.
F: Smooth and easy to drink. Carbonation is moderate for the style. 
O: Very enjoyable and a good job by Barrel Brothers. I look forward to trying more offerings by them in terms of goses.. I am glad to have tried. Cheers!\xa0479 charactersTheBrewsky, Nov 03, 2018']

name: The Dare
review:
["4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.2%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25Pretty good gose. It's sour but not too sour. It does have just a little bit too much salt on the front end. Other than that it's a great beer. Will drink again.\xa0161 charactersdb00785, Jul 23, 2019", '4.4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Druthers Brewing Co. "The Dare"
on tap @ Druthers Brewing Co., Albany, NY on 4 June 2016

Notes: Hazy yellow body beneath a short head of white. The head retention and lacing are average. The nose is clean, if you can call it that, seeing as it has a slight sourness like you might find in a cider, and some salt alongside grainy wheat and background spice. It's at least not funky, shall we say? And the flavor follows. It's perfectly balanced between wheaty malt, tartness, and salt; and a delicate spiciness from coriander appears in the acidic, dry finish. Gose can be a hard style to pull off, and this is one of the better examples I've had.\xa0648 charactersNeroFiddled, Feb 01, 2017']

name: Gose In Different Area Codes
review:
['4.19/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.9%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Can.

A: Cucumber upfront, followed by a moderate lacto tangy sourness and noticeable salty finish. 

A: Deep golden, slightly hazy with with thinnish white head that quickly recedes into the glass and creates a very fine ring. 

T: The beer is crisp with moderate Cucumber, followed by a slightly sharp, tangy moderate lacto sourness that lingers and complements the salty finish.

M: Light bodied with moderately high carbonation with some effervescence. 

O: Pretty enjoyable! The cucumber nicely complements the tangy lacto sourness and salty finish. A little stronger, tangier and saltier than some goses, but this iteration came together pretty well. Very easy to drink!\xa0677 charactersPhil-Fresh, Jan 27, 2017']

name: Spittin Seeds
review:
['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.3%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Pours a light golden color. Mostly clear and nicely effervescent. Thick three finger sudsy white head dissipates quickly leaving no residual head. 

Aroma has notes of lightly salted watermelon and a hint of wheat. Not much else going on with the aroma. 

Taste is initially just a classic nose - you get wheat, salt, a bit of brine-y tartness. Towards the middle to the back end the watermelon flavor comes through and builds Gives the palate a mix of salty watermelon and tart wheat notes. Dry tart finish. 

Feel is slightly tart, producing just a slight puckering sensation. Body is light and crisp. Moderate carbonation. 

Overall this is a well made gose and the watermelon works really really well with the style. Its not their best gose since its a bit more subdued and watery than the others, but its still really nice. Hope this is a regular in the summer.\xa0866 charactersFBarber, Sep 07, 2019', '4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.9%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Tasted in a Rastal Teku from a one pint can on August 22, 2019. What goes better with watermelon than salt? Nothing. Great idea for a summer Gose. Recommended.\xa0160 charactersHopheadjeffery, Aug 27, 2019']

name: Gose
review: ['3.93/5\xa0\xa0rDev +10.4%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Bottle: Poured a clear light golden color ale with a medium size foamy head with light retention and no lacing. Aroma of light tart notes with some subtle salty notes. Taste is a nice mix of tart notes with subtle salty notes and light dry finish. Body is full for style with good carbonation. Very well brewed for the style with just enough character and good drinkability.\xa0374 charactersPhyl21ca, Feb 08, 2017']

name: Seed Spitter
review:
['3.7/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.9%look: 2.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.7512 oz can from NC ($2.25 at Crafty Beer Guys) -- very fresh with a May 2019 date. 
Pours with a hazy pale golden body and a weak head. 
Tart aroma with soft, ripe pitted fruit notes. 
Moderately tart and salty for style, yet relatively mild flavor; fruity with a nice bready base.\xa0280 characterschinchill, May 16, 2019', '3.69/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.7512 oz can

Pours hazy apple golden. No head retention. 

Smells of saltine cracker and tart citrus.

Flavor is of citrus, dry cracker malt, and a bright, clean melon finish. 

Light body, stinging carbonation on the tongue.

Light and refreshing. Really nice sessionable summer beer. Drinks very easy. Worth trying for that specific setting. Not sure I would go looking for it otherwise though.\xa0401 charactersCylinsier, Jul 21, 2018', "3.76/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4A: Pours a very lightly hazy medium golden honey in color with moderate to heavy amounts of active visible carbonation rising quickly from the bottom of the glass and faint pale pink + golden yellow colored highlights. The beer has a two finger tall fizzy sudsy foamy off-white head that quickly reduces to a large patch of slightly mottled thin film covering the entire surface of the beer and a thin ring at the edges of the glass. Light to moderate amounts of lacing are observed.

S: Light to moderate aromas of slightly artificial watermelon with a light aroma of briny saltiness and very light aromas of slightly sour wheat.

T: Upfront there is a light flavor of slightly sour wheat malts with a hint of grainy sweetness and a light amount of lacto tartness. That is followed by a light amount of brininess and a light to moderate flavor of natural + artificial watermelon flavors. There is a light amount of lingering briny tartness in the finish.

M: Light bodied with slightly heavier than moderate amounts of carbonation. Light amounts of acidic prickliness are present.

O: Pretty easy to drink and enjoyable though I've never been a salted watermelon guy so there might be something a little lost on me. Alcohol is well hidden and it would be great on a hot summer afternoon.\xa01,288 charactersdbrauneis, Sep 11, 2017"]

name: Imperial Lime Gose - Barrel-Aged
review: ['3.99/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.4%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Sampler size from Founders. Dark golden color with minimal head. Smell is some lime, citrus and an overall sweetness. Wow! Starts off sweet, barrel notes of juniper, wood. Finishes tart and slightly sour. Picture a tart and strong gin and tonic+margarita. Unique and worth a try.\xa0285 charactersstrohme2, Nov 02, 2017']

name: Salty Bog Cranberry Gose
review:
['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Lightly hazed gold with two fingers of ivory head. 
Smell is fruity and bready malts.
Taste is tart fruit cranberries with a fair malt support.
Mouthfeel is medium with good carbonation level. The finish is dry and balanced.
Overall a tasty gose. Canned on 05/28/19.\xa0266 charactersSpikester, Nov 07, 2019', '3.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev -12.9%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.25Thanks to Dan for this. 12oz can poured into 14oz teku. Poured a lightly cloudy pinkish-brown color with just a cap of off-white head that had no retention or lacing.

Light grain, fruit, and salt on the nose. Same on the palate. The body was the expected light, was crisp, and finished dry. Drinkability was fine, but not outstanding. Overall, a nice enough brew that would have benefited from a bit bolder cranberry presence. probably worth a shot if you see it.\xa0464 charactersbeertunes, Apr 30, 2019', "4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9.9%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4Poured into a stange.
The appearance was a glossy pink color with a sly transparency about it. Some carbonation could be seen rising to fill a modest finger's worth of white foamy head. The head dissolved fairly quick and didn't leave any lace.
The aroma had a fabulous blend of sweet to tart cranberry meshing with some sour-ed wheat and a touch of salt backing that up.
The flavor did a wonderful job of blending the sweet to the tart and allowing the salt come in nicely. Sour-ed wheat gets pushed back here. Nice aftertaste of cranberries, salt and a light touch of lemon.
The mouthfeel was about light bodied with a crushability almost like I barely witnessed before in this style, damn, I think I could pound about 30 of these or maybe I feel like I could do that.
Overall, this was so needed today. My hat goes off to Silver Moon, over there in Oregon, thanks for helping me bear this crushing heat right now.\xa0918 charactersLone_Freighter, Jun 30, 2018", "3.78/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75As one would expect, this thing pours pink. Deep pink with an orange tint, but pink. Luckily, I'm in the mood for thirst quenching and easy drinking more than anything else, and this looks like it was intended for just that. A pink influenced white and foamy head sits above, but only for a minute before giving in to it's Seltzer like inspired, clean, bubbly, and clear qualities. No lasting head, absolutely no lace, no worries.

Guess what. This smells exactly as you'd imagine. Tart cranberries, water impregnated with salt, and just a light hint of crushed wheat. Maybe a squeeze of lime.

Fittingly, it tastes as such, as well. I hate to be repetitive, but cranberries, salt water, and wheat. I will say that the cranberry does in fact take a slight back seat, which is nice, but not much more going on here.

The body is light, crisp, dry, and lively with carbonation. Clearly salty and tart, but with a mild fruity balance. Most importantly, it's refreshing and rediculously easy to drink.

I'm a fan of the Gose style, particularly an original, though fruited suits me just fine. I'd easily kill 12 of these in one day if I was out working in the yard, however today, I'm laying on a couch in my backyard staring at some trees and the sky with a slight breeze blowing on a 70° day. Ah what the hell... I'll have a few more.

Cheers.\xa01,355 charactersLingenbrau, May 06, 2018"]

name: Yoga Pants
review: ['3.66/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.2%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.75Pours a hazed light straw color with a white head that leaves behind some lacing. Aroma is of sour grains, wheat and a bit of peppery spice. Savory and sour flavors; vinegar, coriander, and lemon. Citrus, tartness, and earthy notes. Light bodied, kind of watery feel. Overall, this is a nice little beer. Gotta love yoga pants.\xa0333 charactersStinkypuss, Mar 11, 2016']

name: Pink Lemonade Pants
review:
['3.98/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Bottle

name: Strawberry Ginger Gose
review: ['3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.7516oz bottle. Poured out a slightly hazy, golden orange color with reddish highlights and a small head of foam. It smelled of sweet strawberries and ginger. Nice tart flavor with saltiness, ginger and strawberry.\xa0211 characterszeff80, Jun 14, 2018', '4.01/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.6%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Had on tap at the St Louis Hop Shop. name: Does It Come In Pink?
review:
['3.19/5\xa0\xa0rDev -9.1%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3On tap at Golden Road Brewing in Los Angeles, CA.

Pours a murky ruby red with a foamy reddish-white head that settles to wisps of film on top of the beer. Tiny dots of lace form around the glass on the drink down. Smell is of grain, earth, floral, and salt aromas. Taste is much the same with salt, floral, earth, and tomato sauce flavors on the finish. There is a mild amount of earth bitterness on the palate with each sip. This beer has a lower level of carbonation with a slightly crisp and medium bodied mouthfeel. Overall, this is an average beer with a salty tomato sauce flavor and virtually no tartness that I usually get from the style.

Serving type: on tap.\xa0670 charactersUCLABrewN84, Nov 22, 2014']

name: Orange Gose
review:
["4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev +11.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Pours a slightly cloudy deep amber coloration with a small, fizzy head that soon fades to nothing. Smells of biscuity malt and oranges, with just a hint of coriander as well. Taste follows the nose, being dominated by slightly sweet'ish biscuity malt and oranges, with a lighter note of coriander and just a hint of sea salt coming through as well. Finishes with a light acidity and some oranges and coriander lingering in the aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel with a medium body and carbonation.

This is a very nice and true to style understated Gose with a light acidity and a good orange presence, pepped up by a noticeable coriander presence and just a hint of salt. Very easy-drinking and refreshing.\xa0701 charactersSnowcrash000, Aug 20, 2019", '3.59/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.4%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Pours a cloudy deep orange color with a small top off white head that dissolves quickly. 
Aroma is of orange, zeest, corriander and some salt. 
The flavour is fruity with notes of oranges and slightly sour. It is some slight salt notes in the flavour as well as some notes of corriander. 
The finish has some citric bitterness. Aftertaste dissappear quickly. 
Smooth and fresh mouthfeel with a prickly carbonation and a light body. 
Not my typical beerstyle, but very refreshing on a hot summer day.\xa0501 charactersOlaB, Aug 02, 2019']

name: Dragon Fruit Gose
review:
["4.27/5\xa0\xa0rDev +10.6%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25On tap at the brewery taproom in Hanoi.
Pours with a clear red body that looks like cranberry juice with water. Decent pinkish white head.
Rich fruity aroma with a moderately tart, clean, fruity flavor.
Overall: best dragon fruit beverage I've ever tasted.\xa0256 characterschinchill, Oct 24, 2019", "3.58/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.3%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75On-draught @ the brewpub. 175ml for 45000 VND (like other PSBC beers, this is one of the priciest in the entire country).

Gose. 3.80% ABV. 

APPEARANCE: Presents with no head - just an off-white floater ring signalling the head's less than 5 second retention. No lacing.

Body colour is a pinkish peach of average vibrance. No yeast or lees are visible within. Translucent and semitransparent.

AROMA: Pleasant smacky Lactobacillus bacteria immediately announces itself. Salty without being meaty or briney. Bright Fruity character is lovely, but I wouldn't recognize it as dragonfruit in a blind tasting. Sourness seems moderate (~4/10 in terms of intensity).

The coriander suggested on PSBC's description never emerges.

Suggests a great gose with a superb balance of sour, salt, and fruit, even if the depth of flavour doesn't seem to be as on point as the finest expressions of the style.

Aromatic intensity is mild (apt for the style).

TASTE & TEXTURE: Lovely. The dragonfruit does come through, lending this superb gose a unique memorable flavour. They committed to the salt, but it only aids the refreshing vibe of the brew. Coriander? No, but who cares? 

Neutral wheat glues this together, giving it a light bodied backbone that bends whimsically to the Lactobacillus bacteria pulling the strings in this build. Sourness isn't puckering, but it's apt for the style, coming in at about a 5/10 in terms of intensity. A nice lactic smackiness accompanies the bacteria.

Balanced, well-built, approachable. Smooth, wet, well-carbonated. There's a natural harmony of acidic texture to twangy sour taste here.

OVERALL: In short, it's well-executed across the board, though there's ample room for more depth and expressiveness of flavour; dragonfruit in this gose is not as evocative as, say, blood orange is in Anderson Valley's.

Highly drinkable. Would make a superb summer brew.

The dragonfruit sets this apart from the other gosebiere in this recent craft beer trend, and I have to say I prefer this to many American expressions of the style. Hat tip to PSBC for a job well done, but let's bring that price down to local norms, eh?

B (3.58) / GOOD\xa02,161 characterskojevergas, Jul 14, 2016"]

name: Tide Flats
review:
['3.58/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.5%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.7516oz bottle poured into 20oa Duvel tulip. Poured a pleasantly murky dark straw-gold color, with less than a half-inch of white head that that had moderate retention, and no lacing. I sent one of these to @LloydDobler as his "blind beer" in NBS BIF #6: Roadrunner vs Coyote.

This Gose is certainly salty; the fact that the brewery is only a couple miles from the oyster farm ( http://draytonharboroysters.com/ ), from whence the "liquor" was obtained is a clear factor. Nice grain base. Enough salt to notice, but not enough to overwhelm.

Crisp, clean body, with a nice dry finish. I know that this is a sucky review, but, this is a tricky beer to rate. It's enjoyable, I'll grab more. If ya want one, message me.\xa0714 charactersbeertunes, Oct 15, 2017', "4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Blind tasting notes. 
Bottle courtesy of beertunes

Pale yellow with a ton of head. Slightly murky. Soooo freakin foamy. Nose is lemon, poppy, coriander, sourdough. Taste is sour and funky but dry. Tomato??? Sour lemon michelada is my guess. My mind must be playing tricks on me, or something. I had a margarita gose this weekend so the tartness took me right back to there. Gotta take a second pour before ripping off the label. Very salty, so it's a gose for sure. Maybe a kettle soured salted tomato. I really don't fucking know. Chalky and slightly milky. Tasty, but bizarre brew.\xa0584 charactersLloydDobler, Oct 09, 2017"]

name: Quiet Riot
review: ['4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.1%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Certainly not traditional (for a gose), but very tasty and hit all the right marks when I was in the mood for a refreshing, bright, tart, and fruity beer. Strong overripe passionfruit, citrus zest, pink guava, and lime juice notes on both the nose and tongue, with just the right amount of salinity. A nice combination of tart, sour, funky, sweet, and fruity, with no heavy lean in one direction (tart, funky, and fruity probably make up a majority of the overall experience). And a very exotic looking and feeling beer, though still very light and refreshing. Winner, winner.\xa0580 charactersAmeriCanadian, Sep 09, 2019']

name: Zrbtt
review:
["3.84/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.7512 FL OZ can
Served in a Michigan Wolverines football pint glass

This beer pours copper colored with a rose tint to it and an ever so slight haze. It is topped with an inch of off white head that leaves no lacing.

It's a nose full of raspberries.

The taste starts out like a raspberry ale. The tartness finally creeps in on the finish and lingers a little into the aftertaste.

Medium bodied with a syrupy mouthfeel

This is not a real exciting beer from Batch. I suspect that it would be better on a hot summer day than on a dreary fall football Saturday. Regardless, Go Blue!\xa0580 charactersbuschbeer, Nov 24, 2018", '3.98/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Poured from take-home 40 oz bottle to tulip glass. Pours a hazy, deep pink color with a finger of fizzy foam that dissappears quickly and leaves no lacing behind. Nice aromas: fruity berries, wheat, biscuit, and something funky. Flavors roll and evolve as liquid warms. Raspberry, white grape, tart tang, wheat cracker, salt, floral and earthy funkiness. Lactose sweetness gives way to salty kick and funky tartness. The balance between the three is quite nice.\xa0461 charactersTripel_Threat, Sep 27, 2018', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 412 ounce can into tulip glass; no can dating, but is a recent release. Pours slightly hazy reddish/pinkish orange color with a 1 finger fairly dense and fluffy light pink head with good retention, that reduces to a thin spotty lace cap that lingers. Nice spotty lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of juicy/tart/tangy raspberries, fruit skin/seeds, lemon, lime, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white wine, sea salt, coriander, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, lightly toasted biscuit, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of raspberries, fruity/acidic yeast, lactose, pale/wheat malts, and light-moderate coriander/salt notes; with great strength. Taste of juicy/tart/tangy raspberries, fruit skin/seeds, lemon, lime, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white wine, sea salt, coriander, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, lightly toasted biscuit, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness; light fruit tang, and coriander spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of juicy raspberries, fruit skin/seeds, lemon, lime, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white wine, sea salt, coriander, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, lightly toasted biscuit, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Great complexity, robustness, and balance of raspberries, fruity/acidic yeast, lastose, pale/wheat malts, and light-moderate coriander/salt flavors; with an awesome malt/tartness and tangy fruit balance; with no puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp/clean finishing. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering tartness, tangy fruit, and spiciness. Medium carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately bready/grainy, fairly acidic/tangy, and lightly saline/tannic balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol for 6.1%. Overall this is an excellent gose. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of raspberries, fruity/acidic yeast, pale/wheat malts, and light-moderate coriander/salt flavors; very smooth, refreshing, and fairly crisp/clean to drink; with the mellowly acidic/tangy/drying finish. Not overly lactic or salty. Great balance of authentic juicy raspberries, lacto, and pale/wheat malts against acidity. Not as jammy as I expected, but still delicious. A very enjoyable offering, and spot on style example.\xa02,465 characterssuperspak, Sep 22, 2018']

name: OG

["4.07/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4L - Pours little to no head and is dark yellow and hazy

name: Mezkin Blackbird
review:
["4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.4%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25This is a wow beer.

Opaque violet with a large, airy pastel purple froth dying to a ring leaving some arms on the glass.

Smell is lemon-lime, gin, blackberry and a savory herb bouquet.

This one's just salivatingly tart with an herbal spike that leads into the blackberry, lemon-lime and a very gin-like character, without the booze.

Medium to full of body, this Mezkin's got a tingly fizz and a semi-dry tang.\xa0413 charactersSabtos, Mar 15, 2018"]

name: Lime Gose
review: ['4.03/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8.6%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 412 ounce can into tulip glass, canned on 4/16/2019. Pours fairly hazy medium golden yellow color with a 2 finger dense, creamy, and rocky white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a large cap that lasts. Thick foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of big tart/sour limes, citrus peel/zest, lemon, peach, pear, apricot, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, coriander, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of limes, fruity/acidic yeast, coriander, sea salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big tart/sour limes, citrus peel/zest, lemon, peach, pear, apricot, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, coriander, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang, and coriander spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart limes, citrus peel/zest, lemon, peach, pear, apricot, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, coriander, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Great complexity, robustness, and balance of limes, fruity/acidic yeast, coriander, sea salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; with an awesome malt/tart/spiciness and tangy fruit balance; with no puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering tart/spiciness and tangy fruit. Medium-plus carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/grainy, fairly crisp/acidic/tangy/sticky, and lightly saline mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5%. Overall this is an excellent fruited gose. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of limes, fruity/acidic yeast, coriander, sea salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth, refreshing, and fairly crisp to drink with the modestly acidic/tangy/drying finish; not overly lactic/salty. Very flavorful and not watery for the ABV. Great balance between vibrant limes, Lacto complexity, and coriander spice; with a nice sized pale/wheat malt backbone against acidity for the ABV. Minimal residual sweetness with crisp dryness. A very enjoyable offering, and spot on style example as expected.\xa02,489 characterssuperspak, May 03, 2019']

name: Mass Whole Red Tide
review:
["3.54/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5Tap at the brewery.

Decent fluffy fizzy head, little creamy, murky auburn chestnut color. 

Nose strange, toasty grainy malt notes, herbal grassy, mild spices, sweet candy fruity notes, eventually a mild briny seaweed note. 

Taste brings sweet candy malts, mildly sweet, caramel and toasty, reddish malts, with fair spicy like hops, background is a strange yeasty herbal thing, hint of tangy, little briny note in the background. Finish brings a bit more of a briny salty note, hint tangy, little spicy earthy hop, herbal notes and sticky malts lingering. 

Mouth is med bod, little syrupy, decent carb. 

Overall well it's not really anything like a gose, too malty, too Hoppy, sticky and not really sour, the seaweed is light thankfully and interesting, but not really what I was expecting for a gose.\xa0805 charactersjlindros, Sep 05, 2015", "3.76/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.3%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 3.25Enjoyed at the brewery. I remember Ben talking about the plans for this beer, using cape cod sea salt and sea weed. Glad to see it finally happened. 

A - Poured a nice hazy reddish rusty hue with a thin head that fades slowly to leave a thin halo. I dig this color. 

S - Aromas of light salt, nice brine notes, maybe a little bit of caramel and malt sweetness. Hmm...

T - Taste is similar to the nose, the salt is rather mild, light acidity. The malt profile here is much heavier than normal gose beers, which offers some caramel sweetness that I suppose balances out the traditional gose notes. 

M - Mouthfeel is brightly carbonated, very crisp. 

O - Overall this beer was one I was really looking forward to, however, the malts really get in the way of what makes a gose a gose. The salt level isn't bad but I miss the nice punch that other gose offer (ie Westbrook). I could see this working as a gruit (as they can have seaweed) but with this malt backbone it's hard to think gose. 

Serving type: on tap\xa01,013 charactersrudzud, Aug 28, 2015"]

name: Dream Cannon No. 3: Star Burst
review:
['3.84/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 416 oz can

Pours hazy punch red, pinkish white head is fine and dissipates to a lacing.

Smells of various tart and sweet fruit juices including apple, orange, pineapple, passion fruit, and strawberry.

Tastes of tart mixed fruit juices. Like a tart punch with a sourdough and cracker malt undertone.

Light to medium body with fizzy carbonation on the tongue.

This is pretty enjoyable and drinks really easy. Not very beer-like or especially sour. But definitely something worth trying. I would probably drink this again when I am in the mood for something different than beer flavors. The fruit flavors are very clean and not artificial.\xa0645 charactersCylinsier, Jan 10, 2019']

name: Slushee Fund
review:
['3.65/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.4%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 3 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.5C: deep Amber with great clarity
S: refreshing sour cherry
T: very mild, quick cherry to lime transition finishing with a bit of salt. Mild sour disappeares with not much zing.
M: clean and refreshing with a lace left in the back of the mouth.
O: good daytime gose in a hammock on a hot day. Good entry level hose.\xa0316 charactersSouthernchugs, Jul 03, 2019']

name: Silly People
review: ['4.02/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.5%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 4a unique gose here with french grey sea salt and lemon peel, and a somewhat more interesting fermentation profile than is common in these. instead of just a front end lactic thing, its got a little funk, a bit of saison character as well, not quite a phenol but an ester, some green pear, and some light sweetness, its distinctive for sure, but still is obviously a gose, off color is so good at doing that in their beers! the salt is high mineral, there is a light olive brine thing, a green olive sort of vegetal aspect too, and some real tang. the lemon peel makes it fresh and zesty and zippy, but also a little bitter, which is an interesting layer in a gose. the wheat malt has some light honey sweetness to it, but is dry by the end. a little yogurt sort of funkiness and twang, maybe even a little bretty thing going on, but young to me. i love the pucker, its just right for this, and there are stone fruit and white grape layers here as well. i wish it was more carbonated, its not still but its not as lively as the flavors seem to want either, and with the sourness it drags in texture just a little bit. more effervescence would make this amazing. the flavors rule though, this is subtly unique, and really good. i love off color, they dont seem to get enough credit for being one of the best, they really are. great take on the style here, but all their own. nice with spicy curry whole fish!\xa01,406 charactersStonedTrippin, Nov 08, 2019']

name: Breakside Gose
review:
['3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75better than its ratings. i think people have forgotten how a basic gose is supposed to taste, everyone wants to barrel age them in tequila, spike them with vanilla and milk sugar, and add all kinds of esoteric fruits and veggies into them, lost are the beers like this, the pure and straight up examples of the style. sure this might be a little bland by some standards, but the proportions are right and its mighty traditional and drinkable, which is more and more what i am looking for in this style. this one is really pale, clearer as they go, with a short but spritzing white layer of bubbles on top. it smell and tastes real clean on the souring and the ferment, with some tart lemon character to it, some minerals from the salt, and a lightly floral element. not at all too sour, although acidity is probably above the average in the style right now, it sure doesnt impede drinkability at all. i know breaskside for quality in everything they do, and that continues here. sometimes less is more, and that is absolutely the case with this. a throwback to a few years ago when everyone discovered the style in its purest form for the first time. understated, but in a good way. summery and light.\xa01,201 charactersStonedTrippin, Sep 27, 2018', "3.8/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8.3%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4On Draft at Belmont Station, served in a tulip.

I have fallen in love this style as of late. 

A: Staw colored, reminds me of a glass pineapple juice (minus the pulp). Thin white head that quickly dissapears.

S: Faint hint of sour, but not the main aroma. Lemon zest, starfruit and faint seashore dominate.

T: This is where this beer shines. You can taste the wheat backbone, but the citrus/apple flavors wash delicately over the tounge. The coriander is almost undetectable, but it is there. 

M: Mild fizzy carbonation keeps the mouthfeel light and effervescent.

O: Maybe its a a mental thing, but the salt left on the lips reminds me of being at the coast, and this is exactly the type of beer I'd be drinking. A great summer beer that I will be enjoying more of in the near future.\xa0791 characterstcampbel1, Aug 15, 2011"]

name: Watermelon Spritzer
review:
["4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Taking on summer head first and just like a pro, Evil Twin brewers whip up the perfect dog days defeat with a sour German styled ale with a generous soaking of watermelon juice. 

Pale gold and with hardly any suggestion of red fruit in sight, Watermelon Spritzer graces the nose with a radiant, vibrant and highly aromatic perfume of the finest watermelon imaginable, along with hints of white wine, cider and green fruit. With a gentle drift of sea air, the nose soon gives way to a brisk sweetness of light taffy, honey and agave.

Then as the ale washes the middle palate, a huge burst of watermelon comes with the fruity juiciness of the red fruit candy, but without its sweetness. Instead, a clean and acidic flavor of crabapple, gooseberry, white grape, lime and lemon transforms the watermelon into a sour and pickled rind episode. Without much sweetness, the light sourdough maltiness fuses with a rounded salinity to amplify the overall character of watermelon in the absence of much sweetness.

Light bodied and insistent upon holding onto a mild bready creaminess, the beer's overall character is that of an expressively carbonated watermelon cider or wine, much like a fine sangria or simple cocktail. As a perfect thirst quencher, this highly refreshing, highly drinkable ale wins the war of summer.\xa01,313 charactersBEERchitect, Sep 19, 2019"]

name: Peach Gose
review: ['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.8%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Poured from the tap into a tulip glass at Taco Mac in Smyrna, GA. The appearance is a slightly murky golden color with a small white head. The aroma is very big on the peach smell. The flavor follows the aroma. Maybe to "fruity" for some. I found it to be very good.\xa0271 charactersordybill, Aug 23, 2016']

name: Shade Blackberry Tart Ale
review:
["3.73/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75There they go, throwing shade all over the spring season. And this time, that overcast comes with the flavor of blackberries that layer over a German styled sour ale with gentle additions of sea salt for heft and roundness.

MadTree's Shade, Blackberry Tart edition pours with a hazy lavender color and a fluffy ivory froth. Blueberry aromas abound along with the tangy underling scent of citrus, cider, wine and an overall wine cooler character. Moderately sweet and wheaten, the bready taste of pastry crust comes with aspects of saltwater taffy and nectar.

The sweetness slowly relaxes and the sourness pulls slightly ahead for a moderately sour tone that brings a brightness to the robust blackberry flavors. Lemon, apple, white grape and under ripened berries all complete the bulk of flavors while the roundness of sea salt brings a gentle brine to the late palate.

Low in bitter, the medium bodied beer carries a not-so dry an not-so sweet taste through a somewhat watery texture that extends on the palate with a sensation of flat wine spritzers and kool-aid. Where they understand the genuine character of the gose style, the beer simply falls a little flat.\xa01,169 charactersBEERchitect, Mar 26, 2019"]

name: Mango Mosaic Goseface Killah
review:
['4.34/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.8%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Had on tap at Aurora in a flight. Not best way to try; but favorably impressed. Enjoyed their Gose, but thought the Mango iteration was delicious; and didnt take on some of the puréed fruit character and body that is more prevalent today. Enjoyable refreshing lactic tart Gose with very tasty tropical notes. Well done.\xa0321 charactersBillRoth, Aug 15, 2019', "4.13/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4On tap at Aurora Ale and Lager Co in King Ferry, NY.

This one pours an incredibly hazy golden and milky yellow color, with a small head, and lots of lacing.

This smells like tart but mostly sweet mango, vanilla, lemon, and citrus.

This is a bit over the top, but still pretty delicious. The mango is done well, with a nice creamy juiciness, and just a touch of tartness. This is obviously not traditional in the slightest, as I get no salt or salinity or anything like that. It's nicely citrusy, though, with a very light acidity.

This is creamy, and really drinkable, with a fairly full body.

This is super gloopy, but still worth a look for sure.\xa0653 charactersGreesyFizeek, Jul 01, 2019"]

name: There Gose The Snow
review: ['3.73/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75drinkable for the style, interestingly served to me in a pint glass, uncommon for the style, and the second new beer i have had from telluride in the last week, they must be ramping up the innovation side of things after a long but steady period of the same stuff over and over, it got a little tired, so this seems well times. its weird to me that so many gose types have plums in them all of a sudden, i have seen at least two roads and weldwerks with the same thing, if not a few more around town of late, is there a sale on plums or something i should know about going on? this one is pink and a little hazy, not as bright as some, and fizzy more like a soda than a beer in the glass. aroma and flavor are only lightly tart, clean enough and all, but barely even sour, well below the average for the style. the plum is nice, but it too is rather subtle, and the salt i am used to in the style is hardly there at all. some other sort of yeast esters here too, a little gritty texture to it, thin in a way, not much from the wheat malt, maybe dumbed down a little bit, but i prefer this to bracing acidity or forced fruit. the plum is natural and tastes good, no cheesy lactic elements here either, its professionally done, just maybe a little safe. faint coriander late, relatively dry for the fruitiness, more generic fruitiness though than plum specific, which is more unique to this fruit than to this specific beer, its often the case with plums in an ale like this. overall decent but nothing new or special. one of the first sour beers i can recall from telluride...\xa01,575 charactersStonedTrippin, Jul 31, 2018']

name: Paloma Gose
review:
["4.23/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25A: Tangerine sunset. Minimal head.

S: Delivers a resounding, if unexpectedly sweet, laurel blossom laurel, green clementine, and donut citrus blend. Pomelo, navel orange, oakevanilla; creamsicle, popsicle stick, key lime pie.

M: Light-med body, near slimy feel. Lightly carbonated. 

T: Kinda apes Westbrook's Key Lime gose. Sharp, tart, and complex sweet, oily citrus. Hints of cracker malt, vanilla bean. But really not altogether salty or savory. Easily mistook as pale wheat ale or berliner weisse. Easy to drink during hot weather.\xa0539 charactersorcrist_cleaver, Jun 23, 2019"]

Pours sorta orange, seems dark for a German Gose... big and earthy spiciness from the Juniper and the Lavender... the floral notes work well with the piney... lightly tart with hints of coriander. Pretty tasty.\xa0234 charactersJohnGalt1, Aug 10, 2016']

name: Punch Bowl Snobs Blueberry Gose
review: ['4.53/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.3%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.5Now this is a fantastic gose! There is a heavier breadiness, almost like coffee cake, as a base, but the blueberry tartness, sugars, and sour oak flavors really take it from there. Taste is powerful yet decently nuanced for style. Smell is tart blueberry an honey wheat. Pours a magenta with little foam, and it is as fun as it looks. Bravo!\xa0346 charactersREVZEB, Aug 05, 2018']

name: Patio Season
review:
["4.29/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.4%look: 2 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5A huge thanks to Jeff for delivering the Barrel Theory goods! 750ml crowler into Night Shift stemware. 

These sours are never much to look like. This one is mango and papaya juice. Nose has hints of orange, big passion fruit and dominant guava. The papaya doesn't come through as much except as a bit of freshness towards the end. Beer opens orange and passion fruit. There's a puckering presence from the guava in the middle that's sharp, aggressive. More guava and passion fruit tartness at the finish. Excellent flavor bomb. Body is light with ample carbonation. Prickly and lively in the mouth and super drinkable and refreshing. Puckering going down. 

Consistently excellent sours... and Patio Season is no different.\xa0724 charactersSpeedwayJim, Apr 13, 2019", '4.18/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.9%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Pours a slight hazed golden color(looks like a great IPA). smell is very fruity and tropical. Taste is tart/sour also sweet with pineapple and berries . Mouth feel was tart and very fruity a great one to sip on,some sourness lingers in the finsh ..very good.\xa0259 charactersgatornation, Apr 06, 2019', '4.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.4%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Crowler. Cloudy burnt orange.

Straight dole pineapple juice. Hardly tastes like beer. Sour and some tart. All the other fruits are hard to find, but I’m sure they are blended into this fruit juice goodness.

This hardly tastes like beer and I love it. One of my favorite BT sours.\xa0283 charactersmothman, Mar 10, 2019']

name: Decadent Creamery - Mango Sorbet
review: ['4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9.3%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.516 ounce can into tulip glass, canned in 9/2019. Pours moderately hazy/cloudy pale golden yellow color with a 1-2 finger fairly foamy and fluffy white head with great retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Nice spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big juicy/tart/tangy mangoes, melon, fruit skin, lemon, lime, orange, peach, pear, apricot, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, white bread, light lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of mangoes, fruity/acidic yeast, moderate salt, and pale/wheat malt notes; with big strength. Taste of big juicy/tart/tangy mangoes, melon, fruit skin, lemon, lime, orange, peach, pear, apricot, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, white bread, light lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang, and light spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/tangy mangoes, melon, fruit skin, lemon, lime, orange, peach, pear, apricot, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, white bread, light lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of mangoes, fruity/acidic yeast, moderate salt, and pale/wheat malt flavors; with an awesome malt/tartness and tangy fruit balance; with no puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp/clean finishing. Moderate increasing dryness from lingering tang/tartness and carbonation. Medium-plus carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/grainy/acidic/tangy, and lightly saline balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol for 5.8%. Overall this is an awesome fruited gose. All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of mangoes, fruity/acidic yeast, moderate salt, and pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink with the modestly acidic/tangy/drying finish; not overly lactic or salty. Very flavorful and not watery. Awesome balance of big juicy mangoes and Lacto complexity; with a great clean pale/wheat malt backbone against acidity. Minimal residual sweetness with crisp acidic/tangy dryness. A really enjoyable offering, and impressive spot on style example as expected.\xa02,358 characterssuperspak, Oct 17, 2019']

name: No Way Gose
review:
['3.84/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25A: The beer is crystal clear yellow in color and has a moderate amount of visible carbonation. It poured with a quarter finger high white head that died down, but consistently left a short head covering the surface.
S: Light aromas of lactobacillus and limes are present in the nose.
T: The taste has stronger flavors of limes along with notes of tequila from the barrel aging.
M: It feels light-bodied and tart on the palate with a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: This beer is very easy to drink and has refreshing qualities. This would make for a nice selection for a hot summer day.

Serving type: can\xa0608 charactersmetter98, Jun 16, 2019', '4.01/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Canned 04/12/19, 9:38:53, #NOWAYGOSE

Pale golden pour, not too much rising head or lace. Stagnant, gold, small amounts of rising carbonation.

The aromas really introduce the adjuncts nicely. Lots of present lime, with a presence of guava as well and the pineapple serving as a subtle compliment. Tart aromas, getting similar nose to a margarita. Some light agave sweetness is really the only other tequila influence I got from this beer.

Tart, mildly puckering flavors with lime taking the forefront. Fresh pineapple juice swoops in and really gives this gose a great tropical feel. Salty backbone helps cut through any residual acidity and makes for a gose that’s perfect for a hot summer day.

Crisp, light, mildly sticky puckering quality to the feel of this beer. Think of that feeling you get after half a bag of Sour Patch kids. Clean, refreshing finish.\xa0865 charactersWickedBeer, Apr 29, 2019']

name: Canada Gose On Concord Grape
review: ['3.79/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Pours a light and see through purple, with a small head. The head breaks quickly, but there is a nice island of foam left behind. The smell is a combination of classic gose, a little like the seaside and then grape jelly, a little like the sammiches we enjoyed as kids. The flavor is most like a gose, light salt/brine, tart, herbs and then you get the Concord grape, which is sweet but not overly so. The feel is lighter with medium carbonation. The finish is a fight between the classic gose tart and the sweet grapes. \n\nAn enjoyable beer and a perfect summer beer. I could easily see a few these disappearing on a summer day on the patio.\xa0643 characterspolloenfuego, Sep 08, 2017']
