name: Blood Orange Cranberry Tart Ale
review:
['4.24/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9.6%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.255 oz pour on tap. This is a great winter/holiday gose. The blood orange and cranberry flavors are distinct and work very well together. I like this much better than the Union Craft cranberry/cinnamon gose (and I like that beer, too).\xa0233 charactersLucular, Nov 18, 2019', "3.71/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.1%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75L: golden orange with a loose white head fed by a steady stream of small bubbles

S: salt and coriander, very faint orange peel aroma

T: less coriander in the taste than there was in the smell. Salty and tart. Sour orange with a hint of cranberry at the end

F: crisp and tingly, not a lot of body. Goes down easy with a definite orange aftertaste

O: was kind of expecting this to taste like Thanksgiving orange/cranberry sauce, but it doesn't. The coriander is very light, the cranberries are subtle at the end of the swallow. A nice refreshing beer.\xa0553 charactersofficerbill, Oct 28, 2019", '3.96/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 412oz can into a pint glass at Hucklebucks in Pottsville, Pa last night. Best by January 2020.

Paraphrased from the website, " the classic Madras cocktail was the inspiration for this beer. 17 pounds per barrel of real fruit, 1st fermentation with lactobacillus, 2nd with house ale yeast. Also with coriander and sea salt added"

Despite the can proclaiming a royal red body, this beer is clear yellow with a small white head which quickly dissipates to a faint covering. no lacing.

Aroma is Mildly fruity, slightly salty, and tart.

Upon tasting, the odd thing is that other than the salt, non of the ingredients come through on their own. It's tart, salty, and a little fruity. Seems the balance evens out the individual flavors, and it's a nice drinking experience.

Mouth medium, finish somewhat tart.

Overall, an enjoyable drink, went down easy.\xa0852 charactersMikeWard, Oct 18, 2019']

name: The Pianist
review: ["3.74/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.6%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75Can from Julio's\nJust a hint of hazy on this light golden elixir with a thin bubbly white head that dissipates almost instantly. Lemon lime and salt on the nose and its also most of the flavor. Crisp tart somewhat refreshing ale.\xa0229 charactersjohnnnniee, Jul 07, 2019"]

name: Most Seasoned
review: ['3.44/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.7%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5At the source! Served from tap into Trophy tulip. Poured a hazy golden yellow with a one finger white head that subsided to a minimal amount almost instantly. Maintained nice lacing throughout the glass. The aroma was comprised of sweet malt, meat, salt, tart, and wheat. The flavor was of sweet malt, meat, wheat, and tart. It had a light feel on the palate with medium carbonation. Overall this was a decent brew. The meat character was different, but not really in a good way, sadly. Missed the huge tart and salt aspect in the flavor. Easy to drink though. Tick.\xa0566 charactersthagr81us, Jan 25, 2014']

name: Never Leave
review: ['4.13/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.9%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4A very smooth low acidity, low salt gose. Gose is nowhere near the top of my style list. Maybe not a perfect representation of the style, but certainly one that I would drink again.\xa0181 charactersSludgeman, Aug 21, 2018']

name: Super Jammer 75
review:
['3.72/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5Pours a murky orange color with a half-finger of antique white head. Nice lacing.

Big tart aroma with lemon and gin most prevalent. A kiss of cherry. Not sure if salt really has a smell, but the anticipation of salt is huge in this.

The taste is tart up front, joined quickly by a surprisingly toasty impression and overly salty backend. The aftertaste has some of that pleasant lemon and juniper with, again, just a little cherry.

Full bodied with zippy carbonation.

The lemon and juniper in this are great, but it’s much too salty, even for a Gose, and the “imperial” nature of this lends a bit more malt character than I appreciate in the style. If you don’t dissect it and just drink it, it’s still pretty good.\xa0734 charactersthebeers, May 27, 2019', '4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.1%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25L - 1/2 finger fizzy head atop a near-opaque orange juice body.

S - orange, baking spices, trees, berries. 

T - orange and lemon-lime candy. Gin, pine, mixed berries. Low bitterness. Moderate-low sweetness. Low booziness.

F - medium body with appropriate carb.

O - hides its booze well, but there’s so much going on here its hard to process. Need Superspak to review this.\xa0378 charactersCanConPhilly, May 25, 2019']

name: Strawberry Pretzel Salad
review:
['4.16/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4L - 2.5 finger dense pink head atop a translucent grape-juice body.

S - strawberries, salt, brown sugar.

T - strawberries and cream. Sugar, tart berries. No bitterness. Moderate-high sweetness. No booziness.

F - medium-light body with high carb.

O - very sweet, but delivers on what it promises.\xa0299 charactersCanConPhilly, Mar 10, 2019', '4.23/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.2516 oz can poured into a teku

A- A slightly hazy bright red with a two finger pink head.

S- Tart, a little salty, lots of strawberries, some cream.

T- Strawberries mainly tart but a little sweet, some cream, nice saltiness, touch of pretzels.

M- Smooth, medium body, a little creamy.

O- Really nice fruited gose, flavors come together really well.\xa0351 characterslarryi86, Feb 25, 2019', '4.21/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Pours a hazy strawberry-rhubarb red color with a finger of purple-tinted head. Solid lacing.

Lovely lightly-sour gose aroma with strong strawberry and cream undertones.

The taste follows the nose, with the strawberry and cream jumping out, landing on top of a nice sour base with definite saltiness to it. There is a sort of pretzel-dough quality as well, but that may be psychosomatic.

A touch heavier bodied and certainly more creamy than usual for the style, with a very slight grittiness as well.

These guys make top-notch fruited sours and this is no exception. The strawberries and cream really pop.\xa0612 charactersthebeers, Feb 24, 2019']

name: Five Island Watermelon
review:
["2/5\xa0\xa0rDev -24.8%look: 2 | smell: 2 | taste: 2 | feel: 2 | overall: 2Served on tap at Ottawa Winter Brewfest 2018, third session (Saturday, 7pm-1am).

Best way to describe the strange smell and taste that accompanied the watermelon flavor was that of pasta water. Not sure if something went wrong during the brewing process or over the course of the festival to cause this. Perhaps the lines were not properly sterilized.

Still not the worst beer I've had despite this, hence the '2' rating.\xa0423 charactersJotora, Feb 19, 2018"]

Sour and tart, but not overpowering. I like their Berliner’s better, but this was solid.\xa0187 charactersmothman, Feb 02, 2019', '3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Pours a hazed dull yellow color with thin white head Smell had lemon and citric fruit faint herbal smell. Taste was citric lemon with passion fruit and a salty lemon lime finish. Crisp and tart mouth feel with some dry sourness.\xa0229 charactersgatornation, Nov 27, 2018']

name: Lei Effect
review: ["3.54/5\xa0\xa0rDev +14.6%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.5Bottle. Pours a pale clear yellow colour. Aromas of salted preserved lemons, a bit of funk, and sweet tropical juice notes. Overall, this one tasted quite salted upfront. Favour profile was light and bright with a touch of dryness on the close. The predominant flavour profile is mild salted preserved lemons with a moderate funkness, a fresh guava body, with a touch of tartness but not much. Seemed too salty for what it was but still tasty overall. Clean finish.Carbonation is mild. Didn't pick up too much of the coriander though.\xa0534 charactersNilocRellim, Aug 23, 2019", '1.33/5\xa0\xa0rDev -57%look: 2.25 | smell: 1 | taste: 1.5 | feel: 1 | overall: 1.25Can from the brewery...big mistake. The bartender asked me if I was familiar with the "goss" style to which I replied, yes, because yes I am quite familiar with the style. But this...this was a horredous mess of a beer, and I don\'t know how people actually buy it. Maybe I got a bad can or something, but, well, I\'ll just say, as a Jersey boy, I know what the salt marshes smell like, and after having this "beer," now I know what the salt marshes taste like too. Yes, I know, goses are brewed with salt, but there\'s a subtlety involved. This literally tasted like it was made from unfiltered brine dredged from the Great Salt Lake. And let\'s talk about the smell. As soon as I took a whiff, I actually thought I was going to vomit. It was so nauseatingly sulfurous and swampy. I looked at the 16 ounce glass in front of me and was filled with dread and regret. But you know what, I held my breath and started gulping it down. And I actually did hold my breath, it was that hard to drink. And I know there must have actually been something wrong with the beer, because actually after about 5 or 10 minutes, I reopened my nostrils and surprisingly, the foul aroma had flashed off and the beer was somewhat palatable. Either that or my sense of smell and taste were permanently damaged. Whatever the case, I finished the whole grody glass and went on my merry way. There are a lot of things a gose can be, but this was not a gose. It was an unholy nightmare that would make Poseidon himself weep.\xa01,494 charactersRifugium, Jul 10, 2019', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +29.4%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4a very tasty sour here, built half like a gose and half like a belgian with, with the coriander in there and all the wheat, its tropical and fresh and really pretty darn good. passion fruit is a cool add here, bringing something new and flavorful to what otherwise would be a pretty faithfully authentic old worldy brew. lightly orange in the glass and quite hazy, with a tall white head and a little bit of sediment towards the bottom of the bottle. smells tangy from both the lacto souring and the passion fruit, summery though too, and i get the briny salt in there too, very appealing, lightly floral, earthy with the wheat, and lemony in the sour profile. the flavor is juicy passion fruit, nicely dosed. and the souring is really quite professional, clean and not flavorless, resonating well with the passion fruit. the salt highlights it all, i get orange and lime notes pulled up by it too. lots of fresh fluffy wheat, and a tasteful amount of a toasted sort of coriander. really nice proportions on this, and overall a beer i could have done several glasses of if we werent sharing. i was impressed with proper, ill be on the hunt for more of them next time in utah. one of the better fruited goses i have had of late...\xa01,229 charactersStonedTrippin, Jan 11, 2019']

name: Gose
review:
['4.18/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.6%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25A: Pours a slightly hazed golden/yellow color. At first a two finger white head forms, but recedes in a second to a small film. Not much lace is left behind, as is the case with most examples of the style.
S: Tart lemon rind light grains, but the tartness lingers and makes this very enjoyable.
T: Like the nose tart and slight "sour." The lemon rind sourness builds and is very enjoyable. With a touch of spice, a touch of savory, a touch of puckering, a touch of biscuit malts. Nothing is dominate, and an overall very well done Gose.
M/O: A light body that is very crisp and very effervescent. That gives way to a nice puckering tart and savory character that makes me want to keep coming back.

This is an excellent example of the style. To many breweries in the Houston area have turned this style into a gimmick, and I forgot how enjoyable a Gose can be. Fairly simple, but really enjoyable overall. Which is the MO for Holler. Highly recommended.\xa0966 characterschamp103, Apr 23, 2017']

name: Gose
review: ['3.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.4%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5bluehende, Apr 17, 2016', '3.7/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.1%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75barflybastard, Oct 23, 2015', '3.92/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.7%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4DarthVorador, Jul 29, 2015', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.8%Stermax, Jul 10, 2014']

name: Gordon Biersch Gose
review:
["4.03/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.8%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Growler from Gordon Biersch Rockville shared by yourefragile as a segway in the midst of the 2011 barrel-aged barleywine tasting. Quite a few pours into the SAVOR snifter. Maybe I should have gotten a bigger glass out for this one.

Initial pour is a hazy straw color with a good single-finger white head with good retention and a good dosage of lacing. 

Nose is slightly lactic with a good portion of wheat and some light citrus in the background. Flavor hits all the right spots. Salt is a little on the low end but I won't complain about that. Light acidity throughout and a nice light citric character to complement the wheat base.

Light body and good carbonation. Dry finish with a slight pucker. Really drinkable and sessionable. I could have killed the growler myself.\xa0777 charactersThorpe429, Aug 22, 2011", "3.91/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.7%look: 4.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Thanks for another Gose from yourefragile, nice.

Served in a tiny snifter (4 or 5 times). Beer is yellow and hazy with a wispy / thin white head of small bubbles, some lacing, mild to moderate carbonation, looks like a gose.

The aroma is a little weak, some lactic, mild, some yeast character, mild, some grains.

Beer is thin and light. I was expecting a more salty / more creamy / more sour beer than this. It is still quite good, very drinkable, I thoroughly enjoyed it and went back for fourths. This was in the berleinerweiss territory for final gravity though, low, good for the style though. An interesting attempt that I would have never expected from a Gordon Biersch but apparently interesting things happen at these places. I'd have it again.\xa0755 charactersdrabmuh, Aug 22, 2011", '4.33/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.3%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.5On tap at GB Rockville, day of tapping. Served in a .5L nonic.

Beautiful clouded pale straw color with a creamy retentive white head. Citrus lemon aroma with sour wheat and mild salt in the finish. Medium thick with soft carbonation and a lingering dry, sour finish. Initially a strong yeast and wheat base in the flavor followed by a refreshing lemon and tart finish. Not as much salt as expected, but this is exceedingly drinkable and refreshing.\xa0449 charactersyourefragile, Aug 20, 2011']

name: Brewer's Tan
review:
['4.41/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.5On tap at Colter Bay in Buffalo, NY.

This one pours a fairly hazy golden yellow color, with a small head and lots of lacing.

There’s a lot in here, and most of it comes through on the nose. It’s mostly pineapple and coconut, with macadamia and a touch of spice coming through.

Despite the ingredients list, this is nowhere near as heavy handed as it could have been. The pistachio adds a great creamy and nutty sweetness to the pineapple and sour citrus flavors. There’s some spiced coconut cream too, and a nice creamy vanilla finish.

This is light bodied, clean and creamy, with an awesome drinkability. It’s so light, but vibrantly juicy and flavorful.

This is approachable gloop. It’s really nice stuff.\xa0722 charactersGreesyFizeek, Wednesday at 07:28 PM', '4.18/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Received in a trade. Had planned on sharing this with JLindros but I'm already swinging by tomorrow with a dozen beers so something had to give. Now it's a game of 'which one of these do I drink myself'. As I crack this I can hear him going "this isn't a beer!" 

A - Poured into my Duvel tulip a nice hazy very pale golden hue with a thin half finger white head that faded to leave a thin halo and light wisps.

S - Big aromas of sweet over ripe pineapple. Tons and tons of pineapple, both fresh and canned, the coconut is a bit on the heavy toast. Decent vanilla on the aroma, not much in the way for cinnamon, good lactose, flashes of creamy wheat. Not getting much pistachio either. If this was billed as simply a 'pineapple coconut vanilla gose' then it would be aces, however, all the other added bits don't quite translate on the nose.

T - Taste is nice gose acidity, sour lactic notes, pie crust flavours that are stereotypical of a Westbrook gose. Big creamy wheat followed by sweeter pineapple. The pineapple is nice, not overly there bit bringing the sweet fruit. The coconut oddly enough is much more subdued than it was on the nose. The coconut that is there is almost aggressively toasty. Faint, faint vanilla and just a little bit of cinnamon. I'm not sure if I get pistachio either. As it warms the pineapple pops even more.

M - Mouthfeel is lightly carbonated, decent body, not as flemmy as the style can be.

O - Overall this was a solid beer, however, some components next quite popped namely the cinnamon and pistachio and the coconut stayed as an overly toasted background element. The pineapple here was absolutely splendid, reminding me very much of a pineapple cider in the level of fruitiness. For that element I would drink this again but on the whole I'd say this was one of Westbrook's weaker Gose entries.

Serving Type: Can\xa01,856 charactersrudzud, Nov 01, 2019']

name: Gose
review:
['3.82/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.7%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Appearance - Pours a straw gold with two fingers of foamy white head.

Smell - very subtle earthy, leafy, and floral hops, biscuity and grainy malts, citrus (orange), hint of coriander, hint of salt, and earthy yeast.

Taste - The hops are very subtle but then it quickly goes into the biscuity and grainy malts followed by a pleasant hit from the salt. The orange, coriander, and earthy yeast help to finish the brew off. 

Mouthfeel - Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Finishes crisp with a pleasant lingering saltiness.

Overall - A easy drinking Gose. This brew has a good level of saltiness and just the right amount of fruitiness.\xa0643 charactersleaddog, Apr 22, 2018', "3.72/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.9%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.758oz glass at Beer Revolution YEG Oliver Square. A gose being released in the middle of the holiday season - more inanity, or hubris, I can't tell which.

This beer appears a slightly hazy, pale golden straw colour, with one finger of puffy, loosely foamy, and mildly creamy eggshell white head, which leaves a few instances of tendril lace around the glass as it quickly blows off. 

It smells of gritty and grainy pale malt, saltine crackers, a minor hard water flintiness, ethereal citrus rind notes, and very subtle earthy, leafy, and floral noble hop bitters. The taste is semi-sweet, grainy and crackery cereal malt, some tart domestic fruitiness, saline solution, and more understated earthy, musty, and floral green hoppiness. 

The carbonation is fairly low-key in its innocuous frothiness, the body a decent medium weight, and mostly smooth, nothing really getting in the way of forward progress here. It finishes off-dry, the waning malt and lingering fruitiness landing just so.

Overall - this comes across as a pleasantly rendered version of the style, with the tartness more fruit-borne than derived from the grain. It's actually sort of refreshing amongst all the darker and heavier options available right now, so I apologize for my earlier gibe.\xa01,263 charactersbiboergosum, Dec 17, 2017"]

name: Little Smoky Gose
review:
["3.96/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 416 oz draft straight from the brewery (#1 of 4 in my flight)
*this is a smoked lime gose

A: cloudy light golden body, white bubbly head with extremely low retention
S: citrus lime with smoke up front and center, lacto sourness, a tad of biscuit malt and wheat spice kicker at the finish
T: follows the nose - tart and earthy smoked lime, light amount of salinity, lacto wheaty bacteria love weirdness, and a little bit of malt biscuit sweetness. 
F: high carbonation, light body. lush feeling with a dry finish

Overall (personal opinion):
great gose almighty - i could do this one all day. next to no salty/salinity with this gose and that's okay! this brew fully plays on other great possibilities to highlight within the style and the whole experience is better for it. especially given how popular the gose style has been over the last couple years, i haven't had too many that i felt compelled to review on here because of the boredom experienced with so many players trying the same things on the field, i am so delighted to report one that stands out in the best way\xa01,074 charactersimnodoctorbut, Jun 28, 2019", '4.14/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9.2%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25hands down my favorite beer we had from these guys. im not sure if this is how their little gose always is, or of this was a special edition with smoked limes and salt, but its an incredible take on the style, and makes this stand out as one of the more unique gose types i have ever had, special edition or full time, it doesnt matter (it should be all the time, its world class and wholly original!). the smoke is there right away in the nose, but before it can be acrid or harsh, the fresh lime zestiness and clean lacto come in and clean it up and give it this crazy brightness. the flavor matches the nose there too, the smoke is strong but it doesnt dominate, while the salt is pretty robust too, drying this out and adding nice body along with the pale wheat. the balance is there in such a cool way, between the crackery dry grain, the interesting smoky citrus fruit, and the earthy salt, its sharp but drinkable at the same time, and so intriguing and good that i have a hard time ever setting the glass down. amazing depth of flavor in such a light and drinkable beer too, the smoked lime and the salt is a brilliant combination over this base. the best i had from these guys, and a gose thats extremely memorable, one of the best in the game right now as far as i am concerned...\xa01,290 charactersStonedTrippin, Jul 15, 2018']

name: Citra Gose
review:
['3.02/5\xa0\xa0rDev -10.7%look: 4 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 2.75 | feel: 3 | overall: 3A: Moderately hoppy upfront with a grassy, citrus aroma, light salt and faint tartness.

A: Golden color with a slight orange hue, clear, with a moderate white head with solid retention. 

T: Hoppy upfront with a grassy, citrusy taste, light malt sweetness with moderate hop bitterness, light salt and a very faint funk. 

M: Medium-light bodied with moderate carbonation. 

O: Terrible; the beer’s hops smell and taste a bit stale. It reminds me of an IPA left open for three days.\xa0486 charactersPhil-Fresh, Feb 22, 2017', '4.18/5\xa0\xa0rDev +23.7%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.2522oz bottle into snifter. 

A: Pours a light and clear straw golden with a couple fingers of soft light tan head. The head took its time slowly fading into a wispy film leaving steaks of bubbly lace down the glass.
S: Huge and fresh notes of citra come through and dominate the nose. I get volatile notes of citrus zest alongside dank notes of cousin and lightly sweet fruit nectar. There are undertones of mild tartness, crisp wheat, and dry crakery grains.
T: Follows the nose with flavors of fresh and green citra hops, citrus zest, and dry wheat and pale malt backbone. There’s touch of melon and salinity in the finish, and the aftertaste is lightly bitter, herbal, and sweet. I get some fruit nectar sweetness throughout, and just a kiss of tartness. 
M: Light body, crisp and dry mouthfeel, sparkling carbonation with an easy softness to it. Very refreshing and easy to drink. Tartness adds character but isn’t acid or even that noticeable by any means. 
O: Light and crisp overall, with a great dry hopped flavor. Definitely reminded me of a hoppy session ipa than something that is supposed to have some acid to it. Delicious; worth checking out.\xa01,159 charactersscottfrie, Jun 07, 2016']

name: El Chapulín Colorado
review:
['4.08/5\xa0\xa0rDev +17.6%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.2512oz bottle. Thanks Bill! Wow - excellent for an insect beer (brewed w/grasshoppers & beetles) & also for a gose. Nice salinity & a floral/abysinth liqueur-like quality. Medium to full body and medium- carbonation.\xa0216 charactersFlandersNed, Sep 30, 2015', "4.17/5\xa0\xa0rDev +20.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Brewed with grasshoppers. I've eaten chapulines before and they are toasty like popcorn kernels and slightly minerally.

Reddish orange, thin layer of foam and minor spotty lace. Darker red than most gose. Aroma is vaguely fruity, slight briny quality from the salt. 

Taste has a unique fruitiness contrasted with a savory saltiness. Almost like a berry or cranberry tartness. Saltiness gets more pronounced as it warms, a little much but overall it's unique. Light and drinkable, more than just a novelty, this is a very interesting beverage.\xa0544 charactersemerge077, May 20, 2015"]

name: Ghouly Gose
review:
['3.67/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.4%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.5Served on tap in a pint glass
Appearance – The beer is served a hazy pinkish-orange color with a small fizzy white head of foam. The head fades very fast leaving a trace of fizzy lace on the sides of the glass.
Smell – The aroma of the brew is quite tart with some other lighter smells of guava and passionfruit. Along with these smells are some light aromas of grass and a bit of berry.
Taste – The taste begins with a more mild sour taste with flavors of apple cider vinegar and some light fruit tastes of apple, apricot, and guava as well as a bit of blueberry. As the taste advances the light sweet upfront fades even more and is accompanied by a bit of an increase in the sour with more lemon and vinegar coming to the tongue. A little bit of a sea salt taste as well as a little hay and light fruit comes to the tongue near the end of the taste, to leave a lightly tart, and drier fruity taste to linger in the mouth.
Mouthfeel – The body of the brew is rather thin and light with a carbonation level that is on the slightly higher side. For the lighter sour and fruity taste the feel is spot on and is very easy to drink.
Overall – While not super flavorful, it is a very easy to drink sour. This would be a good sour session.\xa01,250 charactersDarkmagus82, Oct 12, 2018', '3.84/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8.2%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75On draught at Old Chicago. 

Pours a hazy orange red with a tiny head of foam. 

Smells fruity,guava and blueberries are there adding a mild tartness. 

Blueberries seem to be stronger in flavour than the guava. Bit salty, very light tartness. 

Smooth and light bodied. 

I like it.\xa0283 charactersBitterbill, Oct 10, 2018']

name: El Gozador
review:
["3.73/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75Touched by agave and laid down to slumber in tequila barrels is about as good a description that this barrel-aged German sour ale is going to get. With all things tequila finding its way into the culinary arts scene, there's no better taste to capture the character of true agave than that of Gose

Goodwood's El Gozador pours with a fine pale haze and a chrome color. Breaming with carbonation, the ale casts a champagne character on the session. Its tightly woven but short statured froth casts a scent of citrus, herb, hay, cider and chardonnay on the nose while its taste is supple with sourdough, saltwater taffy and margarita

Its arid maltiness lifts and the sourness seeps in as the middle palate draws near. Its crisp and refreshing taste invites a clean sourness of green apple, white grape, lime and lemon, along with hints of agave and kiwi. As its faint hops roll into those spicy oaken notes, a kiss of nuttiness and tequila persists while its finish is of soft burlap and worn balsa.

Light but a bit more moderate for sour ale, the beer stops shy of absolute sourness or dryness and allows a pillow of sourdough to roll onto its softly wheaten finish. The light funkiness of booze soaked oak allow for a linger of spice and earth perfume with a dry note note singing a short, sour and peppery symphony.\xa01,318 charactersBEERchitect, Nov 07, 2019", '4.02/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Look - bright copper orange color with a slight rim
Smell - tart sweet vinegar slight wood
Taste - slight sweet citrus tart vinegar very slight hint of tequila and oak
Feel - medium full body with a lighter carb
Overall - tasty interesting beer\xa0244 charactersdrdiesel9483, Jul 22, 2019', '3.68/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Good but not great.
Dark brown color.
Smells like oak barrels soaked with tequila.
Interesting set of flavors but not very strong. Definite wood barrel aging is present with a slight vinegar/gose flavor up front which transforms into a citrus/tequila finish. Very smooth. Good combination of flavors that work good together. I would like it better if the flavors had a little more punch to them.\xa0396 charactersWilliamLee, Jun 30, 2019']

name: Cranberry Gose
review:
["3.74/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.5%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Had this on 2016-03-13 in Columbia, PA at the brewery on-tap

A - Cloudy straw-gold with a very short white head and little lace.

S - Cranberry, light coriander and light wheat. Pleasant but not strongly aromatic.

T - A good amount of wheat, cranberry/citrus, mild coriander and salt. It's lightly tart but not sour. The aftertaste is light and fades quickly although some salt remains. The flavors are subtle and balanced. 

M - Light body and light-medium carbonation.

O - This is an easy-drinking/sessionable, refreshing and tasty brew. My personal preference is for a more sour Gose but I enjoyed this concoction after a long gym workout.\xa0650 charactersTucquan, Mar 16, 2016"]

name: Winzig Haus Bier
review:
["3.81/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.2%look: 3.25 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Clear pale shimmering gold with the thinnest ring.

Smell is bready toast with a slight bratwurst-like smoke and a hint of corn.

In flavor, a nice tartness quickly leads into smoked sausage with a sauerkraut presence. The tartness doesn't recede, as lemon, orange and a hint of salty cracker continue to play along nicely with the mild smokiness.

The light body is supported by an emerging froth, and finishes semi-dry.

R. Shea should take note, as this is far closer to a sauerkraut beer than the attempt they made, and it also tastes great, for a Lichtenhainer.\xa0566 charactersSabtos, Apr 19, 2018", "4.18/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Served to me in a mug glass on-tap at the brewery, this beer is a cloudy/hazy light golden color with a nice white head that's about an inch thick when first poured. Settles to a thin white ring of foam lining the inside of the glass with no lacing. Aromas of malts and wheat and a little bit of barnyard, musty funk. Has a somewhat smoked malt and wheat flavor upfront that gives way to a bit of an astringent, slightly sour, musty, barnyard funky taste with a nice bit of salt. Really spot on flavorwise for this style. Has a mainly crisp, yet smooth, light to medium bodied mouthfeel with moderate carbonation. Has a clean, just slightly dry finish. This one really cites the inside of the mouth nicely after each sip and the flavors like to linger there for awhile. Very easy to drink.

Eric\xa0803 charactersneenerzig, Jun 17, 2017"]

name: R W Shadrick Motor Sales
review: ['3.88/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75This was poured into a pokal. The appearance was a glossy burnt orange almost brown color with a quickly dissipating slim finger’s worth of little white head. No lacing. The smell took in the sour to sweet to tart lemon rind bitterness. Delicate sweetness comes in-almost bubblegum-like. Wheat portion doesn’t seem as sour-ed as some goses I’ve had before. Still there, slightly. The taste had a good combined effort between the sour to tart lemon rind and pulp. Light sweet bubblegum to sour aftertaste treats the finish as well. On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a bit of a tad heavier sort of feel to it than some other goses I’ve had. Saltiness lines my tongue nicely, not as puckering, but still a decent level all around. Overall, its a pretty good gose for the most part, I could see myself having again on warmer days.\xa0869 charactersLone_Freighter, Jun 08, 2017']

name: Freigeist / Kingpin Grätzhainer
review:
["3.7/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.4%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 4On-tap at Albion, New York, NY

A: The beer is hazy yellow in color—a little too hazy to see if there is any visible carbonation. It poured with just a thin collar of white bubbles around the edge of the glass. 
S: Light aromas of smoked malts are present in the nose. 
T: The taste follows the smell, having stronger flavors of smoke and associated notes of iodine along with a light amount of sourness and slight hints of saltiness. Notes of the smoked malts linger into the finish. 
M: It feels a bit more than light-bodied on the palate and has a moderate amount of carbonation. 
O: With the iodine and band-aid like flavors, this won't be everyone's cup of tea but if you like smoky beers it's and interesting mix of a smoked beer and a sour that is rather light in body and easy to drink. 

Serving type: on-tap\xa0819 charactersmetter98, Aug 13, 2017", "3.6/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.6%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5Hazy yellow color with white head. Aroma is smokey and lemony. Taste follows, lemony but not really tart, smokey, not really malty. Medium body and carbonation. Not bad but it doesn't have anything to jump forward at you.\xa0221 charactersCiocanelu, Sep 11, 2016"]

name: Gose - Passionfruit And Dragonfruit
review:
["4.21/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.9%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.2516 oz. can released week of 7/10/18. Poured into Belgian ale glass.

O: Excellent drink on a hot day.\xa0532 charactersIvoryFoxhole, Jul 21, 2018"]

name: Yacht Rock Gose
review: ['3.7/5\xa0\xa0rDev -10.8%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 4Competent gose, rounded out and a bit watered down tart gose flavour. On tap at the source. I am now officially gosed out for the summer. Hits the style, though takes down the salt recognition.\xa0193 charactersSammy, Jul 03, 2018']

name: Blackberry Sorbet
review:
["4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Taking craft beer to the tangy and smoothie side of culinary art, Decadent Ale employs the use of blackberry and cream to mimick the effects of sorbet, yet manifested in beer form. 

Pouring a deep burgundy, blueberry stained hue, Blackberry Sorbet builds a creamy neon pink swath of foam to expel a host of dark fruits, light pastry, vanilla cream and a sour twinge of red wine. A moderately sweet taste leads with the simplicity of taffy, cobbler and sweet cream as the sour ale gets off to a sweeter start.

But the bracing acidity waltzed onto the middle palate and chases away much of the sweetness. The sourness that it brings highlights the dark fruit, especially the blackberry flavors for a mix of sour berry cobbler and a lime laced smoothie. Lemon, gooseberry, crabapple, wine and cider all complement the mix while other nuances of black cherry, blackcurrant, blueberry and raspberry flavors aren't far off.

Medium bodied to start, the sourness creates a sharp, spicy and drying palate for a crisp, clean and highly refreshing session; one that's highly sangria-like but with a vanilla and cream type of body. Red wine shines in a medium short aftertaste and a racy, piquant finish.\xa01,195 charactersBEERchitect, Nov 19, 2019", '3.41/5\xa0\xa0rDev -14.5%look: 4 | smell: 3 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5From the bottom rim of the can: "DECBSS1-AI"

Appearance: The body is a dark red-purple color and has a cloudy opalescence that allows only light and large shadows through. The head is a frothy pink-purple short cap with good retention and lacing.

Aroma: It has a souring fruit scent with an aroma of raspberries. There is a bit of a sulfur scent to the beer.

Taste: It tastes like raspberries.

Mouthfeel: It is light bodied and tart. Carbonation is good.

Overall: The can states that this is a "GOSE STYLE ALE WITH BLACKBERRY" and there is definitely a berry presence, although it wasn't distinguishable as blackberry and came across as raspberry. It was pleasant and enjoyable. I could drink it again and I would recommend it to berry lovers.\xa0748 charactersteromous, Nov 16, 2019']

name: Poppy’s Moonship (Apricot & Tangerine)
review:
['4.39/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Can stamped "081619."
This was poured into a stange.
The appearance was a glossy yellow color with some cloudiness but also a small remnant of transparency. A two and a half fingers worth of white foamy head sat there for a little bit before sliding off eloquently. Messy lace strings it's way in waves across the glass.
The aroma shapes itself around some funk, salt, sour-ed wheat, apricot and tangerines flesh. Intricately intertwined with pizazz noting some subtle grassy hops and tart features.
The flavor, once again, like the aroma blended all of those prior mentioned aromas together, sweetly through some funk, grassy with those added fruits but not overbearing. Mild aftertaste of salt, funk, sour with a touch of tart, grassy and the apricot/tangerine goodness.
The mouthfeel was about medium bodied, maybe a touch over and having a fine sessionability about it. Good carbonation with a semi-smooth funky/earthy finish of wheaty malts and tart fruits.
Overall, many brewers try to brew fruited goses but tend to take it too far; Schilling always seems to be able to brew to style but also allows their creative edge to add in that finer touch for pure enjoyment!\xa01,174 charactersLone_Freighter, Oct 12, 2019', "3.99/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.2%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4This one pours a slightly hazy golden orange color, with a small head, and not much lacing.

This smells briny and saline, with wheat, citrus, tangerine, and just a touch of apricot.

This has a much more present salt character than most fruited goses you'll find out there lately - which are just fruit bombs that don't actually taste like much goses. There's unfortunately a slightly buttery flavor - I'm not sure if it's diacetyl, something else, or I'm imagining it, but luckily it's not a strong flavor. There's a moderate amount of fruit flavor, and definitely more tangerine than apricot.

This is light bodied and creamy, with a nice crispness, and a really solid drinkability.

Despite the minor off-flavor, this was a fun beer, and mostly well-constructed.\xa0766 charactersGreesyFizeek, Sep 16, 2019"]

name: Punch Bowl Snobs: Cherry Gose
review:
["3.85/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.5%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4My first from a young brewery that specializes in German tarts (Gose and Berliner Weiss.)

Cherry Gose is reasonably well-balanced for an often sour style. 
Its Looks are a nice reddish body without a head. Smells also don't intrigue me; some cherry, some tart, a tad of funk. But, Tastes finally show its balance; not wickedly sour where many young brewers end up, but respectful of my buds. Mildly salted. In the mouth, the same balance; not too dry. But, maybe a few more bubbles would make nice.

I don't get much more than pretty photos from Sour Note's website. While the brewer is clearly knowledgable in these two obscure styles, the brewery is a mere 17 months old. I like how they have focussed on the uncommon, instead of the easy-money appeal to the low-common denominator of the American palate's desire for hops. I hope Sour Note's strategy works in in the end. In the meantime, I'd like to find their saison.\xa0923 charactersBeginner2, Nov 16, 2019", '3.62/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.5%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5A: A dusty rose in color, a very dainty white head peeks out for a second and then is gone entirely. 

S: Some light tartness and a hint of funk, along with the usual gose funk. Light cherry, and a hint of almond as well as cranberry. 

T: Tart and crisp up front, with notes of cherry, and cranberry. Brine, and a touch of funk in the finish. 

M: Light in body, carbonation seems a little low, slight cling in the finish. 

O: I like the flavors, but I think a tad drier and a touch more carbonation, would really elevate this one.\xa0534 charactersBeejay, Feb 27, 2019']

name: Grouse Mountain
review: ['3.81/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75a gose with blood orange thats really well balanced. the fruit is natural and forward, yet the beer is still dry, a nice way to work it in without it taking over. the salt is pretty robust here too, and it highlights the cracked toasted coriander seed character this has as well. wheat malt is really light, its yellowy in color and minimal in flavor and body on the grain side, but its plenty fresh, and its a nice earthy balance against the bright and clean acidity. this is quite sour, on the edge of where i can only have one before my stomach turns around, but it really is very tidy, no sweaty or cheesy elements to it at all. some great bitterness is added by the blood orange, its not all sweetness, that oily zesty character comes up. i like that all the different aspects of this come together so well, and it ends up being drinkable for how sour it is because its both interesting and balanced. these guys werent great when they first opened, and its taken me years to make it back here, i think they have a totally different ownership and brewer and everything now, but all the beer was way better than it used to be...\xa01,131 charactersStonedTrippin, Nov 10, 2018']

name: Double Seesaw: Blood Orange
review:
["3.8/5\xa0\xa0rDev -9.7%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Poured from a 16 oz can into a stemmed harmony glass.

Pours an opaque deep amber orange color with a finger of white head. The head leaves no lacing as it quickly settles into a thin ring.

The aroma brings notes of blood orange, grapefruit, and orange soda. There's some faint lemon zest as well. 

The flavor is extremely citrusy and mildly tart, with plenty of malt on the back. Comes exactly as advertised.

The feel is light bodied with good carbonation. Prickly and refreshing and drinkable as hell.

Overall, a good gose that is more or less straight up juice. If you like blood orange, or really citrus in general, you will enjoy this beer.\xa0649 charactersScaryEd, Nov 06, 2019"]

name: Maestro
review:
['3.63/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.2%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5Appearance - Pours a straw gold with a finger of bubbly white head.

Smell - very pungent vinous aromas upfront, bready and biscuity malts, coriander, salty aromas, earthy and floral hops, and a bit of funky earthy yeast.

Taste - vinous aromas followed by the bready and biscuity malts. The coriander, saltiness and earthy and floral hops follow next and then the funky earthy yeast makes it presence known. 

Mouthfeel - Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Finishes dry with the vinous aromas, coriander and salt lingering.

Overall - A refreshing gose that displays the vinous aromas well. Not too pungent with the saltiness or coriander which makes this an approachable beer.\xa0684 charactersleaddog, Aug 19, 2018', "3.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.7%look: 3 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5473ml can - a 'foedre-aged Brett Gose'. Why the fuck do I keep buying this kind of thing?

This beer pours a slightly hazy, pale golden straw colour, with one finger of puffy, loosely foamy, and fizzy off-white head, which leaves zilch in the way of lace anywhere near the glass as it quickly evaporates.

It smells of gritty and grainy cereal malt, white saltine crackers, some muddled earthy spiciness, a bit of plain funk, some mixed pome fruitiness, and very tame earthy, musty, and floral hop bitters. The taste is grainy and crackery pale malt, saline solution, a musty yeastiness, coriander/clove spice, and more very, very (very) ephemeral musty, weedy, and floral hoppiness.

The carbonation is pretty much inane in its hooky-playing frothiness, the body a so-so medium weight, and sort of smooth, I suppose, with little getting in the way of a bland time at this particular juncture. It finishes trending dry, the general graininess kind of bleeding out.

Overall - yeah, I'm not really getting anything in the purported (big-ass) barrel or funk department, which is both a blessing and a curse, as such. It's just a generic version of the style, and adequate enough on another sunny Alberta summer evening.\xa01,221 charactersbiboergosum, Jul 15, 2018"]

name: Põhjala / To Øl - Imperial Ginie
review: ['3.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev -9.8%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5On tap at Beavertown Extravaganza. Hazy orange color. Aroma is dominated by sweet, candied fruit notes. Taste is astringent with sweet lime and tequila flavor.\xa0159 charactersCiocanelu, Sep 19, 2017']

name: Gose
review: ['3.88/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Poured out a slightly hazy, golden color with a small, white head of foam. It smelled salty with some wheat notes. Strong punch of saltiness with crisp wheat and a tart bite.\xa0174 characterszeff80, Jun 16, 2017', '3.76/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.6%look: 1.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Pours a hazy, gold color. 1/4 inch head of an off-white color. Slight retention and poor lacing. Smells of bacterial funk, slight citrus, wheat, pale malt, and a hint of salt. Fits the style of a Gose. Mouth feel is smooth and crisp, with an average carbonation level. There is also a distinct tartness. Tastes of bacterial funk, slight citrus, hint of earthy malt, wheat, pale malt, and a hint of salt. Overall, decent aroma, body, and blend.\xa0451 charactersTone, Jul 26, 2016']

name: Gose North
review: ["3.85/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.3%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Really hazy golden color with off-white head. Aroma is quite tame, just some generic citrus tartness and yeast. Taste follows, lemony, grainy, medium tartness that does out towards the finish. Slightly salty, some pickle juice on the aftertaste. Medium body and carbonation. Overall it's a nice gose but it lacks some aromatic qualities.\xa0337 charactersCiocanelu, Feb 24, 2017", '4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev +11.1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.5330 ml bottle into tulip glass, best before 10/17/2018. Pours hazy medium orange/amber color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy off white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big tart lemon, lime, orange, mango, berries, peach, pineapple, melon, pear, sea salt, light pepper, hay, straw, wheat, cracker, light lacto funk, and herbal/yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/acidic/spicy yeast, quince/sea buckthorn fruit, and moderate pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big tart lemon, lime, orange, mango, berries, peach, pineapple, melon, pear, sea salt, light pepper, hay, straw, wheat, cracker, light lacto funk, and herbal/yeast earthiness. Moderate fruity/lactic tartness and light-moderate yeast spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of tart lemon, lime, orange, mango, berries, peach, pineapple, melon, pear, sea salt, pepper, hay, straw, wheat, cracker, light lacto funk, and herbal/yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Great complexity, robustness, and balance of of fruity/acidic/spicy yeast, quince/sea buckthorn fruit, and moderate pale malt flavors; with a great malt/tart/spiciness balance, and zero puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Moderate dryness from tart/spiciness, increasing through the glass. Medium-high carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately crisp/acidic/saline, and fairly creamy/grainy balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4%. Overall this is an excellent fruited gose. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of of fruity/acidic/spicy yeast, quince/sea buckthorn fruit, and moderate pale malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, and quite refreshing to drink with the modest acidity. Really great balance between the lacto and fruit flavors; with a nice malt backbone. A really enjoyable offering.\xa02,031 characterssuperspak, Feb 11, 2017']

name: Simpler Times (Pig Ate My Pizza Collab)
review:
["4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.5%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25A huge thanks to Jeff for this. 750ml crowler into Night Shift stemware. 

Nice color. Nose is super funky. Hints of cheese and hay mixed with unripened strawberry, lemon zest and cream. Very aromatic. Beer opens with a crazy strawberry bang. Like I'm drinking tart strawberry jam. Lemon appears in the middle and finishes off with a bright, zesty pucker. More fresh lemon and strawberry seediness at the finish. Delicious. Body is light with ample carbonation. Prickly and lively on the palate and goes down puckering and tart with a lingering finish. Easy drinking. 

I don't remember the last time I've encountered a more strawberry-y sour. Definitely unique.\xa0663 charactersSpeedwayJim, Jul 27, 2019", '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4On tap. Whit head. Lightly hazed golden color.

Tons of strawberries up front. Then the lemon kicks in. Citrusy with a little acidity. Tart. Reminds me of sour patch kids.\xa0171 charactersmothman, May 22, 2019']

name: Beyond the Shore
review:
['4.11/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5.9%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Look: Pours a deep, almost gold color with a thin white head that quickly fizzles away. 

Aroma: Salted sourdough pretzels, ocean air, tart lemon peel and slight floral notes.

Taste: Creamy. Salty at first with savory/malty flavors of lightly toasted bread and wheat. Tart and briny midpalate with sweet lemon, ending on clean notes of soft coriander and basil. Lots of mineral, salty flavor, the aftertaste reminds me of the beech.

Feel: Sessionable, crisp, effervescent. Light-medium body. Mildly creamy but bubbly overall.

Overall: Highly recommended.\xa0557 charactersBloodSoakedAleMug, Jul 19, 2019', "3.71/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.4%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75A: The beer is somewhat hazy and a darker shade of yellow in color with a light amount of visible carbonation. It poured with just a few white bubbles on the surface that quickly faded away.
S: Light aromas of lemony yogurt are present in the nose.
T: The taste follows the smell and has light flavors of yogurt with notes of lemons (without any associated acidity). There is a light amount of sourness.
M: It feels a bit more than light-bodied and slightly creamy on the palate with a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: This beer isn't as sour or salty compared to other beers in the style, but is pleasant and has some refreshing properties.

Serving type: can\xa0663 charactersmetter98, Oct 24, 2018"]

name: Cherry Lime Gose
review:
['3.92/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.6%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4On tap at Canon & Draw in Richmond.

Pours a light reddish orange with a little bit of fine foam.

Smell is tart with notes of white wine, cherries and lime.

Taste is lightly acidic and tart, with notes of cherries, lime and Prosecco. Very refreshing.

Mouthfeel is thin to medium, a bit creamy, with sparkling carbonation.

Overall, a very enjoyable gose, light and refreshing.\xa0379 charactersJamFuel, Dec 09, 2018', '3.72/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.6%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75On-tap at Canon & Draw Brewing Company, Richmond, VA

A: The beer is hazy orange amber in color. It poured with a minimal white collar around the edge of the glass.
S: Light aromas of red cherries are present in the nose.
T: The taste has flavors of cherries blown tin hints of lime and some saltiness.
M: It feels light- to medium-bodied and faintly creamy on the palate with a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: This beer is easy to drink and was almost like having a cherry lime popsicle.

Serving type: on-tap\xa0514 charactersmetter98, Aug 11, 2018']

name: MidWestern Exotic
review:
['4.57/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.5%look: 4 | smell: 5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5Appearance: Arrives a hazy orange juice color with a one finger head; a few dribs and drabs of lace

Smell: Pungent tangerine - just smells fresh squeezed 

Taste: The tangerine pounces with a blood orange element adding more bitterness; the peach adds some sweetness but it is very subtle; the salt is more discernible here than in many Goses but it does not overwhelm 

Mouthfeel: Light to medium body with moderate carbonation; rather puckery 

Overall: This is a fantastic Gose with really bright flavors\xa0513 charactersbrentk56, Oct 10, 2019', '4.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.9%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5On tap. White head. Hazed golden orange.

Straight tang juice. The tangerines pop with orange and peach blending in. Very tart and citrusy. Lemon. 

Light bodied. Massive flavor. Need this for the summer. One of their best Goses.\xa0229 charactersmothman, May 22, 2019']

review:

O: This beer is packed with lots of aromas and flavors of guava and key lime. It seems to be a lot more fruitier compared to other beers in the style.

Serving type: can\xa0636 charactersmetter98, Mar 30, 2019']

name: BlackBerry Gose
review:
['3.95/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.8%look: 4.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Hazy, translucent purple appearance with a creamy, white and purple-tinged head. Good retention and lacing for a Gose.

The aroma is immediately salt and coriander, but also lots of berry jam.

The palate is blackberry jam and wheat malt, but very prominent salt and coriander. A spicy and balanced, tart Gose.\xa0312 charactersHorseheadsHophead, Nov 07, 2019', '3.53/5\xa0\xa0rDev -11.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.516 oz can split with my wife. Looks very nice - fairly dark purple color with a nice rocky off-white head. Smell and flavor are fairly sour with some fruitiness but not a whole lot else going on. Not terrible but definitely a letdown.\xa0234 charactersLucular, Sep 30, 2019', '4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.8%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25L: hazy purple/pink with a thin lilac head that quickly dissolves to a film
S: unripe blackberries, citrus, sea water, funky yeast
T: tart blackberries sprinkled with a little salt, some lemon
F: nice carbonation puts some tingle on the tongue and throat. Smooth and dry with a pleasant tart/salty aftertaste
O: a darn good blackberry gose. The berry flavor is prominent without being over powering, the saltiness is well balanced by the funky tanginess. My only complaint is that I would have preferred slightly over-ripe blackberries to slightly under-ripe ones, but over all this is a very tasty beer.\xa0604 charactersofficerbill, Sep 28, 2019', '4.34/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Very juicy berry taste however, to be a true gose I need to taste the salt and I’m just not getting any of that. Should be more of an American wild ale beer rather than a gose.\xa0178 charactersThe_Beer_Guru, Aug 26, 2019']

name: The Fox & the Monkey
review: ['3.98/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.8%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Had on tap. Very nice work in creating an all around authentic and tasty gose. Takes you on an adventure of light wheat followed by a lovely tang of lime, sour, passion fruit and slight saltiness.\xa0198 charactersREVZEB, May 18, 2018']

name: Spicy Avocado Margarita
review:
["3.7/5\xa0\xa0rDev -5.4%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.5Served in goblet from the can. 

Appearance: Hazy green color looking a bit like a concentrated green tea with medium bubbles creating a white head rising a nudge or so above one finger's length. 

Smell: Smells like lemons and lime zest. Seriously, I cook as a hobby and it's strong with another dose of yeast. Has a Belgian aroma which makes me think of some lambics. 

Taste: alright, definitely complex sour with a spicy feel. It has a sweet undertone but it's very mellow. The spiciness from the hot sauce might be a touch overbearing for some. 

Mouth: Touch dry and carbonation is coming off full with a full body to go with it. 

Overall: I normally don't like spicy beers but this one is actually refreshing. Spicy lemon lime Gatorade. Yes I said it and don't care. Always in a glass, Salud!\xa0800 charactersBlurryVisi0n, Aug 15, 2019"]

name: Double Passion Fruit
review: ['4.23/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Had on tap. Cloudy golden pour with no head. Smell and taste are the same: a whole lot of passionfruit, with slight lime, wheat, and lemon, not complex but enjoyable. Has sour pucker and slight acidity without being overwhelming. Feel could use a little more behind it besides the passionfruit sweetness and sour, but if looking for a lighter berliner with tons of one note flavor, look no further!\xa0402 charactersREVZEB, Jun 22, 2019']

name: Proc-La-Rita
review:
['3.99/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.7%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Poured from a 32oz growler into a solo cup (who needs proper glassware at the beach!?)

Appearance: Light, straw yellow with a thick, sudsy head. Tons upon tons of bubbles!

Aroma: Lots of limey citrus and acidity. Smells refreshing and tropical.

Taste: Like a carbonated, slightly alcoholic margarita mix. I mean that in the best way possible......really refreshing and "crushable." The basil comes through and really drinks like a margarita soda, with just the right amount of sour.

Feel: Crisp, with a very light body and a super-clean finish.

Overall: the perfect brew for a badminton match, a sand-castle build, or the base for an especially delicious margarita. Nice and refreshing, with great flavor to boot!\xa0718 charactersTheElectricOne, Jul 10, 2015']

name: Dark Fruit Gose
review:
["3.85/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.758oz glass at Beer Revolution YEG Oliver Square. Not sure if this is a unique offering, but it's been made clear that it's not up to me.

This beer appears a murky, medium magenta colour, with a thin cap of wispy and faintly bubbly pink head, which leaves a low-lying berm of fuzzy lace around the glass as it quickly blows off. 

It smells of lemon juice, mixed black berry fruity notes, white saltine crackers, gritty and grainy pale malt, a soft earthy yeastiness, and some faint leafy, herbal, and floral noble bitters. The taste is grainy and crackery cereal malt, a muddled dark stone and berry fruitiness, lemon peel, saline solution, and more understated earthy, musty, and floral green hoppiness. 

The carbonation is quite meek in its perfunctory frothiness, the body a decent middleweight, and mostly smooth, but for a mild fruity tartness messing with the ideal here. It finishes trending dry, the sourness amping up its lingering game. 

Overall - well, this is indeed a pleasantly rendered version of the style, with the unspecified 'dark fruit' carrying itself with a certain aplomb. Frooty, tart, and full-flavoured, it works for me as a keg-kicker on a sunny May afternoon - muchas gracias, once again, Hamish!\xa01,228 charactersbiboergosum, May 20, 2018", '4.59/5\xa0\xa0rDev +17.1%look: 4 | smell: 5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Very interesting experience. Bright ruby red brew. Surprisingly light aroma, but flavor is full of fruit but also a bit of saltiness (which I learned from the bartender is true to the type). Also a bit of tartness.

Enjoyed on tap at the Green Growler in Croton-on-Hudson, New York.\xa0282 charactersjmbranum, May 06, 2018']

name: Magic Lantern: Passion Fruit, Peach, Apricot
review: ['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.1%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4i dont think i love this base gose, no matter what they put in it, its just sort of thick and messy to me, but that said, this is my favorite iteration i have had of it so far. i think the passion fruit is out in front of the other fruits, but thats cool, because it seems to have a similar tartness and sweetness as the base beer itself, and that is a nice unity. the peach tastes fresh and natural to me too, and i like the sweetness balancing out some of the sourness of the gose. this doesnt taste salty to me though, and i sort of miss it here, it would accent some of the fruit in a needed way, and it would help some of the sweetness resolve in the finish, but instead its just the acid there. sort of jammy and thick too, not as light and refreshing as i like the style to be, almost overly wheaty and fruity, kind of the opposite of what i look for in the style from a texture standpoint, but i find myself enjoying its substance and layers. this isnt my favorite series these guys do, but i understand they need something in the taproom that they can turn around a little faster than some of the oak aged wild beers. good not great, but definitely unique...\xa01,167 charactersStonedTrippin, Dec 27, 2017']

name: Mother Gose
review:
['3.52/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.6%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Pours looking like mango juice.

Smell is tart with notes of mango, lime, grass and bell peppers.

Taste is tart and vegetal with big notes of bell peppers, with some mango and lime around the edges. Some lemon comes on along with a slight chili heat, and a little bit of salt on the finish.

Mouthfeel is thin, well carbonated.

Overall, a well made beer, never overdoing the pepper.\xa0384 charactersJamFuel, Oct 05, 2019']

name: La Gose Town
review: ['3.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev -10%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Bottle: Poured a light pale yellow color Gose with a large white foamy head with good retention. Aroma of lightly citric notes with some tart notes also noticeable. Taste is a nice mix of tart notes with light citric notes and alight lemony finish with a hint of smoke. Acidity is very low. Body is about average from style with good carbonation. Enjoyable and easily drinkable with some complexity.\xa0399 charactersPhyl21ca, Nov 30, 2015']

name: Maverick & Gose Key Lime Gose
review:
['4.32/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 4 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25In a snifter at O'Brien's Pub.

A: Cloudy pale yellow, as one expect when mixing lime and soda. No head. No release of bubbles.

S: Lime nose with no other detectable scents. Lemonade!

T: Strong refreshing lime tartness with no chemical bite like bottled lime juice. Clean finish with no lingering tartness. No "Cry Baby" burnout of the tongue.

F: Thin and light as the bubbles come alive on the palate.

O: Super refreshing on a San Diego summer day. Highly tart and sour, which I seek out.\xa0494 charactersDangalicious, Aug 09, 2015']

name: Gose
review:
['3.9/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.6%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Poured into a pokal, the appearance was a semi-milky/pulled cloudy yellow color with a slight translucen translucency to it. A smal small finger and a half's worth of white foamy head started and glided off at a good enough pace. No lace.
The aroma had some malted wheat trying to display some sour to tart character. Yes to the "sour-ed" wheat experience in this, though I must admit, the "sour-ed" wheat was quite faint. Some lemon sweetness and a low lying salinity rides the underneath.
The flavor was a moderate sweet wheaty portion developing into some sour to tart qualities then trying to mix it up with some saline features. Aftertaste was sour-ed wheat, semi-tart and an ever so slight touch of salinity.
The mouthfeel was about medium bodied with a fair sipping quality about it. Good carbonation for a gose. Finish was semi-sour with a clean tartness and a nice push from the wheat, some sticky sweet to sour.
Overall, pretty nice gose for the most part, I'd come back to this.\xa0989 charactersLone_Freighter, Aug 26, 2019', '4.26/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.2%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25Canned 5/28/19. Not sure how I missed it. Pours a cloudy whitish-blonde hue with a thin head into my glass. Aroma is sweet, grassy, reminiscent of summer. Crisp, clean citrus upfront, followed by a touch of buttery malt in the middle. Super clean finish. Easygoing example of this wonderful style, perfect for those hot summer days!\xa0332 charactersBrad007, Aug 03, 2019']

name: Red & Blue Imperial Puffsicle
review:
["4.29/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.4%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25This one pours a super murky and joosy looking purple color, with a small head, and lots of lacing.

This smells mainly like blueberry, creamy and like pie, with some raspberry, and light vanilla/marshmallow.

This is my first Joose, and it's absolutely ridiculous. It's not beer, not at all- not even in the slightest, honestly. It's a far out representation of juice, and that's really what they were going for. It's got a thick flavor, with more blueberry than raspberry, and just a touch of vanilla on the finish.

This is creamy and chewy, with an impressive amount of fruit propping up the body here. It's very drinkable.

These beers are ridiculous. It's hard for me to actually accept them, but at the very least they taste quite good.\xa0743 charactersGreesyFizeek, Dec 21, 2018", '4.35/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25On tap at The Answer.

Pours a deep purple with pink foam.

Smell is sweet to start with roasted marhmallows, and then a slight tartness with notes of raspberries and lemon.

Taste is sweet and sour, with distinct marshmallwy sweetness and tartness from ripe raspberries and blueberries with a hint of lemon.

Mouthfeel is medium, well carbonated.

Overall, a terrific sweet and sour beer with great balance.\xa0408 charactersJamFuel, Dec 08, 2018']

name: Spezial-Gose
review:
['4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.6%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25A: The beer is hazy amber yellow in color. It poured with a short white head.
S: Moderate aromas of lemons are present in the nose.
T: The taste is quite lemony and has a light to moderate amount of sourness.
M: It feels a bit more than light-bodied and slightly tart on the palate with a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: This gose is very easy to drink and has refreshing properties.

Serving type: bottle\xa0408 charactersmetter98, Jul 14, 2019', '4.68/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9.9%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.750.5l on tap.

Described as a cross of witbier and gose. 

Clear golden, head is typically weak but leaves a faint yet persistent lace.

Aroma is the salty, tart gose nose except a tad more fruitiness to it. 

Taste has a very pleasant creamy feel, much better than in the bottle version. As in best sours always, in my book at least. Smooth tartness, spicy coriander/bergamot in the middle, a sweet fruit/salt marriage shines throughout. All basic tastes except bitterness are present in perfect harmony. 

Having tasted this in bottle, which is good but lacks the creaminess and smoothness, I recommend the tap version. A classic.\xa0631 charactersKooVee, Apr 24, 2019']

name: This Gose
review:
['3.9/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Very nicely blanced Gose with just the right amount of koriander, salt and tartness to make it a light still tasty refreshing offering. Delicately balanced!\xa0156 characterssafaricook, Apr 16, 2017', "3.69/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.7%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5A: The beer is clear yellow in color and has a moderate amount of visible carbonation. It poured with a short white head that died down, leaving a narrow collar around the edge of the glass and some small patches of bubbles on the surface.
S: Light aromas of lemongrass are present in the nose.
T: The taste follows the smell and has delicate flavors of lemongrass along with hints of coriander spices.
M: It feels light- to medium-bodied and a little tart on the palate with a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: This beer is very easy to drink and has refreshing flavors of lemongrass. I didn't notice any saltiness.

Serving type: bottle\xa0641 charactersmetter98, Jul 02, 2016", '3.71/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.1%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75"This Gose is a collaboration beer brewed with our close neighbours Loch Fyne Oysters. Designed as the perfect beer to pair with their world famous smoked salmon. Tart and salty with herbal and citrus notes from the addition of coriander and lemongrass, this beer is zesty and refreshing on its own while pairing wonderfully with the rich and smoky flavours of the fish."

Bottle from Valhallas Goat, Glasgow. BBE 09/2017, so another 18 month BBE

Pours clear pale gold, nice two finger head.

Light, airy aroma , you can smell the lemongrass, pear drops, 

Initial hit of lemony sherbet, lemongrass again and the coriander, then the salty lemon hits which leads to dryness then the well rounded bready malt comes in. Aftertaste is a bit lemon jiff though - seems a bit fake if you get my meaning. No bitterness that I can tell. 

I'd like to try this with food, would be excellent imo .\xa0893 charactersHanglow, Apr 19, 2016']

name: Beach
review:
['4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.512 ounce can into tulip glass, canned on 7/19/2019. Pours very hazy medium golden yellow color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big tart/tangy limes, citrus peel/zest, lemon, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of limes, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt notes; with big strength. Taste of big tart/tangy limes, citrus peel/zest, lemon, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang; light zesty bitterness and spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/tangy limes, citrus peel/zest, lemon, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of limes, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; with an awesome malt/tartness and tangy fruit balance; with no puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp/clean finishing. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering tartness, tangy fruit, and carbonation. Medium-plus carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, creamy/grainy/acidic/tangy, and lightly saline/zesty balanced mouthfeel that fantastic. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5%. Overall this is an outstanding fruited gose. All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of limes, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink with the modestly acidic/tangy/drying finish; not overly lactic/salty. Very flavorful and not watery for the ABV. Awesome balance of vibrant limes and lacto complexity; with a great clean pale/wheat malt backbone. Minimal residual sweetness with crisp dryness. A highly enjoyable offering, and outstanding spot on style example as expected.\xa02,384 characterssuperspak, Sep 13, 2019', '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Taking the German Gose to the slightly darker side of sour beer, Central State Brewing employs the use of smoked sea salt and black lime for a decidedly citrus kick and a hint of darkness for added charm.

Cloudy gold and rising with a white foamy cap, Beach takes the senses to the beach with the radiant perfume of citrus, sea air and a general margarita, sangria scent. Its tepid sweetness greet the tongue with the soft suggestions of saltwater taffy, sourdough and agave. 

But its not until the sour ale splashes the middle palate that the true radiance of black limes. Its that jolt of citrusy zest that brings that strong margarita tone to the forefront in taste. Fleeting sweetness assists with the sharply acidic taste that highlights the lime and the more nuanced flavors of gooseberry, passionfruit, green apple and white grape. The roundness of sea salt amplifies the citrus and provides a slightly juicy taste late.

Not much in the way of smokiness, a mild peppery taste ensures that the medium light bodied beer remains supported and balanced. A quick aftertaste of burlap and lime extends slightly after a brisk, invigorating and refreshing finish.\xa01,165 charactersBEERchitect, Aug 19, 2019']

name: That's The Way It Gose
review:
['4.03/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4.25Note; Bottled 8/16/16, Bottle 110/144

A: Pours a relatively clear medium yellow in color with moderate amounts of active visible carbonation and faint pale golden yellow highlights. The beer has a finger tall fizzy foamy white head that quickly reduces to a large patch of thin film covering a little more than 75% of the surface of the beer and a thin ring at the edges of the glass. Light to moderate amounts of lacing are observed.

S: Light to moderate aromas of slightly sour wheat malts and grainy malts. That is followed by light to moderate amounts of briny salt, tart lemon citrus, and a hint of coriander.

T: Upfront there is a moderate flavor of slightly sour wheat malts and light to moderate flavors of grainy malts with just a hint of sweetness. That is followed by moderate flavors of briny salt and tart lemon citrus. Finally there is a light flavor of coriander towards the finish. The lingering flavor is one of tartness from the wheat and the lemon citrus.

M: Light bodied with slightly heavier than moderate amounts of carbonation. Crisp with light to moderate amounts of acidic prickliness.

O: A nice example of a gose, refreshing, and easy to drink. Enjoyable with a nice amount of tartness and enough salinity to balance it somewhat.\xa01,260 charactersdbrauneis, Sep 23, 2016']

review:
['3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev -9.9%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75L: hazy gold under a 1/2" fleeting white frothy cap

S: bright lime aroma with a little tart and some biscuit

T: big tart salty lime flavor with a light bread crumb backbone

F: medium light with medium carbonation and medium tartness

O: light and refreshing and very drinkable\xa0279 characterspat61, Oct 28, 2018', "4.53/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8.9%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Pours a nice golden color. Somewhat hazy, and murky. The head was minimal, and white. 
The nose is a nice funky aroma. Some of the barrel ageing in it, but there's also a fruity aroma mixed in. 
Taste really fruity up front, but there's a hint of the barrel ageing on the backside. The two flavors compliment each other well. I also get a hint of the salt in the beer, as well as the lime. 
Quite full bodied, even though it's only a 5.5 % beer. 
Damn, this beer is a winner. Just very well put together. All flavors just work together so well.\xa0544 charactersVictory_Sabre1973, Sep 17, 2017"]
