name: Death By Disco
review:
['4.03/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 3 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Welcome back to I CAN Only Tell You That I Am Drinking These New Beers This Sunday of My Own Free Will Before CANother Flashback Begins (Week 767)! I went upstairs after those first two & had a bit of a lay-down before arising & taking a tab. It's time for a CANQuest (tm) flashback to Weeks 755/756! 

A note of explaCANation: These next several are NOT out of the backlog, but from various venues as the pre-buyout CANs still have the "Independent" seal & will be CANlector items. I am buying them as I find them, but the stream will eventually dry up. 8=( 

From the CAN: "Kettle Sour Series"; "Gose Style Ale"; "Blackberry*Lemon*Sea Salt"; "Malts[:] Pilsner[,] Pale Wheat[,] Vienna[,] Carafoam[,] Acidulated[,] Melanoidin[,] Hops[:] Crystal[,] Yeast[:] American Ale[,] Adjuncts[:] Flaked Wheat[,] Blackberry Puree[,] Lemon Peel[,] Sea Salt[,] Plato[:] 10[,] IBU[:] 8"; "Ohio Craft Beer".

I was curious to try this one since I have found an affinity for Goses, thanks to their inCANsion of Sea Salt. To this end, and since it also had a wheat malt base, I did a little bit of in-CAN agitation before Crack!ing open the vent just to ensure that everything was in suspension. The Crack! was spectacular & so I CANtinued with a slow, gentle C-Line Glug into the awaiting glass. It responded by foaming up beautifully to form two-plus fingers of dense, foamy, rocky, pinkish head that would best be described as resembling freshly-spun cotton CANdy! Color was a cloudy Magenta (SRM = N/A). Nose smelled like salted Raspberry Lemonade! 8=O Hey, we now have salted caramels, salted chocolates, why not salted Raspberry Lemonade? Yum. Mouthfeel was thin-to-medium, less watery than many in the style. The taste was … ready? Salted Raspberry Lemonade! 8=O Oh my, but it was tart & salty! This would have been CANtastic during this past Summer. All three of the primary adjuncts worked really well together, as long as you are into saltiness. We know that Raspberry Lemonade is a real thing already. Dang, but this was tasty. Its (relatively) low ABV made it quite quaffable, again as long as neither tart (not sour) nor salt bother you. This was better than a cup of bug juice on the fantail! Finish was tart, salty & totally dry. Mmm. YMMV.\xa02,240 characterswoodychandler, Nov 03, 2019', "3.92/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.2%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4A: The beer is hazy ruby red in color—too hazy to see if there is any visible carbonation. It poured with a quarter finger high off white head that left a thin layer of bubbles covering the surface, a collar around the edge, and a touch of lacing down the sides of the glass.
S: Light to moderate aromas of sour blackberries are present in the nose along with hints of lactobacillus.
T: The taste has flavors of blackberries along with hints of lemon and only a light amount of sourness—it's just a tad bit more sour than it is salty.
M: It feels a bit more than light-bodied on the palate and has a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: This beer is very easy to drink and is much more fruitier than it is sour.

Serving type: can\xa0733 charactersmetter98, Feb 23, 2019"]

name: Margarita Gose
review:
['3.8/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Not sure the canned on date, but I know this batch was having over fermentation issues when not consistently refrigerated... more for me!

Pours a hazy brown-hued gold, with a small white head that quickly fizzles out.

Nice nose of tart lime zest and a sweet citrusy balance on the back end. 

The flavors are more of the same, bright zesty citrus and a medium acidity that balanced a light salt level. Wheaty, almost chewy finish; I’d prefer that acidity to finish but it’s still solid.

Light bodied, crisp. Lightly salty, lightly acidic. Bright flavors.\xa0561 charactersWickedBeer, Sep 13, 2018']

name: Cha Chaan Teng Gose
review:
['3.55/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3 | overall: 3.5A 946ml crowler, filled on 25th May 2017. Poured into a Lost Abbey teku.

Appearance: A clear pale golden copper colour with an almost two finger white head that dissipated quickly to nothing, and no lacing.

Aroma: Tart, sour, salted lime, lemon, bready malt and wheat.

Taste: Sour and salty, mainly salted lime and lemon with strong bready malt and wheatiness.

Mouthfeel: Medium-light bodied with only moderate to light carbonation.

Overall: Nice and refreshing especially for a hot summers day. If you haven’t tried it before, the salted lime may take some getting used to. But luckily, I’ve grown up with it. The one thing for me is that this would have been even better with higher carbonation.\xa0706 characterskitch, May 27, 2017']

name: Roja-Rita
review: ['4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.9%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Alright my minions, this beer pretty much is the epitome of “it is what it is.” And what this beer is, is straight toddler juice at 4.8%. For real, if I have some of this to my lil soldier he would guzzle it like a bad habit. But this is grown up toddler juice, so Raul ain’t gonna do that. Thang pours a light rub red like Lucille Ball at her local salon. With that is simple fruit essence, kind of like smelling that alien fruit punch they sell at your local Albertsons. Taste? Yep. Right along those lines. Straight fruit punch with added lime salt, and they best part, booze.\n\nDo it again? Why the hell not! Yes please!\xa0629 charactersRaulMondesi, Mar 23, 2019']

name: Never Never Sorry Sorry
review:
['4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Appearance: Arrives with the liquid looking like purple paint; a one finger mauve head caps and splatters lace

Smell: Black currant and blackberry aromatics dominate; the raspberry and apricot take a back seat

Taste: As with the aroma, the tart black currant comes on strong, with the twin berry flavors balancing; through the middle, the apricot makes a stand and hangs around for the finish; just a hint of salt in the aftertaste 

Mouthfeel: Medium to full body with moderate carbonation; very creamy, almost like a smoothie 

Overall: Nice expression of fruit, particularly if you are a fan of dark berries\xa0617 charactersbrentk56, Oct 01, 2019']

name: Salty Walter
review: ['3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75hands down the best beer we had at old soul, and really the only one we tried from them that i would care to drink again without some tweaks being made. its a very well done gose, the right amount of tart without being too acidic, just enough to be refreshing, and very clean and refined in the lacto profile, more professional there than really anything else happening in this place. its light and bright and active in the glass, with a short but lasting white head on top, lots of bubbles, and a bright lemony tangy aroma, smells fresh and summery, an attractive hot weather quencher. the salt aspect is great in here too, drying out the wheat malt beautifully in the finish and giving an almost oceanic property to the taste, perfect for florida! good body here and almost crisp at the end with the dryness and the nice carbonation. lemon zest there at the end too from the lacto. definitely the best beer these guys had on when we visited, although the blackberry tart was also quite good. they seem to have the front end souring process pretty well down. recommended.\xa01,072 charactersStonedTrippin, Feb 28, 2018']

name: Savage Crush
review:
['4.08/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.8%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4A: The beer is cloudy dark yellow in color. It poured with quarter finger high white head that quickly died down, leaving a few specks of bubbles on the surface and a narrow collar around the edge of the glass.
S: Light to moderate aromas of blood orange, guava, and passion fruit are present in the nose along with hints of salty funk.
T: The taste follows the smell, but has much stronger flavors of tropical fruits with guava and passion fruit standing out in particular. There are some notes of limes and hints of saltiness towards the finish.
M: It feels medium-bodied on the palate and has a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: This gose tastes more like a fruit drink than a beer. I really liked all of the tropical flavors in the taste.

Serving type: can\xa0766 charactersmetter98, Feb 21, 2019']

name: Ivana Humpalot
review:
["4.46/5\xa0\xa0rDev +12.9%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5L: Had this beer on-tap at The Answer Brewpub, poured into a snifter glass. Had a pinkish-red color and a cloudy consistency. There was a quarter inch of off white, foamy, fairly long-lasting head. Good lacing.

S: An incredibly fruity aroma of citrus, watermelon, wheat, and sea salt.

T: Tasted of a small amount of wheat (barely noticeable), lots of citrus fruit (lemon, orange), a tinge of sea salt, a good shot of watermelon, and some pears as well. Like the aroma, the flavor is quite fruity. It's sweet, zesty, and pretty sour / tart. An oddly complex and well done flavor.

F: A well-carbonated beer with a vibrant finish. Light-bodied.

O: This is one of the more interesting takes on the gose style I've had recently. Drinkable.\xa0738 charactersavalon07, Apr 22, 2018"]

name: What Gose Round
review:
['4.16/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Draft at the brewpub.
Murky hazed orange, nearly opaque. A fingers width of foam that fades to a thin ring, no surface skim.

Aroma is crisp and minerally, not much acidity.
Taste is more acidic and sour, lemony tang with an initial hint of the pink Himalayan salt on first taste. 
The sourness is dominant but fades soon into a clean dry finish. Light and very quenching, had two in a row easily. 
Really nails the style, and very refreshing on humid August day. Had 2 in a row.\xa0479 charactersemerge077, Aug 07, 2016']

name: Juiced! Guava
review:
['4.12/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.4%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Canned 12/28/18. Not the freshest but I am looking forward to trying it. 
L: Pours a straw yellow in color, slight unfiltered appearance. Little head formation and bar-none lacing. 
S: Defined salinity with bright fruit presence. Smells like an appealing gose. 
T: Tons of guava character with salty finish. Finish is slightly bready with lingering flavors of guava and tartness. 
F: Medium in body and light to medium in weight. Appropriate carbonation for the style. 
O: I am a big fan of beers in the gose style. Super refreshing and low abv keep me coming back for more. This would be a sunny day treat forsure. I am very glad to have tried. Cheers!\xa0653 charactersTheBrewsky, Mar 29, 2019', '4.76/5\xa0\xa0rDev +12.8%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5A very solid gose. The guava was not overbearing but complimentary to the gose style. It was not overly sour or salty. Went down easy. Worth a shot!\xa0152 charactersIRONRakkasan, Mar 25, 2019']

name: Older Pro Gin
review:
['4.14/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.2%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.5Thanks to bl00 for this one from NBS BIF #007. 16oz can poured into 10oz fluted tulip. Poured a cloudy medium yellow with about an inch of white head that had moderate retention and no lacing.

A definite Gin note was at the front of the nose, with some grain as a base. There were a variety of fruit and floral tones as well.

Very similar on the tongue, with a pleasantly sharp tang. A wee bit of wood was also apparent.

The body was light and crisp, and had a tart, dry finish.

Drinkability was very good, the gin goes extremely well with the Gose. Overall, an excellent beer. A must-try if you get the chance.\xa0615 charactersbeertunes, Apr 10, 2018']

name: First Ascent Gose
review:
["3.52/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5650ml bottle - wow, a straight-up Gose, with no fruity or flowery adjuncts, it's been a while!

This beer pours a slightly hazy, medium golden yellow colour, with two fingers of puffy, loosely foamy, and bubbly off-white head, which leaves but a few specks of remote islet lace around the glass as it quickly dissipates.

It smells of sour grain, some estery yeastiness, a whiff of baby puke, some muddled earthy spiciness, and faint leafy, herbal, and dead floral hop bitters. The taste is gritty and grainy cereal malt, mild salted crackers, ethereal coriander spice, some weak tart lactic 'character', and more well-understated earthy, musty, and floral hoppiness.

The carbonation is quite timid in its damned-near inert frothiness, the body an adequate middleweight, and mostly smooth, with nothing really creating any sense of a disturbance at this particular juncture. It finishes off-dry, the lightly-soured malt exhibiting the most lingering moxie.

Overall - this is a more or less capably rendered version of the style, and aside from that misstep in the aroma, easy enough to put back - another pleasant salve for a string of sweltering days for we who are without A/C here in Wild Rose Country.\xa01,209 charactersbiboergosum, Jul 19, 2018"]

name: Northern Monk/North Northern Powerhouse 2019 002 Triple Fruit Gose
review:
['4.01/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Pours a reddish orange with a little bit of foam along the edges.

Smell is tart and juicy with notes of raspberries, papaya and melon.

Taste is tart with a little bit of sweetness. Notes of cream, raspberries, papaya, melon, grapes and a hint bitterness. Very refreshing with a tinge of saltiness on the finish.

Mouthfeel is medium, creamy and well carbonated.

Overall, a very nice sour. Far from a traditional gose, but very tasty.\xa0436 charactersJamFuel, Aug 06, 2019']

name: Rosa's Gose
review:
['4.18/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.2%look: 3 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Served in a weizen glass at the brewery.

Arrives with a foamy, frothy pale white head. Lace settles over the body. The body looks like a banana smoothie, cloudy yellowish with a mineral tinge. It looks a bit chewy. 3

The aroma is definitely potent with salt, but also banana and lemon and some acidity. Tartness is present. 4.25

Plenty of sat makes its way to the palate and I give them a thumbs up for that. Follows with tart flavors and hints of berry-like fruit, a tad of yogurt, hints of sweet wheat, crisp apple, and light funkiness. 4.25

Though the appearance suggest otherwise, this drinks light and refreshing. Tartness prevails with a dry, salty element and mineral feel throughout. 4.25

Easy drinking, flavorful and tart and salty enough for the uber beer geeks that only speak the language of sours and barrel-aged beers, this brew does the trick.\xa0864 charactersONovoMexicano, Apr 23, 2015']

name: La Vida Gose #7 (Plums Blueberries & Cherries)
review:
['3.93/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.2%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Pours purple with a one inch light pink head that left almost no lacing. Smells of cherries, plums and.mild lactic acid sourness. Tastes of tart cherries, plums, blueberries, blackberries, mild tartness, mild lactic acid sourness. Light to medium bodied, lightly carbonated, dry mouth feel.\xa0290 charactersEMH73, Aug 22, 2019', '3.66/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.1%look: 4.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Received in a trade and shared with JLindros.

A - Poured into a Kate the Great tulip a nice hazy plum purple hue with a thick pinkish white head that fades to leave light wisps.

S - Aromas of really bright cherries and plums. Tons of blueberries and sweet tartness. I do sadly get a huge buttery oak, which can only mean one thing: diacetyl.

T - Taste is similar to the nose with loads of buttery diacetyl. Incredibly unfortunate. The fruits are pleasant, good plums and cherries, light tartness and sweet berries.

M - Mouthfeel is lightly carbonated, really astringent, tons of diacetyl flemmy slickness as well.

O - Overall this was a really underwhelming beer. Tons of diacetyl here ruins the beer, which is a shame because the fruits are really nice.

Serving Type: can\xa0778 charactersrudzud, Aug 10, 2019', '3.52/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.9%look: 4.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3Thanks to rudzud
Light pink foamy semi dense head, medium retention, light lacing, dark very hazy opaque purple auburn color

Nose loads of fruit, plum, cherry, blueberry all there , very berry fruit but also quite tart, lactic acid, little sour lacto and hint spice, a little buttery diacetyl

Taste big tart fruit, all berries, plum, blueberry, cherry, tasty lactic acid tart yogurt, then a ton of buttery popcorn diacetyl unfortunately, especially late, little flemmy, dry flemmy acidic finish, lingering diacetyl and tart berry fruit, dry gritty astringent finish

Mouth is med bod, medium carb, slick diacetyl, light acidity, little astringent 

Overall the fruit was great but diacetyl and light astringency was really sad\xa0728 charactersjlindros, Aug 10, 2019']

name: Stranger Than Me
review:
["3.67/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.8%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.7516 oz can

Pours slightly hazy lemon gold. Sugar white head retains as a lacing.

Smells of crackers, lemon citrus, and lactic acid. 

Tastes of citrus juice, lactic acid, lime, cracker and bready malts. 

Light to medium body with tingly carbonation on the tongue.

Okay gose. Nice presentation and aroma, flavor is a bit off. The tartness is there, but it has a slightly odd aftertaste. It's not bad, just a bit weird. Ultimately this would be a nice spring beer and is pretty refreshing. Sessionable, worth a try maybe for that.\xa0539 charactersCylinsier, Dec 18, 2017"]

name: Galloping Cranberry Gose
review: ["4.94/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.5%look: 5 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 5 | feel: 5 | overall: 5This beer is like nothing we have tasted anywhere. It's very easy to drink. We have tried all of them we can find on tap while visiting Wilmington and every one of them had some similarities, yet the fruits really come out in color, aroma, and flavor. This one had an obvious cranberry presence.\xa0295 charactersKev-a-Beer, Feb 25, 2019", '4.94/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.5%look: 5 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 5 | feel: 5 | overall: 5Last beer here for the night. I refuse to say which were pints and which were flights. I\'ve cleansed my pallet (washed the delicious Ocean from my tongue with the lovely Hay Bale). This brewery\'s Gose are insane. Perfect saltiness, sour, and fruit. Never been disappointed here with any beer. can\'t say that about many breweries across the country. Yall need to check this place out if you want true quality.\n\nAnd BTW, yes I rank aroma 4.75 because I don\'t think you can have perfect 5 aroma in a Gose if there is any fruit at all. Would have to "stank" a bit, and this doesn\'t.\xa0578 charactersCaliBeerBear, Feb 25, 2019']

name: La Manchurita
review:
['4.63/5\xa0\xa0rDev +20.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 4.75It pours a somewhat cloudy, lime yellow body with visible carbonation, and a thick, soapy, white head.

It has a distinct aroma of blackcurrant and lemon. Very alluring.

The taste is really crisp and lightly sour, with lemon, blackcurrant, salt and spices. Light bodied. Highly carbonated. The aftertaste leaves a nice taste of lemon in your mouth.

Crisp, clean, refreshing and unique. Very enjoyable. Perfect for summer.\xa0423 charactersNofoba, Oct 30, 2019']

name: Mango Chili Gose
review: ['4.01/5\xa0\xa0rDev +11.1%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4.25Pours a hazy, orange coloration with a small, fizzy head that soon fades to nothing. Smell has an odd cucumber aroma to it, although some mango is also coming through. Taste is a great balance juicy, somewhat tangy mango, some quite noticeable chili heat that builds up into the aftertaste and medium lactic acidity, giving this a certain citrus note, as well as the merest hint of cucumber for some reason (they also make a cucumber Gose, coincidence?). Finishes with a medium lactic acidity and some mango, as well as a medium/strong chili heat that lingers quite a bit on the tongue long after the swallow. Smooth mouthfeel with a medium body and carbonation.\n\nWhile I suspect that the chili heat may be a bit much for some here, I personally think that this is quite a nicely balanced Gose with a refreshing, tangy mango character and good acidity, with the spicy chili note fitting in quite well and lending a rather nice kick to this.\xa0940 charactersSnowcrash000, Sep 13, 2019']

name: Super Love
review: ['4.18/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.516 ounce can into tulip glass, canned on 7/10/2019. Pours fairly hazy pale golden yellow color with a 2 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice dense foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big juicy/tart/tangy passion fruit, fruit skin/seeds, lemon, lime, peach, pear, pineapple, apricot, melon, berries, red/green apple, white grape/wine, coriander, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of passion fruit, fruity/acidic yeast, coriander, salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt notes; with big strength. Taste of big juicy/tart/tangy passion fruit, fruit skin/seeds, lemon, lime, peach, pear, pineapple, apricot, melon, berries, red/green apple, white grape/wine, coriander, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang, and coriander spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/tangy passion fruit, fruit skin/seeds, lemon, lime, peach, pear, pineapple, apricot, melon, berries, red/green apple, white grape/wine, coriander, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of passion fruit, fruity/acidic yeast, coriander, salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; with a fantastic malt/tartness and tangy fruit balance; with no puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp/clean finishing. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering tartness, tangy fruit, and carbonation. Medium-plus carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/grainy/acidic/tangy/sticky, and lightly saline mouthfeel that is fantastic. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4%. Overall this is an outstanding fruited gose. All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of passion fruit, fruity/acidic yeast, coriander, salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink with the modestly acidic/tangy/drying finish; mellowly lactic/salty. Awesome balance of big juicy fruit and Lacto complexity; with a great clean pale/wheat malt backbone against acidity. Minimal residual sweetness with crisp dryness. A highly enjoyable offering, and outstanding style example. Fantastic summer beer.\xa02,573 characterssuperspak, Aug 02, 2019']

name: Super Guapo
review:
["4.04/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 4Thanks to JLindros for sharing this can.

A - Poured into a Kate the Great tulip a nice hazy golden hue with a thin white head that fades to leave light wisps.

S - Aromas of light salinity, decent tart key lime, there is a decent amount of cereal grains.

T - Taste is similar to the nose with loads of tart key lime juice. Fair amount of salinity. Really bright, loads of creamy wheat and tart. Quite zesty with a good almost cake like flavour.

M - Mouthfeel is lightly carbonated, body is super light which comes across as very watery.

O - Overall this was a solid enough gose. Not on Westbrook level but it's a solid readily available replacement.

Serving Type: can\xa0672 charactersrudzud, Jun 22, 2019", '4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9.4%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 4.25Canned 5/18/19
Pours a light fizzy bubbly head that fades quickly, little lacing, clear pale golden slight tan color

Nose big key lime, supplier juicy key lime, with some zest, good tart gose base, hint doughy malt, salt note too, almost limeade

Taste tons of lime, key lime juice and tart zest, light base gose with little tart base and doughy bread base, lots of zest, light salt, although a little watery, dry finish, touch more salt and plenty of tart lime lingering with doughy cake batter like

Mouth is watery slight thin, medium carb, little tart flemmy

Overall pretty nice, good solid base and nice key lime, but a bit thin\xa0635 charactersjlindros, Jun 22, 2019']

name: Gose
review: ['3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.7%Poured on-tap and served in a stemmed goblet, the beer is a cloudy, bright yellow coloring, with a filmy, white head. Nose of salt, tart white grape, subtle citrus, sour notes, and a toasted grain backbone. The flavors are roasted/toasted grains forward, with a subtle tart white grape and citrus blend. Salt and brine highlights, and subtle buttered bread notes, too. Smooth, with a transition to crisp and dry. Very nice. The aftertaste is toasty and grainy mostly, with a dry, slightly tart lingering finish. Very drinkable.\xa0534 charactersGarthDanielson, Sep 10, 2014']

name: Toes On The Nose
review:
["4.47/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.6%look: 4 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5From a 32oz growler poured a couple weeks ago.

Pours a clean looking golden color, smallish white head that fades quickly, no lacing on the glass or head on top.

Smell has a huge burst of lemony goodness, I can pick up some sea-worthy aromas coupled with the citrus.

Taste has a nice balance between the salinity of the sea water used and the lemon zest presence, very light and crisp makes this easy to go down, a bit stronger than the typical Gose but you wouldn't know it when drinking, carbonation has fine bubbles and ample of it.\xa0538 charactersdeltatauhobbit, Apr 27, 2016"]

name: It's Pronounced Gose
review: ['3.56/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.8%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5the only sour i tried while i was in here, its not bad, interesting for not having fruit or anything weird in it, quite substantial for what it is, drinks a little heavy, but i really dont mind the grain and mineral character being a little more robust here, it just kind of caught be off guard for how low alcohol it is. this is brassy colored and shiny and doesnt hold much of a head, its clear for the style and has a lightly metallic nose where i get some lemon acidity and some coriander to it, a briny element from the salt, and quite a lot of malted wheat, more than i am used to, and that holds true in the flavor too, where the wheat is a little sweet and crackery, stands out quite a lot. the salt is stronger here which i like as well, helps it dry out at the end. funny esters to the lacto part though, tart green apple, dish soap, and lime, not as clean as i think it could be, and definitely not as drinkable, but its not overly acidic and its nice to have one as robustly flavored as this is. could use a little tweaking and dialing in, but its on its way.\xa01,071 charactersStonedTrippin, Sep 14, 2018']

name: Juice Cabuice
review: ['4.35/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Phenomenal gose. Had a sampling of 6 different SG beers, with Juice Cabuice thrown in at the end for something different, but it was by far my favorite of the night. Incredibly clean, tasty, and refreshing. Body is a pale golden straw color with a nice haze to it, strong carbonation, and a thin white head that road its way down the glass and left a faint trail of lacing. Aromas of lemongrass, pithy citrus, sour candy, wet hay, and a little briny saline. Just spot on. Taste carries those strong gose themes forward, with a bright tartness on the front of the sip, lemon and citrus rind following, a little white cracker and green grass, and the perfect amount of salt to dry out the aftertaste and leave me craving another sip. Wonderfully sharp and crisp. Feel is a hair bigger than I expected, silky and medium-bodied. Maybe it was the hot evening air and a refreshing beer style that fit the mood just right. Or maybe it was the fantastic execution of the beer itself. Either way, it was the beer I wanted to drink more and more of as the night rolled on.\xa01,073 charactersAmeriCanadian, Jul 16, 2017']

name: Meersalz - Raspberry
review:
['4.34/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.2%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Who needs the raspberry syrups when you have access to copious amounts of the actual berries to give a German-styled Gose depth, character and charm but without the syrupy sweetness that altered the original Leipzig sour and spice beer. And when you have the brewing prowess of Narrow Gauge the Gose style just got an upgrade.

Pouring a foggy and peachy mauve, the Raspberry Meersalz builds a softly pink stained froth. A juicy and tart scent of red berries decorate the nose along with notions of lemonade, rose wine and a gentle drift of citrus, burlap and sea air. But then the sweetness releases firm impressions of saltwater taffy, pastry tartlet and sourdough early in taste.

As the sour and wheaten ale splashes the middle palate, the radiant juiciness of raspberries share hard candy proportions with a achingly succulent jammy sweetness. But then the bracing sourness comes back with a crabapple, lime, lemon, gooseberry, white grape sourness. The rounded salinity and perfumy spice of coriander brings the sourness of ale and the copious raspberry flavors together seamlessly.

Medium bodied for a sour ale, the off-dry flavors carry a tremendous sense of culinary art as balance to the brazen acidity that threaten to batter the palate. But a medium quick finish leaves a trail of raspberry juices and damp burlap in its wake.\xa01,340 charactersBEERchitect, Oct 31, 2019', '4.41/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.8%look: 4.75 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25Poured from a can dated 7/22/19 into a stemmed goblet. Pours a gorgeous opaque reddish purple, definitely the color of raspberry. Thick pink head that dissipates fairly quickly with nice lacing. Smells of jammy sweet fruit. Full bodied. Lightly tart. More sweet raspberry with some bready notes on the finish. Fantastic.\xa0320 charactersmgundy32, Sep 26, 2019']

name: Riverita
review:
["4.14/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.9%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Can poured into a Mountain Rambler Brewing Co pint glass

A: Pours slightly hazy golden amber with a frothy off white head that dissipates relatively quickly and leaves a few spots of lacing. 

S: Zesty citrus, mild tartness, coriander, slight herbal notes, a touch of salt, twangy wheat, biscuity malt, and a little almost agave like sweetness. 

T: Pleasantly tart, zesty citrus, lots of lime plus a little lemon and tangerine, coriander spice, a touch of ginger, herbal notes, a hint of salt, biscuity malt, twangy wheat, and agave like sweetness. 

M: Medium body, moderately lively carbonation. 

O: The use of coriander and ginger add the perfect compliment to all the citrus. Wouldn't mind the body just a touch lighter, but overall a really solid margarita inspired beer.\xa0779 charactersRyanK252, Oct 15, 2019"]

name: Pure Guava
review: ["3.7/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.6%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75Can from Market of Choice. \n\nA mostly clear light yellow with a surprisingly large and long lasting head, this looks good. The nose has quite a bit of guava with a white guava juice character to go with the straw like wheat note. Mildly lactic as well. The palate opens with guava notes dominating, freah, juicy, floral and refreshing. Unfortunately, there isn't a whole lot else going on. The salt and coriander notes are mild, and the palate is a little watery. More cilantro like than a coriander seed note. Faintly lactic, this is warery, mildly slick on the finish with some lingering guava. Light in body and moderately carbonated, this beer is refreshing.\xa0663 charactersDefenCorps, Jan 20, 2019"]

review:

name: Salty Bitch
review:
["3.9/5\xa0\xa0rDev +13.4%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 45 oz pour on tap. Aroma and smell are tart wheat beer with some salinity and more coriander than I expected. Mouthfeel is moderately carbonated. Overall it's a solid gose.\xa0171 charactersLucular, Oct 18, 2019", '2.99/5\xa0\xa0rDev -13.1%look: 4 | smell: 1.25 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.512oz bottle into a pint glass at Hucklebucks, Pottsville, PA Thursday night. Best by 12/30/19, a very recent addition to the Flying Dog lineup. FD calls this an "American Tart Ale", but since it's brewed with salt & coriander, I'll put it in as a Gose. 

Pale slightly hazy yellow body with a decent white head which leaves a little lacing.

Gave it a sniff, and this might be the worst smelling beer I've ever had. I can think of no other word than body odor, which really made me think If I wanted to go further. But after a few moments, I took a nervous sip....

Fortunately, the aroma doesn't come through on the taste. Initially it's a little salty, but you get used to it, and after a few mouthfuls, it seems there is a decent balance, and in fact, most flavors come through as muted and light, except the coriander, which doesn't come through at all. It's not even excessively tart. malty, slightly salty, and a little grainy. 

Mouth is a solid medium, finish malty and a little salty. 

Overall, given the aroma, this turned out better than expected, but it still isn't a good beer. Another party at the table declared it worse than blue moon and could not handle more than 2 mouthfuls.\xa01,196 charactersMikeWard, Aug 31, 2019']

name: Lough Gill / Thin Man / Industrial Arts - Sligose
review:
['3.83/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.7%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 4better than its ratings, a cool collaboration, and a neat beer to put oysters in, although i really wanted this to be weirder. at the same time that i respect it for being subtle in the right ways, i also sort of need more from it, i want to taste salt and seaweed and oysters as odd beer ingredients in this well made base gose, but i hardly do, mostly in the finish for all of it, and it just ends up tasting like a slightly better gose than everyone else is doing, but not nearly as interesting as it should given the recipe. still light to drink, not much malt flavor here, lots of bubbles too, and an assertive, even gripping dryness, all of which i like. the salt is there, but it doesnt taste special to me, and the oysters add some obvious protein to the body and perhaps a bit of added salinity, but not the fishy funk i wanted here. seaweed is minimal too, but none of this negative talk has anything to do with how well i liked the beer overall, which was a whole lot. tart and clean and crisp and with a little of the oyster fresh cold water oceanic vibe later on, i want more of all the ingredients, but this is a great gose, no debate. smart use of some curious adds, be bolder next time! drinkable by the barrel full, we all thought this was delicious on a hot summer boat day!\xa01,292 charactersStonedTrippin, Aug 21, 2018', '3.71/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75A: The beer is clear yellow in color and has a moderate amount of visible carbonation. It poured with a half finger high white head that died down, leaving a few small patches of bubbles on the surface and a collar around the edge of the glass.
S: Moderate aromas of seaweed are present in the nose—these seem to resemble orange peel.
T: The taste follows the smell and is somewhat orangey with some salty hints of brine towards the finish.
M: It feels light- to medium-bodied on the palate and has a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: I would never have guessed that a seaweed and oyster gose would be this pleasant tasting.

Serving type: can\xa0647 charactersmetter98, Jul 21, 2018']

name: Double Red Raspberry Gose
review: ['4.28/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.6%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 416 ounce can into tulip glass, canned on 10/18/2018. Pours very hazy dark ruby red/pink/orange color with a 1 finger fairly dense and fluffy light pink head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a small cap that lasts. Nice dense foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of big juicy/sour/tart/tangy red raspberries, fruit skin/seeds, lemon, lime, orange, grapefruit, peach, plum, pear, apricot, red/green apple, red grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, biscuit dough, light toast/peppercorn, lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of raspberries, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, and pale/wheat malt notes; with big strength. Taste of huge juicy/sour/tart/tangy red raspberries, fruit skin/seeds, lemon, lime, orange, grapefruit, peach, plum, pear, apricot, red/green apple, red grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, biscuit dough, light toast/peppercorn, lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tart/sourness, fruit tang, and light spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of sour/tart/tangy red raspberries, fruit skin/seeds, lemon, lime, orange, grapefruit, peach, plum, pear, apricot, red/green apple, red grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, biscuit dough, light toast/peppercorn, lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of raspberries, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, and pale/wheat malt flavors; with a fantastic malt/tart/sourness and tangy fruit balance; with no puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp finishing. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering tart/sourness and tangy fruit. Medium carbonation and medium-plus body; with a very smooth, creamy/bready/grainy, acidic/tangy/tannic, and fairly saline balanced mouthfeel that is fantastic. Zero warming alcohol for 5.5%. Overall this is an incredible fruited gose. All around fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of raspberries, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, and pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth and fairly crisp/refreshing to drink with the modestly acidic/tangy/tannic/drying finish. Nicely soft feel, and not overly lactic/salty. Fantastic balance of super juicy/jammy berries and lacto complexity; with a nice sized pale/wheat malt backbone against acidity. Mild residual sweetness with crisp acidic/tangy dryness. A highly enjoyable offering, and outstanding spot on style example as expected.\xa02,569 characterssuperspak, Oct 30, 2019']

name: Barney Kool Breeze
review: ['3.9/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.8%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75the flavors of this boysenberry gose are better than its execution, if that makes sense. like, the taste of the fruit is great, its salted just enough, and the lactic weirdness is actually flattering to the complexion of this one, but from a technical standpoint, the beer is way too wheaty and thick and heavy and flat to be refreshing like the style should be, and the lacto souring isnt near clean enough for this to fit what i look for in more expertly done examples of the style, except that i cant hate on it at all because i like the way it tastes so much. the boysenberry is sweet and jammy, but has some tartness of its own, and the wheat makes it taste and feel almost creamy, like richer and bigger, but without really adding any sweetness. awesome. i wish it had just a little less body and some better carbonation, because then it would be tip top, the fruit in here is excellent and i like the way the salt brings it out. not just a summer beer either at this size and depth, which i also like it about it. these guys have taken some major strides forward lately!\xa01,077 charactersStonedTrippin, Sep 24, 2017']

name: Gose Sour Wheat
review: ['3.78/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.1%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75an impossibly mild version of the style here on all counts. the acidity is quite moderate, the saltiness is minimal for sure, and its not particularly herbaceous or fragrant, but it comes together super well, and is one of the most drinkable versions of the style i have had all summer, i mean, like by the bucket kind of beer, which is uncommon for a sour style. looks the part, hazy and light, with a tall white head. they were smart with this one though, keeping it rather delicate, its a patio pounder, which is a nice alternative to some of the others they have out there. a nice mineral profile, fresh white wheat, a soft earthy quality, insanely fresh, majorly clean bacterial tang, but not much more than that on the sour end, still very german and somehow more traditional seeming than most of these that are out there in the craft world right now. wonderful overall quality on this one, but those who like them super sour will find this less than fully satisfying. right in the wheelhouse for me! appreciate the low alcohol too!\xa01,038 charactersStonedTrippin, Sep 05, 2017', '3.79/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.3%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Poured a slightly hazy, orange color with a small, thin head of foam. It smelled of wheat, lemon and a general tartness. Tasted tart, slightly salty with lemon and mild wheat flavors.\xa0183 characterszeff80, Aug 14, 2017']

each sips were different and it made her special\xa0444 characters3Vandoo, Sep 02, 2019']

name: Yuzu & Grapefruit
review: ["4.03/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.5A very nice low-alcohol offering. The smell has a lot of fruits (yuzu, lemon, grapefruit) in it, which are suplemented in the taste with bergamot (Earl Grey). It has a gentle sour/salty profile. I'm actually amazed by the amount of different flavours they managed to put in this and how well they combine with eachother. Nice refreshing summer stuff, and way better than a lot of alternatives available in the low-percentage abv beer category.\xa0443 charactersZet, Sep 24, 2019", '4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.7%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Nice offering with low alcohol. Quite flavourfull with citric aromas from Yuzu and Grapefruit. not bitter and not sour seemingly from fruits. tartness from lactic acid and an apropriate salinity (Gose is the base beer). The earl grey stays nicely in the background and adds to the impressive orchester of well tuned tastes. Super refreshing but also deep. Very enjoyable low abv beer.\xa0384 characterssafaricook, Nov 25, 2018']

name: Monkey's Out of the Bottle
review:
['4.38/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.5When I got this, I was expecting something a long the lines of Sierra Nevada's "Otra Vez", however I ended up liking it more.

It poured into a pretty yellow color with a little bit of white head.

The pineapple wasn't overpowering, but definitely there and made for a pretty refreshing beer. While it wasn't the most 'crisp' beer, it still had a clean finish that didn't leave a bad aftertaste in the mouth that I sometimes find happens. 

Finishing it, I almost wanted to get another.\xa0486 characterszpaden, Mar 15, 2019', '4.45/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.4%look: 4 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.5I enjoyed this beer very much. It was a more traditional Gose than many that people produce. It was not overwhelmed with fruit. The beer had the traditional gose backbone with a nice touch of Pineapple. Extremely balanced with salt, tart, and the pineapple and finished extremely clean. Excellent brew.\xa0307 charactersJamieDuncan, Mar 01, 2019']

name: Galloping Cherry Gose
review: ["5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +5%look: 5 | smell: 5 | taste: 5 | feel: 5 | overall: 5This beer is like nothing we have tasted anywhere. It's very easy to drink. We have tried all of them we can find on tap while visiting Wilmington and every one of them had some similarities, yet the fruits really come out in color, aroma, and flavor. This one was my favorite! Reddish in color and tart cherry.\xa0311 charactersKev-a-Beer, Feb 25, 2019", '4.94/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.8%look: 5 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 5 | feel: 5 | overall: 5Whoop whoop back on the East Coast and at my favorite freakin brewery on earth! Dang, this is some of the best sour beer I have ever put in my mouth. Not too sour, but enough to let you know dis aint yo mommas cherry beer. Wow, cherry on the nose and tongue, super dry and crisp, nice color. Dayum.\xa0298 charactersCaliBeerBear, Feb 24, 2019']

name: New Grist Gose W/Lime
review: ['4.04/5\xa0\xa0rDev +11.6%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Had on tap. Bright yellow and bubbly clear pour, almost no bubbles except from rising carbonation here and there. Smell is full of key lime, salt, and sour yeast, kind of like key lime pie. Taste has an acidity that sneaks up on you, but fits well with the key lime, salt, yeast, and supporting citrus zest. Feel is a little thin and the acidity cumulating gets a bit much, but overall a light, bright and refreshing dessert beer\xa0433 charactersREVZEB, May 09, 2019']

name: Great Bridge Special
review: ["4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Gotta rate it high. This thread should be more accurate though. Great Bridge special is an ever evolving beer. I've had it when it was anything from a stout or IPA to a sour or gose. Always delicious. These guys are brewing geniuses.\xa0233 charactersLAND_MINE, Mar 13, 2015", '3.85/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75* The Great Bridge Special is actually a rotation of one off beers - the GBS on 2/7/15 was an American Brown Ale.\n\nPoured a brown body with one finger head and lace. Aroma is sweet with something like hazelnuts and toffee along with some roasted malts. Smooth bodied, the nuttiness give off a smoothness to the beer and there is some caramel sweetness as well. Not the most flavorful brown ale but has some sweetness to it and has balance.\xa0442 charactersclayrock81, Feb 08, 2015']

name: Grandma's Apple Pie Gose
review:
['4.53/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Shared with JLindros.

A - Poured into a Kate the Great tulip a nice hazy super pale hue with a thin head that fades to leave light wisps.

S - Big aromas of apple cider and pie crust. Big creamy wheat as well, light tartness, good salinity. Bright apple as well, quite pleasant.

T - Taste is similar to the nose with enormous sweet and tart apples, good apple cider and cooked apples, great pie crust, lovely cinnamon and vanilla. Great pie crust notes, creamy wheat, light salinity. Quite pleasant and delivers what it promises.

M - Mouthfeel is lightly carbonated, creamy, not really flemmy.

O - Overall this was a rather solid gose with phenomenal apple pie notes. Exquisite.

Serving Type: can\xa0701 charactersrudzud, Nov 01, 2019', '4.53/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5THanks to rudzud
light fizzy head, no retention, very pale pear flesh color

NOse is mostly gose, lots of raw dough wheat, with a tart lacto funk like, little yoghurt funk, with some apple cider like and funk, maybe even pear cider like, hint of salt I think

Taste is loads of apple pie, just raw apple pie out front, baked apple out front, with a little apple and pear cider, with nice baked oats and wheat doughy pie crust, a little lacto funk bringing a little apple skin, granny smith sweet and tart notes, a touch of salt in the background, dry bready crust finish and tart without being flemmy

Mouth is med to fuller bod, a little creamy oats and pie crust and lacto, light tartness but not flemmy

Overall wow, the taste really is apple pie, the baked apples and oat crusted pie crust, so nice, with a good base gose and tart lacto funk, apple cider, hint of salt, just really well done\xa0895 charactersjlindros, Nov 01, 2019']

name: Forecast Chapter #2
review:
["4.03/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.8%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Quite a good pour for a Gose, the head often being too high- sometimes 4F for some Goses. Nice looking- not usually the case in the style.

The beer poured a cloudy copper golden color with a 2F head in a Gose glass.

Sea salt aroma, kelp, possibly cabbage as indicated by the brewer as being an ingredient in the beer.

Excellent MF. Quite tart, carbonated- more than other beers in the style.

The aroma transitions well to the taste: sea salt, fruit, kelp.

Excellent finish- bitter and tart.

Nice approach to the style which can be unbalanced in flavor. Lots of continuity in this beer, and the finish is one of the best I've tasted in the style.\xa0651 charactersbrureview, Aug 06, 2017"]

Rich berry aroma and flavor lots of salt but unfortunately is is more acetic than lactic.I managed to finish my glass but wouldn't order another.\xa0261 charactersjohnnnniee, Dec 10, 2017"]

name: Epicurean Series 2019 – Spicy Pickle
review: ["3.7/5\xa0\xa0rDev +7.9%look: 4.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Finally worked up the nerve to try this one. Gose with cucumbers, sea salt, fresh dill, coriander, and a spicy pepper blend. Poured from a can into a La Fin du Monde tulip. The pour is light orange, hazy, and sports a massive white rocky head with excellent retention for a sour beer. The nose is a lot like regular Pickle. You get the cucumber and dill and all that wonderful lemon-like acidity, but the peppers really come through as well.\u200b\n\u200b\nLight body with a delicate feel and that classic (polarizing - people either love it or hate it) Pickle flavor (I won't restate my impressions - read the review). Then, right at the back of the palate, those peppers come through. It adds considerable complexity and adds a nice lingering heat to the finish.\u200b\xa0759 charactersdeadonhisfeet, Aug 17, 2019"]

name: Give Up The Gose
review:
['3.88/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Serving Type: 473 mL 

A- Pours a cloudy light-brown with a fizzy head (like a soda). No lacing. 

S- Not much for an aroma. Slight chocolate note, sour tang. You really have to get your nose in there to smell anything.

T- A solid punch of sour, salty tanginess up front finished by a hint of sweet chocolate. Extremely tasty. 

M- Moderate carbonation and light body. 

O- This brew is my first Gose but not my first Sour, so I pretty well knew what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised by the new dimension that the saltiness gave to the beer. The chocolate wheat malt was also a nice touch that brought forth a beautiful finish. Crossing my fingers that Maybee will brew more sours!\xa0688 charactersPorterPro125, Dec 12, 2016']

name: Nick Foles Popsicle
review:
["4.49/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5L: Had this beer on-tap at The Answer Brewpub, poured into a snifter glass. Had a bright red color and a thick, smoothie-like consistency. There was a small amount of off white, foamy head that quickly dissipated. Good lacing.

S: A very nice, very sweet aroma of tropical fruit, watermelon, and salt.

T: Tasted of a mild, infinitesimally small amount of malt, a lot of watermelon (surprising), a tinge of salt, lots of tropical fruit (passion fruit, in particular), and a ton of raspberries. Definitely sour. An exceptionally fruity, oddly complex flavor. Tastes kind of like a Sour Patch Kid, but better. Fruity, light and delicious.

F: A lot of carbonation with a lively, prickly finish. Light-bodied.

O: Even if you're not an Eagles fan (never in a million years), give this one a try. Drinkable.\xa0803 charactersavalon07, Jan 28, 2018"]

name: The Sailor’s Dream
Never Never Ever Ever
review:
['4.35/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Out of a 16oz can at Codex 

Look: Translucent beet red with a thin hibiscus pink head. Has an almost grainy appearance to it like there is a lot of particulate in it. 

Smell: Slight salinity and a mild sharp tartness. Big notes of fresh raspberries, and strawberries. 

Taste: Well rounded berries on the attack. The fruit drops out only to be filled in by a salt note and a pleasant tartness. Then the berries ramp back up for the body that is dominated by berry smoothie notes all the way tot the finish. 

Feel: Medium acidity, no alcohol at all, mild carbonation, no bitterness, and a semi dry finish. 

Overall: This is an adult berry smoothie. It stretches the bounds on what can be called a beer but is delicious none the less. Excellent stuff.\xa0753 charactersBergBeer, Sep 14, 2019', "4.18/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.3%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25On tap at Tap and Mallet in Rochester, NY.

This one pours a super gloopy looking pink/purplish color, with a small head, and lots of lacing.

This smells like purely of fruit, of course, with mostly raspberry and strawberry. My nose can't pick out much that feels like plum.

This isn't super challenging to appreciate or analyze - there's a clean and authentic pureed juiciness here, and very little sourness. There's nothing to think about here, and it just tastes good.

This is thick, and chewy, and pretty drinkable, with that classic Veil melted smoothie type flavor.

I've liked most of these beers, despite my philosophical revulsion towards them.\xa0656 charactersGreesyFizeek, Aug 20, 2019"]

name: Evil Twin NYC / Omnipollo - The Hardest Thing About Parking My Electric Sco
review:
['4.74/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.2%look: 5 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 4.75 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.75Drank on tap at Evil Twin Brewing NYC, Queens, NY
Served in a stange

The beer poured a completely opaque oxblood hue. Thick and viscous, like fruit nectar. The body was capped by an inch-tall, frothy, light magenta crown that slowly faded to a medium sized collar. A wall of drippy lacing coated the glass from top to bottom.

Berry smoothie notes dominated the aroma. Freshly pureed berries, to be exact. Blackberry came through strongest. Lots of raspberry too. Perhaps some blueberry as well. Tart and slightly sweet. By the drink’s end, the maple notes finally came forth.

The flavor profile was also fantastic. Again, berry notes dominated. Blackberry was most apparent. Some raspberry was noticeable as well. Nice balance of sweet and tart. Subtle creamy vanilla notes appeared in the center. This was perhaps the milk sugar. Some lemony tartness also came through here. Crisp and slightly acidic. The beer finished tart and tangy with a hint of lingering salinity.

Nice creamy mouthfeel. Slick and smooth on the palate. Fuller bodied perhaps for the style. The liquid contained a super fine, mild effervesce that suited the beer perfectly.

With so many adjuncts, I was afraid this beer might come across as an overly sweet, disjointed mess, but that definitely was not the case. The berry notes played a starring role, and the vanilla, maple and milk sugar were just there as accents. Overall, really well done.\xa01,424 charactersDamian, Oct 26, 2019', '4.4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.3%look: 4 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Appearance: Pours a deep purple color as the blackberry juice dominates; the head is lavender and while it fades to a ringlet, the lacing is splashy

Smell: Blackberry and blueberry dominates, with the maple, vanilla and milk sugar producing the pancake that underpins

Taste: Lactic blackberry forward with the blueberry and raspberry peeking through; underneath, the pancake flavors of milk sugar, maple and vanilla add a subtle sweet character; increasingly tart, through the middle, but the sweet element creates considerable complexity; the salt is barely detectable until the end

Mouthfeel: Medium body with moderate carbonation; moderate pucker

Overall: This is a really interesting beer with a lot going on; my fear of the kitchen sink in reading the label here was unjustified

Thanks, devoured by vermin, for the opportunity\xa0841 charactersbrentk56, Sep 27, 2019']

name: Mangose
review: ['3.84/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.7%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75a mango gose, as you likely guessed from the clever name. its a cool beer, not overly sour or salty, which i think allows what tastes to me like fresh mango to be really forward in the beer. the sweetness of the fruit offsets some of the cleaner lactic sourness, and it stays refreshing and drinkable for a sour beer, which i like in a gose style. its not overly lively, just a short white bubbling on top of an range hued cloudy base, some carbonation rising up but it dissipates. aroma of tangy sweet fresh mango, no forced or too much, but up front and very natural. its accentuated by a lemony sourness and a pinch of salt, which dries out some of the sugar in the taste. the flavor is mango driven but there is a light white wheat malt complexion all the way through it, as well as a citric acidity, very clean. a floral element, maybe light coriander here, a nice wrinkle. mango in the finish with the acid, again very real fruit tasting to me. it could stand a little more carbonation, but it still drinks really fresh and easy. mango is a tricky fruit to brew with, that maintain flavor but not make it too sweet paradox, and these guys have found the perfect mark with it here in a pretty solid base gose. well done.\xa01,225 charactersStonedTrippin, Dec 04, 2017']

name: Santa Margarita
review: ['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.8%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4it seems like there are a million of these out there now, citrus infused gose types, but this one is well ahead of the median, a really well made beer, almost overly intense on the lime, but its incredibly fresh and natural fresh squeezed and juicy, and about that acidic too, so while it might not be an all day sort of thing, its a real nice drink, summery and tropical and refreshing in small doses. the lime is about as intense as it might be in an actual margarita, so if that is you palate, you have to try this! the salt works the same way as in the cocktail too, highlighting the citrus and drying out the finish a little bit. the wheat malt is super light here, almost too light, but there is enough beer elements still to keep this from being juice. the lactic souring is relatively clean, sharp though and intense, any more would be too much, but its perfectly sympathetic with the lime juice in here, really enhancing and delicious. i feel like this needs a tequila back! overall an impressive little gose from these guys, you have to want some high level flavor, but if you do, this is excellent!\xa01,109 charactersStonedTrippin, Oct 02, 2018']

name: Mr. Blonde (2019)
review: ['4.08/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.9%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 4.5500 ml can into tulip glass, best before 2/4/2020. Pours slightly hazy pale golden yellow color with a 2 finger dense and rocky white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a large cap that lasts. Thick foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of big juicy/tart/tangy limes, cucumber, citrus peel/zest, watermelon, lemon, peach, pear, apricot, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, peppercorn, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of limes, cucumber, peppercorn, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big juicy/tart/tangy limes, cucumber, citrus peel/zest, watermelon, lemon, peach, pear, apricot, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, peppercorn, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang, citrus peel/rind bitterness, and peppercorn spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of juicy/tart/tangy limes, cucumber, citrus peel/rind, watermelon, lemon, peach, pear, apricot, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, peppercorn, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of limes, cucumber, peppercorn, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; with a nice malt/tart/bitter/spiciness balance. Mild pucker/astringency, but not overwhelming. Moderate increasing dryness from lingering tart/bitter/spiciness, tangy fruit, and carbonation. Medium-high carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately crisp, creamy/grainy/acidic/tangy, fairly resinous/rindy, and lightly saline balanced mouthfeel that is nice. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5%. Overall this an excellent fruited/spiced gose. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of limes, cucumber, peppercorn, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, and pretty refreshing to drink; despite the increasingly bitter/spicy/resinous/drying finish. Not overly lactic/salty. Great balance of vibrant/juicy fruits, peppercorn, and Lacto complexity; with a nice pale/wheat malt backbone against acidity. No residual sweetness with crisp resin/rindy dryness. A really enjoyable offering. Was more bitter/resinous/drying than expected, but still an impressive style example as expected.\xa02,585 characterssuperspak, Apr 24, 2019']

name: Epicurean Series - Spicy Pickle
review: ["3.91/5\xa0\xa0rDev -7.8%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Hazy straw yellow darkened by the spice to brownish-red hues topped by a fizzy off-white head dying to nothing.\n\nThe classic Urban Artifact Pickle base is the primary flavor at first, exhibiting softly tart lemon cucumber with a crisp effervescent medium-full body finishing semi-dry. Then the spicy heat comes up from swallow to the back palate. It's at a level slightly spicier than chicken paprikash, with maybe some spicy okra--mild, but good. It totally nails the homemade spicy pickle character. The fact that the base doesn't have a lot of dill to it kind of makes it work better. That said I still wish the regular Pickle had more dill!\xa0644 charactersSabtos, Jul 15, 2019"]

name: Raspberry Gose
review:
["4.47/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.7%look: 5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Served in a tulip at the brewery. 

A- Cloudy wheat-looking beer. Straw-colored. Pale white head with sticky lace. 5

S- Fruity, berry-friendly, salt is noticeable. Banana notes are noticeable. 4.25

T- Oh my that's tasty. Very strong raspberry flavor, lightly sweet wheat/malt flavors, and a tart berry and lemon finish. This is just a lovely tasting brew. 4.5

M- Exceptional light-drinking feel. Tart with light sweetness with neither overpowering the other. The dryness on the finish suggests some salt. 4.5

Outstanding. Fruity and tart and refreshing and drinkable. Woosa.\xa0578 charactersONovoMexicano, Jul 01, 2015"]

name: Ponderosa Gose 2
review:
["3.48/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3.6%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.25473ml can - version 2 of their Gose, now made with blood orange and black currant. Dubbed a 'Frosty Gose'.

This beer pours a murky, medium orangish-amber colour, with three flabby finger of puffy, finely foamy, and somewhat creamy off-white head, which leaves some random blotchy lace around the glass as it eventually subsides.

It smells of gritty and grainy cereal malt, a lesser spicy wheatiness, seawater, some muddled citrus and dark fruity notes, and faint earthy, musty, and dead floral hop bitters. The taste is grainy and crackery pale malt, wet salted Wheat Thins, a still mixed and matched citrus and berry fruitiness, and a hint of mildly phenolic yeast.

The carbonation is average in its palate-coddling frothiness, the body a so-so middleweight, and mostly smooth, with nothing really existing here that might be cause for concern. It finishes off-dry, the malt and generic frooty essences presiding.

Overall - yeah, the guest ingredients pretty much just phone it in, resulting in a rather bland and uninspiring offering. Not bad, per se, but I'm not feeling moved to do anything, much less what the label suggests I should be doing, what with all the snow on the ground outside.\xa01,202 charactersbiboergosum, Jan 16, 2019"]

name: Chixulub
review: ['4.28/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.6%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.25Poured on draft at Collect in Detroit, soft pale yellow with lingering head. Softly funky, piney, beautiful carbonation and mouth feel. Very easy drinker, would love to sit on a patio in the summer with a few of these.\xa0218 charactersdetpizzaboi, Feb 10, 2019', '4.25/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.9%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 419.2 ounce can into tulip glass, canned in 12/2018. Pours moderately hazy/cloudy pale golden straw color with a 2 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big tart lemon, lime, orange, grapefruit, peach, pear, pineapple, passion fruit, mango, melon, guava, citrus peel/zest, sea salt, red/green apple, white grape/wine, hay, straw, herbal, floral, grass, wheat, cracker, and white bread; with lighter notes of peppercorn, leathery/musty/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of citrus/fruity/tropical hops, fruity/funky/spicy/acidic yeast, salt, and light-moderate pale/wheat malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big tart lemon, lime, orange, grapefruit, peach, pear, pineapple, passion fruit, mango, melon, guava, citrus peel/zest, sea salt, red/green apple, white grape/wine, hay, straw, herbal, floral, grass, wheat, cracker, and white bread; with lighter notes of peppercorn, leathery/musty/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate lactic tartness; light Brett tang, herbal/floral/grassy bitterness, and yeast spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart lemon, lime, orange, grapefruit, peach, pear, pineapple, passion fruit, mango, melon, guava, citrus peel/zest, sea salt, red/green apple, white grape/wine, hay, straw, herbal, floral, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, light pepper/leather/musty funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/fruity/tropical hops, fruity/funky/spicy/acidic yeast, salt, and light-moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; with an amazing malt/tartness balance, and zero puckering flavors after the finish. Very crisp/clean finishing. Moderate increasing dryness from lingering tang/tartness and carbonation. High carbonation and light body; with a very smooth, moderately grainy/acidic/tangy/sticky, and lightly saline balanced mouthfeel that is fantastic. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.2%. Overall this is a fantastic dry hopped gose! All around outstanding complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/fruity/tropical hops, fruity/funky/spicy/acidic yeast, salt, and light-moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink; with the high carbed/bone dry finish. Not overly lactic or salty. Very flavorful and not watery for the ABV. Amazing balance of juicy/vibrant Galaxy hops and Brett/Lacto complexity; with a solid pale/wheat malt backbone against acidity. A highly enjoyable offering, and amazing style example as expected. One of the smoothest in the style I have ever had.\xa02,761 characterssuperspak, Jan 20, 2019']

name: Fruited Gose
review:
["3.77/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.3%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4.75 | overall: 44 oz pour on tap into taster. The one I had was fruited with cranberry, and had ginger and hibiscus in it.

A: Medium red body with good clarity looked a little darker than cocktail juice, not much of a head to speak of but it was a small pour.

S: Overwhelming ginger and hibiscus and a light fruited smell that i couldn't quite figure out. The combination of the hibiscus and ginger almost gave it a medicinal smell.

T: The ginger hits you right up front followed closed by a perfumeyalmost honeysuckle taste/smell and then just a hint if fart fruit cherry? berry? plum? Can't quite make it out and then a slow lingering return of ginger. The beer finises with a nice light salinity.

M: Light, clean, crisp and with a refreshing finish from the saltiness without tasting salt itself.

O: I think there is a solid gose here hidden underneath some unnecessary spices. I'd be very excited to try just the base beer. However, this one i would never have guessed was cranberry unless I was told, and the ginger was too heavy handed.\xa01,031 charactersSomethingClever, Feb 27, 2018"]

name: Watermelon Cucumber Gose
review: ['3.9/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.5%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.512 ounce can into tulip glass, canned on 6/22/2018. Pours moderately hazy/cloudy golden amber color with a 1 finger dense off white head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big juicy/light tart/tangy watermelon, cucumber, fruit skin, lemon, lime, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape, coriander, sea salt, hay, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/acidic yeast, fruit, salt, coriander, and pale/wheat malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big juicy/light tart/tangy watermelon, cucumber, fruit skin, lemon, lime, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape, coriander, sea salt, hay, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang, and light coriander spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of juicy/tart/tangy watermelon, cucumber, fruit skin, lemon, lime, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape, coriander, sea salt, hay, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, fruit, salt, coriander, and pale/wheat malt flavors; with a great malt/tart/spiciness and tangy fruit balance, with no puckering flavors after the finish. Slight lingering spice astringency through the glass, but not overwhelming. Light-moderate increasing dryness from tartness, tangy fruit, and spiciness. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/bready/grainy, fairly acidic/sticky, and lightly saline balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5%. Overall this is a delicious fruited Gose. All around nice complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, fruit, salt, coriander, and pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth and refreshing to drink with the modestly acidic/spicy/drying finish. Not overly lactic or salty. Well balanced authentic juicy fruits, Lacto, spice, salt, and pale/wheat malts. A very enjoyable offering, and spot on style example.\xa02,298 characterssuperspak, Jul 14, 2018']

review:
['3.98/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.5%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 412 oz cans poured into a pint glass.

A great pepper aftertaste and I can feel some blodd orange in there. A very refreshing yet complex gose. Well done!\xa0381 charactersPascalMotard, Apr 15, 2018']

name: Bonus Track: 14
review:
['3.94/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.4%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Lightly hazed peach-tea color with a fat finger of white head that’s quick to fizz away. No lacing.

Sour aroma with restrained grapefruit and a slight floral, tropical note — like a very mild passionfruit.

Tart tasting with relatively strong cracker malt character and nice dash of salt. Very slightly sweet. The grapefruit and passionfruit-esque elements are there, but both in the background. 

Light bodied with a nice burst of carbonation upon swallowing.

A fine gose, but not on the same level as their NEIPAs, IMO.\xa0531 charactersthebeers, Aug 11, 2019']

name: Coconut Cream Pie Gose - π Edition
review:
["3.81/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75L: Had this beer on-tap at Westbrook's tasting room, poured into a taster. Had a golden yellow color and a hazy consistency. There was a quarter inch of foamy, somewhat long-lasting head. Above average lacing.

S: A good, but not spectacular, aroma of coconut, citrus fruit, malt, and vanilla.

Tasted of a moderate amount of malt (present throughout), a good shot of vanilla (a nice sweetness), a fair amount of coconut (less than expected), and some citrus fruit as well (lemon, in particular). A solid, but not entirely successful, flavor. It has a tart, sweet quality, but it's almost too subtle. Still, it's a likable flavor.

F: A decent amount of carbonation with a smooth finish. Light-bodied.

O: An uneven beer, but it has its bright spots. Worth a look.\xa0764 charactersavalon07, Jul 03, 2019"]

name: Mango Gose
review:
['3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.6%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75A: Light mango upfront, a bit grainy, with a faint salt and tartness.

A: Deep golden color, fairly hazy, with a thin white mostly uniform head that quickly forms a thin film across the glass. 

T: Moderately light mango, followed by a light lemon, with a slight grainy flavor, with faint salt and slightly sharp and odd sourness.

M: Medium-light bodied with moderate carbonation.

O: Alright; drinkable, with a light mango aroma and flavor, but has an odd slightly sharp sourness that’s a bit off putting.\xa0509 charactersPhil-Fresh, Feb 23, 2017']

name: Out of Fucus - Rock Weed Gose
review:
['4.24/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Appearance - Pours a cloudy apricot with three fingers of frothy white head.

Smell - sea salt, funk, lemon peel, citrus, spicy earthy, leafy, and floral hops, biscuity wheat malts, and earthy yeast. 

Taste - sea salt upfront followed by the funk, lemon peel, and citrus. The spicy earthy, leafy, and floral hops come through next followed by the biscuity wheat malts and earthy yeast.

Mouthfeel - Medium bodied with moderate to high carbonation. Finishes with a pleasant tartness from the sea salt. 

Overall - A highly enjoyable Gose that utilizes the rock weed to its full potential. You definitely get a natural sea salt taste and every other element in this brew just works in unison. A highly sessionable brew!\xa0718 charactersleaddog, May 12, 2019']

name: Date With Jake
review:
['3.73/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.1%look: 3 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3 | overall: 3.75Today, I am CANcentrating on The CANQuest's (tm) problem children. They are those beers who do not know how to behave in (especially) warm/hot weather & decide to test the limits of their aluminum CANtainer. If I CAN identify them in time, I will move them up in the queue of the backlog & throw them into the reefer in the hopes of salvaging it. Other times, I only hear a metallic "TING!" followed by a gushing explosion. 8={} In those cases, the CAN is dumped, rinsed & placed in The CANQuest (tm) Bag o' Shame to be displayed whenever I go for a lecture. 

From the CAN: "Could this Boysenberry Gose be a one night stand, or a lifelong commitment to happiness? We will leave the choice to you. Date with Jake is created with real boysenberry and blueberry fruit puree, with a slight sea salt finish and refreshing 4.2% ABV. Make a date with this beer!"; "From Barn to Brewery"; "Handcrafted and Brewed Phoenixville, PA".

I did not enchanter any difficulty in Crack!ing open the vent & given its style + the adjuncts, I went with a heavy-handed C-Line Glug. I got a brief finger of fizzy, foamy, soapy, pinkish head that quickly dissipated into wisps. Color was a hazy Magenta (SRM = N/A). Nose smelled very fruity but I was unsure that I could have identified the fruit adjuncts on my own. Mouthfeel was thin & watery, but that is not unheard of in/from a Gose. 

A what?!? This was built as an "American Wild Ale" when "Gose" is right on the label! Change Request forthcoming! I am reviewing it as a Gose. 

Boy, was this one tart! I have had some tart Goses in the past, but between the fruit, the wheat malt & the sea salt, this was one puckering little date. It began with a tart fruitiness, still impossible to parse out, then hit with a wash of saltiness. Phew. That'll get the taste buds up and at attention. Finish was tart, dry & highly refreshing on yet another hot, humid Summer's day. Mmm. YMMV.\xa01,912 characterswoodychandler, Aug 07, 2019']

name: Gose
review: ['3.84/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.2%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Golfer3Aces, Nov 04, 2015', '3.68/5\xa0\xa0rDev -8.2%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75spoony, Sep 06, 2015', '4.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +12.2%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5a77cj7, Jun 19, 2015']

name: Corvus
review:
["3.76/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75650ml bottle - a 'lingonberry lime Gose', with the same name as a local brew around here, which is why I've skipped purchasing it for a few weeks, until I looked closer at the label.

This beer pours a murky, almost opaque medium apricot amber colour, with two fingers of puffy, loosely foamy, and fairly fizzy off-white head, which leaves a few instances of spotted islet lace around the glass as it quickly evaporates.

It smells of gritty and grainy cereal malt, mushed lime flesh, a hint of lactic acid, saltine crackers, some muted dark fruitiness, and ethereal leafy, earthy, and floral hop bitters. The taste is grainy and bready pale malt, blackberries, soured yogurt, that lime juice that comes in those little plastic green containers, saline solution, and more well-understated earthy, musty, and floral hoppiness.

The carbonation is competent in its palate-pleasing frothiness, the body a solid middleweight, and mostly smooth, as this isn't the sourness you're looking for, apparently. It finishes off-dry, the malt and salty character predominating.

Overall - this comes across as a fairly decently rendered version of the style, with the fruit adjuncts applied by a deft hand. Easy to drink, refreshing, and very enjoyable for a late August weekend tipple, if I may say so myself.\xa01,300 charactersbiboergosum, Aug 25, 2018"]

name: Magic Carpet Rye'd
review:
['4.14/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.2%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Ruby red with a fuzzy, thick persistent off-white to pink bubbly collar.

Smell does have a toasty rye character paired with caramel, boysenberry, raspberry taffy and biscuit.

Taste is tart raspberry and boysenberry with a semi-bitter patch of wild herbs. Wow is this unique!

The medium-full body has a big froth and a semi-dry finish.\xa0337 charactersSabtos, Mar 22, 2018']
