name: Crocodile Tears Lime Gose
review: ['3.74/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.3%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75a fun new beer from these guys, nice to see them branching out this wide in terms of style, and they have done a nice job with it. this is the first sour i am aware of them making, and its pretty solid. pours clear for a gose, light golden with a bubbly white layer on top and a ton of carbonation, looks as much like a soda as it does a beer. high lime in the nose, authentic and zesty and really fresh. some acidity to the fruit too, which helps it blend in so well with the lactic sourness that is present, really mouthwatering and appealing. the flavor is good too, very clean for a kettle type sour, none of that cheesy immature weirdness on it, bright acidity, perfect with the lime in the flavor too, and its very limey all the way through. maybe a little thin in body and lacking on grain character, but the salt adds a little weight to it, and i love all the bubbles. really impressive for a first sour beer, a huge leap forward for grandmas house, and honestly one of the better citrus fruit gose styles i have had lately. lots of lackluster beer in this style out there, i was impressed with this.\xa01,108 charactersStonedTrippin, Oct 17, 2016']

name: Mario Gose
review: ['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.8%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4mjpolzin, Jul 14, 2019', '3.85/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75aasher, Jul 23, 2015']

name: Pineapple Gose
review:
['3.81/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.8%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75Clear light golden pour with a white head. Juicy pineapple aroma. Taste follows the nose with a great juicy pineapple flavor. Can also taste a bit of salt. Light bodied and drinks really easy.\xa0192 charactersKaribourgeois, Feb 02, 2019', '3.52/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.1%look: 4.25 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.5No canned on date, first time trying these guys.

Definitely nails that pineapple juice pour. Frothy two finger head of foam that quickly fizzles out with only small spots of lace.

The nose has a combination of overripe pineapple, a little bit of artificial tropical pineapple flavoring, and anise. The aroma is predominantly dry.

Much milder flavors than the nose suggested. The pineapple is definitely present, without being overwhelmingly sweet or artificial. Other flavors of wheat grain and salt ring true as well, with just a whisper of funk in the finish. There’s admittedly not a ton going on with this beer, but on a hot day like today it is perfect.

The combination of a mild flavor profile and this sharp, seltzery carbonation, I have to make the comparison to a La Croix. I don’t want this to come off as a bad thing, but it gives you a more accurate idea of what to expect.\xa0893 charactersWickedBeer, Jul 24, 2018']

Salt levels seem appropriate. Easy to drink. Love that it's so low an abv. Pretty good stuff.\xa0173 charactersRblWthACoz, Jun 14, 2015"]

name: Himmlisch
review: ['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.2%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4LAM01833, Feb 17, 2019', '4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25liquorpig, Jun 22, 2018']

name: Flamingos Gnome-Matter What: Lawn Ornament Series #2
review:
["4.16/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4This one pours a light and hazy yellow-ish color, with a small head, and not much lacing.

This mainly smells like banana on the nose, with some marshmallow and a general citrusiness.

I'm not entirely sure I get every flavoring in here, but what I do get is pretty delicious. It's kind of reminiscent of banana runts, liquified and slightly sour, with a nice creamy vanilla and marshmallow sweetness on the back end, and some generic citrus - maybe that's the paw paw? I don't get the chocolate, really.

This is is light bodied and very drinkable, with a nice creaminess, and a silky body.

This is some of that typical crazy adjunctery that Mortalis is known for. It's pretty silly but it's also delicious.\xa0709 charactersGreesyFizeek, Sep 29, 2019"]

name: Gose
review:
["2.89/5\xa0\xa0rDev -6.8%look: 4.25 | smell: 2.75 | taste: 2.75 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 2.75L - Mostly hazy light orange with carbonation coming off the bottom of the glass. Initially had a volcanic three fingers of white head, but it disappeared quickly and left no lacing.

S - Generic macro aroma, a little wheat and barely any salt

T - A little saltier on the taste which lets you know it is supposed to be a Gose, but it doesn't have the same pop as other examples of the style. A dry doughy flavor and more of that wheat from the aroma. The only way you know it had orange or lemon was from an acidic zest, but no actual fruit flavor.

F - Light, but not watery. That macro taste doesn't make it all that refreshing...especially for warmer months. 

O - I don't know. It kinda reminds me of Bud Light, but with a little bit of salt. The one thing I can give it is that I destroyed my growler in no time, so it did go down relatively easy despite a macro feel. Breweries are doing a standard Gose more than ever these days and most o them are perfectly fine. This one falls behind the pack and while not terrible, it is still mediocre. It's bland and your tatebuds are trying to find something to cling onto, but there is nothing available.\xa01,154 charactersThrewRedButter, May 27, 2016"]

name: Black Sour Blossom
review: ['4.53/5\xa0\xa0rDev +3.2%look: 5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Pours nearly as dark as the Black IIPA. Smells faintly of black cherries. Tastes balanced; not too sweet, sour, or bitter but a fantastic mix off all three; reminds me of a black forest cake but without the sweetness. Has a good mouthfeel and is overall very good.\xa0267 charactersShoeIn-BrewWin, Jun 07, 2019']

name: Collective Arts / Verdant - Spacial Relations
review:
['4.04/5\xa0\xa0rDev -2.2%look: 3.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Happy New CANned Collab Beer Sunday (Week 770) as I try to get out from under the backlog here at Chez Woody. It is a real boon for The CANQuest (tm), but I have pretty much stopped buying more beer for the meantime. 

From the CAN: "Imperial Gose brewed w/Plum, Apricot, Raspberry Himalayan Salt & Coriander"; "Art: Sergio Vazquez San Juan, Puerto Rico"; "Unfiltered Keep Cold".

That last meant that I had free license to do some in-CAN agitation before Crack!ing open the vent. I also employed a more heavy-handed C-Line Glug than usual, resulting in a pseudo-cascade. This took a little while to settle into two-plus fingers of dense, foamy, rocky, pinkish head that looked like freshly-spun cotton CANdy. I was really impressed by its head retention since such rarely happens in/with this style. Color was a murky, turbid Magenta (SRM = N/A). Nose smelled redolently of raspberries & salt! 8=O Mouthfeel was medium, big for the style. The taste was quite tart, driven by the raspberries, but backed up by the salt & coriander. I didn't really perceive that plums & apricots, but there was a LOT going on with this one, to the point that it was tough to parse one flavor from another. This put me in mind of a salted fruit smoothie, which is not a bad thing. The fruit was an inspired addition in this case & I am a big fan of saltiness, so what was not to like? Yum. Finish was quite dry, lightly puckering & nicely tart. It hid its 8.0% ABV well, making it a little too drinkable for comfort. This was CANother impressive beer from this CANadian brewery! YMMV.\xa01,566 characterswoodychandler, Yesterday at 03:52 AM', '4.2/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.7%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 416 ounce can into tulip glass, canned on 9/30/2019. Pours very hazy deep ruby red/orange/pink/amber color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy light pink head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big juicy/tart/tangy plums, apricot, raspberry, fruit skin/seed, lemon, lime, orange, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, red grape/wine, sea salt, coriander, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, biscuit dough, light toast, peppercorn, lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of plum, apricot, raspberry, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, coriander, and pale/wheat malt notes; with big strength. Taste of big juicy/tart/tangy plums, apricot, raspberry, fruit skin/seed, lemon, lime, orange, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, red grape/wine, sea salt, coriander, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, biscuit dough, light toast, peppercorn, lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tart/sourness, fruit tang, and coriander spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of sour/tart/tangy plums, apricot, raspberry, fruit skin/seed, lemon, lime, orange, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, red grape/wine, sea salt, coriander, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, biscuit dough, light toast, peppercorn, lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of plum, apricot, raspberry, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, coriander, and pale/wheat malt flavors; with a great malt/tart/sour/spiciness and tangy fruit balance; with no puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp finishing. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering tart/sourness, tangy fruit, and spiciness. Medium carbonation and medium-plus body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/bready/grainy, sticky/acidic/tangy/tannic, and fairly saline balanced mouthfeel that is great. Minimal warming alcohol for 8%. Overall this is a fantastic imperial fruited gose. All around fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of plum, apricot, raspberry, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, coriander, and pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth and fairly crisp/refreshing to drink with the modestly acidic/tangy/tannic/drying finish. Nicely soft and not overly lactic/salty. Fantastic balance of super juicy/jammy fruit, coriander, salt, and lacto complexity; with a nice sized wheat/malt backbone against acidity. Minimal residual sweetness with crisp acidic/tangy dryness. A highly enjoyable offering, and outstanding spot on style example as expected.\xa02,670 characterssuperspak, Oct 29, 2019']

name: Never Never Found Found
review: ["3.85/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.9%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.7516oz can, snifter glass. Pours a cloudy papaya orange body, one finger white head, good retention, medium collar, with particulate lacing- presumably from the added fruit. Smell is tropical fruit and papaya mostly, a touch of wheat, not particularly tart. Flavour is primarily a tropical fruit smoothie; pulpy papaya and mango, not much else. Touch of lemon and wheat, perhaps, minimal lactic acidity. Medium bodied, pulpy and substantial, lower in carbonation, not particularly slick or dry. Basically a fruit smoothie. Good, but might as well just get the fruits and throw them into a blender, pour in a can of Westbrook gose and you've got this beer.\xa0653 charactersStevedore, Aug 22, 2019"]

name: Raspberry Crush Gose
review:
['4.07/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.8%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25A: Pours a murky opaque purplish-red in color with light to moderate amounts of fine active visible carbonation rising along the edges of the glass and faint purple + garnet red + maroon colored highlights. The beer has a two finger tall dense sudsy foamy very pale pink head that slowly reduces to a couple of small to medium sized patches of medium thick film surrounded by a large patch of slightly mottled very thin film covering the majority of the remainder of the surface of the beer and a medium thick ring at the edges of the glass. Light to moderate amounts of lacing are observed.

S: Moderate aromas of slightly sweet, slightly tart fresh raspberries over the top of slightly sour wheat malts with minimal amounts of sweetness and light amounts of tart lacto lemon citrus. Very light aromas of brininess and spice/coriander.

T: Upfront there are light flavors of slightly sour wheat malts with minimal amounts of sweetness and light amounts of tart lacto lemon citrus. That is followed by light flavors of brininess and spice/coriander. Finally there is a slightly stronger than moderate flavor of slightly sweet, slightly tart fresh raspberries. No perceptible hop presence and minimal bitterness but there is a lingering tart raspberry flavor in the finish.

M: Just shy of medium bodied with moderate amounts of carbonation. Moderate amounts of acidic prickliness.

O: Easy to drink with well hidden alcohol and a really nice combination of raspberry + lacto tartness. Refreshing. Very nice sweet/tart raspberry and just enough brininess.\xa01,554 charactersdbrauneis, Sep 13, 2019', "3.84/5\xa0\xa0rDev -3%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 4A: The beer is very hazy light purple in color. It poured with a half finger high pink head that died down but never completely faded away and left lots of lacing down the sides of the glass.
S: Moderate aromas of raspberry purée are present in the nose.
T: The taste is a bit sour and has flavors of raspberry purée along with hints of saltiness.
M: It feels a bit more than light-bodied and tart on the palate with a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: This beer is very easy to drink and is quite refreshing as it isn't that sour and has some tartness in the mouthfeel.

Serving type: can\xa0592 charactersmetter98, Sep 13, 2019"]

name: Science Fair Project
review:
["3.85/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.3%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75A: The beer is clear, dark reddish purple in color and has a light to moderate amount of visible carbonation. It poured with a quarter finger high pink head that left a narrow collar around the edge of the glass.
S: Light to moderate aromas of cherries, pears, and yogurt are present in the nose.
T: The taste follows the smell, but seems a little fruitier with lots of flavors of dragonfruit that seem to resemble a mixture of cherries and pears. I didn't get any of the grapefruit. There is a slight amount of sourness.
M: It feels light- to medium-bodied and a little creamy on the palate with a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: This gose isn't that sour compared to other beers in the style but it does a very good at showcasing the aromas and flavors of dragonfruit in both the smell and taste.

Serving type: can\xa0821 charactersmetter98, Jan 19, 2019"]

name: Pinwheel - Orange
review:
['4.05/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1.5%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Appearance - Pours clear golden color with a thin white head that dissipates quickly to a thin ring.

Aroma - The coriander comes out mainly along with the orange, hint of salt not really getting any vanilla in the nose but that is not surprising since the orange is so strong.

Taste - Yeah much more salt in the taste and I like it. Orange is a little more subdued but still for front I still struggle to find the vanilla but that is fine, the orange and salt work well together. 

Feel - light bodied crisp well carbonated hint of dryness really easy drinking.

Overall - Hints the mark well for an orange gose, great flavors easy drinking.\xa0643 charactersDragginballs76, May 26, 2019', '3.93/5\xa0\xa0rDev -1.5%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 412 ounce can into tulip glass, canned on 1/23/2019. Pours slightly hazy medium golden yellow color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of juicy, lightly tart/tangy oranges, lemon, lime, citrus peel/zest, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, coriander, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light vanilla/peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Nice and pleasant aromas with good balance and complexity of oranges, fruity/acidic yeast, coriander, salt, moderate pale/wheat malts, and light vanilla notes; with solid strength. Taste of juicy, lightly tart/tangy oranges, lemon, lime, citrus peel/zest, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, coriander, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light vanilla/peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang; light coriander spiciness, and zesty bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of juicy/tart/tangy oranges, lemon, lime, citrus peel/zest, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, coriander, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, light vanilla/peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Great complexity, robustness, and balance of oranges, fruity/acidic yeast, coriander, salt, moderate pale/wheat malts, and light vanilla flavors; with an awesome malt/tartness and tangy fruit balance; with no puckering flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp/clean finishing. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering tartness, tangy fruit, and coriander spiciness. Medium carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately bready/grainy/acidic/tangy, and lightly sticky/saline balanced mouthfeel that is fantastic. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.5%. Overall this is a delicious fruited gose. All around nice complexity, robustness, and balance of oranges, fruity/acidic yeast, coriander, salt, moderate pale/wheat malts, and light vanilla flavors; very smooth, refreshing, and fairly crisp/clean to drink; with the mellowly acidic/tangy/drying finish. Not overly lactic or salty. very flavorful and not watery for the ABV. Awesome balance of juicy oranges, Lacto complexity, coriander, salt, and pale/wheat malts against acidity. Minimal residual sweetness with crisp dryness. A very enjoyable offering, and impressive spot on style example.\xa02,595 characterssuperspak, Apr 05, 2019']

name: Casa De Amigos
review: ['4.18/5\xa0\xa0rDev +25.9%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Having this beer on-tap at the brewery. Served in a standard pint glass, this beer draws a fairly cloudy/hazy light to medium golden color with a white head that’s about 2/3 of an inch thick when first drawn and served. Settles eventually to a medium sized ring lining the inside of the glass. Not really any lacing here. Aromas of some bready malts and wheat along with a nice slightly sour, tart barnyard funk note. A very similar flavor profile here, with some bready malts and wheat that give way to a slightly sour, tart barnyard funk note with a hint of salt. Not any discernible hop flavors here, and that’s to be expected. Spot on flavor wise for this style. Has a crisp, slightly prickly, smooth, light to medium bodied mouthfeel with moderate carbonation. Has a clean, slightly dry finish. The wheat and the slightly sour and funky taste linger nicely for the aftertaste.\n\nEric\xa0901 charactersneenerzig, Jul 21, 2019']

Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang, and light spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/tangy cranberries, fruit skin/seed, lemon, lime, orange, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, red grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, biscuit dough, light toast/peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Excellent complexity, robustness, and balance of cranberries, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, and pale/wheat malt flavors; with a fantastic malt/tart/tangy balance, and no puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp/clean finishing. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering tang/tartness and carbonation. Medium-plus carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/bready/grainy, acidic/tangy/tannic, and lightly saline balanced mouthfeel that is fantastic. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of cranberries, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, and pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth, refreshing, and fairly crisp/clean to drink with the mellowly acidic/tangy/tannic/drying finish. Nicely soft and mellowly lactic/salty. Very flavorful and not watery for the ABV. Awesome balance of juicy cranberries and Lacto complexity; with a nice sized clean pale/wheat malt backbone against acidity for the ABV. Mild residual sweetness with crisp acidic/tangy dryness. A very enjoyable offering, and impressive spot on style example as expected.\xa02,522 characterssuperspak, Oct 18, 2019']

name: Prickly Pear Gose
review: ["4.21/5\xa0\xa0rDev +1%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Dark amber brew with lacing in the glass. Spritzy and tangy, but not actually sour. Quite aromatic with fruit. Not particularly salty, though there is just enough. The fruit tastes ripe and mellow. There is almost a watermelon flavor plus that elusive indescribable cactus. Just a little sweetness, even. \n\nThis is about my favorite Gose in years. Maybe it's not one for the purists, but it's highly drinkable and has what seems important to me: clean and refreshing zingy taste. On tap at the brewery tasting room.\xa0515 charactersmactrail, Apr 08, 2018"]

name: Ain’t Afraid of No Gose: Lemon Sorbet
review:
['3.44/5\xa0\xa0rDev +6.2%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.2512 ounce can - $2.79 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia.

Appearance: Pours a relatively clear, bright yellow-hued body with an inch of loose, snow white suds.

Smell: A lemony flash, a kernel of hinted sweetness, faint malts beneath and a lactic overtone.

Taste: Tart, sour and lemony, lactic. Mercifully, it never takes the oft dreaded Lemon Pledge turn many a lemon beer can. Decent salinity, very low hint of coriander. From there, things drop off, flavorwise, pretty rapidly.

Mouthfeel: Light-bodied. Well carbonated.

Overall: Sufficient.\xa0553 charactersChainGangGuy, Aug 18, 2019']

review:
['4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev +0.5%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4On tap @ Bad Seed Brooklyn.

Pink pint glass pour. This is apparently guava centric, which is cool, given that this is Crown Heights & totally by chance.

Smells lightly floral, mildly meaty with malt, with a big guava trail.

review: ["4.17/5\xa0\xa0rDev -0.2%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Interesting take on a gose. Pale crisp yellow. Full sudsy head slowly leads to flat top with little lacing. Smells very peppercorn on the nose, and salty. Honestly smells like some sort of cured meat. Tasty; slight pale malt presence, mixed with very peppery flavor, washed over with a saltyness, and ends with a bitter tartness. Well carbonated, and washes a smooth dry finish. Overall delicious. Couldn't have more than two pints in one sitting. But very refreshing.\xa0468 charactersbrother_rebus, Aug 30, 2015"]

name: Frugivore
review:
['4.09/5\xa0\xa0rDev +9.1%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Appearance - Pours cloudy straw color with a nice dense white head that settles to a thin cap. No lacing.

Aroma - Nose is straight up rotted mangoes, nice saltiness coming through, some wheat a hint of funk and some mild lemon. There is a hint of vinegar as it warms a bit. 

Taste - Yeah the mango is strong and leans toward the overly ripe side. balanced mild funk and salt, little wheat mixed with lemon.

Feel - Light bodied prickly carbonation very light and effervescent. Slightly dry finish.

Overall - Well done sour, the mango is there for sure and everything else is well balanced.\xa0593 charactersDragginballs76, Jul 20, 2019']

name: Plum City
review:
["3.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev -8.6%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Poured on tap at the brewery
A: Hazy, the color of the inside of a plum
S: Light, wheat, plum
T: Plum, wheat, a touch sour
M: Light-bodied
O: They describe this as having sea salt but I don't taste it. It would add a nice complexity if it were more present\xa0256 charactersONUMello, Apr 21, 2016", "4.15/5\xa0\xa0rDev +8.4%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25This is the first beer I am drinking at Bottlehouse's brand new, second location that just opened in Lakewood, a west side suburb of Cleveland. This location will be specializing in sour beers. This is the first sour-esque beer they have ready. Served to me on-tap in a weizen glass,this beer draws a very cloudy/hazy light to medium golden color with a nice white head that's about an inch thick when first served to me. Head settles to a thick ring lining the inside of the glass. Not much lacing though. Aromas of some crisp wheat and bready malts that give way to some hints of barnyard funk and notes of plum. The taste is pretty much the same, with some crisp wheat and bready malts with mild sweetness followed by some barnyard funk and a hint of grape sourness as well as just a hint of salt and vinegar. Rounded out with a bit of sweetness from the plums. Not really any discernible hop presence here. Has a fairly crisp, slightly prickly, yet smooth, slightly acidic, medium to full bodied mouthfeel with moderate carbonation. Has a clean, somewhat dry finish. Easy to drink. A very interesting and tasty take on the style.

Eric\xa01,152 charactersneenerzig, Apr 02, 2016"]

name: Who Gose There
review:
["4.21/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.4%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25EDIT: Who Gose There has variants have become a thing at Right Brain in the last couple years. This one was the cherry lime. 


Fantastic gose! Had it on tap at the pub and loved it so much we had to grab a growler. Reddish pink in color, nicely carbonated, with a finger of white sizzling foam. Beautiful fruit aromas with lime and cherry notes, some bready /crackery and floral notes. Amazingly balanced flavor with an explosive burst of tangy lime at first that's tempered by sweet/tart cherry and a finish of course rim-salt. Hope to see this one again and again.\xa0567 charactersTripel_Threat, Jul 21, 2018"]

review:
['4.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev +2.3%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5Crowler from 11/18/2018

T: Starts off with a ripe fruit juice flavor. Then, I pick up a hint of the sea salt. It finishes up with a slight hint of fermented fruit with a little more lilikoi to finish off the sip.

name: Torm
review:
['4.01/5\xa0\xa0rDev -4.3%look: 3 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4It pours a cloudy, carrot orange body with a tiny amount of floaties. Small white head with some lacing.

It has an aroma of lingonberries and lemon, with notes of honey.

The taste has lemon, salt, wheat and lingonberries. The mouthfeel is light bodied, dry, crisp and sour, with high carbonation and little bitterness. The aftertaste is sour and wheaty.

A refreshing gose.\xa0375 charactersNofoba, Nov 08, 2019', '4.36/5\xa0\xa0rDev +4.1%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25L: Very hazy amber color, quarter finger white head, excellent thin lacing, no visible carbonation.

T: Honey, sweet, sour. Superb. Balanced and smooth.

F: Light bodied, plenty of flavor.

O: A nice imperial gose. Smooth and tasty. Bravo to Pohjala.\xa0290 charactersrex_4539, Oct 12, 2019']

name: Tinta Blanca
review:
['3.45/5\xa0\xa0rDev -10.4%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3 | overall: 3.5From the bottom of the can: "06 MAY 2019"

Appearance: The body is a milky and opaque with a beige color. It has a short creamy textured head with good lacing.

Aroma: There is a light sour fruit aroma and a cream of wheat scent.

Taste: Up front there is the flavor of tart raspberry. This is followed by a bit of cinnamon spice flavor and a bit of black pepper. There is wheat in the aftertaste. A salt crust forms around the mouth while drinking, and it becomes very salty over time.

Mouthfeel: It is smooth but a sharp tartness cuts at the tongue. It is medium bodied and finishes dry on the palate.

Overall: The can states that this is made "with Peaches, Lemons, Limes and Apricots conditioned on Oak." There is a definite tartness to the beer but it doesn't convey any clear fruit aromas or flavors. The oak it was conditioned on doesn't appear to add any flavor either. It is a good tasting Gose and I would recommend it, but not based on the description on the can.\xa0976 charactersteromous, May 23, 2019', "4.24/5\xa0\xa0rDev +10.1%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25L: Had this beer on-tap at Growlers to Go - Short Pump, poured into a pint glass. Had an orange-yellow color and a super cloudy consistency. There was a small amount of foamy head that quickly dissipated. So-so lacing.

S: A sweet and enticing aroma of citrus fruit, malt, wood, salt, other light fruits, and tropical fruit.

T: Tasted of a mild amount of salt (just a pinch), a bit of malt (not a huge factor), a ton of citrus fruit (lemons and especially limes), some other fruits (apricots, peaches), a hint of oak, and a little tropical fruit (mango). An extremely sweet, sour, and fruity flavor. The fruit overwhelms the other elements, but this isn't a problem. Tasty.

F: A well-carbonated beer with a sharp finish. Medium-bodied.

O: A light and refreshing beer. Drinkable.\xa0781 charactersavalon07, May 11, 2019"]

name: Resistance Is Fruitile
review:
['3.94/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.75Pint can - no date - poured into a tulip at 45F.

Pours a deep wine stain burgundy hue, with three fingers of foamy magenta head, with superb retention, and intricate lacing. The body itself is completely opaque with a dull matte sheen.

Nose: Berries on berries. Sweet macerated blackberry, blueberry, currant, and raspberry. The lacto tang also gives a hint of creaminess, giving the impression of mixed berry yogurt. There's a faint note of salinity, as a good gose should possess. There's a faint impression of clean, pale grain, which shows the senses that it's still certainly beer, however, there is no olfactory indication of any hopping. 

Palate: Both a subtle sweetness, restrained tartness, and hint of salinity hit the palate simultaneously. The bouquet of berries comes into focus next, with strawberry and raspberry taking the lead. Flavours of currant, blackberry, and blueberry are also evident. The sweetness and flavour of the berries paired with the slightly salty tang really go nicely together, and all is well. However, there is a very sharp, almost acrid bitterness that comes into clear focus shortly after. It isn't a pithy or resinous bitterness that one would associate with hops, but rather a very tannic, almost medinal bitterness, like what you would find in the pits or seeds of certain fruit. I'm not entirely sure if perhaps the berry seeds are responsible for this bitterness, or if it's due to something else, but it is quite distracting, and ultimately detrimental to the overall experience. There is also a creamy, milky flavour that tastes exactly like lactose, although the can says nothing about it, therefore I will assume there is none in the beer. This creamy aspect slightly dampens the bitterness a little, but not entirely, as it lasts well into the finish, where the creaminess fades away, along with the sweetness and salinity, leaving a fairly dry aftertaste, with the bitterness being the only thing to linger. 

Mouthfeel/Body: The beer is medium-to-full-bodied, with a thick, creamy feel about it, giving it a "milkshake-like" quality. Effervescence is very fine, and rather scarce, to the point where it feels like it's lacking a little bit. The little bit of carbonation seems to be at odds with the creamy body. The beer is fairly wet upfront, becoming fairly dry in the finish. 

Overall: This beer feels confused. It looks great, it smells great, and it tastes great, for the first third of the experience, before the aggressive, biting bitterness comes in, and lasts well into the finish. The mouthfeel isn't a strong point of this beer. The thick creamy body seems out of place, and is somewhat of a turnoff. The enjoyable qualities just don't seem to outweigh the distracting negative qualities, and for me, personally, I have a hard time enjoying this one. There are others that will not mind the texture, and even fewer who may be able to look past the astringent bitterness, but for me, it's a miss - and that's saying nothing of the serious price tag on this one.\xa03,028 charactersSierraNevallagash, Jul 26, 2019']

name: White Peach Gose
review: ['3.99/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.75 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4on tap at the brewery, i thought this was fabulous. its got just the essence of the peach in aroma and flavor, and in the background and coming on late to both senses, but its absolutely white peach, which is cool, different from yellow peach in this, and i genuinely appreciate that nuance, very neat! the gose is somewhat complex too, with a little drying funk to it, more interesting on the fermentation side than just the lacto souring up front, its almost like its fermented, at least in part, with a rustic saison strain or something, subtle but a nice touch if intentional. i dont get any saltiness here, the peach is in front of that, and so is the medium bodied and cerealy wheat malt base. raw and simple and sort of organic to me, ever so slightly toasted and herbal, but with a lemon lime soda thing going on too, only a touch of sweetness in the fruit, keeping it from being totally covered up by the modest acidity. it doesnt look real heady in the glass, but there is plenty of carbonation as i drink it. the thing i love the most about this is the specifically white peach character. really good beer overall, but i liked everything i drank in here. nobody talks about these guys, but they are covering a lot of ground and doing it well!\xa01,253 charactersStonedTrippin, Oct 17, 2019']

name: Gose
review:
["3.6/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5On tap at the Surf 'N' Suds Beer Festival held at Carpenteria State Beach in Carpenteria, CA.

Pours a murky light orange with a foamy white head that settles to a partial film on top of the beer. Small dots of lace form around the glass on the drink down. Smell is slightly sour with wheat, perfume, salt, and spice aromas. Taste is much the same with slightly sour wheat, salt, and spice flavors on the finish. There is a very mild amount of acidity on the palate with each sip. This beer has a good level of carbonation with a crisp mouthfeel. Overall, this is a pretty good beer that is solid, but quite salty in the taste. 

Serving type: on tap.\xa0651 charactersUCLABrewN84, Aug 17, 2015"]

name: Sauer Kirsch
review: ['3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75a gose with cherries in it, and a beer i would have liked a whole lot more if i did not have it right next to the blackberry edition, which really was incredible, so this sort of paled in comparison. the color is only lightly pink from the fruit, the beer has better clarity and less apparent density than the blackberry one, short thin head on it. it smells clean, the souring is done right, no weird esters or off flavors to it, no funk at all, very german on the malts with the lemony acidity, its pleasing, refreshing, and quite traditional, i think it would be solid even without the fruit. the cherry is subtle in intensity compared to the blackberry in that one, but its natural and doesnt linger in the finish, a light medicinal element to it, nice with the citrus essence the lacto provides, and a neat accent flavor, almost has a cocktail vibe to me. carbonation is a little light, but so is the body, and the minerals and saltiness here make it finish fast. a nice fruited gose overall because its gose first and fruit second. an easy drinker in warm weather and not too sour to be consumed in high volume!\xa01,117 charactersStonedTrippin, Mar 03, 2019']

name: Decadent / Evil Twin - Tropical Mimosa
review:
['3/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.5 | smell: 2.75 | taste: 3 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3Served in a Teku glass at the Decadent Brewery in Mamaroneck, NY.
A: Pours a hazy, dark golden to rose color (resembles pink grapefruit juice) with a less than one finger, white head, no more than a rim retention, if that, and basically no lacing.
S: Very funky to the point of being slightly off-putting. Aromas of pink grapefruit pith.
T: Semisweet. Palate basically somewhere between pink grapefruit (especially the pith) and tangerine). Minimal bitterness.
M: Medium to full bodied with low, low carbonation.
O: Tastes nothing like a Mimosa. Not the strongest Gose I have had by a long shot.\xa0597 charactersVoxRationis, Jun 02, 2019']

name: Margarita Gose
review: ['3.85/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75i find it a littl odd that the interesting beers from these guys are always solid to excellent, but the fundamentals like a porter and an ipa and the like are always lackluster. not sure what that says about a place, whatever, this one is really good. the lime on it is natural and clean, acidic and bitter, but also summery and refreshing and very well proportioned. the salt is there too which i like, and there is a sharp vinous sort of profile to the souring thats more than one dimensional, also a nice touch. the lime really drives the flavor, but the wheat can still be tasted too, and there is a briskness to the whole thing, flavorful as it is, that keeps it easy drinking, uncommon in a kettle sour for me, and actually i was surprised by how much i liked this one overall. it has that sort of melted frozen marg taste and feel to it, but it takes me exactly there, and thats impressive for a beer. the right amount of things at the right time in this, right on for summer, and one of the better overall beers i have had from these guys so far. no worries that they cant make a decent cream ale i guess...\xa01,115 charactersStonedTrippin, Jun 11, 2019']

name: Bounce House
review:
['3.31/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.25On tap at Radio Social in Rochester, NY. Blackberry/peach/blood orange version.

This one pours a hazy looking dark reddish color, with a small head, and lots of lacing.

This smells like berries, orange, butter/diacetyl, and lactose.

This has a slick and diacetyl-ridden finish that kind of sours me (good pun, idiot) to the things this beer is trying to accomplish. There is some nice non-sour blackberry, not a ton of peach, and a respectable smattering of blood orange. The off flavors here are hard to reconcile, though.

This is thick and creamy, with a decent level of drinkability, even with the off-flavors.

This has some major issues. It has potential, though.\xa0672 charactersGreesyFizeek, Jul 14, 2019']

name: Whoops, I Tarted
review:
["3.9/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4With on foot in historic northern German brewing practices and the other in urban dictionary, the talented team at Mirror Twin offer a Gose-style beer with moderate tartness and a floral, briny nuanced taste and utmost refreshment heading into warmer weather.

Whoops, I Tarted arrives pale gold and nearly brilliantly clear. Its short but persistent froth carries a soft mustiness, bright citrus, cidery scent that promises sourness. Its taste is lightly sweetened with sourdough, pulled candy and musty wheat germ. 

Fresh and fruity, the sweetness lifts slowly and the fruit forward tartness of the beer begins to shine. Lime, lemon, green apple, green grape and a host of tangy berry-like flavors frame a soft sourness that comes with soft woods of balsa, cork and a brisk briney salinity. Orange peel, hay and a return of doughy must chimes in at finish.

Crisp, clean and acidic, the medium light beer is true to gose style in its restrained sour palate and its rounded salty subtlety. A quick aftertaste of sourdough, taffy and burlap kisses the late palate one last time and then flutters away effortlessly. A simple yet effective sour beer that'll surly cut the thirst of Kentucky beer drinkers this summer.\xa01,216 charactersBEERchitect, Apr 25, 2017"]

The body is light & crisp, the tartness is measured and the salted caramel is authentic without being cloying. Having that tartness with a more common dessert flavor provides a fun contrast on the palate and, simply put, just tasted good.\xa0383 charactersajm5108, Mar 10, 2019']

name: Raspberry Lemonade
review: ['4.1/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.516 ounce can into tulip glass, canned in 7/2019. Pours moderately hazy deep ruby red/pink/orange color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy light pink head with great retention, that reduces to a thin lace cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big sour/tart/tangy red raspberries, fruit skin/seeds, lemon, lime, citrus peel/zest, peach, plum, pear, melon, apricot, red/green apple, red grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, lighter peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of raspberry, lemon, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt notes; with big strength. Taste of sour/tart/tangy red raspberries, fruit skin/seeds, lemon, lime, citrus peel/zest, peach, plum, pear, melon, apricot, red/green apple, red grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, lighter peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tart/sourness, fruit tang, and light spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of sour/tart/tangy red raspberries, fruit skin/seeds, lemon, lime, citrus peel/zest, peach, plum, pear, melon, apricot, red/green apple, red grape/wine, sea salt, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, lighter peppercorn/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of raspberry, lemon, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; with an awesome malt/tart/sourness and tangy fruit balance; with no puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp finishing. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering sour/tart/tang and carbonation. Medium-plus carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/grainy/acidic/tangy/tannic, and lightly saline mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.5%. Overall this is an awesome fruited gose. All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of raspberry, lemon, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth, refreshing, and fairly crisp to drink with the modestly acidic/tangy/tannic/drying finish. Very flavorful for the ABV. Not overly lactic/salty. Awesome balance of super juicy/jammy raspberry/lemon and lacto complexity; with a nice pale/wheat malt backbone against acidity for the ABV. Minimal residual sweetness with crisp acidic/tangy dryness. A really enjoyable offering, and impressive spot on style example as expected. Had it on tap previously, was just as good out of the can!\xa02,661 characterssuperspak, Aug 16, 2019']

name: Funky Face: Margarita Gose
review:
['3.97/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4On tap at brewery:
Hazy straw yellow with a decent head that yields to a thick collar. Sheets from the collar slide back to it, though a few spots last longer.

A mix of lime, wheat, and a very slight white wine vinegar note. Taste opens with a sour bite and malt/wheat. The latter gains presence by the end, though the lime note sustains the sour opening to past mid-taste. A light salinity at the first taste becomes more obvious as the other flavors duel with each other.

Nicely straightforward Gose with a definite lime aspect that fits into the mixed drink impression, though it stays pretty solidly in the beer category.\xa0631 characterscjgiant, May 16, 2019']

Minimal lacing on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big sour/tart/tangy limes, lemon, citrus peel/zest, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, coriander, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, light peppercorn/musty/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of limes, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, coriander, and moderate pale/wheat malt notes; with big strength. Taste of big sour/tart/tangy limes, lemon, citrus peel/zest, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, coriander, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, light peppercorn/musty/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/lactic tartness, fruit tang, and light sourness/spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of sour/tart/tangy limes, lemon, citrus peel/zest, peach, pear, melon, red/green apple, white grape/wine, sea salt, coriander, hay, straw, grass, wheat, cracker, white bread, light peppercorn/musty/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Great complexity, robustness, and balance of limes, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, coriander, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; with a fantastic malt/tart/sourness and tangy fruit balance; with no puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp/clean finishing. Moderate increasing dryness from lingering tart/sourness, tangy fruit, and carbonation. Medium-plus carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/grainy/acidic/tangy, and lightly saline mouthfeel that is fantastic. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4%. Overall this is an excellent fruited gose. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of limes, fruity/acidic yeast, sea salt, coriander, and moderate pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink with the modestly acidic/tangy/drying finish; not overly lactic/salty. Very flavorful and not watery for the ABV. Awesome balance of vibrant limes and Lacto complexity; with a great pale/wheat malt backbone against acidity for the ABV. Minimal residual sweetness with crisp dryness. A really enjoyable offering, and impressive spot on style example as expected.\xa02,453 characterssuperspak, Sep 08, 2019']

name: The Blood Orange Otter
review:
['4.04/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4.25 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4L: Had this beer on-tap at Growlers to Go - Short Pump, poured into a pint glass. Had a bright orange color and a very cloudy consistency. There was a half inch of foamy, somewhat long-lasting head. So-so lacing.

S: A very nice aroma of citrus fruit, malt, spices, and salt.

T: Tasted of a mild amount of sea salt (very fleeting), some malt notes (present throughout, but subtle), a lot of citrus fruit (lemon, lime, and especially the advertised blood orange), and light spices (coriander). A light, sweet, and fruity flavor. It has lots of citrus fruit and an extremely tart character. Lively and tasty.

F: A well-carbonated beer with a sharp finish. Medium-bodied.

O: A rock solid, easy to drink gose. Drinkable.\xa0719 charactersavalon07, Sep 06, 2019']

name: Strawberry Gose in the Machine
review: ['3.73/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75looks like these guys have quite a few locations now, makes sense, its a concept that works, plus, how many beers could i drink in an average feature length film? a fair few. this has to be a profitable model! this is a strawberry gose, and its light and drinkable, neither too sour nor overly fruited, both of which i appreciate in a session beer context. gose is everywhere now, no longer a lost old world style, and so many of them have fruit too. the ones i think work the best are these, with sweeter fruits, like strawberries, mangoes, and pineapples, to offset some of the lacto sourness. this one is pretty reserved, a jammy sort of sweet strawberry and lemony tartness, clean in the souring, and with enough wheat body to keep it beery. i like the sort of desserty nature of the fruit, it doesnt bother me at all in a sour like this, and even though it might lack a little depth, its hard to argue with the flavor overall. i think its cool these styles have become mainstream, and its examples like this that really make it happen. i cant imagine anyone not at least enjoying one glass of this...\xa01,105 charactersStonedTrippin, Oct 02, 2018']

name: Blast, Splat, Oops!
review:
['3.81/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.7532 oz crowler poured into Cave of the Mounds snifter/shaker thing. 

Mellow gold color with a tall creamy head of 3 fingers, receding to 1/2 finger after awhile leaving sparse lacing. 

Aromas of hard mineral, restroom, faint passion fruit, honey graham, and some wheat kernel. 

Flavor brings some passion fruit and mango to the front, with a pleasant fruity blast. Honey malts and slight sea salt also begin to develop. Acidulated malt. Very faint floral hops, another quick kiss of tropical fruit, and finally it closes out on wheat kernel and washed out fruity pebbles. 

Feel is crisp and biting, with a somewhat bothersome starch on the tongue but nothing overly distracting. 

Overall a pretty solid Gose, nothing I would feel inclined to return to though.\xa0763 charactersThe-Adjunct-Hippie, Dec 07, 2018']

name: Pink Guava Gose
review: ['3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75a neat brew here with pink guava, lime, and margarita salt, super pale, cleanly soured (very nicely done here), and with just enough guava to make it interesting, slightly tropical, and balanced against the citrusy lactic tang this finishes with. the margarita salt might be lime salt, or there might be lime in it, its tough to tell, but the minerals of the salt are as obvious as the brine element it contributes, and the acidity of the lime resonates with the bacterial souring in a cool way, the whole thing is summery and bright and really sings, refreshing too, more so than sour beer usually is for me, even a gose. the wheat malt in here is super light, more pale pils type than anything, but not a ton of that coming through either, and basically no hops, so this depends on the fruit and salt a lot to give it character. guava is natural and light and not fermented all the way out, the lime highlights it well, and the saltiness adds a briskness to the finish, along with nice carbonation. they did a good job with this, the souring is surprisingly professional, and overall this was a tasty and unique modern gose. well done.\xa01,137 charactersStonedTrippin, Oct 07, 2019']

name: African Dream Pop with Raspberry and Blueberry
review:
['4.13/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4.25 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4.25Pours a dark, creamy-looking, purple-raspberry color with three fingers of raspberry head. Good retention and decent lacing.

Huge, creamy blueberry and raspberry aroma. Sweet more than sour.

The taste is less sweet than expected. Light sourness with clear blueberry and raspberry again, along with some definite creaminess, and strong salt in the finish. But it’s not the same explosion of juiciness and creaminess from the nose. There’s a hint of toast mid-palate, then some berry tartness mixes with the salt for a semi-dry finish.

Medium bodied, a little milky in the feel, with light carbonation.

The look and smell of this are extreme. The flavor is very nice, but comes across as fairly clean tasting by comparison. I can’t believe I’m saying this, but if they dialed the sweetness up a smidge I bet people would kill for this. It’s delicious as it is nonetheless.\xa0892 charactersthebeers, Nov 20, 2019']

name: Zephyr Margarita Gose
review:
["4.04/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25Canned on 6/20/18. Really old can, older than I realized when purchased. Must have been at local grocery store for a while. Still glad to try something new from a local brewery. 
L: Pours amber in color. More transparent than I am used to with typical gose beers, but it isn't deal breaking by any means. About a half finger of an off-white head with no lacing. 
S: Definitely pick up lime with mild yeast presence. Slight astringency to the beer. Problem is, the smell is almost non-existent. As I really shove my nose in the glass, I think I detect oak, but not entirely sure. 
T: The redemption point in comparison to the smell. Lime with a defined salinity are the two domineering flavors. Oak present on the finish and even more so in the after taste. Flavor is tart but transient. As I become acclimated to the drink, I am really starting to appreciate the lime. It tastes natural and refreshing. 
F: Light in body and weight. Somewhat higher on the carbonation scale. Nice feel and is refreshing. 
O: This would be stellar on a summer day. It's light, crisp and refreshing. Has just the right amount of tartness and salinity to make me want more. I would definitely buy again, glad to have tried and look forward to trying more from Fogbelt. Cheers!\xa01,257 charactersTheBrewsky, Jan 07, 2019"]

name: Peach Gose
review:
["4.07/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4Picked a bottle of this up at the brewery.

A - Poured into my Duvel tulip a hazy golden orange hue with a big two finger head that faded slowly to leave a nice blanket and solid lacing. Just superb head and color on this beer!

S - Aromas of big lemons and creamy wheat. Nice tartness, light coriander. The peach notes are beyond subtle, they're nonresistant. 

T - Taste is similar to the nose. Excellent lemon and creamy wheat followed by some nice lighter coriander. Dave has really nailed the base beer down. Nice slightly slightly finish with lingering tartness. The peach is flashes of stone fruit pits along with just a little bit of peach skin. 

M - Mouthfeel is nicely carbonated, crisp, medium bodied. Finish just a little flemmy. 

O - Overall this base beer is just spot on. Utterly dialed in. The fruit though seems to get a bit lost. It is incredibly, incredibly subtle. I think so far the sour cherry one has been my favourite as that one really delivered.

Serving Type: Bottle\xa0995 charactersrudzud, Jun 30, 2018"]

Aromas were pretty good with the cherry flavor. The cherry aroma followed the nose with a sweet taste up front but then a sour aftertaste. The balance of the flavors and the carbonation made this beer very drinkable on a hot, humid day. Overall, refreshing with good flavors.\xa0373 charactersfitzy84, Jul 16, 2018']

brewery: Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café & General Store
name: Straight Science '19-2
review:
["4.43/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4.5 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.75Served on tap at Bell's Brewery - Eccentric Café.
A: Pours a nearly hazy, ruddy or rose golden color with a one finger, very light pink head, rim retention, and modest lacing.
S: Only very light aromas of plum, berry, and sea salt.
T: Dry and tart. Flavors of black plum (especially the skin) and chardonnay grape, hardly pick up the salt, although the caramel malt backbone is there. Relatively low, but not entirely absent bitterness. 
M: Light bodied with solid carbonation. Very refreshing.
O: The word at Eccentric the day I visited was that SS '19-2 is in the running to be the second installment in Bell's Leaves of Grass series. Remarkably light for a Gose, very flavorful, and absolutely delicious. This could very well be my favorite Gose to date. If the rumor is true, I can only hope it and the other installments of the series get nationwide distribution (hint, hint).\xa0886 charactersVoxRationis, Jun 20, 2019"]

name: Doctor's Orders Electrolyte Serum Rhubarb Wheat
review:
['2.94/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4 | smell: 2.5 | taste: 3 | feel: 4 | overall: 2.5Doctor’s Orders, haven’t tried them before even though it sounds like the brewery was named after me: Doc. It isn’t though, my brewery name (when I open my own brewery) will be DöcBräu™ - and I will only be producing Ales, no Lagers thank you (too much effort IMO). Pipe dream aside Doctor’s Orders claim they brought the Gose style to Australia, and they could be right - Gose’s haven’t been around for long even though they were popularised in the states since before I got into craft beer. This Gose is made with rhubarb and wheat, which I suspect will make it similar to a Berliner Weissbier (with rhubarb instead of raspberry sweetness)... I guess we shall soon find out.

Poured from a 375ml can into a Duvel tulip.

A: Cloudy pale straw body, nice fluffy snow white head that compacts from a meaty 3 centimetres to a respectable half centimetre. I like the colour: pale straw is an appealing hue for a brew [rhyme intended]. 8/10.

S: Funky freak show! Salt, normally not a feature in any beer but most welcome in a Gose, comes through front and centre. Notes of banana and rhubarb, hint of bubblegum, barnyard yeast funk, this is could be mistaken for a child’s vomit at a petting zoo - but alas, it is a beer [I believe there was a vomit-flavoured jelly bean in Harry Potter - this is clearly the liquid version of that]. Shades of intriguing and bad mingle freely here. TBH it is what it is, which makes it hard to like/love. 5/10.

T: It really tastes a bit like a wheaty/funky Gatorade... what an odd brew. I’ve had Gose’s before (6 according to my BA account), so this isn’t simply a case of being unfamiliar with the style - this brew is a bit of a mess. Other notes of the above: salt, banana, rhubarb, barnyard yeast and an overall grainy character. Admittedly the more I drank the less bad it became... my taste buds probably surrendered to its weirdness. Again: hard to love. 6/10.

M: Body is alright though - mid to light, with a creamy dense carbonation (that’s the wheat for you - always bringing body). 8/10.

D: Not a fan, and I’ve had Gose’s I’ve liked before. This is the unholy marriage of beer and a sports drink - please heed my words. It’s still better than a Victoria Bitter though - so really let’s give Doctor’s Orders some credit. Also Gose’s are a tricky style: it Gose with the territory [been waiting to crack out that pun for a while now, cheers!]. 5/10.

Food match: This feels like something to drink after a workout session.\xa02,505 charactersdoktorhops, May 25, 2017']

name: WTF Raspberry Ginger Gose
review:
["3.74/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.758oz glass at Beer Revolution YEG Oliver Square. So now they've added ginger to their Raspberry Gose. Got it.

This beer appears a hazy, pale salmon-tinged yellow colour, with one skinny finger of wispy and bubbly off-white head, which leaves pretty much nothing in the way of lace anywhere near the glass as it quickly blows off. 

It smells of bready and biscuity cereal malt, earthy ginger, some mild yeastiness, a bit of indistinct tropical fruitiness, and some plain citrus rind. The taste is gritty and grainy pale malt, faded spicy ginger, frozen raspberries, orange rind, earthy yeast, and a very faint leafy, weedy, and herbal green hoppiness. 

The carbonation is fairly low-key in its innocuous frothiness, the body a so-so middleweight, and generally smooth, with a touch of sourness kind of messing with the ideal at this particular juncture. It finishes trending dry, the raspberry showing some lingering mettle. 

Overall - this is a pleasant enough iteration of the style, with the adjuncts doing well to represent themselves. Good for another hot summer day in the ol' Chuk, and a way better deal than paying for a pint or growler at the actual brewpub, just sayin' - yes, I am a broken record.\xa01,213 charactersbiboergosum, Jul 29, 2018"]

name: Brasii Rollmops
review:
['3.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.5Amber orange color with a thin head with short retention.
Nice malty aroma with notes of smoke, lemon drops, toasted malts and mild sourness.
Flavor with notes of smoked and slightly toasted malts, sour dough, lemon, green apples, blue cheese and lactic acid. Dry and acid aftertaste, though not strong.
Light body with appropriate carbonation.
Well done Lichtenhainer. It is well attenuated and gave the right smoke and sour notes, with a hint of blue cheese that I felt in my other attempts of this historical style. The Brazilian malts (brasii, which means malt in Latin) worked quite well.\xa0593 charactersFLima, Dec 03, 2017']

name: Easy Gose
review: ["3.05/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3 | smell: 3 | taste: 3 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3Pours a clear, deep, dark amber coloration with a medium, fluffy, quickly dissipating head. Smells of sweet, caramel malt, with a light gooseberry and green apple note as well. Taste is dominated by sweet, caramel malt and sea salt, with some estery gooseberry, green apple and red berry notes coming through as well, with just a hint of flowery green pepper as well. Finishes with a very light acidity and some gooseberry and green pepper lingering in the aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel with a light body and medium carbonation.\n\nThis just seems poorly balanced, to be honest: too sweet and malty, too salty and just not tart/acidic enough at all, almost being non-existent, actually. Its one saving grace are some nice estery fruit notes and the use of green pepper, which is interesting, but doesn't really work all that well here either, being quite floral, although it does seem to turn a bit more spicy in the aftertaste. It's just about all right, but really doesn't work all that well.\xa0991 charactersSnowcrash000, Jul 01, 2019"]

name: Black Mamba
review:
['3.92/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4A: Pours an opaque extremely dark purplish black in color with moderate amounts of fine active visible carbonation rising along the edges of the glass and moderate very dark purple + very dark garnet red highlights. The beer has a two finger tall fizzy foamy purplish/pinkish tan head that reduces to a medium sized patch of very thin film covering a little more than 35% of the surface of the beer and a thin ring at the edges of the glass. Minimal amounts of lacing are observed.

S: Just shy of moderate aromas of slightly tart, slightly sweet dark fruits (blueberry, blackberry, and black currants) over the top of light aromas of roasted + slightly sour wheat malts + lemon citrus lactic tartness and a hint of brininess.

T: Upfront there are moderate flavors of roasted + slightly sour wheat malts with minimal amounts of sweetness and a light flavors of lemon citrus lactic tartness as well as a hint of brininess. That is followed by slightly stronger than moderate flavors of slightly tart, slightly sweet dark fruits (blueberry, blackberry, and black currants). Light to moderate amounts of lingering tartness.

M: Medium bodied with moderate amounts of carbonation. Light to moderate amounts of acidic prickliness.

O: Drinks pretty easily with well hidden alcohol and enough tartness but not overpowering sourness. Very interesting and enjoyable with the contrast of the roasted malts with the more traditional gose flavors + aromas.\xa01,446 charactersdbrauneis, Oct 24, 2019']

name: Hate to See Her Leave, Love to Watch Her Gose
review:
['3.7/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.751st review or rating of this beer on BA. Available in 6 pack cans. They even started dating their cans! 

Pours a darker hibiscus like reddish shade. Smallish lighter pinkish head, 1/2" but quickly recedes. Aroma doesn't lean to heavy on the spice rack, the coriander and salt are there but not overwhelming. Bit of that floral hibiscus feel to it. 

Solid "sour" component to the beer. 5 on a 10 pt scale, might be slightly heavier than average for a gose. Nice dry effect of what seems like hibiscus, rose petals, flowery like feels. Salt enough for a drying effect. Coriander and other spice rack contributions are appropriately de minimis. Mouth feel is light, yet floral and fruity. Good amount of flavor to this relatively sessionable beer. One of the best things Brewer's Cabinet makes, I rarely check them out due to the majority of their beers not being very good, infected or undated. Things are starting to turn around for them. Would happily buy this again at less than $10 per 6 pack at Winco.\xa01,023 charactersrodbeermunch, Oct 07, 2019']

name: Self-Destructive Tendencies
review:
["3.59/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75It was pink...on tap at the brewery. Minimal head. Pink...cute.

Slight smell of strawberry, sledge hammer hit of brine, some grapefruit and resin pine along for the ride, too.

The taste - super salty assault. Once the shock dies down, a bit of sweetness, a little strawberry (?), and some typical IPA hoppiness. ANy tang from the wheat is buried by the salt. Ok...it sounds like a mess and I think it is, but it was actually enjoyable to drink.

Overall, fun and if it was less salty it might fare better. According to the staff, this was a case of too many brewers in the brewhaus. One thought they were making a gose, one a fruity sour, the other an IPA. True or not, this does sound like hey this doesn't taste hprribke, let's put it out there. I liked it, but it is a mad scramble.\xa0787 charactersLeRose, Aug 17, 2018"]

name: INU Island Punch Raspberry
review:
['3.76/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 5 | smell: 4 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.75Pouring from a 32 oz. Crowler into a tulip glass, this beer pours out like a thick dark berry juice. A finger worth of sea foam pink bubbles that leave a heavy wall as they slowly recede.

The nose carries berries and slight acidity while the flavor does the same, except adding a layer of malt base. Crisp wheat. This is light and refreshing. Not picking up much, if any salt but there is a very light, natural acidity. This would be absolutely wonderful by the pool or ocean. Even then, with my preferences, I could still use a little bit more body on it. I like where the carbonation is at though. 

Overall, it’s a great summer brew.\xa0639 charactersAyatollahGold, Jun 13, 2019']

name: Very Berry Citra Gose
review:
['3.58/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5Wanting badly to be a sangria but also wanting to be an IPA, the West Sixth brewers have their hands full trying to wrangle this wild and wily, fruitcentric ale. 

Chocked with copious amounts of vine ripened berries, Very Berry Citra Gose soon fills the nose with the tangy succulence of blueberry, blackberry and raspberry along with herbal citrus notes and a rounded brininess of sea air. Held within its hazy ruby coat likes a taffy-like sweetness with hints of hard candy that tease the early tastebuds with fruit juices, agave and a hint of sourdough.

As the middle palate becomes awash with the berry juiciness, a more racy taste of tangerine offers a brightness and a zip of tartness that leads into a botanical grassiness laced with chive, verbena and hemp. Trending both sour and bitter, the togetherness of these palate sensations suggest ruby red grapefruit flavor. Tea-like with a hint of gin, the finish is gently sprucy with a medium short linger of fruit skins and seed spiciness.

Medium light in body, the tart and moderately bitter beer offers a drying palate to contend with the juice sweetness while the creaminess of wheat is a buffer for the minty alcohol spice. Trying hard to become a sangria, hints of white wine shine through the Citra hops and the fruit additions for a cidery, vinous session throughout.\xa01,333 charactersBEERchitect, Oct 09, 2019']

name: Bluzon
review:
['4.24/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4 | smell: 4.25 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25On-tap at Beer + Burger Kings Cross, London, England

A: The beer is very hazy purplish red in color. It poured with a short pink head that died down, leaving a narrow collar around the edge of the glass.
S: Moderate aromas of blueberries and blackberries are present in the nose along with hints of vanilla.
T: The taste is a bit sweet and sour with flavors of blackberries and vanilla and hints of raspberries.
M: It feels light- to medium-bodied, creamy, and a bit tart on the palate with a moderate amount of carbonation.
O: This beer is deceptively drinkable considering its strength. It makes for a good dessert beer with the sweetness and vanilla.

Serving type: on-tap\xa0676 charactersmetter98, Oct 24, 2019']

Aroma is typical for the style - salt, tart fruit. Good, refreshing flavor - some hibiscus, berry, lime - has some nice depth while still being tart and refreshing\xa0233 charactersajm5108, May 02, 2018']

name: Kill Yr Idols
review:
["4.03/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4 | overall: 4Watermelon gose...perhaps a little artificial tasting, but does the whole 'salty melon' thing well, and was almost like liquid Bubbleicious gum. The 12 oz bottles were hilariously mislabeled stating 22 oz, but hey man, let's talk beer. 

Too clear for a gose, but, again smelling great and tasting extremely refreshing for a scorching GA summer, it's a pretty nice entry in Burnt Hickory's huge category. 

Also, it's always nice to see breweries honor bands, and no one does it quite like Burnt Hickory. This one is in honor of Sonic Youth and all of their noisy glory, so cheers to BH for that!\xa0596 charactersthatoneguymike, Aug 23, 2016"]

name: Snake Bite
review: ["3.42/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.5Feel free to change the beer style listed as I was the first to review & there was no beer style listed on the can. I decided to pop in to a local small brew store to try a few of their offerings. This was my first visit & I came at a time when no one was present in the tiny brew store attached to the pub. A member of the wait staff was very nice as she helped me but told me that this was an IPA and would be hoppier than the other IPA I bought. Nope. It's unique but I would describe this as a Belgian Gose, or possibly some kind of specialty sour beer. Not my type of beer. In general, I don't like sours, Belgians, or Gose. I'm an IPA, Stout & Porter guy. After considering dumping it after the first sip though, it grew on me a bit. Lightly golden with active carbonation, it pours with a small head & leaves no lacing. Belgian yeast taste, with a dominant sour saltiness with a touch of sweetness at the end. Fizzy light mouthfeel; not full at all; not my type of thing for sure.\xa01,000 charactersJesterr44, Apr 23, 2017"]

It had a thin white head and no lacing. Interesting aroma. Definitely funky, but something else I can't quite put my finger on. The taste is funky, earthy and some citrus. Good.\xa0251 charactersBoto, Sep 10, 2016"]

name: Imperial Black Passion
review: ['4.5/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4.5 | smell: 4.5 | taste: 4.5 | feel: 4.5 | overall: 4.5PprBurke, Dec 22, 2018']

name: Bits n Bobs
review: ['3.53/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.5a cranberry gose, some ambitious beers coming out of here lately. its pretty ruby pink from the tap with pretty good clarity and a lazy layer of airy white to light pink bubbles. aroma is good on the cranberry side, tart and astringent and a little medicinal. the sour side smells a little cheesy and unclean, but its not unappealing, very prominent acidity is evident. the flavor is almost all cranberries and the souring bacteria, lemony lacto is better than it smells but still a little unrefined, while the cranberry aspect is awesome, super puckery and natural tasting and lots of it. the problem here for me is the lack of beer flavor, we get so little from the wheat, including body where this feels pretty thin, and the salt element is hardly evident at all. i wish there was a little more of both in here, it seems more like juice than beer without them unfortunately, but the flavors are agreeable and its nice to see these guys trying this kind of thing. the cranberry flavor is excellent but the rest of the beer needs a little fine tuning...\xa01,054 charactersStonedTrippin, Mar 28, 2018']

name: Good Gose
review: ['3.57/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3.5 | feel: 4 | overall: 3.5pretty much everyone thinks the can make a sour mashed or kettle soured beer these days, and for the most part they are right. its not hard at all, and we are seeing these spring up like crazy. they arent all good, but this one is pretty good. some would call it amateurish, but i like its intense lacto profile and buckety funk, its so much less clean and refined than others, and i like its rustic elements, although i know (or am mostly certain) this is a happy accident of reckless experimenting. clear for the style, very light in body for how dynamic the yeast profile is, and overall a really solid beer. there are flaws for sure, but the seem to help more than they hurt in this happy accident of a brew. carbonation is awesome, this is super refreshing, but maybe a point or so high on the abv for where i like the gose to sit. definitely their most adventurous beer on the menu, i hope they keep moving in this direction and pushing the boundary with beers like this. its not perfect, but its a lot of fun.\xa01,016 charactersStonedTrippin, May 12, 2015']

review:
['3.27/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.5 | taste: 3 | feel: 3.5 | overall: 3.25On tap at Brewskival 2019.

Pours a bright yellow with fine, wisy head.

Taste starts tart with notes of pineapple and lime and then adds smoked meat. The combo is a bit weird and disjointed, just feels like to completely different drinks have been layered on op of each other.

review: ["3.79/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Pours a deep, dark brown coloration with a large, but quickly fading, frothy head. Smell is dominated by chocolate aromas, with some light roasted coffee and berry tartness coming through as well. Taste is the opposite of the nose, with the chocolate and coffee notes being a lot more subdued, but with a stronger acidity and lighter tart berry notes and salt. Finishes with a medium tartness and a bit more saltiness coming through in the aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel with a medium body and carbonation.\n\nMaybe it's because this bottle is a little old, but I really didn't get a lot of chocolate/coffee flavor from this, even though the aroma is there. Still a nice Gose with a good tartness, light saltiness and mild berry flavor as well as just a hint of chocolate/coffee.\xa0775 charactersSnowcrash000, Jan 14, 2019"]

name: Gose
review:
['3.12/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.5 | smell: 3.25 | taste: 3 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3Pale gold visibly carbonated
Smell is earthy and phenolic
Mouth and taste are dry with low acidity mildly carbonated low sweetness and faintly sour with subtle bready malt
Overall an ok wheat but lacks pizzazz it comes off as a middle of the road gose to my palate\xa0265 charactersSlatetank, Jan 14, 2019']

name: Wild Coast
review:
['3.47/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.25 | feel: 3.25 | overall: 3.5A Gose, or an IPA? It says Gose first so that's how I'll review it...

Bright straw gold and nearly perfectly clear with a thin white head and next to none in the lace department.

All IPA on the nose. Old school East coast with a malty sweet graininess and a smidge of spice. 

Flavor follows nearly ommiting the gose inspiration. Earthy, dusty, slightly spicy and malty with the smallest drop of salt imaginable.

Feel is clean but a little hefty. Mild carbonation and no where near spritzy like that of those hailing from Leipzig. Despite this, a very easy to drink beer.

All in all, this should have been called a "Salted IPA". It's nowhere near an actual Gose, but it is still an enjoyable beer. 

Cheers.\xa0718 charactersLingenbrau, Jan 24, 2019']

name: Guava Gose
review: ['3.75/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 3.75 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 3.75 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 3.75one of the more guava forward beers ive ever had really, only a few others come to mind on that list, the must use a ton of it here. its concentrated in the nose and taste of this lightly haze straw colored beer, like some sort of puree was used, rather than whole fruit, but its natural to me, and really cool without all its usual friends like pineapple, passion fruit, and mango blocking out its true essence. i think the base beer is pretty good here too, i immediately taste the salt, the brininess and mineral profile that it contributes, and the pale wheat malt is evident as well, not all fruit, still beery enough for sure. the souring is the just okay part of this for me, its not too tart or anything, in fact it has a drinkable level of acidity, and some flavor to it as well, but its the sweaty, slightly stinky element that comes on late that makes this one seem a little amateurish, not as clean as it could and should be, and it turns me off just a little. the guava is cool though because its there from start to finish, and its obvious but never sweet, which lends to drinkability. very tropical and vacation-esque brew, nicely carbonated too, summery and fun. those i were with adored this, i liked it but wasnt in love. still need to try some more beers from these guys to get a true sense of who they are, but this was an enjoyable sour whose base identity as a gose came through nicely.\xa01,408 charactersStonedTrippin, Sep 03, 2019']

name: Cut Your Teeth
review: ['4/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4 | feel: 4 | overall: 4This is a North Fork collaboration with Earth Eagle Brewings in Portsmouth NH. Had in a tulip at the NF Brewery. Firstly let me say I wish there was a way to add a style of beer on this website. There are a number of sour varieties now and the only option I find even remotely appropriate is a Gose and this is not a Gose. This is a soured kettle ale that poured nicely and had some beautiful and pungent fruity notes on the nose. The beer drank very nicely with some berried fruit forward notes that are just past ripeness. Finished nicely and without a hint of the high alcohol content (for a sour beer).\xa0606 charactersosheamatth, Sep 09, 2019']

name: Who Gose There Grapefruit
review: ['3.92/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4 | smell: 3.75 | taste: 4 | feel: 3.75 | overall: 4Very nice Gose. This one, another entry in the Who Gose There lineup, was had at the pub. Served in a snifter. name: Melpomene - Blood Orange Moscow Mule
review:
["4.18/5\xa0\xa0rDev 0%look: 4 | smell: 4 | taste: 4.25 | feel: 4.25 | overall: 4.25On tap at Mortalis Brewing in Avon, NY.

This one pours a hazy golden yellow color, with a small head, and lots of lacing.

This smells like candied and juicy orange, a touch of mint/herbal aromas, lime zest, and lemon.

I don't really get the ginger, and only a touch of mint here. There's certainly lots of blood orange and lime, though, and it lends a light but firm juiciness to the beer. The lime adds a slight sourness that also feels lemony. I don't really identify this as a gose.

This is light bodied, and very drinkable, with a great level of drinkability.

This isn't quite as good as the other beer in the Nine Muses series I've tried - Ourania - but it's still a fun little beer.\xa0693 charactersGreesyFizeek, Jun 28, 2019"]

review:
